name: Founding Senior Software Engineer, Fullstack
description: Credal is hiring a Founding Fullstack Engineer to join our team in Brooklyn, NY! This role requires a strong background in software development, including experience in front-end technologies such as React, CSS, and Typescript, as well as back-end technologies such as databases, server-side frameworks, and APIs.

requirements.description: • Be customer-focused - care about addressing the challenges our customers encounter, using their feedback to continuously shape our product.
At least one full time role (or internship for new grads) at a top tier startup or larger company, where they've done meaningful work.
requirements.explanation:
A top tier company could be:

  • One of the FAANG companies (a few examples in ideal companies)

  • A great private company (a few examples in ideal companies, or anything started by founders with strong backgrounds, or anything funded by top VCs)

  • Any of the top trading firms (Jane St, Citadel, Jump etc)

requirements.description: • Be ambitious - we’re working on an incredibly hard problem and are looking for people who are energized by challenges.
Experience in a high-growth, fast-paced environment with a high technical bar; has taken full ownership of projects from start to finish.
requirements.explanation: See example companies in Ideal Companies section

requirements.description: CS degree or similar
• AI/ML especially in generative AI / LLMs.
• CloudOps/DevOps - using tools like Terraform, Kubernetes, etc.
• Data infrastructure - using tools like dbt, Airflow, Dagster, Snowflake, etc.
Startup experience, founding team experience a big plus

responsibilities: Working with AI/LLMs: Improving the performance of our Retrieval Augmented Generation platform by experimenting with foundational LLMs and novel search techniques. Help define industry standards for how to leverage generative AI in enterprise settings.

Enhancing our developer-focused APIs: improving and expanding the functionality of our APIs to make them more user-friendly and efficient for developers. This includes optimizing performance, adding new features, and ensuring seamless integration into existing customer workflows.

Making improvements to our frontend: Refining the visual design, optimizing the performance, and implementing new features in our platform’s frontend to make it more intuitive and engaging for our users.

Working on our data platform: Making improvements to our data platform to ingest, transform, and embed customer data for use in generative AI applications. Optimizing the data infrastructure’s performance and scalability to ensure reliable and timely data integration.
workPlaceText: In-person in Brooklyn office
experience_info: as a software engineer, ideally in a full stack role, at a top tier company
recruiting_advice: This role is for anyone with any level of experience. They should be hungry and want to work at a fast moving company, and embrace uncertainty and be able to take ownership of features from end to end. There is no minimum level of experience - we want to consider everything from new grads to 5+ years of experience as well.
tech_stack: AI/ML: Langchain, OpenAI, Anthropic, and Cohere

company.name: Credal (YC W23)
company.description:
At Credal, our mission is to Harness AI for everyone building a better future. We're a hyper-growth, well funded startup building an extraordinary team of thoughtful doers that can shape the future of the AI industry. With strong funding from great investors, we have the runway to navigate market fluctuations while making ambitious bets on our product vision.

The goal is to enable anyone to supercharge the operational workflows of all of our users at an enterprise - such as understanding data, taking actions, and building end to end workflows that can be run via AI. By freeing up the operational burden of someone's day to day, they can be more productive, creative and focus on what tasks really matter.
company.teamAbout:
Ravin Thambapillai, Founder

I hanker after an honorable Goddam skull. I worked at Google, TheHutGroup (now THG) at Series A, GoCardless at Series A, and most recently at Palantir for 7 years, where I led the building of significant parts of America's emergency-public-health infrastructure, including what Atlantic Magazine called "America's most reliable Pandemic data."

  

Jack Fischer, Founder

Five years at Palantir in various technical capacities on projects ranging from airline reliability to defense computer vision. Palantir's US commercial hiring manager 2020-2022. Worked on several of the precursors to H1 (YC W20) and developed their early entity resolution algorithms. Now enabling secure AI!

name: Founding Engineer
description:
Tribe is re-inventing groupchat - think a 'pro Whatsapp' that enables delightful engagement and builds closer communities with an all-new set of powerful features and brand new design.

We're a small team of craftspeople led by Rajat Suri (Co-founder Lyft / Presto) looking to add a single founding engineer to our team. We plan to never raise venture capital but only focus on building a product we truly love and can be proud of showing to our family and friends.

We're looking for a highly resourceful and motivated founding engineer who gets stuff done fast and is ready to focus for the next few years on building the best groupchat app that's ever been built.

requirements.description: Proficient in React Native, Ruby on Rails, and PostgreSQL
Wants to work in an early stage startup on a small team (5)
Strong work ethic, Self-directed, takes ownership, low ego, and passionate about the work
Excited at the idea of building a new type of group chat/messaging app
Proven ability to get things done quickly with limited resources
CS degree from a good university

responsibilities: wide variety of projects and responsibilities
workPlaceText: Onsite in SF or Remote
visa_text_more: See www.limadream.com which is our partner
experience_info: developing consumer-facing apps
recruiting_advice: Someone with mobile app experience is helpful
avoid_traits: someone who wants a chill role

company.name: Tribe
company.description: Tribe is made for people who love group chats. We are building what we hope will be the best possible group chat experience.
company.teamAbout: Small team of top quality designers and developers

name: Software Engineer (Full-Stack)
description:
Replo helps companies sell more online. Today, our platform helps ecommerce businesses automate performance marketing with data and AI.

Founded in 2021 by Yuxin Zhu and Noah Gilmore, we've experienced rapid growth, surpassing 1,000 paying customers in just six months.

We are hiring a mid to senior/staff level full-stack engineer to join our team in-person 3 days/week in San Francisco and focus on shipping products.

requirements.description: CS degree or similar from top university
Excited to work hybrid with the team in San Francisco
Strong proficiency in Typescript/React/Node.
• Experience in fast-paced and ambiguous environments, and defining software architecture patterns to solve customer pain points.
• Can leverage GPT/Claude/Cursor to accelerate their work.
• Experience building products 0 -> 1 with real users and revenue.
• Has a product and customer-focused mindset.
• Values writing clean, maintainable software, including documentation (e.g. the code needs to be correct and run fast, but we’re the ones that have to read it and understand it).
Previous experience at an early-stage (Series A or earlier) startup
Has experience being burned by deployment and maintenance issues. If you have a a strong opinion on how products should be built, that’s good.
Former founder, or founding experience
Experience in and enjoyment of hackathons
• Have an eye for visual design (or past experience in product design, Figma, etc).

responsibilities: Architecting and implementing full-stack product features in Typescript/React/Node
Building AI tools for end-customers to generate new content
Developing analytics and experimentation products end-to-end
Creating 3rd-party integrations with platforms like Shopify
Building payments/billing infrastructure for managing customer use-cases
Owning multiplayer editor end-to-end, focusing on CRDT and React-performance
Own our user onboarding flow from end-to-end
workPlaceText: Hybrid in San Francisco
visa_text_more: At this time, Replo is unfortunately unable to support employees on visas.
experience_info: Ideally fast-moving engineer with at least 1 year of experience from an early-stage startup (pre-Series B)
recruiting_advice: Small startup, ex-founder background is ideal. Computer science background highly desired.

company.name: Replo
company.description:
Replo helps companies sell on the internet.

We do this by helping marketing teams automate building and testing customer journeys using data and AI.

Today, companies on the internet spend a fortune trying to figure out the right audience, messaging, and experience to maximize revenue online.

They spend 100s of hours digging through analytics tools, ad platforms, and spreadsheets every month, and $100,000+ on marketing agencies and developers.

We think most of this can be automated in the next 4-5 years.

We built Replo to analyze your online traffic, provide deep insights, test new ideas, and implement those strategies 10-100x faster. Instead of taking weeks to launch a new product online, all you'll need to do is give Replo a budget, a product, and a target market and we'll figure out the rest.
company.teamAbout:
Replo was founded in 2021 by Yuxin Zhu and Noah Gilmore. They met at UC Berkeley in 2011 while studying computer science (go bears, IYKYK). We launched in late 2022 and grew to over 1000+ paying customers, in under a year with no sales or marketing budget.

To date, we’ve raised over $8.2M from Figma, YCombinator, Vercel, General Catalyst, Infinity Ventures, MAGIC Fund, Base Case Capital. We're headquartered in San Francisco.

name: Founding Backend Engineer
description: Founding Backend Engineer

requirements.description: Previous startup experience.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to commit to decisions even when there are disagreements.
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent practical experience.
A founder-like mindset with a passion for taking responsibility and making a significant impact.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment, quickly learning and adapting to new challenges.
Fast growing startup or FANNG work experience.

responsibilities: Design scalable solutions and ship features for a production-ready voice agent platform.
Lead initiatives across frontend, backend, and infrastructure, with opportunities for ownership and growth.
Collaborate closely with designers and engineers throughout the design and implementation phases.
Provide technical support, customer success assistance, and implementation guidance directly to our customers.
workPlaceText: On-site in Redwood City/San Francisco Bay Area
visa_text_more: Can sponsor H1B and Green card
experience_info: in full-stack software development.
recruiting_advice: Ideally demonstrated technical abilities in previous work experience, and is open to work hard at a startup.

Have issue dealing with stress
Bad in communication
Seeks work life balance
benefits: Competitive salary with an equity package, year end bonus.
100% health, dental and vision insurance coverage.
Meal and commute expenses fully covered.
Option to reside at the office with your own private bedroom.
H1B and Green Card sponsorship available.
A friendly office cat to brighten your day!
The chance to innovate and push the boundaries of voice AI in a dynamic, venture-backed startup.

company.name: Retell AI (YC W24)
company.description:
Retell AI is a powerful platform for building production ready voice AI. We recently closed a $4.5M seed round and achieved remarkable growth, reaching $3M in revenue within six months. Retell AI is proudly backed by Alt Capital, Y Combinator, and other leading investors.

Our team is composed of experts from Meta, Google, and TikTok, and we operate out of our in-person office in Redwood City.

We are at a pivotal moment in history where Voice AI will become the primary interface for accessing products and services, revolutionizing our interactions with machines for the better. Retell AI is at the forefront of creating this new reality.
benefits: Competitive salary with an equity package.
Meal and commute expenses fully covered.
Option to reside at the office with your own private bedroom.
A spacious and comfortable work environment, complete with unlimited snacks and drinks.
A friendly office cat to brighten your day!
The chance to innovate and push the boundaries of voice AI in a dynamic, venture-backed startup.
company.teamAbout:
Active Founders

Bing Wu

Co-founder & CEO at Retell AI. Enthusiastic about the human brain and AI, Bing spent three years as a product manager at ByteDance/TikTok, where he led B2B and consumer products that delighted billions. Before joining ByteDance/TikTok, Bing founded two investor-backed startups in college, generating six-figure revenues.

 

Todd Li

Todd is the founder of several venture-backed startups. Before his startup journey at Retell, Todd worked at Google Ads as a software engineer.

 

Evie Wang

Evie is the Co-founder and CMO of Retell AI She has a design background and a deep understanding of B2B business as she spent 3 years as a Product Designer at Bytedance.

Weijia Yu

Weijia excels in product and software development, with a specialization in machine learning. At Meta, he spent three years as a PM hybrid Tech Lead within Facebook product team. Prior to Meta, Weijia led app development at ObEN, a Series B AI tech startup, providing full-stack AI solutions including TTS(text-to-speech), computer vision and chatbot.

 

Zexia Zhang

Zexia is the co-founder and CTO of Retell AI. Passionate about ML, Zexia is always at the frontier of advancing speech technologies. Before Retell, Zexia spent four years at Google where he led the development of next-gen speech translation experience, and NLP solutions for call analysis.

name: Founding Full Stack Software Engineer
description:
Carma is a B2B managed marketplace for commercial fleet operators to receive same-day automotive repair for any vehicle with real-time, transparent quotes and guaranteed pricing. We are tackling an enormous market—worth $177 billion in the United States alone.

Fleet operators face the challenging task of keeping hundreds or thousands of vehicles on the road with minimal downtime. Carma's technology addresses this challenge by connecting fleet operators with highly vetted auto service partners, guaranteeing a 24-hour turnaround.

As a full stack engineer, you'll build exceptional experiences for our customers. We're a small team, and you'll be foundational to the success of the engineering team at Carma.

requirements.description: Have meaningful experience building and shipping high-quality products.
requirements.explanation: We value candidates who grasp the level of software engineering excellence required to create a product with an optimal user experience.

requirements.description: Very strong English communication skills
requirements.explanation: We don't want this to become a blocker, whether due to vocabulary, accent/misunderstandings, etc.

requirements.description: Are able to take ownership of ambiguous business challenges and transform them into tangible product features.
• Possess a strong grasp of software engineering fundamentals.
CS (or equivalent) degree from top US, Canada, or UK institutions. Bonus points for high GPA or early graduation.
• Have an iterative mindset: Eager to tackle challenges and continuously improve our technical systems.
Engineering experience in a high-traction startup

responsibilities: Design and build frontend and backend software.
Navigate the full software development lifecycle, encompassing implementation, testing, and technical support.
Collaborate with cross-functional team members to advance our product and engineering goals.
Iterate on our engineering infrastructure.
Refine our recruiting process and conduct technical interviews.
Offer mentorship and support to fellow team members, fostering a collaborative work environment.
visa_text_more: We can currently sponsor TN visas, but are unable to offer other visa sponsorships at this time.
experience_info: Full time SWE with customer facing feature development role. No QA, DevOps, Data Science/Analytics, temporary contractor roles, or performance engineering roles.
recruiting_advice:
While we seek candidates with a compatible technical stack, we primarily value raw intelligence and cultural fit. Our engineering team is heavily involved in coding, so those primarily focused on architecture recently may not be the best fit. We're looking for ambitious individuals eager to grow with the company. If a candidate prioritizes work-life balance in a remote setting, they might struggle here. Our team members are incredibly driven, ambitious, and hardworking. In essence, our culture is defined by intense execution. We're building a supportive, high-growth environment and aim to expand our team with members who are committed to delivering results.

We're planning to hire at least two more engineers as soon as possible. We've raised just over $5 million so far, primarily backed by high-net-worth individuals. Compared to our latest valuation, our funding size is relatively small, so our dilution won't be as significant as typical institution-backed ventures. Our main KPI is vehicles under management, which is growing at a healthy double-digit rate month-over-month. We comfortably have 3+ years of runway.

We also provide the technical interview guideline: https://docs.google.com/document/d/127jjGddKcraFhRXzteKgA5Ojtv-2iopABkEF-9UaZLE/edit
avoid_traits: Lack of engagement is a red flag for us. We highly value candidates who demonstrate curiosity by asking thoughtful questions and actively seeking to learn more about the opportunity.
Essentially, any traits opposite to those of our ideal candidate, as described above, would raise concerns for us.
Inability to articulate a coherent narrative about their previous experience listed on the resume.

company.name: Carma (YC W24)
company.description:
We’re Carma, a Y Combinator-backed, first-of-its-kind marketplace platform for commercial fleets to get correct car repair, fast and fair. Our mission is to solve the massive $573B problem with commercial auto repair – difficulty for commercial fleets to efficiently shop for automotive service and difficulty for auto repair shops to attract customers.

Carma is a B2B managed marketplace for commercial fleet owners to get same-day automotive repair for any vehicle with instant transparent offers and guaranteed pricing. Every year, fleet owners spend $573B on auto repairs globally.

Fleet owners request any service through our mobile app, which we send to our network of highly-vetted partner service centers. Our partner service centers give users real-time offers on their requested services.

Our fleet customers save upwards of 50% when they use Carma vs. the median price for the same service in their zip code, while our partner service centers increase their revenues and obtain new customers.
benefits: Stellar medical, dental, and vision insurance.
Remote work with occasional on-site visits to customer locations.

name: Senior/Staff Software Engineer (C++)
description:
We're seeking a talented C++ engineer to shape the fundamental algorithms that will power Quilter's future innovations. As a Senior to Staff Software Engineer, you'll have the remarkable opportunity to architect the core geometry, physics, and meshing engines that drive our automated PCB design system. This is a greenfield role where you'll own and solve some of the most complex and impactful challenges on our technology roadmap.

You'll collaborate closely with our world-class team of ML/AI researchers and engineers, applying your expertise in areas like path planning, collision detection, and geometric optimization to solve intricate routing problems. Your high-performance C++ code will create dynamic representations of circuit boards, enabling our reinforcement learning agents to explore and manipulate these environments.

requirements.description: • A strong academic background (B.Sc, M.Sc, or Ph.D) in meshing, simulation, physics, robotics, or related fields.
• Proficiency in Python to integrate with our ML systems.
• A passion for pushing the boundaries of what's possible in automated circuit design.
Experience at a fast-paced, high-growth startup or tech company
Explicit experience in computational geometry (ideally publications, PhD theses, ...)

responsibilities: Create high performance representations of physical circuit boards that allow for manipulation and exploration of those boards
Apply algorithms created for path planning, collision detection, geometric optimization to solve routing problems
Maintain a high performance geometry library
Work closely with the reinforcement learning team to support training agents that choose actions in the environment you create
workPlaceText: Remote (US)
visa_text_more: can sponsor anything
experience_info: maintaining and extending large, high-performance C++ codebases in collaborative environments.
recruiting_advice:
SIGGRAPH is a great conference where the best folks in this field publish. There is also a group at CMU (Keenan Crane) that produces amazing talent in this field.

People tend to join Quilter because we are solving a real, very difficult, very fun problem. People also really enjoy the flexibility of full remote.
avoid_traits: Experience only in academia
experience only in small team or mostly solo projects
no experience with code review, live production systems, regression testing, C++ style guides, etc
no experience with computational geometry

company.name: Quilter
company.description: At Quilter, we are helping electrical engineers save time and accomplish more by automating the tedious and time-consuming task of designing circuit boards. Our team is composed of experts in electrical engineering, ML/AI, and software development leveraging (and inventing) novel techniques to solve the decades-old problem of automating circuit board design. We raised $10 million in series-A funding to use a combination of machine learning and high-performance computing (HPC) to make designing printed circuit boards a less grueling and manual experience
company.productDescription:
Quilter is creating the "compiler" for circuit boards. Today, creating the blueprints for manufacturing a circuit board is a totally manual process. For this reason, it is a process that can take weeks or months to do (imagine if you had to compile code by hand). 

Quilter seeks to fully automate this process. This will allow electrical engineers to focus just on creating high level circuit schematics (like writing code) instead of manually drawing blueprints for weeks on end to get a board build.
company.teamAbout:
Quilter has been fully remote from the start with team members distributed throughout the US and an unofficial "headquarters" in Los Angeles, CA. No matter where we come from, we're united by a common vision for the future and a core set of values we think will get us there:

  1. Focus on the mission

  2. Demonstrate grit

  3. Never stop learning

  4. Pursue excellence

name: Founding Engineer (Applied AI)
description:
Scale Medicine is building the intelligence layer for drug development. Our secure AI assistant streamlines drug development workflows by connecting external scientific knowledge to company data and documents. We believe this technology could increase the rate of breakthrough drugs tenfold.

As our Founding Engineer (Applied AI), you will own the core AI capabilities and application logic of our flagship product. This role is perfect for those who aspire to be future founders of AI and biotech companies.

requirements.description: • Strong software engineering skills with experience in AI/ML, especially building and deploying production-ready systems.
• Demonstrated ability to iterate and ship features in a fast-paced environment.
• Proven track record of coming up with product ideas and seeing them through to implementation.
• Outstanding communication skills. Can convey complex technical concepts to non-technical customers.
• Proficiency in Python and experience with modern web development frameworks (e.g., Next.js, FastAPI).
• Familiarity with database technologies, including relational, vector, and NoSQL databases.
• Experience working with large language models and other AI/ML technologies.
• Understanding of data processing pipelines and ETL processes.
• Prior startup experience, especially in early-stage environments.
Background or strong interest in biotechnology or biology
• Experience with product design and user experience (UX) principles.

responsibilities: Product Iteration: Create AI systems that balance state-of-the-art results with rapid deployment. Work closely with the Product team.
Massive-Scale Data Processing: Architect solutions to handle multimodal data sources crucial for our products.
Evaluation and Optimization: Build data-driven evaluation systems to continuously improve product performance.
workPlaceText: Hybrid in NYC
visa_text_more: H1B sponsorship and transfer
experience_info: Experience should be tilted to backend SWE and data engineering. Even better if they have experience with large-scale search datasets.
recruiting_advice:
• Company has years of runway

  • Raised from top investors

  • Founder-market fit: previously, the founder started a top 20 AI drug discovery company, led the world's largest biotech startup accelerator, and has a PhD in computational biology and machine learning (published at ICML).

  • Already has contracts with large biotech companies

  • Existing MVP is getting strong customer feedback

  • Opportunity for early employees to grow with the company into larger roles ("Head of" and beyond)
avoid_traits: Emphasis on research. We're not a research company.
Wants to be a pure IC. Instead, they should be interested in wearing multiple hats.
Long career of implementing technologies without huge business outcomes to go with those implementations.
Obsession with tech implementations rather than products built / customer-obsession.

company.name: Scale Medicine
company.description: We're building AI tools that empower drug developers to eliminate disease within our lifetimes. Our secure AI assistant streamlines pharmaceutical workflows by connecting external scientific knowledge to company data and documents.

name: Product Marketing Manager
description: We're looking for a junior to early-mid level Product Marketing Manager who will focus on leading GTM enablement efforts (building internal and external collateral + training GTM teams) and launches for our core Identity products.

requirements.description: Relevant, adjacent industry experience (identity, compliance, fraud and/or risk - but no direct competitors like Socure, Jumio, Trulioo, IDMe, Veriff, SiftScience)
requirements.explanation: The identity industry is complex and ever-changing. We also have really technical buyers.

requirements.description: Light product marketing experience supporting or running product launches and feature releases
Experience in B2B SaaS (especially platform and/or technical products)
requirements.explanation: Persona has multiple products, our products can flex to different use cases, and we're industry agnostic

responsibilities: Become an expert on Persona’s product and customers, working across Product, Marketing, Sales, and Customer Success to launch new products and features and evolve our product roadmap and release process
Partner with Sales and Customer Success to understand the Voice of the Customer and drive adoption of products and best practices via training, tools, and collateral
Develop a deep understanding of our market (buyers, competitors, and industry trends) and translate the knowledge into compelling messaging, positioning, and battlecards
Partner with Content and Lifecycle marketing to fuel our GTM engine with actionable campaigns
workPlaceText: In-office in SF, with the option to work from home Monday and Friday
experience_info: as a junior product marketer, early stage start-up GTM generalist, ex-consultant, or ex-lawyer
recruiting_advice:
Product Marketing experience is not required.

Ideal industry: B2B SaaS platform/infrastructure product that is highly technical and has both technical/non-technical users (Atlassian, Twilio, Plaid, Stripe are probably pretty ideal here)

Sample sectors: Fintech/tech/regulated infra (Plaid, Stripe, AWS, Retool, Square) Platform solutions with developer orientation (Twilio/Segment, Intercom, Airtable, Webflow, Atlassian)

More so than having PMM experience, we are seeking a highly curious individual who is eager to dive deep into our product and its intricacies. They should be willing to roll up their sleeves to conduct thorough research that will can help provide insights to support both product development and enablement efforts. Candidate should also be able to distill complex technical concepts into clear explanations that will resonate with both internal stakeholders and customers. A proactive attitude, strong attention to detail, ability to juggle multiple projects and stakeholder management will be key to success in this role.

company.name: Persona
company.description: Founded in 2018, Persona is a 250-person tech startup based in San Francisco, backed by Index Ventures, Coatue, Founders Fund, and First Round Capital. Persona offers flexible building blocks that help businesses fight fraud, stay compliant, and build trust among their customers. For example, Coursera uses Persona to ensure the right person is earning each degree, OpenAI uses Persona to prevent the misuse of ChatGPT, and Lime checks the ages of customers before they ride electric scooters or bikes. To learn more, check out this short video.
company.teamAbout:
Approximately 70% of our team is made up of referrals from former co-workers (our largest alumni populations are from Square, Dropbox, LinkedIn and Coursera). 

Notably low attrition particularly in our tech team where engineers have an average of 10 years of industry experience.

Our team is in-office in San Francisco, with the option to work from home on Monday and Friday.

name: Enterprise Customer Success Manager
description:
As a member of Persona’s Customer Success team, you will be a trusted advisor for a portfolio of growing Enterprise and Core customers, supporting them at each stage of their lifecycle with Persona and ensuring they derive value from our platform and services. You’ll be responsible for onboarding new customers, managing relationships with existing customers, and strengthening customers’ engagements with Persona through renewals and expansion.

This isn't your typical Customer Success role. At Persona, you will be a key contributor on a fast-growing go-to-market team working cross-functionally across sales, engineering, product, and marketing. Our Customer Success Managers have directly influenced business outcomes, impacted Persona's product roadmap by synthesizing customer feedback, and driven revenue growth through deepened platform adoption.

requirements.description: • Proven track record of learning and understanding technical and complex products.
• Prioritization of customer experience and empathy, with a goal of portfolio retention and expansion.
• Outstanding verbal and written communication, including explaining complex concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
• Track record of structured, analytics-driven problem solving.
• Excellent multitasking capabilities, including prioritizing effectively across a wide variety of tasks and evaluating situational urgency.
• An ability to take on open-ended problems in unstructured environments.

• A growth mindset - you enjoy learning, are comfortable with ambiguity, can be flexible in your thinking, are ready to give and receive both constructive and positive feedback to be a great teammate!
• Willingness to travel up to 25% of the time for customer engagements.
Academic background from a top-tier university (think Ivies, top-10 schools)
• Experience managing complex customer engagements.
requirements.explanation: See ideal companies for examples of some of those

responsibilities: Be responsible for the ultimate success of our relationship with our customers throughout onboarding, implementation, launch, post-launch, adoption, expansion, and renewal
Master Persona’s platform products and future product offerings; and ability to communicate offerings to customers
Own the customer relationship with large organizations, serving as a trusted advisor to executive and senior leadership across various functions
Manage best-in-class customer health in your portfolio by identifying growth opportunities and mitigating account risks, with the support of your account team
Engage with Persona’s Engineering, Product, Design, Sales, and Solutions Engineering teams to incorporate and prioritize customer feedback and inform product roadmap
Drive strong customer advocacy efforts via collaboration with Persona’s Marketing team to identify and amplify our biggest customer success stories
Create and influence playbooks and other scalable resources, both internally and externally, to optimize the customer experience throughout the customer lifecycle
workPlaceText: In-office with the option to work from home Mondays and Fridays in San Francisco or New York
experience_info: at a B2B company with a complex technical SaaS product in Customer Success, Account Management, or other relevant roles.
recruiting_advice:
What we're looking for: Ability to pick up a highly technical product, grit and great work-ethic, strong attention to detail, previous customer-facing experience working with large/enterprise customers.

More information about soft skills:

1. Having a high competency in understanding, dissecting and communicating complex product and technical issues to both non-technical audiences. Being able to communicate complex ideas in simple, broken down ways.

2. Cross functional collaboration will be key to this role. Customer success managers cover a wide breadth of topics, and have to know the platform extremely well. That said, there is a limit to what we can achieve without others, and our success depends on the internal relationships we have. We could not support our customers at the level we do without the rest of the company.

3. Staying calm in a storm. Being able to absorb customer feedback and turn it into something productive - if a customer is unhappy with a certain feature, being able to communicate that effectively with the proper amount of urgency to the relevant folks will bring this person immense success. If a customer is happy - sharing that more broadly with everyone who is involved. It takes a village to support these customers!

4. Ability to produce content, create assets, and adapt exist resources to become relevant to your customers. A lot of the time, we do NOT want to re-invent the wheel to save time. If resources exist, we should be leveraging them, updating them, and making them relevant to our customers! On the other side of things, if the resource, process or public asset does not exist, being able to see the gap and have the skill set to go and fill it will be huge.

company.name: Persona
company.description: Founded in 2018, Persona is a 250-person tech startup based in San Francisco, backed by Index Ventures, Coatue, Founders Fund, and First Round Capital. name: Backend Engineer
description:
Help our Backend team at Ender build robust and scalable APIs.

We’re looking for a backend developer who will be a key member of our tight-knit team. You will be responsible for building Services & APIs by writing code that is clean, minimal, and easy to understand.

A typical day involves working with Frontend, Design, and Product teams to solve issues that are massively scalable. Our software is used by property investors, vendors, tenants, and our operations team.

Join us to solve fundamental problems in real estate sales, leasing, accounting, and maintenance coordination.

We're looking for someone who

  • Loves clear, concise, readable code

  • Obsesses over continuous personal and technical improvement

  • Strikes the optimal balance between rigor and velocity

  • Offers multiple solutions and chooses the most appropriate

  • Crafts solutions from both full specs and loosely-defined requirements

  • Has empathy, a collaborative spirit, and the ability to think like a user

  • Has a startup mentality: ready to solve big problems with a small team

  • Has a strong work ethic

requirements.description: Curiosity about real estate space
Extensive knowledge of data structures and algorithms
Ability to write concurrent code that utilizes our multi-core servers
Experience debugging code, solving problems, and fixing performance bottlenecks
Backend experience with Java on AWS
Experience in and excited to join a high-growth, fast-paced startup (seed-Series A)
(For Junior candidates) Excited to work in-office with the team in Austin 5 days/week.
requirements.explanation: After the first 30-90 days, we can be more flexible with hybrid work.

requirements.description: CS degree or similar from a top university (MIT, Ivies, Stanford, CMU)

responsibilities: Building robust and scalable APIs
Writing clean, minimal, and easy to understand code
Working with Frontend, Design, and Product teams
Solving massively scalable issues
Solving fundamental problems in real estate sales, leasing, accounting, and maintenance coordination
workPlaceText: In-person in Austin, TX (Junior) or Remote for Mid & S1
experience_info: We want engineers that don't need micromanaging and are able to work independently. These people (all levels) will be in the weeds, getting work done.
recruiting_advice: Focusing on candidates that can hit the ground running. 1-6 years is probably a good range. Startup or tech experience is super helpful.
tech_stack: In-person and remote whiteboarding when team members are away from Austin

company.name: Ender
company.description: Unlock Your Data. Real estate data is stuck in silos. Ender is the first fully integrated real estate ERP system, allowing for AI applications and automation of workflows.
company.teamAbout:
Our team is comprised of founders, executives, and early employees from Addepar, Amazon, Robinhood, and VC funds. We've built massive systems that automate solutions to complex problems at scale. We're taking our talent to real estate.

See who we are at https://ender.com/team.

name: Software Engineer, Full Stack
description:
We're looking for an impact-driven intermediate, senior, or staff engineer passionate about solving hard problems. You'll be joining an experienced founding team with senior engineers from Mozilla, Spotify, LinkedIn, and Apple on a mission to automate mundane, soul-crushing tasks.

You'll have the opportunity to make a major dent here - you, along with a few other engineers, will be building a data graph used by over 50,000 companies to help standardize the internet. You'll have direct product input and shape our roadmap as we grow to 1M users.

We are committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workplace where everyone feels valued and empowered.

requirements.description: Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform.
Degree in computer science or related field (electrical engineering, computer engineering, systems engineering)
requirements.explanation:
• An engineering field related to computers, no mechanical/chemical engineering etc.

  • Dropouts OK

requirements.description: Does personal projects or contributes to open source
Excited to work with the team a few times a month in San Francisco or Toronto. We don't support relocation.
Experience working on complex products
requirements.explanation:
No recent:

  • Marketing websites

  • CMS

  • Internal tools

  • Consulting

  • Wordpress development

requirements.description: Experience with Typescript
Experience with modern databases such as Postgres, MySQL, MongoDB, Firebase
requirements.explanation:
• No Oracle DB

  • 3+ YOE

requirements.description: Previous experience working at a tech-forward company with a high engineering bar, or high-growth startups
requirements.explanation:
• Preferable experience in Series A/B - more flexible in Toronto

  • If a long stint, 4+ years, must show a high growth rate, e.g. promotion every 2-3 years

requirements.description: Experience with React
requirements.explanation: • At least 1 YOE with React

requirements.description: Starting programming before college

responsibilities: Contribute across the stack to further bolster our flagship Chrome Extension with everything from UI components to REST APIs to database models
Develop and deliver features from inception to implementation.
Dive into infrastructure and dev-ops to help scale the delivery of our back-end (AWS)
Architect for the future of clients we intend to build (web, desktop, mobile)
Lead Magical’s design and component system to build strong reusability across Magical’s surface areas
Building the monetization foundations for users and companies to manage plans and payments
Scaling our infrastructure (AWS) to serve tens of millions of requests each day
Using on-device machine learning models to recommend personalized and contextual automations to users as they work
workPlaceText: A few days a month onsite in either: San Francisco or Toronto (Bloor-Yonge)
experience_info: If more than 4 YOE must be at senior level at their current role, must have been in IC role sometime in last 3 years
recruiting_advice:
We are looking for candidates who:

  • Are autonomous

  • Have high energy

  • Are clear and effective communicators

  • Worked at companies with a high engineering bar and/or high-growth startups

Selling points:

  • Eliminate mundane and soul-crushing tasks by building reliable automations across the entire web

  • Help build a data graph and standardize the internet

  • Leverage AI to recommend personalized and contextual automations to users as they work

  • Multi-year runway

  • Started monetizing large customers last quarter and closed $500k worth of deals
avoid_traits: Made small incremental improvements to existing mature products likely through A/B testing
Long time spent in consulting
Worked on low complexity products and/or internal tools
Worked at old school tech companies e.g. Oracle, IBM, SAP
benefits: We organize a variety of team events and off-sites (Iceland, Lisbon, Dominican Republic, Mexico), ensuring they accommodate diverse interests and encourage inclusivity for all team members
We support a healthy work-life balance and offer flexible working hours to accommodate your personal and family needs
Interesting and challenging work, because saving time for our customers and allowing them the time to find joy is the best outcome
We offer competitive salary and equity, because we know that compensation is important
Unlimited PTO because it's one less thing to have to track and is most flexible
Annual wellness credit to help you stay healthy and happy
Productivity stipend to help you furnish your home office

company.name: Magical
company.description:
Magical is the smartest way to get shit done. Whether you're filling spreadsheets, sending messages or making records, Magical effortlessly moves data across all your websites.

Ever spend hours on your computer, wondering how your college degree ended up in you copy-pasting the same slightly modified cold email over and over again? We have too... which is why we built Magical.

But on a serious note, in less than a year we've saved the world 1,000 years of time (!!!). And the love we get from our users keeps showing us how magical what we're building really is.
company.teamAbout: We’ve got world-class talent, but also Tier-1 Investors. You can learn more about both here.

name: Principal Software Engineer
description:
We are looking for a technical lead and architect who can build and reinforce our foundation for efficient large-scale data processing, and blazing fast product experiences. We source and coerce huge amounts of first-, second-, and third-party data from hundreds of channels, run dozens of AI/ML models on top of that data, and need it to be available in real-time across our applications that customers use to find, evaluate and manage their engagement with, startups. Scaling our data engine, search index/engine, and applications, with strong consistency across our surfaces and delightful performance, requires creative and elegant architecture across our stack.

If you're a systems design wizard who obsessively maps out and optimizes the foundation to accommodate all its components and are unsatisfied unless the end-user experience is best in class, please reach out since this may be the right role for you.

requirements.description: Experience in working in Python/strongly typed languages.
3+ years of backend experience: Demonstrated in building systems that scale and have experience working with various databases, data orchestration, and managing data consistency.

Experience architecting and implementing high-performance, offline-capable web applications, including frontend, backend, and data syncing components. Proficiency with offline data storage solutions (IndexedDB, LocalStorage, CacheAPI) and real-time synchronization technologies such as WebSockets.

Experience in large tech environments with a deep understanding of best practices for scaling systems, and/or hands-on growth experience in startups, having navigated and solved the growing pains firsthand.
2+ years of experience in an early-stage startup.
3+ years of experience in leading teams either as a Technical Lead or Engineering Manager.
Proven track record migrating systems in a changing environment that allows for little to no downtime to meet increasing demand.
Experience in optimizing applications for performance and responsiveness.
Obsessed about your craft and share your knowledge (tech talks, articles, open source, etc).

responsibilities: Architect and implement high-performance, offline-capable web applications, including frontend, backend, and data syncing components.
Implement offline data storage using APIs like IndexedDB, LocalStorage, or CacheAPI.
Utilize queues and observables to enhance resilience and manage complexity.
Design and implement robust multiplayer functionality:
Develop real-time synchronization mechanisms
Implement server-side logic for managing states
Optimize network communication to minimize latency and ensure smooth interactions.
Experience with large-scale data management and synchronization
Demonstrate proficiency in designing and implementing efficient data synchronization processes across multiple data storage and serving layers (e.g., databases, caches, search indexes).
Have hands-on experience working with backend systems that handle high volumes of data.
Understand the challenges and solutions for maintaining data consistency and performance in distributed systems with large datasets.
Lead migration efforts from legacy applications to modern, scalable solutions.
workPlaceText: In-person in NYC
experience_info: in frontend development: Demonstrated ability to build intuitive, user-facing, delightful products.
recruiting_advice:
Some things that have been indicators of success on our team:

  • candidates who have worked at both big tech and startups have faired well

  • candidates who have shown career progression at their roles vs jumpiness from role to role

  • candidates who have resumes that are output-driven
avoid_traits: People who come off as egotistical, overly focused on job title, leveling, comp, etc.
People who are specifically targeting management as a means of career progression
People used to have lots of resources/tools at their disposal, and not accustomed to being a little scrappy/resourceful

company.name: Harmonic
company.description:
About us

Harmonic is the startup discovery engine. We believe in innovation, entrepreneurs, and efficient capital markets. It pains us to see great startup opportunities consistently go undiscovered. So, we dedicated ourselves to mapping out the startup landscape and building the index and tools that ensure the most promising founders get found and funded.

The world's largest and most prolific venture capital firms rely on us to find and invest in the next Google, AirBnB, Uber, Stripe, and Anduril. We play a crucial part in ensuring hundreds of billions of dollars get routed efficiently and that the innovations the world would most benefit from materialize.

We’ve been growing steadily and need passionate driven people to help us get to the next level. If you want to work in a high-growth environment with some of the most talented folks on the planet and resonate with our values, read on.
benefits: Top of the line health, dental and vision insurance, with 100% premium covered
Monthly team dinner (we have a lot of foodies) for each office
Quarterly company-wide offsites. Locations so far: Barcelona, Puerto Vallarta, Austin, & Salt Lake City
company.teamAbout:
We’ve been growing steadily and need passionate driven people to help us get to the next level. If you want to work in a high-growth environment with some of the most talented folks on the planet and resonate with our values, read on.

  • Explore Working with Sang to understand decision-making processes related to the engineering function.

  • Explore the Team Page to get acquainted with the rest of the company.

name: Full Stack Engineer - Backend Focused
description:
It’s time that payments work for merchants, not the other way around. Ansa is building a branded wallet solution to increase customer retention and unlock new growth opportunities.

Our best-in-class closed-loop-wallet as a service enables payment experiences akin to the Starbucks balance, the Clipper card, Steam Wallet, and Uber Cash.

With Ansa, our merchant partners have increased revenue over 25% and seen over 50% higher customer retention. We are convinced that we are the last piece of the puzzle in driving delightful loyalty experiences with our slick payments product.

Engineers on our team work on new product initiatives and help scale our payment infrastructure to millions of processed $ volume. You’ll work closely with our existing customers and cross functionally with our product designer and go-to-market roles. We are post revenue and are excited to rapidly grow this year. From building out our in-store payment offering, growing our developer platform, to spearheading our robust analytics and reporting products, there’s a ton of exciting work to take on!

requirements.description: Experience working with Golang web frameworks, AWS, Postgres.
Operated at an early stage or growth stage startup before.
• Based in the SF Bay Area (or willing to relocate!) and excited about working closely in-person with a tight-knit team.
• Interested in building a top class engineering culture from the ground up.
Innately curious and brave enough to consider new payment paradigms or verticals for applications, can navigate low information environments.
Loves working in fast-paced, lean environments.
Execution oriented, excited by the high-ownership nature of joining a team at this stage.
Appreciates and looks for elegant solutions but understands trade-offs of robust designs/engineering vs. moving fast.
Experience building fast, reliable cloud applications.
• Experience in building one of these areas: core ledgers, money movement platforms/services, and merchant facing APIs for in-app/online POS.
• Bonus points if you have experience in mentoring other team members, and have previously worked closely with designers.
Passionate about payments and/or fintech.

responsibilities: Scale our core ledger that tracks both digital and physical money movement.
Scale our card network integrations that power in-store payments.
Build and maintain complex reconciliation infrastructure to make sure we never lose a cent across our partner bank, payment processors, merchants, and card networks.
Build and scale our financial reporting & accounting integrations that allow our merchants to close their books seamlessly.
Design and maintain our payment APIs and SDKs that make for frictionless integration.
Design and build features that prime us for enterprise-readiness, including SSO and RBAC.
Design and ship products that help merchants drive end-user adoption and engagement, creating a flywheel of user spend (i.e. our incentives engine and analytics).
Scale up our cloud infrastructure as we move towards fully containerized, blue-green deployment.
Own end-to-end design, implementation, and release of features.
Design and implement engineering processes.
Prototype new ideas and iterate towards the ideal user experience.
Contribute to our engineering infrastructure.
Help grow our engineering team 🎉
workPlaceText: In-person in San Francisco
visa_text_more: Can sponsor TN and E3 but not H1B
experience_info: independently owning and driving scalable, impactful projects end to end.
recruiting_advice:
The candidates that do the best in our process are curious, bright, and have been an owner in previous roles. Of course, candidates coming out of fintech are always interesting, but we're also open to candidates who don't have fintech experience but are eager to break into it. We always focus very heavily on clear and concise communication as well. We are looking for candidates who are not only strong communicators, but also are capable of taking highly complex concepts and sharing them cross-functionally with non-technical team members.

We have a super strong culture! Sophia, our CEO, and JT, our CTO, are absolutely incredible leaders, and we take every opportunity we can to bond as a team. We went to Mexico City in the spring for our offsite, we host monthly game nights, we have happy hours to celebrate team wins, and so much more. We also have two adorable office dogs, Earl and Bowie! 🐶
avoid_traits: Not curious
Looking for solid structure
Doesn't like to be a team player
Ego
Interested in comp more than product
Doesn't see the value in in-person collaboration

company.name: Ansa
company.description:
Commerce has out-innovated payments. Ansa is the payments platform to help merchants catch up: increase revenue, retention, and take back control of unit economics.

Ansa enables any brand to launch closed-loop wallets for a fraction of the effort and cost. We power payment experiences akin to the Starbucks balance, the Clipper card, Steam Wallet, and Uber Cash.

With Ansa, our merchant partners have increased revenue over 25% and seen over 50% higher customer retention. We’re the last piece of the puzzle to drive delightful experiences by combining payments, incentives, and customer insights.
benefits: Stellar health, dental, vision insurance coverage, including fertility benefits & One Medical.
Commuter benefits and new equipment: laptop, monitor, and other tools to help you on days when you WFH.
We also offer 401(k), healthcare FSA, and dependent care FSA to fit your needs.
company.teamAbout:
We believe in shipping product with a unified sense of focus, which is why we prioritize our values, product principles, and how we collaborate together. We have a strong ethos of intentionality and a fixation on delivering products that our customers love.

While we take our work seriously, we strive to foster a culture of levity, curiosity, and kindness!

As an in-person team, we live for the office white-boarding moments, fun lunch conversations, and monthly game nights. We all play a role in making the office an exciting and safe space to be.

We’re proud to be building an inclusive team and welcome all orientations, identities, origins, religions, and ancestry.

Our culture

  • Bias to action, momentum is everything.

  • Getting it right is better than being right - we win as a team.

  • We collaborate efficiently.

  • Have an eternal learner’s mindset.

  • Be an owner.

  • Enjoy the journey and be good to each other.

  • We have a physical office space in the Mission – we aim to work mostly in-person but are flexible with hybrid work. We care deeply about making the office a fun and safe space to collaborate as a team and grow our team culture and identity

  • Half the fun of this stage of building is the camaraderie, standing around a whiteboard, and codifying the culture together.

  • We provide daily team lunches 🍽️ we’re close to a lot of great food options and love trying new places as a team (Flour + water, bon nene, tartine, etc.)

  • We also have monthly game nights 🎲

As a Founding team member, you will be setting the direction for our product from the ground up and play a crucial role in the success of Botchat’s venture. This role will entail working in the NYC office with the Founder approximately 4 times a week.

name: Founding Engineer, Product
description:
Providers need to get in network with insurance companies, but the process is time-consuming and an administrative headache. We ingest provider information and use AI to automate submissions, saving providers months of waiting.

We provide standardized questionnaires to collect all required provider information and documents. Our customers are then able to request a new network enrollment in just a few clicks instead of spending hours navigating insurance websites to find the correct forms.

On the backend, we’re automating each part of the enrollment process. We also have an experienced ops team as humans-in-the-loop to make sure everything is processed correctly. This ensures that enrollments are completed quickly and accurately, our customers’ two most important KPIs.

We’re growing rapidly each month and are hiring a founding engineer to build features and automation to meet customer demand. Our vision is for all of this paperwork to be entirely automated by computers and to become the de facto network infrastructure between providers and payers.

As the founding engineer, you’ll have a hand in all of our systems: customer-facing web app, AI automation, and internal tooling/infrastructure. You’ll also have a significant voice in deciding engineering strategy, best practices, and culture for the whole company going forward.

company.name: Ply Health (YC S24)
company.description:
Every healthcare provider in the US must be enrolled with payer networks (e.g. commercial insurance, Medicaid, etc.) to bill for services. However, the payer enrollment process is fragmented and time-consuming: each payer in every state has a unique process. This process is currently entirely manual and the complexity often leads to errors, causing months of delays and lost billings for providers.

Ply Health standardizes and automates payer enrollment. Providers fill out a single form and our AI-powered connectors submit the correct forms and manage the cases until completion. In half a year, we’ve done over 3,000 enrollments for our customers and helped some of our customers halve their enrollment timelines, earning them hundreds of thousands of dollars more in revenue per provider.

name: Founding Fullstack Engineer
description:
Apriora is similar to a marketplace, as we serve both candidates through the interview experience and employers through the data aggregation and analysis platform. As a hands-on engineer, you will build both consumer-facing and enterprise-grade software with a clear opportunity for growth.

Problems that you could work on related to consumer software are:

  • How can we bring the average interviewer response latency down to 200ms?

  • How can we fine-tune our models to decrease hallucination and increase response accuracy?

  • How will our system architecture change as we scale to thousands more users, concurrently?

Problems that you could work on related to enterprise software are:

  • How do we integrate with our customer’s internal hiring systems?

  • What’s the best way to present the interview data visually and as fast as possible?

  • And many, many feature requests that need to be built out!

company.name: Apriora (YC W24)
company.description: Apriora is building the future of hiring. Apriora conducts job interviews in real-time with an AI recruiter. Companies use us to get the best hiring signal on their applicant pool and hire in a fraction of the time. Our AI recruiter has a live conversation over a video call with each of your candidates based on the interview questions you choose or that are recommended based on the job description. During the interview, our AI asks personalized follow-up questions in real-time based on the candidate's responses. Our AI recruiter can be customized to your roles in minutes and has already conducted thousands of interviews across engineering, IT, retail, hospitality, and more.
company.productDescription: Our autonomous AI recruiter is powered by our conversational AI technology. You'll be helping build the next fully autonomous recruiter which is capable of sourcing, screening, and interviewing candidates. You will contribute to expanding our beautiful app for recruiters to view and analyze all the interview data, as well as build integrations for our enterprise customers.
company.teamAbout: At Apriora, we're a small, passionate team focused on building a revolutionary AI Recruiter. As a founding full-stack engineer, you'll join a group of curious builders who thrive on solving challenging problems. We're a young team, hungry to create and constantly push the limits of what's possible. We primarily work with Next.js, Python, and Express, and we’re looking for someone who loves to code, experiment, and iterate quickly. Hackathon experience is a huge plus because we love that "build fast, break things, and learn" mentality. Most importantly, we believe in being kind, collaborative, and fostering a positive, supportive environment where everyone can contribute their best. If you're driven, curious, and excited to shape the future with us, you'll feel right at home.

SwingVision is a team of A.I. experts from Tesla & Apple venture backed by Tennis Australia, Sony & Techstars. We're on a mission to democratize the professional sports experience for athletes of all levels.

Our mobile A.I. processes video on-device (no internet required) to generate pro-quality stats, highlights and officiating in real-time.

company.teamAbout:
SwingVision was founded by two UC Berkeley roommates with a passion for sports and technology.

Swupnil Sahai was working on autonomous driving at Tesla and Richard Hsu was working at an AI startup when they realized they could use computer vision to improve their tennis game. In 2019, they joined forces and assembled the SwingVision team to change sports forever.

From pitching Andy Roddick in a locker room to getting featured in Apple's product launch events, SwingVision’s journey has been a roller coaster. But the team is just getting started!

company.name: konko.ai
company.description:
We're on a mission to make inbound sales more helpful for buyers, more fulfilling for sales and higher converting for companies.

Modern inbound sales is chaos: buyers are bombarded with choices and sellers scramble to grab fleeting moments of buyer attention.

The expansion of the digital economy has only added to the noise—searches yield overwhelming results, and options blur together leaving buyers hesitant and inbound sales reps drowning in leads that seldom convert.

We're here to change that.

Our AI agent for inbound sales - Kora - cuts through the noise by autonomously engaging with every lead at the moment of intent, on the right messaging channel with the right talk track.

This isn't your average bot: Kora is infused with emotional intelligence and the tactics of top sales reps.

Just like your top inbound sales rep, Kora has real conversations with leads.

She asks thoughtful questions to understand each and every lead's context and earn their trust. She provides helpful information and handles objections. She passes on  high-quality leads to sales and puts tire-kickers on 'nurture mode'.

Unlike your top inbound sales rep, though, Kora does this at scale 24/7.

For companies, Kora delivers 140% higher conversion rates at lower customer acquisition costs.

For sales teams, Kora deflects low-value leads and surfaces high quality leads so sales can swopp for the close.

And for buyers, she delivers a responsive, empathetic buying experience right when it counts.

Welcome to the future of inbound sales.‍
company.teamAbout: Konko AI was founded and is led by Harvard Business School graduates and Financial Institution + AI experts Jean Marc Goguikian (BCG, JP Morgan) and Michael Haddad (C3 AI, Tesla). The team includes AI researchers and engineers with experience at C3 AI, DataRobot, IBM, SAP, and Columbia.

name: Software Engineer
description:
At Statics, we believe building a successful AI agent involves three key data layer pillars:

  1. Discovery: Identifying the data an agent needs to perform effectively and determining where this data is stored.

  2. Authentication: Securely obtaining the necessary credentials for agents to access information.

  3. Ingest: Cataloging and organizing the accessed data, and defining its governance.

We believe all three pillars are critical, and we are actively developing solutions at the second pillar today. 

As a Software Engineer at Statics, you will be an essential part of the product development dialogue, working to enhance the developer experience in helping AI agents access the right data.

company.name: Tennr
company.description:
Today, when you go to your doctor and need to be referred to a specialist (e.g., for sleep apnea), your doctor sends a fax (yes, in 2024, 90% of provider-provider communication is a 1980s fax). These are often converted into 20+ page PDFs, with handwritten (doctor’s handwriting!) notes, in thousands of different formats. The problem is so complex that a person has to read it, type it up, and manually enter your information. Tennr built RaeLLM™ (7B—trained on 3M+ documents) to read these docs, talk to your doc to ensure nothing is missed, and text you to help schedule your appointment so you can get better, faster.

Tennr is a NYC-based tech company that launched out of Y-Combinator and is backed by Andreesen Horowitz, Foundation Capital, The New Normal Fund, and other top investors.

company.name: Vitalize Care
company.description:
Vitalize Care is solving the most pressing clinical operations problems for health systems. Our first product enables health systems to optimize how they schedule and deploy nursing staff to align with real-time patient demand.

Due to poor software, nursing leaders spend ~50% of their time managing nurse schedules and rely heavily on spreadsheets and pen-and-paper. As a result, staffing decisions are inefficient, and can come down to a combination of phone-tag and guesswork. The average nurse gets called in last minute via texts or calls, and hospitals are spending millions in labor spend trying to keep up.

In less than 10 months, Vitalize has signed enterprise contracts with 20+ hospitals and has raised $7M from investors including Y Combinator, health system customers, and hospital executives around the country.

company.name: Sphere
company.description:
Overview

Sphere is on a mission to build the world’s first AI-powered cross-border compliance platform, starting with sales tax, VAT, and GST.

We currently help global companies like Runway AI, Weaviate, Zeplin and many more remain in compliance with their indirect tax requirements, wherever their customers are around the world.

Our product specifically helps with nexus monitoring, registration, real-time tax calculation, filing, and remittance.

At the core of our platform is the world’s first tax-focused LLM trained on local and global tax legislation and tax rate data.

This AI-powered tax engine will allow us to expand rapidly across geographies, product categories, and other compliance areas to help all businesses go global from day 1.

Why this is a massive opportunity

🌍 The market is enormous: This is a ‘need to have’ solution for every business around the world once they hit a certain stage. It’s becoming increasingly hard to ignore (see below) and if businesses don’t collect and remit indirect tax, they end up paying for it out of pocket later.

🌬️ Strong macro tailwinds: Businesses are going global earlier and earlier and they’re not equipped to deal with cross border compliance. Additionally, tax authorities are clamping down on cross border tax compliance which means demand for this solution will continue to grow (e.g. EU forcing payment processors to hand over tax evaders from April 1, 2024).

✨ AI can change the game - a lot of processes related to tax compliance / research have been extremely manual and cumbersome to date. That’s why incumbents like Avalara, Vertex (and newer players like Anrok) haven’t been able to move outside the US. We think LLMs can change that.

🔮 Product vision: We believe that tax-focused LLMs will be the foundation of a broader cross border compliance platform that help businesses go global from day 1. We want to be the Deel for international billing.
company.productDescription:
Currently our product helps companies:

- Monitor where they are exposed from a tax perspective around the world
- Register with the right tax authorities 
- Calculate and collect tax in real time at the point of transaction (either at checkout or invoices)
- File the right tax returns on a periodic basis
- Remit tax payments due when filings are submitted
company.teamAbout:
While running his last marketplace business, founder Nicholas Rudder ran into ongoing compliance challenges selling to customers across the US and around the world. Nick also comes from a finance background in Australia.

He’s now joined by a rockstar engineering team from Deel, who helped build their US and cross-border payroll compliance systems.

The team is hybrid with some roles remote and some in person in SF. Shipping velocity is high and everyone is given full autonomy and accountability on parts of the product

name: Senior Software Engineer
description:
The Role

As a Senior Software Engineer, Full-Stack at SmartPass, you’ll be an integral part of the engineering team, contributing to innovative projects that impact our million+ users. Your role involves close collaboration with the technical co-founder, and the entire Engineering, Product, and Design (EPD) team to enhance and perfect our product.

Why you might be excited about us

  1. We’re building software that reduces admin and teacher burden, making schools a better learning environment. If you’re into education and love working on tough engineering problems, you’ll love helping build our product.

  2. Good design is one of our core values and differentiators. We won’t ship something that isn’t easy to use and doesn't looks good, even though we’re still a small startup.

  3. A handful of us are hybrid in the NYC area, if you are too you can join us and collaborate with the founders face to face and some of the EPD team members. 

  4. We’re small, so you’ll have big responsibilities and lay the groundwork as we start scaling.

  5. Our team has a wide range of experiences (folks from Microsoft, Salesforce, Nielsen, previous startups, and K-12 administrators/teachers).

  6. Our culture is simple: we work hard, we’re lifelong learners, and we’re fun — at every monthly all-hands, we start with a “memes of the month” and then dive deep into the work someone is doing.

  7. Get in at the ground-level of a fast-growing startup.

  8. We'll mold your role to shape a career you're excited about. We care a ton about your satisfaction and job happiness, and will help prep you for whatever you're looking for in the future.

Why you might not be excited about us

  1. We’re small (~50 people in the company right now), so if you like more established companies, it’s not (yet) the right time. You’ll help build our company’s culture.

  2. Since we’re an early stage startup, projects and priorities may shift. We’ll expect you to bring your own experience and give input to shift these priorities, too.

  3. Our customers love us, and there's a lot we can improve. It's a great place to be, but that means there's some jank. (Nothing too scary! 😃)

company.name: SmartPass
company.description:
SmartPass is a fast-growing K-12 startup developing a platform to make schools more efficient. Initially, we launched with a digital hall pass system — not just bathroom and water fountain visits but managing all kinds of student movements such as counselor appointments, nurse visits, and office hours. Our solution has successfully aided over 3,000 K–12 schools in maximizing classroom time, minimizing aimless hallway wandering, and enhancing student accountability.

In the past year, we've grown our product suite to include three more offerings: Flex for adaptable scheduling, ID cards for secure student identification, and Attendance for roll-call. Each product is at a pivotal stage, and we're on a mission to make SmartPass the most delightful, easy-to-use operations tool schools have ever seen. K-12 software is typically bad, and we’re in the process of changing that.
benefits: Generous PTO, Sick days, and Holidays
100% Healthcare Coverage: Medical, Dental, Vision, OneMedical, Teledoc Health, and TalkSpace
Buy Any Book Policy: Purchase books, podcasts, and newsletters for your development
401(k): Company-sponsored 401(k) for you to contribute to
Paid Parental Leave: 12 weeks for primary, 4 weeks for secondary and flexible return to work
company.teamAbout:
A Philadelphia-area high school assistant principal knew there was a better way to monitor his chaotic hallways. He took his idea to the computer science class. Two seniors—Peter Luba and Dhruv Sringari—took the problem and got to work. Their solution had an immediate impact.

After launching SmartPass in 2018, the team and the product have continued growing. Backed by Reach Capital, SmartPass is committed to building best-in-class software that supports better learning environments and reduces the burden on educators.

company.name: Ellipsis Labs
company.description:
Ellipsis Labs is a profitable, venture-backed New York-based startup, building products and infrastructure optimized for decentralized finance.

The company developed Phoenix, the leading order book spot exchange on the Solana blockchain, and a top 10 DEX (decentralized exchange) with >$50B in volume since inception in 2023.

Ellipsis Labs is continuing to build with Atlas, a layer 2 blockchain for verifiable finance. Verifiable finance enables financial applications to combine the performance of traditional finance with DeFi's transparency.
benefits: Beautiful Chelsea office with lots of natural light

Phoenix, a leading decentralized exchange, and the fastest on-chain orderbook in decentralized finance. >$50B trade volume in <2 years without market-maker incentives.

Atlas (currently in private testnet available to developers), a layer 2 blockchain for verifiable finance.

name: Customer Success & Operations
description:
Join Fulcrum's exceptional founding team to revolutionize the $1T+ insurance industry. We're transforming insurance brokerages with cutting-edge AI Agents, serving diverse customers including top 100 brokerages. You'll ensure a 12-star customer experience while optimizing our operations.

We're looking for someone with 2-5 years in B2B SaaS customer-facing roles (e.g., Implementation Manager, Customer Success Manager, Onboarding Specialist, Solutions Engineer, or Technical Project Manager), preferably in insurtech or related fields.

Excellent communication skills, adept at conveying complex concepts to various audiences
Strong project management skills with a track record of timely delivery, proud of ability to work hard and knock doors down to achieve the desired outcome
Previous experience working in an early-stage startup or dynamic environment (high-growth, high-signal startups or top VC-backed seed-Series B startups)

Experience in customer success roles (i.e. Implementation Manager, Customer Success Manager, Onboarding Specialist, Solutions Engineer, or Technical Project Manager), preferably in insurtech or related fields.
Experience working in a scrappy environment without being stuck on rigid processes, preferably has seen processes be built and/or adjusted as the company scaled
Excited to work in-person in SF with the team at least 5 days/week

responsibilities: Customer Onboarding and Relationship Management: Lead the post-sale process, including discovery sessions, go-lives, and implementation check-ins. Build deep understanding of customers' processes and needs, forging strong relationships and ensuring our solutions meet their requirements.

Implementation and Adoption: Manage multiple active implementations across various use-cases. Drive adoption of Fulcrum's full suite of solutions, identifying opportunities for customers to expand usage and realize more value.
Strategic Problem-Solving: Creatively solve customer problems with workarounds and thoughtful product modifications. Synthesize customer feedback to inform product improvements and company strategy.

Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner with internal product and engineering teams, providing insights to drive product enhancements and customer success. Develop and implement best practices, training materials, and processes for customer success as we scale.
Performance and Metrics: Own key customer success metrics, including retention, expansion, and satisfaction scores. Ensure a 12-star customer experience while optimizing our operations.
Versatile Support: As part of our small team, be ready to troubleshoot and resolve customer issues when needed.
