company.name: Fulcrum
company.description:
Fulcrum is a generative AI company focused on revolutionizing enterprise automation. Our mission is to alleviate the burden of mundane, repetitive tasks within businesses, which currently incurs costs exceeding $300 billion annually. Through our flagship product, Fulcrum, we offer a solution that eliminates the need for extensive manual labor.

Our powerful AI-automation platform helps industries, such as insurance brokerages, deliver a more premium customer experience and improve their profit margins.

Our generative AI platform enables the rapid development of specialized document processing and UI automation workflows. This allows brokerages to streamline operations, free up account managers, and boost customer experience - all while improving profit margins.
company.productDescription: Fulcrum is transforming business automation with their GenAI products. This role involves prototyping, developing, and delivering innovative features that meet the complex needs of enterprise customers. If you have a passion for AI and a desire to drive technical breakthroughs, apply now to be part of this extraordinary team.
company.teamAbout:
Our values

  • We work hard and enjoy being together in person. We are transparent about our work ethic and expectations because it enables us to have extreme ownership in building at a pace that is unmatched.

  • Customers, customers, customers. We're customer-obsessed and always start with the customer first. We are all the customer support team.

  • Speed meets reliability. We innovate rapidly without compromising stability. Our enterprise clients trust us to deliver fast, dependable solutions that drive their business forward.

  • Take care of each other. We trust each other and want to enable everyone to do their best work. That means competitive compensation, premium healthcare, unlimited PTO, and other great benefits.

You will work closely with the founders, enterprise customers, and a world-class technical team to revolutionize the way enterprises operate. We are looking for individuals who have worked across the stack on incredible products across consumer, enterprise, and various industries and who are excited about building the future of the modern enterprise and GenAI products.

This role is based in San Francisco, CA. We use an in-person work model and offer relocation assistance to new employees.

name: Senior Software Engineer
description:
You will be a part of the founding team in one of the fastest growing startups in the world. As we scale, we need an engineer who can build high-quality products quickly. You will collaborate with everyone at Rillavoice, even our customers, to deliver a world-class solution.

Rillavoice is built using Typescript with Node.js on the backend, and React/React Native on the frontend. Our integrations and AI workloads are built on Python. We use PostgreSQL as our database. We will look to your experience to impact our codebase and help our engineering team expand its skillset.

requirements.description: Ability to move fast and iterate quickly.
Experience owning technically challenging projects.
Bonus points if you have experience in mentoring engineers and interviewing!
A customer-first mindset and an interest in talking with customers to make sure what we’re building meets their needs.
Experience working in a fast-paced startup environment, building 0-1, and scaling products
Experience with cloud infra
Excited to work in-person with the team 6 days/week in NYC
Previous engagement in hackathons, entrepreneurship clubs (in school), VC fellowships, etc.

responsibilities: Build high-quality products very fast.
Contribute to building new features from scratch as we push forward our technical roadmap.
Have empathy for our users and build solutions for them. And you’ll be able to do this without any explicit planning or expectations.
Push for a high bar for the quality of our codebase and our technical decisions. You’ll help in setting the standard for the future as we scale the engineering organization here at Rillavoice.
Scale yourself. Being an early-stage company, you will need to grow in both leadership and execution as the company scales.
Help recruit future engineers to expand the team.
workPlaceText: In-person in NYC
visa_text_more: All
experience_info: building software across the entire stack, from backend to frontend (let us know if they have any preferences!)
recruiting_advice:
• We work 6 days a week in the office, my advice is to mention this from the beginning to avoid having candidates drop off later.

  • The candidates we like are the ones who are obsessive. They show signs of obsession with certain things, whether that is the project they are currently working on, or a unique/niche hobby. Obsession with startups and building new things is a great trait for an engineer at Rilla

  • Candidates who already work in startups are a great place to start. Ex-founders are even better

  • Selling points on Rilla:

    • We are one of the fastest-growing startups in history. In 2022, we went from 0 to $1.4mm ARR. In 2023, we went from $1.4mm to $11mm ARR. We have already more than doubled our ARR this year and are on track to surpass $40mm ARR.

    • We have no product managers at Rilla because we have our engineers get their hands dirty with product. We want our engineers also thinking of the what and the why, not just the how. Engineers get to talk to customers, visit them onsite, see them using the very thing they created. We tighten the feedback loop, and engineers get to see and feel the impact of their work.

    • We don't need to fundraise. We are not like most startups that are running out of runway and need VC money to stay afloat. We could be cash flow positive if we want to, but we invest all our money into growth right now. We are a company where our last raise was a Series A last year, with the numbers of a Series B/C company.

Does not want to talk to users
Lacks that hunger to grow quickly as an engineer
Not interested in startups

company.description:
Rilla’s the leading conversation intelligence software for outside sales. Think solar, roofing, and real estate sales reps.

They talk to customers face to face, our mobile app records their conversations, and our AI automatically transcribes and analyzes their conversations to help them improve their sales.

Our vision is to bring the power of conversation intelligence from the Zoom meeting and the call center to the more than 10M sales people who work offline.

We’re backed by Byron Deeter (one of the best investors in history) from Bessemer Venture Partners, the top Cloud investor in the world. And we’re a Cloud 100 Rising Star company.

company.name: Causal
company.description: We're building a new way to think and work with numbers. Causal is a tool for performing calculations, visualising data, and communicating with numbers. We take the good parts of spreadsheets and combine them with the good parts of programming, to make number-crunching fast, collaborative, and accessible to everyone. We are well-funded by some great VCs (Accel, Coatue, Passion Capital) and angel investors (Naval Ravikant, Scott Belsky, and many more) across the US and Europe.
company.teamAbout:
Join us as we build the future of spreadsheets. We're on a mission to help people use numbers to make better decisions together. There's lots to do as we build Causal to become the de-facto tool for working with numbers — we'd love your help.

We're a small team, and well-funded by some great VCs and angel investors (Naval Ravikant, Scott Belsky, and many more) across the US and Europe.

name: Forward Deployed Engineer, Substrate
description:
Build a new team at Palantir. The Highside Substrate team is the team responsible for Palantir’s core production infrastructure — 100s of K8s clusters — from on-prem to the major cloud hyperscalers in classified USG environments,

You will design and build Palantir’s managed Kubernetes product offerings across all these environments.

You and your team will be responsible for bootstrapping and operating the entire highside fleet of K8s clusters with zero manual steps by building industry leading tooling and contributing to core CNCF components. You will also be responsible for ensuring scale, stability and security across a matrix of compliance regimes and hosting infrastructure types. Your team culture emphasizes engineering rigor and operational excellence at scale. This means issues in production should be pre-empted and deeply root-caused, and investments in automation and self-healing systems are key.

If you’re excited about infrastructure at scale and working with Kubernetes, this is the right role for you.

requirements.description: Candidate must have an active Security Clearance (Secret or TS)
requirements.explanation: This role is for building the classified substrate team.

requirements.description:

company.name: Palantir
company.description:
At Palantir (NYSE: PLTR), we're helping the world's most important institutions use their data to solve their most urgent problems. Our software lets our customers integrate and analyze all of their data so they can answer questions that they couldn't before. From delivering disaster relief to building safer automobiles, we're honored to help make our partners better at their most important work.

Together with our customers, we're building the future of national security, healthcare, energy, finance, manufacturing, and more. And we need bright minds from around the world to help us.
company.teamAbout:
We want every Palantirian to achieve their best outcomes, that’s why we celebrate individuals’ strengths, skills, and interests, from your first interview to your longterm growth, rather than rely on traditional career ladders. Paying attention to the needs of our community enables us to optimize our opportunities to grow and helps ensure many pathways to success at Palantir. Promoting health and well-being across all areas of Palantirians’ lives is just one of the ways we’re investing in our community. Note that our offerings may vary by region.

In keeping consistent with Palantir’s values and culture, we believe employees are “better together” and in-person work affords the opportunity for more creative outcomes. Therefore, we encourage employees to work from our offices to foster connectivity and innovation. Many teams do offer hybrid options (WFH a day or two a week), allowing our employees to strike the right trade-off for their personal productivity. Based on business need, there are a few roles that allow for “Remote” work on an exceptional basis. If you are applying for one of these roles, you must work from the state in which you are employed. If the posting is specified as Onsite, you are required to work from an office.

name: Full-Stack Engineer
description:
The Product Engineering team is responsible for building and delivering workers like Alice and Jordan. 11x's customers represent a range of diverse backgrounds and maturity, from early-stage startups to established global enterprises.

We are looking for a driven, innovative and generalist full-stack software engineer to ideate, scope, and train our workers around previously unsolvable problems that deliver significant value for our customers and, in turn, their future customers. You will have the opportunity to build agents full-stack to automate the billions of human hours spent on menial tasks every year. You will collaborate closely with the Product and Design team.

Our stack is rapidly changing but currently includes NextJS (+ Tailwind), Prisma and GraphQL, with AWS and Azure in the cloud as well as use of OpenAI, Anthropic, Gemini and Perplexity.

This role is based in our San Francisco HQ.

requirements.description: Would like a good pipeline of senior female engineering candidates, at least 50%
Operate with high urgency, be adept at frequent context switching and working on multiple projects at once with expansive ownership, and ruthlessly prioritize.
Experience owning problems end-to-end, and willing to pick up whatever knowledge is missing to get the job done to ensure both the team and its customers succeed.
Needs to be able to work in San Francisco every day. We work long nights and log in on weekends as well given the company's insane growth curve.
Experience in high growth startups.
Thrives in chaotic environments and can handle ambiguity. Motivated by moving very quickly.
Should not have short tenure at companies unless there is clear / strong reason for why.

responsibilities: Scale the range of workflows, data pipelines and integrations that are the core of our digital workers
Build new workflows and contribute to the maintenance of existing feature-rich workflows
Be the connective tissue between Applied Research, GTM, Product, and Engineering, especially when it comes to frontier model techniques for customer use cases
Highlight new and creative ways our architecture and Digital Worker playbook can be established in new domains

company.name: 11x
company.description:
At 11x, we build fully autonomous digital workers that automate specific jobs end-to-end. We sell work, not software.

Alice, our AI Sales Development Rep, was the pioneer in establishing the digital workers category. In less than a year since launch, she has generated millions in revenue and earned the trust of hundreds of companies, including Brex, Otter AI, and Hasura. Our second worker, Jordan, is the world’s best calling agent, and supercharges speed to lead.

Our startup thrives on a culture of relentless velocity, ownership, and boundary-pushing. Our team comprises of pirates - ex-founders and founding employees of unicorns (e.g., Brex, Tractable), as well as entrepreneurial operators from Revolut, Amazon, and McKinsey.

name: Staff Software Engineer (Forward Deployed)
description:
Being a part of Forward Deployed Engineering (FDE), you will design and build solutions to support our largest customers and scale our enterprise motion. FDE is a high-pace, customer-facing, business-focused engineering team, and we pave the way for Ramp to support the largest and most complex organizations in the world.

On FDE, you will interact directly with customers and deliver solutions end to end — from understanding pain points and shaping product decisions to designing and implementing scalable systems. We are a full stack team and collaborate closely with sales and core product engineering.

Check out our Engineering Blog for more on our tech stack, mission and values!

requirements.description: Experience at fast-paced, high-growth company, and desire to work in a fast-paced environment, continuously grow, and master your craft
Track record of shipping high-quality products and features at scale
Comfortable working with customers + strong communication skills - have translated customer needs into solutions
Experience building software in high-growth environments (startup or larger, but in high-growth periods), not just maintaining systems
Strong experience in modern frameworks (python, typescript) - want to see that people are very hands-on in the code

responsibilities: Deliver solutions end to end that meet the needs of our largest, strategic customers — understanding user pain points, scoping product specs, and designing and building software.
Collaborate closely with our sales and go-to-market teams to close exciting deals, activate customers, and expand the value Ramp provides over time.
Drive our core product engineering roadmap and make important prioritization and scoping decisions that determine when we build custom solutions vs. accelerate larger existing projects.
Solve technical challenges to support new levels of scale, and help us develop and execute our strategy to grow our enterprise platform.

Our FDE org is newer, so it's really a place for engineers to pave the way for Ramp's success with enterprise. There's a lot of autonomy and impact within these roles to shape the org and technical direction.

We love ex founders because typically they are still hands on in the code, but are comfortable speaking with customers and understanding requirements.

Mainly focused on Java, C++...

company.name: Ramp
company.description:
Ramp is the ultimate platform for modern finance teams. Combining corporate cards with expense management, bill payments, vendor management, accounting automation and more, Ramp's all-in-one solution is designed to save businesses time and money, and free finance teams to do the best work of their lives. Our mission is to help build healthier businesses, and it’s working: over 25,000 businesses on Ramp to save an average 5% and close their books 8x faster. 

Founded in 2019, Ramp powers the fastest-growing corporate card and bill payment platform in America, and enables tens of billions of dollars in purchases each year. 

Ramp's investors include Founders Fund, Stripe, Citi, Goldman Sachs, Coatue Management, D1 Capital Partners, Redpoint Ventures, General Catalyst, and Thrive Capital, as well as over 100 angel investors who were founders or executives of leading companies. The Ramp team comprises talented leaders from leading financial services and fintech companies—Stripe, Affirm, Goldman Sachs, American Express, Mastercard, Visa, Capital One—as well as technology companies such as Meta, Uber, Netflix, Twitter, Dropbox, and Instacart. In 2023, Ramp was named Fast Company’s #1 Most Innovative Company in North America, LinkedIn’s #1 Top Startup in the U.S., a CNBC Disruptor, and a TIME100 Most Influential Company.
benefits: 100% medical, dental & vision insurance coverage for you (partially covered for your dependents, One Medical annual membership)
401k (including employer match on contributions made while employed by Ramp)
WFH stipend to support your home office needs
company.teamAbout:
Build the future

Finance software hasn’t evolved in decades, making it hard for companies of all sizes to manage and deploy their resources effectively without waste.

We’re building finance automation that builds trust, helps companies grow, and frees people from busy work.

Do your best work

Launch your career at Ramp. Join a stellar team built around mentorship, empowerment, and ownership.

Growing without fear, winning the marathon sprint by sprint—these are just a few of the core values that shape us.

Invest in people

With team members across the globe, we regularly gather to connect in person, solve problems and learn from each other.

We offer wellness stipends, education support, flexible PTO, and much more to help you invest in personal growth and stay on top of your game.

name: Software Engineer (Product, Design)
description:
We’re looking for an experienced full-stack product engineer with strong design skills to join us as we build the backbone of technical sales. In this role, you’ll contribute to the entire tech stack, and will need the ability to think critically about product, design, and our customers’ goals.

By keeping a lean team, we’ve been able to move fast and want to keep it that way with high performers that take pride in their work. The role reports directly to our Founders and will work alongside our team in-person in our NYC office.

company.name: Coast
company.description:
At Coast, we make APIs visual, enabling companies to create instant and bespoke previews of a true integration for customers. Instead of showing prospects API documentation, customer-facing teams can now demo exactly what their API can do for any given prospect. Sales, marketing and solutions teams use Coast to collapse sales cycles, build pipeline, and offer bespoke solution journeys.

We’re trusted by some of the world’s most innovative companies: Twilio, Plaid, FIS, Zurich Insurance, etc., and we’re backed by firms and operators like Y Combinator, Arash Ferdowsi, Calvin French-Owen, Amjad Masad, Liquid2 and more.

In 2023 we grew 11x, and in our first year in market signed public and growth stage companies across a number of industries: fintech, healthtech, insurance, unified APIs, transportation, communication and more.

name: Tech Lead
description:
Entering and settling credible commitments is critical for global trade, but it’s slow and complex. Ante Labs is building Ante, a protocol for onchain commitments, and hiring talent excited to transform societal accountability.

Imagining how claims settlement evolves in a world without computers, and you get something rooted in legacy courts. But the world has always-on, programmable ledgers. So why not build open tools to create, verify, and settle commitments, which accelerates trust formation and growth?

We're growing, and are looking for a sharp, ambitious Tech Lead to join our team!

requirements.description: Security-minded and fast at implementation
Proficient in Solidity and smart contracts
Comfortable assigning tasks to team members and coordinating their efforts
Strong interest in mathematics, with a deep understanding of decentralized finance (DeFi) or traditional finance
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field, preferably from a top university or program
Experience working with Node.js and React
Recent experience in a start up environment

responsibilities: Flex your Solidity and smart contract proficiency, consistently and speedily producing reliable code
Deploy code to the production environment, delivering features that are intuitive, easy to test, and ready for immediate feedback
Facilitate communications between design and development teams, taking into account how technical solutions impact the user experience
Lead and manage a team of developers, delegating tasks and fostering a productive work environment
Embrace a remote-first work culture, communicating effectively with our globally distributed team
workPlaceText: Remote, globally-distributed
visa_text_more: We cannot sponsor visas but we are open to hiring globally
experience_info: in full stack development in a production environment
recruiting_advice:
Thanks for helping us with the search for our Tech Lead!

As an org, we believe that each step of the recruiting process is a opportunity to not only screen the candidate, but give the candidate positive signals about the org. We don't want to waste time for the candidate nor for ourselves, so it's top priority to use time effectively.

We are looking for a security-minded fullstack dev who is proficient in Solidity and Smart Contracts. An ideal candidate is someone who can implement quickly and 'fail fast' -- they will be writing and reading code every day! Candidate should feel comfortable and confident to assign tasks to the design and dev team, broadcast ETAs/updates to the org, and ensure product functionality when deploying updates.

Previous product and Web3 experience are a big plus.

Updated: Ante Recruiting Pitch

company.name: Ante Labs
company.description:
The vast majority of things attempted in crypto don't make sense, but a few things make a lot of sense. Ante works by enabling users to create verifiable onchain commitments with autonomous settlement. At scale, Ante can help keep the world honest, level the playing field for entering global commerce, and explicitly digitize trust.

Concrete crypto products like Uniswap, Maker, Compound / Aave, etc., have become "verbs" in crypto. That's because they actually are coherent with crypto's differentiating properties. Consequently, they make so much sense now that it's easy to forget that they weren't a part of crypto from day one.

The goal of Ante is to “verb-ify” a new primitive - an “Ante,” or a credible commitment - that, in retrospect, seems obvious. (“Tokenizing” as a concept seems obvious now, and swapping stems from tokens, but Uniswap didn’t become “a thing” until tokens were ubiquitous.)

name: Solutions Engineer
description: As a Solution Engineer at Bland, your primary responsibility will be ensuring the success of our enterprise customers as they go live with their AI phone agents. You will help with prompting, integrations, and directly with customers to make sure they have whatever they need to succeed. This is a hands on, customer facing role. We are a start-up, and we need people who understand what that means.

requirements.description: Experience working at a high-growth startup.
Comfortable working full-stack, from building React components to developing APIs to integrating with third party services.
Comfortable working outside the typical 9-5 hours - this position will involve being available at odd hours.
Experience in building enterprise level for AI Services
Experience with LLMs.
Experience with AI/ML applications, and comfortable with prompt engineering.
Customer obsessed, detail-oriented, and enjoys collaborating cross-functionally on a small team.
1+ years in a customer facing engineering role, ideally in enterprise settings.

responsibilities: Onboard enterprise customers, helping with initial prompting, integrations, and set-up
Weekly check-in calls with project leaders, weekly workshops with engineers
Anything the customer needs, we make happen, your job is to take the actions needed to do just that
Work closely with our customer success and sales teams to better understand our customers needs and how we can ensure their success
Build conversational pathways for and with our customers
Spend time on customer calls, providing support to sales
workPlaceText: In-person in SF at least 3 days/week
experience_info: in customer success, sales engineering, software engineering, or a similar position.
recruiting_advice:
We would love to have the chance to interview candidates who are inclined to be builders and are obsessed with details, but at the same time are willing to engage with customers live on a call in a customer-centric way. The ideal candidate can hold a technical conversation with a CTO or a VP of Engineering at a true enterprise but also help a non-technical member with LLM prompt questions.

They also need to be able to have a lot of autonomy in their day and be able to perform effective project management to make sure they are running successful implementation calls. This role will partner with Customer Success very closely. So if they've partnered with that team in previous roles, that will be a great addition.
avoid_traits: We want to avoid candidates whose default answer to not producing outcomes for customers is a list of these things: 1) Well, the product doesn’t have the feature; 2) The customer is hard to work with; 3) This is beyond what I can do; 4) I don’t have bandwidth.
Looking for 9-5-type work-life-balance

company.name: Cartesia
company.description:
Our mission is to build the next generation of AI: ubiquitous, interactive intelligence that runs wherever you are. Today, not even the best models can continuously process and reason over a year-long stream of audio, video and text—1B text tokens, 10B audio tokens and 1T video tokens—let alone do this on-device.

We're pioneering the model architectures that will make this possible. Our founding team met as PhDs at the Stanford AI Lab, where we invented State Space Models or SSMs, a new primitive for training large-scale foundation models. Our team combines deep expertise in model innovation and systems engineering paired with a design-minded product engineering team to build and ship cutting edge models and experiences. We bring commercial experience from companies like Scale AI, Doordash, Microsoft, Google Brain, Snorkel, Zoom, Character AI, and more.

Our first model is Sonic, the fastest model that allows you to generate ultra realistic and expressive voices from text. After just months of development, Sonic tops every reputable third party evaluation platform as the best model in the space, standing out on its latency, naturalness, and fine-grained controllability features like speed and emotion. Sonic is widely adopted across real time uses cases like call centers, gaming, avatars, and entertainment. This is just the first of many models we plan to build.

We're funded by leading investors at Index Ventures and Lightspeed Venture Partners, along with Factory, Conviction, A Star, General Catalyst, SV Angel, Databricks and others. We're fortunate to have the support of many amazing advisors, and 90+ angels across many industries, including the world's foremost experts in AI.
benefits: 🍽 Lunch, dinner and snacks at the office.
🏥 Fully covered medical, dental, and vision insurance for employees.
company.productDescription: Try it at play.cartesia.ai or check out our product page at cartesia.ai/sonic
company.teamAbout:
🏢 We’re an in-person team based out of San Francisco. We love being in the office, hanging out together and learning from each other everyday.

🚢 We ship fast. All of our work is novel and cutting edge, and execution speed is paramount. We have a high bar, and we don’t sacrifice quality and design along the way.

🤝 We support each other. We have an open and inclusive culture that’s focused on giving everyone the resources they need to succeed.

name: Product Engineer
description:
We're looking for a a senior product engineer/frontend engineer to help us build the most flexible and easy to use number crunching tool.

We have to solve various difficult engineering/UX problems:

  • A spreadsheet-esque frontend interface: This interface comes with a slew of UI/UX challenges to support a tool that is both incredibly powerful yet delightfully simple

  • Loved by beginner and expert users: Ensure our interface is highly performant, offering a low floor for newcomers and a high ceiling for power users tackling the most demanding use cases.

  • Dashboarding and data visualisation capabilities: We have to allow users to create beautiful charts and tables to communicate with numbers.

company.name: Causal
company.description: We're building a new way to think and work with numbers. Causal is a tool for performing calculations, visualising data, and communicating with numbers. We take the good parts of spreadsheets and combine them with the good parts of programming, to make number-crunching fast, collaborative, and accessible to everyone. We are well-funded by some great VCs (Accel, Coatue, Passion Capital) and angel investors (Naval Ravikant, Scott Belsky, and many more) across the US and Europe.
company.teamAbout:
Join us as we build the future of spreadsheets. We're on a mission to help people use numbers to make better decisions together. There's lots to do as we build Causal to become the de-facto tool for working with numbers — we'd love your help.

We're a small team, and well-funded by some great VCs and angel investors (Naval Ravikant, Scott Belsky, and many more) across the US and Europe.

name: Founding Senior Engineer (Frontend)
description:
The Senior Engineer (Frontend) will own the design and implementation of our entire frontend Dashboard platform. You’ll also be a foundational part of how we build the culture at Vapi.

What ramp-up will look like:

  1. Design and ship frontend features

    • Ship a pre-scoped feature within the first 7 days

    • Ship a feature independently within the first 30 days

    • Collaborate with growth engineering to ship set of experiments within the first 45 days

  2. Make the frontend codebase more robust, composable, and maintainable

    • Ship a pre-scoped improvement or refactor within the first 14 days

    • Ship an improvement independently within the first 30 days

  3. Listen to user feedback and ship improvements

    • Receive a request from Support team and ship the fix within the first 14 days

    • Pick up customer threads unprompted, investigate and solve within the first 14 days

  4. Build things that delight customers

    • Unprompted, delight a customer within the first 30 days (ex. Confetti on first call)

Join us as an early backend/fullstack hire! If you have experience building stable and performant systems at scale, we'd love to chat. We're looking for someone who can continue meaningfully contributing to our codebase as our team grows. Our stack is Node (Typescript) on AWS.

Why you might be excited about us

company.name: Kovo
company.description:
Kovo is on a mission to help underserved Americans transform their financial lives. We believe that everyone should have the opportunity to experience the rewards of economic independence. By facilitating access to credit through a first-of-its-kind financial empowerment platform, we are committed to helping those who need it most — people with limited or no access to credit because they don’t look like everyone else. Our movement is championing an accessible pathway toward financial inclusion.

Founded by seasoned veterans from Plaid and Yahoo, we are backed by Inspired Capital and supported by Homebrew alongside an incredible group of founders and leaders from Plaid, Yahoo, Cash App, Affirm, NerdWallet, LendingClub, Ramp, Alloy, Uber, Etsy, Carbon Health, Grindr, and GroupMe.

name: Backend Engineer
description:
Exa is building web-scale systems for search. We routinely run batch jobs with >1000 machines and develop production services that involve many terabytes of text. Up for the challenge?

Desired Experience:

  • You have extensive experience with some high performance language (C++, rust, etc.)

  • You’re comfortable optimizing the crap out of a system

  • Care about the problem of finding high-quality knowledge and recognize how important this is for the world

Example Projects:

  • Recreate Google-level search over 10 billion pages in 1 month

  • Revamp our document parser to work for any website

  • Make a custom vector database run over a billion vectors in under 100ms

requirements.description: Care about the problem of finding high quality knowledge and recognize how important this is for the world

Awards or merits, like...

  • Strong test scores, whether this is on SAT/ACT (1550+ on 1600 scale is good, 2300+ on 2400 scale, 35+ ACT), or math olympiads

  • Competition programming involvement is a big plus, as well as international or even national olympiad participation.
Projects: Projects are a plus when they demonstrate high technical ability such as proficiency in low level programming, intricate machine learning, etc.
requirements.explanation: However, they can be a negative, particularly commonly in students, when people just put in class projects in their resume as filler (be mindful of this, but don’t exclude people based on this necessarily).

requirements.description: Programming languages + technical skills: Familiarity in low level programming languages that one would only find learning if one has strong interest in programming. Languages like this would be Rust, Haskell, Lisp, while languages that would not fall in this category would be Python, Typescript, Java.
Culture fit: Startup mindset, teamwork/collaboration, passion for our field, humble, and friendly
requirements.explanation:
• Startup Mindset:

    • Excited to work in a startup environment.

    • Willingness to work hard and not seek a typical 9-5 job.

    • Ability to wear multiple hats and adapt to changing needs.

    • Ability to learn on the go and accept changes.

    • Takes ownership and can work independently.

    • Capable of pitching ideas and being proactive.

  • Teamwork and Collaboration:

    • Values teamwork and is open-minded.

    • Collaborative attitude and strong communication skills.

  • Passion for the Field:

    • Deeply cares about solving the problem of finding high-quality knowledge and recognizes its importance for the world.

  • Personality

    • Judge people favorably if they don’t take themselves too seriously, and have an accurate, solid view on life.

responsibilities: Recreate google-level search over 10 billion pages in 1 month
Revamp document parser to work for any website
Make a custom vector database run over a billion vectors in under 100ms

company.name: Exa
company.description:
Transformers feel magical -- they understand text at near-human level. Yet traditional search engines (cough, Google) don't feel magical -- they don't understand text at near-human level. It doesn't have to be this way.

At Exa, we're training foundational models for search. Our goal is to build systems that can instantly filter the world's knowledge to exactly what you want, no matter how complex your query. Search is a unique research problem within generative AI -- instead of generating a single piece of text, search involves asking the same questions about billions of texts.

No other AI lab is exploring this direction. That means if we don't find novel methods for search, they won't be found. Our team has already made breakthroughs not seen in the literature, and we have more coming. Want to explore the search frontier with us?
company.productDescription:
Exa finds the exact content you're looking for on the web using embeddings-based search.

Exa has three core functionalities, surfaced through our API endpoints:

- Search for pages Find any pages on the web using a natural language query. If you still need it, Exa supports also supports Google-style keyword search.

- Get contents from pages Obtain clean, up-to-date, parsed HTML from Exa search results. Contents can be semantically targeted using our 'highlights' feature.

Find similar pages Based on a link, find and return pages that are similar in meaning.

- Exa's precise content retrieval supercharges RAG pipelines, automates hours of research, and creates high-quality datasets for a niche use-case.
company.teamAbout:
We are a (growing) family of highly technical idealists on a very practical mission. Most idealists don’t have their own million dollar cluster of A100s and the ability to train SOTA self-supervised search models, but we do and we have. This is not your average AI startup 😎.

We understand that fully organizing all knowledge will require even more technical leaps. This excites us. The hardest problems reap the greatest rewards.

name: ML Research Engineer
description:
Exa was built with a simple goal — to organize all knowledge. After several years of heads-down research, we developed novel representation learning techniques and crawling infrastructure so that LLMs can intelligently find relevant information.

No other AI lab is exploring this direction. That means if we don't find novel methods for search, they won't be found. Our team has already made breakthroughs not seen in the literature, and we have more coming. Want to explore the search frontier with us?

This role involves experimenting, analyzing, and implementing creative solutions to drive new customer growth. As part of our new and expanding team, you'll have the opportunity to make a significant impact on our company's trajectory.

Crescent is building the world's largest and most-loved financial technology company.

We're building a full-stack suite of finance products designed to save businesses time and money. Starting with our high-interest checking account that helps businesses grow.

name: Growth Engineer (Business Systems)
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled Business Systems Engineer to join Crescent Financial in building the backbone of our highly successful GTM. In this role, you will have ownership over designing, developing, and optimizing our Sales and Marketing pipelines and support our GTM team in bridging our data sources seamlessly into Salesforce & Hubspot. 

This is a systems engineering role, meaning you’ll define how our GTM strategies will reflect in our CRM. We’ve kept extremely clean records and expect a disciplined approach to your data pipelines.

You’ll be joining a highly technical growth team of former founders with combined decades of experience in engineering, marketing, RevOps and sales. We're growing rapidly and you'll be a core part of a talent-dense, fast-moving team dedicated to revolutionizing business banking.

requirements.description: Strong understanding of CRM systems and experience integrating them with other enterprise platforms, we are all about connecting systems, this has to be your bread and butter.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, effective written & verbal communicator
High IQ/EQ, hungry builders looking for ownership, speed, and impact from day one
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high-growth environment
Cares about building 10x products for customers with extreme velocity
High energy and excitement about the fintech space and willing to work really hard towards our vision
Salesforce certifications are a huge plus
Experience in scaling an early-stage startup is a big plus
Very much bought into our mission to build the world's largest and most-loved fintech/financial services company
Previous fintech or financial services experience

responsibilities: Systems Design & Development: Analyze, design, and implement our GTM strategy in Salesforce. From workflows to parent-child object relationships to dashboards; we are standing up several huge initiatives that will bring in 100’s of millions in the next 60 days. We need support in managing the demand for Crescent.
Help Finalize Transition from HS to SFDC: We have bi-lateral sync processes for certain fields between the two CRMs until time is set aside to finish building the workflows in SFDC.

Make Prod Data Actionable: The Growth team spent time connecting some parts of our production database to our snowflake instance, we’ve created clean query views for consumption in Salesforce. Now we need to finish the reporting aspects and extend this data for automation. SFDC will be our hub.

Data Management & Reporting: We are keeping a clean system with little if any loose ends, this is our 1# priority as a growth team building a monolith growth stack, because once your information is dirty it’s over. We want reporting and analytics for edge cases.

Growth Mindset: Stay hungry for information, the growth world moves so quickly that if you blink it will pass you by. Crescent is on the cutting edge of growth tech from AI enriching workflows to best in class data architecture.

name: BDR/SDR
description:
We're looking for a business athlete who wants to join a championship team of high-caliber talent, focused and diligent to get the win. They have empathy, grit, and a never-die attitude. They fight hard for the customer and can add immense value to them through the product. They care deeply about the success of each customer, their clients, and their teammates. They are passionate about B2B finance and helping people become as financially efficient as possible, and they find fulfillment in doing so.

About Rampd Sales Training:

Employed salespeople at Crescent will receive training from and through the Rampd selling framework. Rampd is a leader in coaching and GTM (Go-To-Market) sales strategy for early-stage startups. They have worked with over 350 founding teams, providing coaching, training, and support for some of the most successful startups, and salespeople across the globe. Their clients have collectively raised over 3.2 billion in venture funding, and their trainings are widely used by tech companies for onboarding, training, and coaching salespeople to achieve great success in their roles.  After training, you will be well-prepared to excel in the AE (Account Executive) role at Crescent, and the skills and knowledge you gain will benefit your entire career.

requirements.description: Understanding how to use and update CRM. (We will train you)
Track record or relevant experience in meeting and exceeding sales goals
Some experience conversing with C-level executives. We will train you.
A growth mindset and complete dedication to mastering the art of selling.
• Grit and the willingness to do whatever it takes to succeed.
Being coachable, taking extreme ownership, and trusting the process.
You are a PHD → Positive, Hungry and Determined!
Excellent quantitative, analytical, and communication skills

responsibilities: Generate new sales opportunities via inbound lead follow-up and outbound communications
Research companies and add prospects to our strategic account lists
Expand the top of the sales funnel via both warm and cold outreach campaigns
Qualify prospects with Rampd selling framework while leveraging BANT criteria
Be the first point of contact for new businesses interested in using Crescent
Become an expert in our CRM and ensure pipelines and activities are consistently up to date and accurate to the highest level of attention and detail
Outbound prospecting entails finding, qualifying, and scheduling discovery calls for account executives
Handle and overcome any objections
Actively seek out feedback and improvement
Provide an exceptional and customer-centric experience
Commit to the mastery of learning the craft of selling
Most importantly, bring your energy and have fun!

visa_text_more: not for this role
experience_info: in sales at a SaaS company. Fin-tech experience is a bonus.
recruiting_advice: Good school and sports is an indicator to us of drive and talent

Only experience at large companies
Low agency, not self-starter, people who need a lot of prompting

Not extremely sharp, only moderate IQ/EQ
Is not excited about joining a hard working SF-based team

Medical, Dental, and Vision benefits (100% premiums covered)
Stipends for health and personal development
Tech and remote work bundle (up to $5k)
A proven onboarding and sales training process with Rampd that cuts typical ramp time by 75%, and gives you the skills to be successful in the role within 2 weeks.

name: Senior Product Backend Engineer
description:
We believe that the way consumers and businesses interact with their data will drastically improve in the next few years. Koodos Labs is building the products and infrastructure that’ll usher this shift and you'll be essential in achieving this vision.

We’re looking for an experienced, thoughtful senior product backend engineer to accelerate our product development. This is a backend role, with a strong collaborative element.

We’re early stage, so you'll have an outsized equity stake and an unparalleled opportunity to shape the product direction. Engineers at koodos labs decide what gets built and why, in addition to figuring out how.

requirements.description: Cares about building a great product experience with Shelf, has high level of user empathy.
Pragmatic; knows when to take on technical debt, descope features, work on architecture, and prioritize enablers.
requirements.explanation: Able to use understanding of the business and product to maximize their and the team’s impact and productivity.

requirements.description: Experience working closely with other engineers teams, comfortable with some organized chaos, and capable of managing their time to work effectively.
requirements.explanation: We're a very collaborative team, and this engineer will be a glue for the team -- ensuring frontend and backend can 'speak' to each other

requirements.description: Has worked on a product development team shipping iteratively
Experience with NodeJS, Postgres, and AWS.
Startup experience, comfortable adapting rapidly while remaining focused on a goal.
requirements.explanation: It helps if they've experienced the ups and downs of startup life before, but so long as they're excited for an adventure, we’re excited to have them join.

requirements.description: Excited to work in person with the team in New York.
requirements.explanation: We are an in-person team in New York and believe that being together IRL is an important part of setting the right pace, level of collaboration and culture early on.

requirements.description: Knows how to design data models, work with large datasets, implement APIs, and leverage cloud infrastructure to achieve your goals.
requirements.explanation: This'll be their day-to-day

requirements.description: Cares deeply about holding both code and teams to a high standard.

responsibilities: Work directly with our CTO (ex-founder & led product & engineering teams at Improbable) and our small but mighty team of founding engineers
Collaborate on building the APIs used by Shelf for new product features and experiences
Build the services, pipelines, and data to power new product capabilities
Support long-term scalability of our architecture as more users join and use Shelf
Ensure code and product quality
Implement engineering best practices across development and deployment
Guide/mentor other engineers (note: this is an IC role; if you're looking for a pure Engineering Manager role, this isn't the best fit)
workPlaceText: We're NY-based (we have our own office in West Soho) and we work in-person.
visa_text_more: H1B Transfer accepted
experience_info: building backend applications: You have experience build scalable systems that are able to process data to power features and user experiences.
recruiting_advice:
• Working directly on the API layer at product-led and data-heavy companies

  • Folks interfacing between frontend/design engineers and the Backend in their day-to-day

  • Ex-technical founder / current technical founder

  • Ideally have done both the early stage, and later stage -- know how to cross the boundary between them.
avoid_traits: Individualistic and non-collaborative
Bad communicator
Can't compromise
Wants to prioritize work-life balance
Ego

company.name: Koodos
company.description:
koodos created Shelf, which connects to your favorite services to help you keep track of what you’re consuming and, optionally, give your friends an authentic view into what you’ve been into lately. On Shelf, you can track what you’ve been consuming and get personal insights, plus you get a customizable web page that updates automatically and lets you showcase your vibe—sort of like a “Spotify Wrapped", but for everything!

To power Shelf, koodos developed DataMover, pioneering infrastructure that allows users to securely access their data from any site or app and store it in their personal data store. Similar to Plaid but for user data, DataMover has already been integrated into multiple apps, securely linking hundreds of thousands of accounts and empowering users to regain full control over their data access and privacy.

While Shelf’s fun features are front and center, it’s also about giving users true control over their data. With the rise of AI agents and the death of cookies, there’s a growing need for personal data access and the future is shifting from centralized data aggregation to a more decentralized model where individuals have more of a say around access to their own data. Beyond market pull, this wave is driven by regulatory changes, technological advances in secure data management and transfers, and the rise of apps that seamlessly interact with user-controlled personal data stores.
company.productDescription:
Shelf is a digital storefront for your taste & your new personal data manager.

It's built using DataMover, a toolkit for secure, user-permissioned integrations that lets you get user data from any site or app — even if it doesn't have an API.
company.teamAbout:
We have backgrounds as startup founders, in big tech, academia, creative industries and as early members at successful startups. We’ve come together around a shared vision and are dedicated to creating positive experiences for cyberspace.

We care about building a genuinely diverse team. We are a majority-first gen immigrant team and sponsor visas — we think that’s important as we build towards enabling easier digital migration. We share values of individuality, empathy, reliability, kindness and humility. One big overlap among our life experiences is contrasts: contrasts between our own upbringing and the world around us, contrasts between what was expected of us and what we ended up pursuing and our bringing together of contrasting, interdisciplinary worlds.

We aspire to build the best team of the 2020s. Just like PayPal in the 90s, Google in the 00s, and Stripe in the 10s, we want to be known as "a place where it's good to be from."

More about us here.

name: Founding Fullstack Engineer
description:
Danswer is the AI assistant that connects to all your company tools and docs and makes finding any piece of information a breeze. Think ChatGPT, but with access to all your companies documents (only the ones you have access to, of course :P). Or, if you know Glean, you can think about it like an open-source Glean.

As a founding engineer hire at Danswer, you'll play a pivotal role in shaping the core product. Help us become the single application where users go to find all work related information. This is an in-person role based in San Francisco, CA.

requirements.description: Excited to work in a fast moving startup and in small teams with significant unknowns and able to execute well with incomplete information.
requirements.explanation: This is just the dichotomy between startups and big tech. We want people who are excited about the startup experience.

requirements.description: Excellent communication skills, with a strong ability to collaborate with others (both teammates and external customers)
Experience with Docker/Kubernetes, cloud technologies (AWS, GCP, Azure), and on-prem/cloud deployments
Experience (or even just interest) in information retrieval and AI (NLP, Deep Learning, GenAI)
Previous Founder or 0-to-1 engineer at early startup
Experience with Typescript/React/NextJS, Python, Relational DB (Postgres), Redis, Docker
requirements.explanation: This is our tech stack so it's generally best if they are at least familiar with a few of these.

requirements.description: Able to work in-person with the team in San Francisco, and game to work 60h+/week

responsibilities: Building a consumer grade UI experience for GenAI Chat, Enterprise Search, and Admin/Curation features
Improving the flexibility and quality of the search pipeline
Building a semantic understanding of customer organizations
Extending current permission/access controls
Expanding knowledge curation features
Owning the entire development cycle of new features
Collaborating with founders to shape and influence the direction of the product
Contributing to the engineering strategy
workPlaceText: In-person in San Francisco (FiDi). We are a hard working team, 60H weeks.
visa_text_more: Can sponsor TN and H1B transfer but not H1B sponsorship
experience_info: (or more) in software engineering and building real-world applications
recruiting_advice: Top companies with high pay or early joiners of now very successful or growth stage startups are great places to find talent.
avoid_traits: Prompt Engineer (means they like AI and wanted to work in it but didn't actually get deep into it)
Every project was internal facing or developer productivity. Ok to have some of these but not everything.
Complaints about previous team or manager.
Overly rambling, not getting to the point is no good.

company.name: Danswer
company.description:
Danswer is the open source AI Assistant connected to your company's docs, apps, and people. We sync to all sources of information (Slack, Google Drive, Confluence, Github, etc.) and provide a single place where users can ask anything and get an answer immediately. Think your most knowledgeable co-workers, all-rolled into one, and available 24/7!

We also allow users to create custom assistants with access to specific knowledge and tools. For example, customer support teams have built out agents to auto-answer inquiries based on specific internal knowledge sets. Sales teams have created an assistant who they can chat with about their past sales calls, find patterns, and use this information to close more deals. The possibilities are endless 🤯
company.teamAbout:
About the founders

Yuhong Sun - Expertise in Machine Learning (with specialization in NLP) as well as backend systems. Previously working on Deep Learning for NL-to-SQL and Semantic Search at Alation, inc.

Chris Weaver - Previously TL on the anti-fraud engine team at Robinhood. In a past life, I was a top 100 League of Legends / Hearthstone player 😎

name: Customer Engineer
description: Danswer is the AI assistant that connects to all your company tools and docs and makes finding any piece of information a breeze. Think ChatGPT, but with access to all your companies documents (only the ones you have access to, of course :P). Or, if you know Glean, you can think about it like an open-source Glean.

Experience with Typescript/React/NextJS, Python, Relational DB (Postgres), and Vespa or Elasticsearch

requirements.description: Have either helped deployed a product in the customer's cloud OR owned the deployment pipeline for a cloud-hosted, managed product

requirements.description: Able to work in-person with the team in San Francisco, and game to work 60h+/week

responsibilities: Act as the primary technical advisor to Danswer’s rapidly growing customer base, providing expert support and building strong relationships
Guide customers through their self-hosted deployments across different clouds (AWS, GCP, Azure, etc.) and deployment methods (Docker Compose, Kubernetes, AWS ECS, Helm, etc.)
Debug and patch tricky, deployment-specific issues with customers
Contribute features to systematically eliminate common issue points during deployment
Create a seamless onboarding experience by developing comprehensive documentation that enables open-source users to easily deploy Danswer in their own cloud environments
Work with customers to find the best use cases for Danswer, maximizing our impact and value
Be the voice of the customer and bridge the gap between customers and product. Relay product insights and customer feedback to founders/engineering and help shape the direction of product
workPlaceText: In-person in San Francisco
visa_text_more: H1B transfers or OPT
experience_info: as a Customer Engineer / Solutions Engineer / Deployed Engineer at a enterprise facing software company OR have 2+ years of experience in DevOps / Software Engineering and have an interest in shifting to a more customer-facing role
recruiting_advice:
This person will

  • help customers deploy our product (containerized software) on the customer's cloud

  • assist customers with any issues they run into, both pre and post-sales. Put in quick fixes to address easy to address bugs.

  • implement systematic improvements to the deployment process to make the deployment/upgrade process smoother over time

  • [not-as-important] Work with the eng team based on the learnings / feedback they've gotten from customers to improve the product.

Should be 80-90% technical, but able to communicate well and interact with and support customers.

Three main profiles we're thinking right now:

  • Perfect fit (e.g. Customer Engineer at another company with a similar problem, matches description above)

  • DevOps-type profiles who have an interest in working more closely with customers (experience managing how software is deployed).

  • Talented, underutilized Support Engineers looking for more ownership / fun / to work at a startup.

company.name: Avoca
company.description:
Avoca (YC W23) is building the AI Sales agent for the Trades - bringing AI to the industries that need it the most.

The founders are two MIT engineers with a background in building AI first products: Apurva Shrivastava, a 2nd time AI founder who was an engineer at Retool, and Tyson Chen, who was an early PM at Nuro and previously built chatbots for F500 companies at BCG.

Since entering the trillion dollar home services market just 9 months ago, Avoca is going through exponential growth and is poised to revolutionize the entire industry with its powerful AI agents capable of closing leads across all communication mediums (call, text, web-chat, lead aggregators).
company.teamAbout:
Apurva Shrivastava

Apurva is a 2nd time founder who studied CS at MIT and has worked on AI products at Apple, Sunshine, and was most recently at Retool where I did engineering. Growing up in Michigan, he helped his parents handle tiresome communications while establishing their own small business.

  

Tyson Chen

Cofounder of Avoca. Previously I was an early PM at Nuro for 3 years trying to make self-driving goods delivery a reality. Before that, I worked as a consultant at BCG in NY for 2 years, helping bring AI to multiple F500 companies. I studied CS at MIT where I focused on ML research, specifically using generative AI for drug discovery. As a kid, I helped manage communications for my mom's acupuncturist business in Pennsylvania.

name: Founding Mobile Engineer
description: As a Mobile Engineer at Finvest, you will leverage your experience building consumer-facing mobile apps to help us build the next generation finance platform. Your problem-solving skills and understanding of UI/UX principles will be essential in ensuring high performance and responsiveness in our app. You will also tackle performance and optimization issues, working to diagnose and prevent problems while being comfortable with taking projects from concept to completion.

requirements.description: Proven experience as a mobile engineer, ideally with a focus on building consumer-facing apps
Strong problem-solving skills and understanding of UI/UX principles
Experience with performance and optimization problems and eagerness to both diagnose and prevent these problems
Comfortable with going from 0 to 1

responsibilities: Develop and maintain the core frontend architecture for Finvest's mobile platform
Collaborate closely with the team to build intuitive and high-quality user experiences
Implement design principles to ensure a seamless app experience with high performance and responsiveness
Push the boundaries of frontend engineering as we build new user experiences for wealth management using AI
Build the foundational modules such that we can scale development in the future

company.name: Finvest
company.description:
We are building the next generation finance platform. Our mission is to enable everyone to grow their wealth in a stress-free way. We want to become the single place where people manage their money.

Our initial game plan is to become the #1 company for the entire fixed income market. Given the high interest rate environment and a shift towards responsible investing among the newer generation, we believe there’s a once-in-a-generational opportunity to bring bond investing to retail.

The longer-term vision is to build a new experience for wealth management. Today, a typical person uses multiple financial instruments to manage their money, inefficiently. We finally have an opportunity to help them make the best of their money by building an intelligence layer over their financial life.

Additionally, with the advances in AI, we believe we have an opportunity to build while being lean. We have seen ambitious companies in fintech implode due to high customer acquisition cost while competing with capital advantaged incumbents. Not anymore - we’re changing the playbook.
company.teamAbout:
Our values

  • At Finvest, we're not just aiming for incremental improvements. We aim to create groundbreaking products that are 100x better than existing solutions. Our goal is to make old methods obsolete to the point where we can't imagine going back.

  • We believe hunger is more important than expertise or fancy resumes. We let the best ideas win, not the loudest voices. That's how A+ teams win.

  • We challenge the status quo. We are a team of dreamers and optimists.

If this is you, you should join us

Instead of just looking for technical skills, we want people who resonate with our mission and can operate with a similar vigor. Here's what that means:

  • You have a chip on your shoulder.

    We have no interest in building a small company. Startups require a lot of work anyway - there is no point wasting time if you aim small.

  • You like working in a small team and want to take ownership of new products.

    The sky is the limit at Finvest. We don’t ever intend to hire a big team. We want hungry and tenacious folks who want to learn and grow their careers.

  • You love ownership. You obsesses over details.

    We have an ambitious roadmap. You won’t get an opportunity to take this level of ownership anywhere else.

  • You will work with smart, no BS-type people here. Outlier outcomes require outlier teams.

We work in-person.

We believe that the best products are created by teams who work together. Our office is located in Financial District in San Francisco, a few blocks from the BART and MUNI stations. We work in-person 5 days a week.

name: Founding Backend Engineer
description:
At Homie, we're constantly building, launching and iterating. We believe that the best consumer products are built by small teams with low-ego. We want to continue trying and failing, experimenting constantly, and obsessing over the user experience. We go the extra mile in everything we do, with users are our only source of truth.

We're looking for a talented engineer to own our backend function and help us continue to exponentiate our trajectory.

requirements.description: Experience working on social or B2C products
Excited to work in-office with the team in San Francisco
High level of autonomy, experience growing products from 0-1 in a fast-paced environment
Experience building scalable data systems
CS degree or similar from a top university
Strong backend experience in python, java, node, rust, etc. - track record of being a strong backend engineer more important than specific language
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to articulate system design concepts and technical solutions clearly to team members

Candidates should show clear evidence of rapid professional growth in previous roles. For junior candidates, this could mean multiple internships at well-known software companies or rapid promotions (less than two years per role) if they stayed with one company.

responsibilities: Work across products and the data platform solving a wide breadth of problems
Architect systems at scale - everything from real-time web scraping to vision grounded state machines to beat bot protections
workPlaceText: On-site at our office in Hayes Valley
visa_text_more: can sponsor H1B transfer and TN
experience_info: working in early stage, high-growth startups (former founder is a big plus) - can be flexible, we're more focused on the type of work they've done than the number of years they've worked

We've found that high agency engineers with 2-7 YOE and experience building in consumer are most well suited for success at the company. So far we have only hired former founders, but open to hiring non-founders as well.

Here is a short slide deck with a bit more info on our team: https://docsend.com/view/ysnyhn9pazbgkrcq
avoid_traits: High ego

company.name: Homie
company.description:
Our Team

We build things that push the boundaries of what is possible: Homie is pioneering a paradigm shift for consumer applications in the age of AI. We create products that challenge the status quo and redefine what it means to socialize digitally.

We are a team of technical founders: Everyone on this team is hyper ambitious and technical. The founders were early engineers at Sequoia backed consumer unicorns. We look for people who care about their technical craft but are equally pragmatic. We prioritize prototyping quickly as the vast majority of the technical challenges we face require bespoke solutions.

We are backed by world class investors: We’ve raised 3.1M from Keith Rabois at Khosla Ventures, OpenAI Fund, and angels like Naveen Rao (CEO of MosaicML) and Surabhi Gupta (VP of Eng at Robinhood)

Our Work

Location

People are at the core of our business, and being irl allows us to accelerate. Everyone works and lives near our beautiful office in Hayes Valley, San Francisco.

Vibe

We are constantly building, launching and iterating. We believe that the best consumer products are built by small teams with low-ego. You’ll get to play a key role in continuing to exponentiate our trajectory.

Product

We are product people. 95% of the things we try fail. We experiment, obsess over the user experience and go the extra mile in everything they do. Users are the only source of truth.
benefits: Significant ownership stake in the company
Significant stipend for living within 15 min walk of office

We look for people who care about their technical craft but are equally pragmatic. name: Founding Engineer
description: We are looking for an exceptional and passionate Full Stack Engineer to join us. You’ll have the opportunities to ship to thousands of users from day 1. You’ll have significant ownership of the product. You’ll be building the most fun experience ever for global music fans!

Experience launching consumer apps on your own in the past.

Experience hacking together side projects

recruiting_advice:
How do we work?

  • Significant equity + competitive salary We’re a team of 3 and want our next teammates to feel true ownership over the company.

    • 0.5% - 2% equity

    • $150 to $200k salary

  • Remote friendly for anyone within +/- 3 hours of EST.

  • Hybrid in New York & Toronto if you’d prefer to cowork.

  • Work Style We work intensely and we work whenever we need to work. We could take a day off on Wednesday but we will grind through the weekend.

  • Fun We’ll always host offsite at a music festival :)

company.name: Soundmap
company.description:
💚 What is Soundmap? Soundmap is a gamified consumer social app for music fans. We have scaled to 300k DAU in less than 6 months and we are consistently top 3 in the iOS music game chart.

We have the opportunity to bring a brand new experience to millions of music fans around the world. We want your help to make that happen 🎶

We’ve raised from some of the best investors in consumer, including A16Z Speedrun, Sequoia Scout Fund, Brooklyn Bridge Ventures, Gold House Ventures, Intonation Ventures, Untamed Ventures, the founder of NGL, etc. To date, Soundmap has raised around $2m and we are profitable.
benefits: Health Insurance, Gym, Festival Tickets, and more
company.teamAbout:
What is it like to work at Soundmap?

  • Fast-paced We routinely build new features in less than a week start-to-finish. Expect to ship code into production on your first day.

  • Small-and-scrappy We are a team of 3 working on Soundmap nonstop. We believe the best consumer products are built by small teams who can move mountains. You’ll get to play a key role in Soundmap’s trejactory.

  • Product-obsessed We are product people. Great product retains and grows itself. We obsess over the user experience until all the details are right. Everyone is expected to go the extra mile in everything they do.

  • Constantly-evolving We’re very early in our journey. This means we’re constantly shipping new features, taking feedback from our community, and iterating.

  • Ownership-focused You’ll be given the trust and responsibility to take ownership over what you build. Nearly everyone on our team would be building their own things if they weren’t working on Soundmap.

What are some of the challenges?

  • Uncharted territory No one else is doing what we are doing in music. We must continue to introduce brand new experiences.

  • Scaling rapidly We grew to 300k DAU in less than 6 months and will need to continue scaling rapidly.

  • Building something people love In order for Soundmap to be a household name, we have to stay laser-focused on building features and products our users love. Product wins all.

Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in AI/ML technologies and methodologies, evaluating and adopting new tools and frameworks as they are released.
Ensure the responsible use of AI within projects, advocating for ethical practices, including transparency, diversity, and privacy.

company.name: H2 Corporation

Our platform is already transforming the landscape through cutting-edge technology and AI-driven solutions. We recently exited stealth mode, raised funding from the top VCs in Japan and the US, and are rapidly accelerating our product development and go-to-market initiatives.

As an AI Engineer (CV) you will be part of our AI engineering team where you will develop cutting-edge computer vision AI systems. Your expertise in computer vision techniques, generative models, and AI research will guide our efforts in creating groundbreaking products and services. You will play a pivotal role in shaping our AI strategy and products and fostering a culture of innovation.

company.productDescription: AISekisan is the world's first cloud-based build estimator tool that incorporates advanced AI to perform complex material takeoffs from 2D drawings. AISekisan can perform takeoffs for route based materials such as pipes and ducts, a wide-range of symbols, and even auto calculate size of pipes and ducts in seconds.

name: Product Manager
description:
Join us as a Product Manager at Sorella Labs, where you will play a crucial role in orchestrating and driving forward the development of Angstrom, a first-of-its-kind decentralized trading system at the forefront of MEV-aware application design. Working closely with our Head of Engineering, you will be responsible for ensuring smooth execution and timely delivery of our protocols and peripheral systems.

This full-time, in-person role is based in our SoHo, Manhattan office.

requirements.description: Strong communication skills with the ability to bridge technical and non-technical stakeholders
Excellent organizational and leadership skills with the ability to manage multiple complex projects simultaneously
Proficiency in project management tools (JIRA) and Github
Experience working in crypto, understanding of that context and engineering requirements (i.e. Rust and Reth)
Experience with and understanding of software development lifecycles
Experience in a mix of startups + established companies (vs all startup or all enterprise level), with some of that experience at Crypto-specific companies.

responsibilities: Collaborate with the Head of Engineering to plan, organize, and oversee all aspects of the development of Angstrom.
Manage product timelines, resources, and budgets to ensure efficient delivery of various development projects.
Coordinate cross-functional teams, including developers, researchers, and stakeholders, to align efforts and meet project goals
Maintain and review prodect documentation, including project plans, status reports, and risk assessments
Facilitate communication between technical and non-technical team members, ensuring clear understanding of project objectives and progress
Identify and mitigate potential risks and bottlenecks in the development process
Track prodect milestones and KPIs, providing regular updates to leadership
Support the implementation of best practices in project management
Contribute to the development and maintenance of comprehensive documentation, including both Angstrom-related materials and internal resources like onboarding guides and process documentation.
workPlaceText: In-person in SoHo, MYC
experience_info: in product management in software development or blockchain / DeFi related projects
recruiting_advice:
• Independent workers willing to take autonomy of everything under their responsibilities

  • Young and hungry (previous founder / startup experience)

  • Competitive

company.name: Sorella Labs
company.description:
Sorella Labs is a dual product and research organization building solutions to the hardest problems in decentralized finance.

The team is currently building a robust and scalable protocol to address the two leading challenges decentralized systems pose in on-chain liquidity markets:

  • Loss-vs-rebalancing (LVR) for liquidity providers (LPs)

  • Suboptimal execution for swappers
company.teamAbout:
We are a mission-driven team of established builders and researchers creating sustainable on-chain markets and experiences. Our expertise spans across several pivotal areas of Ethereum research with a particular focus on MEV and DEX design.

Operating at the forefront of MEV-aware infrastructure, we have fostered strong working relationships with leading organizations like the Ethereum Foundation, Uniswap Labs, Chainbound, and Gattaca.

Our contributions to the community also extend to multiple open-source projects, including:

  • Reth

  • Foundry

  • Alloy

  • Ethers-reth

  • Brontes, our (forthcoming) canonical MEV tracing system built on top of Reth

name: Software Engineer
description:
Sift is looking for a talented, hardworking Software Engineer to join our team. They’ll help shape future-focused data infrastructure that will power spacecraft, satellite constellations, renewable energy, autonomous transportation, and more.

We want team members who are passionate about solving complex engineering problems and building a fast-growing startup.

As a Software Engineer at Sift, you’ll have the opportunity to heavily influence our stack because we’re still in the early stages of building the product.

Experience designing and building large-scale, distributed systems or web applications using Go, Python, or an equivalent language
Self-starter, able to navigate ambiguity and changing priorities
Team player with excellent communication skills and a collaborative work ethic

Experience with relational and non-relational databases, e.g., PostgreSQL, Druid, Pinot, Timescale, or similar
Experience with data exploration tools like Grafana, Jupyter Notebooks, Metabase, PowerBI, or similar
Strong understanding of DevOps principles: version control, testing, continuous integration, build, deployment, and monitoring
Front-end experience in React or a similar JavaScript framework
