Design and build a delightful user interface for visualizing and transforming millions of data points
Work closely with customers, including hardware engineers, to understand their problems and find efficient solutions
Help define engineering culture, standards, and processes
Collaborate with peers on architecture, design, and code reviews
workPlaceText: In-person in El Segundo on Mondays and Thursdays
experience_info: in software engineering or data engineering
recruiting_advice: Ideal candidates will have experience with Go, Python or equivalent language. Ideally they would have experience within a top tier engineering org
tech_stack: Web frontend & backend: Go, React, TypeScript, WebAssembly,  D3.js, WebGL, and Tailwind
Data: Parquet, Flink, Kafka, Beam, DuckDB, Timescale, QuestDB, InfluxDB, and Druid
Infrastructure: GitHub Actions, AWS, Azure, GCP, Docker, Kubernetes, and Terraform

company.name: Sift
company.description:
Sift is transforming how modern machines are built and operated. Our platform goes beyond traditional monitoring, enabling automated data review that catches unusual conditions in systems too complex for manual checks. This not only enhances reliability but also dramatically speeds up development cycles.

At our core, we provide a unified solution for ingesting, storing, and analyzing vast amounts of machine data. By combining powerful data processing with easy-to-use visualizations, we help engineers make sense of enormous amounts of information. From spacecraft to self-driving cars, Sift is the backbone of innovation for companies pushing technology to new limits.

Born from the challenges of spaceflight, Sift aims to accelerate technological progress. We believe that by giving engineers better tools to understand and improve their creations, we can unlock a new era of innovation. Our mission goes beyond solving today's engineering problems; we're building the foundation for a future where the most ambitious machines are developed with confidence, run with precision, and constantly improved.

We're also tackling related challenges like simplifying regulatory compliance, and improving manufacturing processes. By connecting data from various sources—from sensors to manufacturing records to regulatory requirements—we're empowering a new generation of engineers to build the technologies that will shape our world.

Join us in our journey to usher in this new age of reliable, groundbreaking technology. Whether you're launching rockets, developing autonomous systems, or advancing energy and transportation, Sift is your partner in turning vast amounts of data into insights that drive innovation forward.
company.teamAbout:
The tools to manage complex machines weren't keeping pace with the machines themselves. Our founders saw an opportunity to revolutionize how engineers work with data, paving the way for faster, safer innovation across industries. To understand the full story behind our mission, read "Why We Left SpaceX" and discover how we're transforming the landscape of hardware engineering.

Our team is comprised of senior engineers and operators from SpaceX, Google, and Palantir. We believe that the best software is written by those close to the source of the problem. One of our founders, Karthik, was a Dragon flight software lead responsible for two Dragon missions to the ISS. His team used SpaceX’s end-to-end data platform before, during, and after every Dragon mission. Our other co-founder, Austin, was a lead on Starlink’s tools team, responsible for the platform that collected data from over 2000 Starlink satellites for exploration and data review.

name: Software Engineering Manager
description:
Sift is hiring a hands-on engineering manager to lead and scale our engineering team. In this role, you’ll be instrumental in driving the technical execution of our product roadmap while ensuring our engineering practices are solid and scalable. You’ll work closely with our engineers, product team, and customers to solve complex technical challenges and deliver innovative solutions to customers building satellite constellations, renewable energy, and autonomous transportation. You will also have the unique opportunity to build and refine our engineering processes from the ground up.

We’re looking for an Engineering Manager who thrives in dynamic, high-growth environments and is passionate about building exceptional teams and products. This is a rare opportunity to shape an early-stage company’s success by driving engineering excellence. You will report to our Co-Founder and CTO and play a critical role in aligning the team’s efforts with Sift’s long-term technical vision.

requirements.description: Bachelor's degree in computer science, data science, engineering, math, physics, or STEM discipline.
Strong experience designing and building large-scale, distributed systems or web applications using Go, Python, or an equivalent language.
Deep systems background and value technical excellence. You deliver well-engineered and durable solutions, leading technical discussions, design, and code reviews.
A demonstrated track record of successful mentorship and accelerating reports growth, being an effective multiplier for the team.
Self-starter, able to navigate ambiguity and changing priorities in a start-up environment.
Proven ability to balance hands-on development with team management.
Team player with excellent communication skills and a collaborative work ethic.
Experience working with in-stream data processing and analytics using Apache Kafka, Flink, Beam, or similar
Experience with relational and non-relational databases, e.g. PostgreSQL, Druid, Pinot, Timescale, or similar
Experience with data exploration tools like Grafana, Jupyter Notebooks, Metabase, PowerBI, or similar
Strong understanding of DevOps principles; version control, testing, continuous integration, build, deployment and monitoring

responsibilities: Lead a team of engineers, accelerate their growth by providing thoughtful feedback and technical mentorship, and effectively manage their performance.
Collaborate with go-to-market, product, and engineering to build and champion a long-term technical roadmap that reduces the operational burden, ensures scalability, and mitigates risk.
Work closely with customers, including hardware engineers, to understand their problems and find efficient solutions.
Drive execution, ensuring high-quality projects are delivered on time and aligned with company goals.
Establish and refine engineering processes, including code reviews, sprint planning, and post-mortems, that increase velocity, maintain product quality, and ensure high technical standards.
Track and report key engineering metrics (e.g., error rates, shipping velocity) to ensure continuous improvement and efficient execution.
Help scale the engineering team.
Contribute to the codebase, working on high-impact features and helping solve critical technical challenges.
workPlaceText: In-person in El Segundo on Mondays and Thursdays
experience_info: in software engineering, preferably B2B SaaS, with at least 2 years of experience leading engineering efforts from analyzing requirements to scoping, shipping, and operating in production.
recruiting_advice: Ideal candidates will have experience with Go, Python or equivalent language. Ideally they would have management experience within a top tier engineering org
tech_stack: Web frontend & backend: Go, React, TypeScript, WebAssembly, D3.js, WebGL, and Tailwind
Data: Parquet, Flink, Kafka, Redpanda, Beam, DuckDB, Timescale, QuestDB, InfluxDB, and Druid
Infrastructure: GitHub Actions, AWS, Azure, GCP, Docker, Kubernetes, and Terraform

Join us in our journey to usher in this new age of reliable, groundbreaking technology. Whether you're launching rockets, developing autonomous systems, or advancing energy and transportation, Sift is your partner in turning vast amounts of data into insights that drive innovation forward.
company.teamAbout:
The tools to manage complex machines weren't keeping pace with the machines themselves. Our founders saw an opportunity to revolutionize how engineers work with data, paving the way for faster, safer innovation across industries. To understand the full story behind our mission, read "Why We Left SpaceX" and discover how we're transforming the landscape of hardware engineering.

Our team is comprised of senior engineers and operators from SpaceX, Google, and Palantir. We believe that the best software is written by those close to the source of the problem. One of our founders, Karthik, was a Dragon flight software lead responsible for two Dragon missions to the ISS. His team used SpaceX’s end-to-end data platform before, during, and after every Dragon mission. Our other co-founder, Austin, was a lead on Starlink’s tools team, responsible for the platform that collected data from over 2000 Starlink satellites for exploration and data review.

name: Senior Product Manager
description:
Sift is hiring a founding product manager to guide product strategy and develop our roadmap. In this role, you’ll be pivotal in understanding customer challenges and ensuring our product provides meaningful solutions to complex engineering problems. You’ll partner closely with customers, go-to-market teams, and engineers to ensure alignment between Sift’s vision and our user’s needs. You’ll also have the unique opportunity to shape our process from the ground up.

We’re looking for a PM who thrives in dynamic, high-growth environments and wants to service industries like satellite constellations, renewable energy, and autonomous transportation. This is a rare opportunity to influence an early-stage company's success and direction. You will report to our Co-Founder and CTO and play a critical role in translating our long-term vision into a tangible product roadmap.

requirements.description: An ability to synthesize myriad inputs and build a cohesive roadmap.
Strong customer empathy with a history of building relationships, conducting deep research, and translating insights into product features.
Proven ability to collaborate effectively across multiple teams and lead cross-functional collaboration without being a bottleneck.
Strong understanding of product prioritization frameworks and experience building products that deliver measurable value to customers.
Technical fluency, with the ability to discuss and align on engineering trade-offs and communicate technical concepts to various stakeholders.
Experience with data warehousing/lake housing (e.g. Snowflake, BigQuery, Iceberg)
Data job orchestration (e.g. Dagster, Airflow)
Batch and stream processing systems (e.g. Kafka, Spark, Flink)
Data cataloging, discoverability, and life-cycle management
Data science models, integrations, or data pipeline development (DBT, Fivetran, AirByte)

responsibilities: Guide the vision, strategy, and execution of Sift’s product, ensuring short-term tactics align with long-term goals.
Establish close relationships with customers to uncover their needs and validate opportunities.
Own the product development lifecycle from ideation to launch, ensuring alignment with company goals and user needs.
Collaborate with the go-to-market, design, and engineering teams to set priorities, optimize the product roadmap, and drive business objectives.
Conduct market research and competitive analysis to shape product strategy, identifying opportunities to expand value for existing customers and drive new revenue.
Set up instrumentation to measure and validate product value, ensuring product decisions are based on clear metrics.
Build a scalable product development process, facilitating smooth collaboration between design, engineering, and product functions.
workPlaceText: In-person in El Segundo on Mondays and Thursdays
experience_info: as a product manager, with a proven track record of delivering complex B2B SaaS products. Experience at an early-stage startup is a strong plus.
recruiting_advice: Ideally the candidate will have background at a top tier engineering org.

company.name: Sift
company.description:
Sift is transforming how modern machines are built and operated. Our platform goes beyond traditional monitoring, enabling automated data review that catches unusual conditions in systems too complex for manual checks. This not only enhances reliability but also dramatically speeds up development cycles.

At our core, we provide a unified solution for ingesting, storing, and analyzing vast amounts of machine data. By combining powerful data processing with easy-to-use visualizations, we help engineers make sense of enormous amounts of information. From spacecraft to self-driving cars, Sift is the backbone of innovation for companies pushing technology to new limits.

Born from the challenges of spaceflight, Sift aims to accelerate technological progress. We believe that by giving engineers better tools to understand and improve their creations, we can unlock a new era of innovation. Our mission goes beyond solving today's engineering problems; we're building the foundation for a future where the most ambitious machines are developed with confidence, run with precision, and constantly improved.

We're also tackling related challenges like simplifying regulatory compliance, and improving manufacturing processes. By connecting data from various sources—from sensors to manufacturing records to regulatory requirements—we're empowering a new generation of engineers to build the technologies that will shape our world.

Join us in our journey to usher in this new age of reliable, groundbreaking technology. Whether you're launching rockets, developing autonomous systems, or advancing energy and transportation, Sift is your partner in turning vast amounts of data into insights that drive innovation forward.

name: Founding Engineer - Computer Vision
description:
Odyssey is building full-stack space supercomputers backed by world-class investors in pursuit of an audacious multi-planetary scale vision. We're looking for a Computer Vision Engineer to join our team in El Segundo, CA!

You probably are:

  • The smartest person in every room you've ever been in.

  • Irritated by how slow everyone else moves.

  • Convinced that "2001: A Space Odyssey" was actually a recruitment video.

  • The person who looks at impossible problems and says "Hold my coffee".

  • Ruthlessly proactive.

  • Ready to sacrifice everything for the chance to build the greatest multi-planetary scale project of your life.

Perks:

  • Chance to name a satellite (No, you can't call it 'HAL 9000', we all know how that went).

  • Your code will literally be in space. Beat that, GitHub Copilot.

  • Unlimited satellite imagery (legal disclaimer: for work purposes only).

  • A desk with a view of... well, everything on Earth.

requirements.description: An escape velocity mindset.
requirements.explanation: We're looking for someone who has grown a lot in previous roles and is ruthlessly proactive and growth-driven

requirements.description: Ruthlessly proactive.
Ideally shipped more cutting-edge space tech than NASA on a good decade but if not, at least shipped products that made people go "holy sh*t!".
requirements.explanation:
Our goal is to ship the greatest products, features, and improvements daily and faster than anyone in the industry.

The philosophy here is that if we're not consistently making our products obsolete then someone else is, and that's deployed and applicable on a daily basis.

Having previously shipped amazing and deeply technically challenging products and consistently delivered is a must.

requirements.description: Ability to write code faster than Neo in The Matrix.
requirements.explanation: That requirement feeds into the need to be an absolutely ruthless world-class coder and the ability to ship daily.

requirements.description: Irritated by how slow everyone else moves.
requirements.explanation:
It's extremely important for us to move at light speed.

Odyssey's scale of the long-term vision is literally multi-planetary, and many of the things we're building today have never actually been built and deployed at scale so it's extremely important for us to have someone with the technical acumen to understand the tech and the ability to deploy ideas into a working code in the hands of customers within hours on a daily-basis.

The day-to-day is a non-stop cycle of testing and shipping.

requirements.description: The stamina to work 100-hour weeks.
requirements.explanation: That's simply our normal schedule. We're in the office working from early morning till late night 7 days a week.

requirements.description:
One of the following

  1. U.S. citizen or national (highly preferred)

  2. U.S. lawful, permanent resident (aka green card holder)

  3. Refugee under 8 U.S.C. § 1157

  4. Asylee under 8 U.S.C. § 1158, or be eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State.
requirements.explanation:
ITAR REQUIREMENTS:

  • To conform to U.S. Government export regulations, applicant must be a (i) U.S. citizen or national, (ii) U.S. lawful, permanent resident (aka green card holder), (iii) Refugee under 8 U.S.C. § 1157, or (iv) Asylee under 8 U.S.C. § 1158, or be eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State. Learn more about the ITAR here.

This is, unfortunately, a requirement that we have to abide by as the technologies we're building are regulated under ITAR regulations.

requirements.description: Ready to sacrifice everything for the chance to build the greatest multi-planetary scale project of your life.
requirements.explanation:
Extremely important for the candidate to understand that this is an all in role and the work environment is very intense, long hours, and non-stop on a daily-basis.

The problem we're solving is extremely difficult and requires a very hardcore approach to making it happen.

On the other side, the products built at Odyssey will solve crucial problems at a global scale and become the bedrock for humanity's multi-planetary scale expansion.

It's a strict all-in or not in at all policy.

responsibilities: Build advanced GEOINT AI that'll turn Earth observation into Earth clairvoyance. Make it so advanced that it'll predict where you'll be tomorrow (Don't worry, we're not actually doing that... or are we?).
Create AI so smart it can play 4D chess with satellite constellations.
Lay the foundation for computers that will live in space.
Make orbital computing so efficient, that it'll make ground-based data centers look like abacuses.
workPlaceText: Location: El Segundo, CA. Think of it as Low Earth Orbit with better weather. Hours: Yes.
visa_text_more: We do not sponsor visa unfortunately and will strictly only hire within ITAR restrictions: ITAR REQUIREMENTS:  To conform to U.S. Government export regulations, applicant must be a (i) U.S. citizen or national, (ii) U.S. lawful, permanent resident (aka green card holder), (iii) Refugee under 8 U.S.C. § 1157, or (iv) Asylee under 8 U.S.C. § 1158, or be eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State. Learn more about the ITAR here.
experience_info:
- PhD-level skills in computer vision and geospatial tech. No degree required but around 5+ years of experience (give or take) is. 

What we're evaluating here is the level of technical knowledge or evidence that the candidate is able to learn and deploy knowledge at a high rate. 

A degree of anything is not required at all to work at Odyssey but the foundation we're measuring is whether a candidate has enough applied technical acumen to understand what we're building and hit the ground running from day zero.
recruiting_advice: The job description is a very well-throughout framework for exactly who we're looking for and exactly what they'll be doing at Odyssey, therefore, the most optimal framework for finding the right candidate.

name: Senior Software Engineer, Evaluation
description:
Harmonic is the startup discovery engine. We believe in innovation, entrepreneurs, and efficient capital markets. It pains us to see great startup opportunities consistently go undiscovered. So, we dedicated ourselves to mapping out the startup landscape and building the index and tools that ensure the most promising founders get found and funded. Our team has been growing fast, and we're now looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join our Evaluation team in New York!

About the Evaluation team

The Evaluation team helps make Harmonic the primary source of information for evaluating potential investment deals through easily accessible, relevant, and accurate people, company and investor data. To learn more about the team:

  • Explore Working with Sang to understand decision-making processes related to the engineering function.

  • Who's currently on the team: Junfeng (Kenny) Xu, Austin Berke, and Joseph Wang!

  • Explore the Team Page to get acquainted with the rest of the company.

company.name: Miter
company.description:
Miter is a modern Human Capital Management platform (HCM) for construction and service contractors. Construction is one of society’s largest and most important industries, employing 7+ million people in the US, yet its productivity growth has lagged the broader economy for several decades. For many categories of construction, it’s more expensive to build now than it was 30 years ago, resulting in higher housing, energy, and transportation costs. 

While there are several causes of construction’s malaise, at Miter we’re focused on a simple one: contractors need better tools to build high-performing teams. Although many industries have enthusiastically adopted HCMs like ADP, Rippling, and Paylocity, construction has not. 

There’s a simple reason: the “traditional” HCMs don’t understand the nuances of construction, resulting in fragmented systems, manual data entry, and inaccurate payroll and reporting.

At Miter we're leveraging recent breakthroughs in payments technology to build world-class HR, compliance, and financial software for construction firms. Miter brings onboarding, timesheets, payroll, labor compliance, and spend management into one platform, enabling our customers to save time, bid on more projects, and grow their businesses.
company.teamAbout:
💜 Our mission

Our mission is to enable contractors to build great teams and increase profits. We measure our success in terms of the cost savings and productivity gains we drive for our customers. 

If we’re successful, we’ll make it possible for construction firms to build more with less, driving positive second-order effects on housing and infrastructure costs and third-order effects on economic growth.

🌟 Our values

At Miter, our most valuable assets are our people and culture, and our talent philosophy is to hire a lean, diverse team of incredibly talented people, pay them well, and get out of their way. 

We’re deliberate about building a culture where anyone can do their best work and build meaningful and lasting relationships.

Our values reflect what we believe in and how we work:

  • Win as a team: We’re determined and competitive, but we enjoy winning as a team far more than we enjoy winning as individuals. We invest in each other and love seeing each other succeed.

  • Build the blueprint: We simplify complex problems in writing to create clarity. Clarity aligns our teams, sharpens our decision-making, and accelerates execution. 

  • More wood, fewer arrows: We prioritize ruthlessly and throw our weight into only the projects that matter. We finish what we start.

  • Give a damn: We’re determined to leave our mark and hold ourselves and each other to high standards. We’re craftspeople at heart, and we enjoy the rigor and discipline required to perform at a high level.

  • Start with the customer: We are voracious students of our customers’ problems. We celebrate only when our customers celebrate.

Remote vs in-office work

We believe that great people can do great work from the office or from home. Roughly half of Mitosaurs work from our SF and NYC offices, with the rest working remotely. Each day at 2pm PT, we have “Mitogames”, an optional collaborative game-playing session on Google Meet.

Miter is remote-friendly, but we believe that the best relationships are built in-person. We hold all-company offsites 2x per year, and we encourage Mitosaurs to meet and work IRL as often as is reasonable. Life is too short not to love the people you work with.

Work/life balance

We’re a fast-paced, high-performance culture, which means that most Mitosaurs work hard. If work/life balance is a top criteria in your job search, or if you never want to work over 40 hours/week, Miter probably isn’t the right fit. Miter is a great fit for those who take pride in their craft and want to accelerate their career growth. That said:

  • Mitosaurs are evaluated based on output and results, not input or hours worked. Miter is a high-trust culture, which means we trust Mitosaurs to work where, when, and how they want. 

  • Miter should never interfere with health and happiness. Family, friends, mental health, and physical fitness should take priority over Miter.

  • We offer unlimited vacation and encourage Mitosaurs to take all the time they need to perform at a high level.

name: Senior Product Manager
description:
At Chapter, we're reimagining retirement for older Americans, and our mission hinges on exceptional product experiences. Crafting products that shape the way seniors navigate their healthcare coverage, manage their finances, and spend their time presents many challenges. Chapter is looking for a passionate and thoughtful product manager to join the team and drive strategy and execution for one of our product lines.

You will join Chapter as one of the first Senior PMs, where you'll have ownership over a Chapter‘s product line. One PM will focus on driving the strategy and execution of consumer facing products, while the other will enhance internal tools that enable product scaling and operational efficiency. PMs lead a cross-functional team of engineers, tech leads, and designers. As Chapter grows, there may be opportunities to hire and manage additional PMs.PMs.

Graduated from a top 20 school

Ruthlessly prioritize and help the team maintain a fast product release cadence
Work with our Head of Product and other product managers to help shape product processes and culture

company.name: Chapter
company.description:
Chapter is the industry leading Medicare navigation platform that helps simplify and optimize Medicare for patients, customers, and clients of the most impactful organizations in the country. Hundreds of organizations rely on us to build, maintain and demonstrate trust through Medicare guidance in a way that improves brand value for our partners.

Our unbiased, consumer-centric approach has been recognized by the National Council on Aging and led the US Senate to invite Chapter’s CEO to testify about how to improve the Medicare enrollment experience for America’s seniors.

Chapter has recently been recognized as a Forbes 2023 next Billion Dollar Startup and a Fortune Impact 20 company. Our world-class investors include Addition Capital, Narya Ventures, Peter Thiel, Maverick Ventures, Susa Ventures, XYZ Ventures, and Health 2047 of the American Medical Association, among others.
benefits: Full medical, dental, and vision, premiums covered at 100% for full-time employees
Unlimited PTO, a winter break shutdown, and paid holidays to encourage a healthy work-life blend
Team retreats, hackathons, and engineering team events including game nights.
$500 desk setup subsidy to set-up your unique home office

Benefit from our partnerships with Spring Health (mental health support), Rightway (care navigation), Carrot (fertility support), and OneMedical (concierge and telehealth care) to prioritize your well-being.
In-office lunch on Tuesdays, Wednesday, & Thursdays, and a stocked office pantry
Generous and competitive parental leave for all parents
A beautiful NYC (SoHo/West Village area) office and a hybrid in-office policy — dogs welcome!

name: Head of BizOps
description: We’re looking for the right person to independently lead our Business Operations & Strategy function, reporting directly to the CTO. This role requires someone who can independently identify and implement operational efficiencies, whether through vendor management, automation, or hands-on problem-solving. You'll tackle complex challenges and present clear, concise updates to the executive team. The ideal candidate is experienced in driving results solo or with a small team (fewer than five), and thrives in a scrappy startup environment. This is not a fit for career consultants, large-team operations managers

name: Software Engineer (iOS)
description:
Ramp is NYC’s fastest growing startup and America’s fastest growing corporate card. We’re building the ultimate platform for modern finance teams – and we’re just getting started. 

We are, at our core, an engineering company and is on a mission to build the best engineering team!

We are rapidly scaling our iOS app and looking for someone to help build the next iteration of Ramp on Mobile with our world-class team. You have a strong sense of ownership and enjoy owning projects from inception to scaling in production. We value people who take pride in their work and show an aptitude for learning quickly, whether they’re familiar with our stack or not.

Check out our Engineering Blog for more on our tech stack, mission, and values!

requirements.description: Drive to learn new technologies and adapt to different situations
Strong understanding of mobile design patterns and best practices
Understanding of security best practices for mobile apps
Experience with web apps (React, JS, etc.)
Proficiency in Swift for iOS development
Knowledge of iOS UI components and the iOS Developer Platform
Experience contributing at least one mobile app and/or several features that reached a large number of users
Desire to work in a fast-paced environment, continuously grow, and master your craft
Experience with backend technologies (Python, Flask, SQL, OpenAPI, etc..)
Experience managing apps with App Store Connect
Experience with our mobile stack: SwiftUI, Swift Concurrency, The Composable Architecture, Bazel, widgets, app extensions
requirements.explanation: SwiftUI is must - others doesn't matter

responsibilities: Design, build, and launch new products on Ramp’s iOS App
Help establish and influence engineering processes, tools, and systems that allow us to scale the code base, productivity, and the team
Code review, set engineering standards, mentor, and own quality
Work with other engineers to build the necessary backing services for the app
Work with Product and Design to plan and identify key features to make the app successful
Work alongside product and business teams to understand customer feedback in order to constantly improve our product
workPlaceText: New York, Miami, or Remote
experience_info: in iOS development
recruiting_advice:
founding engineers do well

Strong SwiftUI exp is a high pri
avoid_traits: only does UIkit, not familar with modern iOS paradigms

company.name: Ramp
company.description:
Ramp is the ultimate platform for modern finance teams. Combining corporate cards with expense management, bill payments, vendor management, accounting automation and more, Ramp's all-in-one solution is designed to save businesses time and money, and free finance teams to do the best work of their lives. Our mission is to help build healthier businesses, and it’s working: over 25,000 businesses on Ramp to save an average 5% and close their books 8x faster. 

Founded in 2019, Ramp powers the fastest-growing corporate card and bill payment platform in America, and enables tens of billions of dollars in purchases each year. 

Ramp's investors include Founders Fund, Stripe, Citi, Goldman Sachs, Coatue Management, D1 Capital Partners, Redpoint Ventures, General Catalyst, and Thrive Capital, as well as over 100 angel investors who were founders or executives of leading companies. The Ramp team comprises talented leaders from leading financial services and fintech companies—Stripe, Affirm, Goldman Sachs, American Express, Mastercard, Visa, Capital One—as well as technology companies such as Meta, Uber, Netflix, Twitter, Dropbox, and Instacart. In 2023, Ramp was named Fast Company’s #1 Most Innovative Company in North America, LinkedIn’s #1 Top Startup in the U.S., a CNBC Disruptor, and a TIME100 Most Influential Company.
benefits: 100% medical, dental & vision insurance coverage for you (partially covered for your dependents, One Medical annual membership)
401k (including employer match on contributions made while employed by Ramp)
WFH stipend to support your home office needs
company.teamAbout:
Build the future

Finance software hasn’t evolved in decades, making it hard for companies of all sizes to manage and deploy their resources effectively without waste.

We’re building finance automation that builds trust, helps companies grow, and frees people from busy work.

Do your best work

Launch your career at Ramp. Join a stellar team built around mentorship, empowerment, and ownership.

Growing without fear, winning the marathon sprint by sprint—these are just a few of the core values that shape us.

Invest in people

With team members across the globe, we regularly gather to connect in person, solve problems and learn from each other.

We offer wellness stipends, education support, flexible PTO, and much more to help you invest in personal growth and stay on top of your game.

name: Staff Software Engineer (Cloud Security)
description:
Ramp is NYC’s fastest growing startup and America’s fastest growing corporate card. We’re building the ultimate platform for modern finance teams – and we’re just getting started. 

The Security Engineering team helps make Ramp the most secure place for our customers to collect, manage, and put to work their business’ financial information 

Our work centers in three areas:

  • Ramp builds products with an eye for security

  • Ramp detects and responds to threats before they cause harm

  • Security powers Ramp’s growth

Check out our Engineering Blog for more on our tech stack, mission and values!

requirements.description: Experience with Azure, GCP, and other cloud providers
Experience improving the developer experience and security properties of a multi-service deployment
5+ years of experience building in AWS (with Terraform)
A strong sense of ownership: you need to drive projects from inception to scaling it in production
Experience with Python (Flask) and Terraform
Desire to work in a fast-paced environment, continuously grow, and master your craft

responsibilities: Drive our cloud security roadmap: review our cloud deployments to identify opportunities for improvement
Design and build security-focused infrastructure primitives and integrate them into our existing products and development processes
Lead remediation of prioritized issues across our technology stack
Partner with infrastructure, data, and devops teams to design and deploy solutions that are inherently secure
workPlaceText: New York, San Francisco, or Remote
experience_info: building software in fast-paced, high-growth environments
avoid_traits: Cloud/Infra Engineer with minimal cloud experience
Candidates who don't have a SWE/Engineering background

name: Founding Engineer
description:
Biogenesis Tech, Inc. (Biogenesis) builds critical internal tooling for clinical trial operations, reducing what would be a $2B+ and 13+ year endeavour to a fraction of that time. This means more helpful therapies to patients, more dollars invested into research, and ultimately more lives saved.

Our founding team is driven by this mission. With backgrounds from defense, biotech, and pharma - our team is building a modern, intuitive, and user-centric platform that will ultimately propel Biogenesis to become a premier tech-based pharma company in the years to come.

We're looking for a Founding Engineer to join our team.

requirements.description: Proficient in profiling, debugging, performance optimization, and testing.
Expertise in building scalable backends with modern server-side languages like JavaScript, Golang, Ruby, or Rust
Professional experience with Linux systems and tools
Experience developing HIPAA-compliant systems.
Strong attention to detail, able to work independently and in a team, take initiative, and communicate effectively.
Willing to work extended hours and weekends as needed.
Strong English-speaking skills
No more than 2 years in a big company (ie Google, Meta, etc.)
CS degree or similar from a top university (MIT, Stanford, Ivies)
requirements.explanation: Or very clear history of growth in past roles

requirements.description: Experience building something from 0-1, curious to build

responsibilities: Develop responsive, performant, and well-architected web applications using modern full-stack techniques, and take high ownership and autonomy in UI/UX design and implementation to craft flawless user experiences
Expertise in React, TypeScript, HTML, and CSS for modern browsers
Design, build, and maintain APIs that reliably and efficiently handle high loads. Experience with relational databases, SQL and NoSQL database technologies

Contribute to architecture, design, and code reviews, while identifying and addressing security vulnerabilities. Empathize with end-users to balance user experience and engineering constraints, delivering comprehensive solutions
workPlaceText: In-person in Palo Alto
visa_text_more: O-1, TN
experience_info: As a SWE
recruiting_advice:
The best way to learn about what your day could look like is to have an honest conversation with the team. We’d be interested in speaking to you if:

  • You are detail-oriented when building scalable, secure and performant web applications

  • You take extreme ownership over what you do, and hold yourself and others to a high bar

  • You factor security, architecture, and UI/UX throughout your development cycles.

  • You can communicate clearly using the English language, and you show a degree of emotional intelligence
avoid_traits: Lack of communication skills

company.name: Biogenesis
company.description:
At Biogenesis, we are pioneering a transformative approach in clinical trials through the principles of decentralization, automation, and unparalleled speed. Our mission is to redefine this landscape, where innovative scientific endeavors are no longer hindered by logistical complexities or administrative burdens. We envision a future where drug development and clinical trials transcend traditional constraints, driven by our sophisticated, self-sufficient systems.

Our ambition is to be the backbone of groundbreaking medical breakthroughs, including the quest for a cancer cure. By enabling scientists to devote their full attention to research and innovation, we aim to unlock new realms of possibilities in personalized medicine. Our model of Drug Research as a Service (DRaaS), underpinned by cutting-edge artificial intelligence and novel operational systems, is designed to streamline the entire drug development process. This revolutionary approach empowers even individual researchers to efficiently manage end-to-end trial operations, ushering in a new era of efficient, focused, and accelerated drug discovery.

name: Growth Marketing Manager
description:
Why is this role important?

As a Growth Marketing Manager at Attio you will manage our performance programs [paid ads, referrals, lifecycle email, etc] and a team of marketing specialists that will grow based on program success and demand.

Whose team will you join?

Our Marketing team is responsible brand and product led communications; attracting customers, and generating leads for conversion through PLG or our Sales, Success and Support motion.

The marketing team is growing under the guidance of Alex Vale. Day to day work focuses on growing awareness of Attio through amplifying our customer’s voices and unique product differences, with the ultimate goal of getting Attio into the hands of more teams.

requirements.description: 2+ years of relevant management experience
Scale performance programs [Paid Search / Social / Media and Referrals]
Own our lifecycle marketing and marketing ops platforms
Build experimentation framework, analytics, and roadmap for top of funnel CRO
Create new performance programs, potentially around: Affiliates and Partnerships

responsibilities: Scale our current performance programs (paid search, paid social, paid media, referrals)
Build experimentation framework, analytics, and roadmap for top of funnel CRO
Own our lifecycle marketing and marketing ops platforms
Create new performance programs, potentially around affiliates and partnerships
workPlaceText: Remote (US or Europe) or On-site (London)
experience_info: scaling performance channels in fast-growing startups
recruiting_advice:
We’re really focusing on:

  • Paid search/social

  • Lifecycle email

  • Marketing ops/analytics

We have a high-bar for where and how they have achieved great results in these areas.
benefits: Equity in an early-stage tech company on an incredible trajectory
Apple hardware and a budget for desk amenities
Team off-site in fun places! (We've been to Lisbon and Malta so far)

company.name: Attio
company.description:
CRMs are at the center of the software stack for millions of businesses. They're ubiquitous and totally essential, yet current products are completely archaic, unloved and in massive need of overhaul.

This is software that millions of people use for hours and hours a day – and a $50 billion category – yet you probably can't think of a single awesome piece of software in this space.

Attio is changing that. We’re building a radically new type of CRM – one that is incredibly flexible and powerful as the most advanced CRM data models but also as intuitive, delightful and collaborative as today’s best no-code software.

Attio is the CRM of the future: a living, breathing platform that connects with a customer’s GTM stack and evolves with them as they grow – from zero to IPO and beyond.
locations: Employees distributed across the US, UK and EU
benefits: Equity in an early-stage tech company on an incredible trajectory
Apple hardware and a budget for desk amenities
Team off-site in fun places! (We've been to Lisbon and Malta so far)
company.teamAbout:
Attio employees are currently based in the US and Europe. We are all trusted to produce high quality work in the environment that works best for us.

Attio is for people who own their role, learn quickly, are endlessly curious and find happiness in delivering consistently brilliant outcomes that push the company forward. We love to work with people who are passionate about working this way and will do whatever it takes to get things done.

Kindness is evident in how we work and there is a high level of respect across the team thanks to working hard. This allows us all to challenge ideas, be independent and attract world class talent to join us.

We have an office in London.

name: Senior Product Engineer
description:
At Summation, we're building the next-generation business planning platform to transform how enterprises make financial decisions. Founded by former co-founder and CTO of a public company, we've created one place to access financial data, understand performance, and optimize the business.

We are looking for two Seattle-based product engineers to join us. They will be responsible for all aspects of product engineering, with an emphasis on frontend development. Our Senior Product Engineers will design and build efficient and reusable frontend and backend systems that drive powerful web and mobile applications, and work with our team in Bellevue 3x / week.

requirements.description: Contributions to open-source projects, particularly those involving financial applications.
Bachelor's or master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Familiarity with financial software or algorithms, understanding of basic financial models and data.
Experience with RESTful APIs and other service-oriented architectures.
Proficiency in modern programming languages like TypeScript, Python, or Java.
Experience with frontend frameworks such as React.js or Vue.js.
Excellent problem-solving skills, team collaboration, and communication abilities.

responsibilities: Design and implement innovative software solutions that simplify and automate financial planning
Collaborate with designers, product managers, and other engineers to ideate, prototype, and launch new features
Architect efficient and reusable frontend and backend systems
Analyze and optimize the performance of web applications
workPlaceText: Hybrid in Bellevue, WA
visa_text_more: Can sponsor TN or H1B transfer but not H1B Sponsorship
experience_info: frontend or frontend-leaning fullstack development, with a proven track record of delivering on successful projects.
recruiting_advice:
• Startup mentality

  • Growth mindset / upward trajectory, looking to expand scope and accelerate their career or entrepreneurial journey

  • High energy, high hustle

  • High IQ

  • Care about shipping great products that impact customers in a positive way

company.name: Summation
company.description: Summation is the modern, AI-powered business planning software for businesses. Consolidate data, streamline workflows, optimize decisions. All in one place.
benefits: Comprehensive health insurance coverage for you and your family
Flexible working hours and hybrid work options
Generous vacation and paid time off policy

name: Software Engineer, Full Stack
description:
Our mission is to free humanity from work by building AI agents that will, eventually, be able to act autonomously, leveraging any tool to pursue any goal. We are starting with a platform for anyone to be able to build and share these “Lindies,” purpose-made for specific tasks, ranging from executive assistance, to customer support, recruiting and more. We’re a team of 20+ and have raised $52M from Menlo, Battery, Coatue, Elad Gil, Jack Altman and more to pursue this vision.

As a Full-Stack Software Engineer, you will be part of the talented team building the core Lindy experience, powered by a full-stack Typescript application built on React and Node.

requirements.description: A passion for building and delivering exceptional products.
The ability to navigate a fast-paced work environment.
A hard-working ethic to help build and grow a new startup.
Exceptional written and oral communication skills.
Experience with our technology stack (Typescript, Node, GraphQL, MongoDB, Redis)
Be able to work in a San Francisco office 4 days a week.
requirements.explanation: We are big believers in the magic of in-person work.

requirements.description: Excitement and passion for the transformative potential of AI on humanity.
requirements.explanation: We're a mission driven company and we want everyone here to be excited and passionate about the mission to free humanity from work.

responsibilities: Collaborate with the founder, PMs, designers, and other engineers to navigate trade-offs and build a world-class product.
Work with urgency to build critical features with a keen attention to detail and high-quality maintainable code.
Completely own your features end-to-end, from product requirements, code, testing, observability, rollout, and maintenance.
workPlaceText: We are an in-office company, working from our San Francisco office 4 days a week. We do sponsor visas and cover relocation fees for up to $20,000.
visa_text_more: We sponsor O1 applications and H1B transfers
experience_info: building complex React web apps.
recruiting_advice:
Specifically looking for folks who are stronger on frontend than backend.

React is pretty much required. Typescript + GraphQL deeply preferred.

Founding engineer / early engineer at small startups is a big plus - looking for folks who are self directed and do well in unstructured environments.
avoid_traits: "architect"-type folks who talk more than do
bootcamp engineers unless they're proven to be exceptional
AI/ML researchers (that's not the right fit for this role)

company.name: Lindy
company.description:
Lindy is an AI assistant, designed to manage your daily tasks and act as an executive assistant for busy professionals.

Lindy AI agents integrate with your existing tools and have the personalized context necessary to automate the mundane.

Whether you're looking for

  • an automated executive assistant to organize email and plan travel

  • a scribe to transcribe medical notes

  • a chatbot to automate customer support, or

  • a custom solution for your business function and teams...

There's a Lindy for you.

And if there's not, you can build a purpose-built AI agent in minutes, without a line of code.

Our long-term goal is to automate all knowledge work by creating an AI that can use any tool and access any data it needs.

We envision a world where you can describe intricate workflows and get sophisticated apps to automate them, without the need for technical expertise.
benefits: A lot of autonomy within your area of responsibility.
The fun of working at a no-nonsense startup that just wants to build an amazing product and business.

Lindy’s culture is composed of three pillars:

  1. An elite institution (who we are)

  2. Doing the best work of our lives (what we do)

  3. Moving fast (how we do it)

Learn more about our culture here!

name: Founding Engineer
description:
We are looking for a talented founding engineer to join us on our mission to bring transformative financial services to businesses globally. You will be working on designing, building and scaling Pillar’s platform alongside a strong team that has varied and thorough experiences in the domain being tackled. The ideal candidate will have experience working at a fast–paced engineering organization, and tackling complex problems. You will be expected to take solutions to problems from 0 to 1, and maintain full ownership over all services that you build. Over time, your role will grow and evolve with the company, including managing and mentoring new hires, and taking on an engineering leadership role. 

While a prior background in fintech would be helpful, it is not a requirement; we will teach you the domain knowledge you will need. Ultimately, we look for people who are always eager to learn and willing to go the distance as we continue on our journey to reshape financial services for the millions.

A sense of deep curiosity: always keen on learning more about all aspects of the customer, domain, and product

Exude empathy and a collaborative spirit in a high-paced environment

Work on integrations with multiple vendors that help power the platforms
Design and build the customer facing front-end for the platform
Participate in designing and architecting the infrastructure behind our services
Work to help evolve the platform as we scale the product
Help us define and develop our tech stack as the product grows
Help us build out and mentor an incredible team

recruiting_advice: Looking for people with the strong desire to join an early stage team. Love to work on hard problems and have ownership. Ideally, person has demonstrated robust work experience in college/before they were at their current role.

company.name: Pillar
company.description:
Pillar protects global businesses from macroeconomic risk by automatically hedging their freight, currency, and commodities exposure. 

Risk management plays a critical role in the functioning of any business. In the past 4 years, volatility across these asset classes - swings from +20% to 450% - has wreaked havoc on SMEs who rely on them to function. Yet, the solutions needed to limit the effects of this volatility – seasoned traders and investment banking services – remain in the hands of the few: billion dollar companies with unlimited resources. Pillar solves this by bringing protection previously available only for the largest corporations to the 30M+ SMEs worldwide who have $7T+ of underserved risk. With a few clicks, customers are able to manage their risks through Pillar’s seamless, end to end platform. 

We’re on a mission to give all businesses Fortune 500-level financial services, starting with risk management, enabling them to focus on building their core business. We’re backed by world class investors like J Ventures, Neo, Graph Ventures, Ride Ventures, Expansion Ventures, the CEO of Uber and Co-Founder of Vanta, along with seasoned executives and operators from Stripe, Robinhood, and Airbnb.
company.teamAbout: We've previously designed global risk management strategies for large private equity firms, hedged FX risk for F500 companies, and built trading platforms for institutional clients.

name: Founding Optics/Laser Engineer
description:
We are building out the first team at Aurelius, and are looking for 2-4 engineers to help develop our first product MVP. Yes, you will be building a laser gun.

This opening is for an optics engineer with experience in EECS, optics, photonics, laser system development and/or robotics. This person will be simulating and designing new laser systems, retrofitting existing systems to maximize power down-range. This person will be familiar with laser physics in at least a basic capacity and be ready to do laser work that no one has done before. There will be opportunities to publish in this position as well.

This is a generalist engineering role that will require self-direction and adaptability. We do hire for technical skills, but are huge believers in the power of learning quickly. If you’re passionate about our mission, please apply even if you’re not the perfect cookie-cutter-candidate.

US Citizen

Do what is necessary for the company to succeed

company.name: Aurelius Systems
company.description: The US and our allies have prepared for a world where we will be fighting increasingly large and sophisticated systems (Planes, Aircraft carriers, etc), but this world never came. The future of warfare will involve large numbers of small-scale and mass-manufacturable drones, and we aren’t prepared to defend our country from these threats abroad or domestically. Aurelius Systems has set out to address this problem by equipping the US and our allies with the systems they need to fight current and future conflicts in a scalable and cost-effective manner.

name: Software Engineer (General)
description:
Harmonic is using data and AI to map the world of startups. When companies are first formed, they’re invisible to the world. We’ve created the only complete startup database, enabling the right investments to reach the right entrepreneurs at the right moment.

As a Software Engineer at Harmonic, you will play a crucial role in influencing and executing the overall vision of our offerings. Collaborating with Product & Design, you will create products that help customers discover startups and exceed their expectations. Your responsibilities will include working on every layer of our stack, troubleshooting issues, and ensuring our customers gain maximum value from our product. If you know someone with a track record of building scalable systems, experience in frontend and backend development, and a passion for sharing your knowledge, we'd love to chat with them!

"Get Shit Done" by working on every layer of our stack, proactively troubleshooting, and solving any issues that stand in the way of our customers gaining maximum value from our product.

company.name: Harmonic
company.description:
About us

Harmonic is the startup discovery engine. We believe in innovation, entrepreneurs, and efficient capital markets. It pains us to see great startup opportunities consistently go undiscovered. So, we dedicated ourselves to mapping out the startup landscape and building the index and tools that ensure the most promising founders get found and funded.

The world's largest and most prolific venture capital firms rely on us to find and invest in the next Google, AirBnB, Uber, Stripe, and Anduril. We play a crucial part in ensuring hundreds of billions of dollars get routed efficiently and that the innovations the world would most benefit from materialize.

We’ve been growing steadily and need passionate driven people to help us get to the next level. If you want to work in a high-growth environment with some of the most talented folks on the planet and resonate with our values, read on.
benefits: Top of the line health, dental and vision insurance, with 100% premium covered

company.name: Reducto
company.description:
The vast majority of enterprise data is in files like PDFs and spreadsheets. That includes everything from financial statements to medical records. Reducto helps AI teams turn those really complex documents into LLM-ready inputs with exceptional accuracy.

Hundreds of companies have signed up to use Reducto since our launch, and we’re now processing tens of millions of pages every month for teams ranging from startups to Fortune 10 enterprises. We’re hiring founding software engineers to help us continue to serve our customers as we build the ingestion layer that connects human data with LLMs.
company.productDescription: Reducto is an API that turns really complicated documents and spreadsheets into LLM-ready inputs
company.teamAbout:
We're a team of 3 (Adit, Raunak, and Erica), growing to 10 by the end of the year! We work in person in our SF office and care a lot about the product we're building.

Our work is entirely centered around what customers need, and we don't do recurring meetings or siloed roles. That means everyone is involved with everything from product roadmap to working with the end user.

name: GTM Lead
description:
We're seeking a GTM Lead to spearhead our sales efforts, and partner with our CEO to become her #2 in sales. This is not your Average Joe’s sales role. The GTM Lead is a blend of sales, product, and customer success. A teammate that thrives in ambiguity, is passionate, curious, creative, and detail-oriented will be a great fit. You will become an integral member of our organization, working across both strategic and execution-focused levels.

Fintech leaders have referred to Rightfoot as “witchcraft” due to the seemingly magical nature of our product. If you thrive at the intersection of early sales and product development, come join our team as we brew up some magic!

requirements.description: Able to work with our team in San Francisco 4 days a week.

Experience closing sales

Ready to jump in wherever is needed, no matter how big or small.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, highly detail oriented.
Low ego, brings humor, creativity, and optimism to their work.

requirements.description: Thrives in the chaotic beauty of a startup, okay with ambiguity, are scrappy and self motivated.
We are looking for folks who have been at (recently) companies where they were one of the early teammates

Lead Customer Success: ensure customers launch successfully, and support them throughout their journey in partnership with the CEO.

Drive Customer Discovery: connect the dots between customer conversations, listening intently to the customer always, and bringing your insights to the table to inform our product and how/ what we build for our customers.
workPlaceText: Rightfoot is based in San Francisco, CA in what we like to think is a fun part of town (Van Ness & Jackson St). You'll be expected to come into the office to collaborate with the team 4 days/ week, and we work from home on Fridays.

recruiting_advice:
We only want people who are truly excited about being early stage startup. We typically like negative-selling to tell them: we don't have everything figured out, we have early stages of PMF, things are messy, your role will change frequently. If they have a big smile, that's a good sign it's the right person.

Having some kind of "founding" experience is great.

Number of people is a great indicator for their startup experience (rather than just stage). Working somewhere less than 20 people is better than working at a 50 person series seed.
avoid_traits: Worked at big tech (google, amazon, etc). The exception is if they've had a couple startup experiences since then. Anyone who is looking to manage people. No patience for high ego. If they are more focused on process than on learning that's a negative sign.

company.name: Rightfoot
company.description:
Rightfoot is the leading provider of passwordless, consumer-permissioned financial data.

We believe consumers have the right to easily permission their financial data in order to access fair financial services. And we feel strongly that this process should not require a customer to share their sensitive bank details like username and password.

The technology that we’ve pioneered creates significant value for lenders and financial services providers, as well as the consumers and small businesses they serve. With the consent of customers, Rightfoot surfaces up-to-date banking and credit data, such as bank account balances, deposits, withdrawals, and credit card balances, without a log-in experience. Our award-winning technology increases conversion in the onboarding experience, seamlessly enables financial institutions to monitor customer accounts, screen for fraud, and more.

Rightfoot was named a 2023 CB Insights’ Fintech 100, Forbes Cloud 100 Rising Star, and Will Reed Top 100. We are backed by top fintech VCs like Bain Capital Ventures and BoxGroup, as well as executives and founders of companies like Venmo, Block, Marqeta, Eventbrite, and more.
benefits: Have an outsized impact solving real world financial problems
Paid medical, dental, vision insurance (90% paid by Rightfoot for employees, 51% for dependents)
Unlimited books that help you grow at the company
Unlimited "Whoopsie Cocktails" for making the biggest mistakes
Unlimited vacation days (and we require/ encourage you to take it)
A funny, quirky, scrappy, and kind team

We are a small team with a friendly, mostly-remote culture. The company is well capitalized, having raised 9.1 million dollars in a Series Seed led by Greenoaks Capital.

avoid_traits: Job Hoppy

company.name: Tennr
company.description:
Today, when you go to your doctor and need to be referred to a specialist (e.g., for sleep apnea), your doctor sends a fax (yes, in 2024, 90% of provider-provider communication is a 1980s fax). These are often converted into 20+ page PDFs, with handwritten (doctor’s handwriting!) notes, in thousands of different formats. The problem is so complex that a person has to read it, type it up, and manually enter your information. Tennr built RaeLLM™ (7B—trained on 3M+ documents) to read these docs, talk to your doc to ensure nothing is missed, and text you to help schedule your appointment so you can get better, faster.

Tennr is a NYC-based tech company that launched out of Y-Combinator and is backed by Andreesen Horowitz, Foundation Capital, The New Normal Fund, and other top investors.
company.teamAbout: Our founding team began working together studying at the bleeding edge of AI and LLMs at Stanford, combined with a team of experts with decades in the healthcare space.

name: Material & Process Engineer
description:
Using robotics and data processing, Rangeview is reinventing the technology stack of precision casting and factory operations. Rangeview 3D prints the largest and most complex ceramic parts in the world as casting molds, using in-house developed materials, equipment, and processing.

We are looking for a materials engineer to work on taking this process even further, developing photocurable binder systems, ceramic materials, and processing. The job involves major freedom to explore different approaches and iterate quickly, while working on a very high performing team.

A can-do attitude is necessary, exceptional ability will be rewarded, and meaningful equity will be offered.

US Citizen or Green-Card Holder

Ceramics Engineering Experience
Polymer Formulation Background (Specifically acrylates/epoxides, or other photocurable systems)
Experience with Aerospace Qualification Processes
Willing to Relocate to Los Angeles, and work full time in person.

Material R&D planning, work with CTO to set direction
Support Production by diagnosing production issues

Generally, we are also looking for people who are earlier in their career, and are willing to work very hard.

company.name: Oway
company.description:
Oway is a rideshare freight platform that uses machine learning to automatically coordinate and sell unused space in trucks to SMBs at a 50% discount for lightning-fast shipping.

Every year, nearly 50% all truck space goes unused annually in the almost $1T US trucking industry. On the other hand, SMBs represent 44% of the US GDP and are historically forced to deal with high freight rates and friction due to their small size compared to enterprise businesses.

With trucking being a hyper-fragmented market (90%+ of US trucking companies are small family businesses), we decided to build an ecosystem that takes all of this inefficiency and turns it into something that could fundamentally transform the livelihoods of businesses and drivers alike.

Oway is designed to be simple (you can place an order in 30 seconds) and scale with your business. Our ML rideshare protocol now allows businesses to ship freight affordably and faster than ever before. We also improve the survivability of independent truckers by maximizing their revenue when they’re already on the road - and it’s great for the environment too. 🍃

name: Senior Software Engineer
description:
We're on the hunt for an enthusiastic and driven software engineer to join our team at an exciting stage of our startup's journey. If you're eager to contribute to building and scaling innovative products, this role is your ticket to making a significant impact. You'll gain hands-on experience in a dynamic startup environment, working with and contributing to cutting-edge generative AI and voice/transcription models + technologies.

As an early engineer, you will be a cornerstone to our company's growth and success. If you are a self-starter who is ready to wear many hats and build build and scale products from zero-one, then this is the perfect role for you. You’ll have lots of autonomy and will need to be comfortable operating in ambiguous situations with an entrepreneurial mindset.

We are well-funded and offer competitive compensation, generous equity, and standard health benefits.

company.name: Assort Health
company.description:
At Assort Health, we have developed the first generative AI call center built for healthcare. Our long term goal is to make exceptional healthcare accessible anytime, anywhere, for everyone.

Unfortunately, the high costs of scaling and maintaining call center operations and administrative staffing within healthcare are often passed down to the patient. We solve this problem leveraging the latest advances in machine learning to build an AI-powered contact center platform for healthcare.

We have PMF, paying customers, and a huge pipeline of inbound customers that we plan to onboard this year. We're supported by a top-tier institutional lead investors like Quiet Capital, as well as several angels, including the former CMO of Flatiron Health and board director of Athena Health, and the founders of Infinitus, Mercury, Mammoth Biosciences, and PathAI. If you're interested, you'll also have the opportunity to meet them!
company.teamAbout: Assort is led by Jeff (former Head of Product Engineering at health tech company valued at 6B Athelas/Commure, first non-founder engineer at Cameo, engineer at Facebook, Duke grad) and Jon (Founder of Shimmer YC S21, 7 publications in healthcare AI, former UCSF med student, Stanford grad in top 3%).

name: Business Development Executive
description:
Fluidstack is an AI cloud working with top AI companies like Poolside, Meta, Modal, and Reka. We have seen exceptional growth and are looking for talent to help build the sales function from an early stage, take full ownership, and execute.

The core responsibilities are as follows:

Outbound:

  • Manage our Tier 2 cold outbound strategy

  • This primarily involves Scalable personalized outreach to companies that could spend $25k-$1m/month with FluidStack, and scale beyond this in the future.

  • Be responsible for organizing and managing the full list of companies that fit inside this category.

  • Build system ensuring we recycle through this list.

  • Primary outbound bjective is adding to pipeline and building a repeatable, scalable process for outbound.

Inbound:

  • Develop repeatable processes for qualifying inbound leads, through both personalised and automated outreach.

  • Nurture and support users starting out with FluidStack

Other

  • Closing customers (100-300k ACV initially, with deal sizes increasing with experience over time)

  • Support account management, account executive, supply and rev ops functions in with day to day oprations and process optimization.

  • Should have a desire to grow and develop in at least one of the above areas.

We are looking for a product-focused full-stack engineer to join us in building the world's largest and most-loved financial technology company.

name: Senior Product Designer
description:
About the role

We're growing rapidly and are looking for a Senior Product Designer who loves crafting elegant user experiences, thrives on complex challenges, and builds in a systematic, scalable manner.

As a design-first platform, you'll be a key pillar of our team with the autonomy to own and shape design direction for the entire product experience. You'll be a force multiplier who knows how to move fast and is excited to distill complex workflows and data intensive applications into intuitive, delightful experiences. You will inform the role design plays at Numeric and how the team grows with the business.

How we work

🐎 We get prototypes in front of customers quickly and ship features frequently. We believe this is the best way to learn & iterate.

🧩 We invest in common building blocks that allow us to build powerful and customizable features fast and look to constantly improve them.

🏰 We work closely with our engineers to discuss tradeoffs and advocate for a quality user experience.

🗝️ We empower everyone to have the ownership and tools to do their best work and we rigorously protect the team's time so we can maximize our impact.

requirements.description: First-principles thinking: you can deconstruct complex problems and craft elegant solutions.
Familiarity with data-intensive applications, engineering concepts, and/or experience as a software engineer; you can translate effectively between user needs and technical realities.

Passion for great design: you create product experiences that are beautiful and functional (with the portfolio to show for it), with an eye and for clean visual aesthetics optimized for user experience.

Strong systems thinking: you have an affinity for design systems with consistent use of design patterns, colors, & typography, and are excited to participate in technical discussions and advocate for exceptional user experience with keen awareness of tradeoffs and bias for shipping.

Startup mindset: you love jumping in at the 0->1 phase, you’re biased towards quickly launching product, iterating, and you thrive in ambiguous, rapidly-evolving environments. You're a strong, independent individual contributor with acute leadership skills.

responsibilities: Understand our users and their pain-points, interfacing with our customers & conducting user research, interviews, and usability testing as part of your methodology
Craft intuitive design sketches, end-to-end prototypes, and high-fidelity flows that are simple and elegant, and solve the most pressing problems our customers are experiencing
Define and own a scalable and component-based design system and design function, enabling fast execution & future scaling of a broader product and design team
Work closely with Product & Engineering to ensure we consistently translate complex technical architectures into simple and intuitive user experiences
Look for creative and innovative ideas inspired by analogous verticals and past experiences, inspiring the team through amazing execution
As we bring our product to market, support the initial definition & development of our marketing and branding design language
equity: Seriously Competitive (and sliding scale based on desired cash comp)
workPlaceText: In-person in SF or NY
experience_info:
as a full-spectrum product designer: you have a deep knowledge of best practices in user experience research, information architecture, and visual/interaction design. Experience building end-to-end prototypes with Figma and other best-in-class design tools. 

Note: would like to see at least ~2 YoE in a design role at a mid-sized (Series B+) or larger company.
recruiting_advice:
We are a team/culture that maintains an extremely high bar for quality / output / intelligence (EQ & IQ). A designer with the ability to speak to engineers & customers with the same level of depth and thoughtfulness is essential (and will excel!) Someone who is excited to (and has a proven track record of) learning something highly technical/specific and being able to translate that into advocating for the best UI/UX possible.

This designer will help shape the future of financial accounting and reporting working closely with our engineering team and key customers of ours like Plaid, Brex, OpenAI and more.
avoid_traits: Only experience in very large organizations
Only experience building/maintaining design systems
Animation or strictly visual designers (want UI/UX product design with good visual sense)
Folks not interested in working in-person in SF

company.name: Numeric
company.description:
Numeric is an AI accounting automation platform, built to take manual work off accountants' plates so they can focus on what’s impactful. Our product is currently used by hundreds of private and public companies to organize their close, automate reconciliations, and leverage AI for auto-drafted flux explanations and technical accounting research.

We have experienced founders and are fortunate to be well funded and be backed by great investors, including Founders Fund, Long Journey Ventures, and many founders and CFOs.
benefits: A fantastic office environment in downtown SF or NYC (we’re in-person!)
A comprehensive compensation package including a competitive salary, equity, and full benefits (medical, dental, vision, 401k)
company.teamAbout:
What we care about

We are an early startup, and our culture and values will continue to be defined by the people who join us on this journey. So expect our values to change over time as we incorporate new ideas and ensure they reflect the diversity of voices that make up Velocity.

Today, there are a few things that we double down on that we believe will lead to outsized early success

  1. Trust & Autonomy — we are a small team with big ambitions. Speed is our advantage and we maximize it by equipping everyone with the knowledge, tools, and support to make important decisions and take ownership of their work. As a result, we get a lot more done than people expect us to.

  2. Continuous Improvement — we care deeply about shortening the time to value for what we build and move quickly to release product and features. How we hire reflects this value as well. [A little bit of slope makes up for a lot of y-intercept](https://gist.github.com/gtallen1187/e83ed02eac6cc8d7e185#:~:text=for the weekend.-,A little bit of slope makes,a lot of Y-intercept.&text=So at a mathematical level,will cross the blue line.).

  3. Written Communication - we emphasize strong documentation and a scientific approach to evaluating and addressing problems. We believe a culture of writing promotes systematic thinking, creates shared institutional knowledge, and drives alignment of plans & priorities.

  4. Curiosity — finance and accounting systems need a first-principled rethink. The ways in which we differentiate our product, company, and culture will be defined by our ability to challenge conventions and consistently embody a learning mindset. All team members engage with our customers and take an active role in identifying opportunities to define solutions & improve our product.

Here is a bit more info about Numeric's team and mission!

company.name: Retell AI (YC W24)
company.description:
Retell AI is a powerful platform for building production ready voice AI. We recently closed a $4.5M seed round and achieved remarkable growth, reaching $3M in revenue within six months. Retell AI is proudly backed by Alt Capital, Y Combinator, and other leading investors.

Our team is composed of experts from Meta, Google, and TikTok, and we operate out of our in-person office in Redwood City.

We are at a pivotal moment in history where Voice AI will become the primary interface for accessing products and services, revolutionizing our interactions with machines for the better. Retell AI is at the forefront of creating this new reality.
benefits: Competitive salary with an equity package.
Meal and commute expenses fully covered.
Option to reside at the office with your own private bedroom.
A spacious and comfortable work environment, complete with unlimited snacks and drinks.
A friendly office cat to brighten your day!
The chance to innovate and push the boundaries of voice AI in a dynamic, venture-backed startup.

Bing Wu

Co-founder & CEO at Retell AI. Enthusiastic about the human brain and AI, Bing spent three years as a product manager at ByteDance/TikTok, where he led B2B and consumer products that delighted billions. Before joining ByteDance/TikTok, Bing founded two investor-backed startups in college, generating six-figure revenues.

name: Founding Senior/Staff Engineer
description:
Complete is on a mission to make compensation a winning advantage for the world's highest-impact companies. We are breaking compensation workflows out from spreadsheets and bringing them into the 21st century — think leveling and compensation cycle planning, total rewards statements for employees, interactive candidate offers and much more!

Why Complete? We realize that Compensation is a key determinant to a company's success (and their biggest spend!). Yet, enterprises lack the expertise to build and operate a defensible compensation strategy, making it one of the most costly mistakes to their financial and operational efficiency. We believe that companies with creative compensation strategies do and will continue to win. Our customers include highly impactful startups like Render, Vercel, Brex, Linear, and Cortex, all the way to world-class enterprises like Roblox.

Complete is backed by Accel and YC. We're also lucky to count technology leaders and operators like Will Larson (CTO of Carta), Eric Sagar (COO of Plaid), Mathilde Collin (CEO of Front) as our angels and/or advisors. Our ARR has grown 3x since Jan of this year, and we're hitting an inflection point where we need stellar engineers (like you!) to come join us.

Our CEO, Rani Mavram, has built a very strong community of CTOs/Founders/Advisors around the company, and we would love to bring "entrepreneurs-to-be" within the company!

Here is a page with a bit more about me and Complete as a company: https://www.anantjain.dev/posts/complete
