Our customer-obsessed team sees every challenge as an opportunity to build with empathy and compassion. Every team member is a culture-add and builds onto our evolving values.

name: Lead Technical Account Manager
description:
This role will be responsible for managing regular check-ins, driving growth, and averting churns within an account base of 100+ commercial to enterprise customers. This person will be taking over this responsibility from a group of 3 that does it on the side of their primary functions. As such, it's expected that the person in this role will develop tools and processes to manage a large customer base and scale efficiently with growth. When their tools and processes can't keep up with the book of business, they will lead expanding the team and will be the presumptive manager of additional hires.

From our job post:

As the Lead Technical Account Manager, you will own the ongoing relationship with our customers. After their onboarding is complete, you will work with them to discover new pain points and needs and help them use Metaplane to solve them. This role calls for someone with empathy with customers, strong organizational skills, and the technical acumen to dig in deep on their challenges. Your work to deepen our customers’ usage of the platform will be instrumental to the company’s success as you grow accounts, develop advocates and evangelists, and represent the voice of the customer back to the product team for incorporation into the product roadmap.

Metaplane is a small, tight-knit, high-performing team, and the perfect candidate will be ready to get their hands dirty on day one while building up a scalable practice to support the company as it grows. If you’re excited to lead account management at a fast-growing Series A startup, including the opportunity to eventually build a team, we’d love to hear from you.

requirements.description: Strong collaborator, and experience working with Product, Sales, Marketing, and more.
Empathy for the customer and enthusiasm for solving problems -- working with our customers to maximize the value they get out of the product.
Experience managing a large (60+) customer portfolio and prioritizing to maximize customer success and company outcomes.
Experienced in a high-growth startup, or in a fast-paced environment with a high level of ownership and autonomy.

responsibilities: Running regular check-ins with customers
Conducting small product demos of new features to existing customers
Managing customer churn (and identifying it proactively)
Drive customer growth and upsell
Develop processes and tools to enable Metaplane to grow faster

Collaborate with other teams to be the voice of the customer: provide the Product team with customer perspectives on the roadmap, collaborate with the Sales teams to identify the newest, most valuable use cases for Metaplane, and bring customer case studies and advocates to the Marketing team
visa_text_more: Can sponsor TN visas. Other visas must be exceptional fits.
experience_info: in account management or customer success in B2B SaaS.
recruiting_advice:
I'm looking for a few qualities that strike a balance between different career priorities:

  • they've built out tools to accelerate scaling, but they are also in the trenches with customers every day

  • they can manage their book of accounts like a sales person, but they can meet with the customer like a consultative technical expert

This is a relatively new product category, so the role requires a decent amount of running educational sessions. Ideally the candidate will have experience leading calls like that.

We are a fully-remote company founded by MIT and HubSpot alums and backed by prominent investors, including Y Combinator, Khosla Ventures, Felicis, and the founders of HubSpot, Vercel, and Okta.

The #1 reason why people choose to work with us is the quality of our team. We win together as a small team of highly talented people, valuing both autonomy and collaboration.

name: Senior Product Designer, Growth
description:
Why Growth Design?

Fitbod's growth relies on driving health & fitness outcomes in our customers. This depends on new users building a habit of using Fitbod, consistently exercising to realize fitness results, and finally referring people they know to our platform. We’re hiring a designer to help more people move through each step of this fundamental growth loop.

Why Strength Training?

Strength training is a simple, accessible way for anyone to improve quality of life that’s hiding in plain sight. Fortunately, more people are discovering strength training than ever before. We’re not just focused on the advanced gym-goer. Rather, we are unlocking functional movement, strength, flexibility, and freedom from pain for millions of people.

Our recommendation AI is used by hundreds of thousands of paying customers. It employs advanced statistics, machine learning, and over 400 million fitness data points to create highly personalized and flexible fitness plans.

Why you’re set up for success

  • Revenue-driving impact - You’ll directly operate on our highest leverage, short-term growth levers. You'll have the responsibility, impact and "proof of work" of driving the core metrics behind a successful consumer subscription business.

  • Establish the growth design practice at Fitbod - As our first growth designer, you’ll partner directly with our co-founder, a product designer who has deep, applied experience of applying design to drive our growth strategy. You’ll practice hypothesis-driven product development through collaborating with Product, Data-Science, and Growth Marketing.

  • Mature metrics & user research capacity - User research plays a core part of our product development cycle. Our product is well equipped and integrated with our data analytics tools. This empowers anyone in the organization to answer data questions themselves.

  • We’re a small team with healthy business economics - The market is rewarding profitability over grow-at-all-costs. Having raised a total of $4.6M to reach $25M+ ARR at cash flow positive, we have shown the ability (unique among VC funded tech startups) to grow at a venture scale while maintaining profitability and stability.

requirements.description: Great balance of communication design skills with applied interaction design and brand experience.
Values the role of quantitative and qualitative research methods in driving the design process.
Familiarity with data analysis tools.

responsibilities: 4+ years product design experience.
Great balance of product design & visual/communication design
Values the role of quantitative an qualitative research methods to drive the design process.
Familiarity with data analysis tools.
workPlaceText: Remote in the US
experience_info: in product design.
recruiting_advice:
• Experience with Growth Design (move short term biz metrics, iterative, hypothesis driven, data-driven, product sense - user psychology).

  • Ideally Consumer Mobile Subscription experience, but can also have Consumer mobile/web, or B2B with consumer end users (Gusto, Slack, Notion, etc)

  • Above average Visual Design / Communication design chops. Yes, primarily UX/Product Design, but indexes higher on visual. They could have started as visual and made the jump.

  • Ideally some startup (small company) experience vs all large company

  • The products they’ve designed - Closer to a match are Habit-building product (fitness, wellness, language). Next Productivity, Music, Social Networks. Farther from a match is Consuming content-based experienced (streaming video, reading, news) or transactional (shopping, amazon, wallmart, etc)

  • Fast, divergent explorations without being too married to one solution.

  • Experience with scaffolding users via clear funnels, positioning (copy, CTAs, start/end states), reducing load.

  • Leveraging emotion, motivational tactics, rewards to drive user action.

  • For velocity, compromises for implementation ease, narrower scope solutions

Possible keywords

  • Growth

  • Onboarding

  • Activation

  • Acquisition

  • Conversion

  • Virality

  • Monetization

  • Referral

  • Discovery

  • Resurrection

  • Funnel

  • Engagement

  • A/B Tests, AB Tests

  • Landing Page

  • Retention

name: Founding Engineer, Senior
description:
PointOne is building the AI tech stack for law firms, replacing rote admin tasks—timekeeping, price prediction, business intelligence, etc.—currently costing them $80B/yr. We are currently working with 50+ law firms and are growing rapidly.

The Founding Engineer will work with the founders to build a category-defining product, continue scaling it to massive enterprises, and become a leader in the organization.

We’re looking for someone who is excited by this challenge and the impact we'll have if we do this right. We work every day, together, in person, because we understand that every minute counts in the early days of a startup. This is going to be intense early-stage startup work; the person we hire is expected to become a leader and help form the company’s vision and culture.

We're backed by YC, Bessemer, General Catalyst, 8VC and we're based in NY.

company.name: Truewind (YC W23)
company.description:
Truewind is AI-powered Bookkeeping and Financial Modeling for Startups.

Through a combination of artificial intelligence and concierge service, we deliver a delightful financial back office experience to fast-growing companies. Reliable bookkeeping, detailed financial models, built exclusively for startups. We are a San Francisco-based startup backed by Y Combinator.
benefits: Off-site events in SF and NYC twice a year!
company.teamAbout:
Co-founders Alex (CEO) and Tennison (CTO) met in San Francisco and started building Truewind in November 2022. Alex is a 2x YC founder and ex venture capital investor. Tennison has spent 10+ years building software at Flexport, Pinterest, and Alibaba.

Founded on the heels of ChatGPT, we are in a unique position to rethink accounting and finance workflows from the bottom up. Using the latest generative AI technologies, we’re building an AI-native copilot to enhance accountants & financial analysis everywhere.

Now is an exciting time to join — in 6 months, we have 40+ venture-backed startups as paying customers, a small yet mighty team of 7 people (2 engineers), and over $3M raised from Y Combinator & Fin Capital.

name: Senior Full-Stack Engineer
description:
We’re looking for an exceptional full-stack engineer to join us as a founding team member.

Truewind is changing the way accountants and financial analysts work by building AI-native workflows. We’re developing cutting-edge AI technology that simplifies bookkeeping, financial reporting, and decision-making, providing finance teams and companies with the insights they need to succeed.

The founding full-stack software engineer is multifaceted; you will be instrumental in shaping both the technical and culture foundations of our company. You’ll need to feel comfortable going outside your comfort zone and enjoy wearing many different hats. Strong experience building web applications is essential; if you've built them from scratch, that's even better.

Lastly, we want you to join us in San Francisco. We believe building in-person is a 10x multiplier for the company and we hope you’ll join us here. Our HQ is the Financial District in San Francisco (more details on the [home page](https://www.notion.so/Truewind-is-hiring-14fef79adac6424e95eb99b2560a017b?pvs=21)).

Ensure the security, privacy, and compliance of our technology and data.

Lead and mentor a team of engineers, data scientists, and developers as the startup grows.
Collaborate with sales, marketing, and customer service teams to ensure a seamless customer experience and drive user adoption.

company.name: Keeper (YC S21)
company.description:
Bookkeepers today are stuck working in excel spreadsheets and homegrown project management solutions to support their clients. Keeper is on a mission to change that.

With our all-in-one tool, bookkeepers can manage their work, communicate with clients, catch hard-to-find errors, and deliver reports to help their small business customers make smarter strategic decisions.

Founded in 2021, Keeper has raised $6M in seed funding, backed by leading tech investors like Y Combinator and founders at top startups like Lattice, Front, Superhuman, Plaid, and more. Keeper currently helps thousands of bookkeepers and accountants manage the books for startups and small businesses across the US.

name: Account Executive
description:
GovDash is looking for ambitious Account Executives to join our team! Our Sales team has a unique mission to help make government contractors aware of the deep impact that GovDash's platform can have on their ability to win and manage contracts.

GovDash launched in September 2023, and is being rapidly adopted by companies across the country to redefine how their capture, proposal and contract teams go after opportunities. We assist government contractors with capture, proposal development, contract management & more—all in one place.

We've previously hired 2 incredible software engineers through the platform, and are excited to continue collaborating to build out our Sales team. We're looking to hire 2-4 Account Executives - let's do this!

requirements.description: Have fantastic communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to explain complex concepts in a simple way.
Exceptional organizational skills, and the ability to thrive in ambiguity and work autonomously.

Care about America and her interests.
Experience working in early-stage startup environments.

Stayed in previous roles for 2 years or more; no job hopping
The ability to operate with high horsepower, be adept at frequent context switching and working on multiple projects at once with expansive ownership, and ruthless prioritization.

Run discovery calls with incoming leads
Demo the GovDash platform

We're also looking for a VP of Sales archetype in parallel with this search. I am looking for someone who ideally understands public sector sales, who is young but has experience and is super hungry to become an executive. They should be data-driven and want to take ownership over the sales function and work with me directly. This is an urgent hire, but has been very difficult for us to find so far.

visa_text_more: Unfortunately can't sponsor visas for this role
experience_info: experience doing GTM, growth or SDR/AE experience out of college. Intentionally looking for more junior profiles
recruiting_advice:
What you can pitch candidates (I feel like sales folks will like this?)

  • We're growing Revenue/GMV 50% MoM (huge upside for sales person to join and crank)

  • Crossed $1M revenue in June 2024, $2M revenue in August, and $3M annual revenue in September

  • Tangible growth: we went from making 1 hire a month to 1 hire day in less than 7 months

  • We already have great logos, track record, case studies to work with: Scale AI, Hightouch, Traba, Palantir, Eight Sleep, Decagon, Character AI etc

  • Huge TAM: $700B market globally

    • We're expanding to different product lines, different industry verticals, markets/countries so there's huge growth potential to capture all TAM

  • No ceiling: they can be Head of Sales one day

  • Financial upside: equity and uncapped comission

Look for candidates that are:

  • Aggressive by nature and never satisfied.

    • They should never say 'that was enough for the week' or 'we're growing pretty fast' because we can always grow faster and do more.

  • 100% Action oriented

    • After we say let's try X, they should do it the next minute. Getting things done immediately

  • High aptitude (really smart)

  • Ambitious & hungry

  • Enviable work ethic

Ideal profile: max 1-2 years experience out of a top school crushing it as an SDR at a top B2B early stage startup hungry to do even more

They basically need to book so many demos that we are drowning in sales calls. We're trying to 2x revenue every month

Alignment and work ethic:

Also would appreciate if you could screen candidates for this:

We're an early stage startup and not just the founders but the rest of the team work really hard. e.g. our founding customer success manager works 8am - 9:30pm everyday. Wayne, who recently joined to lead growth works 8am - 12am everyday, basically similar hours to how the founders work.

We just simply have too much to do and will not become the company we set out to be without this level of commitment.

If we were to all visualize Stripe and Airbnb's early team, we would all agree that they worked insanely hard and if they hadn't, they wouldn't be the company they are today.

Of course, it will not be reasonable to ask this without the upside. We're growing revenue/GMV 50% MoM and in some cases doubling each month. We recently had some small strategic investments (not a full round) that valued us at 4x the valuation we raised our seed round from (in march) and in 7 months went from making 1 placement a month to 1 placement a day.

We truly all believe we're building a massive company and a great founding sales/gtm is a necessity to making this a reality. They will also have no ceiling in terms of growth potential.
avoid_traits: Passive / Neutral (Not aggressive & proactive)
High ego

company.name: Paraform
company.description:
Paraform is a marketplace connecting companies with open roles and recruiters who can fill them.

Companies can work with specialized recruiters more cheaply, monitor their performance, and flex based on demand. Recruiters don't have to worry about acquiring clients while earning and working on their own terms.

Incredible teams at the most exciting startups and enterprises are being built as a result.

We power talent for a wide range of customers:

  • Enterprise - Palantir, Anduril, Scale AI

  • Growth stage - Eight Sleep, Character.ai, Applied Intuition

  • Early stage - Mintlify, Jenni.ai, Decagon.ai

We've raised money from:

  • Co-founders - Twitch, Doordash, and Eventbrite

  • VCs - A*, Soma Capital, Founders Inc, and Primer Sazze

  • Leadership - Palantir, Opendoor, Ramp, and Scale AI

Other highlights:

  • GMV/Revenue increasing 50% MoM

  • We just moved into a beautiful new office in North Beach. Check out video of it here
benefits: 🌉 Beautiful office with golden gate bridge view at the Fort Mason Center in San Francisco. Moving to North Beach soon and we think it's even better :)
🌏 Company Offsites (NY, LA, Sydney, Seoul etc)
company.teamAbout:
Hey 👋 we're John and Jeff, the co-founders of Paraform. Funnily enough, this all started when we tried to recruit each other in 2022. Ever since then, we've experienced first-hand how broken recruiting is and our mission is to finally fix it.

Our values and culture

  • We work hard and enjoy being together in person. We are transparent about our work ethic and expectations because it enables us to have extreme ownership in building at a pace that is unmatched.

  • Customers, customers, customers. We're customer-obsessed and always start with the customer first. We are the customer support team.

  • Ship fast and break things. We believe great products come from lots of experimentation, so we value fast development. No one is going to wait around for us to make things, especially something that's perfect.

  • Take care of each other. We trust each other and want to enable everyone to do their best work. That means an all food and transportation compensated, gym membership, unlimited PTO, global offsites, premium healthcare and a free bike.

name: Senior Fullstack Engineer

We're looking for a founding full-stack engineer to help us build an IDE for AI development.

This is an open-ended, unsolved problem, and we’re looking for tinkerers, hackers, and creatives who want to build the toolkit for the next decade of AI development.

We're a small team, so we’re looking for someone who can tackle complex problems end-to-end, and create a product that solves problems and delights users.

name: SRE / HPC Engineer
description:
Fluidstack is an AI cloud working with top AI companies like Poolside, Meta, Modal, and Reka. Our HPC Engineer will be responsible for ensuring peak performance of GPU infrastructure and providing top-tier support to customers.

Your main responsibilities include deploying new clusters, automating processes to support scalability, and offering client-facing support for GPU debugging and performance optimization.

requirements.description: Experience provisioning large scale clusters and networks with e.g. BCM, UFM.
Experience with large-scale GPU systems, working with Nvidia GPUs and Infiniband networks.
Experience with HPC systems, System Administration, SRE, or DevOps.
Experience with large scale workloads utilizing orchestrators like Slurm or Kubernetes.
Experience with automation of bare-metal machines and containers, using tools such as Ansible, Bash, or Python.
Fast learner, adaptable, and passionate about Fluidstack’s mission!
Experience with shared storage on platforms such as NFS, DDN, Vast, CephFS, etc.

responsibilities: Deployment. We will be onboarding new clusters at least monthly - you will help take bare-metal servers and deploy them for our customers as high performance compute as a service.
Automation. Our GPU fleet is large and growing. You will help us to automate many of our processes and systems to allow us to support Fluidstack continuing to scale.

Support. This will be a client facing role - you will work closely with our customers to make sure that they are able to utilize our infrastructure to achieve their goals. You will work on everything from GPU debugging, Slurm management, to training performance optimization.

company.name: Rundoo
company.description:
What we do

Our mission is to empower building materials suppliers with great technology. There are over $1,000,000,000,000 of building materials bought in the US every year, and many of these transactions happen in on-prem point-of-sale systems. We want to bring these transactions online, enabling better experiences for contractors and homeowners alike.

What we stand for ⭐️

The values we hold most dear are learning through feedback and experimentation, enjoying our time together, truly empathizing with clients (we've worked at paint stores & lumber yards!), building a diverse team, and driving to achieve as fast as we can.

How we've fundraised 💰

We've raised $18m across three rounds:

  1. A $2m pre-seed led by Kent Bennett at Bessemer with participation from Plug & Play, Quiet Capital, and Sequoia.

  2. A $5m seed led by Caitlin Bolnick Rellas at CRV.

  3. An $11m series A led again by Bessemer and CRV.
benefits: Medical, vision, and dental insurance with 100% premiums covered for you, 50% for dependents (~$5-6k/yr) 🏥🥸🦷
Unlimited audiobooks via our team subscription to Libro ($500/yr) 🎧
And more! If you have ideas, let us know 🙂
company.teamAbout:
Who we are

In alphabetical order:

  1. Adam (Territory Account Executive): studied Communications at UConn (Go Huskies!) and worked as an AE at a large cloud software company (Box); a frequent at concerts around the greater NYC area in his spare time 🫡

  2. Amanda (Recruiting & Operations); studied marketing at De La Salle University; worked in recruiting at a few startups; loves SCUBA diving! 🌊

name: Backend Engineer (Go)
description: This role is focused on empowering building materials suppliers with innovative technology to bring transactions online and enhance experiences for contractors and homeowners. The ideal candidate will make significant contributions to the software used by clients, introduce systems to improve team velocity, set and enforce engineering quality standards, mentor teammates, and collaborate with product and design teams to define project goals.

requirements.description: You collaborate well with engineering teammates and cross-functionally—especially working through natural tension with designers and product managers.
You give positive & constructive in-the-moment feedback to your teammates and enjoy receiving the same.
You're excited to work at least a couple days a week in-person at our office in Redwood City.
You have written production backend software using Go.
You have worked in a fast-paced startup environment.
You have written frontend software using React and TypeScript.
You have familiarity with construction or building materials.

responsibilities: You'll make significant individual contributions that get used instantly & heavily by our clients who depend on our software to run their businesses.
You'll leverage your orthogonal expertise to introduce abstractions and systems that improve the team's velocity.
You'll raise the bar for engineering quality by setting and enforcing standards.
You'll mentor teammates to help them grow as architects & engineers.
You'll work closely with product & design teammates and our clients to collectively define what we're building.
workPlaceText: HQ in Redwood City
experience_info: in software engineering
recruiting_advice: Our culture values are Relentless, Unassuming, Now (bias toward moving fast), Delightful (finding joy in the work itself), Optimized, & Open. We like candidates who have a mix of startup and big company experience.
avoid_traits: Arrogance

company.name: Rundoo
company.description:
What we do

Our mission is to empower building materials suppliers with great technology. There are over $1,000,000,000,000 of building materials bought in the US every year, and many of these transactions happen in on-prem point-of-sale systems. We want to bring these transactions online, enabling better experiences for contractors and homeowners alike.

What we stand for ⭐️

The values we hold most dear are learning through feedback and experimentation, enjoying our time together, truly empathizing with clients (we've worked at paint stores & lumber yards!), building a diverse team, and driving to achieve as fast as we can.

How we've fundraised 💰

We've raised $18m across three rounds:

  1. A $2m pre-seed led by Kent Bennett at Bessemer with participation from Plug & Play, Quiet Capital, and Sequoia.

  2. A $5m seed led by Caitlin Bolnick Rellas at CRV.

  3. An $11m series A led again by Bessemer and CRV.
benefits: Medical, vision, and dental insurance with 100% premiums covered for you, 50% for dependents (~$5-6k/yr) 🏥🥸🦷
Unlimited audiobooks via our team subscription to Libro ($500/yr) 🎧
And more! If you have ideas, let us know 🙂

name: Founding Account Executive
description:
We've worked with companies like Nvidia, Bill, Hubspot, OctoAI, Superhuman, Brave, Bubble, and countless others to help them put their brand or product in front of their target ICP, with The Deep View as serving as their trusted medium. We're now looking for an Account Executive to join our sales team and continue to scale our outbound sales motion.

As an Account Executive, you are a proven hunter & sales closer with a track record of quota attainment and overachievement. You have experience working in full-cycle sales, from prospecting to proposals and renewals. We believe in aligning incentives with our customers, and you will embody this throughout the sales process, engaging with C-Level executives and key decision-makers at startups and enterprises alike. This role will primarily focus on increasing the sales volume of dedicated placements within newsletters, including full email newsletter takeovers and sponsored sections. There will also be other sellable channels at your disposal, including web and social.

As an early team member, you will also have the chance to help build the sales engine and shape the sales strategy that drives the company's growth.

requirements.description: Consultative sales approach and comfortable leveraging analytical & quantitative skills
Experience working in a startup, and excited to join an early-stage company
requirements.explanation: Wants to join a startup and be a founding member. Should expect to work a lot while making a huge impact.

requirements.description: Consistent track record of hitting or exceeding sales targets in a fast-paced environment
Experience selling newsletters, podcasts, or social media campaigns on fixed rates
Experience closing upwards of 20 deals a quarter, with an average deal size of $10K
Demonstrated experience in selling successfully $50k+ enterprise contracts
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, attention to detail
Longevity (3+ yrs) at recent roles, with maybe 1-2 exceptions. We'd want to stay away from people who are hopping every year.
Demonstrated interest in AI (plays around with chats, follows AI news, etc.)

responsibilities: Develop and deploy a direct sales and partnerships strategy, including prospecting, pipeline management, upselling, and renewals
Scale the volume of direct partnerships for primary, secondary, and tertiary email placements based on flat fees
Build relationships with brand partners, preparing and presenting proposals to prospective partners
Drive revenue for The Deep View, owning the entire sales cycle through close, and leveraging sales methodologies to uncover customer needs and pain points
Articulate The Deep View’s value proposition using appropriate sales qualification standards, and develop strategies for closing opportunities
Own sales activity and monthly revenue forecasting in Hubspot
experience_info: in quota-carrying direct fixed-rate media sales in a full cycle closing role with strong prospecting, qualifying, negotiating, and closing skills
recruiting_advice: We're seeking candidates with a proven track record in full-cycle B2B sales, particularly those with experience in media or digital advertising. Look for individuals who demonstrate strong self-motivation, as they'll be responsible for their own lead generation. Ideal candidates should have experience with long sales cycles and managing complex, high-value accounts. We value those who can show quantifiable results, such as consistently meeting or exceeding quota, or significantly growing accounts over time. Familiarity with newsletter monetization strategies is a plus. Candidates should be comfortable with data-driven selling and have experience using CRM systems. Strong communication skills are essential, as they'll be interfacing with high-level decision-makers.
avoid_traits: Ego
Pessimism
Inflexibility
Lack of ownership
Lack of curiosity
Inconsistency
benefits: 100% medical, dental & vision insurance coverage for you

company.name: The Deep View
company.description: Founded in May of 2023, The Deep View is a newsletter-first media brand that delivers breaking news and insights on artificial intelligence to hundreds of thousands of professionals every day. Our content, newsletters, and podcasts provide professionals with the critical analysis and information they need to make sense of what's happening in AI and how it affects their lives.

name: Staff Software Engineer, Discovery
description:
We are looking for an engineer to join our team and help us unlock the full potential of our most critical asset: our data. You will have direct impact on our revenue and customers by ensuring that our systems can handle the complex relationship between our entities.

You will be responsible for scaling our knowledge graph infrastructure and managing our time series data. You will also evaluate and improve our data storage and taxonomy systems, and mentor and manage other engineers on the team.

requirements.description: Extensive experience in search systems (search, recommendations, and knowledge graphs).
Passionate about making discovery more intuitive and user-friendly.
Experience with search technologies (Lucene, Elastic Search, Solr, etc).
Experience with streaming technologies (Pub/Sub, Kafka, RabbitMQ, etc).
Experience with various data storage solutions (SQL, NoSQL / key-value stores).
2+ years of experience in an early-stage startup.
3+ years of experience in leading teams either as a Technical Lead or Engineering Manager.
Proven track record migrating systems in a changing environment that allows for little to no downtime to meet increasing demand.
Obsessed about your craft and share your knowledge (tech talks, articles, open source, etc).
Experience in working in Python/strongly typed languages.

responsibilities: Derive deeper insight from our data by scaling our current knowledge graph infrastructure to handle hundreds of millions of datapoints.

Deeply understand how our insight layer is connected to the rest of our application layer and ensure the needs of our customers and teams are met by focusing on performance, observability, and most importantly customer demand.
Evaluate how we store time series data and help us scale it 10x the current throughput in an iterative manner.
Leverage ML infrastructure and services to continually improve our taxonomy and derive relevant signals from the underlying data.
workPlaceText: In-person in NYC or Bay Area
experience_info: building highly performant, highly observable, and highly scalable systems.
recruiting_advice:
Some things that have been indicators of success on our team:

  • candidates who have worked at both big tech and startups have faired well

  • candidates who have shown career progression at their roles vs jumpiness from role to role

  • candidates who have resumes that are output-driven
avoid_traits: People who come off as egotistical, overly focused on job title, leveling, comp, etc.
People who are specifically targeting management as a means of career progression
People used to have lots of resources/tools at their disposal, and not accustomed to being a little scrappy/resourceful
benefits: Top of the line health, dental and vision insurance, with 100% premium covered
Monthly social budget for each office

company.name: Harmonic
company.description:
About us

Harmonic is the startup discovery engine. We believe in innovation, entrepreneurs, and efficient capital markets. It pains us to see great startup opportunities consistently go undiscovered. So, we dedicated ourselves to mapping out the startup landscape and building the index and tools that ensure the most promising founders get found and funded.

The world's largest and most prolific venture capital firms rely on us to find and invest in the next Google, AirBnB, Uber, Stripe, and Anduril. We play a crucial part in ensuring hundreds of billions of dollars get routed efficiently and that the innovations the world would most benefit from materialize.

We’ve been growing steadily and need passionate driven people to help us get to the next level. If you want to work in a high-growth environment with some of the most talented folks on the planet and resonate with our values, read on.
benefits: Top of the line health, dental and vision insurance, with 100% premium covered
Monthly team dinner (we have a lot of foodies) for each office
Quarterly company-wide offsites. Locations so far: Barcelona, Puerto Vallarta, Austin, & Salt Lake City
company.teamAbout:
We’ve been growing steadily and need passionate driven people to help us get to the next level. If you want to work in a high-growth environment with some of the most talented folks on the planet and resonate with our values, read on.

  • Explore Working with Sang to understand decision-making processes related to the engineering function.

  • Explore the Team Page to get acquainted with the rest of the company.

name: Founding Engineer
description:
Our Founding Engineer will play a crucial role in building Blockit, a seed stage company focused on building a generative AI scheduling agent.

This person will collaborate with the founding team to design and build key features for the AI scheduling agent. They will contribute to the entire tech stack, design and implement advanced algorithms and models, and contribute to the overall technical strategy of the product and company.

The ideal candidate would have 2-5 years of experience and have attended top schools and worked at high-growth startups.

requirements.description: Experience at a high-growth “startups” (think retool, ramp, notion, etc.), and now wanting to join an early-stage company
Able to work with the team in SF
CS Degree from a top-tier university (MIT, Stanford, Ivies, CMU, etc.)
Interest in productivity tools
Experience building product / features that uses LLM
Excited to work at a seed-stage startup
Product engineering experience

responsibilities: Collaborate with the founding team to design and build key features for our AI scheduling agent.
While backend-focused, contribute to the entire tech stack (node / react / typescript / LLM integrations) to lead a project end-to-end.
Design and implement advanced algorithms and models that drive the intelligence behind our scheduling agent, continuously improving accuracy and efficiency.

As a founding engineer, contribute to the overall technical strategy, making key decisions that will shape the future of our product and company, especially on the AI/LLM fronts where there isn’t an established process yet.
workPlaceText: In-person in SF 4 days a week
experience_info: (i.e. young, hungry engineers who have enough experience to hit the ground running right away)
recruiting_advice:
A couple notes:

  • Because we have a pretty senior eng team, we are open to new grad hires as well if they have good internship experience

  • 5 years of experience isn’t a hard cap, but we’ve found it’s much harder to convince sr+ engineer to join an early stage startup, especially given seniority of our team

Our values:

  • Simple - speak plainly, don't over-complicate things

  • Speedy - bias to action/getting things done

  • Spirited - sense that they care about what they do

  • Students - curious-orientation, lead with questions
avoid_traits: Unfriendly
Overly focused on comp
Not able to work in-office in SF

company.name: Blockit
company.description:
Say hello to Blockit: your 24/7 AI executive assistant. It's different because - well - it actually works.

Blockit eliminates back-and-forth coordination, learns your scheduling preferences, and consistently surprises you with correctness.

name: Fullstack Software Engineer
description:
There are very few software engineers with intimate knowledge of 9-1-1. Taking a page out of Palantir’s book — this role is “Forward Deployed”. You will gain an understanding for our customers’ problems through directly interacting with them: site visits, customer support, and integration assistance. Unlike most SWEs, expect this to be 20%+ of your time.

We are looking for 2 engineers to join our team. As a Fullstack Software Engineer at Aurelian, you will be responsible for designing and building solutions that address our customers’ needs, end-to-end. You will have a deep, technical understanding of the problems ECCs face and will work directly with them to improve their experience with our platform.

requirements.description: Track record of shipping products
Excited about being customer facing for at least 20% of your time
Strong technical skills; experience with React, Python, containerized applications (Azure is a plus)
Excited and intentional about working in an early-stage, high-growth startup
Strong ability to break down and clearly communicate technical concepts; possesses strong interpersonal skills and is easy to talk to.

Wants to hit the ground running with small team of 4, work onsite five days a week at our Seattle (Fremont) office, and understands the commitment of working 50+ hours per week in a startup environment.
Holds a Computer Science degree from a top 25 program.
Previous experience as a founder or first 10 employees at a startup highly preferred

responsibilities: Work closely with our largest customers to problem-solve technical hurdles
Design, develop, and ship features that make our product better and more complete
Help customize and integrate our software to best match our customers’ needs
workPlaceText: On-site in Seattle 5 days a week (soon to be an office, likely in Fremont area)
visa_text_more: U.S. citizens only
experience_info: of software engineering experience with early signs of excellence, demonstrated through great internships, rapid promotions, impactful projects, and lots of ownership.
recruiting_advice: We're looking for a talented software engineer that can work closely with 9-1-1 professionals. A great hire is going to be blue collar -- willing to get their hands dirty and able to talk to anyone. If they confuse you with technical lingo, they're not going to be a good fit. If they have side projects and passions and care deeply, they'd be great. Make sure they're willing to work.
avoid_traits: Lazy
Poor personal skills / eye contact
Slow response times
Weak willed
low energy
People wanting cash-heavy comp
People interviewing with massive companies

company.name: Aurelian
company.description: Aurelian automates non-emergency calls for 9-1-1 centers. We do this through an AI-powered operator that routes, triages, and resolves calls without the need for human intervention. Our mission is to help 911 operators focus their time and energy on emergencies by automating repetitive tasks.

name: Embedded Software Engineer
description:
Neros is transforming a defense industry mired in costly, behemoth machinery—to circumvent a looming vulnerability gap, to give dismounted soldiers a fighting chance against tanks, and ultimately, to get as many humans off the battlefield as possible.

As an early Neros employee, you will get to help decide the direction of our future. We are looking for someone who can write the embedded software on the Neros Archer platform including flight control and radio link code.

requirements.description: Experience with C/C++ programming
Microcontrollers and ST Microelectronics experience
Experience with embedded protocols (I2C, SPI, CAN BUS, and custom protocol design)
Basic electrical engineering skills (incl. oscilloscope and logic analyzer)
Bachelors or Masters in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or closely related degree
Experience in electronics design (schematic design, PCB design, microsoldering)
Flight control software experience (Betaflight, PX4, Ardupilot)
Experience with sub frame latency video compression and embedded wireless systems
Industry experience with new board bring up
comfortable with low level embedded programming

responsibilities: own neros embedded programming
write the code that goes on the neros drone
software bring up for new pcbs
workPlaceText: In-person in El Segundo, CA
recruiting_advice: n/a
avoid_traits: legacy aerospace

company.name: Neros Technologies
company.description:
Neros is transforming a defense industry mired in costly, behemoth machinery—to circumvent a looming vulnerability gap, to give dismounted soldiers a fighting chance against tanks, and ultimately, to get as many humans off the battlefield as possible.

While consumer technology is evolving by bounds on the smaller-cheaper-better path, U.S. defense technology wallows in the large, centralized, and wildly expensive paradigm. Our air, land, and sea machinery budget is staggering; yet these large assets can still be vulnerable to very small weapons. When swarm technology comes into its own, the asymmetry will escalate. Nowhere is the pattern more glaring than in small unmanned aerial systems (sUAS)—drones. 

https://www.sequoiacap.com/article/partnering-with-neros-next-gen-drones-made-in-america/
company.productDescription: a drone that goes 0-60 in one second and can blow up a tank
company.teamAbout: We are a fast paced defense startup founded by 2 professional drone pilots that put college on hold to build Neros

name: Lead Brand Designer
description:
Airfoil is a collective of designers, engineers, and artists helping cutting-edge products in crypto, AI, and fintech take flight. As we continue our involvement in the web3 space and expand our footprint in the world of AI, we’re selectively adding talented creatives to our team.

We’re currently looking to hire a talented Lead Brand Designer to join our brand design team.

requirements.description: Engage in constructive design critiques.
Self-motivated, able to work independently but also collaborative and driven by group critique.
A portfolio showcasing brand and visual design work with a strong design sensibility.
Effectively communicate conceptual ideas and design rationale.
Able to work independently, prioritize accordingly, and iterate quickly.
Strong communication skills without a fear of over communication.
Has worked for or with venture-backed startups or fast-paced agencies
Illustration or graphic design ability.
Ability to prototype in your tool of choice (Figma, Illustrator, etc).

responsibilities: Lead projects for the brand team and own client communication + task management.
Mentor and guide fellow team members.
Define and create a visual language as an extension of the brand (illustrations, icons, colors, typography, animations, etc.) and own all aspect of brand design for projects.
Collaborate with UX designers to create and maintain a cohesive and consistent brand experience between Marketing and Product.
Continually iterate on concepts in an effort to make the brand relevant and relatable to our audience(s).
experience_info: (6+ preferred)
recruiting_advice:
We don't want to talk to talk to anyone until we get their portfolio approved. Portfolio is #1 deciding factor.

  • Shows portfolio to leadership team, and if they like it they'll move them forward

Not looking for generalists - we need someone who is the best at what they do (brand design).
avoid_traits: Poor English skills (need to be good at comms in English)
Defensiveness (need to be open to feedback)
Someone who wants a very rigid schedule (need flexibility for clients + team)

company.name: Airfoil
company.description:
Airfoil is a collective of designers, engineers, and artists helping cutting-edge products in crypto, the creator economy, and future of work take flight. Since our inception in 2019, we’ve worked with 80+ teams to bring their products to market, including Solana Labs, Drift Protocol, Layer3.xyz, Playhouse, Highbeam, and more.

As we increase our involvement in the web3 space and prepare to launch our own product offerings, we’re rapidly growing our Toronto and Singapore-based (but remote friendly) design teams.

As a fast-growing startup, working at Airfoil is both exciting and sometimes challenging.
company.teamAbout:
At Airfoil, we believe that your time with us should be helpful to us and to you, and we see your experience here as an opportunity to further your learning and growth as a designer. For these reasons, we will support you in several ways:

- Thorough design critiques and support from our team.
- Access to learning resources and projects. 
- Cross-border experience and training from tech company founders. 

At Airfoil, we are committed to building a safe environment where you will be supported through your professional and personal growth. We are designers second and people first.

name: Founding Operator
description:
We are hiring a Founding Operator at Paraform. We are growing fast and have a lot of customers to manage, from startup to enterprise, and your goal is to make sure they have a 12 star experience.

We also have a lot of incredible recruiters and agencies on our marketplace who need support to do their best work. Your goal is to also make sure they have a 12 star experience.

At Paraform, we are obsessed with making our customers and recruiters happy. You will be working closely with everyone on the team but have full ownership. There will be a lot of complex problem solving and relentless execution involved in this role.

requirements.description: Bachelor's degree at top university
requirements.explanation: If they dropped out to do something important, that's fine too! Good college is not just about 'signaling' to us. It's an efficient way to screen for aptitude and work ethic (Ivy League, Stanford, Berkeley, CMU, MIT etc). After talking to many candidates, this seems to be the biggest indicator of aptitude

requirements.description: High Aptitude - they have to be incredibly smart
requirements.explanation:
A lot of signs of this like doing exceptional things and top schools

Screening call with you should be really interesting and not generic

requirements.description: Actively want this kind of role
requirements.explanation: Wants to join a startup and be a founding member. Should expect to work long hours, intensely, while making a huge impact.

requirements.description: ex-startup founder
High energy and genuine interest and excitement about Paraform
requirements.explanation: After some interviews, we've seen some candidates just not have high energy and weren't too excited about our product. The number 1 sign of not being genuinely interested is saying generic stuff about us 'ohh I love the talent space', 'recruiting is broken', 'I've always been interested in recruiting since applying to job as a college grad' are probably immediate red flags to us

requirements.description: Proactive personality. Revenue/growth oriented
requirements.explanation: If they seem like they will only do what's told, that's not a fit. They have to be very proactive and take initiative. Please screen for this!

requirements.description: Have previously done something undeniably exceptional or there is something really interesting/rare about the candidate
requirements.explanation: Essentially have spiked in something. E.g. they made a short film in high school that won an Emmy or they made $100k managing Minecraft servers etc

responsibilities: Onboarding Customers: You will help hiring managers seamlessly onboard to Paraform and make sure they are setting themselves up for success
Customer Relationship Management: You will forge strong relationships with customers, understand their needs, and ensure our products/services are meeting those needs.
Recruiter Success: You will help recruiters on our platform match with the best possible searches (open roles) and help with anything that will allow them to do their best work.
Customer / Recruiter Support: You will help unblock users on both sides of the marketplace both proactively (self-identify based on our standards) and reactively (Slack and Intercom messages)

Marketplace Operations: There are a lot of operations involved to running our fast-growing marketplace, and operations work can include but not limited to payments, quality control, recruiter application review etc
workPlaceText: We have a beautiful office in San Francisco (North Beach) where we all work in person!
visa_text_more: Unfortunately can't sponsor visa for this role
experience_info: doing generalist operations at a top early stage fast growing B2B startup
recruiting_advice:
Our ratio is looking quite sad at the moment, and want to commit to hiring more female team members moving forward! Merit is most important of course but just want to actively make an effort

In screening calls, please screen for:

  • Are they very likeable

    • This is a very relationship heavy role.

  • It it clear that they mean business? Are they serious and relentless?

    • This does not necessarily contrast with the first bullet point. We are looking for likeable + serious/relentless type folks

  • is it clear that they're extremely smart?

    • very clear communication

    • very good problem solving sense

    • please avoid people who just say generic stuff

  • olympian work ethic - is it clear from their previous track record that they work exceptionally hard?

  • bottomless energy = consistency - are they energetic is it clear from their previous track record that they are a consistent performer?

  • high ambition - what is their goal? why is it clear that they want to achieve something exceptional?

  • curiosity and open-mindedness
avoid_traits: Paraform is not the right place for folks looking for work-life balance at this stage. Our team is 5-6 days in person at our office and work long hours. Typically our team works 8am - 10pm weekdays and on weekends on a more relaxed schedule either 8 hrs on either Saturday or Sunday or 4 hrs each day rough estimate. Founders work 8am - 1am weekdays and roughly 8-10 hrs on the weekend. We're looking for someone to match or exceed this work ethic
Energy-takers. We're looking for people who energizes the team, not take away time and energy away
Passive personality. Please avoid people who only do what they are told. We need proactive self-starters

Easily satisfied / low standards: we need people who have an exceptionally high bar for what 'excellent' looks like. E.g. even if our customer says they are happy with the quality of candidates, we have to doubt it and ask ourselves 'really? that's not good enough, how can we make sure they have an even better experience'. Same is true for recruiters

company.name: Paraform
company.description:
Paraform is a marketplace connecting companies with open roles and recruiters who can fill them.

Companies can work with specialized recruiters more cheaply, monitor their performance, and flex based on demand. Recruiters don't have to worry about acquiring clients while earning and working on their own terms.

Incredible teams at the most exciting startups and enterprises are being built as a result.

We power talent for a wide range of customers:

  • Enterprise - Palantir, Anduril, Scale AI

  • Growth stage - Eight Sleep, Character.ai, Applied Intuition

  • Early stage - Mintlify, Jenni.ai, Decagon.ai

We've raised money from:

  • Co-founders - Twitch, Doordash, and Eventbrite

  • VCs - A*, Soma Capital, Founders Inc, and Primer Sazze

  • Leadership - Palantir, Opendoor, Ramp, and Scale AI

Other highlights:

  • GMV/Revenue increasing 50% MoM

  • We just moved into a beautiful new office in North Beach. Check out video of it here
benefits: 🌉 Beautiful office with golden gate bridge view at the Fort Mason Center in San Francisco. Moving to North Beach soon and we think it's even better :)
🌏 Company Offsites (NY, LA, Sydney, Seoul etc)
company.teamAbout:
Hey 👋 we're John and Jeff, the co-founders of Paraform. Funnily enough, this all started when we tried to recruit each other in 2022. Ever since then, we've experienced first-hand how broken recruiting is and our mission is to finally fix it.

Our values and culture

  • We work hard and enjoy being together in person. We are transparent about our work ethic and expectations because it enables us to have extreme ownership in building at a pace that is unmatched.

  • Customers, customers, customers. We're customer-obsessed and always start with the customer first. We are the customer support team.

  • Ship fast and break things. We believe great products come from lots of experimentation, so we value fast development. No one is going to wait around for us to make things, especially something that's perfect.

  • Take care of each other. We trust each other and want to enable everyone to do their best work. That means an all food and transportation compensated, gym membership, unlimited PTO, global offsites, premium healthcare and a free bike.

name: Senior Software Engineer
description: As a Senior Engineer at Lantern, you will play a pivotal role in architecting and developing our data and AI platform. You'll work closely with cross-functional teams to drive technical excellence, innovation, and scalability. This role requires a blend of deep technical expertise, strategic thinking, and the ability to mentor and lead other engineers. You'll be instrumental in shaping our product roadmap and ensuring our technology aligns with evolving customer needs and market demands.

requirements.description: Experience with modern software development practices, including CI/CD, infrastructure as code, and microservices architecture
Extensive experience with cloud technologies (AWS, GCP, or Azure), scaling data intensive applications, and distributed systems
Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to think critically about technical and business challenges
Deep understanding of data processing frameworks (e.g., Apache Spark, Kafka) and ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch)
Proven track record of leading complex technical projects and mentoring other engineers
Able to work 4 days a week in our NYC office
Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical audiences

responsibilities: Architect and design scalable, high-performance systems for our data and AI platform
Lead the development of core platform features, with a focus on machine learning and data processing capabilities
Collaborate with product managers and other stakeholders to translate business requirements into technical specifications
Provide technical mentorship to other engineers and contribute to the overall growth of the engineering team
Stay at the forefront of AI/ML technologies and industry trends, continuously evaluating new technologies for potential integration
Drive innovation by proposing and prototyping new features or improvements to our existing platform
Contribute to the company's intellectual property through patents or research papers when appropriate
Work closely with the Forward Deployed Engineering (FDE) team to ensure smooth implementation and adoption of new features
Collaborate with the sales and customer success teams to understand customer needs and provide technical solutions
Partner with the GTM team to develop and refine technical narratives for our product offerings
Design and implement systems that can handle large-scale data processing and real-time AI operations
Optimize platform performance, ensuring high availability and reliability for our customers
Develop and maintain robust monitoring and alerting systems to proactively address potential issues
workPlaceText: On-site in NY
experience_info: in software engineering, with a focus on data-intensive and AI/ML systems
recruiting_advice:
• 4 days/week in office

  • have worked at startups less than 100 people

  • former founders

  • data intensive applications
avoid_traits: Job hopping

company.name: Lantern
company.description:
Lantern is a cutting-edge Data + AI platform that empowers revenue teams to accelerate pipeline creation and streamline operations. Our mission is to empower sales and marketing teams by spotlighting customer and prospect signals, such as when a champion changes jobs. We identify insights from over 30+ tools used by your customers and target accounts, seamlessly integrating those account changes directly into your workflows and internal processes.

With our recent Series A funding, we're poised for exciting growth and continued innovation in the revenue operations space!
company.teamAbout:
Why Lantern?

  • Impact: Opportunity to shape the future of revenue operations through cutting-edge AI technology

  • Innovation: Work on challenging problems at the intersection of big data, machine learning, and business intelligence

  • Growth: Join a rapidly growing company with recent Series A funding and significant market potential

  • Collaboration: Work closely with a talented team of engineers, data scientists, and business leaders

name: Software Engineer (Recent Grad)
description: We're looking for highly talented recent grads in the US and Canada to join our team. They should know Django and have a strong academic background and some interesting projects under their belt. We don't have a specific opening for these candidates, but will route them within our team depending on their strengths.

requirements.description: CS degree from a top-tier university (Waterloo, Berkeley, CMU, MIT etc)
High degree of self-accountability and drive
Strong knowlege of Django

workPlaceText: Remote in US or Canada
visa_text_more: US or Canadian Citizens preferred
experience_info: in fullstack engineering, backend leaning
avoid_traits: Someone looking for WLB. Please see my explanation for further details.

company.name: Aktos
company.description:
Debt Collectors play an overlooked yet integral part of our financial ecosystem. They help Consumers settle their debts and improve their credit scores— granting them clean states to start over. Collectors help critical businesses like doctor's offices and local governments, who deal with high payment default risk, secure their revenue streams and ensure their continued survival.

In truth, Collectors have incredibly interesting, multi-faceted jobs. They are often one part sales person, one part therapist, and one part detective in their mission to recover funds. At Aktos, we are building a modern software platform that caters to Collectors' unique workflows, and make the credit recovery process a more positive experience for all parties.
benefits: Competitive salary with employee stock options, bonus and access to a 401K
company.productDescription: The Aktos product is a system of record, and core workflow software, for debt collection agencies. It is structured like a CRM, but it keeps track of delinquent accounts a collection agency is working instead of sales leads. There is a heavy fintech component as well, as we do multiple payment processor integrations.
company.teamAbout: Aktos was founded by seasoned Product and Engineering leaders who have worked at companies such as Zenefits, TikTok, Meta, LinkedIn, Google, Apple, Amazon, WeWork, Flatiron Health (acquired by Booking.com). We are experts at building, launching, and scaling word-class software platforms— rest assured, if you join us you will be working with and learning from the best.

name: Founding Field Marketer
description:
Pylon is a Customer Support Platform optimized for B2B companies. We've created a full ticketing system allowing you to track customer issues across Slack Connect, Email, Microsoft Teams, In-App Chat, and Tickets. We’re a 14 person, Series A startup, located in-person in San Francisco, and are hiring a Founding Field Marketer to join our team.

The goal of this role (and our recently hired Growth Marketer) is to generate pipeline from new sources. Our Founding Field Marketer will be solely focused on organizing and attending physical and digital events. We’ll be treating each type of event as an experiment and doing our best to track conversion to demo calls.

Sample events to organize:

  • Private dinners for Support Leaders (e.g. VPs of Support, Directors, etc.)

  • Monthly in-person meetups for folks that work in Customer Support and related roles (CS San Francisco Monthly Meetups are a great adjacent example of this)

  • Webinars with customer support leaders

  • The first Pylon conference

Sample events for us to start attending:

  • Support Driven Conferences

  • Customer Contact Week

  • SaaStr

requirements.description: Be in San Francisco
Be a people person
Be excited about traveling for events
Excited about working in-person (5 days/week)

responsibilities: Generate pipeline from new sources.
Organize and attend physical and digital events.
Host dinners for Support Leaders (e.g. VPs of Support, Directors, etc.).
Host webinars with customer support leaders.
Host the first Pylon conference.
Attend support and B2B SaaS events.
workPlaceText: On-site in SF
experience_info: working at a B2B SaaS company (Series A-D) in an event/field marketing role
recruiting_advice:
• Come off as incredible competent

  • Wants to get their hands dirty (not manage people)

  • Excited about in-person

  • Should be a people person
avoid_traits: Prioritizing work-life balance
Job hopping
Wants hybrid work
Doesn't want to do boots on the ground work

company.name: Pylon
company.description:
Pylon is a Series A startup backed by Y Combinator, General Catalyst, and another unannounced Tier 1 investor building the next-generation support system.

We replace products like Salesforce Service Cloud ($7.3B/yr) and Zendesk ($2.9B/yr).

Pylon helps B2B companies manage their customers across the different places they talk to them - shared Slack channels, Microsoft Teams, email, in-app chat, Slack communities, and more. Hundreds of fast-growing companies of all sizes like Mintlify, Hightouch, and Deel use Pylon to track customer conversations across slack/teams/email/in-app/community, resolve customer issues quickly, and keep customers engaged.
company.productDescription: Pylon is a Customer Support Platform. It tracks customer support issues and most often replaces products like Zendesk, Intercom, and Salesforce Service Cloud.
company.teamAbout:
We're a high-energy, ambitious team that want to build the biggest SaaS company in the world.

We work extremely hard and founder salaries are directly tied to company success. The founders started off making $35k/yr and only make $75k/yr today, and live in the office (literally living in conference rooms).

  • Team of 12

  • Backed by Y Combinator, General Catalyst, and an unannounced T1 investor that just led our Series A

  • Team has worked at Airbnb, Samsara, Discord, Affinity

  • Half the team went to MIT and Caltech

  • Located in-person in San Francisco (near the SF Caltrain Station)

  • Cash-flow positive

name: Staff Fullstack Engineer
description:
Aktos is looking for a Staff Fullstack Engineer!

This person should have 5-8 YOE, know Django, and have some FE experience (they will be 80% backend, 20% FE).

This is a pivotal role aimed at building the Operating System for the $18B Credit Collections industry. This position is designed for an engineer with a lean towards backend development (80/20), who is comfortable working across the entire tech stack.

Our Senior Fullstack Engineer will collaborate with our CEO, CTO, and other engineers to develop full-stack features and improvements, refine the SDLC & CI/CD pipelines, and maintain the AWS infrastructure. This position is for those who are comfortable with autonomy, ownership, and have a strong work ethic, with a passion for delivering high-quality code and making sound UX decisions.

requirements.description: Professional experience with JavaScript (React/Redux experience preferred)
Strong fundamental understanding and usage of a RDBMS (Postgres preferred)
Previous experience worked at a top seed-stage or early stage VC-backed startup for at least 2 years.
requirements.explanation: We want someone who understands the hustle at early stage startups.

requirements.description: In-depth knowledge and hands on experience with AWS (Terraform experience preferred)
Experience doing payments integration (e.g Stripe, Paypal, Braintree, etc)
Backend-leaning experience - this role will be 80% backend, 20% frontend

responsibilities: Work across the entire stack using cutting edge frameworks, tools, and own execution.
Refine the SDLC & CI/CD pipelines.
Maintaining our AWS infrastructure.
API/SFTP integrations at scale.
experience_info:
- 5+ years of python exp, AND at least 2+ years of Django experience. Our backend is Python Django, and there are some quirks with Django, so a fundamental understanding will be important.
- Try to look for 2017 graduation or earlier, assuming no career breaks for grad school, etc.
recruiting_advice:
Focus mainly on Canada, but open to US or offshore (LATAM, EMEA, etc.) as well

Please assess for these traits when screening candidates, it will help us a lot:

  • Candidate must have done a payment integration before (e.g Stripe, Braintree, Paypal)

  • If the candidate is specifically looking for work-life balance, please filter them out in the intro call. I typically mention people work at least 50-60 hours a week here.

  • Someone who is comfortable with autonomy, ownership and responsibility

  • Someone who cares more about getting it right, than being right. They love learning, asking questions and are comfortable asking for help when they get stuck

  • Jack-of-all trades; Expert in one - Someone who can do anything from optimizing SQL query to writing maintainable CSS and everything in between, but they still have a preferred part of the stack and are comfortable with full-stack

  • They must have previously worked at a notable tech company (e.g. Amazon, Meta, Airbnb, Stripe, etc). No Microsoft/Twitch employees.
avoid_traits: No Microsoft employees.
Someone looking for WLB. Please see my explanation for further details.
tech_stack: DevOps - Docker, Github Actions, Terraform, AWS, Kubernetes, Helm, Redis

name: Staff Platform Engineer
description:
Aktos is hiring a Platform Engineer for our team!

As we build the foundation for SRE at Aktos, this person will play a critical role in shaping our infrastructure and operational excellence in addition to being a full backend software engineer. Leveraging battle-tested technologies such as Kubernetes, Postgres, and AWS, they will go beyond managing infrastructure to build tools that enable our engineers to create performant, scalable, and resilient applications. However, since we are a small team, we will expect them to be a fully functioning backend software engineer as well. They will be 20% SRE and 80% backend engineer (they need to be able to do backend feature work and integrations).

Who You Are

Backend Engineer Expertise:

  • Python/Django (Django required)

  • Python + DB Performance optimization [Required]

  • API / SFTP Integrations (must have experience)

  • Feature Development experience

DevOps/SRE Expertise:

  • Will need to be comfortable with AWS, Maintaining EKS (Kubernetes on AWS).

DevOps/SRE Skills:

  • Docker, Kubernetes, Helm, Terraform, Github Actions, AWS, Postgres, Redis.

  • They don't need to have DevOps/SRE title, but from their resume they should have some of the DevOps keywords listed right above

    • A lot of early startups don't have dedicated SREs but a senior BE architect/engineer is usually responsible for the DevOps work

Comfortable with:

  • Scalable & Maintainable Backend Feature Development [Experience is Required]

  • Scalable & Maintainable API/SFTP Integrations [Experience is Required]

  • Monitoring and troubleshooting Postgres DB (adding/removing indexes, partitioning/sharding)

  • Maintaining developer environments.

  • Managing CI pipelines and runners.

  • Setting up and managing alerting systems.

  • Providing on-call support and guidance to other developers to triage issues.

Impact and Expectations:

  • Contribute to key performance indicators (KPIs) such as system uptime, performance metrics, and compliance standards.

  • Make a significant impact within the first 6-12 months by leading initiatives to improve infrastructure and operational practices.

requirements.description: Professional experience with containers (Docker, etc) (5+ years required)
Professional experience with AWS (5+ years required)
Strong fundamental understanding and usage of a RDBMS [Postgres preferred]
In-depth knowledge and hands on experience with monitoring solutions [Prometheus, Loki, DataDog, Sentry, etc]
Strong work ethic, end-to-end ownership mentality
Backend Python/Django experience

responsibilities: Conduct performance testing and database health & tuning.
Maintain and enhance our Kubernetes clusters.
Improve monitoring systems and update alerts.
Automate deployments and developer environments.
Explore and implement CI/CD options.
Maintain developer environments and CI pipelines.
Provide on-call support to ensure system reliability and performance. (On-call rotations are designed to be fair and prevent burnout).
Perform backend feature work and integrations using Python/Django
Database Tuning/Monitoring (e.g adding/removing indexes, partitioning, sharding)
Introducing/Training the usage of technologies used for scaling (e.g DynamoDB, Redis, ElasticSearch)
workPlaceText: We're looking for candidates in US and Canada. They must work PST/EST hours/timezones.
visa_text_more: US or Canadian Citizens preferred
experience_info: in DevOps. They don't need to have DevOps/SRE title, if they're a BE software engineer with some indicator that they were responsible for devops at their company, that's fine.
recruiting_advice:
We're looking for candidates with startup mentality who has strong staff level experience in both Backend Software Engineering AND SRE/DevOps experience.

We are NOT looking for pure SRE/DevOps engineers who do not have backend/fullstack experience. There is not enough work for that. This person should be able to diagnose / monitor Database performance bottlenecks, identify/recommend different technologies (Dynamo, ElasticSearch) to optimize performance.

This role is extremely hands-on, so middle managers (esp non-coding) will not be considered.
avoid_traits: No Microsoft employees.
Someone looking for WLB. Please see my explanation for further details.
Avoid people with ONLY big tech experience
Avoid people without early stage startup experience (must have experience at VC-backed high growth startups, not "small software companies") preferable early like Seed-Series B
Folks who do not want a very hands-on role
tech_stack: DevOps - Docker, Github Actions, Terraform, AWS, Kubernetes, Helm, Redis

name: Growth Marketing Manager - Higher Education
description:
At Echo Labs, we're on a mission to revolutionize the transcription industry with the development of the first AI capable of human-level captioning. As a foundational tech company operating in the higher education space as well as other verticals, we believe that the first step to creating a more accessible world is to reshape the way transcription services are delivered.

We're seeking an experienced marketing professional to drive growth and visibility for our organization within the higher education sector. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience and connections in higher education, with a proven track record of creating engaging content and securing high-profile speaking opportunities.

requirements.description: Experience using data to optimize marketing strategies and campaigns.
Experience working across multiple acquisition channels, and ability to think critically about engaging with each.
Familiarity with acquisition analysis and A/B testing.
Located in San Francisco and excited about working in-person.
Proven track record of securing industry (higher ed) relevant speaking engagements, publications, events, etc.
Strong network of contacts within the higher education space
Experience with marketing in the context of higher education

responsibilities: Be the sole marketing/PR team
Creator of all content specific to higher ed (web, newsletter, webinars, etc)
Secure placements in reputable higher education publications
Obtain speaker slots at relevant conferences and industry events
Proficiency in LinkedIn marketing and community engagement
workPlaceText: On-site 5 days a week in San Francisco
experience_info: - we don't necessarily need someone who has had years of direct experience leading teams. We really need someone who's been in there working, making it happen.
recruiting_advice: We're really looking for someone who can get in there and "shovel dirt" with us. We're a scrappy team that gets it done no matter what! This person will really need to be a jack of all trades when it comes to growth marketing. PR/SEO/Growth/Creative/Event Planning/Videos, you name it!
avoid_traits: someone who wants to spend a lot of money outsourcing their job to contractors or others.

company.name: Echo Labs
company.description:
At Echo Labs, we're on a mission to make education accessible to everyone, and we believe that starts with making accessibility itself financially accessible. Founded just a year ago with the support of leading educational institutions and d/Deaf and hard-of-hearing NGOs, our team has been driven by a passion for breaking down barriers and creating inclusive learning environments.

Our groundbreaking Echo Labs Captioning Platform has been turning heads in the tech world, hailed as the first solution capable of delivering ADA-compliant, >99% accurate closed captions at a fraction of the cost of traditional methods. The overwhelmingly positive response to our launch led to a record-breaking pre-seed raise of $7.4 million, empowering us to bring our accessibility solutions to universities and colleges worldwide.
company.teamAbout: A young and enthusiastic team who cares and wants to make a difference. Everyone is willing to go the extra mile and be scrappy.

name: Sr. Full Stack Engineer
description:
At Echo Labs, we're on a mission to revolutionize the transcription industry with the development of the first AI capable of human-level captioning. As a foundational tech company operating in the higher education space as well as other verticals, we believe that the first step to creating a more accessible world is to reshape the way transcription services are delivered.

We're looking for 3-4 passionate, ambitious, and confident Sr. Engineers who want to challenge themselves in a fast-paced, high-growth work environment. Ideal candidates enjoy connecting with people and thrive in a high-performance team with high expectations. They are keen to take on a challenge and looking to take their career to the next level. Working with us, you will personally have the opportunity to contribute to reducing the cost of transcription and improving accessibility worldwide.

As an Engineer on our team, you will be empowering universities, LMS, and VMS systems to embrace our innovative AI technology, making transcription services more accurate and affordable.

requirements.description: Proven experience as a Full Stack Engineer, with a strong proficiency in Node.js for backend development.
Solid understanding of web technologies such as HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and responsive design principles.
Demonstrated expertise in integrating web applications with external APIs and third-party systems, particularly Learning Management Systems (LMS).
Experience with database technologies such as SQL databases (e.g. Postgres).
Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform.
Strong problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
Excellent communication skills and ability to effectively articulate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent work experience.
Contributions to open-source projects or active participation in developer communities.
Prior experience participating in engineering competition teams.

responsibilities: Design, develop, and maintain robust, scalable, and high-performance web applications using Node.js and SvelteKit.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, and deliver high-quality software solutions.
Integrate our platform with various Learning Management Systems (LMS) used in higher education institutions, ensuring seamless data exchange and functionality.
Implement responsive and intuitive user interfaces that prioritize user experience and accessibility.
Optimize application performance and security, identify and address bottlenecks, and troubleshoot issues as they arise.
Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies, best practices, and industry trends, and actively contribute to the technical roadmap and architecture decisions.
Excellent understanding of the entire web development process (design, development, and deployment) and application lifecycle
You will work closely with other engineers to design architecture, develop new features, ensure system consistency, and improve user experience.
