company.description:
At Echo Labs, we're on a mission to make education accessible to everyone, and we believe that starts with making accessibility itself financially accessible. Founded just a year ago with the support of leading educational institutions and d/Deaf and hard-of-hearing NGOs, our team has been driven by a passion for breaking down barriers and creating inclusive learning environments.

Our groundbreaking Echo Labs Captioning Platform has been turning heads in the tech world, hailed as the first solution capable of delivering ADA-compliant, >99% accurate closed captions at a fraction of the cost of traditional methods. The overwhelmingly positive response to our launch led to a record-breaking pre-seed raise of $7.4 million, empowering us to bring our accessibility solutions to universities and colleges worldwide.

company.name: Orb
company.description:
Mission

Orb is on an ambitious mission to provide every business with the infrastructure to unlock their revenue. Best-in class businesses find ways to effectively align their monetization to product usage—whether that's through seats, consumption, feature limits, or usage-based tiers. Orb brings that opportunity to every software company.

We are reimagining billing and invoicing for this era of hybrid pricing in software. Billing is no longer just a finance problem, but also a high-stakes engineering observability problem that customers urgently need solved. At Orb, we take a developer-first, data infrastructure approach to this problem. We make it possible for companies to fully automate their current billing process, and to evolve their monetization strategy over time.

Orb supports the end-to-end workflow for revenue: developers love our product’s extensibility and intuitive API, product managers become empowered to iterate on pricing and packaging much faster, finance teams get fine-grained reporting to facilitate revenue recognition, and customer-facing teams benefit from the transparency Orb brings to the customer relationship.
benefits: Medical insurance - 100% coverage for you and dependents
Unlimited PTO, with 15 days minimum encouraged
16-week paid parental leave with equity vesting
company.teamAbout:
About Us

Our founding team has experience from companies like Stripe, Asana, Plaid, Cloudflare, and Autodesk. We’ve raised $19.1 million in funding from top-tier investors like Menlo Ventures, Greylock, base case, South Park Commons, and Scribble, as well as founders and operators from companies like Vercel, Plaid, Datadog, Notion, Asana, HubSpot, and more.

Working at Orb

When you meet our team, you’ll see we’re a group of dedicated and kind individuals who care deeply about solving what is one of the most mission-critical problems for any business.

Every one of us has outsized impact on the business, our product, and our customers—we hold ourselves to a standard of excellence, with the empowerment to take risks and the judgment to focus our time on maximizing leverage.

We are not a culture of long hours, but we approach our work with intensity and a sense of urgency. With a product like ours, minutes matter: we can help accelerate other businesses tremendously if we’re focused on building quickly while maintaining critical attention to detail. When we’re ‘on’, we’re on; we work hard, then we go home.

We will focus on setting you up for success, with the right expectations and enablement. We coach on outcomes, not inputs or style. We show up for each other with kindness, which earns us the ability to have difficult conversations with trust by default and openness to feedback.

As a growing organization, we value in-person collaboration. We see it as a way to achieve our mission faster, in an environment of rapid ideation, strong alignment, and that energy that makes work more fun.

name: Software Engineer
description:
We’re looking for passionate engineers who are excited to make a big impact in a small team.

At Grit, we believe there is a better way: we’re building AI bots that automatically maintain software through a combination of static analysis, our own query language, and machine learning.

Why you should join us

  • Build a meaningful product to solve a tangible problem for companies.

  • Ownership in all senses of the word: significant equity upside, direct impact on product vision, and contact with users.

  • Solve your own problems. We dogfood our own product and you can build the ideal developer experience as you work.

  • Explore frontiers in programming languages and machine learning.

  • We have a long runway and can offer a competitive base salary ($150-250k).

What is the day-to-day routine?

We are all makers and leave lots of protected time for deep work. Most engineers have a maximum of 3 meetings a week and spend most of the time researching and coding.

Instead of having stand-ups, we have a strong culture of committing work in progress (supported by feature flags). Every engineer is expected to push a daily pull request with their incremental progress.

name: Growth Manager
description: As a Growth Manager (Paid Social Media Buyer) at TubeScience, you'll have the autonomy to decide how to use TubeScience resources in order to maximize return on investment, for both the company and clients alike! You'll work with clients ranging from late-stage startups to publicly traded companies representing a wide variety of industry verticals who rely on performance marketing for their success. You ‘ll work with cross-functional team members to efficiently grow clients’ businesses by optimizing campaigns across media platforms and resolving blockers to achieve shared goals.

Strong communication with internal and external stakeholders. Inclusive client and management skills.

Strong quantitative reasoning and data analysis capabilities with a proficiency in excel.

Bachelor’s degree or higher from a highly selective university, with a preference for a degree in a technical field such as Engineering, Math, Physics, Sciences, providing a strong foundation for data analysis and problem-solving.

responsibilities: Media Buying Strategy: Autonomously develop, implement, and manage media buying strategies for TS Paid Social Media campaigns for current clients with focus on Meta

Build Paid Social Campaigns for client execution: Create and implement Paid Social campaigns, focusing on Meta; Utilize your expertise in Paid Social to create and execute strategic campaigns including but not limited to Facebook Ads, Instagram Ads

Campaign Optimization: Continuously monitor and analyze campaign performance metrics to identify areas for improvement and optimization for clients to execute on. Make data-driven decisions to enhance click-through rates (CTR), conversion rates, and overall return on ad spend (ROAS) while reducing customer acquisition cost (CAC).
Budget Management: Efficiently allocate budgets across campaigns and ad groups to maximize ROI and achieve clients' desired outcomes.
Reporting and Analytics: Generate regular reports on campaign performance, providing actionable insights and recommendations to clients and internal stakeholders.

Client Management: Leading Biweekly Client Calls, Running Internal Team Bi-weekly Client Strategy Calls, Reporting back on creative direct response ad tests,  insights and analytics to inform the creative team for new ad creative. Additionally providing frequent and timely client updates to Internal Teams (TS Pods/ Client Groups)
Media Buying Expertise:  Able to serve as the subject matter expert on social media buying (emphasis on Meta) to advise and enhance clients revenue portfolio to expand clients growth potential.
workPlaceText: In person 1-2 days per week in stunning Los Angeles Arts District office (next to Spotify, Warner, SoHo House, Honey).
experience_info: in digital advertising (inclusive of experience in direct response marketing).
recruiting_advice:
We are seeking a highly skilled Growth Manager with a strong background in digital advertising, particularly in managing large-scale Meta Ad campaigns. The ideal candidate will have 3+ years of experience in direct response marketing, with a proven track record of leading and optimizing Facebook Ad programs with budgets exceeding $1 million per month. They should possess expert knowledge of Meta Ads Manager, strong quantitative reasoning, and exceptional data analysis capabilities. Additionally, they must demonstrate strong communication skills, both in client-facing and internal team interactions, and have the organizational prowess to manage multiple high-profile clients simultaneously.

When sourcing candidates, focus on those with experience in high-growth digital marketing roles, particularly at leading agencies or in-house growth marketing positions at large DTC advertisers. Candidates with a consulting background at firms like BCG Digital Ventures or Accenture are also strong fits. Ideal candidates will exhibit high GMA, high EQ, strong problem-solving abilities, and a goal-oriented mindset. They should be able to navigate complex challenges, learn quickly, and maintain strong client relationships. Specific roles to target include Senior Media Buyer, Paid Social Manager, Growth Marketing Manager, and Account Manager, among others.

We seek individuals who are results-oriented, take pride in building best-in-class teams, possess a low ego, and are eager to learn and grow continuously.
avoid_traits: Poor Communication Skills: Since this role is client-facing and involves managing relationships with high-profile clients, it’s crucial to avoid candidates who struggle with clear, concise, and effective communication. This includes both verbal and written communication, as they will need to convey complex data insights and strategies to clients and internal teams. Additionally, avoid candidates who are not personable or lack the ability to "warm the room," as building trust and rapport with clients, especially in remote meetings, is essential for long-term success.

9-to-5 Mentality: Candidates who exhibit a 9-to-5 mentality, focusing solely on clocking in and out rather than going the extra mile to achieve results, are not a good fit. The Growth Manager role demands a commitment to meeting client needs, which may require flexibility and dedication beyond standard working hours.

Freelancer/Consultant Juggling Multiple Clients: Avoid candidates who are currently working as media buying consultants or freelancers managing a large number of clients, who may struggle to give attention to the workload required for this role. The Growth Manager position demands full dedication and focus to drive high-impact results.

Lack of Client Management Experience: The role requires strong client management skills, including the ability to handle client objections, navigate challenges, and deliver value in a competitive environment.

Poor Organizational Skills: Avoid candidates who have demonstrated poor organizational skills or a tendency to miss deadlines. The Growth Manager will need to juggle multiple clients, campaigns, and internal team communications, requiring excellent time management and prioritization abilities.

Hands-Off Approach: Avoid candidates who lack direct, hands-on experience with media buying, particularly on Meta platforms. This role requires someone who can roll up their sleeves and manage campaigns from start to finish, not just oversee or delegate.

Externalized Locus of Control: Avoid candidates who blame others for failures or challenges, rather than taking responsibility, should be avoided. The Growth Manager needs to own their decisions and outcomes, especially in a role where accountability is key to client success.

Integrity/Character Red Flags: Avoid candidates who demonstrate questionable integrity or character, such as sharing confidential information, speaking poorly of others, or showing a lack of professionalism.

Markers of Low GMA: Avoid candidates who struggle to explain complex ideas clearly or have difficulty mastering new skills. The role requires someone with high cognitive ability, capable of quickly understanding and optimizing complex campaigns.
Overconfidence without Results: Avoid candidates who are overly confident without the track record to back it up (delivering measurable results).

Disinterest in Ongoing Learning: The digital marketing landscape, especially in paid social, evolves rapidly. Candidates who show little interest in staying updated with the latest trends, tools, and best practices would not be suitable for this role.
benefits: 100% Paid Parental Leave up to 12 weeks for new parents
tech_stack: TikTok Ads Manager, YouTube Ads Manager, Snapchat Ads Manager (nice to have)

company.name: TubeScience
company.description:
Over the past 8 years, we quietly bootstrapped TubeScience into the largest producer of social media ads in the USA. While our public profile is minimal (ironically, we don’t do any self-marketing), we have hundreds of employees, billions of dollars in ad spend, and deep technical partnerships with Meta and other platforms. 

What helped us do so is an obsession for numbers over opinions, and a unique “pay for performance” business model. Clients only pay if our ads outperform anything they or any other agency delivers. It’s a very “honest” business model, and clients tend to love it (resulting in extremely high retention and all our sales to date coming from inbound / word of mouth). 

As we look towards the future and AI advances, we see an incredible opportunity to reinvent our business. We plan to take everything we’ve learned, and turn it into a true self-service SaaS offering that can power agencies and in-house teams alike.
benefits: Be part of a passionate, entrepreneurial team that is driven to succeed and working on a high impact problem.
A unique opportunity to shape a team from the ground up.

company.name: Tennr
company.description:
Today, when you go to your doctor and need to be referred to a specialist (e.g., for sleep apnea), your doctor sends a fax (yes, in 2024, 90% of provider-provider communication is a 1980s fax). These are often converted into 20+ page PDFs, with handwritten (doctor’s handwriting!) notes, in thousands of different formats. The problem is so complex that a person has to read it, type it up, and manually enter your information. Tennr built RaeLLM™ (7B—trained on 3M+ documents) to read these docs, talk to your doc to ensure nothing is missed, and text you to help schedule your appointment so you can get better, faster.

Tennr is a NYC-based tech company that launched out of Y-Combinator and is backed by Andreesen Horowitz, Foundation Capital, The New Normal Fund, and other top investors.
company.teamAbout: Our founding team began working together studying at the bleeding edge of AI and LLMs at Stanford, combined with a team of experts with decades in the healthcare space.

By automating revenue cycle management, we enhance financial transparency and support small business owner dentists, ultimately making dental care more efficient, affordable, and understandable for patients.

Anton Lin, Co-Founder, CTO:

name: Fullstack AI Engineer
description: We're on the hunt for talented, high-caliber individuals who live on the bleeding edge of AI technology. As part of our team, you'll play a pivotal role in restoring joy to medicine while pushing the boundaries of what's possible with AI. Our engineering culture emphasizes speed, end-to-end ownership, responsibility, and independence, attracting top-tier talent and promoting exceptional performance.

requirements.description: 2-3 years in AI engineering
A history of consistent top performance and a desire for a mission-driven work culture
Familiarity with using AI for development (e.g. Copilot, ChatGPT, Cursor)
Desire to work across the stack on AI features, including frontend, backend, and interactions with LLM and ML models
Familiarity with our tech stack is preferred, including React, TypeScript, NodeJS, Azure and SQL
Location within Pacific, Mountain, or Central time zone
Experience in Big Tech and a Startup
Prior experience with evaluations of ML or LLM-based product features, prompt engineering, agent-based approaches, and fine-tuning

responsibilities: Take ownership of product features and drive implementation across the components of our software stack.
Adapt the latest AI models (language and speech) and techniques to our use case.
Collaborate with team members in a fully remote work environment.
Design experiments to validate product changes and ensure the highest quality of our software.
Have a passion for our mission and dedication to making a positive impact on the healthcare industry.
workPlaceText: Remote (Pacific, Mountain, or Central Time Zones)
visa_text_more: Only for the strongest candidates
experience_info: Full-time Software Engineering
recruiting_advice:
Both cofounders are Ex-Meta engineers. It's a move fast and break things culture and we're looking for someone familiar with that environment.

Note: The hire reward for our roles is 14% of the candidate's first year salary, but with a cap at $29400. Thanks!

company.name: Freed
company.description:
Doctors are overworked, burnt out, and are quitting in masses.

At Freed, we combine clinician love with the latest AI tech and intense execution to create products that make clinicians happier.

Our first product is an AI scribe that automates medical documentation.

In 1 year we:

  • Acquired 10,000 paying and loving clinicians and exceeded $11M ARR

  • Generated 70,000 patient notes daily and over 1 million monthly

  • Made thousands of clinicians happier

With the backing of Sequoia, the best VC in the world, we are rapidly expanding our product offering. Patient facing assistant, patient insights, EHR integrations, and other products are being built and used by thousands of clinicians and millions of patients.

We are looking for entrepreneurs. Fast, ambitious, and smart individuals who want to take care of the people who take care of our health.

Expect intense, clinician-focused, and interesting co-workers who want to win.

name: Onboarding Manager
description:
Tofu is looking for a proactive, fast-moving, and empathetic Customer Onboarding Manager that will work closely with our customers during the first few months as they onboard to Tofu. Ideally this person has experience with martech/salestech products and complex SaaS products. You’ll play a critical role in defining many of our GTM decisions including improving and documenting our onboarding process, helping diagnose and resolve technical issues, pilot to annual contract conversion, customer adoption and satisfaction, and translating customer feedback and bugs to the product and engineering teams. We are looking for a doer who loves working closely with customers (and product/eng), who loves getting in the weeds of products, and who can think 2 steps ahead to ensure the customer is successful and sees positive ROI as quickly as possible.

This role will offer high levels of ownership & autonomy, ability to work cross functionally with an extremely high-performing team, leadership skill development, and the opportunity to work within the generative AI software space. Our team is a group of kind, talented (yet very humble) people who move extremely fast, work very hard, and maintain a high level of intensity, but also understand that there is more to life than just work. Our team is all based in the Bay Area and work together in our office 3 days a week (we can move so much faster and build stronger team culture when we co-locate) so we are looking for someone who is based in the Bay Area.

requirements.description: Deep level of customer empathy and patience
Proactive, self-starter with grit that can do what it takes to make the customer successful
requirements.explanation:
• Genuinely curious about what the customer is going through, able to understand nuance of customer goals and help them achieve those things

  • Willingness to understand and learn, use the tool in different ways for each customer

requirements.description: Proven track record of driving customer adoption and success within enterprise SaaS
Strong understanding of customer onboarding best practices, methodologies, and tools
Previous startup experience
Data-driven mindset with attention to detail and documentation
requirements.explanation: Thinking systematically and using data to guide long-term decisions

requirements.description: Exceptional communication, negotiation, and presentation skills
Comfortable with technical concepts (manipulating HTML, reporting bugs, integrations with tools) and working with product/engineering teams

responsibilities: Work directly with each new customer to create their first campaigns and show ROI as quickly as possible
Own and run all customer onboarding (first few months) processes and ultimately make the customer successful by having them actively use Tofu within this period
Work with sales to understand the nuances of each customer and proactively tailor onboarding experiences to the needs of each customer
Perform regular check-ins as well as ad hoc meetings with all new customers to solicit feedback, answer questions, and support product usage during the first few months
Work closely with the product and engineering team to resolve customer issues and bugs that are surfaced by customers
Partner with Sales to narrow and refine ICP and help inform the overall sales process
workPlaceText: In-person 3 days a week in San Mateo
experience_info: in enterprise CSM/AM/Onboarding. Bonus points for people with experience in Marketing/Sales tech.
recruiting_advice:
We are ok working with candidates that are early in their careers, but will work hard and have aptitude to learn/grow.

They must have good communication skills and empathy for the customers.

If they have background in B2B marketing space that will also help them build relationships quickly with the customers.

Ideally has prior startup experience.

A non-traditional approach would be to also look at people that have worked at B2B marketing agencies (as they know the space of our customers) but are willing to work patiently with customers and make them successful (in this case we need to find those that will have good traditional CSM traits)
avoid_traits: Someone that is passive, sloppy and cannot build a relationship with customers
benefits: Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance plans
Extreme opportunities for professional ownership and growth
Highly collaborative and high-performing work environment

Our team is a group of kind, talented (yet very humble) people who move extremely fast, work very hard, and maintain a high level of intensity, but also understand that there is more to life than just work. Our team is all based in the Bay Area and work together in our office 3 days a week (we can move so much faster and build stronger team culture when we co-locate) so we are looking for someone who is based in the Bay Area.

Our founders come from companies like Meta, Google, Twitter and Slack and have deep expertise both in the technical domain (AI/ML/NLP) and the business domain (B2B marketing), so we deeply understand the pain-points of our customers and understand how to apply technology to build a scalable product users love.

Stay up-to-date with emerging front-end technologies and industry trends.
Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to peers.
Contribute to the continuous improvement of development processes and workflows.

company.name: Mage
company.description:
Mage is a consumer platform for creating fun content using Generative AI. Our differentiation is the marketplace-like approach where people can earn with their AI models, Concpets, and Apps while making it incredibly easy for mass consumers to use them. Our vision is to bring fun and inspiration to everyone as a new form of entertainment. 

As a consumer platform, we are passionate about delivering cutting-edge solutions to our users and staying at the forefront of technology. As we continue to expand, we are looking for a talented Front-End Engineer with expertise in React to join our dynamic team.

We proudly embrace being a group of misfits who are on a mission to change the world through the power of storytelling and the freedom of expression. Our unique culture is at the heart of everything we do, and it defines who we are as a company.

company.name: Mandolin
company.description:
Nearly all disease will become treatable in our lifetimes. At the same time, drug discovery is quickly becoming an engineering discipline. There has never been a more exciting time for new biotech research to solve humanity’s most fundamental problems.

At Mandolin, we’re building the “last mile” delivery infrastructure to accelerate this unbounded future of cutting-edge drugs — cell/gene therapies and biologics for Alzheimer’s, cancer, schizophrenia, genetic disorders, amongst many others. Reasoning-adept LLMs uniquely unlock the opportunity to bridge this market gap. We’re starting with an “AI knowledge worker” for clinics administering these drugs, and then partnering with health insurers and pharma companies to bring drug breakthroughs to market at scale.

Ultimately, our mission is to substantial extend all healthy human lifespans by minimizing the time to bring life-changing drugs to patients.

We’re a lean, aggressive team of former founders set on building a new generational incumbent in healthcare. We’ve raised substantial institutional funding from the best healthcare AI investors from firms like SignalFire, Maverick, and Thrive (including first institutional checks into rocketships like Hims&Hers, Ro, Grow Therapy, Cityblock, and Devoted Health).
company.teamAbout:
Mandolin was founded by Will Yin and Rohit Rustagi — Stanford dropouts and second-time exited founders — alongside teammates from Google, Stanford, Genentech, and others.

We’ve found market fit and are building out our founding team very quickly. Reasons to join:

  • We have incredible market pull and are already working closely with some of the largest healthcare providers in the country.

  • We’re solving a difficult technical problem, which unlocks a massive market opportunity and enormous impact once solved.

  • You’ll get to define the future of the company from the ground floor, alongside a world-class team.

  • We work in-person in SF, but we hire from anywhere. We’ll pay to relocate you (including internationally).

name: BizOps (Sharp)
description:
About the Role

This is a founding operations role in a fast growing, revenue-generating company backed by the investors behind Uber, Pinterest, Airbnb, PayPal and Palantir (www.a-star.co).

Reporting to the founder, this is the first non-engineering hire at Sharp, a 25-person AI play for first responders.  The initial product is performance and psychology enhancement, built by a team of ex-Navy-Seals running a high-performing culture based in San Diego. This person must be a born killer.

About Sharp

Our team of former Navy Seals and Green Berets adapt cognitive performance coaching from the Special Operations community and deliver it to law enforcement agencies across America. Our brand and methods break down stigma and allow us to reach the individuals within each agency who have historically avoided available mental health and wellness options.

Our special operations-inspired platform, built by U.S. Special Operators and the sports psychologists who trained them, helps you perform your best during your mission and after your mission, and enables you to manage a stressful life, long term.

requirements.description: Heavily indexed towards people obsessed with maximizing their own health, wellness, and trajectory.

responsibilities: This is a "machine to build the machine" role
Set up systems in the company (including finance, legal, HR, customer success, and operations)
Strategy and growth responsibilities to be layered in according to performance
workPlaceText: On-site in San Diego
experience_info: , especially helpful if familiar with revenue operations, funnel dynamics/conversion and a comfort in quantitative environments.
avoid_traits: Short stints, weak academic background

company.name: A* Capital
company.description:
A* is an early stage venture capital firm commonly associated with the so-called "PayPal Mafia".

We are a 12 person seed and pre-seed fund that moves quickly and wins deals. We back generational founders tackling world-changing problems.
company.teamAbout:
Our Philosophy

We have founded, operated and invested in some of the most iconic tech companies of our era. While we're proud of our past, we're just getting started.

  • Conviction-led: We invest first. With unwavering conviction.

  • Relentless: We are relentless. Just like our founders.

  • Founder-centric: We work together. To shape a better future.

name: Forward Deployed Engineer (Forge)
description:
About the Role

This is a founding FDE role in a fast growing, revenue-generating company backed by the investors behind Uber, Pinterest, Airbnb, PayPal and Palantir (www.a-star.co).

Founded by a Thiel-fellow, this 5-person company is working on the edge of deep computing and today's enterprise.  Pilots are live, and they're currently testing their revenue model.  Forge needs someone high-calibre, that could be backed by any top venture firm starting their own company, to come join us. They will work directly on the product, but interface with the client.  This is a very technical role.  

About Forge

Forge is a tool that lets you delegate any repetitive process to a computer using human language. Forge learns by watching you work. After it has learned a new process, you can run any of your saved flows on a schedule or by pressing “run” in the Forge app.

Familiar with the performance standards of global companies but with a hack mindset
Inclined towards sweeping answers for real-day, Fortune 50 data challenges
"Problem finders", not problem solvers

name: Head of Operations - Montreal (Fuse)
description:
About the Role

This is a founding bizops role in Montreal for Fuse (LinkedIn), a leading Silicon Valley fusion company with significant operations in Montreal.

This person will oversee essential executive functions required to manage the company's ambitious goals towards limitless, cost effective energy in perpetuity. Their primary duties will include overseeing administrative employees, implementing communications procedures between teams and developing strategic initiatives to improve efficiency throughout the business.

About Fuse

Life is short - let's do something that matters

Fuse is not a comfortable environment. There are no bean bag chairs. Many of us live, eat, and work at our facility. In winter, it gets cold. We chase fulfillment, not pleasure. We are driven by our belief that controlled fusion is possible. The natural consequences of our pursuit of that mission yield enormous national security advantages to the land of the free and the home of the brave. We are proud of this and would not have it any other way.

Who We Are

We’re Misfits. Tinkerers. Skeptics. Doers. We’re drawn to impossible problems. We fly before we understand why. We’ve brought together a world-class team in cutting-edge engineering, fusion science, energy policy, and manufacturing – with a track record of efficient and rapid execution. We have deep conviction that fusion energy is possible.

Degree in technical field or soft sciences (i.e. econ, poli sci, sociology) from a top-tier school.

responsibilities: Making sure that all operations run smoothly and align with company mission
Overseeing accounting, bank processes and monitoring the financial data and recommending solutions to improve profitability

name: Mobile Engineering Lead
description:
Sauron Industries is looking to create a new modality for homeowners to interact with their properties and security systems, based on a 3D model of the home in a beautiful app for iPad and iPhone. We are looking for a seasoned software engineer and technical leader to help envision and build out this mobile application. You’ll be a critical part of Sauron’s roadmap as you work on developing performance-critical user experiences which are the primary user touchpoint for our entire system.

We are looking for someone who is creative, detail-oriented, and cares deeply about the user experience. The ideal candidate is strategic about building for the long run, and enjoys the process of collaborating with teammates to architect beautiful, reliable, scalable and maintainable applications. You will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining our mobile application, ensuring a seamless user experience that incorporates engaging 3D visual elements.

We Value

  • Collaboration, pair programming, and teamwork.

  • Making small improvements and shipping code to production continuously.

  • Taking ownership across the stack (frontend and backend).

  • Test-driven development, and refactoring regularly to keep our codebases healthy.

requirements.description: Familiarity with end-to-end testing frameworks.
Experience with 3D graphics libraries/frameworks (e.g., Unity, Unreal Engine, OpenGL, Metal).
Proficiency in mobile programming languages such as Swift, Objective-C, Java, Kotlin, or similar.
CI/CD systems.
A strong portfolio of applications that showcase engaging 3D visual elements.
Experience with native iOS development.
User-centric perspective, and solid understanding of UI/UX principles and best practices.
Knowledge of version control systems (e.g., Git).
Experience with React Native (or similar modern frontend frameworks) and TypeScript/JavaScript.
Knowledge of backend services integration (RESTful APIs, JSON, etc.).

responsibilities: Architecting and writing frontend and backend software for innovative mobile interfaces that delight users.
Working closely with designers and AI engineers to continuously improve the user experience.
Optimizing performance for mobile devices to ensure smooth operation and responsiveness.
Conducting thorough testing to identify and resolve issues before deployment.
As you grow into the role you will have opportunities to lead new product features and engineering initiatives.

Sauron has raised an $18M seed round led by A* and Atomic with participation from other leading venture capital firms and angel investors, including 8VC and Flock Safety CEO Garret Langley.

Our team is looking for a software engineer with expertise in infrastructure for integrating sensors, actuators, compute and user interfaces, who is passionate about developing scalable and maintainable systems.

name: Electrical Engineer
description:
Our perception system is built for action. Complementing the sensor systems mounted on the home, our deterrence suite will respond to threats in the moment, preventing crime before it happens. To this end, we are seeking a highly skilled Electrical Engineer with experience in product development, as well as specifying, wiring and mounting home hardware that meets electrical codes.

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in electrical engineering, with expertise in motor controls, PLC programming, hazard analysis, and safety analysis in compliance with electrical codes.

name: Product Engineer
description:
Extend is enabling enterprises to deploy in-house AI agents for processing unstructured data. As a Product Engineer at Extend, you’ll be responsible for building our core platform that companies use to train, deploy, and monitor AI agents. We’re looking to hire exceptional engineers who care about crafting intuitive product experiences, relentlessly focus on the details, and operate with high agency.

We're powering mission-critical data processing at companies where if we get things wrong, there are real world impacts (e.g. missed payments, people can't move into homes on time).

Here's a few of the complex technical problems we're working on:

  • How do we enable enterprises to deploy AI agents into production with confidence?

  • How do we handle never before seen edge cases in customer data?

  • How do we build a self-correcting system that automatically gets better over time?

  • How do we enable non-technical domain experts to train AI agents with their expertise & business logic?

  • How do we help customers make tradeoffs between latency, cost, and performance?

  • How do we build reliable systems that can process large data streams in real-time?

requirements.description: Excited to work in-person with our team 5-6 days per week
Experience in a high-growth startup, previous experience as a founder or founding engineer
CS degree from a top university
Experience working on AI products
NodeJS & Typescript experience
Strong product sense and ability to operate autonomously
In NYC, or willing to relocate
Backend and infra-heavy fullstack engineer
Strong design sense

responsibilities: Build and maintain durable, scalable systems capable of processing 10s of millions of data points per month.
Design and implement the best human ↔ AI interfaces for designing data processing agents.
Have complete ownership over the work done as a founding team member.
Work directly with the CEO, CTO, and other founding members to help build out the team.
workPlaceText: On-site in NYC
experience_info: in full-stack engineering building products in a fast-paced startup environment
recruiting_advice:
When pitching to these candidates, I would highlight how they're going to work on solving never-before-seen problems building AI agents, and that their work will be applied on complex mission-critical data streams at real world enterprises.

Things that indicate the candidate will be a good fit:

  • has shipped features 0 -> 1 in a full-stack capacity into production on their own before

  • are very product minded

  • being an ex-founder or founding engineer is also a great signal
avoid_traits: new grads
short stints (<1 year) at multiple companies in a row
spent whole career at massive companies

description:
Extend is enabling enterprises to deploy in-house AI agents for processing unstructured data. As a Forward Deployed Engineer at Extend, you’ll act as the primary interface between customers and Extend. We’re looking to hire engineers who obsess over customer pain, relentlessly focus on the details, operate with high agency, and want to empower organizations with AI.

Ensuring our customers can successfully deploy AI agents into production is critical, and comes with never before seen challenges. We need to make sure we’re world class at this.

name: Senior AI Engineer
description:
Extend is enabling enterprises to deploy in-house AI agents for processing unstructured data. As an AI Engineer at Extend, you’ll design novel techniques, systems, and human ↔ AI interfaces for building LLM agents that operate on complex data streams. We’re looking to hire engineers who think creatively about problems, keep up to date on the latest in AI research, push for real-world customer impact (not only theory), and are excited about empowering organizations with AI.

We're powering mission-critical data processing at companies where if we get things wrong, there are real world impacts (e.g. missed payments, people can't move into homes on time).

Here's a few of the complex problems you’ll be working on:

  • How do we build a self-correcting system that automatically gets better over time?

  • How do we enable non-technical domain experts to train AI agents with their expertise & business logic?

  • How do we deploy non-deterministic AI into mission-critical flows?

  • How do we help customers make tradeoffs between latency, cost, and performance?

requirements.description: Excited to work in-person with our team 5-6 days per week
CS degree from a top university
Previous experience in applied AI (either professionally or via side projects)
Early startup experience, clear demonstration of autonomy
In NYC, or willing to relocate
Full-stack experience with Typescript
Strong product sense, the ability to create product solutions that align with user needs
Actively keeps up to date on the latest in LLM research

responsibilities: Designing novel LLM techniques for increasing the complexity of use cases and data streams that Extend can be applied to
Monitoring existing agents in production, understanding what’s working well (and what isn’t), and running experiments to solve those issues
Implementing the best human ↔ AI interfaces for designing data processing agents
Having complete ownership over the work done as a founding team member
Working directly with the CEO, CTO, and other founding members to help build out the team

experience_info: in AI engineering / applied AI
recruiting_advice:
AI engineer is a brand new role that (in its current form), hasn't really existed until the past ~1 year. Additionally, a lot of good candidates will ask questions such as "why is this not a GPT wrapper company?"

I would highlight how they're going to work on solving never-before-seen problems building AI agents, and that their work will be applied on complex mission-critical data streams at real world enterprises.

Things that indicate the candidate will be a good fit:

  • has shipped LLM features into production in the past year

  • has worked on AI side projects and posted about them

  • being an ex-founder is also a great signal

To source these folks, the exact company is less important. What matters more is whether or not they've been in an applied AI role before.

name: Growth Marketing Lead
description:
As our Growth Marketing Lead, you'll be responsible for demand generation and lifecycle marketing to capture and keep the interest of data teams around the world. Your integrated marketing campaigns should aim for winning the hearts and minds of data engineers, analytics-engineers, and analysts through showing them the benefits of the best data observability platform on the market.

You'll own digital ad channels, email marketing, marketing operations, paid SEO, with more as you see fit. We're looking for active contributors that aren't afraid to push the traditional frameworks of marketing and are constantly looking to improve how they reach goals.

requirements.description: Experience working across multiple acquisition channels, with deep mastery in 2-3 areas currently.
5-10+ years of prior experience owning growth marketing or lifecycle marketing at a B2B SaaS company.
Experience in a high-growth startup, or in a fast-paced environment with a high level of ownership and autonomy.
Experienced in playing the role of project/program manager and can juggle multiple projects.
Experiment-driven, and enjoy trying out new things to either reach new audiences or improve a campaign you've launched in the past.

responsibilities: Growth Marketing Strategy: Set our channel strategy and plan campaigns that help us grow awareness and fill our sales pipeline. You’ll be straddling between Marketing, BD, and Sales often, sharing funnel metrics insights weekly. You’ll also collaborate with the Product team on in-product growth strategy and referral/affiliate strategy.
Channel Ownership: Own, build, and grow email, ABM, SEO, and paid marketing channels.
Paid Marketing: Build out Metaplane’s paid media strategy and hire contractors or agencies to execute search and paid social advertising campaigns.
Contractor and Agency Management: Hire contractors, agencies, and teammates as needed to hit growth goals. You’ll start as a growth marketing team of one, which will increase to two in 2025.
Marketing Analytics: Create full-funnel dashboards to help us measure, optimize, and scale our marketing efforts. Report on performance to Head of Marketing and senior leadership team.
Website: Own our website performance. You’ll set up comprehensive referral tracking, create landing pages, follow SEO best practices, and run A/B tests to improve our website’s conversion rate.
Marketing Ops: You’ll manage the marketing tech stack, add tools and make improvements as needed. Current stack: Webflow, Zapier, HubSpot, Sigma, Notion, and Amplitude.
visa_text_more: Can sponsor TN visas. Other visas considered only if exceptional fit.
experience_info: - should be mid-career or close to being senior/team lead

Exceptional at collaboration, especially with product and sales teams. Early growth stage experience is helpful. Should be experiment-driven and demonstrate that they know how to resonate with a customer while hitting revenue goals.

  • Breadth of growth experience across marketing channels, with depth of experience required in 2 of the following: ABM, SEO, email marketing, paid marketing, marketing operations, demand generation, lifecycle marketing.

  • This hire should be excited about the opportunity to get in on the ground floor. They’re going to be hands on at building a strategy. Title above is dependent on experience.

company.description: Metaplane helps companies trust their data. Our observability platform alerts data teams to quality issues before they affect business outcomes. We are a fully-remote company founded by MIT and HubSpot alums and backed by prominent investors, including Y Combinator, Khosla Ventures, Felicis, and the founders of HubSpot, Vercel, and Okta.
benefits: Fully covered health, dental, and vision insurance
company.teamAbout:
We're a team of experienced engineers, data scientists, and marketers dedicated to building a world-class product that helps every company trust their data, just as Datadog helps companies trust their software. Beyond building the best-in-class product, we care about building a team of craftspeople who find joy in excellent work.

The #1 reason why people choose to work with us is the quality of our team. We win together as a small team of highly talented people, valuing both autonomy and collaboration.

name: Full-Stack Software Engineer
description:
At Tennr, we’re building a platform for automating rote labor in traditional industries. We believe that humans should spend more of their time doing creative, satisfying work that drives value. To get there we need to leverage AI to automate mundane workflows. We're a team that thrives on ownership and rapid development, dedicated to transforming business landscapes with our technology.

We're looking for a Full-Stack Engineer to join our team in New York. This person will help drive our product forward and take ownership by proactively driving projects from conception to completion.

requirements.description: Proven track record of building and maintaining scalable web applications.
A team player who thrives in collaborative environments and values diverse perspectives.
Excellent problem-solving skills and a knack for efficient, clean coding practices.
Experience with AI model integration and a strong interest in AI and machine learning.
Outstanding communication skills, capable of articulating complex technical concepts to a diverse audience.
Prior experience in a startup or fast-paced tech environment is a plus.
Lives in NYC Metropolitan area

responsibilities: Architect and implement features that drive direct customer value end-to-end in our frontend and backend environments.
Lead performance optimization initiatives, ensuring code quality and adherence to best practices.
Collaborate with sales and customer success teams to respond to feedback from our customers and prospects.
Embrace a founder's mindset, proactively driving projects from conception to completion, and contributing significantly to our company's growth and success.

Evaluation Criteria

  • Collaboration and Communication: Effectiveness in team collaboration and clarity in communication.

  • Adaptability and Learning: Willingness to embrace new technologies and a commitment to continuous learning.

company.name: Tennr
company.description:
Today, when you go to your doctor and need to be referred to a specialist (e.g., for sleep apnea), your doctor sends a fax (yes, in 2024, 90% of provider-provider communication is a 1980s fax). These are often converted into 20+ page PDFs, with handwritten (doctor’s handwriting!) notes, in thousands of different formats. The problem is so complex that a person has to read it, type it up, and manually enter your information. Tennr built RaeLLM™ (7B—trained on 3M+ documents) to read these docs, talk to your doc to ensure nothing is missed, and text you to help schedule your appointment so you can get better, faster.

Tennr is a NYC-based tech company that launched out of Y-Combinator and is backed by Andreesen Horowitz, Foundation Capital, The New Normal Fund, and other top investors.
company.teamAbout: Our founding team began working together studying at the bleeding edge of AI and LLMs at Stanford, combined with a team of experts with decades in the healthcare space.

name: Product Marketing Lead
description:
We’re focused on building the best data observability platform on the market, but we recognize that bringing data quality to all companies requires more than just building a great product. We also need to educate data teams about how Metaplane can help them deliver data their colleagues can trust. 

As our Product Marketing Lead, you'll be responsible for refining and executing our product marketing strategy, helping us make a big splash through product launches, own sales enablement, and help us stand out in the market with differentiated product positioning and messaging. You'll report to our Head of Marketing, and work closely with the company's co-founders.

If you’re a customer-centric and story-driven marketer with a passion for driving business growth, this job is for you.

requirements.description: Strong at product storytelling, and understand how to bring this to life via positioning, messaging, and regular GTM launch moments. Ideally has a portfolio or examples to show you've done this before.
Empathy for the customer and enjoys solving problems for them -- working with our internal teams to build, market, and launch products that data engineers will love.
Experience in a high-growth startup, or in a fast-paced environment with a high level of ownership and autonomy.
Experienced project and/or program manager, and can handle multiple projects at the same time.
Track record of and openness to quickly master new technologies and find it easy to help others become power users.
Strong collaborator, and experience working with with Product, Partnerships, Marketing, CS, and Sales teams, etc.

responsibilities: Product Marketing Strategy: Gain a deep understanding of Metaplane’s audience, develop product positioning and messaging, and communicate about the product and its benefits to our data-obsessed audience.
- Positioning: Develop unique, differentiated product positioning and messaging. You’ll also help us distribute these insights across the organization, and analyze effectiveness.

Messaging: Help us advance data observability and elevate data teams. You’ll craft compelling product messages across marketing channels like landing pages, email, YouTube, external presentations, webinars, and more.
Launches: Plan and execute product launches from strategy to messaging, channel strategy, and measurement; collaborating with Product, Sales, and CS

Sales Enablement: Create sales enablement content that demonstrates Metaplane’s importance in today’s data tech stack, so prospects choose us every time. Create content that address questions concerns at various stages of the sales process.
Market Research: Own market and audience research that aims to help Marketing, Sales, and Product teams to understand customer needs, market trends, and insights about the competitive landscape.
Partner Marketing: As needed, work with our partners on co-marketing efforts. Metaplane works with some of the best data companies in the world, including Snowflake, Fivetran and dbt Labs.
visa_text_more: Can sponsor TN visas. Other visas must be exceptional fits.
experience_info: in product marketing, ideally in SaaS. Bonus points if you've worked with a product-led growth business model or a product with a technical audience, including data teams.
recruiting_advice:
6-10 years of prior experience in product marketing, product marketing experience in technology industry (ideally SaaS), experience developing effective, differentiated product messaging, prior experience in product launch marketing strategy and execution, writing and storytelling abilities. They can choose between a Product Marketing Manager or Product Marketing Lead title.

Traits of successful candidates:

  • High urgency, default to action, like to get things done

  • Comfortable working with stakeholders at all levels - from CEOs to interns. This role must be a strong collaborator and communicator.

  • Project management skills are a must. This role must be detail oriented and able to get a group towards the finish line of a project.

  • Good to great at writing. Although we have content writers, this role will own our product messaging. It must resonate with our audience and convert them into paying users.

DO NOT HIRE FROM:

  • Monte Carlo

  • Anomalo

  • BigEye

  • ... and other data observability tools in our space as determined by G2. In my opinion, those companies are not good at product marketing.

Not curious, not someone who asks a lot of questions.
Poor verbal and/or written communication. We hold a high quality bar for communicating to customers, and we rely on written communication as a fully remote company.
Less than 6 years of experience in product marketing.

name: Engineering Manager (Hands-on)
description:
Keep offers a checking account and credit card for Canadian SMBs. Businesses get better cashback rewards on card spend, lower domestic and international wire fees, currency conversion at a fair price, and increased credit limits for working capital needs.

Our engineering process starts with building good problem statements and hypotheses before jumping into coding. As an Engineering Manager on our team, you will have a big influence on how we plan, prioritize, and execute our product roadmap, while you grow our engineers to excellence.

requirements.description: Significant experience working with Javascript, Typescript/NodeJS, and Postgres, but also flexible and open to using different tech stacks
requirements.explanation: Our interview process evaluates these skills

requirements.description: Experience in Fintech, experience in payments a plus
requirements.explanation: They will probably be on the banking team, so if they understand the logic of the product it will be easier for them when they join.

requirements.description: Understands logic and algorithms, and can diagnose issues quickly
Experience in a startup and/or a dynamic, fast-moving environment and be up-to-date with new technologies
Personable and humble - this person will act as a mentor to their team members

responsibilities: Manage a team, focused on developed their tech/soft skills
You have experience shipping code into production owning your work from definition through customers testing what you did.
You own a particular domain and lead the architecture of it to scale along the business.
Your ability to write Technical Specs is outstanding and people look forward to reading your specs and building their own taking inspiration from yours

You can build a culture of highly collaborative and high performance members. name: UAV Controls Engineer
description: Are you passionate about drone technology and control systems? Neros is seeking a UAV Controls Engineer to join the team and play a key role in designing control algorithms for drone flight controllers, developing autonomous algorithms, and implementing path planning algorithms for autonomous navigation. You will apply model-based optimization techniques to optimize drone performance, conduct system testing and validation, and collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver cutting-edge drone solutions. Stay ahead of the curve by staying informed about the latest advancements in drone technology and control systems.

requirements.description: Proven experience with drone flight controllers such as Betaflight, PX4, or similar systems.
Strong knowledge of companion computers and their integration with drone systems.
Proficiency in developing and implementing path planning algorithms for autonomous systems.
Experience running compute-constrained code on embedded systems.
Solid understanding of control theory, signal processing, and robotics.
Proficient in programming languages such as C, C++, Python, or similar.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work in a fast-paced startup environment.
Strong communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a team.
Knowledge of machine learning and computer vision applications in drone technology.
Familiarity with hardware design and integration.
Experience with simulation tools such as Gazebo, MATLAB/Simulink, or similar.
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Aerospace Engineering, Robotics, Computer Science, or a related field.

responsibilities: Design control algorithms for drone flight controllers, including Betaflight, PX4, or other similar systems.
Develop autonomous algorithms for enhanced drone capabilities.
Develop and implement path planning algorithms for autonomous navigation.
Apply model-based optimization techniques to improve drone performance and efficiency.
Ensure robust and reliable operation of compute-constrained code on embedded systems.
Conduct system testing, validation, and troubleshooting to ensure optimal performance and safety.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including hardware engineers, software developers, and product managers, to deliver high-quality drone solutions.
Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in drone technology and control systems.

company.name: Neros Technologies
company.description:
Neros is transforming a defense industry mired in costly, behemoth machinery—to circumvent a looming vulnerability gap, to give dismounted soldiers a fighting chance against tanks, and ultimately, to get as many humans off the battlefield as possible.

While consumer technology is evolving by bounds on the smaller-cheaper-better path, U.S. defense technology wallows in the large, centralized, and wildly expensive paradigm. Our air, land, and sea machinery budget is staggering; yet these large assets can still be vulnerable to very small weapons. When swarm technology comes into its own, the asymmetry will escalate. Nowhere is the pattern more glaring than in small unmanned aerial systems (sUAS)—drones. 

https://www.sequoiacap.com/article/partnering-with-neros-next-gen-drones-made-in-america/
company.productDescription: a drone that goes 0-60 in one second and can blow up a tank
company.teamAbout: We are a fast paced defense startup founded by 2 professional drone pilots that put college on hold to build Neros

name: Senior Software Engineer
description:
We are currently hiring for 2 positions:

Senior Backend Engineer

  • This person will have a strong focus on building robust data ingestion pipelines, document parsing, and contributing to our backend code for a rules engine, hence enhancing the core of our product.

  • This role requires expertise in Express JS, TypeScript, and JavaScript, or any other mainstream language with a strong emphasis on diligence, accuracy, and systematic development practices.

Senior Fullstack Engineer

  • This person will play a pivotal role in shaping our product's architecture and implementation. We are looking for an experienced and ambitious individual who thrives in an environment of autonomy and innovation and is committed to our mission of creating safer roads and vehicles for everyone.

  • They should be proficient in our stack (Node.js, React, TypeScript, Postgres, Redis, AWS), or able to quickly execute within these technologies.

Who You Are

You are a problem solver who thrives on tackling complex challenges and finding innovative solutions. Your meticulous attention to detail ensures accuracy and quality in your work. As a self-motivated individual, you are proactive, driven, and capable of working independently with minimal supervision. You collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and contribute positively to the work environment.

Adaptable and flexible, you can adjust to changing priorities and requirements. You have a genuine interest in technology, a passion for continuous learning and improvement, and strong verbal and written communication skills that make it easy to convey ideas and information.

requirements.description: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field from a top university (Ivies, MIT, Stanford, CMU, Berkeley, etc.)
Backend: Experience with database technologies and data modeling such as Postgresql

Proficiency in our tech stack: Node.js, React, TypeScript, Postgres, Redis, AWS, or the ability to quickly execute within these technologies; or any other mainstream language as long as you can easily pick up typescript
Exposure to machine learning
Proven experience as a backend engineer with a focus on data ingestion and document parsing
Backend: Knowledge of data processing frameworks and tools (e.g., Apache Kafka, Apache Spark) is a plus
Demonstrated diligence and accuracy in developing critical infrastructure.
Backend: Familiarity with cloud services and containerization (e.g., AWS, Docker)
Fullstack: Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail, with a passion for building safe, accurate, and defensive software. A commitment to code quality and testing, including unit testing.
Fullstack: Experience in designing and implementing scalable architectures and bringing products from concept to completion
Excellent communication skills, capable of conveying technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

responsibilities: (Backend) Design, develop, and maintain data ingestion pipelines
(Backend) Implement document parsing solutions to extract meaningful information from various document formats.
(Backend) Contribute to the backend codebase of our rules engine, ensuring high performance, scalability, and reliability.
(Backend) Develop comprehensive test cases to cover all aspects of the code, ensuring accuracy and preventing issues in critical infrastructure.
(Backend) Methodically approach development tasks, ensuring every detail is addressed and every scenario is considered.
(Backend) Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to backend services and data pipelines.
(Fullstack) Design, implement, and maintain scalable, secure, and efficient code within our applications. This includes both front-end and back-end components of our ADAS software suite.
(Fullstack) Conduct thorough code reviews to maintain code quality and best practices.
(Fullstack) Work with product and customer teams to understand requirements and translate them into technical solutions. Ensure alignment between technical and business goals.
Foster a culture of warmth, innovation, and excellence.
Continuously improve as an engineer or manager and share new knowledge with colleagues.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and deliver solutions that meet business needs.
Write clean, maintainable, and well-documented code.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices to ensure our technology stack remains current and effective.

name: Lead Product Designer
description:
As a Lead Product Designer at Metaplane, you’ll own the design process and strategy for the entire Metaplane platform. You’ll work with our customers on a daily basis to deeply understand the challenges that cause them to fight fires on a daily basis. Then you’ll collaborate with our co-founder and engineering team to research, scope, and design workflows that solve these problems. In doing so, you’ll help data teams preserve trust in the data that powers their entire business.

The primary focus of this role will be designing interfaces and workflows that help data teams monitor what is most important across their data platform, visualize the behavior of their data over time, make sense of the dependencies between their data systems, and automate identifying and fixing data incidents. You’ll ensure we can ship software that transforms the way data engineers do their jobs every week.

requirements.description: Experience collaborating closely with engineering teams to build amazing products.
Experience working with engineers in a high-speed environment, and unblocking them with longer term, strategic design decisions.
Experience listening to and interacting with customers and driving product direction based on their needs.

responsibilities: Meet with customers to do research about new functionality, gather feedback on existing product, or discover forward-thinking product experiences we could b
Design intuitive user interfaces and interactions that solve complex user problems
Help unblock the engineering team to ship quickly while still aligning the team on a longer-term product vision
Work closely with our co-founder to do qualitative and quantitative analysis on product usage and feedback
Iterate on our design system and component library to help our team ship beautiful and functional product experiences, faster

experience_info: product design, interaction design, UX design, and information architecture for SaaS products geared toward technical users.
recruiting_advice:
Because of the technical nature of our product and users, we think the best fit for this role is someone who has been a senior product designer for monitoring and observability tools, data tools, data platforms, software engineering tools, etc.

Note to recruiters: please do not share compensation, even if asked. You can share that: We hire the best candidate and will never let comp be the reason we can't work together. We have a small, well-compensated team of experts and we value quality over quantity.

name: VP of Growth
description:
This role offers the opportunity to lead a cutting-edge growth team, drive innovation in paid social advertising, and significantly impact the success of major performance advertisers. The ideal candidate will combine deep technical expertise with strong leadership skills and a strategic mindset to propel our growth initiatives forward.

Core Competencies:

  1. Strategic Vision and Execution: Ability to develop and implement comprehensive growth strategies that encompass all aspects of paid media, CRO and marketing analytics.

  2. Team Building and Leadership: Demonstrated ability to build, manage, and inspire high-performing teams in a fast-paced, extremely competitive and dynamic environment.

  3. Paid Social Expertise: Deep understanding of paid social platforms, particularly Meta, including advanced targeting, bidding strategies, and performance optimization techniques.

  4. Data-Driven Decision Making: Strong analytical skills and deep expertise in marketing analytics and measurement, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights and recommendations.

  5. Innovation and Adaptability: Capacity to stay ahead of industry trends and adapt strategies quickly in the evolving digital marketing landscape.

  6. Client Management: Excellent communication and relationship-building skills, with the ability to gain trust as an expert and advise C-level executives on growth strategies.

  7. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Ability to work effectively with technology teams, creative strategy and customer success teams to develop and implement cutting-edge marketing solutions and deliver best in class creative and media services.

  8. Operational Excellence: Skills in developing and implementing processes and systems that drive efficiency and scalability.

Personal Traits:

  1. Visionary thinker with a passion for innovation in marketing technology and strategies.

  2. Results-oriented with a focus on driving measurable growth and ROI.

  3. High EQ with excellent interpersonal and leadership skills.

  4. Intellectual curiosity and commitment to continuous learning in a rapidly evolving field.

  5. Strategic problem-solver with the ability to navigate complex challenges.

  6. Highly organized with exceptional project management skills.

requirements.description: 1. Proven track record in a senior growth or performance marketing role, preferably at a top-tier performance marketing agency, ad tech company, or in-house at a major D2C brand.
Extensive experience in paid social advertising, particularly on Meta platforms.
1. Demonstrated success in building and leading high-performing marketing teams.
1. Strong background in marketing analytics, CRO, paid acquisition and marketing technology.
1. Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to influence at the executive level.
1. Experience in structured organization building, particularly in establishing or restructuring marketing departments.
Top tier management consulting background or top tier MBA
Technical background, e.g. degree in engineering, math, physics or sciences
1. Deep expertise in marketing technology and adtech ecosystems.
1. Track record of thought leadership in the digital marketing space (speaking engagements, publications, etc.).

responsibilities: Team Leadership and Development: Restructure and grow the Growth team, comprising paid media and growth specialists. Implement structured rhythms to ensure team excellence and continuous improvement.

Thought Leadership and Consultancy: Position the team as thought leaders and consultants in paid social, measurement, analytics, and CRO for our clients - the largest and most sophisticated performance advertisers on Meta.
Media Optimization: Identify and capitalize on media opportunities to scale winning creatives and improve performance through strategic media interventions.
Budget Optimization: Provide daily budget recommendations to clients that maximize scale and ROI.
Service Expansion: Develop operations to offer paid media management and growth consulting services
Technology Integration: Act as a counterpart to the tech team and partners in developing proprietary technology for media buying, measurement, planning, and analytics.

Industry Leadership: Ensure the team remains at the cutting edge of the rapidly evolving paid social landscape, serving as an expert resource for clients' VPs and CMOs in paid social acquisition, media, measurement, and analytics.
Performance Reporting: Provide insightful reports to clients, highlighting performance metrics and opportunities for growth and efficiency.
Client Relationship Management: Establish and nurture client relationships at both executive and operational levels, consulting on growth and media best practices.

experience_info: Performance marketing
recruiting_advice:
We have a very high bar when it comes to GMA and looking only for people who have solved really difficult problems and/or have a track record of consistent overachievement and/or can show truly innovative and elegant solutions in their past work.

We are also looking for people that are very result oriented and take pride in building truly best in class teams. They shouldn't be afraid of applying a very har bar and demanding for excellence.

Lastly we look for people with low ego, that are happy to be wrong and want to continuously learn and get better.

If you worked on the Director of Client Success Role, we are looking for a similar profile in terms of abilities and personality traits, however this role has hard requirements when it comes to technical knowledge. Candidates MUST have paid social experience and MUST have managed teams before.

company.name: TubeScience
company.description:
Over the past 8 years, we quietly bootstrapped TubeScience into the largest producer of social media ads in the USA. While our public profile is minimal (ironically, we don’t do any self-marketing), we have hundreds of employees, billions of dollars in ad spend, and deep technical partnerships with Meta and other platforms. 

What helped us do so is an obsession for numbers over opinions, and a unique “pay for performance” business model. Clients only pay if our ads outperform anything they or any other agency delivers. It’s a very “honest” business model, and clients tend to love it (resulting in extremely high retention and all our sales to date coming from inbound / word of mouth). 

As we look towards the future and AI advances, we see an incredible opportunity to reinvent our business. We plan to take everything we’ve learned, and turn it into a true self-service SaaS offering that can power agencies and in-house teams alike.
benefits: Be part of a passionate, entrepreneurial team that is driven to succeed and working on a high impact problem.
A unique opportunity to shape a team from the ground up.

name: Software Engineer (Data/ML Platform)
description:
Cleanlab’s mission is to democratize safe, trustworthy, and reliable AI. We believe the most promising path to such AI follows a data-centric approach. We build open-source algorithms and no-code SaaS solutions based on our research to help individuals and teams systematically and algorithmically curate high-quality datasets, which enables AI systems to train reliably on real-world messy and error-prone data.

As a software engineer working on Cleanlab’s data platform and ML platform, you will be responsible for building the data and ML systems that underpin Cleanlab Studio, a user-friendly web app powered by our data-centric ML algorithms.

requirements.description: Several years of cross-team initiatives in a platform or infrastructure-focused environment. You should have led impactful technical initiatives where first-order concerns include performance, data security, cost efficiency, ease of use, and operability.
Multiple years of experience running production code and models in cloud environments. You should be comfortable with the unique challenges of running large software systems at scale.
Previous experience working at top startups or top-tier tech companies.
Able to mentor and coach other engineers, but eager to primarily work as an individual contributor.
Strong direct hands-on coding and development experience.
Strong AWS development experience. Not "just" setting up infra, but also writing apps/services using the infra.
Strong Python skills.

responsibilities: Productionizing the algorithms invented by our ML team by designing and implementing systems that perform data ingestion, data processing, ML training, and ML inference
Optimizing code for speed, scalability, security, and reliability
Ideating and prototyping novel product features enabled by our research
Collaborating with our data scientists and machine learning engineers to integrate feedback

Did you do some amazing work at a past job?

Living in South Bay instead of SF proper

company.name: Cleanlab
company.description:
Everything we do at Cleanlab is guided by our north star – to improve the world’s ML data more easily and quicker than any other solution – enabling AI systems to train more reliably on real-world, messy, error-prone data. We develop next-generation data-centric AI, open-source algorithms and provide no-code SaaS enterprise solutions to help individuals and teams at companies (across all industries) diagnose/fix issues in their datasets and produce more reliable ML models by providing clean labels for training.

While many companies can help store/manage data or develop ML models, there exist few solutions today to improve the quality of existing data, which is the core asset of the modern enterprise. This is where you come in. At Cleanlab, you’ll be able to take ownership of critical projects that pioneer the future of data-centric AI.

We are a hybrid company, with over half of our team (and office) located in San Francisco.
benefits: Premium health insurance (+ dental and vision)
Professional development stipend to keep up with the latest innovations in ML and software.
Competitive salary (+ equity offering for certain roles), with regular opportunities for a raise if things are going well.
Relocation bonus to move to San Francisco
company.teamAbout: Prior to Cleanlab, our founders (3 ML PhDs from MIT) worked at OpenAI, Google, Microsoft, Amazon, AWS, Facebook AI Research (FAIR), Dropbox, Oculus, Palantir, NASA, General Electric, MIT Lincoln Laboratory, MIT, Harvard, and Stanford – at every place we worked we repeatedly encountered the same issue – AI solutions failed to work reliably on real-world, human-centric data due to label errors and poor data quality. So, we spent eight years of PhD research at MIT inventing a new field to solve this problem and after successful pilots with world-leading organizations, Cleanlab emerged.

Cleanlab’s mission is to democratize safe, trustworthy, and reliable AI. We believe the most promising path to such AI follows a data-centric approach. We build open-source algorithms and no-code SaaS solutions based on our research to help individuals and teams systematically and algorithmically curate high-quality datasets, which enables AI systems to train reliably on real-world messy and error-prone data.

As a backend software engineer at Cleanlab, you will be responsible for building the backend APIs that power Cleanlab Studio, a user-friendly web app powered by our data-centric ML algorithms.

name: Growth Marketer
description:
Pylon is a full ticketing system allowing you to track customer issues across Slack Connect, Email, Microsoft Teams, In-App Chat, and Tickets. We're hiring a Growth Lead or Growth Manager to join our team! We're a Series A company that up until this point has had one founder handling all of the GTM.

We're mostly inbound driven, but there are clear opportunities to increase pipeline via more channels. Your primary mission would be to come up with, prioritize, and fully own running experiments to generate more pipeline for sales.

You'd be joining the GTM team which currently consists of one Founder and a Founding AE, and a community manager.

company.name: Pylon
company.description:
Pylon is a Series A startup backed by Y Combinator, General Catalyst, and another unannounced Tier 1 investor building the next-generation support system.

We replace products like Salesforce Service Cloud ($7.3B/yr) and Zendesk ($2.9B/yr).

Pylon helps B2B companies manage their customers across the different places they talk to them - shared Slack channels, Microsoft Teams, email, in-app chat, Slack communities, and more. Hundreds of fast-growing companies of all sizes like Mintlify, Hightouch, and Deel use Pylon to track customer conversations across slack/teams/email/in-app/community, resolve customer issues quickly, and keep customers engaged.
company.productDescription: Pylon is a Customer Support Platform. It tracks customer support issues and most often replaces products like Zendesk, Intercom, and Salesforce Service Cloud.
company.teamAbout:
We're a high-energy, ambitious team that want to build the biggest SaaS company in the world.

We work extremely hard and founder salaries are directly tied to company success. The founders started off making $35k/yr and only make $75k/yr today, and live in the office (literally living in conference rooms).

  • Team of 12
