name: Head of Manufacturing
description:
Rangeview builds robotic foundries to supply the world’s top aerospace companies with precision componentry. We are committed to reinvigorating the manufacturing base that made this country, and supplying the parts needed by the builders of the future. With a deep technical and commercial understanding of automation, Rangeview is reinventing the technology stack of factory operations and precision casting. We are backed by Silicon Valley's top VC funds, and are leveraging cutting edge technologies in additive manufacturing, robotics, and data processing.

We are looking for a foundational leader to run one of the quickest growing factories in the world. This is a job for someone that has always worked with their hands, and who has a deep appreciation for engineering. You will interface directly with our customers, and be responsible for shipping America’s latest aerospace parts.

A can-do attitude is necessary, exceptional ability will be rewarded, and meaningful equity will be offered.

Worked in job shop/machining

Process continuous improvement

We are restoring the industrial foundation that made America a beacon of innovation and progress. We see overseas threats and the next space race as a call to arms, a cry for seriousness. Rangeview is here to build real things, to break conventions, and to reestablish the American spirit.

Using robotics and data processing, we are reinventing the technology stack of precision casting and factory operations.

Our product is a cyberfoundry.

recruiting_advice:
When sourcing, it'll be easier to narrow down who to reach out to if you follow this framework:

Some sourcing tips:

  • Previous titles to target (in order of preference): Chief of Staff, Business Operations, BizOps, GTM or Growth (please avoid AE or SDR), Product (please avoid just PMs)

  • Look for excellence (example frameworks, but not exhaustive):

    • Were they a go-getter throughout their life?

    • Did they do the most challenging/exceptional thing they can in their capacity?

    • Did they secure the hardest internships or clearly made the best use of their time?

    • Did they start a company?

    • Were they interested in startups?

  • top schools: Harvard, Yale, MIT, Stanford, Berkeley etc is a good signal of this

In the screening call, please screen for:

  • Are they ruthless/cut-throat?

    • is it clear that they mean business? Are they serious and relentless (it's good if they intimidate you a little bit)

    • For this role I prefer folks who are more serious than light hearted

  • is it clear that they're extremely smart?

    • either talks really crisp/clear/concise or talks really fast

  • olympian work ethic - is it clear from their previous track record that they work exceptionally hard?

  • bottomless energy = consistency - are they energetic is it clear from their previous track record that they are a consistent performer?

  • high ambition - what is their goal? why is it clear that they want to achieve something exceptional

  • curiosity and open-mindedness
avoid_traits: not genuinely interested in an early stage startup
doesn't seem independent, requires a lot of hand holding
candidates just looking for another 9-5 'job'

company.name: Paraform
company.description:
Paraform is a marketplace connecting companies with open roles and recruiters who can fill them.

Companies can work with specialized recruiters more cheaply, monitor their performance, and flex based on demand. Recruiters don't have to worry about acquiring clients while earning and working on their own terms.

Incredible teams at the most exciting startups and enterprises are being built as a result.

We power talent for a wide range of customers:

  • Enterprise - Palantir, Anduril, Scale AI

  • Growth stage - Eight Sleep, Character.ai, Applied Intuition

  • Early stage - Mintlify, Jenni.ai, Decagon.ai

We've raised money from:

  • Co-founders - Twitch, Doordash, and Eventbrite

  • VCs - A*, Soma Capital, Founders Inc, and Primer Sazze

  • Leadership - Palantir, Opendoor, Ramp, and Scale AI

Other highlights:

  • GMV/Revenue increasing 50% MoM

  • We just moved into a beautiful new office in North Beach. Check out video of it here
benefits: 🌉 Beautiful office with golden gate bridge view at the Fort Mason Center in San Francisco. Moving to North Beach soon and we think it's even better :)
🌏 Company Offsites (NY, LA, Sydney, Seoul etc)
company.teamAbout:
Hey 👋 we're John and Jeff, the co-founders of Paraform. Funnily enough, this all started when we tried to recruit each other in 2022. Ever since then, we've experienced first-hand how broken recruiting is and our mission is to finally fix it.

Our values and culture

  • We work hard and enjoy being together in person. We are transparent about our work ethic and expectations because it enables us to have extreme ownership in building at a pace that is unmatched.

  • Customers, customers, customers. We're customer-obsessed and always start with the customer first. We are the customer support team.

  • Ship fast and break things. We believe great products come from lots of experimentation, so we value fast development. No one is going to wait around for us to make things, especially something that's perfect.

  • Take care of each other. We trust each other and want to enable everyone to do their best work. That means an all food and transportation compensated, gym membership, unlimited PTO, global offsites, premium healthcare and a free bike.

name: Backend Engineer
description: This Backend Engineer role focuses on leading backend development efforts and supporting infrastructure for a robust, secure, and efficient live platform. Responsibilities include engaging in backend development activities, managing and provisioning infrastructure resources using AWS, architecting and implementing end-to-end solutions, troubleshooting performance issues, and maintaining operational processes for high availability and performance.

requirements.description: Previous experience in DevOps.
Strong experience with Node.js and PostgreSQL.
Demonstrated experience with cloud computing platforms (AWS preferred).
Proficiency in Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools, like Terraform.
In-depth knowledge of cloud-native architectures, microservices, containerisation, and serverless computing.
Strong programming and scripting skills (Node.js, Python, JavaScript, plus Bash or Shell scripting).
Experience with logging tools (Loki, Splunk, etc.) and monitoring tools (Grafana, Prometheus, Datadog).
Comprehensive understanding of networking and security principles.
Excellent troubleshooting skills, particularly for performance issues and memory leaks.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Strong opinions but not ideologically tied to specific technologies; naturally curious and willing to learn new technologies; comfortable picking up new stacks and choosing the right tool for the job.
Experience with Real-Time Collaboration (RTC) in digital products.
Experience working in a startup environment, having shipped high-quality products to users.
Familiarity with frontend frameworks such as React (preferred) and understanding of GraphQL.
Experience building text editors, online whiteboards, content management systems, or developer tools is highly valued.

responsibilities: Backend Development: Engage in backend development activities, focusing on Node.js and PostgreSQL, ensuring the creation of robust, scalable, and efficient services.
Infrastructure Provisioning: Efficiently manage and provision infrastructure resources using AWS, ensuring scalability and reliability.
Solution Design and Implementation: Architect and implement end-to-end solutions, including database design and service creation, ensuring scalability, security, and resilience.
Performance Optimisation: Troubleshoot performance issues and memory leaks to ensure efficient and reliable backend operations.
Tool Proficiency: Utilise and master a range of tools and technologies for optimal infrastructure management and deployment.
Operational Excellence: Maintain and improve operational processes for the live platform, ensuring high availability, performance, and rapid issue resolution.
Security and Compliance: Ensure that all infrastructure and deployments comply with security best practices and regulatory standards.

Collaboration and Continuous Improvement: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to improve processes, implementing best practices for continuous integration, deployment, and improvement of the platform's operations.
workPlaceText: Australia - can be anywhere in Australia. basically need someone between AUS - IND timezone.
experience_info: in backend development and cloud infrastructure design and implementation.
recruiting_advice:
• Past experiences that we value

    1. Creator tools (Social media, Presentation software is a plus)

    2. Productivity tools

    3. Design / Product / UX background

    4. Early stage product experience

    5. Product design agencies

  • Why join Chronicle?

    • Everything starts with a story. But storytelling tools hold people back today. We are solving this big and interesting problem that will impact millions of users changing the way people craft and tell powerful stories every day. We are passionate to help anyone deliver presentations that are not just bearable, but enjoyable.

    • We are a design led company with an appreciation of great product taste. Think of it as joining the next Notion, Figma or Linear. We offer an opportunity to build the next big productivity tool with some of the smartest people in the space.

    • Chronicle is built on incredibly nuanced, high quality insights about presentations. There might be other teams who can build products better than us - but nobody can make presentations like we do. That makes a huge difference in the long run.

    • In a world that chases vanity and capital, Chronicle is a refreshingly different take - a place where quality, attention to detail and craft take precedence over mindlessly rushing to build something.

    • We reject mindless and scrappy building. We do not settle. We solve problems first principles. We are not influenced by startups, trends, frameworks. We want to build something timeless.

    • We work flexibly and do not believe in driving work through forced accountability. We try to hire only the best and give them the flexibility and space to do their life’s best work at Chronicle.

    • We offer competitive salaries, significant ESOPs and have open and transparent conversations about your compensation. We do everything in our reach to ensure you are able to bring your best self to work each day.

    • Chronicle is in a powerful position with the runway required to build a world class product - backed by some of the best and most respected investors in the world - Accel and SquarePeg. We are fortunate to have the right people on this journey with us who understand that this is a long term bet

    • We reject mindless and scrappy building. We do not settle. We solve problems first principles. We are not influenced by startups, trends, frameworks. We want to build something timeless.
avoid_traits: Enterprises only experience (e.g. CBA, Woolies, etc.)
Only 6-12 month stints
We are not looking for cowboys/girls → no contractors, dev shops, freelancers
We are not looking for heroes/mavericks → need experience working with a team

We are not looking for someone to only shape the strategic direction of the product - while interest in this space is valued it will not be a core responsibility since we have clarity and validation on our roadmap
We are not looking for just people managers or hands-off designers. This is an IC role and the IC must be at the top of their game with a decent tenure

company.name: Chronicle
company.description:
Chronicle is a new presentation format that enables people to create impactful stories, effortlessly. With remote work, shortening attention spans, and the advent of generative AI, the world has changed. Chronicle is designing the presentation experience that the future deserves.

We’re not creating a better way to do slides or documents - we’re creating a powerful new medium that fundamentally reimagines the role of a creator and consumer of a presentation at work, empowering users to deliver beautiful and engaging output with less effort.
benefits: Compensation. We offer competitive compensation and benefits, including ESOP for all employees, and regular feedback and review cycles, and discretionary performance-based bonuses.
Flexibility: We work remotely but in sync and flexibly, empowering our people to do their best work when and where it suits them, and to live fulfilling lives outside of work.
Autonomy: We maintain a high performance culture, providing significant autonomy to our team to own and deliver high quality, creative output.
Benefits: We offer generous benefits including top-tier equipment and allowances for remote work, learning and development, and wellbeing.
company.teamAbout:
We are a team of 11 senior operators. Mayuresh and Tejas are the Founders, leading product and customer respectively. Chris G leads design and Chris J leads engineering. (Yep, we have two Chrises). Pavan, Harris, Aki, Anik and Praveen are senior developers and Pradeep is a senior designer. Max is our chief of staff and works with Tejas on all things customer.

We believe a small team works most effectively at the stage we are at. We are a small team of senior operators located across Australia and India, hailing from top tier companies and with a strong passion for storytelling.

This is an excellent opportunity to be a founding member of our sales organization and have a great deal of ownership over the sales process and development as our team grows. The opportunity here is big, we’re aiming for double digit monthly growth.

Meet and exceed sales quotas and revenue targets set by Sales Leadership.

name: Software Engineer
description:
At Melange, we are using LLMs to build a tool that will help lawyers and examiners evaluate the validity of any patent with greater accuracy at a fraction of the cost.

Leveraging recent and ongoing advancements in machine learning and natural language processing, you will be building a software infrastructure that conducts patent search faster and more accurately than any human currently can. We are a small team with a friendly, mostly-remote culture. The company is well capitalized, having raised 9.1 million dollars in a Series Seed led by Greenoaks Capital.

requirements.description: Familiarity with machine learning packages such as PyTorch, and Tensorflow.
Familiarity with containerization and orchestration tools like Docker and Kubernetes.
Experience running Postgres or other database technologies in a production environment.
A good work ethic that does not suffer when management is remote.
Worked with AWS, GCP, or Azure extensively.
Shipped a working product to users, either as part of a team or on your own.
Used Langchain, LangGraph, or other prompting tools in production or for personal projects.

responsibilities: Ship high-quality products.
Utilize prompting libraries such as Langchain and Langgraph to develop conversation graphs and evaluation flows.
Collaborate with linguists to integrate our in-house grammar and entity mapping processes into a patent search algorithm.
Design, develop, and maintain robust data pipelines that support our customers and our team.
experience_info: software engineering + data engineering
recruiting_advice:
They really have to enjoy the act of working. This is a remote environment and we can't be there looking over an employee's shoulders. It's also a startup, so the ideal candidate should have a sense of adventure and excitement even for the uncertain.

Finally, pedigree is a consideration for us. For reasons specific to our present cultural needs, we preference people who have worked at a good companies (Google, etc.) and/or attended good schools (Harvard, etc.) more than your normal client might.
benefits: Health Insurance + 401k matching + unlimited paid time off

company.name: Melange
company.description: Melange is a venture-backed startup building a brand new search infrastructure for the patent system. Leveraging recent and ongoing advancements in machine learning and natural language processing, we are building systems to conduct patent search faster and more accurately than any human currently can. We are a small team with a friendly, mostly-remote culture. The company is well capitalized, having raised 9.1 million dollars in a Series Seed led by Greenoaks Capital.

name: Head of Growth (AE/SDR)
description:
We are the venture firm behind PayPal, Palantir, Airbnb, Pinterest, Uber among others.  We are incubating four new companies deploying AI into very specific use cases and are looking to make our first hires to commercialize these technologies.  All four companies have revenue, and in some cases are accelerating (doubling by any measure month-on-month).  It's time to give our engineers an experienced founding head of growth.  Depending on which company, it could be someone with just a few years of experience or a real veteran.  There will be a lot of losers in AI, but the ones that win will likely become icons.  We have met hundreds of founders and believe we have backed the right teams to go after these problems.  The companies are based in San Francisco, San Diego, and Seattle.  They are small (e.g. under 20ppl).  They are using AI to mitigate complex legal, tax, renewable energy, and customer support industries.  We even have a new one coming online soon in psychology.

We understand it's unusual for a venture firm to post these job descriptions but as we were intimately involved in the formation of the companies, we are taking a more active operational role to ensure their success.

We don't know if these products will sell themselves or if we need to build world class sales teams to deploy them.  That's the adventure of it.  Don't let AI eat your lunch; be a part of it.

Excellent communication, written and verbal
Ability to run at hard, unstructured things and bring structure to chaos
First or early GTM experience helpful
Demonstrated track record of success and acceleration (no job hopping!)

recruiting_advice: Any backgrounds with more than 8 years will be archived immediately. Similarly, anyone that has changed jobs every year--or any job hopping of any kind--will also be ignored. Must be from a top school and include some signal of grit and staying with hard things.

name: Senior Product Engineer
description:
We have an ambitious product vision in a nascent area - AI-powered realtime collaboration - so there are a ton of interesting technical challenges on our roadmap.

We’re hiring talented full-stack/backend/ML engineers who are product-minded and excited to delight our customers. We expect every software engineer on our team to be able to work within a complex code-base, own entire product areas, and build new features end-to-end.

requirements.description: You’re a confident, independent, and experienced engineer who is used to extreme ownership and solving hard problems

Ability to work with our stack:

  • Frontend: React, Typescript, MobX

  • Backend: Node.js, Express, Typescript

  • Technologies: Firebase, Firestore, Websockets, Twilio, WebRTC, Postgres, Redis

  • ML: GPT, Transformers, PyTorch, signal processing, few-shot classification.
3+ years experience building complex systems (ideally somewhat related to ours)
A variety of technical skills, deep experience scaling products, not siloed in previous roles
Academic background from a top school (e.g. Ivies, Stanford, MIT, CMU, etc.)
Worked at a startup that scaled from an early stage

responsibilities: Concurrency & distributed systems - Our smart dialer places calls in parallel and runs a realtime AI model on each call. There are some interesting concurrency problems syncing state between Twilio, our backend, and the frontend, and knowing which calls to connect, which to continue in the background, and when to start the next call.

Realtime audio AI & precision/recall/latency tradeoffs (algorithms & models) - We use audio data, transcription, silence detection, and several other signals to detect whether a live phone call is a voicemail, a human, or a dial tree. Here, latency is a third factor added to the standard precision/recall tradeoff because it’s important we can detect humans quickly. Our approach involves LLM embeddings, few-shot learning, data labeling, and continuous monitoring of model performance in prod.

Latency (infrastructure) - If our model took 5 seconds to detect a human on a phone call, the human would hang up. It’s imperative we can detect quickly and that our users can execute calls quickly. There’s latency across the detection pipeline including transcription models, audio models, websockets, Twilio API, database transactions, etc.

Smart call funnels & playbooks (data wrangling, backend eng, GPT-3, UX) - At what point in the conversation do my reps get stuck? What are the toughest questions that we need to address? Can I “program” a playbook so that Nooks will help my team standardize toward best-practices? We’re using GPT-3 and other LLM’s to turn companies’ mostly unstructured call data into actionable strategies & feedback loops.

Conversation embeddings & markov models (ML modeling) - What does the anatomy of a call look like? If I say XYZ, what are the different ways the prospect might answer and the probabilities of each? Conditioned on the first half of the call, what do I say next to maximize the likelihood that I book a demo at the end of the call? Can we use LLM’s to generate embeddings of conversations that we can use to cluster similar conversation patterns and predict where the conversation is headed?

Integrations - Our dialer integrates with customers’ sales engagement platforms. Every new platform we integrate with, that opens up a larger market for our product. When building integrations, we need to make sure they’re robust, reliable, and well-abstracted.

Frontend performance - There’s a lot going on in the frontend - WebRTC, Twilio, React rendering, websockets, etc. And people use Nooks throughout the workday, so we need to make sure our app is performant across a wide range of devices
workPlaceText: Hybrid with office in San Francisco
experience_info: as a software engineer or in a related technical role
recruiting_advice:
See our Notion page with more info on Nooks as a company here.

Our main filters (we look for at least one of these 3)

  • Strong experience

    • FAANG (really Google, Meta, Amazon, Apple, Microsoft) - L6+

    • At fast growing startup for 1.5+ years, i.e 50 engineers → 200

    • Worked on hard relevant tech at a Series D or under while still being flexible product engineer:

      • Data wrangling, ETL, & data pipelines: Hive, Presto, Spark, Airflow, SQL, Kafka

      • MLOps: Sagemaker, MLFlow (Databricks), Pinecone / Weaviate / Milvus, Elasticsearch

      • Backend devops and observability: Kubernetes, Docker, Docker Compose, Terraform / Ansible, Prometheus, Grafana, Datadog

      • Frontend performance / infra: Selenium / Playwright e2e tests, Chromatic, Storybook (for building component libraries)

      • Web audio: WebRTC, TURN / OPUS audio codecs, HLS

    • 5-8 years of experience in a few different solid companies with career progression

  • “Builder” - builds lots of stuff fast, impacts business bottom line. Very product oriented

    • Failed startup founder

    • Founding employee at startup

    • Built impressive side projects with lots of meaningful “customer” feedback

    • Open-source work

    • Published papers

  • Really smart:

    • Good college (Stanford, MIT, Berkeley, CMU, etc.)

    • For those with 2+ years of experience: worked at a place known for a high hiring bar for at least 1+ year. (Or interned at two such places)

      • Startups: Rippling, OpenAI, Plaid, Notion, Airtable, Tailscale, Anthropic, Kalshi, Applied Intuition, Robinhood, Jasper, Character.ai, Snorkel AI, Fastly, MosaicML, Pinecone, Hebbia, Tome

      • Bigger tech: Stripe, Figma, Scale AI, Databricks, Affirm, Airbnb, TikTok / Bytedance, Netflix, Snowflake, Waymo, Nuro, Brex, Ramp, Arc, Coinbase, Instagram, Dropbox

      • FAANG - not always a straight positive signal, but specific divisions

        • E.g in Google: Deepmind, X, Search, Google Brain

        • At Microsoft: Azure

        • Fast promotion cycle at FAANG - i.e L5 in 1.5 years - is positive signal for being really smart

      • Finance: Jane Street, Citadel, Two Sigma, Optiver, Hudson River Trading, Optiver, Rentech, Vatic, etc.

company.name: Nooks
company.description:
Nooks is a platform transforming sales reps from manual laborers to scientists.

With today’s technology, sales reps shouldn’t need to manually write hundreds of emails, research hundreds of websites/linkedins, and make hundreds of calls. They should instead focus on the parts of their job that actually require people - talking to customers, being creative, and problem-solving. With a combination of AI tools, automation and real-time collaboration, Nooks can do the rest.

Teams that use Nooks often see a 2-3x increase in reps’ productivity within weeks! And we’re working on adding prospecting / research workflows (to-be-announced soon!).
company.teamAbout:
The Team

Nooks is ~45 people. Engineering & product are mostly in SF and go to our office 2-3x/week. The go-to-market team is distributed across the U.S.

  • The founders (Dan, Rohan, and Nikhil) met studying AI at Stanford, have published in top AI journals, Forbes 30u30, worked at Scale AI, Tesla Autopilot, etc.

  • The engineering team has won international math & physics olympiads, has experience at Google, Facebook, Slack, Quora, Scale AI, Bolt, Snap, Flexport, and other fast-growing startups.

  • The sales team have been top-performers at companies like Gong, Amplitude, LeadIQ, and Orum.

Fast growth

We’ve grown $0 → ~$5M ARR in 2 years. We grew 4x in 2023 and expect to 3x by EOY 2024.

company.name: TubeScience
company.description:
Over the past 8 years, we quietly bootstrapped TubeScience into the largest producer of social media ads in the USA. While our public profile is minimal (ironically, we don’t do any self-marketing), we have hundreds of employees, billions of dollars in ad spend, and deep technical partnerships with Meta and other platforms. 

What helped us do so is an obsession for numbers over opinions, and a unique “pay for performance” business model. Clients only pay if our ads outperform anything they or any other agency delivers. It’s a very “honest” business model, and clients tend to love it (resulting in extremely high retention and all our sales to date coming from inbound / word of mouth). 

As we look towards the future and AI advances, we see an incredible opportunity to reinvent our business. We plan to take everything we’ve learned, and turn it into a true self-service SaaS offering that can power agencies and in-house teams alike.
benefits: Be part of a passionate, entrepreneurial team that is driven to succeed and working on a high impact problem.
A unique opportunity to shape a team from the ground up.

name: MLOps Engineer
description:
We're hiring 2 MLOps Engineers for our team at Cleanlab!

We're looking for someone with strong engineering skills and experience productionizing code/models in cloud environments, while maintaining the necessary infrastructure. They should be comfortable with large software systems.

We do not require deep knowledge of ML algorithms, but candidates must have previously worked on the infrastructure to support many ML and Data projects at their previous companies

requirements.description: Relevant experience at top tier tech companies with the best infrastructure
Lives in SF and is excited to join the team in-office at least few days a week.
Previous startup experience
Experience working on the infra to support many ML and data projects at their previous companies.
Experience with Sagemaker, MLflow, Databricks, Snowflake, Redshift, ELT/ETL tools, OpenAI, LangChain
Experience with Python (pandas, polars), Relational databases, AWS, Sagemaker, Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD e.g. Jenkins, Flask/Django
CS degree from top-tier university (Ivies, MIT, Stanford, CMU, etc.)

responsibilities: Develop and maintain cloud infrastructure for a web application that has many users, each with many datasets/models, some of which are quite large.
Work on large-scale ML projects with Cleanlab enterprise customers, from inception to production.
Collaborate with other engineers to build and maintain large-scale systems and establish a strong engineering culture across the company.

Pioneer novel software systems for the rapidly growing field of data-centric AI. Our tools enable data scientists/engineers (across all industries) to effectively diagnose/fix issues in their datasets thus improving the quality of their business’s core asset.
Work on cutting-edge MLOps with guidance from MIT PhDs who are prominent in ML research.
Work with a modern tech stack (the latest tooling and ML models) at a dynamic startup.
workPlaceText: Working at least 3 days a week from our office in SF (SoMa)
visa_text_more: We are willing to sponsor visas for the right candidate
experience_info: in MLOps. Schoolwork or general data science work does not count here, you should have tackled hard MLOps challenges at companies dealing with massive datasets, reliable model serving, cloud infrastructure, etc.
recruiting_advice:
We're hiring 2 MLOps Engineers for our team at Cleanlab!

We've hired with Paraform previously, and are excited to keep growing our team with your help.

Both hires should be: software engineer who has managed the infrastructure to support data science or AI teams and has 5 years of experience seeing workflow required to support hundreds and thousands of models being deployed and large-scale data pipelines.

It's important to us that candidates have seen great infrastructure at top tech companies/startups because the infrastructure can vary so much across companies. Who dealt with the best of the best infrastructure and has an idea of what that can even look like and bring that to our platform?

Have they worked on modern cloud infrastructure problems on AI teams? That would be the number one thing. ML modeling skills are not important, just having worked on cloud & data infrastructure ideally in an AI-related context.

When you screen candidates, signs of exceptional:

  • CS degrees at the best universities

  • How active they are on github (do they have projects with over 1000 stars on them? are they a main contributor to a notable repo etc)

  • Experience working at top startups or top tech companies

  • Many years experience with AWS infrastructure for Data/AI projects.
avoid_traits: Job hopping
Living in south bay and saying the commute is ok. We only want candidates from SF proper / surrounding area, or who will relocate
benefits: Stipend for attending conferences to keep up with the latest innovations in ML and software.
Competitive salary (+ equity offering for certain roles), with regular opportunities for a raise if things are going well.
Parental Leave. Take time with your new family members!
Unlimited PTO + Unlimited sick days + 10 company-wide holidays.

company.name: Cleanlab
company.description:
Everything we do at Cleanlab is guided by our north star – to improve the world’s ML data more easily and quicker than any other solution – enabling AI systems to train more reliably on real-world, messy, error-prone data. We develop next-generation data-centric AI, open-source algorithms and provide no-code SaaS enterprise solutions to help individuals and teams at companies (across all industries) diagnose/fix issues in their datasets and produce more reliable ML models by providing clean labels for training.

While many companies can help store/manage data or develop ML models, there exist few solutions today to improve the quality of existing data, which is the core asset of the modern enterprise. This is where you come in. At Cleanlab, you’ll be able to take ownership of critical projects that pioneer the future of data-centric AI.

We are a hybrid company, with over half of our team (and office) located in San Francisco.
benefits: Premium health insurance (+ dental and vision)
Professional development stipend to keep up with the latest innovations in ML and software.
Competitive salary (+ equity offering for certain roles), with regular opportunities for a raise if things are going well.
Relocation bonus to move to San Francisco
company.teamAbout: Prior to Cleanlab, our founders (3 ML PhDs from MIT) worked at OpenAI, Google, Microsoft, Amazon, AWS, Facebook AI Research (FAIR), Dropbox, Oculus, Palantir, NASA, General Electric, MIT Lincoln Laboratory, MIT, Harvard, and Stanford – at every place we worked we repeatedly encountered the same issue – AI solutions failed to work reliably on real-world, human-centric data due to label errors and poor data quality. So, we spent eight years of PhD research at MIT inventing a new field to solve this problem and after successful pilots with world-leading organizations, Cleanlab emerged.

company.name: Paraform
company.description:
Paraform is a marketplace connecting companies with open roles and recruiters who can fill them.

Companies can work with specialized recruiters more cheaply, monitor their performance, and flex based on demand. Recruiters don't have to worry about acquiring clients while earning and working on their own terms.

Incredible teams at the most exciting startups and enterprises are being built as a result.

We power talent for a wide range of customers:

  • Enterprise - Palantir, Anduril, Scale AI

  • Growth stage - Eight Sleep, Character.ai, Applied Intuition

  • Early stage - Mintlify, Jenni.ai, Decagon.ai

We've raised money from:

  • Co-founders - Twitch, Doordash, and Eventbrite

  • VCs - A*, Soma Capital, Founders Inc, and Primer Sazze

  • Leadership - Palantir, Opendoor, Ramp, and Scale AI

Other highlights:

  • GMV/Revenue increasing 50% MoM

  • We just moved into a beautiful new office in North Beach. Check out video of it here
benefits: 🌉 Beautiful office with golden gate bridge view at the Fort Mason Center in San Francisco. Moving to North Beach soon and we think it's even better :)
🌏 Company Offsites (NY, LA, Sydney, Seoul etc)
company.teamAbout:
Hey 👋 we're John and Jeff, the co-founders of Paraform. Funnily enough, this all started when we tried to recruit each other in 2022. Ever since then, we've experienced first-hand how broken recruiting is and our mission is to finally fix it.

Our values and culture

  • We work hard and enjoy being together in person. We are transparent about our work ethic and expectations because it enables us to have extreme ownership in building at a pace that is unmatched.

  • Customers, customers, customers. We're customer-obsessed and always start with the customer first. We are the customer support team.

  • Ship fast and break things. We believe great products come from lots of experimentation, so we value fast development. No one is going to wait around for us to make things, especially something that's perfect.

  • Take care of each other. We trust each other and want to enable everyone to do their best work. That means an all food and transportation compensated, gym membership, unlimited PTO, global offsites, premium healthcare and a free bike.

name: Founding Engineer
description:
The software we build powers our Microschools end-to-end. From day one it helps teachers source real estate, recruit students, and provide an (actually) personalized education to every student. It offers rich insights to parents, enables virtual teachers to deliver exceptional experiences, and runs our back-office operations stack. We have a huge surface area to cover and a lot of hard work in front of us.

We’re building a small team of exceptional, hands-on engineers to play a critical role in building PrimerOS - and you’ll be joining as the third member.

A full JD can be found here: https://withprimer.notion.site/Founding-Engineer-JD-446b8057188443448eb6f9cbfb2ad0f8?pvs=4

requirements.description: You have an immense pride in your craft. Watching a session replay of a user having a bad experience with product you built makes you sick. Every detail matters as this gets sent out to 1m+ kids.
We believe in in-person, just like our schools. We are located in the sunny Mission district in San Francisco.
You have a strong grasp of engineering fundamentals. We use a healthy combination of TypeScript, NodeJS, GraphQL, Prisma, NextJS, React & Relay.
The unknowns of the early-stage fuel you. You love rolling up your sleeves and figuring out what needs to happen.
Desire to work at an intense, in-person environment in SF and be part of the foundation of a fast-growing startup.
You have an unbridled passion for fixing the US education system.
requirements.explanation: This is, as you’d expect, non-negotiable. This work is incredibly hard. But if we succeed, it will be the most fulfilling work of our lives. On the days and weeks that it feels like we’re chewing glass, there are only two things that will get you through: a deep passion for fixing this problem, and looking around and seeing a team that shares that passion. We can guarantee the latter, but only you can guarantee the former.

responsibilities: Own, build, and be responsible for complete product areas end to end.
Work closely with our educators, designer, and head of product to define and build delightful product experiences.
Interact with our users almost every day - you'll meet lots of students, teachers, and parents. Day in and day out you'll see how your work makes a real difference.
Help set the foundations of our engineering culture and grow with the company. Refine our principles and have impact beyond just your engineering work.
Understand when the work is a marathon and when it’s a sprint. This is not a cushy 9-5 job — but we know when to take breaks and pace ourselves.

recruiting_advice:
Primer has an obviously impactful and important mission and has a huge opportunity in ahead of it.

One strategy we find successful is to "pull people out of the matrix" - find people working at unimpactful companies (think accounting software, sales CRMs, yet another AI startup, etc) - and lead the conversation with how they could be spending their time working on something that changes the world.

Another we like is to find education companies who once pitched ambitious visions, but since have shut down - and finding the people who were drawn to their vision. Altschool is a good example here.

One reason to join Primer is that the next few years will likely see a huge shift in the edu apps & what’s possible with a software “Primer”. we’re best positioned to benefit from those advances.

company.name: Primer
company.description:
Fixing our K-12 education system is a civilizationally-important problem. We believe that all of our problems — including the ones that dominate the headlines — are downstream of education.

We have a simple thesis on how to solve it: empower 1,000's of educators to launch microschools in their communities.

We believe the historical tradeoff between price (tuition) and quality is a false dichotomy.

PrimerOS automates and eliminates much of the COGS of traditional schools. Microschools have a structural advantage — asset-light real estate — which means much lower capex and opex. You put it together, and you get something that’s never existed before: a world-class education that’s accessible to normal American families and can rapidly scale.
company.teamAbout:
The next generation is stuck in an industrialized education system. We’re relying on them to invent the future, but they won’t be able to solve 2050’s challenges with an educational supply chain built for the 1950’s. We need a new system, one where kids learn how to think instead of what to think — and that’s what we’re building at Primer.

We’re a team of engineers, educators, and storytellers building a new education system for the next generation.

company.name: Vellum AI
company.description:
At Vellum, our mission is to be the primary platform companies use to bring AI into production. AI is the biggest platform shift since the internet, the applications are everywhere! With foundation models getting better we expect the world to be dramatically different in the future. We intend to be the platform layer to bring this amazing technology to life in production use cases.

We enable companies to bring real business value from AI / LLMs. The output generated by AI / LLMs is usually stochastic and bringing AI into production requires robust testing and choosing the right model for the job. We’ve seen companies spend months of engineering time building good tooling for this (time which could be spent on their core end user facing product) and despite this they struggle to get the best results out of these models. Our platform provides companies best in class tooling to use their own data in production AI applications.

We’re a YC W23 company, raised $9.5m and are backed by top investors like Rebel Fund, Eastlink Capital, Arash Ferdowsi (co-founder of Dropbox), Dharmesh Shah (co-founder of Hubspot), Dan Scholnick (board member of Weights & Biases, Docker, New Relic), and Divya Bhat (former YC group partner, 2x CEO). We announced our fundraise on TechCrunch here: https://techcrunch.com/2023/07/11/prompt-engineering-startup-vellum-ai/

We’re excited to build our core team. The initial team will play a key role in the long term growth of the company.​

P.S: Why the name Vellum? - Vellum is a type of paper - the Magna Carta was written on Vellum. We intend to be the standard source of record in production - You can’t spell Vellum without LLM 😉
company.teamAbout:
Working at Vellum

  • We’re laser focused on helping companies bring AI into production and providing real value. Decision making is simple: if what we do allows our users to increase how many use cases of AI they’re able to successfully put into production, then we do it!

  • Don’t cut corners, cut the right corners. What can you do with 10% of your time to get 90% of the desired impact? Now that you only spent 10% of the time doing something, imagine how much more can be done with the rest of your time!!

  • Everyone is a 1000x team member when they’re passionate about the problems they’re solving and love the people they’re working with

  • Because we trust each other, we can move fast and have fun doing it 😄

Our Values

We live these values every day, we know there are difficult tradeoffs to each of these values and we’re willing to accept them.

1. It’s always Day 0

Every day is an opportunity to excel. We tackle challenges head-on, execute relentlessly, and strive for continuous improvement.

2. Customers come first

We are committed to exceptional customer service. Customers should be delighted when using our product. We measure our success by the tangible business outcomes our customers achieve through our products.

3. Be resilient, not stubborn

We maintain a positive outlook and work through challenges. Our team supports each other, ensuring we don’t let setbacks hinder our progress. We recognize the fine line between resilience and stubbornness, striving to stay on the right side of it.

4. Take care of each other

We believe in the power of teamwork. Our high-trust, low-ego culture ensures we support each other, cover for teammates when needed, and prioritize collective success over individual achievements. We hire and invest in top talent.

5. Go and see

We take full responsibility for our work, striving for excellence in everything we do. No task is beneath us, and we actively seek out and address issues at their source. Our commitment to relentless execution ensures continuous improvement and high-quality results.

6. Share more, share often

We prioritize clear and frequent communication using various tools. By keeping everyone informed, we minimize surprises and ensure alignment across the team.

7. Be transparent

We are committed to honesty with current and future teammates, customers and investors. Transparent communication and setting realistic expectations are essential to success.

8. Love your work, Love AI

We are passionate about AI and genuinely curious about its potential. Our team actively engages with the technology, ensuring we stay at the forefront of the industry.

9. Cut the right corners

We prioritize efficiency and rapid execution. By focusing on the most impactful tasks and adopting a Minimum Viable Product (MVP) mentality, we move quickly without sacrificing quality.

10. Don’t be an asshole

We maintain a respectful and supportive workplace. We communicate openly, give constructive feedback, and avoid ego-driven behaviors. This value ensures a positive and collaborative work environment.

name: Software Engineer
description: tl;dr: we're looking for a world-class engineer who loves simplifying complex systems, unifying fragmented data, and building high-scale backend systems. Learn more about us here (link).

requirements.description: Startup focused: experience at small (Seed/Series A/Series B) startup. No more than 2yrs at later-stage/public companies.
In-person: pumped to work in-person in SF 5 days per week.
Familiarity with cloud infrastructure (e.g. AWS)
Top US/CAN school: studied CS at top 30 undergrad school in US or Canada
Self-motivated, high ownership, low ego; desire to work on a fast-paced, intense, fun team. Excited to be our next hire; passion for building a world-class engineering culture

responsibilities: INTERESTING TECHNICAL CHALLENGES:

Unification: we’re unifying dozens-to-hundreds of fragmented systems under a single standard that we define. Our unification covers data objects, data models, authentication, account-linking UX, and features like filters and pagination. When designing any new feature, we have to do it in a scalable way. For example, when adding filters, we have to research each system we support (and plan to support) and create a generic, system-agnostic solution.

On-prem: we’re connecting with many types of on-prem systems (SQL-based, DLL-based, API-based), many built 20-40 years ago. We provide tremendous value to customers allowing them to interface with these systems in a secure, fast, reliable way, as if they’re modern, cloud-based products. We need to support real-time communication and webhooks when they don’t exist (e.g., using web-sockets).

Scale & speed: we’re handling millions of API requests per day, and growing daily. For our products that we power with our own API (e.g. Analytics), we need to store and retrieve large amounts of data in an efficient way, building elegant caching layers to reduce latency. We ship code daily and iterate quickly based on actual feedback from paying customers (they share tons!).

Operational excellence: we’re creating a reliable API layer on top of many old systems that don’t have APIs. It’s like building a skyscraper on quicksand, enforced by SLAs. We need to innovate in expanding the depth and breadth of our integrations while simultaneously increasing our development velocity. We need to be very creative in how to continually test our code and integrations, creating scalable testing frameworks that can catch edge cases and bugs across 1k+ endpoints.

Mix of back-end and front-end: we’re building front-end apps that dog-food our own APIs (e.g. Sync, Analytics). This helps us build world-class APIs because we suffer any pain present in our API. We’re building both the lego blocks and the higher-level lego models: we see what kinds of APIs our SaaS customers want, then also look at the kinds of API niceties we want for our own applications (like a caching layer, advanced filtering) and implement a combination of the two.

Variety: without knowing, you might assume adding a new integration is low-ambiguity and routine. But each integration we launch is special, completely different and posing unique challenges. This requires researching that system and its nuances in great depth before building on top of it. It’s part engineering, part archeology.

Construction Software Companies use our API to integrate their apps with these systems. company.name: Dupe.com
company.description:
Dupe.com has built the fastest way for shoppers to understand their purchase options and to feel confident in what to buy next. Shopping needs a reset, and Dupe is obliging.

We've built a powerful visual shopping engine that helps shoppers save money and time, and helps them feel confident on what to buy next. We're a small group of relentless and creative executors with an inspired sense of "can do anything" energy.

Dupe was born out of the ashes of a 3 year endeavor to bring AI personal assistants to shopping when we realized that only some shoppers care about staying organized as they shop, but everyone cares about saving money.

Using our insights, we've organically grown Dupe to over 2 million shoppers in 3 months and have grown into a profitable cash-generating machine — it has never been more clear that we're at the very beginning of something enormous.

Join us if you share in that electricity and relentlessness required at the early stages of an exciting upstart.
company.productDescription:
Let’s talk about sticker shock.

We’ve all been there, right? You’re shopping online, and you come across something you love: incredible designer furniture, flawless housewares, the perfect top. You’re instantly obsessed. Your heart skips a beat as you start to imagine buying it… but then you see the price.

Before, there was nothing you could do. Too expensive? Too bad. But now, you have a choice.

You can keep shopping like a normie, taking prices at face value and meekly accepting that you’re limited by your bank account. Or, you can use Dupe to find lookalikes you can actually afford. Taking the products you want as a starting point, then letting Dupe search the entire internet for the same or similar items at a fraction of the price. We think it’s an easy call.

Dupe is the secret that everyone should be in on. It’s a magic trick. A cheat code. A loophole of epic proportions. Why it isn’t mainstream household information yet, we have no idea — but we’re glad you found us early.

Everyone deserves to be surrounded by beautiful things. We built Dupe to make it happen.
company.teamAbout:
We're a team of seasoned startup veterans who've been in the trenches and know what it takes to build something big. Backed by top-tier VCs who believe in our vision, we're well-funded and laser-focused on our mission: revolutionizing online shopping.

Our roadmap? Massive growth and profitability. We're not just dreaming big—we're executing with precision.

company.name: AtoB
company.description:
The trucking and logistics industry provides the backbone of the economy. But the payments infrastructure on which it runs is broken. For the hard-working men and women of this sector, the existing suite of payment tools is outdated, difficult to use, prone to fraud, and saddled with shady fee structures. The incumbent players in this space often overlook the economic and practical needs of this user base.

We're changing that. AtoB is building Stripe for Transportation — modernizing the payments infrastructure for trucking and logistics. Supply chains rely on the timely movement of capital to function efficiently. Our end game is a world in which that capital movement occurs fairly, smoothly, and without delay. As we pursue that end game, we aim to center our customers in every way — offering them world-class customer experience and building products that work with and around the unique constraints of their daily lives. We build for fleet managers in the office and drivers on the road. We strive for products that are efficient, satisfying, and useful. Our customers enable our modern economy — they deserve it.
company.teamAbout:
Our founding team has backgrounds in payments, working on autonomous vehicles at Cruise Automation, leading ops and growth for Uber, and building apps that were featured on the Apple app store. We have staff and senior engineers from Google, Uber, Meta, Shopify, Stripe, Chime, and other leading technology companies.

 

We have raised $125 million+ from investors such as General Catalyst, Elad Gil, Bloomberg Beta, Y Combinator, XYZ; founders and CEOs of companies such as Google (Eric Schmidt), Salesforce (Marc Benioff), Coinbase (Brian Armstrong), DoorDash (Tony Xu), Instacart, Gusto; strategic investors like Mastercard, Flexport and Samsara.

We were named to Forbes annual Next Billion-Dollar Startup List, and have just recently been selected to join the World Economic Forum as a Global Innovator.

On one hand, you’ll be learning and coaching your team to provide exceptional client satisfaction. On the other, you’ll get your hands dirty, oversee a high-performing team, constantly be learning, and withstand the pressure of competing priorities under rapid growth.

You will report directly to the Operations Lead, Arvee, and collaborate closely with other key leaders, including the Systems Lead and Process Lead.

requirements.description: Client Orientation: You have solid experience in handling client interactions, with a focus on boosting client satisfaction and loyalty.
Problem Solving: You have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills in high-pressure situations and are adept at addressing challenges and enhancing operational efficiency.
Figure it out: you’re likely one of those timeless people that could be dropped anywhere in the world, in any century, and you’d figure it out. Your friends probably think of you as that person :)
Leadership: You have demonstrated the ability to lead and motivate a team, driving high performance and fostering a positive work environment in your previous roles.
SLA Management: You are well-versed in monitoring and meeting service level agreements, ensuring all performance metrics are achieved.
Operational Management: You have robust skills in managing daily operations, with a track record of effectively overseeing team activities while keeping stellar performance.
Language: Proficiency in English, both spoken and written.
Communication: You have strong communication and interpersonal skills, ensuring clear and productive interactions within the team and with clients.
Innovation: You have a track record of implementing innovative solutions in past roles. You always think about what can be done better and action your ideas.

Coaching: You have proven expertise in coaching and mentoring team members. You genuinely want to see your team succeed and do everything in your power to ensure they’re reaching their professional goals.
Proactive: You don’t wait to be told what to do. Instead, you are proactive and take initiative in dynamic, high-pressure situations.

responsibilities: Leadership: You’ll lead a team of care coordinators, ensuring they are motivated, well-supported in their daily tasks, and achieving their potential as operators.
Operational Management: You’ll maintain smooth operations for your assigned area and continually seek improvements to enhance its efficiency.
Communication: You’ll ensure clear and effective communication within the team and with patients to keep everyone well-informed.

Training and Development: You’ll identify the best ways to keep your team performing at the highest level and execute them effectively — you’ll constantly obtain and action their feedback on how the team can improve to best serve our fellas.
Problem Solving: You’ll address issues promptly and manage escalations with skill and care.
Coaching: You’ll be a mentor to your team members — constantly helping them achieve their professional goals.
SLA Management: You’ll oversee that all team activities consistently meet or exceed our service standards.
Client Experience: You’ll proactively enhance client satisfaction by delivering superior service and anticipating their needs.
Proactive Innovation: You’ll actively propose and implement changes aimed at improving client experiences, collaborating across teams for success.
workPlaceText: This is a fully remote role.
experience_info: in customer success or a similar role, ideally with at least a year of leadership experience
recruiting_advice:
we are only hiring in the Philippines

what are the most important aspects you are looking to find out in their interview? 

their team management skills

what the candidates needs to have in their resume before I make de call?

ops manager, CX manager, CS manager, team leads

good companies to go for:

fintech: GCash, paymaya / mayaE-commerce: Lazada, ShopeeLogsitics/Delivery: Grab, Sari SukiHigh-growth startup: Kumu
avoid_traits: Project Manager Experience
Consultant Experience
Based anywhere that is not in the Philippines
benefits: PTO with a yearly minimum (>2wks/yr + local national holidays)
Our team is fully distributed across the world and functions fully remotely

company.name: Fella Health
company.description:
We are the telemedicine clinic for bigger guys, worldwide. We use medical weight loss treatment to solve our fellas' most pressing healthcare need, then remain a fella's core healthcare provider for the rest of their life - focused on men's health, longevity, mental health, and primary care.

We will have served 1 million fellas by the end of 2026, and 10 million fellas by the end of 2028.

Our mission is to solve male obesity worldwide, by accelerating the take-up of GLP-1s in middle-aged men. From this, we’ll become the world’s leading men’s health brand.

We’ve grown >130x since Sept 2022 (currently growing >30% MoM) and are strongly cashflow positive. We have expanded our state coverage to >95% of US population, have started to expand our clinical protocol beyond weight (e.g. testosterone), and are eyeing up international expansion.

We're still a young startup and are moving quickly. We have a long way to go. This is still Day 1.

We're backed by top healthcare & consumer investors:

  • Y Combinator

  • Global Founders Capital — backed Facebook, Slack, LinkedIn, Revolut, Rocket Internet

  • AngelList Early Stage Fund (backed by Naval Ravikant)

  • BrandProject (venture-builder behind 2 unicorns)

  • The founders of Indeed, Curative (unicorn), Alan (unicorn), Kaia Health (>$300mil valuation), Vouch Insurance (>$500mil valuation), Not Boring (Packy McCormick)
benefits: Vacation: generous PTO with a yearly minimum (>2wks/yr + local national holidays)
Remote: our team is fully distributed across the world and functions fully remotely
Personal development: budget for books, courses, coaching ($400/yr)
Personal wellness: budget for gym, health apps ($400/yr)
company.teamAbout:
💬 These are the core cultural standards to which we hold ourselves & our team-members at Fella:

  • Belief in the mission — we will have served 10 million fellas by the end of 2028 (1 million fellas by end of 2026) and we transform the life of most fellas who join. We have a lot of work to do. We are obsessed with our fellas and are dedicated to the mission.

  • Bulldozing barriers — the world is malleable and we shape it. We truly believe this and act accordingly. We are relentlessly resourceful and are at the mercy of no-one but ourselves.

  • Unwavering integrity — we are at the frontier, so we often live in ambiguity with no trodden path. When we can’t look to others for guidance, we must maintain impeccable ethics and unwavering integrity.

  • Enduring frugality — we are frugal. We hate being wasteful and we are anti-luxury. We spend our cash wisely & carefully - in a way that would make our grandmas proud.

  • Do what is needed — speed is critical and often the solutions we need are messy. We are comfortable moving quickly and taking on gritty work.

  • End-to-end ownership — we are comfortable owning projects from noticing the problem to delivering the outcome.

  • Dedication to excellence — we are obsessed with our role, with a commitment to compounding self-improvement.

  • Commitment to candor — we believe in open communication and radical transparency. We are clear & caring communicators, welcoming feedback.

  • Only the paranoid survive — the road of expansion is bumpy. We are not fair weather sailers; we embrace the storms. However much we’ve already done, however far we’ve already come — all our work is still ahead of us.

  • Keep your head down — we’re boring people doing exciting work. We don’t chase short-term status: we ignore short-term dopamine hits and focus on what matters. Outsiders will underestimate us and we revel in that.

name: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
Vest Labs is seeking high-agency individuals to join their team in shaping the next era of finance. The role involves overseeing infrastructure operations, deploying and configuring K8s clusters, and designing CI/CD pipelines. Qualifications include 5+ years of DevOps engineering experience, cloud engineering experience, strong scripting and automation skills, and excellent communication. Bonus points if you have experience working with Kafka or DigitalOcean.

We are hiring very urgently for this role. We have a public launch of our product in mid-July, and would love to have this person onboard for that if possible!

requirements.description: Strong scripting and automation skills (e.g. Python)
Must be able to join the team in person NYC Soho office
requirements.explanation: We're open to hybrid at some point, but we need them to be available to be fully in person for their first month at least.

requirements.description: Cloud engineering experience (AWS, Azure, DigitalOcean) in deploying and managing production environments
Experience working at a high-growth startup
Excellent communication skills
Cultural compatibility/familiarity with East Asian cultures (due to our clients and contractors)
requirements.explanation: We have a large client base located in East Asia as well as contractors we work with based there. Therefore, we prefer candidates with working business fluency in East Asian languages (e.g., Mandarin, Korean, Japanese) or with strong cultural competency and familiarity with East Asian cultures. This will enable more effective engagement with both our clients and contractors.

requirements.description: Experience worked with Kafka or DigitalOcean
Managed micro-services with Docker + k8s in production setting

responsibilities: Oversee all major operations related to infrastructure, e.g. maintaining, monitoring, and scaling the production environment
Deploy and configure K8s clusters
Design and build CI/CD pipeline
workPlaceText: In-person in Soho, NYC
experience_info: in DevOps engineering
recruiting_advice: Vest is not a typical startup. The candidate will be challenged like never before, have little work life balance, but grow faster than any other opportunity. They will be a part a lean and agile team backed by some of the best investors and advisors that will stop at nothing to win.
avoid_traits: not communicative - we expect proactive communication
way too focused on compensation package/benefits - we want people who have an "all in" mentality
require structure/formal processes to function - we seek folks who operate on flexible scopes and can just get things done
unwilling to take ownership - if there are no tasks at hand, we expect the candidate to actively seek out things to own and improve

company.name: Vest
company.description: Vest Labs (https://www.vest.exchange/) is building a cutting-edge digital asset financial exchange backed by Jane Street and powered by zero-knowledge proofs. Our mission is to rebuild every financial product into their trustless counterpart.
company.productDescription: Cutting-edge derivatives exchange powered by zero-knowledge proofs.
company.teamAbout:
Our team and advisors include computer scientists, wall street executives, cryptographers, DeFi founders, and physicists.

We are backed by visionary venture capitalists, quantitative trading firms, and global financial institutions such as Jane Street, QCP Capital, BBH, Selini Capital, MatterLabs, Symbolic, and executives from BlackRock, Citadel, Goldman, and Point72 who share our vision for a fully democratized financial system.

name: Software Engineer - Developer Productivity (London)
description:
Are you passionate about engineering quality, efficiency, and increasing the impact of engineers around you?

Software Engineers at Palantir build software at scale to transform how organizations globally use data. As a Software Engineer on Developer Productivity, you’ll identify, develop, and drive investments to improve the velocity and quality of our engineering, as well as bolster the happiness and productivity of other developers.

The role spans a spectrum of areas, such as build and software supply-chain systems, platform runtime environments, telemetry relating concurrency, memory/performance optimizations, and monitoring/alerting. Your primary users will be other developers at Palantir. They will be empowered with the software you develop to build capabilities used by research scientists, aerospace engineers, intelligence analysts, and economic forecasters in countries around the world. There will be opportunities to contribute to open source software, including projects maintained by others that we leverage. You’ll work autonomously within a community that will support and challenge you as you grow to become a strong technical contributor and engineering leader.

The team is hiring for Frontend and Backend engineers.

requirements.description: Strong coding skills with demonstrated proficiency in programming languages, such as Java, C++, Python, JavaScript/TypeScript, or similar languages.
Great problem solving skills with ability to dive into and navigate existing complex systems.
Familiarity with data structures, storage systems, cloud infrastructure, and other technical tools.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.

responsibilities: Define and build standard practices for how services are operated and observed throughout their deployment
Build libraries and tooling for defining service APIs and the RPC interactions between microservices; like the conjure ecosystem
Unify frontend build and CI infrastructure across all of Palantir
Help developers understand and adhere to development practices by building great tools and development processes
Push Palantir to the cutting edge of software supply chain security
workPlaceText: 3-4 days a week in the office. Relocation services are available to all new hires relocating 50+ miles to their new Palantir office of employment. Relocation support may be utilized for 12 months after the new hire's start date. After 12 months, relocation benefits will expire and unused benefits can no longer be used.
experience_info: in software engineering, preferably in fields such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Software Engineering, Physics.
recruiting_advice:
What We Value

  • Expertise and depth of understanding of a technology or problem space. Embracing, centralizing, and abstracting complexity away from our users in order to expose simple, powerful APIs for consumers that solve otherwise incredibly complex technical problems.

  • Ability to understand how technical decisions impact individuals who will use what you’re building and drive to super-power those people.

  • Empathy for developer and operator workflows and productivity.

  • Awareness of recent industry practices and open source advancements.

  • Active US Security clearance, or eligibility and willingness to obtain a US Security clearance is beneficial but not necessary.
tech_stack: A variety of languages, including Java, Go, and TypeScript
Open-source databases like Cassandra, Lucene, Elasticsearch
Open-source libraries/frameworks like GraphQL, Undertow, Jackson, and Log4j
Industry-standard build tooling, including Gradle, Webpack, CircleCI, and GitHub

company.name: Palantir
company.description:
At Palantir (NYSE: PLTR), we're helping the world's most important institutions use their data to solve their most urgent problems. Our software lets our customers integrate and analyze all of their data so they can answer questions that they couldn't before. From delivering disaster relief to building safer automobiles, we're honored to help make our partners better at their most important work.

Together with our customers, we're building the future of national security, healthcare, energy, finance, manufacturing, and more. And we need bright minds from around the world to help us.
company.teamAbout:
We want every Palantirian to achieve their best outcomes, that’s why we celebrate individuals’ strengths, skills, and interests, from your first interview to your longterm growth, rather than rely on traditional career ladders. Paying attention to the needs of our community enables us to optimize our opportunities to grow and helps ensure many pathways to success at Palantir. Promoting health and well-being across all areas of Palantirians’ lives is just one of the ways we’re investing in our community. Note that our offerings may vary by region.

In keeping consistent with Palantir’s values and culture, we believe employees are “better together” and in-person work affords the opportunity for more creative outcomes. Therefore, we encourage employees to work from our offices to foster connectivity and innovation. Many teams do offer hybrid options (WFH a day or two a week), allowing our employees to strike the right trade-off for their personal productivity. Based on business need, there are a few roles that allow for “Remote” work on an exceptional basis. If you are applying for one of these roles, you must work from the state in which you are employed. If the posting is specified as Onsite, you are required to work from an office.
