name: Staff Data Engineer
description:
We are looking for a Staff Data Engineer to lead the development of cutting-edge data systems backing our products for our mission to restore and protect the planet's forests. As a leader on the DMRV (Digital measurement, reporting, and verification) team, you will build, scale and deploy systems for ingesting, storing and computing the data powering our AI and Remote Sensing insights and are responsible for delivering those data insights to our customers to enable them to identify and originate the highest quality nature-based projects.

A typical day includes collaborating across engineering and science teams to understand new dataset ingest pathways for model or algorithm features, writing code to support efficient compute and scalable transformation and algorithms to unlock insights over project data, designing systems for easy data access and experimentation pathways, pair coding with other engineers to raise the standards and bar on our technical work, and roadmapping core improvements to our data, compute or measurement stack.

We're looking for engineers who find joy in the craft of building but live for seeing the end-to-end impact and want to rally engineers around them. Engineers who push forward initiatives by asking great questions, cutting through ambiguity, and organizing to win. Engineers who are relentlessly detail-oriented, methodical in their approach to understanding trade-offs, and place the highest emphasis on building and building quickly.

requirements.description: Owned and operated distributed compute system - you aren’t just familiar with distributed workflows but have been responsible for deploying, scaling, overseeing and maintaining the infrastructure needed to run them.
Passion for environmental sustainability and a desire to make a meaningful impact on the planet.
Proven track record of architecting, designing, building, and maintaining robust ETL pipelines with a strong understanding of end-to-end system architecture and design

Strong understanding of end-to-end system architecture and design. Strong software engineering practices and proficiency in Python programming, debugging/profiling, version control, and system design.
Comfort with fast pace execution and rapid iteration startup environment. Excited by product impact.
Built Data pipelines and infra ML and Scientific applications- Have worked with ML and/or Science teams previously.

Geospatial - familiarity or willingness to get your hands dirty with raster and vector data, and nuances of geospatial data and common geospatial cloud-native data formats (geopackage, flatgeobuf, cloud-optimized geotiff). Our tech stack includes Zarr, Rasterio, Geopandas, and Xarray

Proven ability to lead cross-team engineering efforts, including planning, execution, and delivery of complex projects, with strong communication skills to understand stakeholder requirements and translate them into long-term plans and projects
requirements.explanation:
• Ability to identify potential projects, manage prioritization, and consider trade-offs and opportunity costs.

  • Proactive in finding and driving projects forward, ensuring alignment with business needs and technical direction.

requirements.description: Distributed Compute - familiarity with distributed compute technologies and knowledge of distributed systems concepts (like CPU/GPU interactions/transfers, latency/throughput bottlenecks, pipelining/multiprocessing) Our tech stack includes Dask and Flyte deployed through Kubernetes and GCP.

responsibilities: Impact: Empower our interdisciplinary team and customers to derive insights needed to originate high quality nature based projects from our multi-TB datasets by building the ingest pipelines, access and compute supporting our geospatial and remote sensing data powering our products.

Technical leadershipand innovation: for cross-functional projects as our data and compute pipelines are core platform assets used across teams. Connect product value across teams with the core design and technologies available to develop strategies and vision for the data systems we need to build and how we build them. You will work with teams to implement this vision.

Advocating for and mentoring on best practices: applied to our data pipelines and compute. Mentoring teammates to raise the bar across the engineering teams to enable step-level increases in efficiency.

Hands on contributions: coding the systems and tools that enable all engineering and science to produce high-quality insight for forest carbon projects and optimizing methods to run efficiently on large amounts of geospatial and remote sensing data.
workPlaceText: Remote, within 3 hours of Pacific Time
visa_text_more: H1 B transfer
experience_info: in software and data engineering (ideally +2 years operating at the staff level)
recruiting_advice: you can use the ideal candidate search with the profile OF Bernhard and take it from there; we also want folks who are mission-driven.
avoid_traits: Location: we want to stay on North America and Latam.
less than 4 years experience and not start up experience

company.name: Pachama
company.description:
Pachama is a mission-driven company looking to restore nature to help address climate change. Pachama brings the latest technology in remote sensing and AI to the world of forest carbon in order to enable forest conservation and restoration to scale. Pachama’s core technology harnesses satellite imaging with artificial intelligence to measure carbon captured in forests. Through the Pachama marketplace, responsible companies and individuals can connect with carbon credits from projects that are protecting and restoring forests worldwide.

We are backed by mission-aligned investors including Breakthrough Energy Ventures, Amazon Climate Fund, Chris Sacca, Saltwater Ventures, and Paul Graham.
locations: Remote within North America or Latam
benefits: Health, dental and vision, remote work stipend, unlimited vacation and paid Parental leave
company.teamAbout: Our story began with a group of friends with a shared love of nature and drive to address the devastating effects of climate change. Having already made strides in developing innovative technologies, they made the bold decision to harness their collective expertise toward the betterment of our planet. Thus, Pachama was born—a project built upon unwavering optimism and a commitment to fostering enduring, positive change.

name: Robotics Engineer
description: Join our team at Molg as a Robotics Engineer and contribute to the development of circular manufacturing technology for electronics products. You will work closely with a talented team of engineers to create innovative solutions for assembly intelligence, computer vision, and microfactories. If you have experience in robotics, enjoy writing robotics applications, and have a strong background in software development, this role is perfect for you. Be part of a collaborative environment where you can make a real impact on the future of electronics manufacturing.

requirements.description: Experienced in modern software development (e.g. C++, python, ROS, github, docker, etc)
Enjoy writing end-to-end robotics applications or have built/integrated robotic hardware in industry
Ability to communicate effectively and efficiently both verbally and in writing
Have implemented and shipped software and/or hardware for commercial robot products

responsibilities: Delivering high-quality, testable code for built/integrated robotic hardware (i.e. microfactories)
Building core CAD to robotic motion and grasp planning workflow software (i.e. assembly intelligence)
Developing and expanding advance simulation and motion planning capabilities
Collaborating with mechanical, electrical, and software engineers on end-of-arm tooling, fixturing, vision systems, and control systems
Contribute to overall product roadmap and assist with prioritization of workload
workPlaceText: On-site in Sterling, VA
visa_text_more: Can support H1B Transfers and H1B Sponsorship
experience_info: in the commercial robotics industry
recruiting_advice:
Things to Know:

  • We’re a small collaborative team with big ambitions, and there’s a good amount of context-switching. We expect people to be autonomous and drive their own work to completion.

  • We are a profitable business that is primarily funded from customer revenue, which means we are scrappy and looking to build a great sustainable company for years to come.

  • As a growing company and startup, priorities may shift as customer or business requirements change. We strive to empower individuals with context and decision-making power to meet this need. 

  • We strongly favor people that have a history of getting things done and enjoying their work.
avoid_traits: zero commercial experience
lots of job hopping/short stints (<12 months)
narcissism
not a team player/not collaborative

company.name: Molg
company.description:
Our mission is to tackle the fast growing e-waste problem by making electronics manufacturing circular. 

Molg builds robotics microfactories and software to autonomously assemble and disassemble complex electronic products like laptop PCs, servers, and battery packs. Working with some of the leading computer + server manufacturers as well as industrial companies like Stanley Black and Decker, we are building the circular manufacturing technology to recover existing in-market devices for reuse and recycling as well as helping develop the next generation of circular-focused devices at the design level.
benefits: 100% Cover of Healthcare Premiums, 75% Dependents (United Healthcare Platinum), including dental and vision
company.teamAbout:
We spend our days building robotic systems, developing complex assembly intelligence software, and designing the next generation of circular products for our customers. Given the importance of working hands-on with physical systems, we are a 100% in-person team collaboratively working in our industrial space in Sterling, VA, down the road from the largest data center market in the world.  Our facility includes a variety of robots, CNC milling machines, 3D printers, and all the tools needed to build and test our products. It is important to us that anyone on our team that is interested in learning how to use our various pieces of equipment and machinery is taught and can gain the skills and appreciation for making physical things.   

While we are primarily funded by our work with Fortune 100 companies, we are also supported by amazing backers like Elemental Excelerator and Techstars.

name: Software Engineer
description: Join the team at Melange, a startup with a focus on revolutionizing patent search through advanced technology. As a software engineer in this role, you will be responsible for developing conversation graphs, integrating grammar processes, and maintaining a robust codebase. The ideal candidate will have experience shipping products, working with cloud platforms, and have familiarity with containerization tools. Additionally, experience with prompting tools, NLP packages, and cybersecurity is a plus.

requirements.description: Had ownership over aspects of product development in both small and large organizations at differing points in your career.
Have used Langchain, LangGraph, or other prompting tools in production or for personal projects.
Familiarity with NLP packages such as Spacy, Stanza, PyTorch, and/or Tensorflow.
Experience with cybersecurity.
Shipped a working product to users, either as part of a team or on your own.
requirements.explanation: This means you have: 1) proficiency with one of AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud, 2) familiarity with containerization and orchestration tools like Docker and Kubernetes, and 3) built and maintained CI/CD pipelines.

responsibilities: Ship high-quality products.
Utilize prompting libraries such as Langchain and Langgraph to develop conversation graphs and evaluation flows.
Collaborate with linguists to integrate our in-house grammar and entity mapping processes into an iterable patent search algorithm piloted by AI patent agents.
Steward the codebase, ensuring that it remains robust as it scales.
experience_info: as a software engineer
recruiting_advice:
We are a nerdy culture. One shared interest among most of our team is an interest in strategy board games.

We prefer candidates who attended better schools and candidates who have worked for better companies.

The candidate should have 5-10 years experience. Any more years than ten and we would be overpaying for experience we don't really need.
avoid_traits: Should be trustworthy!

company.name: Melange
company.description: Melange is a venture-backed startup building a brand new search infrastructure for the patent system. Leveraging recent and ongoing advancements in machine learning and natural language processing, we are building systems to conduct patent search faster and more accurately than any human currently can. We are a small team with a friendly, mostly-remote culture. The company is well capitalized, having raised 9.1 million dollars in a Series Seed led by Greenoaks Capital.

name: Software Engineer, Infrastructure
description: As an Infrastructure Engineer at Orb, you will be responsible for designing and maintaining product features that require deeply understanding reliable and scalable systems. The infrastructure team works on every part of the stack and ships product quickly. Notably, this is not an auxiliary or support team; at Orb, performant infrastructure is a core part of the offering.

requirements.description: Based in the San Francisco Bay Area or willing to relocate (with support from Orb)
Experience with databases
Experience working on scaling infrastructure
Experience working with AWS or other cloud environments utilizing containerization technologies such as Docker or Kubernetes.
Background at companies with strong engineering (bar at Asana, Segment, or higher) or at a notable, high-growth early-stage startup
Strong knowledge of best practices in modern software development such as deployments, CI/CD, data management, security, and distributed systems.

responsibilities: Building and scaling our data ingestion pipelines to support ever increasing data volumes. We ingest anywhere from 100 million to one billion events an hour and expect to see massive growth over the next year. These data pipelines need to be incredibly robust; the accuracy of every event counts.

Understanding how to scale query throughput against our specialized datastores in service of product features like real-time alerting while maintaining maximum flexibility in metrics customers can define. This allows our customers to implement usage limits and spend management through Orb.
Providing the most performant and flexible APIs to our customers and their end users, so they can build experiences that leverage usage data stored in Orb.
Building simple and reusable system-level components to serve as a foundation for other engineers. For example, designing and building a robust rate and cost limiting strategy across Orb’s API.
workPlaceText: In-person in San Francisco (FiDi)
visa_text_more: We do not do ANY transfers (H1B, TN, etc.).
experience_info: (6+ preferred) in software engineering, specifically with 2+ years of experience in infrastructure engineering.

https://jobs.ashbyhq.com/orb/2b527d31-12c5-41e4-80fc-8b63e36143f7 the JD should give you a good sense of what search terms to plug in for booleans.

company.name: Orb
company.description:
Mission

Orb is on an ambitious mission to provide every business with the infrastructure to unlock their revenue. Best-in class businesses find ways to effectively align their monetization to product usage—whether that's through seats, consumption, feature limits, or usage-based tiers. Orb brings that opportunity to every software company.

We are reimagining billing and invoicing for this era of hybrid pricing in software. Billing is no longer just a finance problem, but also a high-stakes engineering observability problem that customers urgently need solved. At Orb, we take a developer-first, data infrastructure approach to this problem. We make it possible for companies to fully automate their current billing process, and to evolve their monetization strategy over time.

Orb supports the end-to-end workflow for revenue: developers love our product’s extensibility and intuitive API, product managers become empowered to iterate on pricing and packaging much faster, finance teams get fine-grained reporting to facilitate revenue recognition, and customer-facing teams benefit from the transparency Orb brings to the customer relationship.
benefits: Medical insurance - 100% coverage for you and dependents
Unlimited PTO, with 15 days minimum encouraged
16-week paid parental leave with equity vesting
company.teamAbout:
About Us

Our founding team has experience from companies like Stripe, Asana, Plaid, Cloudflare, and Autodesk. We’ve raised $19.1 million in funding from top-tier investors like Menlo Ventures, Greylock, base case, South Park Commons, and Scribble, as well as founders and operators from companies like Vercel, Plaid, Datadog, Notion, Asana, HubSpot, and more.

Working at Orb

When you meet our team, you’ll see we’re a group of dedicated and kind individuals who care deeply about solving what is one of the most mission-critical problems for any business.

Every one of us has outsized impact on the business, our product, and our customers—we hold ourselves to a standard of excellence, with the empowerment to take risks and the judgment to focus our time on maximizing leverage.

We are not a culture of long hours, but we approach our work with intensity and a sense of urgency. With a product like ours, minutes matter: we can help accelerate other businesses tremendously if we’re focused on building quickly while maintaining critical attention to detail. When we’re ‘on’, we’re on; we work hard, then we go home.

We will focus on setting you up for success, with the right expectations and enablement. We coach on outcomes, not inputs or style. We show up for each other with kindness, which earns us the ability to have difficult conversations with trust by default and openness to feedback.

As a growing organization, we value in-person collaboration. We see it as a way to achieve our mission faster, in an environment of rapid ideation, strong alignment, and that energy that makes work more fun.

name: Founding Engineer
description:
Tavrn is seeking a talented individual to join their team in revolutionizing the legal industry through AI-powered tools that enhance efficiency and success for paralegals and lawyers. As a key member of the engineering team, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing software solutions tailored to the unique needs of law firms. Working closely with the CTO and other team members, you will help shape the technical roadmap and strategic vision for Tavrn's innovative legal tools.

Leading and mentoring a team of engineers, you will foster a culture of innovation, collaboration, and excellence within the organization. Collaborating with cross-functional teams, you will ensure seamless integration of AI-powered tools into Tavrn's product offerings. By staying informed on emerging technologies and industry trends, you will drive continuous improvement and innovation in the legal tech space, taking ownership of key technical decisions and solving complex challenges related to legal workflows and AI integration.

As a key member of the engineering team, this role will involve hands-on development, maintenance of data pipelines and LLM / data science leadership.

requirements.description: Has built batch and streaming data pipelines
Has developed/owned/maintained ETL pipelines for internal business systems (for example: Rippling, HubSpot, Monday.com, Quickbooks/NetSuite, and similar).

Write efficient, reusable, and reliable code, primarily in SQL and Python.

Make smart tech choices about tools and platforms to be used, balancing trade-offs thoughtfully

Work closely with others, including employees, clients and vendors to make sure we’re building the right things the right way to have real impact on the business

company.name: TubeScience
company.description:
Over the past 8 years, we quietly bootstrapped TubeScience into the largest producer of social media ads in the USA. While our public profile is minimal (ironically, we don’t do any self-marketing), we have hundreds of employees, billions of dollars in ad spend, and deep technical partnerships with Meta and other platforms. 

What helped us do so is an obsession for numbers over opinions, and a unique “pay for performance” business model. Clients only pay if our ads outperform anything they or any other agency delivers. It’s a very “honest” business model, and clients tend to love it (resulting in extremely high retention and all our sales to date coming from inbound / word of mouth). 

As we look towards the future and AI advances, we see an incredible opportunity to reinvent our business. We plan to take everything we’ve learned, and turn it into a true self-service SaaS offering that can power agencies and in-house teams alike.
benefits: Be part of a passionate, entrepreneurial team that is driven to succeed and working on a high impact problem.
A unique opportunity to shape a team from the ground up.
company.teamAbout:
Our values:

  • Do the right thing

    especially when it's difficult

  • Be the best

    at whatever we do

  • No snake oil

    regardless of how tempting

name: Founding Software Engineer
description:
What you’ll do

  • Build a product that will be used at scale by cities, counties, and citizens across the United States. GovWell is the primary workspace and system of record for our users - government staff typically use it 8 hours a day, 5 days a week. Additionally, thousands of citizens use GovWell to access government services. You’ll see the direct impact of your work and receive immediate feedback with each new feature.

  • Make an impact in an underserved, but societally important industry. We deserve effective, transparent government, but the overwhelming majority of cities and counties lack the modern software necessary to deliver it. GovWell is changing that.

  • Learn how to build a company from zero to one. As employee #7 and engineer #2, you’ll see the entire startup journey. If you want to start your own company someday, there’s no better way to learn.

Our Tech Stack

  • RedwoodJS is our fullstack framework

  • Our front-end is written in React and TypeScript

  • Our back-end is written in TypeScript with NodeJS

  • We use GraphQL to communicate between front-end and back-end

requirements.description: Demonstrated interest in govt /public service - ie campaigns, govtech
Has had early roles at companies that eventually became Series A/B/C - ideally at industry-defining companies like Palantir, Rippling, Ramp, etc.
Track record of success: Quickly advancing to higher levels, or maintaining the same title at companies known to not to title changes (i.e. Palantir)

Frontend: You've built a frontend system from scratch, knowing the intimate details of how data flows to/from every section of the system. If most of your experience is in creating component libraries or writing simple display components in React, this role is likely not right for you - but check back in a year!
Frontend: You are a frontend engineer who loves building products that real people use every day
Backend: You have extensive experience implementing backend features (see examples below)
requirements.explanation:
Some examples might include:

  • Implementing Business Logic: You have extensive experience in implementing intricate business logic in backend systems. For instance, you might have developed a complex algorithm to calculate personalized recommendations for users based on their browsing history and preferences.

  • Reducing Technical Debt: You've successfully tackled technical debt by refactoring code, optimizing database queries for performance gains, or implementing automated testing frameworks to improve code reliability.

  • Scalability and Performance Optimization: You've played a pivotal role in enhancing the scalability and performance of backend systems. This could involve horizontally scaling services to handle increased user load, optimizing database schema for faster query execution, or implementing caching mechanisms to reduce latency.

  • Security Enhancements: You've contributed to strengthening the security posture of backend systems by implementing robust authentication and authorization mechanisms, mitigating common vulnerabilities such as SQL injection or XSS attacks, and staying updated with industry best practices for secure coding.

  • Integration with Third-Party Services: You've integrated backend systems with various third-party services and APIs to enable seamless data exchange and functionality enhancement. This might include integrating payment gateways, social media APIs, or geolocation services into our applications.

requirements.description: Fullstack: You have extensive experience owning features end-to-end. You love to take Figma designs and make modifications to the database setup, backend code, and frontend code to make those designs come to life.
A track record of long tenures (2 years minimum, ideally 3+) at reputable companies
A degree in computer science from a top-tier school (graduating with honors/summa cum laude a plus)

responsibilities: Building a workflow management system that is powerful and easy to use, but flexible enough to accommodate the unique processes of 80,000+ government agencies in the United States (think: Salesforce for governments). Today, GovWell is used to process permit and license applications for everything from new affordable housing developments to small business licenses.
Enabling a Figma-style document review experience that helps governments easily collaborate to review, mark up, and approve technical documents such as building and development plans.

Developing a flexible and powerful document generation system to automatically generate official documents including permits and licenses for thousands of unique processes (think: Canva for documents).
Creating a payments experience that makes it easy for citizens to pay billions in annual permit/license fees, property taxes, and utility bills online.
workPlaceText: The founders are both located in New York City and work in person 3-4 days per week at our office in Manhattan (28th and Park, next to the 6 train). We strongly prefer NYC-based candidates, but are open to exceptional remote candidates.
experience_info: experience in backend or fullstack development, or 5+ years of frontend development experience
recruiting_advice:
Notes on Candidates

  • Educational background

    • A degree in computer science from a top school - Graduating with honors/summa cum laude

  • Tenure

    • A track record of long tenures (3+ years) at reputable companiesCompany background- Has had early roles at companies that eventually became Series A/B/C - Work at industry-defining companies like Palantir, Rippling, Ramp

  • Layoffs

    • Never laid off - No long employment gaps (2+ months)

  • Career Progression

    • Quickly advancing to higher levels - quick jump from SWE to Senior SWE, or Senior SWE to Tech Lead OR Maintaining same title at a company that we know does not do title changes (ie Palantir)

  • Public service / civil mindedness

    • Demonstrated interest in govt /public service - ie campaigns, govtech

  • Titles- Software Engineer - Senior Software Engineer - Staff Software Engineer - Founding Engineer

Resources:

  • Core Values

  • Product Looms

  • Sourcing Philosophy

company.name: GovWell
company.description:
We the people (and the taxpayers) deserve effective government. But the software powering government services is 20 years behind the private sector. GovWell’s mission is to build modern software products to help government serve communities better. After launching April 2023, we raised $1 million in pre-seed funding and today more than 200,000 citizens in 7 states rely on GovWell products to access essential government services.

We're helping 80,000+ local governments serve their communities better with modern software. From making it easier to start businesses to increasing the supply of affordable housing, we're honored to make our customers better at developing vibrant and safe communities.
benefits: Up to 100% premiums covered for medical, dental, and vision insurance for yourself and partner.
company.productDescription:
Technical challenges GovWell is solving:

- Building a workflow management system that is powerful and easy to use, but flexible enough to accommodate the unique processes of 80,000+ government agencies in the United States (think: Salesforce for governments). Today, GovWell is used to process permit and license applications for everything from new affordable housing developments to small business licenses.

- Enabling a Figma-style document review experience that helps governments easily collaborate to review, mark up, and approve technical documents such as building and development plans.

- Developing a flexible and powerful document generation system to automatically generate official documents including permits and licenses for thousands of unique processes (think: Canva for documents).

- Creating a payments experience that makes it easy for citizens to pay billions in annual permit/license fees, property taxes, and utility bills online.
company.teamAbout:
Who are we?

Our mission is deeply personal for us. Ben Cohen, Co-founder and CTO, grew up helping his father — a general contractor — to apply for hundreds of construction permits. Ben’s experiences navigating clunky, outdated government websites inspired him to build better solutions for the millions of tradespeople whose livelihoods depend on getting permits fast. Prior to founding GovWell, Ben worked for Uber and Amazon as a Software Engineer, and earned his AB in Computer Science summa cum laude from Princeton.

Troy LeCaire, Co-founder and CEO, was employee #1 and Chief of Staff at RippleMatch, a B2B SaaS company, helping it grow from 0 to $10M in annual revenue and a $200M valuation. Before RippleMatch, he worked for two senators from his home state of Wisconsin. He believes passionately in the potential for technology to help government work more effectively for citizens everywhere. Troy earned his BA in Government magna cum laude from Cornell.

Core Values

Striving

We believe a good life means striving vigorously towards difficult goals that are personally meaningful and challenge us to become the best version of ourselves. We are uncomfortable with stasis and constantly seek to improve. We value colleagues who inspire and motivate us.

Public Service

We believe that citizens deserve effective and transparent government, and that good technology products are necessary to advance this goal. We take pride in building products that benefit society. Given our position, we have a special responsibility to do excellent work and to prioritize the public interest in our decision-making.

Exceptionalism

We believe small teams of exceptional people can do great things. We only hire people who are among the top 1% at what they do, and we hold each other to this same standard.

Humility

We believe that people are inherently fallible, and what matters more than avoiding mistakes is how we respond to them. When we make a mistake or are unsure, we own it fully. We actively solicit criticism and feedback from others in order to improve.

Be Direct

We believe that it’s important to be direct with each other because doing so builds trust, respect, and empowers people to make better decisions. We are proactive about sharing our thoughts and feelings, especially when it may be uncomfortable. We praise great work generously, and share constructive feedback calmly and empathetically.

name: Business Development Manager
description:
Join GovWell in their quest to bring government services into the 21st century. We're looking for a business development manager to help drive new sales through cold outreach via email/phone and attending industry events. As a business development manager, you will be responsible for engaging potential customers, speaking with local government decision-makers, and autonomously iterating on outreach strategies.

This role offers the opportunity to shape business development strategy, learn how to build a company from zero to one, and define the company culture as an exciting place to work and grow. This position reports to Troy LeCaire, Co-founder and CEO.

Who we are looking for:

  • A confident communicator who enjoys talking to people, especially on the phone. Local government has a heavy phone culture, so you should be comfortable and confident with high volume cold calling (80+ dials / day).

  • A fast learner who can grasp new concepts quickly.

  • A creative person who enjoys coming up with new ideas, not just following the standard playbook.

  • A resilient personality who is used to hearing many “nos” before getting to a “yes”.

requirements.description: Track record of exceptional performance in roles requiring high volume cold outreach, especially via phone.
Evidence of extreme discipline and work ethic, a “whatever it takes” mentality.
Demonstrated interest in public service / government.
Strong alignment with our Core Values
requirements.explanation: Core Values here

requirements.description: Familiarity with sales engagement and CRM software like Outreach and Salesforce.

responsibilities: Own our top-of-funnel, working to identify and engage potential customers via phone, email, and occasionally in-person events / conferences.
Speak via phone with local government decision-makers to uncover needs and qualify opportunities before passing them to the CEO.

Autonomously iterate on our outreach strategies. On a given day, you might write a new email sequence, revamp your cold call script, travel to attend a conference, or decide that a value proposition we hadn’t considered before is actually what resonates best with prospects.
Hustle, a lot. Compared to a larger company, you’ll have way more autonomy to shape business development strategy, but at the end of the day we need someone who can get sh*t done and execute.
Help define our company culture as an exciting place to work and grow.
Learn how to build a company from zero to one (great if you want to be a founder someday!).
workPlaceText: The founders are both located in New York, NY and work in person in our Manhattan office 3-4x a week. We strongly prefer candidates in NYC for this role.
experience_info: sales, business development, outreach, project management, relationship management
recruiting_advice: Look for people 1-3 years into their career who have a solid track record at reputable organizations, good schools, but who aren't necessarily in tech today. People in politics/government can be good
avoid_traits: Short tenures
No track record of success/promotion
Overqualified - 5+ years of experience with no growth
Multiple bizdev/sales positions
benefits: Competitive base salary and uncapped earnings.

name: Senior Software Engineer, Growth
description: As a member of AtoB's engineering team, you will be instrumental in revolutionizing the payments infrastructure for the trucking and logistics industry. You will play a key role in building products from start to finish, scope projects, measure success, quickly iterate based on user feedback, and more.

requirements.description: Experience working with backend tech (e.g. Ruby on Rails, Python, and/or NodeJS)
Experience working with modern frontend tech (e.g. React) with a strong grasp on the fundamentals (HTML/CSS/JS)
Experience in sign-up flows, onboarding, and marketing systems
A growth mindset in your career & an extreme level of ownership over the work you do
A strong desire to level up while holding yourself and your teammates to a consistently high bar of quality

responsibilities: Lead & participate in building products end to end, from helping to scope projects to measuring their success and iterating quickly based on user feedback
Build and iterate on our GTM architecture, signup flows, and services responsible for onboarding new customers
Design, implement, and maintain the APIs & user-facing experiences core to our business and growth strategy
Debug production issues across services and multiple levels of the stack
Make effective tradeoffs between business priorities, user experience, and reliability
workPlaceText: Remote or Hybrid - we have offices in SF and NY.
experience_info: building products with speed and quality
recruiting_advice: We are looking for candidates from strong companies to be strong individual contributors.
avoid_traits: Primarily Java shop candidates
Only big company experience

company.name: AtoB
company.description:
The trucking and logistics industry provides the backbone of the economy. But the payments infrastructure on which it runs is broken. For the hard-working men and women of this sector, the existing suite of payment tools is outdated, difficult to use, prone to fraud, and saddled with shady fee structures. The incumbent players in this space often overlook the economic and practical needs of this user base.

We're changing that. AtoB is building Stripe for Transportation — modernizing the payments infrastructure for trucking and logistics. Supply chains rely on the timely movement of capital to function efficiently. Our end game is a world in which that capital movement occurs fairly, smoothly, and without delay. As we pursue that end game, we aim to center our customers in every way — offering them world-class customer experience and building products that work with and around the unique constraints of their daily lives. We build for fleet managers in the office and drivers on the road. We strive for products that are efficient, satisfying, and useful. Our customers enable our modern economy — they deserve it.
company.teamAbout:
Our founding team has backgrounds in payments, working on autonomous vehicles at Cruise Automation, leading ops and growth for Uber, and building apps that were featured on the Apple app store. We have staff and senior engineers from Google, Uber, Meta, Shopify, Stripe, Chime, and other leading technology companies.

 

We have raised $125 million+ from investors such as General Catalyst, Elad Gil, Bloomberg Beta, Y Combinator, XYZ; founders and CEOs of companies such as Google (Eric Schmidt), Salesforce (Marc Benioff), Coinbase (Brian Armstrong), DoorDash (Tony Xu), Instacart, Gusto; strategic investors like Mastercard, Flexport and Samsara.

We were named to Forbes annual Next Billion-Dollar Startup List, and have just recently been selected to join the World Economic Forum as a Global Innovator.

name: Business Operations Analyst / Associate
description: Our BizOps team handles a variety of problem-solving challenges. Expect to own a particular area of our business, collaborate with teammates across Engineering, Sales, and Customer Success, and leverage your analytical toolkit on a daily basis. The particular problem you'll work on when you join depends on both business needs + your particular strengths and interests. This is a great generalist role to get exposure to all elements of building a high-growth company - from on-the-ground operations to big-picture strategy.

requirements.description: We are open to different experience levels for this role; your exact responsibilities and scope will match the experience you bring to the table
Proficiency in data analysis (SQL, Python, or R); you don't need to know SQL when you join, but expect to learn quickly!

responsibilities: Determining vertical-specific KPIs
Optimizing our growth funnel, pre-and post-sales
Building a process playbook for our sales, underwriting, or support teams
Running experiments to increase our growth or revenue
Analyzing purchase or payments data and using the results to make business decisions
Conducting interviews with customers to inform product decisions (and then working with the engineering team to implement)
workPlaceText: Remote (US or Canada), but preference is for hybrid work in either New York or San Francisco.
experience_info: in management consulting, strategy, at a high-growth startup, or in a heavily analytical role is a plus
recruiting_advice: We are looking for someone with a consulting background who is heavy on the analytics and operations side. They will be working in SQL quite a bit (although not a requirement), as well as directly with customers.
avoid_traits: Someone who is not hands on

company.name: AtoB
company.description:
The trucking and logistics industry provides the backbone of the economy. But the payments infrastructure on which it runs is broken. For the hard-working men and women of this sector, the existing suite of payment tools is outdated, difficult to use, prone to fraud, and saddled with shady fee structures. The incumbent players in this space often overlook the economic and practical needs of this user base.

We're changing that. AtoB is building Stripe for Transportation — modernizing the payments infrastructure for trucking and logistics. Supply chains rely on the timely movement of capital to function efficiently. Our end game is a world in which that capital movement occurs fairly, smoothly, and without delay. As we pursue that end game, we aim to center our customers in every way — offering them world-class customer experience and building products that work with and around the unique constraints of their daily lives. We build for fleet managers in the office and drivers on the road. We strive for products that are efficient, satisfying, and useful. Our customers enable our modern economy — they deserve it.
company.teamAbout:
Our founding team has backgrounds in payments, working on autonomous vehicles at Cruise Automation, leading ops and growth for Uber, and building apps that were featured on the Apple app store. We have staff and senior engineers from Google, Uber, Meta, Shopify, Stripe, Chime, and other leading technology companies.

 

We have raised $125 million+ from investors such as General Catalyst, Elad Gil, Bloomberg Beta, Y Combinator, XYZ; founders and CEOs of companies such as Google (Eric Schmidt), Salesforce (Marc Benioff), Coinbase (Brian Armstrong), DoorDash (Tony Xu), Instacart, Gusto; strategic investors like Mastercard, Flexport and Samsara.

We were named to Forbes annual Next Billion-Dollar Startup List, and have just recently been selected to join the World Economic Forum as a Global Innovator.

name: Senior Software Engineer, Risk
description: As a member of AtoB's engineering team, you will be instrumental in revolutionizing the payments infrastructure for the trucking and logistics industry. Your role will involve building a platform to verify and underwrite new customers, creating machine learning models to assess creditworthiness and prevent fraudulent behavior, and collaborating with various teams to manage customer credit and payment risk. You will play a key part in defining the technical roadmap for risk engineering and ensuring the balance between speed and quality in delivering technical solutions.

requirements.description: Are self-motivated and relentlessly focused on delivering business value.
Strong sense of ownership and enjoy working on projects end-to-end in a fast-paced, high autonomy environment.
Have solid backend experience and experience in data transformation to deliver critical impact to the business.
Enjoy thinking about systems and their life cycles, edge cases, interactions, and failure modes.

responsibilities: Help build the platform that allows AtoB to verify and underwrites new customers and identifies and prevents fraudulent behavior and coordinated attacks.
Create and improve machine learning models that score customers for creditworthiness and loss risk and determine other risk-related factors.

Partner with various Risk and Product teams including analysts, business operations, underwriters to create strategy, vision and the goals for managing customer credit, transaction and payment risk at AtoB.
Deliver robust technical solutions rapidly and iteratively.
Help define the technical roadmap for risk engineering.
Ensure we are making the right tradeoffs between moving fast and holding a high quality bar.
workPlaceText: Remote (US or Canada)
experience_info: building B2B or B2C SaaS products, preferably in fintech or the financial services domain assessing risk and detecting fraud at scale.
recruiting_advice: We are looking for candidates from strong companies who are solid individual contributors.
avoid_traits: Primarily Java shop candidates
Only big company experience

name: Chief of Staff
description:
Chief of Staff to Founder

This is a new role on a 50-person team reporting to the founder of a highly-watched defense company related to Palantir. This role is based in Los Angeles (but we have similar roles in SF and NY).

Be among the first non-engineering hires at a company launching high-altitude balloons carrying 2-3lb payloads over places like Ukraine, Israel and Taiwan.

This is not a glorified admin role. The Chief of Staff archetype is used as a launching point to develop our own founders or other leading operational roles. This is perfect for someone who is mission-driven but not sure if they want to go to business school. Internships in PE, VC or banking are helpful.

Technical degrees, especially any engineering fields, are highly encouraged. The role will involve significant travel, including international. Must be familiar with the performance standards of either a global company or top-performing culture or academic background.

Leverage the founder's time and act as a full proxy.

company.name: A* Capital
company.description:
A* is an early stage venture capital firm commonly associated with the so-called "PayPal Mafia".

We are a 12 person seed and pre-seed fund that moves quickly and wins deals. We back generational founders tackling world-changing problems.
company.teamAbout:
Our Philosophy

We have founded, operated and invested in some of the most iconic tech companies of our era. While we're proud of our past, we're just getting started.

  • Conviction-led: We invest first. With unwavering conviction.

  • Relentless: We are relentless. Just like our founders.

  • Founder-centric: We work together. To shape a better future.

name: Associate
description:
This is a partnership-track role with the investment team behind PayPal, Palantir and Facebook.

A* refers to a search algorithm developed at Stanford. We are a 12-person fund managing $600 million dollars, guiding founders from idea to IPO. We have scaled and operated companies like Uber, Airbnb and Pinterest.

This is a new role, and the first time we are recruiting outside our known networks. Traditionally the domain of billionaires and Unicorn founders, we believe there is now enough data available to train people to become good investors early in their careers.

We're looking for well-spoken and curious minds; able to hold mutually opposing views simultaneously, and able to articulate views through data, humility and optimism. This is a partnership-track roll, shadowing partners in order to get the model down for what success looks like and what the early signals for greatness are.

Native-level written and spoken English

Attend 20-30 pitches weekly
Develop investment thesis

name: Founding Engineer
description: Join Shortbread as a Founding Engineer and be part of a team that is revolutionizing the way comics are created and consumed. With a focus on guilty-pleasure romance stories and cutting-edge AI technology, Shortbread is paving the way for creators to bring their comic series to life in minutes. We're looking for someone with a background in full stack development, a passion for visual storytelling, and a desire to work on a small, innovative team.

requirements.description:
Track record of success (any of these):

  • Top CS school (Stanford, MIT, Berkeley, etc.)

  • Fast growing, hot startup (like Perplexity, Character AI, Midjourney, Runway, etc.)

  • Major contribution to ML research / open source projects
Experience with Stable Diffusion / generative AI
Experience with mobile development in Flutter
Passionate about webtoons, comics, art, story telling, or other visual art-forms
You've built something from scratch, whether that’s a side project, your own startup, or a team you led
AI Eng at hot AI startup / former founder / founding engineer at startup for >1 year + some other impressive track record (notable internship, job, top school)

responsibilities: Building features for Shortbread Studio using React and Typescript

Applying cutting-edge generative AI research and technology to build an incredible interface. This is an open ended, deeply creative and technical problem space that combines art, AI, and engineering.
Proposing, designing, implementing, and owning projects while working directly with the founders
Communicating with artists who use Shortbread Studio to lead product development

visa_text_more: Currently not sponsoring

recruiting_advice:
We find people from top tech (ex-FAANG) tend to not be our ideal candidates - they lack the right motivations and character traits that we look for at a small startup. That said, its possible a talented ex-FAANG engineer wants more ownership and decides to give startups a try.

We have rejected almost every new-grad / within a year or two of new-grad candidate because they are too junior and aren't exceptional enough. Our ideal candidate could still possibly be a new-grad, but they have to be the top 1%.

We are just hiring a single founding engineer to close the role, so we are looking for someone truly exceptional - the 10x engineer.
avoid_traits: Not driven

Average, middle of the road performers
People who need to be told what to do

company.name: Shortbread (YC W23)
company.description:
Shortbread is Netflix for comics, powered by an AI Comics Studio.

Traditionally, comics are drawn by hand by multiple artists. Shortbread Studio speeds up the process 10x, allowing anyone to bring a story idea to a high quality comic series in minutes.

On the Shortbread App, creators publish and sell their comic series. We currently specialize in guilty-pleasure romance stories serving a mature audience.
company.productDescription:
Traditionally, comics are drawn by hand by multiple artists. Shortbread Studio speeds up the process 5-10x, and allows anyone to create comics without requiring drawing skills by leaning on generative AI to handle the tedious mechanical side of comic creation.

We allow creators to:
- Go from line sketched storyboards to fully drawn and colored panels in seconds
- Generate beautiful panels purely from textual descriptions
- Iterate on panels to fix incoherencies
- Easily create character AI models that can consistently draw your character in any pose, setting, or scene.
company.teamAbout: We are a team of web-comic artists, MIT and Berkeley engineers, backed by Y Combinator. We love visual stories and think everyone should have the power to create their own Batman, Slam Dunk, and Sailor Moon. We love creative work, design, and are passionate about working at the intersection of AI, art, and computer science.

name: Software Engineer, AI R&D
description:
From our core reverse ETL product to our no-code customer data platform, Hightouch's mission has always been to provide business teams with the tools to access and activate their customer data. The emergence of AI and large language models has introduced a new way for users to comprehend, analyze, and leverage their data.

The process of building audiences and experiments, which was previously hindered by the need to understand complex data schemas and query languages, can now be simplified to attributes and goals. Additionally, one-to-one personalization, previously unfeasible due to the large customer scale, is now possible through the scaled generation of content.

As a founding engineer on the AI R&D team, you will work closely with our CTO to drive the technical strategy around implementing AI across Hightouch’s product suite.

We're seeking talented, intellectually curious, and motivated individuals interested in exploring the forefront of AI. While no prior experience with LLMs and AI is required, strong technical skills, particularly in backend architecture, and product intuition are essential for understanding and executing these projects from start to finish.

requirements.description: Should be able to take abstract problems and break them down into something we can build
Should deeply empathize with customers and how we can improve their workflows with LLMs
Backend engineer first, with passion and excitement of how it can interplay with LLMs / AI

responsibilities: Quickly iterating and developing proofs of concept (POCs) to explore the maximum potential of integrating AI into data workflows
Making key decisions about the choice of AI architecture and frameworks
Actively engaging with the AI community to stay updated and incorporate the latest advancements
Developing a deep understanding of user workflows to create seamless AI-assisted user experiences
workPlaceText: Remote (US)
experience_info: - our sweet spot is 2012-2019 grads!
recruiting_advice:
Good indicators

  • Experience in building product at a fast growing startup

    • Working closely with founders

    • Working on roughly defined ideas

  • Open to ex-cofounders

  • Some work doing high level LLM work

    • Less around foundation model training, cutting edge stuff

    • More around leveraging frontier models (GPT4, Claude, Gemini, etc.) in a productized way
avoid_traits: Don’t need an AI scientist / expert on the cutting edge of LLMs (ex. AI researcher / scientist at DeepMind)
Our LLM work isn’t going to be rocket science

company.name: Hightouch
company.description:
Hightouch’s mission is to empower everyone to take action on their data. Through our Reverse ETL platform, business and data users can seamlessly sync data from where it resides, such as warehouses and databases, to where it is needed, including operational systems and SaaS tools. Traditionally, acting on data has required engineering time and bandwidth, and left most business users stuck with charts and reports that are unable to take automated action on their data. With Hightouch, every business user, without writing any code, can activate data to streamline critical processes, improve marketing performance, and scale operations.

Our team operates with a focus on making a meaningful impact for our customers. We believe in approaching challenges with a first principles thinking mindset, moving quickly and embracing our value of efficient execution, and treating each other with compassion and kindness. We look for team members that are strong communicators, have a growth mindset, and are motivated and persistent in achieving our goals.

Hundreds of companies use Hightouch, including Spotify, Ramp, Retool, NBA, Plaid, and Betterment. We’re based in San Francisco, are remote-friendly, and backed by leading investors such as Amplify Partners, ICONIQ Growth, Bain Capital Ventures, Y-Combinator, and Afore Capital.
benefits: Core benefits (health, dental, vision, life insurance)
Connectivity ($50 per month cell-phone or wifi connectivity stipend)
Commuter benefits ($50 are offered to both employees who come into the offices and to remote workers working outside of their home)
Remote first (in-person meetings at our San Francisco and New York offices plus our annual company onsite.)
401k for our US employees and retirement plans for our international employees
company.teamAbout:
Our team operates with a focus on making a meaningful impact for our customers. We believe in approaching challenges with a first principles thinking mindset, moving quickly and embracing our value of efficient execution, and treating each other with compassion and kindness. We look for team members that are strong communicators, have a growth mindset, and are motivated and persistent in achieving our goals.

Our founders were early employees of Segment where they saw the transformative impact of enabling business and marketing teams to activate customer data. However, they also recognized the limitations of the existing rigid legacy Customer Data Platform (CDP) market.

By building a platform that could sit on top of an organization’s existing data infrastructure, our founders knew that teams could unlock a more performant, flexible and secure solution to activating customer data at scale - and thus, Hightouch was born.

name: Senior Software Engineer - Backend
description:
What it means to be an early engineer:

Joining Vellum this early means that you’re going to play a huge part in guiding both the technical and cultural evolution of the company. Together, we’re going to face the hardest technical challenges this journey has to offer head on. As the team grows, you’ll be the battle hardened expert that everyone looks towards for guidance.

With great power comes great responsibility 🙂

requirements.description: Strong interest/passion about AI

Shows "Extreme ownership" – has owned core systems, been at a single company long enough to really own big pieces of the tech and learned all the hard-won lessons that come with it (staying 1.5 years or less at all your companies doesn't give you this as much)
Previous experience working at a startup
requirements.explanation: fast growing startups backed by top investors. Please reference our ideal companies section to get a better understanding of the caliber

requirements.description: Strong proficiency in Python
Experience building complex backend systems, managing infrastructure, doing some devops
Located in New York and game to work in person with the team

requirements.description: Bachelor's degree in computer science or relevant discipline from a top CS school
Prior experience with Google Cloud Platform, Postgres and Django.

responsibilities: Tackling our most difficult (and interesting) problems - prompt chaining, fine-tuning infrastructure, and multimodality, just to name a few
Designing, architecting, and building robust critical infrastructure
Owning our most important backend systems
Defining and scoping green-field projects that move the company forward
Working closely with customers to understand what the need, figuring out how to make them successful, and owning the solutions end to end
Serving as a cultural pillar of the team
Navigating a fast-moving, highly competitive landscape
equity: Highly Competitive Equity (with 10 year exercise window)
visa_text_more: We can do H-1B transfers or O-1 applications on a case by case basis
experience_info: - looking for a senior software engineer.
recruiting_advice:
Some things you can can share with candidates:

Company info, fundraising, and team: https://www.paraform.com/company/vellum-(yc-w23)

What's it like working at Vellum?

  • We’re laser focused on helping companies bring AI into production and providing real value. Decision making is simple: if what we do allows our users to increase how many use cases of AI they’re able to successfully put into production, then we do it!

  • Don’t cut corners, cut the right corners. What can you do with 10% of your time to get 90% of the desired impact? Now that you only spent 10% of the time doing something, imagine how much more can be done with the rest of your time!!

  • Everyone is a 1000x engineer/designer/pm when they’re passionate about the problems they’re solving and love the people they’re working with

  • Because we trust each other, we can move fast and have fun doing it 😄

One selling point you can mention to candidates on a phone screen:

  • Working with Vellum means you get a front row seat into seeing what exciting AI companies are using AI to build. Because of our product, we get to see what companies are using AI for and what it takes to build a successful AI-powered product. For someone who is entrepreneurial and dreaming about starting their own startup one day, this is a cool opportunity.

Technical problems we're solving

There are so many interesting problems we need to solve: prompt chaining, fine-tuning infrastructure, open source models and multimodality, just to name a few. Ultimately, the goal is to bring engineering best practices to the fast moving world of AI/LLMs and ensure that our customers have the best models for the job trained on their own company specific data.

In case the candidate is curious:

  • Google Cloud Platform - as our cloud provider

  • Postgres - as our primary database

  • Python - what we write our backend in

  • Django - for our webservers

  • Flask - for our microservices

  • Typescript - what we write our frontend in

  • React - as our frontend framework

Things you should look out for when you initially screen candidates:

  • Are they articulate good communicators?

  • Excitement level of the AI space is good to gauge. They have to be excited about AI (even better if they're actively looking) but if they are just looking for another job at any company we'll probably not be as excited.

  • Excitement level of working at an early stage startup.

  • Understanding whether they meet the technical requirements on paper?
avoid_traits: Too conservative / risk averse
Is uncomfortable talking to customers
Prefers to do things on their own without collaborating with others
Has a strong need for work-life balance

company.name: Vellum AI
company.description:
At Vellum, our mission is to be the primary platform companies use to bring AI into production. AI is the biggest platform shift since the internet, the applications are everywhere! With foundation models getting better we expect the world to be dramatically different in the future. We intend to be the platform layer to bring this amazing technology to life in production use cases.

We enable companies to bring real business value from AI / LLMs. The output generated by AI / LLMs is usually stochastic and bringing AI into production requires robust testing and choosing the right model for the job. We’ve seen companies spend months of engineering time building good tooling for this (time which could be spent on their core end user facing product) and despite this they struggle to get the best results out of these models. Our platform provides companies best in class tooling to use their own data in production AI applications.

We’re a YC W23 company, raised $9.5m and are backed by top investors like Rebel Fund, Eastlink Capital, Arash Ferdowsi (co-founder of Dropbox), Dharmesh Shah (co-founder of Hubspot), Dan Scholnick (board member of Weights & Biases, Docker, New Relic), and Divya Bhat (former YC group partner, 2x CEO). We announced our fundraise on TechCrunch here: https://techcrunch.com/2023/07/11/prompt-engineering-startup-vellum-ai/

We’re excited to build our core team. The initial team will play a key role in the long term growth of the company.​

P.S: Why the name Vellum? - Vellum is a type of paper - the Magna Carta was written on Vellum. We intend to be the standard source of record in production - You can’t spell Vellum without LLM 😉
company.teamAbout:
Working at Vellum

  • We’re laser focused on helping companies bring AI into production and providing real value. Decision making is simple: if what we do allows our users to increase how many use cases of AI they’re able to successfully put into production, then we do it!

  • Don’t cut corners, cut the right corners. What can you do with 10% of your time to get 90% of the desired impact? Now that you only spent 10% of the time doing something, imagine how much more can be done with the rest of your time!!

  • Everyone is a 1000x team member when they’re passionate about the problems they’re solving and love the people they’re working with

  • Because we trust each other, we can move fast and have fun doing it 😄

Our Values

We live these values every day, we know there are difficult tradeoffs to each of these values and we’re willing to accept them.

1. It’s always Day 0

Every day is an opportunity to excel. We tackle challenges head-on, execute relentlessly, and strive for continuous improvement.

2. Customers come first

We are committed to exceptional customer service. Customers should be delighted when using our product. We measure our success by the tangible business outcomes our customers achieve through our products.

3. Be resilient, not stubborn

We maintain a positive outlook and work through challenges. Our team supports each other, ensuring we don’t let setbacks hinder our progress. We recognize the fine line between resilience and stubbornness, striving to stay on the right side of it.

4. Take care of each other

We believe in the power of teamwork. Our high-trust, low-ego culture ensures we support each other, cover for teammates when needed, and prioritize collective success over individual achievements. We hire and invest in top talent.

5. Go and see

We take full responsibility for our work, striving for excellence in everything we do. No task is beneath us, and we actively seek out and address issues at their source. Our commitment to relentless execution ensures continuous improvement and high-quality results.

6. Share more, share often

We prioritize clear and frequent communication using various tools. By keeping everyone informed, we minimize surprises and ensure alignment across the team.

7. Be transparent

We are committed to honesty with current and future teammates, customers and investors. Transparent communication and setting realistic expectations are essential to success.

8. Love your work, Love AI

We are passionate about AI and genuinely curious about its potential. Our team actively engages with the technology, ensuring we stay at the forefront of the industry.

9. Cut the right corners

We prioritize efficiency and rapid execution. By focusing on the most impactful tasks and adopting a Minimum Viable Product (MVP) mentality, we move quickly without sacrificing quality.

10. Don’t be an asshole

We maintain a respectful and supportive workplace. We communicate openly, give constructive feedback, and avoid ego-driven behaviors. This value ensures a positive and collaborative work environment.

company.name: Multiply
company.description:
Multiply is building financial products for innovators.

We started with an affordable line of credit secured by private tech company stock, enabling employees to buy a home, pay tuition, pay for their wedding, and other major life events without giving up any equity or waiting for an exit. It’s the most affordable, convenient, and fair source of liquidity available.

Multiply is a Series A startup backed by Kleiner Perkins, A* Capital, and Box Group, as well as founders and executives from Plaid, Figma, DoorDash, Notion, Instacart, Faire, Flexport, Ramp, Niantic, Rippling, Iterable, Lattice, Newfront, and more.

company.description:
At Hearth AI, our mission is to radically expand our capacity to stay connected with our people. We want to empower teams to discover more mutuality and create more matches. Founded in 2022, we're building a new relationship management platform powered by AI that fundamentally rethinks the modern network.

We're a small team of builders and artists based in SF, united by a love of people, cutting-edge tech, disciplined focus, fast execution, and the creative invitation to craft with skillful care. We're driven to operate on the frontiers of machine learning and AI in a rigorous engineering environment - to deliver the next generation of products. We believe talent is the ability to let ideas manifest themselves through you. We welcome the not knowing, the challenging tasks, the cyclic confrontation of ideas with real-world feedback. We're here to create.

We're backed by leading investors from Slack Fund, Salesforce VC, M13, Pear VC & angels from Google Brain, Anthropic, Notion, and more 🔥
company.teamAbout:
Values are defined by the tradeoffs we make. This is our living document for harmonizing the Hearth team decision-making process. By sharing our values, we are sharing the culture and intent with which we are creating and using Hearth.

I. We view ourselves as artists - this elevates us as engineers

We are conduits for channeling creative energy into materializing new technology and experiences. We tradeoff comfort and stability for growth and creation. The way out is through. We celebrate that birthing hurts.

II. We value strong action bias

The uncertainty in the creative act doesn’t paralyze us. We tradeoff the false sense of security that comes from fixating on process with decisive action that allows us to rapidly learn from our environment.

III. Goodwill is the reflex

We assume the best from others. We tradeoff the emotional reprieve of interpersonal judgement with the practice of listening to understand and sitting with the range of experiences. And even in the worst case, we know that if they knew better, they would have done better.

IV. We value direct and honest communication

We believe in an obligation to truth-seeking. We believe in high-accountability and no-blame. We tradeoff the illusion of conflict avoidance with transparent communication.

name: Staff Software Engineer, Backend
description:
Monad helps organizations manage an ever increasing sprawl of security tools and systems; ingesting, transforming, and storing security events and data at scale.

We’re hiring Senior Software Engineers for our core team to help us build a high performance, security oriented, data platform.  In this role you will help to architect, and build, the services and systems that lie at the heart of Monad, ingesting huge volumes of security data.  This role is fully remote. We have no physical offices, but we do have yearly offsites to get to know each other in person too!

requirements.description: Mastery of Golang (Ideally, as we’re writing our new platform in it.  If you’re willing to learn however, we’re willing to help)
An understanding of the tradeoffs that fast moving startups need to make, and a willingness to be flexible in your approach to building the services we need
No signs of job hopping (consecutive <1.5yr stints)
Experience designing and building systems which utilize Kubernetes or interact with Kubernetes primitives’ and CRDS.
Experience doing performance benchmarking and analysis in go, particularly around JSON serialization/deserialization
You’ve worked with and have extensive experience in real-time data delivery and streaming kinesis or Kafka
This role is only open for US-based individuals.
A pragmatic approach to engineering. You enjoy “boring technology” because you know it’s rock solid and lets you focus on building interesting things with it
A bias towards action; at an early stage startup we need engineers who’ll “get things done” and are excited by autonomy

responsibilities: In the first three months you’ll:
Help us design the second generation of our platform, aiming to increase our performance and scalability. (The first iteration was written in Python)
Build core functionality of the new platform, working closely with the rest of engineering
Help us build integration testing for the new platform, as well as load testing functionality, so we can be confident in our performance
Talk to our existing customers and design partners to help ensure we’re building to meet their needs.  This won’t eat up all your time, but we think it’s important for engineers to know our customers
workPlaceText: Our remote-first approach ensures you have the flexibility to work where you thrive, supported by a culture that values autonomy, collaboration, and personal growth.
visa_text_more: Can only sponsor if the candidate already has a visa
experience_info: in backend engineering.  You’ve written and supported services in production
recruiting_advice:
This would be employee #7 or #8 so we need a superstar that can come in and hit the ground running. Startup experience and/or FAANG is highly preferred. Extensive experience with Go is a hard requirement.

Looking forward to working with you on this role! ~
avoid_traits: job hopping (less than 18 months in consecutive roles.)
Lack of ownership, accountability, adaptability and autonomy
Anyone residing outside of the US

company.name: Monad
company.description:
At Monad, we're all about making security simpler and more effective. Our mission is clear: we break down the barriers between different security tools, shining a light on hidden risks, and giving security teams the power to manage their data their way. Think of us as the go-to folks for security data ETL (Extract, Transform, Load). We're here to untangle the complex web of security data, making it easier for teams to get the insights they need and act fast.

As a Series A startup backed by industry giants like Sequoia, Index Ventures, and Harpoon, we’re on a rapid trajectory, powered by innovation and driven by a fully remote team. We embrace flexibility, autonomy, and the collective effort to push boundaries in the cybersecurity domain.

Why Monad?

As part of Monad, you'll play a pivotal role in shaping the future of cybersecurity management. We offer the chance to innovate at the forefront of our field, backed by some of the most prestigious investors in the tech world. Our remote-first approach ensures you have the flexibility to work where you thrive, supported by a culture that values autonomy, collaboration, and personal growth.

name: Gen AI Account Executive
description:
Joining Vellum as an AE this early means that you’ll play a huge part in guiding both the business and cultural evolution of the company.

Together, we’re going to face the hardest sales challenges this journey has to offer and build our sales function from the ground-up. As the team grows, you’ll be the battle-hardened expert that everyone looks towards for guidance.

With great power comes great responsibility 🙂

requirements.description: You have ML industry experience or have worked as a sales engineer
requirements.explanation: After ramping up in the new role, you should be able to articulate technical concepts in a simple, precise language to both our technical & non-technical buyers. Our buyers include ML engineers, data scientists & data engineers.

You’re excited to roll up your sleeves to build the sales function from the ground-up
You’ve worked at a Seed, Series A or Series B startup
