requirements.description: Bonus: you’re already familiar with Gen AI / LLM space

responsibilities: Owning our sales process from qualifying new prospects, to managing deals to closure
Our sales cycles run 15-45 days and you’d need to run multi-threaded conversations with executives, engineers and business audiences
You’d also coordinate discussions with legal/procurement/security as part of the sales process
Building your own pipeline to supplement inbound
You’d experiment with outbound tactics like email, social selling (LinkedIn/Twitter etc.), ABM, events etc. to build more pipeline and help us grow faster
Your own pipeline is expected to be 20-30% of your monthly quota
Partnering with the CEO to standardize sales processes
We would figure out together how to streamline discovery, demo, objection handling
We’d negotiate favorable pricing and business terms with our customers by selling business outcomes and quantifiable value. We’re continuously experimenting with ways to drive up ACV
Collaborating closely with the rest of the company
Marketing: Close partnership to determine which channels are working and how to get more inbound leads
Product & Engineering: Serve as voice of customer and share what prospects are looking for to inform the roadmap
Serving as a cultural pillar of the team
workPlaceText: Hybrid, with an office in NYC
visa_text_more: Visa transfers and O-1 applications
experience_info: of quota carrying experience at a B2B startup. You should have also met or exceeded your quota consistently
recruiting_advice:
Looking for candidates who have sold products to technical teams is the #1 priority for the role. AI/ML experience is #2

Some things you can can share with candidates:

Company info, fundraising, and team: https://www.paraform.com/company/vellum-(yc-w23)

What's it like working at Vellum?

● We’re laser focused on helping companies bring AI into production and providing real value. Decision making is simple: if what we do allows our users to increase how many use cases of AI they’re able to successfully put into production, then we do it!

● Don’t cut corners, cut the right corners. What can you do with 10% of your time to get 90% of the desired impact? Now that you only spent 10% of the time doing something, imagine how much more can be done with the rest of your time!!

● Everyone is a 1000x engineer/designer/pm when they’re passionate about the problems they’re solving and love the people they’re working with

● Because we trust each other, we can move fast and have fun doing it 😄

One selling point you can mention to candidates on a phone screen:

● Working with Vellum means you get a front row seat into seeing what exciting AI companies are using AI to build. Because of our product, we get to see what companies are using AI for and what it takes to build a successful AI-powered product. For someone who is entrepreneurial and dreaming about starting their own startup one day, this is a cool opportunity.
avoid_traits: Should have high willingness to learn

company.name: Vellum AI
company.description:
At Vellum, our mission is to be the primary platform companies use to bring AI into production. AI is the biggest platform shift since the internet, the applications are everywhere! With foundation models getting better we expect the world to be dramatically different in the future. We intend to be the platform layer to bring this amazing technology to life in production use cases.

We enable companies to bring real business value from AI / LLMs. The output generated by AI / LLMs is usually stochastic and bringing AI into production requires robust testing and choosing the right model for the job. We’ve seen companies spend months of engineering time building good tooling for this (time which could be spent on their core end user facing product) and despite this they struggle to get the best results out of these models. Our platform provides companies best in class tooling to use their own data in production AI applications.

We’re a YC W23 company, raised $9.5m and are backed by top investors like Rebel Fund, Eastlink Capital, Arash Ferdowsi (co-founder of Dropbox), Dharmesh Shah (co-founder of Hubspot), Dan Scholnick (board member of Weights & Biases, Docker, New Relic), and Divya Bhat (former YC group partner, 2x CEO). We announced our fundraise on TechCrunch here: https://techcrunch.com/2023/07/11/prompt-engineering-startup-vellum-ai/

We’re excited to build our core team. The initial team will play a key role in the long term growth of the company.​

P.S: Why the name Vellum? - Vellum is a type of paper - the Magna Carta was written on Vellum. We intend to be the standard source of record in production - You can’t spell Vellum without LLM 😉
company.teamAbout:
Working at Vellum

  • We’re laser focused on helping companies bring AI into production and providing real value. Decision making is simple: if what we do allows our users to increase how many use cases of AI they’re able to successfully put into production, then we do it!

  • Don’t cut corners, cut the right corners. What can you do with 10% of your time to get 90% of the desired impact? Now that you only spent 10% of the time doing something, imagine how much more can be done with the rest of your time!!

  • Everyone is a 1000x team member when they’re passionate about the problems they’re solving and love the people they’re working with

  • Because we trust each other, we can move fast and have fun doing it 😄

Our Values

We live these values every day, we know there are difficult tradeoffs to each of these values and we’re willing to accept them.

1. It’s always Day 0

Every day is an opportunity to excel. We tackle challenges head-on, execute relentlessly, and strive for continuous improvement.

2. Customers come first

We are committed to exceptional customer service. Customers should be delighted when using our product. We measure our success by the tangible business outcomes our customers achieve through our products.

3. Be resilient, not stubborn

We maintain a positive outlook and work through challenges. Our team supports each other, ensuring we don’t let setbacks hinder our progress. We recognize the fine line between resilience and stubbornness, striving to stay on the right side of it.

4. Take care of each other

We believe in the power of teamwork. Our high-trust, low-ego culture ensures we support each other, cover for teammates when needed, and prioritize collective success over individual achievements. We hire and invest in top talent.

5. Go and see

We take full responsibility for our work, striving for excellence in everything we do. No task is beneath us, and we actively seek out and address issues at their source. Our commitment to relentless execution ensures continuous improvement and high-quality results.

6. Share more, share often

We prioritize clear and frequent communication using various tools. By keeping everyone informed, we minimize surprises and ensure alignment across the team.

7. Be transparent

We are committed to honesty with current and future teammates, customers and investors. Transparent communication and setting realistic expectations are essential to success.

8. Love your work, Love AI

We are passionate about AI and genuinely curious about its potential. Our team actively engages with the technology, ensuring we stay at the forefront of the industry.

9. Cut the right corners

We prioritize efficiency and rapid execution. By focusing on the most impactful tasks and adopting a Minimum Viable Product (MVP) mentality, we move quickly without sacrificing quality.

10. Don’t be an asshole

We maintain a respectful and supportive workplace. We communicate openly, give constructive feedback, and avoid ego-driven behaviors. This value ensures a positive and collaborative work environment.

company.name: Applied Intuition
company.description: Applied Intuition is a Tier 1 vehicle software supplier that accelerates the adoption of safe and intelligent machines worldwide. Founded in 2017, Applied Intuition delivers the definitive ADAS/AD toolchain and a world-class vehicle platform to help customers shorten time to market, build industry-leading products, and create next-generation consumer experiences. 18 of the top 20 global automakers trust Applied Intuition’s solutions to drive the production of modern vehicles. Applied Intuition serves the automotive, trucking, construction, mining, agriculture, and defense industries and is headquartered in Mountain View, CA, with offices in Ann Arbor and Detroit, MI, Washington, D.C., Munich, Stockholm, Seoul, and Tokyo.
benefits: Health insurance: Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance, 100% of employee premiums paid for by Applied Intuition.

Learning stipend: We invest in your learning and growth by reimbursing you for educational and training expenses.
Fitness and wellness stipend: Reimbursed fitness expenses and 25 free Lyra coaching or therapy sessions each for you and your dependents.
Parental leave: 12-week, fully paid parental leave to bond with a newborn child or new adopted or foster child.
company.teamAbout:
Accelerating the world’s adoption of safe and intelligent machines

Applied Intuition was founded in 2017 to equip engineering and product teams with software that makes it faster, safer, and easier to bring autonomous systems to market. While the autonomy industry was thriving, there were no easy-to-use solutions to safely develop, test, and deploy autonomous systems at scale.

Today, we work with 18 of the top 20 OEMs across the globe and offer a portfolio of products. Our team is growing rapidly, and we’d love to hear from you if you’re passionate about moving the entire autonomy industry forward.

name: Assistant Controller
description:
As Senior Accountant/ Assistant Controller, you will own the financial accounting processes for a high growth, tech enabled service business.  Responsibilities span G/L management, Payroll, Month-end Analytics, financial analysis, Accounts Receivable, Accounts payable, Taxes and banking relationships.  Reporting to the CFO, you will serve as a key leader to ensure financials are reported accurately, completely, timely and within GAAP reporting / controls.   The team is growing and this role actively manages direct reports in  Payroll, Accounts Payable, and General accountant(s).  In this role you will be the key finance representative with sales, operations, creative and strategy teams to ensure key cross-functional processes are managed effectively and can be accounted for accurately, timely and efficiently without administrative burden.

The ideal candidate will be a fast learner and capable of building on the existing processes to support increased efficiencies, control and accuracy across the business.

requirements.description: BS degree in Accounting/Finance or equivalent.
Working Knowledge of GAAP.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel/Google sheets formulas (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUP).
Knowledge of SQL.
Experience with multi-state payroll processing and payroll taxes for out of state employees.
Expert in Microsoft Office applications (Excel), Google Sheets, and QB/QuickBooks Online.
Strong Analytical and Organization skills
Strong communication and collaboration skills, ability to multitask and work under pressure, thrive in a fast-paced environment.
Demonstrated experience in managing a team of 4 - 5 accounting and finance team members in a high growth, tech enabled service business.
Comfortable and experienced working with deadlines and willing to work extended hours at time to meet obligations.
Demonstrated problem solving skills leveraging analytics, technology and process support across teams.
Demonstrated ability to manage high volume data sets in complex operations, reconciliations and leveraging data insights to validate financial performance.
CPA license ideal, but not required.
Exceptional organization and communication skills.
Manager level (managed at least 3) in account management/client success at:

company.name: TubeScience
company.description:
Over the past 8 years, we quietly bootstrapped TubeScience into the largest producer of social media ads in the USA. While our public profile is minimal (ironically, we don’t do any self-marketing), we have hundreds of employees, billions of dollars in ad spend, and deep technical partnerships with Meta and other platforms. 

What helped us do so is an obsession for numbers over opinions, and a unique “pay for performance” business model. Clients only pay if our ads outperform anything they or any other agency delivers. It’s a very “honest” business model, and clients tend to love it (resulting in extremely high retention and all our sales to date coming from inbound / word of mouth). 

As we look towards the future and AI advances, we see an incredible opportunity to reinvent our business. We plan to take everything we’ve learned, and turn it into a true self-service SaaS offering that can power agencies and in-house teams alike.
benefits: Be part of a passionate, entrepreneurial team that is driven to succeed and working on a high impact problem.
A unique opportunity to shape a team from the ground up.
company.teamAbout:
Our values:

  • Do the right thing

    especially when it's difficult

  • Be the best

    at whatever we do

  • No snake oil

    regardless of how tempting

name: Senior Product / LLM Engineer
description:
At Actively AI, our product is clicking with really fast growth customers and we now want to put our foot on the gas. Concretely, this means doing two things: making it faster to bring in and onboard new customers and executing on an ambitious product roadmap.

Our ultimate vision is to literally be able to sell a revenue-printing machine to our customers (”plug this in and we’ll power & supercharge as much of your sales + marketing function as possible”) and we think we’re well-positioned to get there… but there’s a lot to build!

To help us get there, we’re looking for exceptional engineers who are excited about digging in across:

  • the product (working closely with users and customers and owning new product features that make the product significantly more valuable for customers end-to-end)

  • the stack (some combination of product engineering, working with LLMs, and building infra to make this work reliably and at scale — we process tens of millions of rows of data daily, including thousands of emails, notes, and call transcripts with LLMs)

  • the entire business (contributing to everything from engineering & product to figuring out and scaling the sales motion (”go-to-market” / GTM) — we’re excited about the rare kind of engineer who wants to deeply understand customers and apply those same problem-solving skills to “reverse-engineering” our own sales motion, and think this is what has enabled some of the fastest-growing companies in the world, including multiple of our own customers, to scale as quickly as they have)

This is an extremely high-leverage, high-ownership role that touches the entire business — we firmly believe all problems are everyone’s problems here. If this excites you, we’d love to talk!

requirements.description: Very strong engineering and/or ML background.
requirements.explanation: You have great technical skills and interest or experience working with LLMs. You enjoy build things (especially from scratch) and are obsessive about what you’re building.

requirements.description: High slope and desire / ability to “learn it all.”
requirements.explanation: You’re curious, always want to learn, and know how you learn best; you’re able to pick up new skills (technical or non-technical) quickly and seek out the help you need.

requirements.description: Stellar career trajectory
requirements.explanation:
& excited to take the next step in your path!

Ideally former founder and/or 2+ years of experience at a hyper-growth startup working very closely with customers (we call it “owning delivery”)

requirements.description: Went to a top university and/or significant work experience at a top, hyper-growth startup
High autonomy, ambitiousness, ownership.
requirements.explanation: You’re pragmatic and love to ship quickly to deliver for customers; you’re excited about owning and leading major parts of the product and roadmap. You’re entrepreneurial and want to build a category-defining company.

requirements.description: Excitement about being hands-on and iterating with customers.
requirements.explanation: You’re a great communicator with blend of technical & product skills, and you love to talk to customers and users and make them happy! You’re very scrappy and willing to dig in where needed. You can figure out what customers want and drill that back into their underlying pain points. You have extreme attention to detail (especially for things that go in front of customers) and the ability to think from a user’s perspective.

requirements.description: Previous experience as a founder or founding engineer
Able to work in person in NYC
Experience with LLMs
Excited to join early-stage, growing company and likes to build things

responsibilities: Talk to multiple users of our product at current customers, or new companies we’re piloting with, to see how they’re using it, what they need help with, and what we can build to make them more successful — we believe in being super hands-on, especially in this phase, to help our customers succeed (e.g., we onboard each sales rep 1:1, check-ins, fast feedback loops, etc.)
Build a piece of the product you’re owning that will produce a step change in value for our customers, and work closely with users to test it out and iterate
Help figure out what on the roadmap to prioritize next / what new features we can build out to solve issues users are facing or unlock more value
Help with data onboarding / POC for a new customer, including potentially building out tools (many AI-powered!) to automate this work and make it easier & faster in the future

Contribute to brainstorming on a top-of-mind GTM question (”what should the pre-sales process look like? what metrics should we anchor on? what kinds of customers should we disqualify earlier and how can we recognize them a priori?”)
workPlaceText: In-person in New York
experience_info: working in software engineering.
recruiting_advice: Our team has alumni from Stanford, Harvard, Berkeley, and CMU so if you find folks from there, can mention that in outreach. We are backed by leaders from Dropbox, Stripe, and Flatiron Health so you can also mention that if people have any ties to those universities.
avoid_traits: only front-end experience
only experience at big companies
did not go to a great university
not based in NYC - need in person

company.name: Actively AI
company.description:
Founded by Stanford AI researchers, Actively is an AI-powered pipeline generation agent that help sales teams prioritize, personalize, and increase SQOs at scale.

AI agents to help GTM teams 10x outbound efficiency by telling them who to target, when, and what to say — so reps spend their entire day talking to prospects.
company.teamAbout:
Our NYC-based team has AI research backgrounds from Stanford, Harvard, and CMU with industry experience at Google, Scale AI, Ironclad, Waymo, Robust Intelligence, and Microsoft. We're backed by top investors, including First Round Capital (seed investors in Uber, Square, Roblox, Clearbit), Lachy Groom, and Stanford AI faculty.

Our Founders

https://www.linkedin.com/in/mgarimella/

name: Director of Engineering
description:
Our engineering team prioritizes creating excellent systems via rapid iterations, collaboration, and peer review. We are looking for a Director of Engineering who will actively mentor and contribute to the personal development of their team. You get just as excited seeing others grow and learn under your leadership as you do by executing the work yourself. You seek to improve standard practices and cultivate a culture of excellence. Most importantly, you'll work with a diverse group of people and collaborate to create the best solutions for Atticus and our clients. 

We’re looking for a Director of Engineering to join Atticus. This person will focus on leading a highly skilled team of cross-functional frontend and backend engineers focused on building a highly performant, intuitive and secure client experience on the web for Atticus clients.

requirements.description: Experience with React or TypeScript.
Experience with Hadoop, MapReduce, or other “Big Data” systems.
You love fostering career growth and building a strong team culture.
You are versed in cloud computing systems (GCP, AWS, etc.) and SAAS concepts.
You’ve built modern, resilient and operationally sane systems exemplifying industry standards (HTTP REST, GraphQL, Stream processing, Big Data).
You proactively identify problems and opportunities and generate creative approaches to solve them.
You’ve planned for, built, evolved and scrutinized monitoring and alerting for your production systems.
You enjoy working collaboratively with a Director of Product and other Product managers to build and maintain a backlog of work for a team of engineers.
You can effectively plan engineering projects with ambitious timelines and advocate for efficient solutions to accomplishing them.
You are deeply committed to end user experience and jump at the chance to improve that experience.
You understand that celebrating accomplishments is just as important as looking for ways to improve.
You have experience managing multiple Engineering teams.
You use objective judgment in leveraging the right frameworks and technologies.
You can and have lead teams’ technical efforts to deliver and support large software systems
You know how to review code and deliver feedback.
You have written idiomatic JavaScript/Node.js or Golang; Java, Python, Scala, or Ruby.
You know best practices for deploying, troubleshooting, and maintaining systems in production.
Experience with Google Cloud Platform, Kubernetes, Docker, CircleCI, Git, Golang, Java.
You’ve leveraged continuous integration systems to their full extent (CircleCI, Bamboo, Jenkins, TravisCI).
Experience with GraphQL, GraphQL Federation, REST APIs and supporting network protocols.
Experience with a distributed SQL platform like CockroachDB or Google Spanner.

responsibilities: Help your team design, build and operate Atticus’ APIs with a focus on performance and reliability
Evaluate storage technologies and methodologies with an eye toward scalability and performance
Architect, design, review, and test code in a collaborative environment with other software engineers.
Leverage your team as multipliers for your skills to create excellent products and services
Train other technical leaders on the team to do as you do.
workPlaceText: This job is fully remote and we’re committed to empowering everyone with flexibility. Live wherever, work remotely, and travel to LA (on the company dime) as needed to be with your colleagues —somewhere between quarterly and yearly. We care a lot about building a great culture and we think some interactions need to happen in person, so we put a lot of thought into retreats, offsites, and other ways to gather.
visa_text_more: Can sponsor TN visa's only; Can't sponsor or transfer H1Bs
experience_info: leading engineering teams (can be a mix of technical lead + EM + Dir)
recruiting_advice:
Focus on the following:

  • Healthtech companies (Oscar Health, One Medical, Teledoc, Two Chairs etc)

  • B2C Consumer focused companies and marketplaces (Spotify, Airbnb, Uber, Turo, etc.)

  • B2B SaaS companies known for UX/ UI (Slack, Figma, Ramp, Brex, Stripe, etc.)

  • Top ~20 engineering schools (https://www.usnews.com/best-graduate-schools/top-engineering-schools/eng-rankings) or top ~20 national universities (https://www.usnews.com/best-colleges/rankings/national-universities)
avoid_traits: Poor communication skills
Not flexible or adaptable
History of job hopping; less than 2 years each of their roles
Lack of growth in previous roles; For example, no promotion after 2+ years in their roles

They've worked at companies that are unethical or reflect poor values, notably dysfunctional or discriminatory places, scammy MLMs, ponzi-type crypto, online gambling, marketing cosmetic surgery / tobacco / fast food / guns / alcohol, etc.
Their story is unclear and lacks big gaps, hard-to-grasp timelines, weird conflicts in jobs / dates / names, etc.
Their writing is weak, i.e. doesn't include endless jargon, different parts of speech used at random, typos, four-page resumes, ten bullets per job, etc.
Their resume and LinkedIn are not professional or organized, without crazy designs, multiple columns, lengthy personal statements, unprofessional photos, etc.
benefits: Medical and dental insurance with 100% of employee premiums covered
15 vacation days & 16 paid holidays each year
$1,000/year reimbursable stipend for education and training outside of work
Up to $1,200/year student loan repayment assistance
Free snacks, drinks, weekly lunches, and regular team dinners/events/retreats

company.name: Atticus
company.description: At any given time, 15 million Americans are experiencing a crisis that requires urgent help from our legal system or government. The right assistance could transform their lives. But today, most never get it. Atticus is a startup on a mission to change that. We're reinventing a broken space: the $100 billion market for legal services for individuals. We've taken a rare and exclusive commodity — access to expert legal advice and referrals — and made it free and available to everyone. To clients, we're a source of trusted guidance and an easy way to find and hire a great lawyer. To lawyers, we're a source of vetted clients and a way to build a practice they love while doing good. For now, most of our work involves helping disabled Americans qualify for government benefits. We also help victims of accidents, misconduct, and violence recover by getting compensation from insurance.
benefits: Medical and dental insurance with 100% of employee premiums covered
15 vacation days & 16 paid holidays each year
$1,000/year reimbursable stipend for education and training outside of work
Up to $1,200/year student loan repayment assistance
Free snacks, drinks, weekly lunches, and regular team dinners/events/retreats
company.teamAbout: We've helped more than 20,000 people in need (see our 6,000+ five-star reviews) and raised more than $50 million from top VC firms like Forerunner, GV (Google Ventures), and True Ventures. (We just closed our Series B round in May 2023, so we're well-funded for the foreseeable future.) We're small but moving fast — our team grew from 52 to 91 last year and we expect to grow again in 2024.

name: Senior Frontend Engineer
description: Join Mintlify as a Senior Frontend Engineer and contribute to building a top-notch product that enhances user experiences. A successful candidate will have experience with TypeScript, React, Next.js, and Tailwind CSS, as well as a keen interest in the developer tooling ecosystem. Strong communication skills, a growth-oriented mindset, and a focus on teamwork are essential for excelling in this role.

requirements.description: Experience with Next.js, Tailwind CSS, and TypeScript
Ability to go from 0-1
Interest in the developer tooling ecosystem
Familiarity with web development trends
Excellent communication skills, and experience working with customers
You're someone who values teamwork and enjoys collaborating with others to achieve common objectives, believing in the power of strong teams to drive change
Strong fundamentals and experience working at early stage VC-backed startup (ideally similar to Mintlify)
requirements.explanation: 0-to-1/builder persona/startup-y. Looking for candidates who worked at startups backed by top VCs like YC, a16z, bcv, sequoia, khosla bessemer etc (more examples in ideal companies section).

requirements.description: Has excellent user design sense through past experiences
Has a portfolio to demonstrate their work
Experience working with React

responsibilities: Interested in building experiences that impact millions of developers
Work directly with our CEO, CTO, and a handful of other engineers to build the modern standard for documentation
Must know React.js, Next.js, TailwindCSS, and Typescript
Must be in-person in SF (relocation available)
Take true ownership of your work and lead key features of the product roadmap
workPlaceText: In-person in San Francisco
visa_text_more: Can sponsor TN and H1B Transfers but not H1B Sponsorships
experience_info: in software engineering
recruiting_advice: Must have a personal portfolio.
avoid_traits: High ego or low agreeableness - anyone who generally seems un collaborative or not interested in listening to opposing ideas

company.name: Mintlify (YC W22)
company.description:
The best companies have effective and user-centric documentation at their backbone. Mintlify helps any company achieve the documentation they need effortlessly, so that they can focus on building what they do best.

Our team has worked across transformative tech companies, gone through YC, and found some amazing investors from Bain Capital Ventures and the founders of Vercel, Sourcegraph, and other top developer tooling companies. We’re well capitalized and ready to put it to good use.
benefits: 🌻 20 days paid time off every year
company.productDescription: Mintlify's platform reaches 12m+ developers every year and power the documentation of 2000+ companies. We're also the #1 most popular YC product used by other YC companies in the past four years.
company.teamAbout:
Our values

We’re a small team with big dreams - and the culture we create is just as important to us as the product we’re building.

📈 Growth oriented

Slope y intercept. We invest in people and growth as the company grows.

💚 Humility

Everyone has a lot to give and a lot to learn. Egos are not allowed.

🌟 Customer focused

We love our customers. We make decisions by focusing relentlessly on them - and accept if this means changing our ideas. Customer success is our success.

💡 Intellectual honesty

We believe in creating an environment where the best ideas win and acknowledging when we are wrong.

👾 Hack to success

We move fast and take big swings. We always aim for a solution that addresses 80% of the problem in 20% of the time. We make educated bets, launch MVPs, and iterate.

🔥 Having fun

Be unapologetically you! We love our game-nights, ping pong tournaments, bufo emojis, and cow jokes (the CEO knows over 100 of them and TechCrunch made fun of him for it).

name: Organic Growth Lead
description:
Fella Health is building a world-class team.

As Organic Growth Lead at Fella Health, you’ll work closely with our Head of Growth & CEO to build low-CAC, long-term-defensible organic channels to power Fella’s future growth engine.

You’ll start by executing our highest-promise organic channels. You’ll own Fella’s creator (influencer) program end-to-end, as well as leading our community/forum-led marketing efforts. You’ll also get your hands dirty doing whatever else is needed in growth.

Over time, you’ll transition to an organic growth scientist, discovering new potential organic channels before rapidly testing the highest-potential ones. Your workflow will be Discover → Test → Optimize → Scale.

In the future, you’ll be on path to own Fella’s entire organic growth strategy.

This is a full-time remote role.

You'll work closely with and report directly to our Head of Growth (Dave Lane) as well as our CEO (Richie Cartwright).

requirements.description: Learning: You're an autodidact with impressive speed and resourcefulness. You regularly teach yourself the skills you need from scratch.
Systems Mindset: You think in and build out systems. You drive towards automation where possible. You’re comfortable with no-code tools.
Language: You are fluent in English, with excellent communication skills.
End-to-end ownership — you are comfortable owning projects from noticing the problem to delivering the outcome.
Operating Skills
requirements.explanation:
• Specific experience: you likely have direct experience in creator (influencer) marketing or community/forum-led marketing. Maybe executing the work, and ideally leading the work.

  • Scientist: you probably hate unfounded assumptions. You’re weirdly comfortable analyzing something from first principles, testing your hypothesis, then coming to a different conclusion. Others call it “thinking outside the box” — but to you it just makes sense.

  • Complexity: you're likely highly organized and can complete multiple projects concurrently.

  • Mindset: you ideally calmly handle uncertainty and rapidly changing situations.

  • Past: you've been pulled into important problems, taken risks, and excelled in new areas. You've likely created something from nothing, however small.

  • Future: you may want to start your own company in the future.

requirements.description: Cultural Skills
requirements.explanation:
• Seeing systems — you recognize the system that produces the outcome and focus on improving the system to fix the underlying cause.

  • Positive-sum thinking — you think in terms of collaboration not competition.

  • Managing yourself — you own your schedule, your habits, your happiness, your life. Your team members help you flourish, but the eventual responsibility lies with you.

responsibilities: Execute highest-promise organic channels — You’ll work with our Head of Growth to execute on the two highest-promise organic channels so far.
Creators: you’ll test, optimize, scale Fella’s creator (influencer) program end-to-end.

Forum outreach: you’ll engage in forums & communities where potential fellas are active, starting with Reddit. If we get it working, you’ll build an AI-powered system (with our eng team) to scale your work.
Support across the Growth team — You’ll support our Head of Growth to maintain sharp insights and get your hands dirty.
Insights: you’ll have regular sales exposure (inc sales calls) to keep your insights sharp.
Support: you’ll get your hands dirty doing whatever else is needed in Growth.
In the future: Discover & test new organic channels - You’ll work with our Head of Growth to uncover new low-marginal-CAC, long-term-defensible organic channels.
workPlaceText: This is a fully remote role, and you’ll work async from Asia or Latin America.
experience_info: in Growth/Marketing. You're very good at early-stage growth & have the results to show.
recruiting_advice:
Advice from hiring Manager:

"For the Organic Growth Lead

  • I am mainly looking for great examples of organic growth successes they have had

  • e.g. built a thriving community that was generating xxx revenue per month

  • e.g. built an influencer program that was generating xxx revenue per month

  • The more whacky and out there the examples - the more impressed I will be as this is a very unique hire

  • What I am not looking for in this position is someone who is an expert in SEO - we will get a lot of applicants for this position from a background in SEO but I am looking for more of a growth hacker / guerilla marketer"
avoid_traits: North America and Europe candidates.

company.name: Fella Health
company.description:
We are the telemedicine clinic for bigger guys, worldwide. We use medical weight loss treatment to solve our fellas' most pressing healthcare need, then remain a fella's core healthcare provider for the rest of their life - focused on men's health, longevity, mental health, and primary care.

We will have served 1 million fellas by the end of 2026, and 10 million fellas by the end of 2028.

Our mission is to solve male obesity worldwide, by accelerating the take-up of GLP-1s in middle-aged men. From this, we’ll become the world’s leading men’s health brand.

We’ve grown >130x since Sept 2022 (currently growing >30% MoM) and are strongly cashflow positive. We have expanded our state coverage to >95% of US population, have started to expand our clinical protocol beyond weight (e.g. testosterone), and are eyeing up international expansion.

We're still a young startup and are moving quickly. We have a long way to go. This is still Day 1.

We're backed by top healthcare & consumer investors:

  • Y Combinator

  • Global Founders Capital — backed Facebook, Slack, LinkedIn, Revolut, Rocket Internet

  • AngelList Early Stage Fund (backed by Naval Ravikant)

  • BrandProject (venture-builder behind 2 unicorns)

  • The founders of Indeed, Curative (unicorn), Alan (unicorn), Kaia Health (>$300mil valuation), Vouch Insurance (>$500mil valuation), Not Boring (Packy McCormick)
benefits: Vacation: generous PTO with a yearly minimum (>2wks/yr + local national holidays)
Remote: our team is fully distributed across the world and functions fully remotely
Personal development: budget for books, courses, coaching ($400/yr)
Personal wellness: budget for gym, health apps ($400/yr)
company.teamAbout:
💬 These are the core cultural standards to which we hold ourselves & our team-members at Fella:

  • Belief in the mission — we will have served 10 million fellas by the end of 2028 (1 million fellas by end of 2026) and we transform the life of most fellas who join. We have a lot of work to do. We are obsessed with our fellas and are dedicated to the mission.

  • Bulldozing barriers — the world is malleable and we shape it. We truly believe this and act accordingly. We are relentlessly resourceful and are at the mercy of no-one but ourselves.

  • Unwavering integrity — we are at the frontier, so we often live in ambiguity with no trodden path. When we can’t look to others for guidance, we must maintain impeccable ethics and unwavering integrity.

  • Enduring frugality — we are frugal. We hate being wasteful and we are anti-luxury. We spend our cash wisely & carefully - in a way that would make our grandmas proud.

  • Do what is needed — speed is critical and often the solutions we need are messy. We are comfortable moving quickly and taking on gritty work.

  • End-to-end ownership — we are comfortable owning projects from noticing the problem to delivering the outcome.

  • Dedication to excellence — we are obsessed with our role, with a commitment to compounding self-improvement.

  • Commitment to candor — we believe in open communication and radical transparency. We are clear & caring communicators, welcoming feedback.

  • Only the paranoid survive — the road of expansion is bumpy. We are not fair weather sailers; we embrace the storms. However much we’ve already done, however far we’ve already come — all our work is still ahead of us.

  • Keep your head down — we’re boring people doing exciting work. We don’t chase short-term status: we ignore short-term dopamine hits and focus on what matters. Outsiders will underestimate us and we revel in that.

name: Founding Software Engineer
description: At Dot Product, the mission is to build a digital humanoid coworker that can work alongside people, using the same tools designed for humans. This role involves solving challenging AI, engineering, and product problems to create a superhuman AI coworker that can free up individuals to focus on more intellectually stimulating tasks. The team consists of experienced builders and former founders backed by top investors and operators in Silicon Valley.

requirements.description: Strong interest in working and experimenting with the latest AI advancements. You have caught the “LLM bug” and want to spend the next phase of your career going deeper.
Strong CS and engineering fundamentals.
Proficiency with Python and/or Typescript + React. Understanding of the modern web stack.
Good intuition for making technical, product, and business tradeoffs.
Experience doing 0-to-1 engineering work at either startups or personal projects.
Experience with deep learning modeling and infrastructure at large scale.
Good sense for product design and UX.
Experience working on low latency real-time systems.
Experience working at early-stage and fast-growing companies.

responsibilities: Designing and implementing end-to-end user-facing features and experiences. We are building in a completely new category, there is a lot that needs to be figured out for the first time.
Architecting and building systems to safely and compliantly serve our products to even the most demanding and regulated industries.

Reducing the end-to-end latency of the system, both real and perceived. This will require performance optimizations at all levels: from hacking on low-level GPU core optimizations to improving our algorithms to experimenting with novel UX ideas.
Solving engineering and product challenges that arise from translating new research ideas into production software.
Everyone on the founding team is expected to work extremely closely with our customers.
workPlaceText: In-person in San Francisco
visa_text_more: We are happy to sponsor visas like TN1, E3 etc. For H1B (or any lottery based visa) we are happy to transfer them but not sponsor new ones, since there's uncertainty in terms of whether the visa will actually get issued or not.
experience_info: building production software.
recruiting_advice:
Just to give some more filtering criteria, at least one of the following must be true:

  • Went to a top tier engineering school (e.g. MIT, Stanford, Berkeley, etc.)

  • Worked at a good AI research company (e.g. OpenAI, Cohere, etc.)

  • Worked at some good well respected silicon valley tech company (e.g. Meta, Google, Airbnb, Stripe, Coinbase, Figma, etc.)

While there are always diamonds in the rough, this simple heuristic will likely have a higher probability of success for who we are looking for.
avoid_traits: Only experience at very large companies or companies not known for high pedigree talent.
They are overly concerned with benefits, compensation, titles etc.
Have a tendency to move around quickly between companies, e.g. change jobs every 1-2 years.

company.name: Dot Product
company.description:
Dot Product is building AI coworkers for operations teams. We call them Operators.

Building Operators that can reliably do work equivalent to millions of human hours requires solving a lot of very hard engineering, machine learning, and product design challenges; it has never been done before. We believe that if we are successful, the results will be noticeable in the global GDP numbers, which makes us extremely excited to work on this every day. We have an opportunity to make a real dent and build a generational company.

We are a small team of builders and former founders, based in San Francisco. We’ve raised $6m from Index Ventures and Lachy Groom, with participation from Fred Ehrsam, Conviction, Marc Benioff, and many other great angels. If you are excited by our work and vision, consider applying to join our founding team.

  • Usman Masood

  • Maksim Stepanenko

  • Michael Dong
company.teamAbout:
Why work at Dot Product?

  • We care deeply about doing Great Work.

  • We are solving a hard technology problem with an enormous market and impact opportunity on the other side.

  • We are a small team of staff-level builders and intend to keep it this way. We hail from companies like Stripe, Coinbase, Primer and Pipe.

  • You will get to be part of the founding team and build the company together with us. We mean it.

  • We work in person out of our office in San Francisco.

Maksim Stepanenko

https://www.linkedin.com/in/maksimstepanenko/

  • Engineer #5 at Coinbase, where he built internal hedging infrastructure, started Coinbase Commerce, and was on the founding teams of Coinbase USDC and Coinbase Ventures

  • Cofounder, President and CTO at Primer.

  • Computer Science at MIT

Usman Masood

https://www.linkedin.com/in/umasood/

  • Staff Engineer and Engineering Manager at Stripe, where he built Ledger and the transactional balance tracking system that powers the Stripe API

  • CTO at Pipe, where he led and grew the engineering and data science team from 5-35 members

  • Chief Architect at PipelineDB (acquired by Confluent), where he built stream processing capabilities into Postgres

  • Computer Science and Philosophy at MIT

name: Founding ML Engineer
description: Joining Dot Product as a Founding ML Engineer means working on cutting-edge technology to create a digital humanoid coworker that can operate alongside humans using the same tools. This role involves designing and training models for multi-step workflows, experimenting with ML models, and building low latency inference infrastructure. You will be part of the founding team, collaborating closely with customers and contributing to the growth and success of the company.

requirements.description: 3+ years of experience working on deep learning.
Experience building, deploying and running ML infrastructure.
Strong Python programmer, and expertise in ML frameworks e.g. PyTorch, TensorFlow.
High level of autonomy and self-direction.
Familiarity with the state of the art LLMs and their strengths/weaknesses.
Experience doing 0-to-1 work on ML models and infrastructure.
Experience training, fine-tuning and prompt engineering generative models and LLMs.
Used and tuned ASR and TTS models.
Experience working at early-stage and fast-growing companies.
Experience with vector databases, embedding models and built real-world RAG pipeline construction.
You have deeply thought about or tinkered with LAM models—agents that can reason and perform actions to accomplish tasks.

responsibilities: Design and train models to run multi-step workflows by operating software directly (via keyboard and mouse) and calling APIs.
Experiment with and fine-tune existing ML models to find the right balance between size, accuracy and speed.
Design benchmarks to improve our understanding of data and model performance.
Build low latency inference infrastructure for speech, language and reasoning models.
Everyone on the founding team is expected to work extremely closely with our customers.

name: Founding Director of Client Success
description:
This is a founding customer success role that is crucial to TubeScience's success as we grow. The core competencies for this role are as follows:

  1. Strategic Planning and Implementation: The candidate must excel in developing and executing comprehensive client management rhythms that encompass all facets of client success, from onboarding to ongoing engagement. They should be capable of foreseeing potential challenges and structuring the communication and processes to mitigate them upfront.

  2. Proactive Communication Architect: Instead of waiting for issues to emerge, the ideal candidate proactively designs communication frameworks that keep clients informed, educated, and aligned with TubeScience’s methodologies and value propositions. This includes setting clear expectations from the outset and maintaining regular, structured touchpoints that preemptively address potential issues.

  3. This will also involve creating comprehensive, user-friendly guides and tutorials based on best practices and TubeScience's proven methodologies.

Business Insights Translator: Proficiency in understanding complex business challenges voiced by clients and converting them into constructive feedback for internal teams, thereby crafting and recommending solutions that align with the clients’ objectives. This not only requires a keen understanding of business strategy but also a deep knowledge of TubeScience’s capabilities.

  5. Relationship builder: Demonstrated that they can systematically build and maintain quality relationships with a large number (minimum 60, preferred up to 100) of people.

  6. Team building: Demonstrated ability to do org design and then fill the org with strong fit (culture & skills) and cost effective talent.

company.name: TubeScience
company.description:
Over the past 8 years, we quietly bootstrapped TubeScience into the largest producer of social media ads in the USA. While our public profile is minimal (ironically, we don’t do any self-marketing), we have hundreds of employees, billions of dollars in ad spend, and deep technical partnerships with Meta and other platforms. 

What helped us do so is an obsession for numbers over opinions, and a unique “pay for performance” business model. Clients only pay if our ads outperform anything they or any other agency delivers. It’s a very “honest” business model, and clients tend to love it (resulting in extremely high retention and all our sales to date coming from inbound / word of mouth). 

As we look towards the future and AI advances, we see an incredible opportunity to reinvent our business. We plan to take everything we’ve learned, and turn it into a true self-service SaaS offering that can power agencies and in-house teams alike.
benefits: Be part of a passionate, entrepreneurial team that is driven to succeed and working on a high impact problem.
A unique opportunity to shape a team from the ground up.

company.name: Neros Technologies
company.description:
Neros is transforming a defense industry mired in costly, behemoth machinery—to circumvent a looming vulnerability gap, to give dismounted soldiers a fighting chance against tanks, and ultimately, to get as many humans off the battlefield as possible.

While consumer technology is evolving by bounds on the smaller-cheaper-better path, U.S. defense technology wallows in the large, centralized, and wildly expensive paradigm. Our air, land, and sea machinery budget is staggering; yet these large assets can still be vulnerable to very small weapons. When swarm technology comes into its own, the asymmetry will escalate. Nowhere is the pattern more glaring than in small unmanned aerial systems (sUAS)—drones. 

https://www.sequoiacap.com/article/partnering-with-neros-next-gen-drones-made-in-america/

company.name: FleetWorks (YC S23)
company.description:
FleetWorks automates the 2B phone calls and emails that the freight industry makes every year. We use voice synthesis, generative AI, and integrations with logistics systems to solve the largest cost in this industry - people.

When Uber Freight needs to ship a truckload of Coca-Cola going from Phoenix to Bentonville. They can use FleetWorks to call the driver to get an ETA, alert the receiver and shipper that the driver is running late, and reschedule the appointment - all with automated text messages, phone calls, and emails.

❌ THE PROBLEM:

Getting freight from point A to point B is still largely handled by humans. Digitized brokers have driven automation, but most day-to-day operations are still handled over phone and email between millions of humans around the world. Given this overhead, freight brokerages operate on low single-digit margins.

Three roles in a freight brokerage spend a significant part of their day on repetitive tasks:

  1. Track and trace agents → Identify loads that are not being tracked automatically via apps, telematics, or aggregators. They reach out via phone or email to the driver or dispatcher for an update.

  2. Load coverage and carrier sales → Handle inbound/outbound calls to/from trucking companies that are interested to book loads. Information like weight, commodity, and appointment time is shared. Then the parties negotiate on price.

  3. Appointment schedulers → Set appointment times for unscheduled loads by calling or emailing facilities, or logging into customer portals. Due to unforeseen issues, 20-30% of appointments need to be rescheduled at the last minute resulting in even more work.

✨ OUR SOLUTION:

FleetWorks sits alongside a broker’s phone, email, and transportation management system (TMS). Calls and emails can be triggered automatically or manually, and relevant information is automatically pushed to the TMS or email for operators to take action.

FleetWorks can automatically

  1. Book loads: Share load details, discuss price, and book the carrier.

  2. Track loads: Call the driver and update the account team on issues.

  3. Schedule appointments: Email or call facilities that don’t have a booking portal.

💲 THE OPPORTUNITY:

There are 150 large brokers in the U.S. (>$100M gross revenue) and they are taking share from small brokers. These brokers alone spend $11B on operational headcount and 70% of headcount is involved in repetitive work.

These operators conduct 1 billion phone calls per year to manage load execution. Today, these calls cost $5-15 depending on complexity. At a rate of $1 per successful call (10x cheaper than the status quo), we believe our near-term market opportunity is $1B.

Given the $11B of spend on operational headcount, FleetWorks provides significant margin expansion for our customers.
company.teamAbout:
FleetWorks helps freight operators focus on high-value work by automating routine calls and emails. Our AI-powered platform can leverage email or use a human-like voice to make tracking calls, cover loads, and reschedule appointments.

Hi everyone, we are Paul and Quang - we’re on a mission to help freight brokers and forwarders become more efficient. Some background on us:

Paul Singer

Automating the manual parts of logistics management. Previously PM at Uber Freight where I led the tech teams managing carrier quality.

Quang Tran

Prior to FleetWorks, worked on moonshot projects at Airbnb. In parallel, cofounded an AI NFT company in 2021. Our team used LLMs and GANs to create & drop art on the blockchain.

name: Software Engineer - Frontend Developer Productivity (London)
description:
Are you passionate about engineering quality, efficiency, and increasing the impact of engineers around you?

Software Engineers at Palantir build software that transforms how the world’s most important organisations use data. As an engineer focused on Frontend Developer Productivity, you’ll work within our Frontend Infrastructure group to identify, develop, and drive investments to improve the velocity and quality of our engineering.

Our frontend infrastructure group covers our entire frontend development stack, from the developer experience in the IDE to the final user experience in the browser. Across the group, we are responsible for developing and maintaining:

Pitch

  • The Frontend Infrastructure group maximizes frontend developer productivity and ensures Palantir’s Foundry, Gotham, and Apollo platforms have performant and consistent user interfaces - they’re essentially managing and maintaining the whole FE ecosystem. The team manages build and CI systems, runtime infrastructure for serving applications, and widely shared component libraries like Blueprint.

Day-to-day

  • Devs on the team spend the majority of their time coding

  • Maybe you're making improvements to our Gradle-based build system

  • Finding efficient ways to make bulk changes across the codebase to improve it in some way (e.g. to upgrade a large shared dependency)

  • With more experience taking an active part in the process, helping us to identify areas we should invest and owning the solutions/outcomes

  • On-call rotations – primarily responding in slack and answering questions about developer infrastructure or other in-the-weeds frontend technical details.

    • While you are expected to be available via PagerDuty 24/7 during your week of this rotation, in practice the overnight pages are very rare

All Teams

  • FE Build Infra - manages the Continuous Integration (CI/CD) pipeline for frontend products, builds developer utilities, and keeps products up to date with the latest web technologies.

    • Strong technical executor

    • Interest and ability in going down technical rabbit-holes in code that we don’t necessarily own. e.g. reading the Webpack codebase to understand why it isn’t behaving the way we need.

  • Blueprint - open source frontend library on which all of our frontends are built:

    ensuring visual consistency across our applications, improving velocity of frontend engineers, and meeting our customers’ accessibility requirements.

    • This team manages the open source community, maintains the internal and open source repos, makes improvements that devs and designers ask for, and keeps all of our frontend monorepos on the latest Blueprint.

  • GraphQL

    • team’s mission is to abstract away the complexities of Palantir’s microservice platforms to simplify frontend development and improve UI performance.

  • Runtime Infra

    • team creates the tooling and services required to performantly and securely run frontend applications in the browser and beyond.

    • Team responsible for serving HTML and the bootstrapping

  • [NOTE: We are focusing this search on more Infra-type candidates]

requirements.description: Passion for helping other developers build better applications
Strong coding skills, with demonstrated proficiency in JavaScript/TypeScript, Java, C++, Python, or another similar programming language
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Great problem solving skills with the ability to navigate complex systems
Empathy for the impact your changes will have on the workflows and productivity of developers and end users
Demonstrated ability to design solutions that balance complexity and ongoing maintenance cost against value to the developer and end user
Eagerness to delve into the source code of open-source libraries (such Webpack or Chromium) to truly understand how they work or to debug an issue
Staying up-to-date with recent industry practices and advancements in open-source technology
In-depth knowledge of web technologies and/or build systems is preferred, but not required.
Familiarity with data structures, distributed systems, and other technical tools

responsibilities: Made improvements to custom vscode extension making it easier to internationalize strings (i.e. make it possible for them to be translated and rendered in other languages)

Been working on splitting our TypeScript compilation process into separate “transpilation” and “type-checking” phases - This greatly improves our CI build times by allowing us to begin the Webpack bundling process much earlier in the build (after “transpilation”, without needing to wait for “type-checking”)
Improve the build and CI system for a large frontend monorepo with millions of lines of code and hundreds of active developers - streamlining the process of integrating and testing new code changes.

Design core infrastructure required to develop and serve our frontends, incorporating features like feature flags for controlling the release of new functionality, internationalization for multi-language support, and commit previews for visualizing updates before deployment.
Define GraphQL API for declarative data loading, allowing our frontend applications to efficiently request and receive data from multiple underlying services.

Expand Blueprint, the open source UI framework used by all of Palantir's applications and thousands of developers around the world to enhance the visual and functional components available for building modern UIs

Optimizing and extending the Gradle-based build tooling, the aim is to counteract this slowdown, ensuring that developers can continue to work efficiently and quickly even as the codebase expands. This may involve implementing caching strategies, parallelizing tasks, optimizing dependencies, or developing custom plugins and configurations tailored to the specific needs of the monorepo.
workPlaceText: 3-4 days a week in the office in London, Relocation services are available to all new hires relocating 50+ miles to their new Palantir office of employment. Relocation support may be utilized for 12 months after the new hire's start date. After 12 months, relocation benefits will expire and unused benefits can no longer be used.
experience_info: in software engineering
recruiting_advice:
Level - Open to exploring what the sweet spot is, but we've been searching for someone between 2-6

  • Someone who can be an individual contributor from the get-go

  • Testing with people who have a lot of frontend experience as well, but open to them having backend also (as long as they have frontend empathy)

  • More experienced people might lean more toward leadership roles 

Any ideal companies to target?

  • Bigger tech companies like Meta, Google, Microsoft + mix of smaller companies usually lends well

    • Have the frontend infra/build infra/devex/productivity teams due to size

      • caveat here if not specifically on one of these teams less interaction with tooling/infra since DevEx teams abstract things away for their product teams

    • Likelihood of experience with large systems - experience working on a platforms at scale so usually indicates that they can work with something similar to Palantir's frontend monorepo.

  • Smaller tech companies - scrappy, often going outside of scope of role, tend to be gritty

Team Structure

  • Dev Productivity teams sit within core infrastructure group in Palantir. They were recently separated from other dev teams so now infrastructure is operating a bit more independently

    • Looking to grow + expand since it’s a new area of the org 

    • This role falls within the frontend area of the work - managing the whole frontend ecosystem 

    • Team focused on each build CI system, runtime infra, graphQL, component library, etc.

      • This person will support one particular function/team - the need now is to build the CI system, CI/CD pipeline 

      • Gradle is the main building system 

  • On the frontend side, there are around 15 people broken into the 4 teams, and the group lead is in Seattle

Learnings so far

  • Found success with individuals who’ve worked in big tech (they have DevX teams), though the risk here is limit of scope 

  • Could also look at startup experience with a wider scope - working in product with experience supporting dev

Tech terms

  • Transpilers, like Babel for JavaScript or TypeScript compiler for TypeScript, are

    tools that automate the transpilation process

  • Variety of programming languages Typescript, java

  • Open-source libraries and frameworks like React and GraphQL.

    • Graphql – flexible data fetching, has a strong type system that enables frontend developers to know exactly what data is available, what types it has, and what fields can be queried, exposes a single endpoint for all data queries and mutations, provide a way to receive real-time updates from the server, has a growing ecosystem of libraries, tools, and services that help frontend developers integrate GraphQL into their projects

  • Industry-standard build tooling, including Gradle, Webpack, CircleCI, and GitHub.

    • Gradle – tool automating the process of compiling, testing, and packaging their code into executable programs or libraries

    • Webpack - open-source module bundler for JavaScript applications.

    • CircleCI - continuous integration (CI) and continuous deployment (CD) platform that automates the process of building, testing, and deploying software. It integrates with popular version control systems like GitHub and Bitbucket and runs your build and test processes whenever new code changes are pushed to the repository.

    • GitHub - web-based platform for version control and collaboration using Git. It allows developers to manage their code, track changes, collaborate with other developers, and host open-source projects.
tech_stack: A variety of programming languages, including TypeScript, SCSS, and Java.
Open-source libraries and frameworks like React and GraphQL.
Industry-standard build tooling, including Gradle, Webpack, CircleCI, and GitHub.

company.name: Palantir
company.description:
At Palantir (NYSE: PLTR), we're helping the world's most important institutions use their data to solve their most urgent problems. Our software lets our customers integrate and analyze all of their data so they can answer questions that they couldn't before. From delivering disaster relief to building safer automobiles, we're honored to help make our partners better at their most important work.

Together with our customers, we're building the future of national security, healthcare, energy, finance, manufacturing, and more. And we need bright minds from around the world to help us.
company.teamAbout:
We want every Palantirian to achieve their best outcomes, that’s why we celebrate individuals’ strengths, skills, and interests, from your first interview to your longterm growth, rather than rely on traditional career ladders. Paying attention to the needs of our community enables us to optimize our opportunities to grow and helps ensure many pathways to success at Palantir. Promoting health and well-being across all areas of Palantirians’ lives is just one of the ways we’re investing in our community. Note that our offerings may vary by region.

In keeping consistent with Palantir’s values and culture, we believe employees are “better together” and in-person work affords the opportunity for more creative outcomes. Therefore, we encourage employees to work from our offices to foster connectivity and innovation. Many teams do offer hybrid options (WFH a day or two a week), allowing our employees to strike the right trade-off for their personal productivity. Based on business need, there are a few roles that allow for “Remote” work on an exceptional basis. If you are applying for one of these roles, you must work from the state in which you are employed. If the posting is specified as Onsite, you are required to work from an office.

name: Site Reliability Engineer (Sydney)
description:
We’re looking for a Site Reliability Engineer who can help us build, operate, and maintain high-performance, scalable, and reliable services for our production infrastructure. Site Reliability Engineers combine engineering experience and an innate drive to improve existing systems and processes, with the creativity to develop novel solutions to evolving challenges. Our team strives to automate processes wherever possible, using whichever tools are best for the job.

We strongly believe in engineering teams being responsible for the operations of their services in production. In this role, you’ll work closely with engineers to advocate and participate in sensible, scalable, systems design and share responsibility with them in diagnosing, resolving, and preventing production issues.

Our Sydney office is 30 people total, so it's a startup environment with the backing of a larger company.

Team

  • This role is on our database operations team and will primarily be dealing with Cassandra, Elasticsearch, and Kafka. The role is half support to ensure reliability of our products, and half project-based to build automations and tooling that transforms how the company thinks operationally about databases. It sounds like a database-centric role might not be the best fit if it's not an area of interest.

  • NY has lots of overlap w/ EU and APAC in regular working hours. Relatively easy handoff process. Pretty seamless handoff overall.

  • 8 members in Database Operations.

  • Interesting theme of everyone on the team - lots of initiative to read up on products, do

    research. General interest in foundational understanding of databases, how to keep things online, how to operate. Strong opinions. Take use cases for how tech has been implemented, keep up to date on the cutting edge.

Team - On call

  • 2 SREs in APAC. Every other week on call during working hours. 8hrs, 5 days a week.

  • Full weekends once every ~8 weeks

  • P2s once every 8 weeks.

requirements.description: Confidence in troubleshooting complex systems issues independently using observability tools and stack traces.
Ability to identify and automate highly manual tasks.
Comfort with large scale production systems and technologies - for example, load balancing, monitoring, distributed systems, or configuration management.
Proficiency with programming languages such as Java, C++, Python, JavaScript, or similar languages.
Ability to work with a high level of autonomy and responsibility in a rapidly changing environment with dynamic objectives and iteration with users.
Demonstrated ability to continuously learn and drive ongoing improvements within and across teams.

responsibilities: Think about systems — their edge cases, failure modes, and life cycles - and how to improve the long-term reliability and scalability of Palantir’s services.
Design, build, and maintain core services and infrastructure used by Palantir.
Participate in operations, including on-call rotations most business hours and every sixth weekend.
Help debug, improve, and optimise Palantir’s services and infrastructure.
workPlaceText: 3-4 days per week at the office in Sydney for first 6 months, then decide with the team after that
experience_info: in software engineering or engineering support, but can be open to 8-10 if the right experience + willing to do less glamorous dev work
recruiting_advice:
Selling points

  • High ownership. Lots of badness that we are responsible for fixing. Fixer mentality. High

    impact, really quickly

  • Exposure to big business problems

  • In the weeds in complex tech.

  • Transforming how we think operationally about DB. Room to steer things

  • Ambitious candidate, take a lot of responsibility in solving hard technical/operational

    problems.

  • Carry the region!! Level up all of AU!

Other

  • Not as much coding, but code diving, understand the system and figure out how system behaves under circumstances. That said, if they’re a Software Engineer that wants to code, there will likely be a lot of room for that.

name: Forward Deployed Software Engineer (Seoul)
description:
Forward Deployed Software Engineers (FDSEs) work directly with customers to quickly understand their greatest problems and design and implement solutions to use data against them. Our customers rely on Palantir’s platforms for some of their most critical operations, and projects often start with an open ended question like “Why are we delaying so many flights?” or “How can we better identify instances of money laundering?”

As an FDSE, you’ll apply your problem solving ability, creativity, and technical skills to help organizations use their data to drive a real impact in the world. You’ll have the opportunity to gain rare insight into and contribute to some of the world’s most important industries and institutions.

Whether you aspire to be an entrepreneur or an engineering leader, we believe Palantir is the best place — with the best colleagues — to learn how. You’ll learn how to unpack a problem and understand the costs and consequences of its solution. You’ll learn new technologies and languages, and even develop them yourself. You’ll work autonomously and make decisions independently, within a community that will support and challenge you as you grow and develop.

requirements.description: Strong engineering background, preferred in fields such as Computer Science, Mathematics, Software Engineering, Physics, and Data Science.
A highly analytical mindset and eagerness to solve technical problems with data structures, storage systems, cloud infrastructure, front-end frameworks, and other technical tools.
Experience or interest in working with and using large scale data to solve valuable business problems.
Strong coder with demonstrated proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, C++, TypeScript/JavaScript, or similar.

Demonstrated ability to collaborate effectively in teams of technical and non-technical individuals, and comfortable working in a rapidly changing environment with dynamic objectives and iteration with users.
Ability to continuously learn, work independently, and make decisions with minimal supervision.
Willingness and interest to travel as needed to client sites. Ability to travel 25-50% preferred, but requirements vary by team and location.
Ability to read, write, and speak fluent business Korean is a requirement.
Professional-level English
requirements.explanation: Internal communications, including the interview process, will take place in English

responsibilities: As an FDSE your responsibilities look similar to those of a startup CTO
Work in small teams with minimal supervision and own end-to-end execution of high stakes projects.
Discussing architecture with fellow engineers
Wrangling massive-scale data
Coding a custom web app
Speaking with customer executives
Establishing strategy for your team
workPlaceText: With customers around Korea Mon-Thu, at Palantir office in Jongno gu Fri
experience_info: with some flexibility - don't want to rule out anyone strictly because of this
recruiting_advice:
Growth opportunities

  • Forward Deployed Engineers are part of C-suite meetings

  • Very involved with customers

Recent reneg - learnings

  • Different social norms between western clients - if a candidate is used to working with western customers, they might not navigate traditional Korean conglomerates as well 

  • Require a bit of push, not as enthusiastic

  • This person must be willing to have the less fun conversations

Onboarding / First Month at Palantir

  • Weeks 1-2 in London - Learning the product, crash course in foundry with other new hires, attending Palantir seminars 

  • Week 3 in Korea - land on their projects

  • Each person gets a mentor (for day-to-day questions), and a lead (focused on their growth)

Other Notes

  • Salary - we are highly competitive in Korea, but might be less so for someone coming from big tech overseas

  • There are 26 people on the Korea team, and we often have happy hours together on Fridays!
avoid_traits: Looking for shiny tech, or wanting to solve really complex problems all the time
Comp is a very big driver - we're looking for someone more mission-aligned
Highly corporate candidates may struggle with complexity of our org and lack of hierarchy

name: Software Engineer - Frontend Developer Productivity
description:
Are you passionate about engineering quality, efficiency, and increasing the impact of engineers around you?

Software Engineers at Palantir build software that transforms how the world’s most important organisations use data. As an engineer focused on Frontend Developer Productivity, you’ll work within our Frontend Infrastructure group to identify, develop, and drive investments to improve the velocity and quality of our engineering.

Our frontend infrastructure group covers our entire frontend development stack, from the developer experience in the IDE to the final user experience in the browser. Across the group, we are responsible for developing and maintaining:

Pitch

  • The Frontend Infrastructure group maximizes frontend developer productivity and ensures Palantir’s Foundry, Gotham, and Apollo platforms have performant and consistent user interfaces - they’re essentially managing and maintaining the whole FE ecosystem. The team manages build and CI systems, runtime infrastructure for serving applications, and widely shared component libraries like Blueprint.

Day-to-day

  • Devs on the team spend the majority of their time coding

  • Maybe you're making improvements to our Gradle-based build system

  • Finding efficient ways to make bulk changes across the codebase to improve it in some way (e.g. to upgrade a large shared dependency)

  • With more experience taking an active part in the process, helping us to identify areas we should invest and owning the solutions/outcomes

  • On-call rotations – primarily responding in slack and answering questions about developer infrastructure or other in-the-weeds frontend technical details.

    • While you are expected to be available via PagerDuty 24/7 during your week of this rotation, in practice the overnight pages are very rare

All Teams

  • FE Build Infra - manages the Continuous Integration (CI/CD) pipeline for frontend products, builds developer utilities, and keeps products up to date with the latest web technologies.

    • Strong technical executor

    • Interest and ability in going down technical rabbit-holes in code that we don’t necessarily own. e.g. reading the Webpack codebase to understand why it isn’t behaving the way we need.

  • Blueprint - open source frontend library on which all of our frontends are built:

    ensuring visual consistency across our applications, improving velocity of frontend engineers, and meeting our customers’ accessibility requirements.

    • This team manages the open source community, maintains the internal and open source repos, makes improvements that devs and designers ask for, and keeps all of our frontend monorepos on the latest Blueprint.

  • GraphQL

    • team’s mission is to abstract away the complexities of Palantir’s microservice platforms to simplify frontend development and improve UI performance.

  • Runtime Infra

    • team creates the tooling and services required to performantly and securely run frontend applications in the browser and beyond.

    • Team responsible for serving HTML and the bootstrapping

  • [NOTE: We are focusing this search on more Infra-type candidates]

name: Technical Product Manager
description:
As a Technical Product Manager at Keep, you will be at the forefront of driving our product vision and strategy.

Why Join Keep?

  • Be a part of a visionary team transforming the Canadian fintech landscape.

  • Thrive in a culture that values data-driven decisions and cutting-edge technology.

  • Embrace our inclusive, remote work environment, promoting diversity and work-life balance.

requirements.description: A proven track record in fast-paced startup environments, demonstrating your ability to thrive in such settings.
Demonstrated expertise in managing multiple API vendor integrations, showcasing adaptability and a broad technology skill set.
Exceptional prioritization skills, focusing unwaveringly on strategic goals.
A deeply analytical mindset, with a history of making data-driven decisions, complemented by robust business acumen.
Proficiency in defining, owning, and enhancing KPIs related to platforms and integrations, driving sustainable growth and operational efficiency.
A strong background in technology and APIs, rooted in engineering and/or experience with platform products.
Previous fintech experience in US and/or Canada is a must have
Previous founder

responsibilities: Identify market opportunities and customer needs, leading the development of new features and products.
Oversee the complete product lifecycle, from initial research to launch and post-launch evaluation.
Collaborate closely with development, design, and operations teams to ensure the delivery of top-notch products.
Work in tandem with sales and marketing teams to guarantee effective promotion and marketing of our products.
Conduct thorough market analysis, staying ahead of emerging trends and opportunities, and keeping a close eye on the competition.
workPlaceText: 100% remote
