name: Senior QA Engineer
description:
Owner, advocate, and architect of quality, ensuring the stability and resilience of the Chronicle product.

What you’ll do

  • Advocate quality practices: Champion best practices and drive Chronicle's quality standards as the primary advocate for quality

  • Define & Document: Establish and manage initial product requirements and test cases to support the implementation of new features.

  • Collaborate & Problem solving: Work closely with the Product team to address and prioritise issues, ensuring a seamless user experience.

  • Comprehensive Testing: Conduct thorough testing across the entire Chronicle experience, from start to finish.

requirements.description: Capability to assist in troubleshooting, diagnosing, testing, and resolving product issues.
Ability to support, define, and review product requirements and specifications, developing comprehensive test plans and cases.
Strong skills in test planning, execution, and defect management.
Proficiency in functional automated software testing for complex web experiences.
Experience with Open Source UI test automation tools.
Expertise in testing backend API services.
Commitment to provide continuous feedback on quality assurance processes, aiming to enhance their effectiveness.
At least 1-2 years in a well regarded software company - especially early in the career.
Have experience working on creation and/or real-time, multi-user collaboration tools (over and above CRUD).

responsibilities: Advocate quality practices: Champion best practices and drive Chronicle's quality standards as the primary advocate for quality
Define & Document:  Establish and manage initial product requirements and test cases to support the implementation of new features.

Comprehensive Testing: Conduct thorough testing across the entire Chronicle experience, from start to finish.

recruiting_advice:
• Past experiences that we value

    1. Creator tools (Social media, Presentation software is a plus)

    2. Productivity tools

    3. Design / Product / UX background

    4. Early stage product experience

    5. Product design agencies

  • Why join Chronicle?

    • Everything starts with a story. But storytelling tools hold people back today. We are solving this big and interesting problem that will impact millions of users changing the way people craft and tell powerful stories every day. We are passionate to help anyone deliver presentations that are not just bearable, but enjoyable.

    • We are a design led company with an appreciation of great product taste. Think of it as joining the next Notion, Figma or Linear. We offer an opportunity to build the next big productivity tool with some of the smartest people in the space.

    • Chronicle is built on incredibly nuanced, high quality insights about presentations. There might be other teams who can build products better than us - but nobody can make presentations like we do. That makes a huge difference in the long run.

    • In a world that chases vanity and capital, Chronicle is a refreshingly different take - a place where quality, attention to detail and craft take precedence over mindlessly rushing to build something.

    • We reject mindless and scrappy building. We do not settle. We solve problems first principles. We are not influenced by startups, trends, frameworks. We want to build something timeless.

    • We work flexibly and do not believe in driving work through forced accountability. We try to hire only the best and give them the flexibility and space to do their life’s best work at Chronicle.

    • We offer competitive salaries, significant ESOPs and have open and transparent conversations about your compensation. We do everything in our reach to ensure you are able to bring your best self to work each day.

    • Chronicle is in a powerful position with the runway required to build a world class product - backed by some of the best and most respected investors in the world - Accel and SquarePeg. We are fortunate to have the right people on this journey with us who understand that this is a long term bet

    • We reject mindless and scrappy building. We do not settle. We solve problems first principles. We are not influenced by startups, trends, frameworks. We want to build something timeless.
avoid_traits: Enterprises only experience (e.g. CBA, Woolies, etc.)
Only 6-12 month stints
We are not looking for cowboys/girls → no contractors, dev shops, freelancers
We are not looking for heroes/mavericks → need experience working with a team

We are not looking for someone to only shape the strategic direction of the product - while interest in this space is valued it will not be a core responsibility since we have clarity and validation on our roadmap
We are not looking for just people managers or hands-off designers. This is an IC role and the IC must be at the top of their game with a decent tenure

company.name: Chronicle
company.description:
Chronicle is a new presentation format that enables people to create impactful stories, effortlessly. With remote work, shortening attention spans, and the advent of generative AI, the world has changed. Chronicle is designing the presentation experience that the future deserves.

We’re not creating a better way to do slides or documents - we’re creating a powerful new medium that fundamentally reimagines the role of a creator and consumer of a presentation at work, empowering users to deliver beautiful and engaging output with less effort.
benefits: Compensation. We offer competitive compensation and benefits, including ESOP for all employees, and regular feedback and review cycles, and discretionary performance-based bonuses.
Flexibility: We work remotely but in sync and flexibly, empowering our people to do their best work when and where it suits them, and to live fulfilling lives outside of work.
Autonomy: We maintain a high performance culture, providing significant autonomy to our team to own and deliver high quality, creative output.
Benefits: We offer generous benefits including top-tier equipment and allowances for remote work, learning and development, and wellbeing.
company.teamAbout:
We are a team of 11 senior operators. Mayuresh and Tejas are the Founders, leading product and customer respectively. Chris G leads design and Chris J leads engineering. (Yep, we have two Chrises). Pavan, Harris, Aki, Anik and Praveen are senior developers and Pradeep is a senior designer. Max is our chief of staff and works with Tejas on all things customer.

We believe a small team works most effectively at the stage we are at. We are a small team of senior operators located across Australia and India, hailing from top tier companies and with a strong passion for storytelling.

name: Founding Tech Lead / Engineering Manager
description:
We're seeking a Founding Tech Lead to lead our engineering efforts and help shape the tech stack, processes and procedures in both the R&D and production stages of our software development lifecycle. As a key member of the founding team, this role will involve hands-on development as well as strategic leadership. You will be instrumental in building the team and developing internal tools and client facing products from the ground up.

At TubeScience we strongly believe in the idea of a working implementation-as-spec, all software starts as a working implementation delivered to end-users within the company before the final tech stack, abstractions and architecture are selected.

requirements.description: Exceptional organization and communication skills.
Highly pragmatic and able to manage tradeoffs thoughtfully; fast-moving startup rather than “corporate” mindset.
BS/MS/PhD in Computer Science or related field.
Proactive and collaborative self-starter with a strong ability to attract other top technical talent and lead them effectively.
A track record of shipping and going through full product development cycle right from writing the first line of code to product in the hands of users and iterating quickly on feedback.
Experience in B2B SaaS, AdTech/MarTech.
Previous founding engineering experience.
Experience with AI integration.

responsibilities: Problem-space Immersion: Spend 6-12 months in the trenches, working in our offices, to truly understand the industry tooling, pain points and needs. During that time you’ll collaboratively build the first version of the product with real-time feedback from customers.
Manage the full software development lifecycle including design, testing, deployment, maintenance, and improvement.
Interface with stakeholders to ensure their needs are met and that the engineering team has clear direction and priorities.
Build, lead, and mentor a team of talented engineers.
Prioritize and triage competing projects as they proceed through their lifecycle proof-of-concept, implementation-as-spec and finally production.
workPlaceText: In person, in stunning LA Arts District office (next to Spotify, Warner, SoHo House, Honey). Open to relocation help for unicorn candidate.

corporate mindset

company.name: TubeScience
company.description:
Over the past 8 years, we quietly bootstrapped TubeScience into the largest producer of social media ads in the USA. While our public profile is minimal (ironically, we don’t do any self-marketing), we have hundreds of employees, billions of dollars in ad spend, and deep technical partnerships with Meta and other platforms. 

What helped us do so is an obsession for numbers over opinions, and a unique “pay for performance” business model. Clients only pay if our ads outperform anything they or any other agency delivers. It’s a very “honest” business model, and clients tend to love it (resulting in extremely high retention and all our sales to date coming from inbound / word of mouth). 

As we look towards the future and AI advances, we see an incredible opportunity to reinvent our business. We plan to take everything we’ve learned, and turn it into a true self-service SaaS offering that can power agencies and in-house teams alike.
benefits: Be part of a passionate, entrepreneurial team that is driven to succeed and working on a high impact problem.
A unique opportunity to shape a team from the ground up.

company.name: Finta (YC W23)
company.description:
Finta is building the Rippling for accounting and finance.

For decades, accountants have relied on manual, error-prone processes, taking 7 days each month to compile accurate financial results. Sadly, this is the industry standard today.

Startups face even greater challenges, grappling with tedious, confusing accounting software and costly bookkeepers, often waiting 3 weeks for inaccurate results.

Finta is redefining company accounting with software that serves as the source of truth for all financial data, providing real-time, accurate results, eliminating the need for QuickBooks and bookkeepers.

Our mission is to revolutionize how growing companies manage finance, accounting, and taxes, empowering founders and operators to make better, faster decisions while staying lean.

Hundreds of startups rely on our real-time dashboard, automated bookkeeping, and compliant tax filings. Since graduating from YC in W23, we've raised over $2M from investors like Garage Capital, Zeno Ventures, and leaders from Mercury, Brex, and Ramp.

name: Head of Creative
description:
Fella Health is building a world-class team.

As the Head of Creative at Fella Health, you'll work closely with our Head of Growth and CEO to develop and execute a winning creative strategy for our direct-to-consumer video ads on Facebook, Instagram and other channels.

You'll start by auditing our current video ad assets and performance, identifying opportunities to improve our creative approach and develop new concepts that resonate with our target audience and drive conversions. You'll bring your expertise in crafting high-impact DTC video ads to set the vision and lead the execution of breakthrough creative across our key social media platforms.

Your initial focus will be on creating and optimizing video ads that deliver strong ROAS and scale efficiently. Over time, you'll expand our video creative capabilities to new formats and channels, always pushing the boundaries of performance-driven creativity.

A key part of your role will be building and leading an in-house video creative team. You'll use your experience in assembling and managing high-performing teams to develop our internal capabilities and reduce reliance on external agencies. This includes hiring top talent, establishing efficient workflows, and fostering a culture of innovation and data-driven optimization.

As Fella Health grows, you'll play a critical role in shaping our overall creative direction and ensuring our video advertising remains a key driver of customer acquisition and growth. Your leadership and expertise will be instrumental in building a world-class DTC video creative function that sets Fella apart in a competitive market.

You'll report directly to our Head of Growth (Dave Lane), as well as work closely with our Lead Designer (Marjoe Bacus) & CEO (Richie Cartwright).

requirements.description: Team leadership: You have experience building, leading, and mentoring high-performing creative teams. You know how to hire top talent, establish efficient workflows, and foster a culture of innovation and collaboration.

Data-driven optimization: You have a strong track record of using performance data to continuously optimize video ad creative. You know how to set up and interpret creative tests, and you use those insights to make data-driven decisions that improve results over time.

Video production expertise: You have hands-on experience with all aspects of video production, from scriptwriting and storyboarding to shooting, editing, and post-production. You know how to craft compelling video narratives that engage viewers and drive action.
Multi-platform knowledge: While Meta platforms are the priority, you ideally have some experience creating video ads for other channels like YouTube, TikTok, or VSLs.
Experience working with video ads for DTC brands with US companies.
E-commerce experience: You have worked with DTC e-commerce brands and understand the unique challenges and opportunities of driving product sales through video creative.

responsibilities: Audit existing video assets - You'll conduct a comprehensive review of our current video ad creative, assessing performance metrics and identifying areas for improvement. This audit will inform your recommendations for optimizing existing ads and guide your strategy for developing new creative concepts that align with our growth objectives and resonate with our target audience.

Build and lead an in-house video team - A key part of your role from the outset will be to build and manage an internal video creative team. You'll be responsible for hiring top talent across roles like scriptwriting, video production, animation, and post-production. You'll establish efficient workflows and processes to ensure the team can produce a high volume of quality video ads while remaining agile and responsive to market trends and performance data. Your leadership will be critical in developing a world-class in-house video creative function that becomes a key competitive advantage for Fella Health.

Develop high-converting video ads - You will take the lead in conceptualizing, scripting, and producing video ad content that drives strong ROAS on Facebook, and Instagram. This involves leveraging your expertise in DTC video advertising to create ads that grab attention, communicate our value proposition, and compel users to take action. You'll continually push the boundaries of what's possible with video creative to achieve breakthrough performance.

Expand video ad capabilities - As you establish a strong foundation of high-performing video ads on Facebook and Instagram, you'll look to expand our reach and impact by testing new ad formats, platforms, and distribution channels. This could include exploring opportunities in VSLs, YouTube ads, OTT/CTV advertising, and other emerging video platforms. You'll design creative experiments to identify the most promising new channels for scaling our video advertising efforts.

Refine messaging and positioning - Once you have established a rhythm of producing and optimizing high-converting video ads, you'll work closely with the growth team to continuously refine our messaging and positioning. This includes iterating on ad scripts, testing new angles and value propositions, and ensuring our video creative remains aligned with our overall brand strategy. Your goal will be to develop a deep understanding of what resonates with our audience and use those insights to inform ongoing creative optimization.
workPlaceText: This is a full-time, fully remote role, and you’ll work async in the timezone of your choice.
experience_info: creating high-converting video ads for DTC brands, specifically on Facebook and Instagram. You deeply understand the unique creative elements that drive performance in the DTC eCommerce space.

company.name: Fella Health
company.description:
We are the telemedicine clinic for bigger guys, worldwide. We use medical weight loss treatment to solve our fellas' most pressing healthcare need, then remain a fella's core healthcare provider for the rest of their life - focused on men's health, longevity, mental health, and primary care.

We will have served 1 million fellas by the end of 2026, and 10 million fellas by the end of 2028.

Our mission is to solve male obesity worldwide, by accelerating the take-up of GLP-1s in middle-aged men. From this, we’ll become the world’s leading men’s health brand.

We’ve grown >130x since Sept 2022 (currently growing >30% MoM) and are strongly cashflow positive. We have expanded our state coverage to >95% of US population, have started to expand our clinical protocol beyond weight (e.g. testosterone), and are eyeing up international expansion.

We're still a young startup and are moving quickly. We have a long way to go. This is still Day 1.

We're backed by top healthcare & consumer investors:

  • Y Combinator

  • Global Founders Capital — backed Facebook, Slack, LinkedIn, Revolut, Rocket Internet

  • AngelList Early Stage Fund (backed by Naval Ravikant)

  • BrandProject (venture-builder behind 2 unicorns)

  • The founders of Indeed, Curative (unicorn), Alan (unicorn), Kaia Health (>$300mil valuation), Vouch Insurance (>$500mil valuation), Not Boring (Packy McCormick)
benefits: Vacation: generous PTO with a yearly minimum (>2wks/yr + local national holidays)
Remote: our team is fully distributed across the world and functions fully remotely
Personal development: budget for books, courses, coaching ($400/yr)
Personal wellness: budget for gym, health apps ($400/yr)
company.teamAbout:
💬 These are the core cultural standards to which we hold ourselves & our team-members at Fella:

  • Belief in the mission — we will have served 10 million fellas by the end of 2028 (1 million fellas by end of 2026) and we transform the life of most fellas who join. We have a lot of work to do. We are obsessed with our fellas and are dedicated to the mission.

  • Bulldozing barriers — the world is malleable and we shape it. We truly believe this and act accordingly. We are relentlessly resourceful and are at the mercy of no-one but ourselves.

  • Unwavering integrity — we are at the frontier, so we often live in ambiguity with no trodden path. When we can’t look to others for guidance, we must maintain impeccable ethics and unwavering integrity.

  • Enduring frugality — we are frugal. We hate being wasteful and we are anti-luxury. We spend our cash wisely & carefully - in a way that would make our grandmas proud.

  • Do what is needed — speed is critical and often the solutions we need are messy. We are comfortable moving quickly and taking on gritty work.

  • End-to-end ownership — we are comfortable owning projects from noticing the problem to delivering the outcome.

  • Dedication to excellence — we are obsessed with our role, with a commitment to compounding self-improvement.

  • Commitment to candor — we believe in open communication and radical transparency. We are clear & caring communicators, welcoming feedback.

  • Only the paranoid survive — the road of expansion is bumpy. We are not fair weather sailers; we embrace the storms. However much we’ve already done, however far we’ve already come — all our work is still ahead of us.

  • Keep your head down — we’re boring people doing exciting work. We don’t chase short-term status: we ignore short-term dopamine hits and focus on what matters. Outsiders will underestimate us and we revel in that.

name: Product Engineer
description:
We are looking for a product-focused full-stack engineer to join us in revolutionizing the recruiting industry.

This is a product engineering role, meaning you’ll have full ownership over building a product and platform that users love. You’ll ship with extreme urgency and rapidly iterate to craft a magical experience for recruiters and companies.

We've grown 50% month over month and you'll play a major part in helping us grow from $450k to $4.5M monthly GMV in the next year. This role has the potential to grow into our Head of Product.

What we look for:

  • Product-minded engineer who cares deeply about the customer and the business. High attention to detail in design and interaction to strive for an easy and delightful user experience.

  • 2+ years of full-stack coding experience building products end-to-end and love owning a codebase top to bottom.

  • You’ve either worked at early-stage startups and/or you’re a tinkerer-builder, often hacking products on your own or with friends.

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills. Thrives from working with a team and has immense drive and passion towards the work you do.

  • Bonus points if you have prior experience in the talent and recruiting space.

What you'll do:

  • Speak with our customers of all sizes on a daily basis

  • Design and build products from end to end that recruiters and customers love to use

  • Work closely with recruiters to learn and develop tools to make them 10x more efficient

  • Automate our internal marketplace operations

  • Build integrations that helps embed Paraform more deeply into existing systems

  • Growth engineering (SEO, billing, signups, activations, etc)

If this sounds interesting, email me at jeff@paraform.com

visa_text_more: We can for someone exceptional
experience_info: as a software engineer
recruiting_advice:
We want to look for a highly product driven and growth focused engineer.

Some key things I think would be helpful when sourcing and pitching:

  • Great engineer who did a lot of frontend

  • We don't want someone who cares a lot about working on interesting technical problems. We want them to care about building a great product.

  • Early airbnb type engineer or engineers that have worked at linear, notion, carta, vercel

  • HCI and design degrees who are also engineers

  • Design, frontend, growth, and product engineer past titles

  • Maybe a non-CS degree but def preferred

  • Pitch that we're design centric with a cool marketplace angle (airbnb, uber, instacart, Lyft, DoorDash, Etsy, upwork) 

  • Pitch that you won’t be micromanaged and have a lot of ownership compared to big tech

  • We’re also not just another AI wrapper

  • Low ego humble personality

  • Dropouts could be a good signal

  • High agency

  • Some questions I plan to ask in my screening interviews

The culture we have is intense and it’s because everyone is really passionate about our mission, so wanted to be transparent that we work nights and weekends.

Current full-time in-person team:

John - CEO and co-founder

Jeff - CTO and co-founder

Linus - Chief of staff

Olivia - Customer success

Anthony - Contract Engineer

Wayne - Growth

Immediate projects an engineer could work on:

  • Integrations (Greenhouse, Stripe, Gmail, Slack, Calendly, etc.)

  • Custom recruiter resources (custom sourcing tool, email campaign software, Paraform Linkedin extension, etc.)

  • Recruiter + client optimal matching with AI

  • Improve internal operations (client/recruiter management, payments, communication, etc.)

  • Any new ideas you come that could 10x our recruiter and client growth

Type of person who will thrive here

  • Experience at a fast-growing, VC-backed startup -> Seed to Series A experience, pre-PMF

  • Wants to write a bunch of code and ship a bunch of product

  • Excited to jump in and work on all different types of features as long as they benefit our customers

  • Can handle complex, ambiguous problems

Type of person who will NOT thrive here

  • Big tech attitude -> likes stability, structure, 9-5

  • Manager -> prefers managing as opposed to writing code

  • Smart & slow -> likes to think through problems really deeply to ensure they get the right answer

  • Excited and unfocused -> takes conversations in all directions

What we value

  • We’re always shipping - fast, scrappy people thrive here.

  • We’re obsessed with goals - we’re here to turn a small startup into a long-lasting company.

  • We start with the customer - we all talk to users and work backward from their problems.

  • We have an outlier output bar - we’re an intentionally small, highly effective team.

company.name: Paraform
company.description:
Paraform is a marketplace connecting companies with open roles and recruiters who can fill them.

Companies can work with specialized recruiters more cheaply, monitor their performance, and flex based on demand. Recruiters don't have to worry about acquiring clients while earning and working on their own terms.

Incredible teams at the most exciting startups and enterprises are being built as a result.

We power talent for a wide range of customers:

  • Enterprise - Palantir, Anduril, Scale AI

  • Growth stage - Eight Sleep, Character.ai, Applied Intuition

  • Early stage - Mintlify, Jenni.ai, Decagon.ai

We've raised money from:

  • Co-founders - Twitch, Doordash, and Eventbrite

  • VCs - A*, Soma Capital, Founders Inc, and Primer Sazze

  • Leadership - Palantir, Opendoor, Ramp, and Scale AI

Other highlights:

company.teamAbout:
Hey 👋 we're John and Jeff, the co-founders of Paraform. Funnily enough, this all started when we tried to recruit each other in 2022. Ever since then, we've experienced first-hand how broken recruiting is and our mission is to finally fix it.

Our values and culture

  • We work hard and enjoy being together in person. We are transparent about our work ethic and expectations because it enables us to have extreme ownership in building at a pace that is unmatched.

  • Customers, customers, customers. We're customer-obsessed and always start with the customer first. We are the customer support team.

  • Ship fast and break things. We believe great products come from lots of experimentation, so we value fast development. No one is going to wait around for us to make things, especially something that's perfect.

  • Take care of each other. We trust each other and want to enable everyone to do their best work. That means an all food and transportation compensated, gym membership, unlimited PTO, global offsites, premium healthcare and a free bike.

name: Software Engineer (AI)
description: We're seeking an experienced Software Engineer (AI) to join our LA-based team in our Playa Vista office or work remotely. This hands-on role involves developing and maintaining advanced AI solutions that power our product suite, including both B2B and B2C applications, as well as broadening our product ecosystem. This role is focused on integrating the latest AI models, rather than building models from scratch.

requirements.description: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, or related field.
Proven expertise in AI frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, and technologies used by OpenAI or Stable Diffusion.
Strong programming skills in Python and experience with mobile and NFC technologies.
Knowledge of design patterns, software engineering principles, and best practices.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Developing and integrating image generation and voice models to enhance user experiences.
Leading innovation by exploring and adopting advanced AI technologies, including the latest LLMs and models(OpenAI, Stability, etc).

  • Passion outside of work: Many great engineers build on the side for fun. Attend hackathons, contribute to open-source projects, and look for those who actively engage in personal tech projects.
avoid_traits: Lack of agency. As an early-stage startup, we require candidates to take full ownership of their projects from beginning to end. Those who need constant management or lack experience in such autonomous roles may not be suitable.
High ego: We need team players who can collaborate effectively without letting personal pride get in the way.
Unable to adjust to pivots: Flexibility is crucial in our fast-paced environment. Candidates who struggle with change or cannot adapt to new directions will find it challenging to succeed here.

company.name: Soundmap
company.description:
💚 What is Soundmap? Soundmap is a gamified consumer social app for music fans. We have scaled to 300k DAU in less than 6 months and we are consistently top 3 in the iOS music game chart.

We have the opportunity to bring a brand new experience to millions of music fans around the world. We want your help to make that happen 🎶

We’ve raised from some of the best investors in consumer, including A16Z Speedrun, Sequoia Scout Fund, Brooklyn Bridge Ventures, Gold House Ventures, Intonation Ventures, Untamed Ventures, the founder of NGL, etc. To date, Soundmap has raised around $2m and we are profitable.
benefits: Health Insurance, Gym, Festival Tickets, and more
company.teamAbout:
What is it like to work at Soundmap?

  • Fast-paced We routinely build new features in less than a week start-to-finish. Expect to ship code into production on your first day.

  • Small-and-scrappy We are a team of 3 working on Soundmap nonstop. We believe the best consumer products are built by small teams who can move mountains. You’ll get to play a key role in Soundmap’s trejactory.

  • Product-obsessed We are product people. Great product retains and grows itself. We obsess over the user experience until all the details are right. Everyone is expected to go the extra mile in everything they do.

  • Constantly-evolving We’re very early in our journey. This means we’re constantly shipping new features, taking feedback from our community, and iterating.

  • Ownership-focused You’ll be given the trust and responsibility to take ownership over what you build. Nearly everyone on our team would be building their own things if they weren’t working on Soundmap.

What are some of the challenges?

  • Uncharted territory No one else is doing what we are doing in music. We must continue to introduce brand new experiences.

  • Scaling rapidly We grew to 300k DAU in less than 6 months and will need to continue scaling rapidly.

  • Building something people love In order for Soundmap to be a household name, we have to stay laser-focused on building features and products our users love. Product wins all.

name: Founding GTM
description:
We are looking for our first GTM generalist operator to join our team at Paraform!

You will be a pivotal player in our team working on primarily building our growth engine by executing/scaling GTM strategies.

This will be a truly generalist growth role working across business development, sales, marketing, content, revenue ops and much more.

We're excited to hyper-scale Paraform's recruiter marketplace with you.

requirements.description: Experience working at notable, high-growth early stage startups
Went to top school
Previous experience in a generalist growth role

responsibilities: Run and scale our existing GTM strategies.
Own (execute, measure, grow, and manage) existing outbound sales motion, SEO, organic social, referrals etc

Take sales calls and close customers - it's actually completely OK even if you've never done a sales call before. This will be split between you and one of the co-founders (John) where you will primarily focus on customers in our existing/proven verticals
Work with our contract SDRs on weekly prospecting of new leads
Work with our writers to output exceptional written content for blog, organic social, and SEO
Work with co-founder (John) to come up with new GTM strategies, quickly execute/experiment, and double down on ones that work
Be the primary operator on building Paraform's growth engine
workPlaceText: This role is on-site at our office in North Beach in SF
visa_text_more: We unfortunately won't be able to sponsor visas for this role
experience_info: out of college working as generalist growth person at notable early stage startup or high-growth company. Companies they worked at should be small enough where they didn't share ownership with others
recruiting_advice:
Culture fit:

  • low ego

  • funny and kind

  • genuinely just a good human being

  • never satisfied

When sourcing, it'll be easier to narrow down who to reach out to if you follow this framework:

  • Are they a go-getter i.e. do they settle or do they always want more?

  • Did they do the most challenging/exceptional thing they can in their environment/capacity?

  • Do they intentionally do and actively seek out difficult/challenging things?

  • Did they start a company?

  • Are they interested in startups?

In the screening call, please screen for:

  • is it clear that they're exceptionally smart?

  • olympian work ethic - is it clear from their previous track record that they work exceptionally hard?

  • bottomless energy = consistency - are they energetic (talk and think fast) and is it clear from their previous track record that they are a consistent performer?

  • high ambition - what is their goal? why is it clear that they want to achieve something exceptional very quickly
avoid_traits: not genuinely interested in an early stage startup
doesn't seem independent, requires a lot of hand holding
candidates just looking for another 9-5 'job'
We're actually trying to specifically avoid account executive and SDR profiles for this role. That will be our next hire post Series A
not passionate/hungry, not a go-getter

name: System Architect
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Software Architect to lead the development of our vehicle platform. The ideal candidate will have extensive knowledge of software-defined vehicles, embedded systems, and experience with industry-standard platforms such as AUTOSAR, Android Automotive OS, and offboard systems.

This role requires a visionary mindset to drive the evolution of our software architecture, ensuring it meets the highest standards of functionality, safety, and security.

requirements.description: Experience in developing safety or cybersecurity relevant systems.
Able to come into our office in Mountain View 5 days a week.
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proven expertise in embedded software development and hardware/software architecture, particularly in QNX, Linux, and Android environments.
Service oriented architecture, signal to service, API specification.
Deep understanding of modern ARM-based SoC architectures.
Experience with Model Based Systems Engineering.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to quickly grasp and structure complex issues.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts to diverse stakeholders.
Business-fluent in English; proficiency in German is a plus.

responsibilities: Architectural Design: Define and implement the overall software architecture for a series vehicle platform, incorporating embedded systems, AUTOSAR, Android Automotive OS, and other relevant technologies. Ensure adherence to industry standards and best practices, particularly concerning functional safety and cybersecurity (ISO26262 and ISO/SAE21434).
System Integration: Lead the integration of various software components and systems, ensuring seamless communication and interoperability between onboard and offboard systems.

Technology Evaluation: Stay abreast of the latest advancements in software-defined vehicles and evaluate new technologies for potential integration into the platform. Drive the integration of open-source projects (Covesa, Eclipse SDV) into the platform, evaluating their suitability and compatibility.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including software engineers, hardware engineers, and product managers, to ensure successful implementation of the architecture.
Performance Optimization: Continuously optimize the software architecture for performance, efficiency, and scalability.
Mentorship: Provide technical guidance and mentorship to other engineers on the team.
workPlaceText: Please note that we are an in-office company, which means the expectation is that you would come in to your Applied Intuition office in Mountain View 5 days a week.
experience_info: in software architecture, with a focus on embedded systems and automotive software.
recruiting_advice:
We have a high bar for engineering talent. Ideally, the right candidate will

  • have worked in the automotive industry (OEMs, suppliers, EV brands, etc)

  • degree from reputable engineering university

  • had exposure to start-up or start-up-like environments

  • can work collaboratively and communicate effectively
avoid_traits: Does not take initiative / show ambition
Not interested in working at a start up
Optimizing for cash compensation above all else
Looking for remote / hybrid
Job hoppiness (3+ roles that they spent 1 year or less at)

company.name: Applied Intuition
company.description: Applied Intuition is a Tier 1 vehicle software supplier that accelerates the adoption of safe and intelligent machines worldwide. Founded in 2017, Applied Intuition delivers the definitive ADAS/AD toolchain and a world-class vehicle platform to help customers shorten time to market, build industry-leading products, and create next-generation consumer experiences. 18 of the top 20 global automakers trust Applied Intuition’s solutions to drive the production of modern vehicles. Applied Intuition serves the automotive, trucking, construction, mining, agriculture, and defense industries and is headquartered in Mountain View, CA, with offices in Ann Arbor and Detroit, MI, Washington, D.C., Munich, Stockholm, Seoul, and Tokyo.
benefits: Health insurance: Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance, 100% of employee premiums paid for by Applied Intuition.
401(k) match: 50% employer matching to help you save up for retirement.
Catered lunch and dinner: Our offices provide catered lunches, expensed dinners, snacks, and drinks.
Learning stipend: We invest in your learning and growth by reimbursing you for educational and training expenses.
Fitness and wellness stipend: Reimbursed fitness expenses and 25 free Lyra coaching or therapy sessions each for you and your dependents.
Parental leave: 12-week, fully paid parental leave to bond with a newborn child or new adopted or foster child.
company.teamAbout:
Accelerating the world’s adoption of safe and intelligent machines

Applied Intuition was founded in 2017 to equip engineering and product teams with software that makes it faster, safer, and easier to bring autonomous systems to market. While the autonomy industry was thriving, there were no easy-to-use solutions to safely develop, test, and deploy autonomous systems at scale.

Today, we work with 18 of the top 20 OEMs across the globe and offer a portfolio of products. Our team is growing rapidly, and we’d love to hear from you if you’re passionate about moving the entire autonomy industry forward.

name: Senior Software Engineer (Game Server)
description:
We are seeking a skilled Game Server Systems Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of multiplayer networking architecture and different client-server synchronization strategies.

As an applied research lab with an integrated game studio/publisher, we are uniquely positioned to lead the way. We build our own games that are native to our infrastructure. This allows us to fully understand and utilize the capabilities of our platform, resulting in novel game designs built around the platform's unique power and quirks.

requirements.description: Experience writing backend services in Go, Java, or Javascript.
Deep understanding of multiplayer networking architecture and different client-server synchronization strategies.
Experience in Unity and C#.
Familiarity with public cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP, etc) and infrastructure-as-code tooling (Terraform, Pulumi, or CDK).
Proficiency in utilizing APM and other observability toolings to diagnose backend services issues and optimize performance.
Familiarity with CI/CD tools (GitHub Action, Jenkins, etc).
Experience building and shipping an MMO game.
Experience writing high-performance multithreaded game servers from scratch.
Experience with data-oriented programming.
Experience building and maintaining distributed and fault-tolerant systems with production workload.
Deep understanding of the Ethereum blockchain.

responsibilities: Design, develop, and maintain highly scalable and performant game server systems.
Implement server-side logic for real-time online multiplayer games.
Design and develop toolings to simplify client-server state synchronization and communication.
Contribute to the development of World Engine, our open-source horizontally scalable game server framework.
Optimize game server performance, reliability, and security.
Develop tools and automation scripts to aid in-game server deployment and operations.
Collaborate with game designers, artists, and client engineers.
Stay up-to-date on the latest game server technologies and architectures.
workPlaceText: San Francisco, CA
experience_info: in software engineering.
recruiting_advice:
• The general candidate archetype you seek is “Software Engineer with Game Development Experience”. Typically, their title is “Software Engineer” not “Game Developer” (which is more client/gameplay focused)

  • Typically, they are focused on backend/networking now, but they’ve had past experience writing game clients.

  • Companies + team to source from:

    • Riot Games (Valorant, League of Legends, TFT)

    • EA

    • Valve (multiplayer games team, Dota 2, CS:GO, etc)

    • Blizzard (WoW, Overwatch, etc)
avoid_traits: Lack of prior experience in working with multiplayer/server-side engineering for games (i.e. they have only been working on game client engineering)
Poor written/spoken communication in English
Candidates not willing to relocate to SF (we make very rare exception for this rule)
Unable to work in person at all (even hybrid)

At Argus Labs, we are shaping the future of video games through applied research in distributed systems and game design. We believe online game worlds should be open and interconnected, rather than closed siloes controlled by platform giants.

Argus is an MMO game developer and publisher built around a collective of hackers and designers in pursuit of the next great paradigm shift in the video game industry.

We recently raised $10 million in seed funding led by Haun Ventures with participation from angels in tech and gaming such as Elad Gil, Balaji Srinivasan, Kevin Aluwi, Siqi Chen, etc.

100% employer-covered medical, dental, and vision insurance (US)
company.teamAbout: We are crypto natives and gaming veterans working at the intersection of bleeding-edge applied research, sagelike first-principles reasoning, and incisively thoughtful game design to ignite the next paradigm shift in video gaming.

name: Senior Software Engineer
description:
We are hiring our next software engineer to join the team! As one of our senior engineering hires, you will be a pivotal member of our company, leading product and engineering decisions. You will own large parts of the product architecture, speak directly with customers, work with design to define the product, and help the business meet its goals. As a member of our team, you will be expected to help drive decisions outside of engineering as well. From defining our product roadmap, to contributing to our go-to-market strategy, Explo is a great opportunity for you to learn what it takes to turn a product into a business.

We're hiring multiple senior software engineers across Full Stack, Backend, Frontend roles.

requirements.description: Experience with end-to-end web development.
Experience working at a reputable early stage or high growth startup
requirements.explanation:
• Backed by top VCs

  • Top %-tile growth

  • Companies known for high bar for talent

requirements.description: Has experience with Typescript, React, Python
Went to top CS School

Excitement to tackle hard technical problems: frontend performance, home-grown charting libraries, scaling infrastructure, data engineering as a service, opening PRs in open source libraries, resilient testing infrastructure, etc.
requirements.explanation: We use React, Redux and Typescript on the frontend and Django on the backend. Experience with these are highly preferred but not required.

responsibilities: You will help define lasting process and own very important parts of our product. This is an opportunity to have real ownership on high priority projects.
You will primarily spend your time improving existing products and creating new ones, providing a great deal of value for our customers.
You will create team-wide systems from the ground up that. You will have a direct impact on best practices and shaping our engineering team’s processes and culture.
You’ll be building things that people love, and you’ll interact with our users every day to get feedback on your work and help troubleshoot issues.
You will work directly with our product designer, product manager, and business team to scope large projects and execute against them.
You’ll be a part of a dynamic engineering team and greater company culture, that values collaboration, transparency and autonomy.

experience_info: in software engineering.

company.name: Keeper (YC S21)
company.description:
Bookkeepers today are stuck working in excel spreadsheets and homegrown project management solutions to support their clients. Keeper is on a mission to change that.

With our all-in-one tool, bookkeepers can manage their work, communicate with clients, catch hard-to-find errors, and deliver reports to help their small business customers make smarter strategic decisions.

Founded in 2021, Keeper has raised $6M in seed funding, backed by leading tech investors like Y Combinator and founders at top startups like Lattice, Front, Superhuman, Plaid, and more. Keeper currently helps thousands of bookkeepers and accountants manage the books for startups and small businesses across the US.
benefits: 100% sponsored Health, dental, and vision insurance

name: Software Engineer - Production
description:
Modern autonomous system development is heavily reliant on daily, realistic, and large scale simulations to test constant software changes. Join our cloud platform team to ensure we're building efficient and reliable systems for managing these large-scale workloads.

As a production engineer you'll be improving the development and deployment of our large-scale simulation infrastructure. The compute and data generation scale of our product workloads pushes the boundaries of standard cluster deployments, and you'll be at the forefront of helping build out and ensure reliability of this system. All while ensuring the deployment infrastructure is interoperable with various custom autonomy software and infrastructure used across the world.

You will work closely across the entirety of the engineering team to ensure the operational success of our backend and a variety of customer deployments. At Applied Intuition, we encourage all engineers to take ownership over technical and product decisions, interact closely with users to collect feedback, and contribute to a thoughtful, dynamic team culture.

About Seoul

Applied Intuition entered the Korean market in 2020. The company has rapidly grown and established strategic relationships with major Korean automotive OEM customers. Based in Gangnam, the Seoul site consists of 5 employees who previously come from LG, Ansys, Unity, Ascent Robotics and other renowned companies.

requirements.description: 3+ years of coding experience from shell scripting (e.g., Bash) to higher-level languages (e.g., Python)
Experience with microservice orchestration frameworks such as Kubernetes
Experience working with containerized systems (e.g., Docker)
Fluency in English and Korean
Experience utilizing open source tooling
Experience with deploying software on either public clouds (e.g., AWS) or on-premise clusters

responsibilities: Create and implement best practices for deploying and maintaining software for multiple customers across all three major cloud providers (AWS, GCP, Azure) with minimal downtime and high reliability
Monitor Applied Intuition software on deployed machines and architect solutions to any bottlenecks that are encountered
Improve developer efficiency by building internal tooling and optimizing our CI/CD systems
workPlaceText: On-site at our Seoul office. Please note that we are an in-office company, which means the expectation is that you would come in to your Applied Intuition office 5 days a week.
visa_text_more: N/A
experience_info: in a software engineering role working on infrastructure, monitoring, or a large scale software product
recruiting_advice:
When reaching out to/screening candidates:

Please DO NOT proactively share the numbers with the candidates in the first reach out. We do not want to disqualify just based on the salary information. If candidates ask specifically you could share high numbers and propose to speak with the recruiter for more details. However, you could say that we pay top of the market and give equity + sign on bonuses.

  1. Please focus on getting a buy in from candidate to meet and learn more about us. We will do most of the selling

  2. After your initial conversation with the candidate, please identify areas where we need to address / sell to convert candidate. What are the motivations, values of the candidate

  3. Look for signals where candidate worked in start up OR initiated a project on his/her own, solved problems, overcame challenges etc.
avoid_traits: Someone who cannot interview fluently in English
Shallow level of software engineer skills

company.name: Applied Intuition (Seoul)
company.description: Applied Intuition is a Tier 1 vehicle software supplier that accelerates the adoption of safe and intelligent machines worldwide. Founded in 2017, Applied Intuition delivers the definitive ADAS/AD toolchain and a world-class vehicle platform to help customers shorten time to market, build industry-leading products, and create next-generation consumer experiences. 18 of the top 20 global automakers trust Applied Intuition’s solutions to drive the production of modern vehicles. Applied Intuition serves the automotive, trucking, construction, mining, agriculture, and defense industries and is headquartered in Mountain View, CA, with offices in Ann Arbor and Detroit, MI, Washington, D.C., Munich, Stockholm, Seoul, and Tokyo.
benefits: Fitness (600 USD) and learning stipends (1,000 USD) annually
company.teamAbout:
**Accelerating the world’s adoption of safe and intelligent machines**

Applied Intuition was founded in 2017 to equip engineering and product teams with software that makes it faster, safer, and easier to bring autonomous systems to market. While the autonomy industry was thriving, there were no easy-to-use solutions to safely develop, test, and deploy autonomous systems at scale.

Today, we work with 18 of the top 20 OEMs across the globe and offer a portfolio of products. Our team is growing rapidly, and we’d love to hear from you if you’re passionate about moving the entire autonomy industry forward.

**Software and functional experts**

Our team has significant software and automotive experience with specialists in simulation, robotics, and autonomy.

**We’re a values-driven company**

Speed, customer orientation, raising the quality bar, and 'laugh a lot' are some of the values that make up the DNA of the team.

name: Risk & Underwriting
description: We are seeking an enthusiastic and experienced Head of Risk & Underwriting to join the Highbeam team. You will collaborate closely with senior leadership and the Capital team to drive the development of our lending framework in a highly dynamic, fast-paced environment.

Strong knowledge of credit, accounting, financial modeling and excel
Ability to flex between high-level strategic thinking and deep analytical problem-solving
Problem solving attitude and eagerness to take on various ad-hoc projects
BA or higher, preferably in Economics, Math, Finance, or Accounting

Strong knowledge of finance, credit and financial modeling
Prior experience providing credit to ecommerce businesses and proven track record of responsibly growing a loan book while minimizing losses
Work with the Capital team to refine our credit box and underwriting model

Oversee Highbeam’s loan book and ensure that risk is being properly managed
Ensure that Highbeam is compliant with it credit policy and lending facility requirements
Collaborate with the Capital team to create monitoring dashboards for underwriting outcomes, processes and losses
Partner with Product and Engineering to build best in class risk tooling to increase operational efficiency
Research emerging underwriting and fraud trends to innovate on Highbeam's decisioning systems and policies
You are interested in working directly with the founding team in a fast-paced, startup environment

company.name: Highbeam
company.description:
Highbeam is building the intelligent banking and finance platform for e-commerce.

There are 2M+ ecommerce businesses in the US processing over $300B of annual spend. Founders of these businesses rely on patching together a finance stack from multiple providers for banking, accounting, tax and credit — none of which are designed for their needs. This results in the founder manually having to figure out budgeting, cash forecasting etc creating a huge challenge — especially in ecommerce where working capital is critical.

Highbeam offers a single platform for ecommerce businesses to understand, run and grow their business. We are a trusted partner working to keep the founder in control of their business through easy to understand insights and clear actions combined with best in class banking.

We have raised $7M+ in equity from Mayfield and FirstMark. We are are based in New York and Toronto.
company.teamAbout: Our small but mighty team comes from places like Shopify, Square, Toast, and Meta

You will own development end-to-end—taking ideas from customers, scoping, building, testing, shipping to production, getting feedback, and iterating.

Our frontend stack: TypeScript, React

name: Content Lead
description: We are seeking a Content Marketing Lead to join our team. As a product-led company, we rely on organic growth to succeed. This pivotal role directly supports our growth by driving organic traffic and increasing user sign-ups through high quality, original, SEO-optimized content. You will be instrumental in building our brand's presence and authority by consistently delivering content that resonates with our audience and ranks well in search. We strongly believe in high-quality writing over high volume fluff — and thankfully, so does our audience.

requirements.description: Content Expert: You have a proven track record of writing high quality content that drives significant organic traffic.
SEO Savvy: Your content consistently ranks for targeted keywords due to your SEO expertise.
Strong Communicator: Excellent writing and editing skills, with an ability to create compelling narratives for a variety of formats.
Results-Oriented: Takes ownership of results rather than just execution. Demonstrated ability to work independently, meet deadlines, and deliver measurable results.

responsibilities: Content Creation: Execute on a content strategy that includes high-quality, original articles, blog posts that target high-intent, high-volume keywords.
SEO Optimization: Optimize content for search, ensuring it reaches the intended audience.

Audience Understanding: Consume what our audience consumes and get close to them. We believe the marketing team should know our customers better than anyone else in the org, so that we can create authentic content that speaks directly to their needs.

Collaboration and Leadership: Work closely with subject matter experts (in and out of the company) to ensure technical accuracy and relevancy. Lead our content calendar and maintain a consistent publication schedule (though we’ll always prioritize quality over quantity).
workPlaceText: We are location agnostic within the US and Canada. Most folks are in Boston and NYC, but we have a few in SF, LA, and Austin. We try to do a company offsite 3-4 times a year. There are no rules, but co-located teammates sometimes get together more frequently, especially in Boston and NYC.
visa_text_more: Can definitely sponsor TN visas. Other visas must be exceptional fits.
experience_info: in content marketing, ideally within an environment targeting technical audiences (or any audience that is far from themselves and requires them to empathize).
recruiting_advice:
Check their actual writing — is it easy to understand, rank well in search, and/or about a difficult topic? All good signs!

Note to recruiters: please do not share compensation, even if asked. You can share that: We hire the best candidate and will never let comp be the reason we can't work together. We have a small, well-compensated team of experts and we value quality over quantity. Other role highlight: you work with the CEO directly as he is the primary SME. We already have a few great content hits so it's not completely from scratch.
avoid_traits: Delegates, strategizes instead of actually writing.
Optimizes for speed instead of quality.

We need someone who can quickly gain a pulse on our audience, write authentically (via interviewing SMEs as needed), and does the writing themselves. Being able to strategize and own more is a nice bonus.

company.name: Metaplane

We are a fully-remote company founded by MIT and HubSpot alums and backed by prominent investors, including Y Combinator, Khosla Ventures, Felicis, and the founders of HubSpot, Vercel, and Okta.
benefits: Fully covered health, dental, and vision insurance
company.teamAbout:
We're a team of experienced engineers, data scientists, and marketers dedicated to building a world-class product that helps every company trust their data, just as Datadog helps companies trust their software. Beyond building the best-in-class product, we care about building a team of craftspeople who find joy in excellent work.

The #1 reason why people choose to work with us is the quality of our team. We win together as a small team of highly talented people, valuing both autonomy and collaboration.

name: Technical Product Manager
description: Hands-on, technical builder to own our system integrations and customer implementations. You will need to embody opposite traits. On one hand, diving deep into the technical nuances of source systems, building data models, and translating complex business logic to our engineers. On the other hand, working 1:1 with customers to define their requirements, onboard them, run demo meetings, negotiate deliverables, and more. You will interface daily between our engineers, customers, and partners (the systems we integrate with).

requirements.description: In-person: pumped to work in-person in SF 5 days per week.
Top US/CAN school: top 30 undergrad school in US or Canada
Experience interfacing with customers (e.g. running user interviews, demoing SaaS products).
Experience building technical products (e.g. APIs, developer tools) alongside software engineers and shipping products on tight timelines.
Knowledge of basic accounting, since many of our use-cases relate to automating financial workflows.
Technical: no need to code, but you must have at least 1 year experience working closely with APIs, databases, SQL, Postman, and similar tools. The more, the better.
Meticulous attention to detail: structured thinker who nerds-out on nuances, accounts for edge cases, and tests your work thoroughly before calling it done
Uncanny ability to deliver results: get the job done consistently, doing any task needed to deliver on time.
Comfortable wth customers: able to work with a wide range of customers, spanning software engineers at startups to CFOs at specialty contractors
requirements.explanation: Should be able to onboard new customers, run demo meetings, negotiate timelines, and communicate clearly over Slack, Zoom, and email.

requirements.description: Startup focused: experience at small (Seed/Series A/Series B) startup. No more than 2yrs at later-stage/public companies.
Hands-on: they'll be a full-time builder, not a manager
requirements.explanation: They must love operating in the messy weeds of nuanced systems, understanding their complexity and simplifying it for our customers. They will focus on product execution and delivery, less on strategy and market research.

requirements.description: High ownership + conscientiousness: able to manage many threads at once without sacrificing quality
Clear + concise communication: oral and written
requirements.explanation: must love writing crisp docs for internal + external reference

responsibilities: Investigate new source systems to integrate with (data models, business logic, APIs, etc.) and become our go-to subject matter expert on each. It’s part product, part data analysis, and part archeology.
Research and define the structure for new data models we launch (schemas, interrelations with other models, how to standardize each across dozens of systems, etc.).
Write detailed documentation (e.g. runbooks, FAQs) explaining source systems, data models, and API features for internal reference and for our customers to use self-service.
Troubleshoot ad hoc issues with integrations and data models, helping our software engineers debug and resolve errors, and unblock our customers from launches and expansions.
Build and own customer and partner relationships. Work end to end with both software startups and construction companies, from sales/demos to scoping requirements, from onboarding to roll-out.
Translate customer needs to detailed product requirements our software engineers can code against.
Assist sales team in customer demos, showing product functionality, refining customer requirements, and driving toward winning their business.
workPlaceText: In-person: pumped to work in-person in SF 5 days per week.

experience_info: at software companies in a data, product, or technical/analytical role.

  • Academic achievement (high GPA, deans list, honors)

  • 1+ time-consuming extracurricular (sports, clubs, TA, etc.)

  • < 1yr at FANG (e..g intern) → startup after

graduate degree
5+ YOE
no startup exp

company.name: Agave (YC W22)
company.description:
We’re modernizing construction, a $12T global industry run by siloed software built 20-40 years ago (on-prem, no APIs, no mobile access, etc.). We connect these systems by building proprietary APIs and wrapping them in a modern UI for automating work.

Construction Software Companies use our API to integrate their apps with these systems. Construction Companies use our UI to automate work, like keeping financial data in sync between field teams on jobsites and accounting teams in an office. We save both time and money, making them more productive and profitable.

Our founding team has worked together for 10 years, first at Graphiq (acq. by Amazon) then at Amazon. We've raised $3M from YC, Accel, and leaders from Plaid, Procore, Autodesk, PlanGrid, Aconex, and more.

These slides explain our company and market: https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1VIRjj0W8wISEqM2IjPsg2-7carWSw-35GlC4ROTXXkU/edit?usp=sharing.
benefits: Healthcare: we cover 90% of your healthcare costs with several plan options.
401k: we match 100% of your contributions, up to 4% of annual salary.

company.teamAbout:
Our founding team has worked together for 10 years, first at Graphiq (acq. by Amazon) then at Amazon.

WHY JOIN US

  • Opportunity: you have the chance to be an early, pivotal member of a fast-growing YC startup modernizing one of the world's largest industries (construction).

  • Team: you'll work with a world-class founding team that's experienced, intense, and ambitious. We've worked together for 10 years, first at a startup that Amazon acquired, then at Amazon, and now at Agave. You'll learn a ton while having outsized ownership.

  • Timing: you're joining at a key inflection point. We're proven (we've grown revenue 4x year over year, have 65+ customers) but also early. This means you have lower risk but also huge upside.

Your technical expertise will inform and shape the future of our technology stack and the processes we use to support it. As we continue to scale our company, there will be opportunities to manage and lead others.

company.name: Arch
company.description:
At Arch, our mission is to build world class financial products for the next generation of investors.

We started with an asset class mostly ignored by traditional financial institutions: cryptocurrencies. In January 2023, we launched our first product, cryptocurrency-backed loans. Customer demand has been very positive, with a rapidly growing loan book and increasing inbound interest each week. We’ve since expanded into other asset classes and products beyond lending. We're growing exponentially with a lot of work to be done, and we’re looking for people to join our mission.

By joining us at this stage you’re not only looking to build products, but also to help build a company. Arch is a close-knit team from best-in-class fintech and consumer companies including Brex, Snapchat, Google, Tinder, Bridgewater Associates and more. We are well funded with backing from top-tier venture capitalists in both traditional finance and crypto including Tribe Capital, Castle Island Ventures, and more.
benefits: Fully paid company health, vision and dental insurance
Generous budget to get the hardware you need to succeed

name: Machine Learning Research Engineer
description:
As a Machine Learning Research Engineer at Advex, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the company's technical direction.

We are seeking an individual who is strategic, capable of transforming research constraints and product specifications into an enterprise-ready application. We value self-starters who aren't afraid to dive into the details and iterate on prototypes in the early stages of development.

Excel at identifying bottlenecks and gaps within research papers and swiftly translating them into code

Technical expertise demonstrated through published papers or industry experience. Examples include:
requirements.explanation:
• Representation learning – SSL, VAE, Dino, SAM, BYOL

  • (bonus) Vision language models

  • (bonus) Diffusion – latent diffusion models, unconditional image generation

Proven track record of rapidly delivering complex project within tight deadlines
Went to top schools: Stanford, Berkeley, MIT, CMU, UIUC, Georgia Tech, and Ivy's etc

Doc I shared in the intake call: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1PGVdCLfH4ZpsvkgdlPuownyyn8YAwzpVs-uaShEs-ow/edit

  1. Companies to target - link (these are ideal, don't limit search to just these)

  2. Interview process and what I'm looking for each interview - link

Source candidates that have at least 2 years of working experience

Our Values

  • Extreme Ownership – Own your piece to an unreasonable level – if that piece succeeds or fails, for whatever reason, the buck stops with you.

  • Fierce Velocity – Rome was not built in a day, but they were laying bricks every hour.

  • The Best Part is No Part – Simplicity over complexity.

  • Be Epsilon Greedy – Greatness cannot always be planned; be willing to explore novel ideas even if things don’t work out.

  • Customer Obsessed – Our customers are the backbone of humanity. It is our duty to improve and make them better in order to exponentially improve the lives of billions of people.

  • Feedback is the breakfast of champions – Embrace feedback. A healthy team is one where constructive feedback is welcomed and expected.

  • Argmax (team) – The only way to win is together; One Team. One dream

company.name: Advex AI
company.description:
At Advex, we're working on solving the hardest problem in all of computer vision – data collection. In order to train a reliable AI model, you need access to the right training data. The inability to gather the right data has been the primary obstacle in global adoption of computer vision in mission critical industries like manufacturing and industrial automation.

Our technology improves model performance by 20-30% for any computer vision task while simultaneously reducing production costs by 10x. Our customers include Fortune 500 companies and some of the fastest-growing startups in the world. We invite you to join us at the ground level as we embark on rapid expansion of our product offerings and customer base.
company.teamAbout:
Advex is a seed stage tech startup backed by Construct Capital, PearVC, and the founders of Dropbox and Gradient Ventures.

Our team comes with over a decade of industry and research experience from top organizations and labs like CMU, Berkeley AI Research Lab, Google Brain, Scale AI, and Qualcomm. We've previously founded and sold companies and created products used over 30 million times. Our team has also published research papers and won research competitions at top conferences like ICLR and AAAI.

name: Technical Marketer (First Marketing Hire)
description:
Despite not having a marketing function today, Recall has incredibly strong PMF - we've grown ARR 10x in the last 12 months and serve over 350 companies, all from inbound interest.

As our first technical marketer, you will pioneer the marketing motion at a company with proven PMF, shape our culture, and super charge our growth. You will play at the intersection of content marketing and growth marketing, driving awareness and generating inbound leads for the sales team. You’ll double down on what is currently working (content marketing) while experimenting with new growth levers.

requirements.description: Proven track record of past successes
Previous experience at a Series Seed, Series A or Series B tech B2B startup
SEO experience
Experience marketing to developers & the developer tooling space
Is based in North America
Previous experience writing content for a developer audience

You would answer "Yes" to the following questions:

  • If this candidate started a startup, would I invest?

  • If this candidate started a startup, would I join as an early employee?

  • When future prospective candidates meet this person, will that be something that encourages them to join?

  • When you talk about your team to future prospective candidates, will you feel proud describing this person?

These questions to ensure the candidate has that "wow" factor.

responsibilities: Grow top-of-funnel and educate our customers through content marketing for developers.
Engage with developers on social media and online communities.
Create and distribute technical content in multiple formats, including: blogs, video, social
Create case studies with our customers and turn them into valuable social proof.
Build and action our SEO strategy.
Generate new ideas for channels and campaigns.
Show demonstrable improvement in our growth KPIs within 3 to 6 months.

recruiting_advice:
Look for marketers who currently work at, or have previously worked at a Seed, Series A, or Series B B2B tech startup that sells to developers.

Look at job titles including: "technical marketer", "content marketer", "product marketer"

Why You Should Join

  • You want to own and shape our marketing motion.

  • You love building from the ground up and having ownership.

  • You are looking for a learning experience and have a growth mindset. 

  • You are ready to build a marketing motion for a new product category.

 

Why You Shouldn’t Join

  • You are not ready for the occasional 60 hour work week right now. 

  • You are not comfortable working without clear structure.

  • You are not ready for a risky career opportunity.Even with our growth, we are still an early-stage startup. If you need something more predictable, this is not the right fit.

  • You’re not excited about working with engineers. You won’t be able to succeed in this role unless you love our customers and want to truly help them in whatever way possible.

company.name: Recall.ai
company.description:
Recall is the universal API for meeting bots. Our unified API captures data from meeting platforms like Zoom, Microsoft Teams, and Google Meet. We support over 350 companies today, and process millions of hours of meeting data every year. We provide a simple API to a problem that typically takes our customers more than a year to build in house, and a team of 5 to maintain forever.

We’re at an inflection point in our growth. In a market where everyone is mining for gold, we’re selling shovels. We grew 1300% last year to over $XM ARR, and serve category leaders such as Calendly, Apollo.io, Grain, and more. Our NRR is 170%.

company.name: Atomus
company.description:
Atomus is a cybersecurity company focused exclusively on small businesses in the Aerospace and Defense industry needing to comply with NIST 800-171, DFARS 7012, and CMMC cybersecurity requirements.

We have major customers including the US Air Force, Defense Innovation Unit, along with aerospace and defense customers. 

We recently raised an investment from early investors in top tier companies like Snowflake, Robinhood, and Anduril among many others to scale Atomus to its full potential.
company.productDescription:
Atomus Aegis is our built cybersecurity software made for small businesses in the Aerospace and Defense industry. The system runs on computers, phones, and servers that handle defense data and configure these systems to the NIST 800-171 cybersecurity requirements.

Imagine if we shipped you a computer that was already compliant with the cybersecurity requirements in your contract out of the box. Our software configures your existing computer to this compliant baseline without the headache of buying new hardware or months having someone do this for you manually.

Once configured, Atomus monitors, maintains, and documents these systems to comply with DFARS 7012 and CMMC cybersecurity requirements.
company.teamAbout: Our team at Atomus is hardworking, move fast, and put our customers first!

company.name: Letter AI (YC S23)
company.description:
At Letter AI, we are revolutionizing the way sales enablement is done. Our generative AI powered platform enables sales teams to build and maintain all the content their sales reps need to close deals, 10x faster and with half the operational overhead. For the first time ever, sales teams can use a unified platform to train and coach their reps, empower them with personalized and interactive content to engage customers, and improve their win rates.

Within just a few weeks of launching, we’ve onboarded leading companies like Lenovo and Redpanda as our first customers and received funding from the world’s best venture capital firms, including Y Combinator and Pioneer Fund.
company.teamAbout:
Ali Akhtar

Founder & CEO of Letter AI. A decade of experience in AI across various roles - as VP of ML Products at project44, ML Engineering Director at Samsara, and AI-focused consultant at McKinsey. Reach out to talk AI, enterprise SaaS, sales enablement, or anything else!

Armen Forget

Co-Founder of Letter AI, software engineer, architect and leader. I started my career in military/aerospace and moved to distributed backends and ML Operations. Currently obsessed with the endless possibilities of generative AI and helping our enterprise customers leverage this technology with minimal friction.

How We Operate

At Letter AI, we want you to be unapologetically you while operating with our core principles in mind:

  • Customer-obsessed: Make your customers unreasonably happy and everything else will fall into place

  • Ambitious yet practical: Set big goals, but stay grounded with disciplined execution and ruthless prioritization

  • Direct yet kind: Never hold back from speaking your mind, but do so in a way that is kind to your colleagues

  • Driven yet humble: Push for excellence and deliver fast, but keep your humility

name: Product Lead
description:
We’re seeking an entrepreneurial Product Lead of Fulfillment Infrastructure. You will own all platform fulfillment functionality and work with our partners to oversee day to day customer lending activity. We have 4 core product pillars (1) APIs & SDKs (2) Command Center (3) Fulfillment Infrastructure (4) Integrated Capital Stack. You will start by leading Fulfillment Infrastructure & Integrated Capital Stack for the first 6-12 months. You will become intimately familiar with the mortgage origination process (if you're not already).

We are not a traditional mortgage lender – we do not staff scores of underwriters or processors in-house. Most of our customers handle sales & borrower support. If you’re excited by the idea of building flexible systems with rigorous human-in-the-loop oversight that can scale to thousands of loans per month, this role is for you.

requirements.description: Significant experience building 0-1 enterprise software in regulated industries
Ability and interest to dig into mortgage and build a deep understanding of the full value chain (if you don’t have one already)

Strong design sense and ability to work closely with designers to build high-quality products
Ability to effectively manage strategic 3rd party integrations and partners
Experience in leading teams & managing people (can be small or large)
Experience working on mortgage software products and/or fintech infrastructure strongly preferred

responsibilities: Be a visionary leader and builder with a clear perspective on how to build scalable, modular origination infrastructure from rate lock to loan delivery
Build a small, high leverage originations oversight team to manage day to day customer loan activity and extract embedded subject matter expertise
Own our internal operating systems and automate origination processes
Lead onboarding, integrations, and day to day operations with our capital partners
Evaluate and manage 3rd party operations fulfillment partners
Be a thought partner and build a strong feedback loop with engineering
Play an integral role in spec-ing, building, and launching support for new loan products
Be a strong partner to our GTM and Account Management teams – supporting the deal process and ensuring our customers are successful

Salary range for Product Lead is more like $180k-$200k

and $200k-$250k for Head of Product
