company.name: Pylon Lending
company.description:
Pylon is the mortgage-as-a-service platform that enables enterprises to build and offer mortgage credit products on top of our APIs. We are on a mission to unlock access to America’s largest asset class.

We build and deliver the underlying pipes that enable high growth companies and forward-thinking institutions to offer mortgage products to their customers. We’re taking an ambitious full stack approach – we provide everything required to go from taking a loan from application in the customer’s product environment to delivering loans to the capital markets.

We’re backed by leading investors including Conversion Capital, Peter Thiel, QED, Fifth Wall, and the founders of Blend, Wealthfront, Ramp, and AngelList.
benefits: Ownership - meaningful early stage equity in Pylon
Healthcare - top tier medical, vision & dental with support for dependents
401(k) - ability to save for your future
Flexible Time Off - be on when you’re on and off when you’re off
Hardware Allowance - $2,000 to fix up your workspace
Annual Off-sites - fully paid for team off-sites in beautiful corners of the world
Home Financing - special assistance in purchasing your home (only available for full time employees)
company.teamAbout:
What we’re not:

  • Building a CRUD app:

    • We’re building a platform that’s only possible due to deep technology investments and thinking hard from first principles. Cargo-culting what’s come before won’t be sufficient.

    • If you’re looking to do mostly plumbing / lego piece assembling, Pylon may be very frustrating for you.

  • An easy job:

    • We’re building a lot of things from the ground up for the first time. Working at Pylon is like a research project where you have to ship to intelligent, opinionated customers regularly.

    • It’s basically guaranteed you’ll be handed a task that is too difficult for you to do. You might fail sometimes. You might have no idea where to start. Our team leans heavily on each other, but there’s no getting around the difficulties.

    • We're constantly pushing on pace as we build alongside our early customers and you'll need to work very hard. That said, we aren’t into performatively working long hours. We seek to optimize quality x speed and ensure our team is doing their best work.

What we are:

  • A small team:

    • We don’t have an army of engineers. If you find something is broken, you are probably the best one to fix it

    • All the code we write has to punch above its weight in maintainability and toil reduction

    • If you have a good idea, you have much more ability to put it into action than at a large company

    • We need generalists: specialization is for big companies that already have everything figured out. If you’re smart, flexible and like digging into everything, we want you.

  • Working in a regulated space:

    • Mortgage is regulated both federally and at the state level.

    • We move fast, but breaking things isn’t an option.

name: Founding Engineer (Full-Stack)

You’ll partner with our CEO to help provide key input on the product roadmap, own product devisions, build our foundational tech platform, and more.

requirements.description: High empathy for caregivers and families who need care.
Strong preference for candidates who have owned product development end-to-end.
Insane intensity and curiosity across everything you do.
requirements.explanation: We're looking for someone who is serious about their work and who will continue pushing and growing.

requirements.description: Experience leading and hiring a team of engineers.
Experience with API development, SQL, devops, CI/CD.
Experience building from scratch with little to no guidance.
Experience with Typescript, React, but more importantly, able to build and learn fast.
Former technical founder of venture-backed company, or founding/early engineer at a startup.

Architect and document our platform while advising key product and infrastructure decisions.
Closely collaborate with our founding team across go-to-market, operations, customer support, and more.
Flex between frontend, backend, product, and more among a scrappy founding team.

experience_info: shipping and iterating code in professional or personal projects.

  • This person should be able to build and hire a team but is solely focused on pushing code to our product for the time being.
avoid_traits: Ego
Seeking high status
Unserious about their work

company.name: Stealth Caregiving Startup
company.description:
Our mission is to transform how families receive care by putting caregivers at the center.

Caregiving is a $290B market that impacts nearly every person at some point in their life. We need to fill 7.8M caregiver job openings by 2026 to care for the 55M+ older adults in the US. We have the opportunity to completely reinvent the caregiving industry.

We recently closed our Seed round, backed by leading investors and founders.

The future of caregiving is coming.
benefits: Competitive Compensation: We only hire the top 0.1% of talent and offer the compensation package to match. We offer competitive medical, vision, and dental.
Company Equity: We are all owners. When we succeed, we all benefit. We provide generous company equity.
company.productDescription: We are creating the leading talent marketplace for caregivers to find their next job and manage their career. We connect caregivers of older and disabled adults with the best job opportunities and provide the core career platform for caregivers to increase their earning potential, upskill, and optimize care for the exponentially growing population of older and disabled adults.
company.teamAbout:
Core Values

  1. Olympian’s Work Ethic: We bend the structures to transform health care. We work harder, longer, and smarter.

  2. Bias for Action: We have to shoot game shots to make game shots. From facing seemingly impossible challenges to an individual day’s work, we are always biased for action. We do the thing.

  3. No Ego: Everyone takes out the trash, metaphorically and literally. Everything we do is to move the company forward.

  4. Customer Obsession: Caregivers are the heart of our company. We do everything to make their experience phenomenal. As a result, we deliver the best care to Families and Employer partners.

Founding team: Ian Lim (CEO) has been a caregiver for his mom since he was 15 and deeply understands the caregiving space. He was previously the first SWE/PM at Otter (Sequoia/a16z backed) and graduated from Stanford in CS.

name: Senior Frontend Engineer

As a Senior Frontend Web Engineer, you will be responsible for developing and maintaining the user interfaces for our web applications, working closely with our design team to create intuitive and responsive user experiences.

requirements.description: Passion for writing beautiful code and deep thinking about how users interact with your code

Senior level proficiency in JavaScript, React, Next.js, and Typescript
Strong understanding of User Experience Engineering - experience with CSS frameworks (we use Tailwind), CSS animations, and best practice Single Page Application design a plus
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
GraphQL API experience
Experience with automated testing frameworks (Jest, Cypress, etc.)

Work closely with our product and design team to translate wireframes and prototypes into rich user experiences
Use a product-driven approach to development, thinking critically about the product strategy and ways to implement it efficiently
Collaborate directly with the Head of Engineering to make architectural decisions and improvements to the development experience
Write automated tests to ensure the quality and stability of our codebase
Optimize web applications for maximum speed and scalability
Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to other engineers
Stay up-to-date with emerging trends and technologies in front-end development

experience_info: front-end web development

  • We're looking for candidates who have expertise and interest in the full spectrum of the domain - from tooling, development experience, and deep architectural ability, to UI/UX, animation, implementing pixel-perfect designs, and someone who is a proven track record of cutting-edge UX engineering.

Candidate's expertise is limited to only knowing a singular Javascript framework well

name: Senior iOS Engineer
description:
We are seeking a Senior iOS Engineer with a passion for developing exceptional mobile applications and rich user experiences. The ideal candidate is a product and design focused engineer, who has shown prior ability in making thoughtful product decisions, and implementing fluid and well-crafted interactions.

The candidate should have extensive experience in building high-performance, consumer-centric iOS applications with a focus on delivering exceptional product experiences. The candidate will be one of the main contributors to our flagship mobile app, tasked with building a rich and delightful user experience, and collaborating with our design team, other engineers, and directly with our head of engineering and head of design.

name: Founding Front-end Engineer
description: We're on the hunt for a founding front-end engineer, a role that blends the art of design with the craft of software development. This unique position will lead the charge in creating an intuitive, engaging user interface for our security data ETL platform, ensuring a seamless and compelling user experience. You'll be the lead for our front-end development efforts, setting the standard for Monad's front-end strategy and execution.

requirements.description: Experience with conducting user research and interviews to deeply understand user needs, pain points, and behaviors
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to articulate design concepts and technical solutions clearly to both technical and non-technical team members
Proficiency in front-end development tools and best practices, including version control, automated testing, and CI/CD
Experience with data ETL processes or security-focused products
requirements.explanation: Insights into the challenges of handling large-scale data or crafting user experiences in the security domain will be a significant asset.

requirements.description: Mastery of HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and TypeScript, with familiarity with frameworks such as Svelte, React, Vue.js, or Angular
No signs of job hopping (consecutive <1.5yr stints)
Willingness to contribute to product strategy and help define the startup's vision and roadmap
FAANG Experience
• Proven ability to build and maintain a strong design system and component library
• Prior experience in a security or data engineering startup
Proven track record of shipping and iterating on products in an early-stage startup environment. Portfolio available or products they can trace their contributions to are a big plus.

Proven experience building intuitive, data-rich user interfaces for security or data-intensive products, with the ability to design and implement scalable, performant front-end architectures that can handle large volumes of data.
This role is only open for US-based individuals.

responsibilities: In Your First 90 Days:
Lay the Groundwork: Begin shaping Monad's front-end architecture and design standards to build a strong foundation for a scalable, high-performing, and user-centric platform.
Strategize and Plan: Start formulating a UI/UX strategy that simplifies complex security data management, focusing on key areas to ensure immediate impact and intuitive user experiences.
Collaborate and Refine: Collaborate with the engineering and product teams to identify and prioritize design concepts that enhance user interaction and journey.
Establish Best Practices: Kick off the development of front-end practices and introduce essential tools aimed at boosting productivity and maintaining deployment quality.
Seek Feedback: Initiate conversations with customers and stakeholders to understand their needs and expectations, using their feedback to guide early design iterations.
workPlaceText: Our remote-first approach ensures you have the flexibility to work where you thrive, supported by a culture that values autonomy, collaboration, and personal growth.
visa_text_more: Can only sponsor if the candidate already has a visa
experience_info: Specializing in front-end development with a bit of UI/UX design experience. Early-stage startup experience is preferred.

avoid_traits: Lack of ownership, accountability, adaptability and autonomy
Less than 18 months in consecutive roles.

company.name: Monad
company.description:
At Monad, we're all about making security simpler and more effective. Our mission is clear: we break down the barriers between different security tools, shining a light on hidden risks, and giving security teams the power to manage their data their way. Think of us as the go-to folks for security data ETL (Extract, Transform, Load). We're here to untangle the complex web of security data, making it easier for teams to get the insights they need and act fast.

As a Series A startup backed by industry giants like Sequoia, Index Ventures, and Harpoon, we’re on a rapid trajectory, powered by innovation and driven by a fully remote team. We embrace flexibility, autonomy, and the collective effort to push boundaries in the cybersecurity domain.
benefits: The golden standard in benefits and unlimited PTO.
company.teamAbout:
Why Monad?

As part of Monad, you'll play a pivotal role in shaping the future of cybersecurity management. We offer the chance to innovate at the forefront of our field, backed by some of the most prestigious investors in the tech world. Our remote-first approach ensures you have the flexibility to work where you thrive, supported by a culture that values autonomy, collaboration, and personal growth.

name: Senior Software Engineer, Backend
description:
We’re looking for Software Engineers to join our team. You’ll work on the back-end, and will partner with every department at Atticus as we continue to grow our platform in an effort to help people in need find trusted legal support.  

The role is a rare opportunity to join a fast-growing Series B startup that doubles as a B-corp social enterprise. Every project you take on will help clients in need get the help they deserve, and you’ll shape our company culture as we scale. We’re looking for engineers who are excited about our mission and the challenges it entails.

requirements.description: • You build modern, resilient and operationally sane backend systems exemplifying industry standards (HTTP REST, GraphQL, Stream processing, Big Data).
• You lint all your code or know you should.
Worked at mission oriented start ups where you are the founding member of a critical end user system
• You work well with product to clarify and translate requirements for teammates
• You enjoy teaching and mentoring teammates on backend system best practices and architecture
• You are willing and able to deploy, troubleshoot, and maintain your systems in production and staging environments.
• You use a modern version-control system for your source code repository (Git, Mercurial, GitHub, BitBucket).
• You know what parts of your code require tests and you write those tests.
• You use objective judgment in leveraging the right frameworks and technologies.
• You are versed in cloud computing systems (GCP, AWS, etc.) and SAAS concepts.
• You leverage continuous integration systems to their full extent (CircleCI, Bamboo, Jenkins, TravisCI).
• Top ~30 engineering schools or top ~20 national universities

• (https://www.usnews.com/best-graduate-schools/top-engineering-schools/eng-rankings)

CS or technical degree from a top university (Stanford, MIT, Ivy League, CMU etc.)

Work with product to evaluate and refine product details and acceptance criteria
Architect, design, write, review, and test code in a collaborative environment with other software engineers.
Evaluate storage technologies and methodologies with an eye toward scalability and performance.
Leverage your peers as multipliers for your skills to create excellent products and services.

Focus on the following:

  • Healthtech companies (Oscar Health, One Medical, etc)

  • B2C Consumer focused companies and marketplaces (Spotify, Airbnb, Uber, Turo, etc.)

  • B2B SaaS companies known for UX/ UI (Slack, Figma, Ramp, Brex, Stripe, etc.)

company.name: Atticus
company.description: At any given time, 15 million Americans are experiencing a crisis that requires urgent help from our legal system or government. The right assistance could transform their lives. But today, most never get it. Atticus is a startup on a mission to change that. We're reinventing a broken space: the $100 billion market for legal services for individuals. We've taken a rare and exclusive commodity — access to expert legal advice and referrals — and made it free and available to everyone. To clients, we're a source of trusted guidance and an easy way to find and hire a great lawyer. To lawyers, we're a source of vetted clients and a way to build a practice they love while doing good. For now, most of our work involves helping disabled Americans qualify for government benefits. We also help victims of accidents, misconduct, and violence recover by getting compensation from insurance.
benefits: Medical and dental insurance with 100% of employee premiums covered
15 vacation days & 16 paid holidays each year
$1,000/year reimbursable stipend for education and training outside of work
Up to $1,200/year student loan repayment assistance
Free snacks, drinks, weekly lunches, and regular team dinners/events/retreats
company.teamAbout: We've helped more than 20,000 people in need (see our 6,000+ five-star reviews) and raised more than $50 million from top VC firms like Forerunner, GV (Google Ventures), and True Ventures. (We just closed our Series B round in May 2023, so we're well-funded for the foreseeable future.) We're small but moving fast — our team grew from 52 to 91 last year and we expect to grow again in 2024.

name: Founding Engineer
description:
About the Role

This is a full-time role as a Founding Engineer at Hadrius, located in New York, NY. As a Founding Engineer, you will be responsible for developing and implementing the core functionalities of the Hadrius platform, from the simplest aspects (CRUD functionality, centering a div) to the more exciting and complex (scaling email ingestion, building robust AI workflows).

You will work directly with the founding team to design and build the future of financial compliance - learning about and wearing every hat. We pride ourselves on having a hands off culture by having very few meetings and giving engineers a broad scope of responsibility. We’re focused first and foremost on empowering each other to do our best work, today and into the future. You'll be on a team that works incredibly hard and seeks other exceptional people excited to do the same.

recruiting_advice:
Hadrius allows regulated financial firms of all sizes to consolidate and automate their complianceprocesses using AI in one platform. Today, we're securing compliance for $200B+ AUM across ourclients.

Our founding team comes from Google, hedge funds, and previous exits, as well as running our own SEC registered RIA where we first built the powerful compliance engine behind Hadrius. We're backed by Y Combinator, Lynett Capital, Singularity Capital, and other exceptional investors.

Our customers range from fast-growing startups to established enterprise companies, and we obsess in listening to each of them and helping them succeed.

As Founding Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the technical direction of our company from the ground up. You will have the opportunity to work closely with the founding team to architect, develop, and deploy our core product, contributing your expertise to build scalable, reliable, and high-performance systems.

You will engage with our biggest challenges and work with our tech stack, which includes: React, Django, and AWS.

company.name: Hadrius (YC W23)
company.description:
About the Company

Hadrius consolidates and automates regulatory compliance for financial firms of all sizes (fintechs, investment advisors, funds, broker dealers, and more) through our AI-powered platform. Our space has been underserved by private equity for decades and we have a unique opportunity to disrupt it with an exceptional team and the advent of LLMs. 

Today, we're securing compliance for $250B+ AUM across our 100+ clients. Our founding team has deep engineering and domain expertise from Google, hedge funds, and previous startup exits. Before Hadrius, we ran our own SEC regulated RIA with thousands of clients where we first built the powerful compliance engine behind Hadrius. 

This isn’t our first rodeo, and our customers know it - we're backed by Y Combinator, Lynett Capital, Singularity Capital and (naturally), our customers. Since inception, we’ve continued to grow rapidly, doubling our revenue every few months.
benefits: Destination Airbnb company work retreats 3-5 times a year
The opportunity to get ownership in a fast-growing startup and contribute directly to its future success
company.teamAbout:
The founding team comes from big tech, hedge funds, and a previous exit before starting a robo-advisor (Quantbase) with thousands of clients. We expect each other to work at our best and constantly challenge ourselves to find ways to grow faster and deliver a better customer experience. The result is a tight-knit company growing rapidly as the cutting edge upstart in an old industry.

We take our work seriously but always find time to share a laugh and get to know each other on a personal level. The team is largely remote, but our main office is in New York City on Wall Street where you’ll be working a few days a week. We will frequently get together - either in NYC, or SF, or at a week long Airbnb in some cool location, to work together in-person 3-5 times a year.

To date, we've raised $2.5M from Y Combinator, Lynett Capital, and Singularity Capital among others.

name: Generalist Software Engineer
description:
At Pylon, we’re a small team building a very ambitious product in the mortgage space.

At this early stage, we’re looking for engineers who can see the opportunity of what we’re building towards and want to have a hand in building it.

We're in search of people who find difficult problems invigorating and who fit well into a high-performing team built on mutual respect and reliance. If you like pushing yourself to learn a massive amount while shipping code that has a huge impact on the end product, Pylon Engineering could be a great place for you.

requirements.description: Typescript and SQL experience
Deep curiosity and excitement about coding
requirements.explanation: If their vibe is "I learned these technologies to get a lucrative job as a developer" it's a bad fit. We want people who can't help but write code.

requirements.description: Uses Linux on their personal computer
requirements.explanation:
If they use a mac, it's not an instant disqualification, but it's a slightly negative signal.

If they use windows, strongly negative signal

(If they use anything with "BSD" in the name, we want to talk to them immediately)

requirements.description: Able and excited to work with the team in person in Menlo Park
Startup experience, someone who wants ownership and to really get into the code
Experience with an expressively typed language like Scala, Haskell, Rust or OCaml.
requirements.explanation: Looking for people who have used languages with generics and sum-types. Usually these are functional languages, but other languages qualify like Rust

requirements.description: Deep backend experience. Not just CRUD
requirements.explanation: Often developers have backend experience which consists largely of doing CRUD operations and minimal business logic. We're looking for someone who has gotten their hands dirty doing truly difficult backend or infra work

responsibilities: At least 4 tough years of experience at modern software companies. For this role, we're looking for someone who has pushed themselves hard and excelled at a software-first company and is looking for their next challenge.
Deep SQL knowledge. We use an ORM and query builder, but it’s a thin wrapper over SQL. You’ve got to know SQL inside and out to really be successful.
Intimate TypeScript familiarity. We don't need you to be comfortable with our entire stack, but knowing TypeScript already ensures you can hit the ground running.
Can start immediately. If you're the right candidate we will move quickly, and we need you to be able to as well.
workPlaceText: On-site at our office in Menlo Park, CA
experience_info: - not necessarily professional. For example, if you've built your own compiler on github and don't have any professional experience, please talk to us.
recruiting_advice:
An ideal candidate would be:

  • High energy

  • Functional programming experience (haskell, ocaml, scala, etc)

  • Have some interesting open source projects on their github that indicate they actually enjoy programming for fun
avoid_traits: Worked primarily in Java / Spring
Only untyped languages on their resume (python, javascript, ruby)
Senior people who mostly do architecture, but haven't gotten their hands dirty coding for a while
Developers who use technologies primarily to get a job. (We're looking for devs & hackers driven by curiosity, not resume)

company.name: Pylon Lending
company.description:
Pylon is the mortgage-as-a-service platform that enables enterprises to build and offer mortgage credit products on top of our APIs. We are on a mission to unlock access to America’s largest asset class.

We build and deliver the underlying pipes that enable high growth companies and forward-thinking institutions to offer mortgage products to their customers. We’re taking an ambitious full stack approach – we provide everything required to go from taking a loan from application in the customer’s product environment to delivering loans to the capital markets.

We’re backed by leading investors including Conversion Capital, Peter Thiel, QED, Fifth Wall, and the founders of Blend, Wealthfront, Ramp, and AngelList.
benefits: Ownership - meaningful early stage equity in Pylon
Healthcare - top tier medical, vision & dental with support for dependents
401(k) - ability to save for your future
Flexible Time Off - be on when you’re on and off when you’re off
Hardware Allowance - $2,000 to fix up your workspace
Annual Off-sites - fully paid for team off-sites in beautiful corners of the world
Home Financing - special assistance in purchasing your home (only available for full time employees)
company.teamAbout:
What we’re not:

  • Building a CRUD app:

    • We’re building a platform that’s only possible due to deep technology investments and thinking hard from first principles. Cargo-culting what’s come before won’t be sufficient.

    • If you’re looking to do mostly plumbing / lego piece assembling, Pylon may be very frustrating for you.

  • An easy job:

    • We’re building a lot of things from the ground up for the first time. Working at Pylon is like a research project where you have to ship to intelligent, opinionated customers regularly.

    • It’s basically guaranteed you’ll be handed a task that is too difficult for you to do. You might fail sometimes. You might have no idea where to start. Our team leans heavily on each other, but there’s no getting around the difficulties.

    • We're constantly pushing on pace as we build alongside our early customers and you'll need to work very hard. That said, we aren’t into performatively working long hours. We seek to optimize quality x speed and ensure our team is doing their best work.

What we are:

  • A small team:

    • We don’t have an army of engineers. If you find something is broken, you are probably the best one to fix it

    • All the code we write has to punch above its weight in maintainability and toil reduction

    • If you have a good idea, you have much more ability to put it into action than at a large company

    • We need generalists: specialization is for big companies that already have everything figured out. If you’re smart, flexible and like digging into everything, we want you.

  • Working in a regulated space:

    • Mortgage is regulated both federally and at the state level.

    • We move fast, but breaking things isn’t an option.

company.name: Atticus
company.description: At any given time, 15 million Americans are experiencing a crisis that requires urgent help from our legal system or government. The right assistance could transform their lives. But today, most never get it. Atticus is a startup on a mission to change that. We're reinventing a broken space: the $100 billion market for legal services for individuals. We've taken a rare and exclusive commodity — access to expert legal advice and referrals — and made it free and available to everyone. To clients, we're a source of trusted guidance and an easy way to find and hire a great lawyer. To lawyers, we're a source of vetted clients and a way to build a practice they love while doing good. For now, most of our work involves helping disabled Americans qualify for government benefits. We also help victims of accidents, misconduct, and violence recover by getting compensation from insurance.
benefits: Medical and dental insurance with 100% of employee premiums covered
15 vacation days & 16 paid holidays each year
$1,000/year reimbursable stipend for education and training outside of work
Up to $1,200/year student loan repayment assistance
Free snacks, drinks, weekly lunches, and regular team dinners/events/retreats
company.teamAbout: We've helped more than 20,000 people in need (see our 6,000+ five-star reviews) and raised more than $50 million from top VC firms like Forerunner, GV (Google Ventures), and True Ventures. (We just closed our Series B round in May 2023, so we're well-funded for the foreseeable future.) We're small but moving fast — our team grew from 52 to 91 last year and we expect to grow again in 2024.

Frontend engineers at Llama are responsible for building the Llama platform, which is a web application built on the Llama smart contract framework. Llama features an onchain policy engine to set permissions, custom execution strategies to define rules for action execution, and treasury management for token approvals and transfers.

About you

  • You are customer-focused and obsessive about delivering the best user experience

name: Founding Full Stack Software Engineer

This role involves designing, developing, and managing software solutions that interface with medical imaging equipment and data.

Deep understanding of PACS/DICOM standards and experience with medical imaging software.

workPlaceText: Hybrid in SF (Southpark)

recruiting_advice:
We are building the first radiology as a service solution powered by a multi-modal radiology copilot. There is a dire radiology shortage (1 radiologist for every 4 radiologist jobs) that is leading to misdiagnosis with horrible consequences (200k people dying a year) - we’re going to solve that.  

We’ve raised from Bedrock Capital, Trust Ventures, Jack Altman. We already have access to over 250,000 unique radiology images to train our initial mode on. This includes X-rays, MRI’s, CAT scans, echo’s, and ultrasounds. We also have our first customer secured (signed a $300k annual contract, not just an LOI). 

Epsilon's unique position as an end-to-end solution provides unparalleled access to diverse medical imaging data at a rapid pace and allows us to steer clear of having to apply as an FDA medical device. The faster we get access to more data by signing up more imaging centers, the stronger and more accurate our model gets.

  • Strong candidates would have had a history of promotions

  • Needs to have a passion for the mission and what Epsilon is trying to build

name: Software Engineer, Machine Learning
description:
We’re looking to hire our first machine learning engineer as we expand our data activation products to include an intelligence layer. While hundreds of companies use Hightouch today to sync data into their SaaS systems to automate and improve operations, there’s a lot of surface area we haven’t touched in helping companies figuring out which customers to message, what content to put in messages, and when to send messages. A lot of this work today is done manually through intuition and guesswork, and we believe that adding machine learning could have a step function impact for our customers. And given our access to data warehouses and databases, Hightouch is perfectly placed to make use of a company’s customer data in building a powerful intelligence layer.

As our founding machine learning engineer, you will help build comprehensive solutions to the above domains from scratch. Responsibilities will be highly varied and include working on customer research, problem definition, predictive modeling, machine learning infrastructure, and partnering with customers.

requirements.description: Experience building 0 to 1 products using LLMs

responsibilities: Personalization and Product Recommendation: There are often many options for what content a company could message a user with, including which products to show from catalogues. Given this large state space, how can Hightouch help personalize messages with the most relevant content for each user?
Automated Experimentation: Helping companies intelligently navigate and automate experiments across the extensive number of options for messaging customers.
Predictive Audiences: Building models to predict which users are most likely to convert, churn, or take desired actions.
Content Generation: Particularly with recent advances in LLMs, how can we help marketers generate text, images, and creatives that are compelling to their customers?
Budget Optimization: Helping companies assess which marketing spend is driving the most incremental conversions, and where the marginal CAC is lowest.

company.name: Hightouch
company.description:
Hightouch’s mission is to empower everyone to take action on their data. Through our Reverse ETL platform, business and data users can seamlessly sync data from where it resides, such as warehouses and databases, to where it is needed, including operational systems and SaaS tools. Traditionally, acting on data has required engineering time and bandwidth, and left most business users stuck with charts and reports that are unable to take automated action on their data. With Hightouch, every business user, without writing any code, can activate data to streamline critical processes, improve marketing performance, and scale operations.

Our team operates with a focus on making a meaningful impact for our customers. We believe in approaching challenges with a first principles thinking mindset, moving quickly and embracing our value of efficient execution, and treating each other with compassion and kindness. We look for team members that are strong communicators, have a growth mindset, and are motivated and persistent in achieving our goals.

Hundreds of companies use Hightouch, including Spotify, Ramp, Retool, NBA, Plaid, and Betterment. We’re based in San Francisco, are remote-friendly, and backed by leading investors such as Amplify Partners, ICONIQ Growth, Bain Capital Ventures, Y-Combinator, and Afore Capital.
benefits: Core benefits (health, dental, vision, life insurance)
Connectivity ($50 per month cell-phone or wifi connectivity stipend)
Commuter benefits ($50 are offered to both employees who come into the offices and to remote workers working outside of their home)
Remote first (in-person meetings at our San Francisco and New York offices plus our annual company onsite.)
401k for our US employees and retirement plans for our international employees
company.teamAbout:
Our team operates with a focus on making a meaningful impact for our customers. We believe in approaching challenges with a first principles thinking mindset, moving quickly and embracing our value of efficient execution, and treating each other with compassion and kindness. We look for team members that are strong communicators, have a growth mindset, and are motivated and persistent in achieving our goals.

Our founders were early employees of Segment where they saw the transformative impact of enabling business and marketing teams to activate customer data. However, they also recognized the limitations of the existing rigid legacy Customer Data Platform (CDP) market.

By building a platform that could sit on top of an organization’s existing data infrastructure, our founders knew that teams could unlock a more performant, flexible and secure solution to activating customer data at scale - and thus, Hightouch was born.

name: Founding Software Engineer Infrastructure
description: As a Software Engineer at NodeKit, you will work closely with the founding team to build highly performant systems on the bleeding edge of blockchain technology. Your primary focus will be developing the core systems built on top of SEQ, including the transaction processing, block building, storage systems, and maintaining compatibility with existing rollups building on top of SEQ.

requirements.description: Experience with Go, Rust, or C++ in production environments
Experience building performance-optimized systems
Startup mindset and entrepreneurial spirit, evidenced by early-stage / scale-up startup experience, side projects, or product launches
Experience working on a L1 or L2 Blockchain in the past
Adaptable and collaborative approach, with experience working on cross-functional teams, leading initiatives, and communicating effectively
Strong product sense, high ownership, and ability to operate autonomously
Alignment with company vision, high commitment, and ability to execute at the highest level
Experience and demonstrated interest in blockchain
Experience building distributed systems

responsibilities: Contribute to design and development of SEQ and other key components of NodeKit’s blockchain infrastructure.
Write production-ready software, primarily in Go and Rust
Execute projects in a timely manner from initial design to development.
workPlaceText: We'll be in-person in NYC starting in June.
experience_info: as a software engineer at fast-growing startups / top companies, with a track-record of shipping products/features and maintaining live applications
recruiting_advice: NodeKit is a blockchain infrastructure company that is building a decentralized shared sequencer called SEQ and a super builder called Javelin. We are a team that highly values tenacity, positivity, and a desire to meet difficult problems head-on. Our customers range from fast-growing startups to established companies, and we obsess in listening to each of them and helping them succeed. We are backed by a16z CSX, Borderless Capital, Polygon Ventures, and Blizzard Fund, as well as founders and leaders from Polygon, Avail, Republic, and Chorus One. As Founding Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in shaping the technical direction of our company from the ground up. You will have the opportunity to work closely with the founding team to architect, develop, and deploy our core products, contributing your expertise to build scalable, reliable, and high-performance systems. You will engage with our biggest challenges and work with our tech stack, which includes: Javelin and SEQ which are both written in Golang with some small Solidity components as well. SEQ is an L1 blockchain which is purpose built for shared sequencing. Javelin is the first super builder which allows for atomic execution across multiple rollups allowing for atomic synchronous composability for the first time ever across blockchains.
avoid_traits: Lack of ownership and accountability
Bias towards deliberation instead of action
Preference for management hierarchies and requiring direct instruction and task-based work
Inability to hold a role for longer than a year / frequent job-hopping
Discomfort with ambiguity and inability to make decisions

company.name: NodeKit
company.description: NodeKit is the composability layer that allows blockchains to unlock synchronous communication. This is achieved through SEQ, the decentralized shared sequencer L1, and Javelin, the super builder. Traditionally, rollups provided scale to blockchains but lacked a way to communicate with one another synchronously. At NodeKit, we enable synchronous communication across different rollups and allow them to decentralize in the process, removing a single point of failure.
company.teamAbout:
Founded in the heartland of the USA in a small town called Ames, Iowa we are building the systems that will enable rollups to become the default option for anyone developing blockchain based systems. We work closely with innovative partners to help decentralize their systems enabling a better user experience while maintaining high performance.

Our founding team's diverse experiences have helped shape our vision for what a truly seamless blockchain experience looks like. The technology we have built provides customers a way to decentralize their systems while remaining free to focus on fostering their ecosystem and their core product.

At NodeKit we are looking to add enterprising and driven members to the team to keep up with the crypto ecosystem and company’s quick growth. We are backed by some of the best funds in crypto including a16z CSX, Borderless Capital, Polygon Ventures, and Blizzard Fund.

company.name: Eden
company.description:
Eden is challenging the inefficient and expensive status quo of today’s home buying process by leveraging AI and tech-enabled solutions to augment the services offered by traditional brokerages.

Our mission is fueled by the belief that everyone deserves access to affordable housing and a fair, transparent buying journey — a vision now more crucial than ever, as housing affordability hits an unprecedented low.

In the coming weeks, we are launching our AI real estate agent, who will endlessly browse with you, learn what you like, and give you top home recommendations. We will replace every aspect of real estate services using technology, including a “TurboTax for real estate” platform for carrying out the transaction.

At every step of the way, we will pass savings back to consumers so they can get closer to the American Dream. Join us as we chart a new course towards a better home buying experience — a journey where technology paves the way to your new home.
company.productDescription:
Your AI real estate assistant.
Eden will endlessly browse with you, learn what you like, and give you top recommendations.
company.teamAbout: Small and nimble team with global presence. Founding team based in Austin with additional engineering talent in Canada and Türkiye. We have all gone through the home search process in some form and are building the product we would want to use ourselves. We are deeply passionate about improving housing affordability with technology. We are a highly rational team and try to have no ego -- we want to solve problems in the best way possible and work hard to do it.

name: Perception Technical Lead
description:
We are building a perception stack for the home. This system must be able to provide full contextual awareness by reliably identifying threats in all environmental conditions. False positives lead to a terrible customer experience, while false negatives detract from our goal to provide absolute peace of mind.

We are looking for a domain expert to lead design, development, and evaluation for perception, marrying classical approaches and machine learning to drive optimal performance. This role will also be highly collaborative with our hardware team, as we develop sensing requirements to guide off-the-shelf component selection and in-house hardware iteration.

requirements.description: You have a deep understanding of the theory and practice of modern machine learning techniques.

You are experienced at all facets of training and using deep-learning models, including writing custom layers/operations, optimizing networks for inference on edge compute, reproducibility and evaluation.
You have extensive experience working with Pytorch, Tensorflow or other modern deep learning frameworks.
You are familiar with the use of VLMs and other multi-modal models for semantic scene understanding and description.
Experience building high-performance software systems using compiled languages (C/C++/Rust/etc.)
Experience with Middleware frameworks such as ROS
Experience with build systems such as Bazel, CMake
Experience in GPU architecture and CUDA programming

responsibilities: Extract the maximum value from our sensors, fusing all observations available while being robust to occlusions, poor lighting and disguises.
Lead the collection, labeling, and management of datasets to train and evaluate ML models.
Leverage state of the art models for 3D object detection, tracking, facial recognition and semantic scene understanding, and push them to the limits of their performance in this problem domain.
Perform trade studies to understand the value of new sensors or processing approaches to system reliability.
Analyze the performance of systems both in simulation and using data from deployments in the field to find headroom and devise solutions to reduce it.
Probe the inner workings of neural networks to uncover and mitigate edge case failures.
Design systems that can understand and communicate when they are not working well.
Contribute to machine learning infrastructure (e.g. distributed training, continuous model integration, data management, and evaluation of production systems).
workPlaceText: In-person in SF
experience_info: with machine learning for hardware products in a safety-critical field, e.g. aerospace, robotics, medical devices, autonomous vehicles.
recruiting_advice: We are looking for someone who has done perception. This is not simulation, controls, but related only to the ability to understand the environment and act accordingly.
avoid_traits: Candidates who have not worked with perception or ML

name: Staff AI/ML Engineer
description:
Harmonic is using data and AI to map the world of startups. When companies are first formed, they’re invisible to the world. We’ve created the only complete startup database, enabling the right investments to reach the right entrepreneurs at the right moment. We cover founders who’ve just filed for incorporation to scaleups hiring their go-public CFO, all in real-time with rich firmographic, team info, and time-series data.

We're looking a Staff Data Scientist to own our insights layer and build models and algorithms to generate first-party data.

requirements.description: Fluency in Python and SQL
Experience with backend libraries and tools like dbt and dagster, familiarity with web servers, and comfort with large data sets.
Ability to work 3 times/week in our Brooklyn (Williamsburg) office
Proven track record of shipping major projects for a data-centric startup

responsibilities: Own our insights layer: build models and algorithms to generate first-party data. This will include using statistical and machine learning techniques, including LLMs, to generate derived insights as well as determine accurate values from error-prone sources (e.g. headcount information)
Develop data products that improve the discoverability of startups in our database. Create and continually improve the similarity, relevance, and tagging algorithms that power our search engine.
Use your knowledge and creativity to extract as much value out of our data as possible. Make us the most valuable and useful source of information on startups.
Oversee general maintenance and health of data pipelines to ensure accurate and efficient transformations of our data.
Collaborate with the team to devise product goals, outline milestones, and execute plans, achieving this with minimal guidance.
workPlaceText: 3 days a week in person in our NYC office (Williamsburg)
experience_info: in Data Science or Data Engineering, or commensurate educational experience (PhD)
recruiting_advice:
What we value:

  • Being customer-obsessed: At the start of each two-week sprint, we commit to our deliverables, focusing on customer impact and fulfilling commitments. Expect an environment of high personal accountability.

  • Continuous self-improvement: We prioritize growth and feedback, celebrating wins & achievements while focusing on how we can strive to be even better next time. We exchange regular feedback and hold quarterly sessions to discuss each other's strengths and areas for growth, driving our development. We index heavily on introspection, openness to feedback, and direct communication.

  • “Get shit done” attitudes: Even when things are uncertain, all of our team members excel at pushing projects ahead, asking the right questions, and overcoming obstacles to keep things moving. You understand the importance of balancing speed and quality, and you excel at communicating what can be realistically achieved given the circumstances.

Who you are:

  • Inquisitive: What kind of topics pique your interest? What keeps you up late at night? What kind of problems do you like to solve?

  • Accountable: Do you take psychological ownership of your work? What are your action steps when things don’t go according to plan? Can we count on your word?

  • Engaged: How active are you in accomplishing your personal and professional goals? Are you proactive about identifying roadblocks? What do you do when you see something that isn’t working?
avoid_traits: People who come off as egotistical, overly focused on job title, leveling, comp, etc.
People who are specifically targeting management as a means of career progression
People used to have lots of resources/tools at their disposal, and not accustomed to being a little scrappy/resourceful
benefits: Top of the line health, dental and vision insurance, with 100% premium covered
Monthly social budget for each office

company.name: Harmonic
company.description:
About us

Harmonic is the startup discovery engine. We believe in innovation, entrepreneurs, and efficient capital markets. It pains us to see great startup opportunities consistently go undiscovered. So, we dedicated ourselves to mapping out the startup landscape and building the index and tools that ensure the most promising founders get found and funded.

The world's largest and most prolific venture capital firms rely on us to find and invest in the next Google, AirBnB, Uber, Stripe, and Anduril. We play a crucial part in ensuring hundreds of billions of dollars get routed efficiently and that the innovations the world would most benefit from materialize.

We’ve been growing steadily and need passionate driven people to help us get to the next level. If you want to work in a high-growth environment with some of the most talented folks on the planet and resonate with our values, read on.
benefits: Top of the line health, dental and vision insurance, with 100% premium covered
Monthly team dinner (we have a lot of foodies) for each office

company.name: Aragon AI
company.description:
Our mission is to democratize access to AI by enabling anyone to scale their likeness and become the most authentic versions of themselves. We’re an AI research lab focused on generating photorealistic images of real people.

  • We launched our first product aragon.ai which generates professional headshots for people in February 2023 and in just a few months we reached 7-figures in annual revenue.

  • The practical use cases of scaling people’s likenesses are vast and we’re continuously launching new products using our proprietary AI models.

Our long-term vision is to create a new layer of the internet for hyper-personalization, where individuals become the models in ads, marketing campaigns, and online shopping experiences; in turn increasing the conversion rate of trillions of dollars worth of businesses in the world.
benefits: Occasional company off-sites/retreats to spend quality time together in person.
Wellness, commute, and food/meal delivery budgets.
We currently work out of the Celo office in San Francisco which is a vibrant community of 20+ top Silicon Valley startups and is also across the street from OpenAI’s office.
company.teamAbout:
Aragon AI is creating personalized AI models. We're a World Class team backed by angels from OpenAI, founders of Vanta, DocSend, and more.

Wesley, CEO of Aragon AI, has been passionate about AI since he was 17 – from winning machine learning competitions to applied AI research at UMich and Clinc AI. He was also employee #1 and tech lead at Virtually (YC S20), the 3rd engineer at Fractional (YC W21), and an engineer at Microsoft. He loves challenging himself and has completed a full 140.6-mile Ironman triathlon.

Akhil, CTO of Aragon AI, was one of the first engineers at Brex, where he played a key role in its growth from pre-launch to a series D powerhouse with $100M ARR in 2 years. He was also an engineer at Meta, Blend (NYSE: BLND), and the 2nd engineer at Fractional. A UCLA computer science grad, Akhil has a passion for travel and productivity hacks.

Our Team

  • We are a diverse global team of 11 that values diversity in culture and thought. We are based out of the San Francisco Bay Area, Los Angeles, Florida, Colorado, Toronto, India, Bangladesh, the Philippines, Nigeria, and Poland.

  • Our engineering team includes new grads to tech leads from the world’s top universities, Y Combinator-backed startups, and Big Tech companies.

  • Our marketing team includes someone who has led the marketing efforts at a Series B consumer company.

  • Two 140.6-mile Ironman triathlon finishers.

  • In our free time, we enjoy watching sci-fi, K-Dramas, juggling, gaming, drawing, and reading.

This hands-on role involves shaping our product suite's future in a dynamic and evolving space. You will contribute to both our B2B to B2C applications as well as broadening our product ecosystem.

Proficient in design tools such as Figma, Sketch, and Adobe Creative Suite

Proactively identify new tasks, challenges, and areas for improvement.

recruiting_advice:
We're looking for a Senior Product Designer to join our team at Spatial Labs. This is our first search for this role on Paraform and we're excited to meet the talented candidates you send our way.

While this is a senior position, we focus more on impact and growth potential than years of experience. The ideal candidate will be highly skilled at UX/UI design for both mobile and web applications. More importantly, we're looking for a product-minded designer who is comfortable owning the entire product lifecycle from end-to-end, essentially taking on elements of a product management role.

The right person will have experience shipping and managing products from start to finish. Candidates who have worked in fast-paced startup environments tend to be a great fit for this role and our company.

As a lean team, this position will have a major influence on the direction of our products. If you're a customer-obsessed designer who wants to take products from concept to launch and beyond, we'd love to hear from you!
avoid_traits: Lack of agency. As an early-stage startup, we require candidates to take full ownership of their projects from beginning to end. Those who need constant management or lack experience in such autonomous roles may not be suitable.

name: Software Engineer, Product Engineering (Full Stack)
description: Pocus is a powerful, flexible, and easy to use web application that thousands of users use daily to make critical revenue impacting decisions. The product engineering team is responsible for continually improving and delivering value to our end-users while maintaining a high bar on quality and polish. Full-stack engineers have the freedom to work across the stack — from building snappy user experiences in the frontend, to building powerful APIs that interact with our data platform. We encourage ownership and autonomy and in this role you will work cross-functionally with our Product and Design functions to build products that solve real customer problems.

requirements.description: Loves shipping early, learning from real world usage, and iterating
Must actively want to work for a startup
requirements.explanation: Here are some indications that will help you filter for this: 1) Must want to move quickly and be scrappy, 2) Must be motivated by equity rather than cash, 3) Must not be motivated by just getting a fancier title (we don't have titles at Pocus), 4) Must be hands-on operationally: candidate will be on-call and will be paged at odd hours in the night if something is on fire

requirements.description: Is deeply familiar with the React ecosystem and is equally comfortable writing frontend code as well as backend APIs
Must have worked at at least one startup before
requirements.explanation: If a candidate has worked only at large companies (Series C/200+ employees or higher when they joined), they will not be a good fit.

requirements.description: Has built complex web applications from scratch
Has worked at 1 or more B2B SaaS companies.
Is authorized to work in the US without requiring any visa sponsorship
requirements.explanation: We don't sponsor visas

responsibilities: Build a web-app that is reliable and extensible
You will work directly with Product, Design, and Customers to drive value and play a key role in making our product feature-rich, stable, and delightful to use
Have complete autonomy: Extreme autonomy and ownership is how we move so fast. At Pocus, you will have the opportunity to influence every aspect of our product and technology.
Work with best-in-class engineering practices: We take immense pride in the craft of our work. We don’t skimp on things like code review, developer tooling, documentation, testing, etc.
Join an incredible team at a magical time: We’re at the beginning stages of explosive growth. Join a passionate, scrappy, and no-ego team of builders that will inspire you every day.
workPlaceText: Only within US, Canada, and Mexico (must have the ability to travel to the US every now and then)
visa_text_more: We're not able to sponsor visas at this time and are also not open to anyone on OPT or other temporary status
experience_info: building web applications for SaaS tools
recruiting_advice:
Please do not contact candidates who are currently at Mixpanel - It's fine if they were there previously.

We're looking for a candidate with a high slope of career growth. Apart from their experience working at a startup, let's say they worked at a large company with a career ladder early in their career, we're looking for folks who had fast career progression e.g. SWE1 --> SWE2 in less than 2 years or SWE 2 --> Senior Eng in less than 3 years.

We're also looking for folks with expanding scope of responsibility. Good candidates will be able to talk about owning larger problems, tackling larger issues. If the candidate is doing the same thing over and over again, they will not be a good fit.

Here are some candidates we would not want you to contact:

  • Candidates who have only worked on the frontend or application layer: Typically, someone with experience in just javascript, python, ruby etc.

  • Candidate must not be a job hopper: If candidate has a pattern of hopping jobs too often, we will not consider them. They should have a history of staying at a company for at least 2-3 years

  • Candidates that are too senior: We're not really looking for someone with 15+ YOE. It's both a mixture of not being challenged enough and having expectations of very quick growth that can get difficult to navigate.

Please also make sure candidates are a good culture fit you can probably easily determine this if you observe whether they have the following traits:

  • Holds a high bar for quality and simplicity and takes pride in their work

  • Loves shipping early, learning from real world usage, and iterating

  • Is collaborative in a remote-first, async setting and is a strong communicator

  • Has a knack for problem-solving and thinking from first principles

  • Loves working in small teams with a strong bias for action
avoid_traits: Must not be a job hopper: If candidate has a pattern of hopping jobs too often, we will not consider them. They should have a history of staying at a company for at least 2-3 years
Must not have worked only on backend or only on frontend technologies. Looking for someone truly full stack.

company.name: Pocus
company.description:
Pocus is the first Product-Led Sales platform that turns product data into revenue. Pocus empowers go-to-market teams to use data to improve customer acquisition, conversion, and expansion - without relying on engineers. Our no-code interface lets non-technical teams use information locked in the data warehouse and join it with customer data (from the CRM) to uncover the best opportunities and take the right action.

Pocus turns product data into revenue by:

🪄 Converting more free trials

🪄 Finding needle in the haystack opportunities

🪄 Increasing sales rep efficiency

🪄 Reaching out to the right buyer with the right messages at the right time
benefits: Unlimited PTO - We offer unlimited paid vacation and require you take at least two weeks off (we work hard, but don’t want you to burn out)!

Wellness Stipend - Taking care of your mental and physical health means you show up to work as your best self. We offer a monthly stipend and you choose what to invest in - gym membership, counselor, or chiropractor. You decide.
Health Insurance - We offer competitive medical, dental, vision insurance for employees and dependents.
Company Offsites - Although we’re remote we truly believe that every team needs in person time to collaborate.
Retirement Savings - Easy contributions to your 401K.
Parental Leave - We offer paid parental leave to spend quality time with your new additions.
Suprise Perks - Whether it’s a stipend for a home office set up or the occasional meal on Pocus, we’re always looking for ways to say thank you to our amazing team.
company.teamAbout:
We’re on a mission to build Product-Led Sales technology that transforms how go-to-market teams use data to drive revenue. But, this is just the beginning. Our vision is to bring the power of data to everyone… including non-technical users.

In a short 18 months, we’ve accomplished an insane amount. We built the first Product-Led Sales platform for customers like Linear and Clockwise, generated a waitlist of hundreds of companies, created a 2,000 member community and pioneered the Product-Led Sales category. We are backed by best-in-class investors (First Round & Coatue) and angel investors (COO Notion, CPO Figma, CRO Zapier, CEO dbt, COO Datadog, CEO Postman, CPO Adobe, etc.)

The Pocus team is full of humble overachievers that like to move quickly, build for impact, solve incredibly tough problems… and have a ton of fun.

name: Security-Focused Engineer
description:
• Method is hiring a security-focused engineer to play a key role in building an autonomous security platform.

  • This person has software and data engineering experience, a bias towards product, are a hacker at heart, and have a deep appreciation for security.

  • This person could come from one of several roles, but whatever their history, they should be passionate about the potential for new security products to evolve the industry. Given the responsibilities, this person is likely early in their career.

  • Example roles:

    • Security engineer

      • With experience implementing and validating security controls in an enterprise environment to be opinionated on what good looks like. Think cloud policies, identity and access management.

      • Has developed novel or custom security products to automate key pieces of their workflows

    • Red teamer / hacker turned product person

    • Full-stack software engineer on a security product

      • Has taken a security product from 0→1

    • Data/integration engineer

      • Who has built integrations of different tools into a security platform

requirements.description: Built security products from 0 to 1 or have built integrations into security platforms
Deep understanding and appreciation for cybersecurity and the cybersecurity landscape
Experience developing and implementing security tools
Experience developing and implementing network security strategies
Have red teaming experience

responsibilities: Developing security workflows for Method cyber agents
Design and implement scenarios in cyber ranges to build and continuously test workflows
Develop new security tools that perceive and validate different aspects of security workflows (e.g. certain k8s active vulnerability scanner)
Develop integrations into 3rd party tools to perceive and command and controls (e.g. EDR integration)
Craft training examples for Method AI to operate tools and learn various security skills (e.g. network security strategy)
Update Method's ontology (data model) with new objects and relationships to complete new workflows
Implement data integrations to turn raw telemetry off of tools and integrations into robust perception for AI and users
Identify and conduct security workflows that align with Method's product roadmap and customer issues
Decompose security workflows into tools, integrations, and skills to build into Method
Implement security benchmarks to measure progress of Method on autonomous tasks
Work, iterate, and debug with customers on their security workflows and Method installations
workPlaceText: In-person in NYC
visa_text_more: U.S. Citizens only
experience_info: in 2 or more of security, software, and. data engineering experience
recruiting_advice:
This individual could come from one of several roles, but whatever their history, they understand that the only mechanism through which the state of cybersecurity will be improved is through powerful security products.

Example roles:

  • A full-stack software engineer who has taken a security product from 0→1

  • A data/integration engineer who has built integrations of different tools into a security platform

  • A security engineer who has developed novel or custom security products to automate key pieces of their workflows

  • A red teamer / hacker turned product person
avoid_traits: We're looking for cross-functional engineers, so please avoid people who have gone deep in one area (like Application security, or pentesting) without also working on or building new tools before.

Avoid candidates who have gone deep only on detections workflows (these are mostly reactive, finding and triaging potential attacks.) We're looking for engineers with experience on the proactive/policy implementation side

company.teamAbout: Method Security is co-founded by Sam Jones, Daniel Kelly, and Sean Hacker, who all previously worked at Palantir.

* Work on general backend systems, including indexing, relaying, monitoring and more for our prover network

We are looking for a strong generalist who is comfortable across all parts of the stack, ranging from infra, backend to being able to quickly pick up new technologies and frameworks.

company.name: Succinct
company.description:
ZK proofs are one of the most critical technologies to blockchain scaling, interoperability and privacy, but are too complex for most developers today. Succinct’s mission is to make zero knowledge proofs accessible to any developer.



[<u>SP1</u>](https://blog.succinct.xyz/introducing-sp1/) is a state of the art zkVM with performance that rivals custom ZK circuits that lets developers use ZK with normal programming languages, like Rust. The [<u>Succinct Prover Network</u>](https://blog.succinct.xyz/succinct-network/), under active development, is a hosted infrastructure layer for any application to outsource proof-generation for open-source proof systems.

Today, top teams in the space, including [<u>Celestia</u>](https://blog.succinct.xyz/blobstreamx/), [<u>Wormhole</u>](https://wormhole.foundation/blog/wormhole-foundation-succinct-ethereum-zk-light-client?ref=blog.succinct.xyz), [<u>Lido</u>](https://research.lido.fi/t/zk-lido-oracle-powered-by-succinct/5747/7?ref=blog.succinct.xyz), [<u>Avail</u>](https://blog.succinct.xyz/vector-x/), [<u>Near</u>](https://alpha.succinct.xyz/near/near-light-client?ref=blog.succinct.xyz), and [<u>Gnosis</u>](https://forum.gnosis.io/t/gip-57-should-gnosis-dao-support-research-of-a-zksnark-enabled-light-client-and-bridge/5421?ref=blog.succinct.xyz) are using Succinct’s infrastructure to build with ZKPs. We have a track record of shipping excellent products and cutting-edge technical work in ZK and have significant revenue from our customers.



We recently announced our [$55 million raise](https://twitter.com/SuccinctLabs/status/1770843544388771914) across our Seed and Series A led by Paradigm, the best investor in crypto. Our team is still small but incredibly strong, and we are looking for exceptional people who are excited to work hard on challenging and impactful problems in a fast-paced environment. Our office is located in San Francisco and we have a strong preference for candidates based there for this role, but are open to exceptional remote candidates.
benefits: Above-market salary and generous equity compensation
Health, dental, and vision insurance for employees and their dependents
Lunch and dinner provided at the office
Optional, company-paid travel to events and conferences
company.teamAbout: We are a small, highly-technical team based in San Francisco, that ships high-quality code at the frontier of ZK.

name: Senior Cryptography Engineer
description:
We are looking for an experienced cryptography research engineer to join our team to continually improve SP1 and maintain its position as the most performant zkVM. In this role you will:

* Identify and improve any performance bottlenecks in SP1 (at the software or proof system level)
* Design new algorithms and arguments at the proof system level that improve performance
* Keep up to date with the latest advances in proof systems (reading papers) and analyze their tradeoffs with SP1 in mind.

You will spend some of your time reading the latest research and producing new research, and some time coding and prototyping ideas alongside the rest of the ZK team. We are looking for someone with a deep understanding of cryptography as well as sufficient coding ability. Check out SP1 here: [https://github.com/succinctlabs/sp1](https://github.com/succinctlabs/sp1)

requirements.description: Prior experience developing ZK proving systems and/or zkVMs
Very strong mathematical and cryptography background and deep knowledge of different proof system families (especially STARKs/FRI)
At least basic familiarity with Rust and/or another programming language used in implementation of new ZK proving systems
Familiarity with optimized systems programming and VMs
Strong grasp of Rust
Degree or coursework in Math or CS from a top-tier university

responsibilities: Identify and improve any performance bottlenecks in SP1 (at the software or proof system level)
Design new algorithms and arguments at the proof system level that improve performance
Keep up to date with the latest advances in proof systems (reading papers) and analyze their tradeoffs with SP1 in mind.

For candidates with less experience, they should have an extremely strong background in math contests or competition programming (or otherwise shown signs of technical excellence).

We don't care much about years of experience as much as experience with relevant work in cryptography OR extremely strong raw intellectual and technical horsepower.
recruiting_advice:
Candidates with the following backgrounds usually do well:

  • Prior experience and sign of excellence at prior crypto company with a focus on cryptography

  • Extremely strong math contest or competition programming background, or math/CS PhD background

  • Prior experience in cryptography (either academic training or relevant industry experience)

  • High trajectory background from top-tier school (Stanford, Harvard, MIT, Princeton, etc.)

Co-founders Alex (CEO) and Tennison (CTO) met in San Francisco and started building Truewind in November 2022. Alex is a 2x YC founder and ex venture capital investor. Tennison has spent 10+ years building software at Flexport, Pinterest, and Alibaba.

Founded on the heels of ChatGPT, we are in a unique position to rethink accounting and finance workflows from the bottom up. Using the latest generative AI technologies, we’re building an AI-native copilot to enhance accountants & financial analysis everywhere.

Now is an exciting time to join — in 6 months, we have 40+ venture-backed startups as paying customers, a small yet mighty team of 7 people (2 engineers), and over $3M raised from Y Combinator & Fin Capital.

We're looking for three Full Stack Software Engineers - the majority of their work will likely focused on our consumer job search product at [https://bandana.co](https://bandana.co), but we're also looking for engineers with experience building self-service SaaS products. Marketplace experience is a plus!

This is a senior role, but we focus on impact and potential for growth more than years of experience. The ideal candidate will be self driven and cares about good engineering practices as well as someone who cares about building for every end user, including those with lower end devices.

We're a series A startup, please keep that in mind when communicating with candidates about comp expectations - make sure we aren't engaging with a candidate simply because they want a competing offer.

At least one of the candidates should have significant infrastructure experience, and ideally two candidates should have a strong frontend focus.

Lack of complex work. We'd like to avoid candidates whose work primarily comprises one-off frontend features. Look for large projects that involve both ends of the stack driven by a business need

Backend only candidates. A candidate with a strong focus on backend is fine as a second hire, but our first hire needs to be frontend focused (will update here once we've made that hire). We also wouldn't take a candidate that never does frontend work.

company.name: Bandana
company.description:
Bandana exists to improve the livelihoods of hourly workers through transparency and trust, starting with finding better jobs.

The broader vision? Re-ignite the belief in the “American Dream” for workers. Specifically, the American promise that hard work can lead to success — and that this applies to all, not just the privileged few.

We seek people who:

  • Lead with Head AND Heart: Smart isn’t enough. At Bandana, we want people who care deeply about the everyday Americans that we serve.

  • Have Informed Opinions (Loosely Held): We have the conviction that building for workers first is the key to our success. Not everyone agrees. We are building an opinionated product For the People — we want to hear yours.

  • Grow Through Action: We learn by doing. This takes time, energy, and in-person investment. Restoring the American Dream is not a 9-to-5 job.

  • Want to Work On What Matters: At Bandana, we work on challenging problems that make a real difference for real people.

Learn more about our company vision here, coverage on Techcrunch here, and check out our current product at bandana.co/search.
company.teamAbout:
We're a small team that values being scrappy and driven. We're almost always in person, but flexible with travel and vacation days.

    • Caleb Lee - COO / Co-Founder

    • Vicky Xu - Founding Product Designer

    • Emily Dich - Founding Engineer

  • See What is Bandana - About the Founding Team for more details
