name: Product Security Engineer
description:
With over $100M in funding, and backed by investors like a16z and Sequoia Capital, Hex is changing how people use data by building a collaborative, shareable analytics workspace.

We are looking for a Product Security Engineer to join our team. They'll own the SSDLC and ensure effective security measures are embedded throughout. They'll build systems and occasionally build/buy tools that help all of Engineering truly shift left, so they can spend less time chasing vulnerabilities and more time on meaningful security engagement. 

This role also includes practicing embedded security within Eng teams, teaching them to think through, prevent, and mitigate common security issues all on their own: everything from creating guardrails to implementing AuthN / AuthZ correctly, to creating secure and resilient infrastructure as code. The security culture they will help create will permeate the entire company. This person will inform the company’s security roadmap, starting with the construction of high-speed, automated, and self-service security strategy.

Paraform is our primary funnel for this role, so please make this a top priority!

requirements.description: Deep understanding of software-security principles and a good understanding of cloud-infrastructure security principles
Hands-on experience with many of the core infrastructure products that Hex is run on, including Kubernetes, AWS, and Terraform
Proficient at threat modeling and keeping the models updated
Excel at working with several different engineering teams and codebases, and at communicating with engineers and non-technical partners across many different backgrounds
You perform code reviews regularly
Experience scaling and optimizing a bug-bounty program with a good signal:noise ratio
Involvement with your Security Community
Interest in the data space, and a love of shipping great products and building tools that empower engineers and users to do more
Writes clean code and and loves creating automations

Able to break down a landscape of scattered security problems, whether complex, simple and/or varies, and group them into logical, achievable components to get the most bang for the buck during quarterly and annual planning

responsibilities: Application Secruity
Cloud Security
Product Security
Threat modeling
Code review
Security design review
Secure-coding training
Appsec vulnerability management
Pentesting
Running and evolving our Bug Bounty Program
Streamlining our product authorization model
Optimizing access control company-wide
Hardening our Kubernetes deployments
workPlaceText: Hex is remote-first, with a flexible work-from-anywhere policy. SF-based is a bonus
visa_text_more: Must be a US citizen or permanent resident
experience_info: in product security (4 years in appsec, 1 in cloudsec)
recruiting_advice:
Hi! Thanks for helping us search for a stellar Product Security Engineer. We're looking for someone who specializes in application security, but has also had exposure to cloud security (like 80/20 appsec/cloudsec). 



This person will be our second-ever Security hire (current security team is a team of 1!) and will have immense impact on Hex's security program and capabilities. 



They will need to be quite senior (at minimum 5 YOE, ideally more) and the ideal candidate will have a developer/coding background. This person will need to be able to sit shoulder-to-shoulder with our engineers and teach them how to write secure code, which also means communication skills will be highly important. 



Some key words to look for that are green flags in profiles include:

* Application Security / appsec
* Threat modeling
* Code review
* Security design review (or similar wording)
* Secure coding, secure-coding training
* OWASP membership or speaking opportunities in their profile
* Code scanning, dependency scanning, application vulnerability testing / scanning --> this is appsec vulnerability management, pen testing, bug bounty
avoid_traits: Bad communication skills (need to be able to teach our developers secure coding)
Too heavy of a focus on Infra or CloudSec (need to have heavy App/ProdSec experience)
Wanting to be in a research-heavy role

company.name: Edvo
company.description: At Edvo, we care deeply about helping people think well.  We believe the next revolution in computing will be Personal Intelligence and Intelligence Augmentation — the same way everyone has a personal computer (now multiple personal computers), we have a thesis that everyone will have a personal database that augments them wherever they are, on whichever device they use.
company.productDescription:
We're starting by helping each of us break out of tab hell, and break into digital spaces designed for thinking and flow.

We're creating the next generation tools for interpersonal computing, to help us make better sense of information and transform passive consumption into active thinking.

Similar to how designers have Figma and musicians have visual interfaces to interact intimately with their work, we'd like to give each of us the ability to interact intimately with our thoughts and knowledge.

We think of the interface as being like a game – where people can construct, navigate, and collaborate in their universes of knowledge. In a nutshell, we believe it's important to break out of expectations of the "traditional" application UI – where everything is rectilinear, transitions between views work a certain narrow way, and relationships are static.

You’ll have a prominent voice in all product design decisions, while working closely with highly collaborative and cross-functional team members to plan, design, and implement.

Given the nature of the problem, our product is large and we are still building basic, critical “table-stakes” functionality. Basic does not mean that these functionalities are not complex.
company.teamAbout:
We're a lean team of seven and remote. We maintain core working hours of 9:30AM to 3PM Pacific, when we're all online and available at the same time. We strive to be clear in our communication and our foundation is based on trust and self-agency.

We're building a team of empathetic and thoughtful individuals who care deeply about how we all think, collaborate, and create. Our current digital environments favor passive consumption, not critical thought, yet billions of people are online to learn, create, and understand the world better.

name: Software Engineer
description:
The products you’ll build will help freight brokers and trucking companies win more business and seamlessly execute freight. Freight brokers use Vooma today for quoting and order entry. Our quoting automation product enables lightning-fast workflows for responding to requests for quotes from shippers. Our order entry product automates the process of building loads that have been won. These are just the first of many critical skills that we’re building into the Vooma Agent.



Vooma is backed by top-tier investors and CEOs, founders and executives from Nolan, Arrive, MoLo, NFI, Convoy, Uber Freight, Motive, Loop, OTR Capital, Project44, Trucker Tools and more. Vooma has enterprise contracts with many of the largest freight businesses in the US.



This is a rare opportunity for you to join a talented and experienced team at the ground level to build a transformational company for a critical industry.



The development of large language models have created a unique period in history where many things that were previously not possible are now possible. Every industry, including logistics, will be transformed by this generation of AI.



At Vooma, you’ll harness the power of LLMs to transform the way freight is executed. You’ll work with us to combine the latest technologies in computer vision, natural language and process automation to build stunning products and experiences for logistics professionals that weren’t previously possible.



You’ll work with a modern web and AI stack (Next.js, GraphQL, Node, OpenAI, Anthropic) and you’ll code primarily in Typescript and Python.

requirements.description: Experience building products with LLMS and AI
Previous experience at a top hypergrowth startup or early team of a VC-backed startup (\<10 employees)
Expertise in cloud infrastructure platforms like AWS, Azure, GCP
Implemented and maintained frontend and/or backend technology stacks through multiple stages of growth
Built and scaled web-based products before

responsibilities: Designing and implementing automation pipelines, along with the data and processing infrastructure to scale with our customers
Working with customers across logistics to understand their needs, and design the tools that enable the workflows of the future
Working closely with the founders to design, hire, and build the company from seed to success

**Please note** that we have not announced our Seed fundraise with Index Ventures yet. We’re comfortable with you sharing verbally with candidates but please do not post anything that mentions Index / our seed on any public pages.

It's often useful to inspire candidates about logistics by pointing out that every physical thing they use today almost certainly got to them on a truck. Working in this space you touch so many lives.

It can also be helpful to point out that the big buzz in the VC world now is AI for Verticals. This has been our thesis since before it was the buzz, and (the way it's playing out) it's looking like the right bet!
avoid_traits: Unclear communication, lack of drive, affinity for big-tech / cushy roles
Pure managers / architect types. We need people who want to be hands-on

company.name: Vooma (YC 23)
company.description: Vooma’s mission is to automate America’s $800BN trucking industry. Everything we touch in the physical world is moved on a truck - it’s the backbone of the US economy. Yet logistics today is still extremely manual. At Vooma, you’ll help us to build the co-pilot for logistics and automate everything but driving the truck.
benefits: The rare opportunity to join a formidable team to build an enduring company, in person, as a first 10 employee
company.teamAbout:
### **Jesse Buckingham**

Jesse is a co-founder of Vooma, a back office automation platform for logistics.

Prior to Vooma, Jesse partnered with private equity fund Alpine Investors to grow a logistics technology business from $2M to $20M+ ARR and put it on track for a 5-7x+ MOIC. He earned his MBA from Stanford GSB and was a consultant at Bain & Company.

Jesse is a father, husband, avid outdoorsman, fitness enthusiast, and voracious consumer of interesting ideas and literature.



### **Mike Carter**

Mike is a co-founder of Vooma, a back office automation platform for logistics. Before Vooma he built self driving trucks at Kodiak Robotics, Uber ATG, Otto, and Stanford's Dynamic Design Lab. He's passionate about pairing rigorous engineering with next-generation automation technologies to drive efficiency in logistics.

name: Software Engineer (Developer Experience)
description:
You will be a Founding Software Engineer focused on Developer Experience to improve how developers understand and interact with Rye's APIs.

Our ideal candidate is an experienced Full Stack Software Engineer passionate about contributing to the codebase, creating engaging demos, and writing documentation - primarily solving developer usability problems through software solutions. This role is suited for someone who loves solving developer problems, infusing creativity into their work, and has a strong sense of API design. We expect this role to be 60% developing software and 40% working directly with our developer customers, the internal engineering team, and the business team.

Joining our fully remote team, you'll have the chance to use your technical expertise to enable developers to integrate faster and shape the future of Rye's API. Your contributions will be crucial in improving how developers understand and interact with Rye's APIs. An example is building new SDKs and boilerplate examples for Rye.

Our systems are built around internet commerce: product data, order placement, tracking orders, returns, and inventory. We use best-in-class tooling - GraphQL API Gateway, gRPC for service to service communication, Typescript Node.js services built with NestJS. We use React and Remix for the frontend.

requirements.description: Strong understanding of best practices in software development and engineering
Good taste in API design
Background in writing technical docs or a portfolio of written content (e.g. personal blog, published articles) with a strong interest in helping developers succeed
Strong ability to craft clear and compelling technical narratives
Adept at simplifying complex technical topics for a broad audience
Experience building systems with a GraphQL API and a gRPC backend system
Passion for helping people develop an accurate mental model of how our technology works
Ability to quickly build a rapport and become a trusted advisor

responsibilities: Build high-quality APIs and SDKs for our developer customers
Collaborate with the internal engineering team to simplify the API and develop features that enhance developer experience
Create boilerplate examples and SDKs for various programming languages to help developers get started with Rye quickly
Act as customer zero, ensuring our documentation meets the reader's needs and enhances their experience using our products
Create high-quality, engaging, and clear documentation that effectively communicates complex technical concepts
Build scalable demos and tools to showcase the functionalities and use cases of Rye's products
Utilize exceptional storytelling skills to articulate the value and intricacies of our technology to a diverse audience
Collaborate with various teams to enhance the developer experience
Deliver exceptional and proactive developer support
Work independently with a remote-first team

We’d like someone with strong customer and product thinking and this candidate should be passionate about developing clear, thoughtful documentation to articulate complex concepts. The ideal candidate will have a background in writing, technical writing, and a strong portfolio of written content (e.g., personal blog, published articles).

name: Full-Stack Engineer
description:
As a Full-Stack Engineer at Axle, you will be helping design our core platform, working closely with the founders to make key product decisions, and building cool tech for our customers as we enable the future of transportation.

We’re excited to launch Beacon, an AI-powered assistant to manage the overwhelming amount of emails and tasks that operations teams in logistics companies manage in order to keep our supply chain running. You will play an enormous role in shaping Beacon and making it a success!

Your role will include architecting and building user experiences around large language models and automated workflows while keeping it all understandable for a human-in-the-loop. You will also build and design the core infrastructure around our AI and application tooling.

Finally, you will help build a repeatable and consistent process for onboarding new customers and getting them up and running quickly!

Our current technology stack is in Go, React, and AWS. And we’re a remote-friendly company with folks in Boston and New York City.

requirements.description: Experience building full-stack web applications with Go/Python, React/Typescript, AWS and other infra tools
Experience with observability tools
Experience engaging with product users
Experience around the logistics industry
Experience building distributed backend systems

responsibilities: Help structure and shape core tenets of the product
Exhibit thought and technical leadership
Design and build repeatable, well-documented processes and code
Build full-stack user experiences for customers with a focus on the back-end, and designing distributed systems
workPlaceText: Remote-friendly company with folks in Boston and New York City
experience_info: as a software engineer
recruiting_advice:
Hi! We're a young, quickly growing startup and are looking for a full-stack engineer who's passionate about building great infrastructure, supporting engineers, and building products. We're so excited to see who you help us find!

We're a small team (3 engineers + 1 GTM person, 2 founders) and everyone is more or less involved in engineering. Our team is very tight knit, albeit remote. We have a chill and fun vibe, but all of us truly care about our customers.

We'd like a product-minded backend engineer. We want them to help us understand our roadmap and advocate for their ideas. They'll be comfortable designing distributed systems and architecture, scalability, maintainability, and reliability.

Ideally, I'd lean towards someone who's passionate about startups and small teams. We want an engineer's engineer - someone who just loves to build! Given the option between someone senior and someone passionate, I'd take the passionate candidate.

I also really would hesitate to work with someone who's used to big companies. We don't have a burnout culture - work life balance and flexibility really matter to us - but we have a lot to build and have ambitious deadlines.

Finally, a strong written communicator is critical. We are a remote team and writing/documentation is very important.

Thank you so much!
avoid_traits: Poor/Unclear Communicator
Ambivalence about startups or Axle itself
Attraction to particular buzzwords
Arrogance

company.name: Axle API
company.description:
At Axle, our mission is to make it easier to use data to build a better future for transportation and logistics. In the US, 70% of all goods are moved by trucks in a $1T industry. But with supply chain breakdowns, rising fuel prices, and labor shortages, business-as-usual isn’t working for anyone. Truckers are struggling and everyday Americans aren’t getting the goods they need.

We’re helping fix our supply chain by building core infrastructure that enables innovative solutions.

Axle is a universal data platform that combines data from hundreds of disparate sources from telematics providers, sensors, and more to enable new technologies in a critical industry.

We’re wrangling different data sources into a universal schema so that innovative tech companies can build new ways to optimize deliveries, reduce fuel costs, and make trucking a well-paid and sustainable career for the hardworking folks on our roads.

company.name: Amber
company.description:
While interest in electric vehicles is at an all-time high, new EVs are still out of reach for most consumers, even with the support of government incentives in policies like the Inflation Reduction Act. High consumer demand and costs of battery materials continue to keep prices high and constrain available inventory.

If new vehicles are so expensive, why not embrace used EVs? The used EV population is poised to explode, presenting an affordable option for more consumers looking to make the leap to electric. However, used EVs come with their own problems — batteries lose capacity over time and replacement costs for out-of-warranty repair on EVs can be explosive.

This is where we come in — at Amber, our mission is to keep electric vehicles on the road longer by building technology-enabled protection, support, and infrastructure for second, third, and even fourth-hand EV owners.
company.teamAbout:
Amber is a seed-stage startup with experienced founders (e.g., Samsara, Metromile, Square) backed by world-class investors, and we’re looking for others who are passionate about the EV future to join us in our mission to accelerate the transition to a cleaner future of transportation.

With the used EV market poised to explode, we think this is the perfect time build these products and services — picks and shovels to ensure that our investment in EVs can be maximized and kept on the road as long as possible.

While ideal teammates will have experience in insurance, automotive, and software, we encourage you to apply even if you aren’t an exact match for a posted position. We value passion, willingness to learn, and diversity of perspectives and would love to hear from you if you think you could be a fit! Amber is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes candidates of all backgrounds.

name: Product Manager (India-based)
description:
We are looking for an experienced Product Manager / Sr. Product Manager to join our product team **in India** to help lead Aspire through an exciting period of growth. As a Product Manager, you will define and contribute to the strategic vision and own the long-term roadmap for major suites of the product. You will use your customer obsession, product domain expertise, and ownership to lead products and teams through strategic and technical ambiguity to ultimate success. You will be responsible for aligning multiple teams and stakeholders, work closely with designers, engineers, marketing, and customer success and more to deliver value to our customers and business. 



As Product Managers, we are responsible for guiding products throughout the execution cycle - from discovery to feature definition and prioritization, product messaging, go-to-market strategies. We are also responsible to make appropriate tradeoffs to optimize time-to-market and technical and business outcomes, communicating goals and KPIs, and desired outcomes. You have a proven track record of product management, experience driving strategy, and influencing executive leadership. The ideal candidate is a self-starter, approaches complex business questions with data and curiosity, is technically minded, and loves to dive below the surface to identify the root cause and help drive a path forward. 



The role will report directly to the SVP of Product and Design.

requirements.description: Demonstrated ability to define a user-centric long-term strategy supported by clear tactics and milestones
Strong UX/UI sensibility  - a keen sense of design and bar for high quality UX and the impact it can have on customer outcomes
Strong experience with data, analytics, and making data-informed decisions
Strong prioritization and organizational skills. Excited by the idea of managing multiple responsibilities at once and ruthlessly prioritizing the highest impact work
Work in a DTC (Direct to Consumer) experience or marketplace solutions would be a bonus

**Clear and effective communication to align outcomes with product priorities**

* *Listens to customer and internal feedback and advocates for customers within their focus area*
* *Actively drive capability readiness and strategic insights for internal teams to help scale adoption and net impact / ROI for customers*
* *Active stakeholder in all aspects of product including product marketing, pricing, & packaging*
* *Actively participates in other teams’ PRD and design reviews, suggests process improvements and helps make the overall product and team better.* 
* *Actively socialize any gaps/delays/conflicts to ensure visibility to appropriate stakeholders as necessary*
* *Design and build the focus areas with customer empathy at the core*

**Owner of product execution & success for their area of focus**

1. *Clearly define and OWN the end to end capability delivery with clear communications with engineering, product marketing, sales and other functions to build and land product innovation.*
2. *Able to breakdown complex customer problems in a clear way for their team and define a series of projects that will solve these problems*
3. *Can manage large scale initiatives that require multiple projects to be executed in order to succeed*
4. *Trusted to identify metric goals (around growth, adoption, and ROI for customers) that drive success for their team and the customer outcomes that matter. Constantly and proactively analyzes data to create insights on how to grow adoption and impact for customers.* 
5. *Continually communicate what’s being worked on, why the solutions matter for customers, and how it aligns with Aspire's goals with the rest of the senior leadership team and organization*

company.name: Ante Labs
company.description:
The vast majority of things attempted in crypto don't make sense, but a few things make a lot of sense. Ante works by enabling users to create verifiable onchain commitments with autonomous settlement. At scale, Ante can help keep the world honest, level the playing field for entering global commerce, and explicitly digitize trust.

Concrete crypto products like Uniswap, Maker, Compound / Aave, etc., have become "verbs" in crypto. That's because they actually are coherent with crypto's differentiating properties. Consequently, they make so much sense now that it's easy to forget that they weren't a part of crypto from day one.

The goal of Ante is to “verb-ify” a new primitive - an “Ante,” or a credible commitment - that, in retrospect, seems obvious. (“Tokenizing” as a concept seems obvious now, and swapping stems from tokens, but Uniswap didn’t become “a thing” until tokens were ubiquitous.)

company.name: Loma
company.description:
Loma is a "click-to-deploy" commerce enablement platform for online communities. Our technology allows any community to launch lightweight commerce rails for its members, including models like peer-to-peer marketplaces, sponsored classifieds, and directories. Technical co-founders (ex Instagram/Nextdoor + ex Wayfair/Zillow) are looking for a first hire to get in on the ground floor to reimagine how communities transact with each other, and enable them to capture the value they create.

We started Loma with a simple belief: communities should be empowered to own commerce amongst their members. The Internet is a near-infinite universe of self-organized affinity groups and organic niche communities. It allows us to find our own tribes no matter how small and esoteric they are. Yet, legacy business playbooks divert us to centralized platforms in order to transact (think Uber, eBay, DoorDash, et al).

We’ve dedicated ourselves to building a peer-to-peer commerce enablement solution for niche communities in automotive enthusiast, esoteric fashion, and sport fandom spaces, plus countless others. We recently raised a pre-seed round led by Lerer Hippeau based on strong demand for our solution from early pilot communities.

Truewind is AI-powered Bookkeeping and Financial Modeling for Startups.

Founded on the heels of ChatGPT, we are in a unique position to rethink accounting and finance workflows from the bottom up. Using the latest generative AI technologies, we’re building an AI-native copilot to enhance accountants & financial analysis everywhere.

Now is an exciting time to join — in 6 months, we have 40+ venture-backed startups as paying customers, a small yet mighty team of 7 people (2 engineers), and over $3M raised from Y Combinator & Fin Capital.

name: Founding Product Engineer
description:
As the Founding Product Engineer at Delphi, you will be responsible for bringing to life a beautiful, seamless conversational & learning experience for consumers, and an intuitive cloning experience for creators.

We are operating in brand new territory. There’s a lot of hype to AI, but the key to winning is building interfaces that abstract away from the core technology & focus on providing a magical experience for users. Design will be one of the major things that sets us apart, and we think about it in everything we do. You will work directly with the CEO & CTO to innovate on conversational interfaces & AI product experiences.

If you are passionate about our mission & making AI accessible through beautiful UX, this role could be a great fit for you.

requirements.description: Experience taking products from 0 to 1 with design and engineering
requirements.explanation: Strong focus on design and high customer empathy

requirements.description: Extensive experience in frontend development (React, Next.js, CSS, and TypeScript)
Past product management experience writing product specs, creating Figma mockups, and conducting user interviews
Previous experience launching consumer products at top VC-backed startups
Passion for great design and brand aesthetic
Previous startup founder experience a plus

workPlaceText: Everyone at the company is in person in San Francisco.
experience_info: building beautiful software products as a frontend engineer and product manager
recruiting_advice:
For certain candidates, since I would like to personally reach out myself and engage the candidate in my own way, I talked to the Paraform team and worked out these direction: [Read carefully]

  1. Recruiters will save all candidates in the extension, but not reach out

  2. I'll review candidates in the sourced tab, rate them as good or bad

  3. In the notes section for candidates I calibrate as good, I'll indicate if I want to reach out, or you as the recruiter should contact them

  4. For ones marked for recruiters, you can go ahead with your normal outreach and screening and can submit candidates to the Paraform inbox

  5. For ones marked for me, I'll take it forward and reach out myself

  6. Paraform will keep track of candidates that I've marked for myself, and will be in touch with me about who’s responded and in progress. Those that enter into the interview process will be submitted to Paraform officially and the recruiter who sourced the candidate will be able to take credit and candidate ownership.

More important than skillset & resume in an early stage startup is alignment.

What we care about:

  • Inherent Drive for Greatness

We approach this in every facet of our lives - work, health, integrity, relationships. There’s no such thing as perfect, but there is such thing as the constant pursuit of greatness. We keep each other accountable to this every day.

  • First Principles Thinking

You should have a good reason for why you are doing what you’re doing.

  • Anti-Mimeticism

Related to the above, you should not being doing things because of external hype. Your decisions ideally are made on your own understanding of the world around you. Everyone in AI right now is extremely mimetic - moving from one thing to another. We must focus and be grounded on the reasons that are driving our actions.

  • Customer Obsession

We appreciate individuals who create products that address real problems. They have empathy, and thus usually good communication skills. UX & design are top priorities in this company because we want the experience of using Delphi to be extremely delightful and intuitive for our users.

  • Good Quests > Bad Quests

We want to have a net positive impact on people’s lives.

  • In Person

The best company cultures, and relationships, are built in person.

  • High Velocity & High Quality

We are using velocity here intentionally. Speed is the absolute value of velocity - we want to move quickly but in the correct direction. We cannot sacrifice quality for speed - we must have both.

Who We're Looking For:

  • Outcasts & people with chips on their shoulders.

These are the people who feel like they still have something to prove. The people from non-traditional backgrounds. Those who think differently. Sam and I view ourselves as outcasts, and we are both heavily motivated to make this work. There is no plan B.

  • Ability to thrive in uncertainty.

We are building in the curiosity phase of a new technology. Things will constantly change, and you have to be ok, even relish, in the ups and downs and uncertainties of innovating in an entirely new field.

A company’s trajectory is baked in after the first 10 employees, so it’s important to us that we build a culture of people who are aligned upon the same values and mission. Obviously, we are early and things will change, but as long as we have a strong foundation, we can grow fast and tall in the long run.

An analogy I like to use: for the first couple of years of its life, bamboo stays under 3 feet. It builds a strong foundation so that in the future, it can grow incredibly fast in a short period of time. Right now, we are focused on building that bamboo foundation.

We're looking for someone to take on those challenges with Martian, both directly contributing as an engineer and leading the ML Eng team.

company.name: Martian
company.description:
Martian is doing for LLMs what Google did for websites. The number of models is exploding and it's hard to figure out what model you should use for what task. Martian fixes that problem through a model router: You give us your prompt, we run it on the best model in real time.

We can do this because we've learned how to predict the performance of a model without running it. That lets us find a model which can complete your request with the highest quality and lowest cost.

Model-routing is just the first tool we're building to help understand the way in which models behave. By pioneering techniques like this, we want to solve the most fundamental problem in AI: understanding why models behave the way they do, and creating guarantees they'll behave the way we want.

Our model router comes out of NLP research we’ve done since 2017. We have raised $9M from the likes of General Catalyst (Stripe, Airbnb) and NEA (Databricks, Salesforce). All of our sales have been inbound—we haven’t had to reach out to large enterprise customers, they have reached out to us for our product.
benefits: Publication of your work in top AI journals
company.teamAbout: The Martian team is a group of passionate, curious, and experienced individuals with deep backgrounds in AI. We have built products that were used by millions of users, and we have worked with several of the top tech institutions in the world.

name: Founding ZK Circuit Engineer
description: We are looking for a **Founding ZK Circuit Engineer** who will implement and optimize cutting-edge cryptographic code for zero-knowledge proof generation. You will be working on interesting and challenging problems necessary to make ZK accessible to smart contract developers. The role will involve both optimizing the prover and implementing novel ZK circuits. Your work will be critical in scaling Axiom to empower smart contract applications to trustlessly access more data and more diverse compute.

You are fluent in Rust, C++, or a similarly performant backend language. We work primarily in Rust and Typescript, but prior experience is not mandatory
You have a strong background in math/cryptography, or strong problem-solving skills and interest in zero-knowledge proofs.

recruiting_advice:
We're hiring one engineer for this role, with the two possible personas below. Please check with candidates if they are looking to join an early stage startup. I will chat a bit about how to do this in the intake call.

  • Archetype 1: Low-level performance -- this is a engineer with strength in designing performant systems. We care about an eye for latency and low-level development as well as some possible upside in working between our backend and zero-knowledge proof libraries. For the latter, we index on:

    • time in a high performance engineering environment like high frequency trading

    • problem solving skills as demonstrated by performance in IOI, IMO, ICPC, or equivalent.

  • Archetype 2: Computer architecture -- this is an engineer with experience working on low-level computer architecture interested in applying it in a new domain. Useful experience includes:

    • Experience with database backends

    • Working with ISAs like RISC-V or WebAssembly.

    • Experience with LLVM, MLIR, or related compiler technologies.

    • Experience with formal methods

company.name: Axiom
company.description: Axiom is using zero knowledge proofs to scale smart contract applications in a new way. Our recent V2 release on mainnet allows smart contracts to compute over the entire history of Ethereum in a fully trustless way. This is critical infrastructure to help blockchain applications scale and will empower developers to build novel decentralized applications with the power of ZK.
company.teamAbout:
Here is who you’d be working with: 

Yi: 

  • Did cutting edge research on probability and machine learning.  Professor at UChicago Statistics (on leave), MIT Math PhD, Harvard Math BA. 

  • Wrote some of the most performant ZK circuits for elliptic curve cryptography and Ethereum data reads (circom-ecdsa, zk-attestor, halo2-ecc).

  • Advised Gauntlet and Scroll and worked at an HFT startup from inception to profitable trading.

Jonathan:

name: Founding Smart Contract Engineer
description:
We are looking for a Founding Smart Contract Engineer to lead the development and deployment of the Axiom smart contracts which interface with off-chain ZK proofs. This will involve designing and implementing the on-chain API call interface, implementing smart contracts for custom integrations with partners, and implementing a Solidity SDK.  Your work will require implementing secure and efficient systems and making design decisions to empower developers using Axiom while maximizing security and auditability.

Your day-to-day work will involve extending and optimizing our core interfaces while supporting custom integrations we build with our partners on top of Axiom. We are looking for someone with knowledge of secure smart contract design patterns, empathy for smart contract developers, and a security mindset. We also value the ability to design tasteful and usable smart contract interfaces.

requirements.description: You have extensive knowledge of Solidity and the EVM
You have experience working with cross-chain bridges or rollups.
You have experience with auditing smart contracts
You’ve worked on a protocol with significant TVL, especially infrastructure related
You’ve earned bug bounties
You have experience writing extensive unit and integration tests
You have experience with developer tools for smart contract application developers (Hardhat, Foundry)
You have extensive knowledge of smart contract security and common pitfalls
You have extensive experience with proper deployment and security practices
You have developed a Solidity smart contract deployed in production on Ethereum mainnet or a rollup on Ethereum.

We're looking for a Founding Smart Contract Engineer to join our team at Axiom.

We're a small team of 7 (6 engineers) and thus far all smart contracts for our V1 and V2 launches have been written by one of the founders. We're looking to bring on our first smart contract hire to work closely with the founder in protocol design and implementation for future versions of Axiom. This role will also involve writing smart contracts for integrations into partner protocols.

This is a senior role, but we focus on impact and potential for growth more than years of experience. The ideal candidate will have implemented production EVM smart contracts using Foundry or Hardhat and be comfortable with cryptography concepts like Merkle trees, hashes, and signature schemes. Experience with cross-chain bridges or rollups is a plus, as is understanding of the broader crypto ecosystem.

We've found candidates with prior engineering experience outside of smart contracts to be good fits, while candidates who have only worked in defi have tended not to meet our bar.

name: Business Development Manager
description: Business development is a process of identifying and implementing new growth opportunities both internally and externally. At CyberConnect, the BD team is the sharpest spear, managing our ecosystem of over 2000 partners. This responsibility comes with various tasks that the BD team handles, including customer relations, identifying pain points, implementing solutions, strategizing on the direction of growth, expanding the pipeline, and following up with clients, among others.

requirements.description: At least 1 years of experience in web3 and crypto
Strong track record of driving product growth and exceeding sales targets
Previous experience at a startup or fast-paced environment in which you thrived in autonomous environments and worked proactively

responsibilities: Orchestrate and manage various BD initiatives across our different verticals, CyberConnect Protocol, Link3, CyberWallet.
Strategic Partnerships: Track and manage our key partnerships and the related customer pipeline to ensure that both partners are maximizing the ROI from the relationship
Client Engagements: Cultivate and nurture relationships with key clients, ensuring consistent communication and understanding of their needs and objectives.
Team Player: Works closely with various internal teams, serving as the primary point of contact for our partners and ensuring that projects are aligned with our business goals and standards.
Market Analysis: Stay abreast of industry trends, competitor activities, and market dynamics to inform and refine our strategic approach.
Making bold bets - build a close relationship with smaller projects with huge growth potential in early stage. Provide them support and build a win-win partnership.
workPlaceText: We're a full remote team but prefer candidates in the US (or at least close to US timezones)
visa_text_more: We're willing to sponsor visa for exceptional candidates
experience_info: in business development, and/or technical sales
recruiting_advice:
This is our first BD Manager, whose profile can be a reference point as we're open to hiring similar profiles (as well as different ones): [https://www.linkedin.com/in/ricky-wang-74b3a0194/](https://www.linkedin.com/in/ricky-wang-74b3a0194/)

To help with sourcing, we recommend you highlight our founder and investor background to potential candidates alongside our mission. I can provide more context below.

Co-founders & background: CyberConnect was co-founded by Wilson, Ryan, Shiyu, Zhimao in 2021. We are early believers in crypto, and a big part of our team is comprised of serial entrepreneurs. In 2018, the same early team built Lino blockchain as well as DLive.tv - the first and biggest blockchain-based live streaming platform. DLive had over 1 million daily active users and $3 million monthly revenue within 6 months’ of launch and was the exclusive streaming platform for the largest YouTuber Pewdiepie. DLive was acquired by BitTorrent in 2020.

Investors: At CyberConnect, we are backed by some of the best investors in tech and crypto: Multicoin Capital, Binance Lab, Animoca Brands, Sky9 Capital, Delphi Digital, Protocol Labs, IOSG Ventures, Lattice Capital, The Spartan Group, Polygon Studios, Tribe Capital, Hashed, GGV Capital, Amber Group, DraperDragon, UpHonest Capital, SevenX Ventures, Mask Network, Smrti Lab, INCE Capital and Folius Ventures. With a total funding of $25M, we are uniquely positioned to make a lasting impact in web3 social.
avoid_traits: Manager; talker; too comfortable

company.name: CyberConnect
company.description:
[CyberConnect](https://cyberconnect.me/) is a web3 social network that enables developers to create social applications empowering users to own their digital identity, content, connections, and interactions. We’re building a world where we have ultimate control over our digital lives, and meaningful, long-lasting connections aren’t decided by centralized or biased tech.

Join our team on our mission to create long-lasting on-chain connections through the power of our network.

With its brands [Link3](https://twitter.com/link3to) and [CyberWallet](https://twitter.com/thecyberwallet), CyberConnect is one of the fastest-growing startups in web3/crypto. We're building something special and are looking for true believers to join our team. We're looking for ambitious individuals with a thirst for knowledge that are interested in working with some of the most exciting and groundbreaking technology.

We eat lunch together as a team or get lunch credit if remote.
We hold team retreats twice a year!
We want people to take time off to rest and rejuvenate. We offer unlimited paid vacation.
You’ll receive all new equipment including a laptop, monitor, and any other accessories you need to do your best work.
company.teamAbout:
Join our team on our mission to change the future of social networking on the internet. CyberConnect is one of the fastest growing startups in web3. We're building something really special and are looking for true believers to join our team. We're looking for ambitious individuals with a thirst for knowledge that are interested in working with some of the most exciting and groundbreaking technology.

It’s not just another job here at CyberConnect. You get to work with a group of talented and passionate people. We build trust based on our strong belief of our mission and spending quality time together collaborating. Here are some photos from our US team’s retreat in Joshua Tree in 2022.

name: Software Engineer (Full-Stack)
description:
As a Full-Stack Software Engineer at Cleanlab, you'll: 

* **Pioneer novel software systems for the rapidly growing field of data-centric AI**. Our tools enable data scientists and engineers across all industries to effectively diagnose and fix issues in their datasets, thus improving the quality of their business’s core asset.
* **Work across the whole stack**, from UI to backend, end-to-end, building highly scalable and distributed solutions.
* **Develop new features and infrastructure** to support our rapidly emerging business and project requirements.
* **Work on interesting challenges** — novel interfaces for data visualization/interpretation and editing raw data directly — using a modern tech stack at a dynamic startup operating in one of the fastest-growing subfields of data science & AI.

requirements.description: Prior experience working with data scientists and ML engineers a big plus
Experience in our tech stack of React, JavaScript, Python, Flask
CS degree from a top university (MIT, Ivy League, Stanford, UC Berkeley etc)
Prior experience at a fast-growing startup or top tech company

responsibilities: Work closely with designers, cloud engineers, UI/UX designers, and product managers to implement full-stack solutions.
Deliver innovative, engaging web applications using the latest in both front-end and back-end technologies.
Collaborate with other engineers to build streamlined systems and help establish a strong engineering culture across the company.
workPlaceText: We are a hybrid company, we need candidates who can be in office at least a couple days each week. Office is in Mission District of SF
visa_text_more: We are willing to sponsor visas for the right candidate
experience_info: developing full-stack web apps shipping code to production
recruiting_advice:
\*\*Please do not disclose salary or equity with candidates during outreach or screening\*\*



Real full stack experience is needed, with knowledge how to connect the FE with the BE in the best way. Make sure the candidate is not "90%-10%" backend or frontend, but closer to 50/50
avoid_traits: job hopping

company.name: Cleanlab
company.description:
Everything we do at Cleanlab is guided by our north star – to improve the world’s ML data more easily and quicker than any other solution – enabling AI systems to train more reliably on real-world, messy, error-prone data. We develop next-generation data-centric AI, open-source algorithms and provide no-code SaaS enterprise solutions to help individuals and teams at companies (across all industries) diagnose/fix issues in their datasets and produce more reliable ML models by providing clean labels for training.

While many companies can help store/manage data or develop ML models, there exist few solutions today to improve the quality of existing data, which is the core asset of the modern enterprise. This is where you come in. At Cleanlab, you’ll be able to take ownership of critical projects that pioneer the future of data-centric AI.

We are a hybrid company, with over half of our team (and office) located in San Francisco.
benefits: Premium health insurance (+ dental and vision)
Professional development stipend to keep up with the latest innovations in ML and software.
Competitive salary (+ equity offering for certain roles), with regular opportunities for a raise if things are going well.
Relocation bonus to move to San Francisco
company.teamAbout: Prior to Cleanlab, our founders (3 ML PhDs from MIT) worked at OpenAI, Google, Microsoft, Amazon, AWS, Facebook AI Research (FAIR), Dropbox, Oculus, Palantir, NASA, General Electric, MIT Lincoln Laboratory, MIT, Harvard, and Stanford – at every place we worked we repeatedly encountered the same issue – AI solutions failed to work reliably on real-world, human-centric data due to label errors and poor data quality. So, we spent eight years of PhD research at MIT inventing a new field to solve this problem and after successful pilots with world-leading organizations, Cleanlab emerged.

recruiting_advice:
We're looking for a software engineer who will be a tech lead for our Sailebot team. This team is currently made up of 2 Mid-level engineers and 2 Junior-level engineers. This position is a leadership position, not people leadership, but technology leadership. They will not have any direct reports but will work closely with me, leading the team from a technical standpoint. 

The ideal candidate will be someone who is able to solve tough problems and level up the engineers around them. They will be comfortable diving deep into distributed systems and think holistically about architecture, scalability, maintainability, and reliability. They will spend the majority of their time in the code, either designing, coding, or reviewing it.

This candidate must understand that they are to be our rockstar developer; this isn't a position where they just architect and review code; they will be expected to code and be given challenging problems.

They are responsible for:

* **Architecture:** Design and help implement AWS serverless architecture (S3, Lambda, ECS)
* **Tech Design and team guidance:** Guide the team of developers how to approach a feature.
* **Development/Code:** Take on the tough code challenges and help other team members to overcome their challenges.
* **Code Reviews:** Review all PRs ensure code is of high qualify, readable, and testable, and following best practices.

name: Lead Product Designer
description: The senior product designer role conceptualises and brings to life an extremely high quality presentation experience to the world. In this role you will be working on the core product and will take end to end responsibility to ship key features that will be used by all of our users.

requirements.description: Passionate about storytelling, information design and/or presentation tools
Ability to run end-to-end Product Design - from insight to implementation
A world class product taste - an aligned and refined taste of what is good and bad when it comes to software
A developer or have engineering experience
Have strong inclinations towards certain styles but are not ideologically tied to a trend; naturally curious and willing to take a step to learn something you don’t have experience in
Experience on the development of the product - side projects are a huge plus!
Have experience in building creation tools
Drive a human-centered design process and work autonomously to plan and move work forwards
High level of visual design and interaction design capability including detailed prototyping and motion
Systems thinking - the ability to conceptualise solutions and interactions that work as part of a larger system.
Have experience building Real Time Collaboration (RTC) in a digital product

responsibilities: Design product experiences that balance vision, craft and meet user needs effectively and delightfully
Own design problems end to end, from concept through shipping and beyond
Craft every detail of new product features, including flows, prototypes and pixel-perfect execution.
Run projects end to end with the founder and engineering team to ship complete experiences
Create new patterns that are intuitive and evolve our design system intentionally
Obsess over visual design, motion and experience
Understand our users and define new opportunities for tools that keep our product on the bleeding edge
Collaborate with Growth teams to ensure our product solutions are represented effectively
Contribute to thought leadership and shape the design culture as a senior member of the design team by providing feedback, direction, and support
Evolve best practices for the design team
workPlaceText: Australia - can be anywhere in Australia. basically need someone between AUS - IND timezone.
experience_info: in product design, ideally 1-2 years in a top tier, marquee company
recruiting_advice:
• Past experiences that we value

    1. Creator tools (Social media, Presentation software is a plus)

    2. Productivity tools

    3. Design / Product / UX background

    4. Early stage product experience

    5. Product design agencies

  • Why join Chronicle?

    • Everything starts with a story. But storytelling tools hold people back today. We are solving this big and interesting problem that will impact millions of users changing the way people craft and tell powerful stories every day. We are passionate to help anyone deliver presentations that are not just bearable, but enjoyable.

    • We are a design led company with an appreciation of great product taste. Think of it as joining the next Notion, Figma or Linear. We offer an opportunity to build the next big productivity tool with some of the smartest people in the space.

    • Chronicle is built on incredibly nuanced, high quality insights about presentations. There might be other teams who can build products better than us - but nobody can make presentations like we do. That makes a huge difference in the long run.

    • In a world that chases vanity and capital, Chronicle is a refreshingly different take - a place where quality, attention to detail and craft take precedence over mindlessly rushing to build something.

    • We reject mindless and scrappy building. We do not settle. We solve problems first principles. We are not influenced by startups, trends, frameworks. We want to build something timeless.

    • We work flexibly and do not believe in driving work through forced accountability. We try to hire only the best and give them the flexibility and space to do their life’s best work at Chronicle.

    • We offer competitive salaries, significant ESOPs and have open and transparent conversations about your compensation. We do everything in our reach to ensure you are able to bring your best self to work each day.

    • Chronicle is in a powerful position with the runway required to build a world class product - backed by some of the best and most respected investors in the world - Accel and SquarePeg. We are fortunate to have the right people on this journey with us who understand that this is a long term bet

    • We reject mindless and scrappy building. We do not settle. We solve problems first principles. We are not influenced by startups, trends, frameworks. We want to build something timeless.
avoid_traits: Enterprises only experience (e.g. CBA, Woolies, etc.)
Only 6-12 month stints
We are not looking for cowboys/girls → no contractors, dev shops, freelancers
We are not looking for heroes/mavericks → need experience working with a team

We are not looking for someone to only shape the strategic direction of the product - while interest in this space is valued it will not be a core responsibility since we have clarity and validation on our roadmap
We are not looking for just people managers or hands-off designers. This is an IC role and the IC must be at the top of their game with a decent tenure

company.name: Chronicle
company.description:
Chronicle is a new presentation format that enables people to create impactful stories, effortlessly. With remote work, shortening attention spans, and the advent of generative AI, the world has changed. Chronicle is designing the presentation experience that the future deserves.

We’re not creating a better way to do slides or documents - we’re creating a powerful new medium that fundamentally reimagines the role of a creator and consumer of a presentation at work, empowering users to deliver beautiful and engaging output with less effort.
benefits: Compensation. We offer competitive compensation and benefits, including ESOP for all employees, and regular feedback and review cycles, and discretionary performance-based bonuses.
Flexibility: We work remotely but in sync and flexibly, empowering our people to do their best work when and where it suits them, and to live fulfilling lives outside of work.
Autonomy: We maintain a high performance culture, providing significant autonomy to our team to own and deliver high quality, creative output.
Benefits: We offer generous benefits including top-tier equipment and allowances for remote work, learning and development, and wellbeing.
company.teamAbout:
We are a team of 11 senior operators. Mayuresh and Tejas are the Founders, leading product and customer respectively. Chris G leads design and Chris J leads engineering. (Yep, we have two Chrises). Pavan, Harris, Aki, Anik and Praveen are senior developers and Pradeep is a senior designer. Max is our chief of staff and works with Tejas on all things customer.

We believe a small team works most effectively at the stage we are at. We are a small team of senior operators located across Australia and India, hailing from top tier companies and with a strong passion for storytelling.

name: Founding Engineer
description:
Decagon is building the most advanced conversational AI agents for the enterprise. Since starting the company, we've been on a tear, winning over customers like Eventbrite, ClassPass, Substack, Rippling, BILT, etc by creating generative AI agents to handle customer service and more. This Founding Engineer role will work with the founders to build a category-defining product and scale it to massive enterprises and high-growth startups alike.

We’re looking for someone who is excited by this challenge and the potential impact we can make if we do this right. You’re a product-minded engineer who thrives in a highly autonomous environment and enjoys working together with a highly driven, resourceful team to win. Shipping fast and building awesome things brings you fulfillment.

We're backed by a16z and based in SF.

name: Site Reliability Engineer
description:
We’re looking for an incredible site reliability engineer to help us build the future of blockchain scalability.

This is an ideal opportunity for an SRE who has experience or interest in running performative blockchain infrastructure, at scale. Caldera currently serves over half a billion requests per day, and secures hundreds of millions of dollars in value.

We’re backed by some of the best investors (Sequoia, Dragonfly, and others) and offer competitive pay, equity in the company, and full benefits.

requirements.description: Experience with high-performance networking, load balancers, and VPC
Experienced with cloud technologies, especially Kubernetes
Experienced in Linux and shell scripting
Knowledge of blockchains (especially Ethereum and Ethereum L2s), past experience running Ethereum nodes or similar in production
Strongly Preferred: additional ability in other scripting or programming languages (especially Javascript, Go, Python)
Customer-focused, with high empathy for both developers and end-users
requirements.explanation: Comfortable being on-call as the main point-of-contact for our customers during incident response

requirements.description: Passionate about working with engineers to make architectural decisions, codify best practices, and lead incident response
Requires strong knowledge of AWS, including expertise in its management and deployment services, to ensure efficient and reliable infrastructure operations.
requirements.explanation: Hands-on experience with cloud / infrastructure providers, including AWS, Vercel, and Cloudflare (if they don't have experience with vercel and cloudfare, it's not a deal breaker)

requirements.description: Past experience designing on-call and incident reporting structures and policies

workPlaceText: REMOTE-FRIENDLY ROLE: Unlike some of our other job postings, this is a remote-first role. No preference is given to candidates from a specific geography, and we’re excited to consider candidates from any international location!
visa_text_more: H1B transfers for employees already issued H1B visas at a different company F1 OPT (super, super easy) assuming they have enough time in their OPT for us to attempt to sponsor a more permanent visa, TN visa (NAFTA visa, Canada and Mexico), H1B1 (special visa only for Singaporean and Chileans), E-3 visa (Australians)
experience_info: in cloud infrastructure technologies and/or blockchain
recruiting_advice:
We’re looking for an incredible site reliability engineer to help us build the future of blockchain scalability.

They should be independent and opinionated, able to solve problems with no hand-holding

They should also actively look for ways to help out beyond the scope of your day-to-day work

They should also be comfortable being on-call as the main point-of-contact for our customers during incident response

This is an ideal opportunity for an SRE who has experience or interest in running performative blockchain infrastructure, at scale.

We also want to have someone who isn't just a brilliant engineer, but a great communicator, is comfortable with customer-facing responsibilities, and can help make architectural decisions with the rest of the engineering team. It's important that they have clear communication skills (written and verbal) to document new processes and architectures, and occasional communication with customers.

Here's more info about what we're building at Caldera: [https://calderaxyz.gitbook.io/caldera-documentation/getting-started/overview](https://calderaxyz.gitbook.io/caldera-documentation/getting-started/overview)
avoid_traits: Candidates without heavy Kubernetes experience or experience running blockchain nodes in production

company.name: Caldera
company.description:
Caldera enables dynamic, scalable blockchain experiences. Currently, dapps that are deployed to general-purpose blockchain compete with thousands of other applications for space on the network — this can lead to "https://www.coindesk.com/tech/2022/01/06/polygon-under-accidental-attack-from-swarm-of-sunflower-farmers/"

That’s where we come in. We’re building software that makes it easy for the most innovative blockchain applications to launch their own ultra-performant blockchains (rollups), enabling applications to own their ecosystem, scale to millions of users, and provide a superior user experience to their players.  

We’re located in San Francisco, and work in-person from the Financial District
benefits: Custom workplace setup (with monitors, peripherals, and accessories of your choosing)
company.teamAbout:
We're a bunch of passionate technologists who love to sink our teeth into interesting problems. We have a tight knit top tier team, previously tackling engineering problems at Google, Meta, Coinbase, and Jump Trading!

We’re backed by some of the best investors in the valley (including Sequoia and Dragonfly Capital) and offer competitive pay, an equity grant in the company, and full benefits.

We’re headquartered in San Francisco.

name: Founding Software Engineer
description:
Yendou is the first CRM designed to help R\&D teams at life sciences companies to scale and accelerate the allocation of cancer clinical trials in clinics, globally.

As our Founding Software Engineer, you play a key role in building the first AI Co-Pilot for Clinical Operation teams.

Your contributions will be key to Yendou’s mission to accelerate the drug delivery to patients in need!

requirements.description: Prior experience in LLM fine-tuning, evaluation, and/or prompting
Experience with Javascript or Typescript ideally also with a modern web framework such as React.js, Next.js, Vue.js or Angular
Experience at notable startup or CS degree from a strong university (ETH, TUM, Oxford, Cambridge, UCL, Imperial)
Excited to join an early-stage company and work in person

workPlaceText: This role is in-person at our office in Berlin!
experience_info: in tech or product-driven companies as a full-stack or AI Engineer
recruiting_advice:
Hey, 

we are looking for a Software Engineer that is a generalist and likes to build. Ideally the person has a background in GenAI/LLMs, building AI Agents/Co-Pilots.

At the moment we are a very small team (2 founders). Over the coming weeks we are going to hire one product designer, founder associate and an engineer, so we are going to be a team of 5.

The person should have the following background

* 3+ years of relevant experience at tech or product-driven companies
* Enjoys collaborating as a team in a fast-paced environment. You will work closely with our designers, CEO, and customers
* Moves and iterates fast. We like to get stuff done. We don’t spend weeks planning before we execute our ideas
* Experience with Javascript or Typescript ideally also with a modern web framework such as React.js, Next.js, Vue.js or Angular
* Experience building products/features using LLMs (that would be the ideal candidate)
avoid_traits: Wants to work 40h per week
Just wants to write code all day and not collaborate with other people
Work in a slow and steady environment
Wants to learn from senior people

company.name: Yendou
company.description:
**Yendou is the first CRM designed to help R\&D Teams at life sciences companies to scale and accelerate the allocation of cancer** [**clinical trials**](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Clinical_trial) **in clinics, globally.**

You might have heard this before: It takes 12 years and $800 million to bring a cancer therapeutic to the market.

**But you know what the outsiders don't know?**

More than 1/3 of this 12-year timeline (4.6 years) and 22% of the clinical trials costs are spent on the process of clinical trial allocation to clinics.

**To solve this problem…**

We are creating the first CRM for Pharma, like Salesforce, but with a list of ready-to-go qualified prospects. No more hunting for doctors or hospitals, now they are all on Yendou and companies can shorten the selection timeline by 12 months.

We just raised a €1.2 million pre-seed round, led by [b2venture](https://www.b2venture.vc/) to bring our product to the next level, and we are hiring our first 3 employees!
benefits: Financial and administrative support with your move to Berlin
Hardware of your choice with a budget of up to €3k
€300 monthly budget for services of your choice e.g. gym, UberEats, Headspace, etc.
company.teamAbout:
[**Zina Sarif**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/zinasarif/) **(Co-Founder & CEO)**

Former cancer scientist, with prior experience at **AstraZeneca** and **Parexel**, specializing in oncology site selection across Feasibility and Study Start-Up.

[**Patrick Rogg**](https://www.linkedin.com/in/patrick-rogg/) **(Co-Founder & CTO)**

M.Sc. in Computer Science, previously working as a Software Engineer at **Citadel, Google**, and **AWS** (Amazon Web Services).

**How we work:**

🏃 **We move fast**

At Yendou you will not spend weeks planning. We have bias for action. Most decisions can be reverted, so we rather get feedback quickly and iterate to arrive at the best solution.

🚫 **We like to focus**

We believe to do your best work, you need a low-distraction environment. We will work hard to make sure that everyone is given the tools and support they need to do their best work.

📝 **We work asynchronously**

We are big believers in asynchronous work. At Yendou you will spend little time in meetings, and a lot of time doing [Deep Work](https://www.amazon.co.uk/Deep-Work-Focused-Success-Distracted/dp/0349411905).

💪 **Small teams, Big Impact**

Small teams spent more time executing and less time coordinating. We rather have a small team of amazing people than a large team of average people.

experience_info: technical experience
recruiting_advice:
We're looking to hire exceptional people who want to join an early-stage company as one of the first few engineers.

Our values

We’re a small team with big dreams - and the culture we create is just as important to us as the product we’re building.

Here are a few things you can screen for:

📈 Growth oriented

Slope y intercept. We invest in people and grow team as the company grows.

Slope y intercept (please read!)

💚 Humility

Everyone has a lot to give and a lot to learn. We all come from different places and backgrounds, bringing unique perspectives and expertise.

🌟 Customer focused

We love our customers. We make decisions by focusing relentlessly on them - and accept if this means changing our ideas. Customer success is our success.

💡 Intellectual honesty

We believe that the best ideas should win and acknowledge when we are wrong.

👾 Hack to success

We move fast and take big swings. We always aim for a solution that addresses 80% of the problem in 20% of the time. We make educated bets, launch MVPs, and iterate.

🔥 Having fun

Be unapologetically you! We love our game-nights, ping pong tournaments, bufo emojis, and cow jokes (the CEO knows over 100 of them and TechCrunch made fun of him for it).
avoid_traits: High ego or low agreeableness - anyone who generally seems un collaborative or not interested in listening to opposing ideas.
Unless exceptional, not in SF

name: Founding Full-Stack Engineer
description:
We are looking for a motivated, dedicated and self-starting founding engineer to join Paraform.

This is more of a [product](https://posthog.com/blog/what-is-a-product-engineer) or [growth](https://posthog.com/blog/what-is-a-growth-engineer) engineering role rather than traditional software engineering in that we want you to have a lot of ownership in what you build

This is a full-stack role and we use a variety of modern technologies including Next.js, Vercel, Typescript.[](https://posthog.com/blog/what-is-a-product-engineer)

We're looking for our first Engineer and would work closely with the co-founders, especially the CTO (Jeff), to develop our core product of enabling a recruiter-driven marketplace.

requirements.description: Excited to join an early-stage company (second engineering hire)
requirements.explanation: Demonstrated interest in working at startups, either have worked previously, or are *super serious* about joining one. Could be early hire, or current engineer at a seed, series A or B startup

They should care about the product as a whole. That includes how to create a product with great design design, engineering, growth, and sales.

[https://posthog.com/blog/product-engineer-vs-software-engineer#how-are-product-and-software-engineers-different](https://posthog.com/blog/product-engineer-vs-software-engineer#how-are-product-and-software-engineers-different)

[https://posthog.com/blog/what-is-a-growth-engineer](https://posthog.com/blog/what-is-a-growth-engineer)

High energy, excited about the Paraform product and willing to hustle/work really hard

Shipped projects end to end

responsibilities: Lead development on our core product
Potentially be a manager and hire people on top of being an IC
Revenue and product driven engineer.
You will build and ship high-quality products quickly
Collaborate closely with product and the rest of engineering to deliver on our roadmap
Own end-to-end design and implementation of features including development, testing and release
workPlaceText: San Francisco: 2 Marina Blvd B300, San Francisco, CA 94123
experience_info: as a software engineer at reputable early-stage startups (Don't want candidates who are too senior or with too much big tech experience)
recruiting_advice:
We want to look for a highly product driven and growth focused engineer. 

**Type of person who will thrive here**
● Experience at a fast-growing, VC-backed startup -> Seed to Series A experience, pre-PMF
● Wants to write a bunch of code and ship a bunch of product
● Excited to jump in and work on all different types of features as long as they benefit our customers
● Can handle complex, ambiguous problems

**Type of person who will NOT thrive here**
● Big tech attitude -> likes stability, structure, 9-5
● Manager -> prefers managing as opposed to writing code
● Smart & slow -> likes to think through problems really deeply to ensure they get the right answer
● Excited and unfocused -> takes conversations in all directions

**What we value**
● We’re always shipping - fast, scrappy people thrive here.
● We’re obsessed with goals - we’re here to turn a small startup into a long-lasting company.
● We start with the customer - we all talk to users and work backward from their problems.
● We have an outlier output bar - we’re an intentionally small, highly effective team.

**Our tech stack:**
● NestJS backend
● Next.js frontend
● Postgres data stores

company.name: Paraform
company.description:
Paraform is a marketplace connecting companies with open roles and recruiters who can fill them.

Companies can work with specialized recruiters more cheaply, monitor their performance, and flex based on demand. Recruiters don't have to worry about acquiring clients while earning and working on their own terms.

Incredible teams at the most exciting startups and enterprises are being built as a result.

We power talent for a wide range of customers:

  • Enterprise - Palantir, Anduril, Scale AI

  • Growth stage - Eight Sleep, Character.ai, Applied Intuition

  • Early stage - Mintlify, Jenni.ai, Decagon.ai

We've raised money from:

  • Co-founders - Twitch, Doordash, and Eventbrite

  • VCs - A*, Soma Capital, Founders Inc, and Primer Sazze

  • Leadership - Palantir, Opendoor, Ramp, and Scale AI

Other highlights:

  • GMV/Revenue increasing 50% MoM

  • We just moved into a beautiful new office in North Beach. Check out video of it here
benefits: 🌉 Beautiful office with golden gate bridge view at the Fort Mason Center in San Francisco. Moving to North Beach soon and we think it's even better :)
🌏 Company Offsites (NY, LA, Sydney, Seoul etc)
company.teamAbout:
Hey 👋 we're John and Jeff, the co-founders of Paraform. Funnily enough, this all started when we tried to recruit each other in 2022. Ever since then, we've experienced first-hand how broken recruiting is and our mission is to finally fix it.

Our values and culture

  • We work hard and enjoy being together in person. We are transparent about our work ethic and expectations because it enables us to have extreme ownership in building at a pace that is unmatched.

  • Customers, customers, customers. We're customer-obsessed and always start with the customer first. We are the customer support team.

  • Ship fast and break things. We believe great products come from lots of experimentation, so we value fast development. No one is going to wait around for us to make things, especially something that's perfect.

  • Take care of each other. We trust each other and want to enable everyone to do their best work. That means an all food and transportation compensated, gym membership, unlimited PTO, global offsites, premium healthcare and a free bike.

Previous experience in a role doing cold calls and email outbound
requirements.explanation: We focus more on email outbounds but would be very interested to ramp up cold call outbounds

Demonstrated experience doing majority customer acquisition through outbound
requirements.explanation: converting in bound is not the most valuable to us as of now

requirements.description: Previous experience selling recruiting products or selling to talent teams

responsibilities: Be the first point of contact for organizations to learn about Paraform by sharing the value we provide to their recruiting requirements
Create qualified meetings and opportunities with new prospects who will become raving customers of Paraform in the future
Gain experience in outbound sales by using multi-touch cadences consisting of prospecting, email outreach, cold calling, LinkedIn social selling, and more, to build relationships with prospects
Innovate on current status quo of outbound marketing, collecting data and marketing
equity: Depends on the comp + open to discussing!

recruiting_advice:
● Were they a go-getter in college? Did they do the most challenging/exceptional thing they can in their capacity? Did they secure the hardest internships? Did they start a company?

● Were they interested in startups? You can assess this in a variety of different ways including: did they start a company? were they part of a startup club at school (e.g. dorm room fund)? Did they do a VC fellowship (e.g. Kleiner Perkins Fellowship)? Did they intern/work at a startup?

In the screening call, please screen for:

● is is clear that they're extremely smart?

● olympian work ethic - is it clear from their previous track record that they work exceptionally hard?

● bottomless energy = consistency - are they energetic (talk and think fast) and is it clear from their previous track record that they are a consistent performer?

● high ambition -  what is their goal? why is it clear that they want to achieve something exceptional very quickly

description:

You can expect to build integrations with third-party data sources to pull millions of records, build high performing SQL queries, write complex business logics, as well as occasionally work on scaling the platform.

requirements.description: Growth mindset that challenges the status quo and focuses on outside-the-box ideas and solutions

Hey! Very excited to start searching for founding backend engineers through Paraform.

This is a full-on IC role where you'll work with the founders directly in-person in SF, push new features every week and build one of the best B2B products out there

company.name: Atomus
company.description:
Atomus is a cybersecurity company focused exclusively on small businesses in the Aerospace and Defense industry needing to comply with NIST 800-171, DFARS 7012, and CMMC cybersecurity requirements.

We have major customers including the US Air Force, Defense Innovation Unit, along with aerospace and defense customers. 

We recently raised an investment from early investors in top tier companies like Snowflake, Robinhood, and Anduril among many others to scale Atomus to its full potential.
company.productDescription:
Atomus Aegis is our built cybersecurity software made for small businesses in the Aerospace and Defense industry. The system runs on computers, phones, and servers that handle defense data and configure these systems to the NIST 800-171 cybersecurity requirements.

Imagine if we shipped you a computer that was already compliant with the cybersecurity requirements in your contract out of the box. Our software configures your existing computer to this compliant baseline without the headache of buying new hardware or months having someone do this for you manually.

Once configured, Atomus monitors, maintains, and documents these systems to comply with DFARS 7012 and CMMC cybersecurity requirements.
company.teamAbout: Our team at Atomus is hardworking, move fast, and put our customers first!

Our ideal candidate thrives in ambiguous situations, has strong appreciation for operational excellence, and understands the nuances of delivering exceptional customer experiences.

Experience working with software tools including CRM systems, Google Drive
Valid driver’s license
