Excellent problem-solver, particularly in ambiguous situations
Excellent verbal and written communication skills

responsibilities: Define the operational flow for our first Amber Repair Center (ARC) location for battery remanufacturing and refurbishment.
Create and manage relationships with a network of parts suppliers: Tier 1 part manufacturers, aftermarket suppliers, salvage yards, and service centers.
Own site performance, setting and achieving targets while holding the team accountable.
Advising customers on additional services and products.
Create and manage a pipeline of talent for the site
Act as Amber’s brand ambassador with customers, the local community, and external partners.
experience_info: Professional work experience; preferably customer-facing; ideally in the EV industry
recruiting_advice:
**Tesla**:

* Tesla is a good place to source, but it's better to find candidates that have been at the company for a long time. 
* The earlier cohorts of Tesla employees have grit and have been involved with building the business, while more recent employees are more likely to have siloed knowledge and be individual contributors in a very specific role.
* Within Tesla, any business units related to used vehicles (re-marketing, Tesla parts) would be a good place to look. 



**Supply Chain Management and Operations**:

* Our advisor [Rob](https://www.linkedin.com/in/robert-l-b053225/details/experience/) has led supply chain management and operations at Asurion (a cell phone protection and repair business). This type of archetype could also be a good fit for us.
* "Responsible for the direction and leadership of the ProtectCELL Technology & Fulfillment Center including: logistics, product repair and refurbishment, warehousing, inventory management, equipment quality, material forecasting, demand planning, procurement, master scheduling, continuous improvement, supplier management, engineering, and P\&L."
avoid_traits: Presumptuous: inflexible, "know-it-all", "man-splainer", "stuck in the past".
Unprofessional: discourteous, late, unresponsive, disorganized, argumentative.
Reactive: poor at planning, makes the same mistakes over and over, slow learner.

company.name: Amber
company.description:
While interest in electric vehicles is at an all-time high, new EVs are still out of reach for most consumers, even with the support of government incentives in policies like the Inflation Reduction Act. High consumer demand and costs of battery materials continue to keep prices high and constrain available inventory.

If new vehicles are so expensive, why not embrace used EVs? The used EV population is poised to explode, presenting an affordable option for more consumers looking to make the leap to electric. However, used EVs come with their own problems — batteries lose capacity over time and replacement costs for out-of-warranty repair on EVs can be explosive.

This is where we come in — at Amber, our mission is to keep electric vehicles on the road longer by building technology-enabled protection, support, and infrastructure for second, third, and even fourth-hand EV owners.
company.teamAbout:
Amber is a seed-stage startup with experienced founders (e.g., Samsara, Metromile, Square) backed by world-class investors, and we’re looking for others who are passionate about the EV future to join us in our mission to accelerate the transition to a cleaner future of transportation.

With the used EV market poised to explode, we think this is the perfect time build these products and services — picks and shovels to ensure that our investment in EVs can be maximized and kept on the road as long as possible.

While ideal teammates will have experience in insurance, automotive, and software, we encourage you to apply even if you aren’t an exact match for a posted position. We value passion, willingness to learn, and diversity of perspectives and would love to hear from you if you think you could be a fit! Amber is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes candidates of all backgrounds.

company.name: Hightouch
company.description:
Hightouch’s mission is to empower everyone to take action on their data. Through our Reverse ETL platform, business and data users can seamlessly sync data from where it resides, such as warehouses and databases, to where it is needed, including operational systems and SaaS tools. Traditionally, acting on data has required engineering time and bandwidth, and left most business users stuck with charts and reports that are unable to take automated action on their data. With Hightouch, every business user, without writing any code, can activate data to streamline critical processes, improve marketing performance, and scale operations.

Our team operates with a focus on making a meaningful impact for our customers. We believe in approaching challenges with a first principles thinking mindset, moving quickly and embracing our value of efficient execution, and treating each other with compassion and kindness. We look for team members that are strong communicators, have a growth mindset, and are motivated and persistent in achieving our goals.

Hundreds of companies use Hightouch, including Spotify, Ramp, Retool, NBA, Plaid, and Betterment. We’re based in San Francisco, are remote-friendly, and backed by leading investors such as Amplify Partners, ICONIQ Growth, Bain Capital Ventures, Y-Combinator, and Afore Capital.
benefits: Core benefits (health, dental, vision, life insurance)
Connectivity ($50 per month cell-phone or wifi connectivity stipend)
Commuter benefits ($50 are offered to both employees who come into the offices and to remote workers working outside of their home)
Remote first (in-person meetings at our San Francisco and New York offices plus our annual company onsite.)
401k for our US employees and retirement plans for our international employees
company.teamAbout:
Our team operates with a focus on making a meaningful impact for our customers. We believe in approaching challenges with a first principles thinking mindset, moving quickly and embracing our value of efficient execution, and treating each other with compassion and kindness. We look for team members that are strong communicators, have a growth mindset, and are motivated and persistent in achieving our goals.

Our founders were early employees of Segment where they saw the transformative impact of enabling business and marketing teams to activate customer data. However, they also recognized the limitations of the existing rigid legacy Customer Data Platform (CDP) market.

By building a platform that could sit on top of an organization’s existing data infrastructure, our founders knew that teams could unlock a more performant, flexible and secure solution to activating customer data at scale - and thus, Hightouch was born.

name: Account Executive
description:
Account Executives (AEs) are the core of OneSchema’s go to market motion. As a full-cycle seller, you’ll be a trusted advisor to engineering leaders building out their data stack. 



Your primary responsibilities will include sourcing new business opportunities, running discovery calls with inbound prospects, deeply understanding their pain, and solving that pain with OneSchema platform. We want AEs with a hunter mentality who take ownership over filling their pipeline. 



This is an exciting opportunity for an ambitious account executive who wants to rapidly learn the skills needed to become a true sales leader. As the 2nd seller on our team, your responsibilities will span far beyond a traditional sales role. We want team members who will contribute actively to the existing playbooks and can build playbooks of their own to tackle new markets. 



This is a role for a salesperson who’s a builder at heart and wants to collaborate closely with OneSchema’s world-class product & engineering teams. You’re the voice of the customer, and will inform the new products we build and markets we enter. As an early member of a top seed-stage startup, you’ll get exposure to top Silicon Valley investors and engineering executives. You’ll be mentored by our accomplished sales advisors including VP of Sales at Airtable, Head of SMB at Notion, and Director of Sales at Webflow. 



The learning and growth opportunities in the role are immense. You’ll report directly to our CEO, and have influence over OneSchema’s top-level strategy. If you’re energized by the chance to have ownership and influence over a new and growing sales function, then we would love to talk to you.  



We have a collaborative, fast-paced in-person work culture. We’re based in San Francisco with team members coming into the office 3x/week.

We are seeking a Senior OS Engineer with a focus on Android-based systems. We're looking for someone with at least 5 years of experience in OS development, ideally with a background in working with the Linux kernel, Android Runtime (ART), and core Android frameworks. It's crucial that this individual has experience with hardware interfaces and custom Android distributions, as they'll be leading the development of low-level system components for our innovative products.

Given the advanced nature of our work, it's important that candidates have been exposed to high-quality OS development environments, preferably at leading B2C tech companies with a strong Mobile/Android OS focus. Experience at companies like Qualcomm, Snapchat, Niantic, Meta, Teenage Engineer, Rabbit Tech, or Microsoft's Mixed Reality team would be indicative of the level of expertise we're seeking.

Exceptional candidates would demonstrate experience in architecting and implementing significant OS features, such as memory allocation and process management, and have a track record of working on large-scale, complex OS projects. Their ability to mentor team members and contribute to a collaborative work culture is equally important.

company.name: Applied Intuition (Seoul)
company.description: Applied Intuition is a Tier 1 vehicle software supplier that accelerates the adoption of safe and intelligent machines worldwide. Founded in 2017, Applied Intuition delivers the definitive ADAS/AD toolchain and a world-class vehicle platform to help customers shorten time to market, build industry-leading products, and create next-generation consumer experiences. 18 of the top 20 global automakers trust Applied Intuition’s solutions to drive the production of modern vehicles. Applied Intuition serves the automotive, trucking, construction, mining, agriculture, and defense industries and is headquartered in Mountain View, CA, with offices in Ann Arbor and Detroit, MI, Washington, D.C., Munich, Stockholm, Seoul, and Tokyo.
benefits: Fitness (600 USD) and learning stipends (1,000 USD) annually
company.teamAbout:
**Accelerating the world’s adoption of safe and intelligent machines**

Applied Intuition was founded in 2017 to equip engineering and product teams with software that makes it faster, safer, and easier to bring autonomous systems to market. While the autonomy industry was thriving, there were no easy-to-use solutions to safely develop, test, and deploy autonomous systems at scale.

Today, we work with 18 of the top 20 OEMs across the globe and offer a portfolio of products. Our team is growing rapidly, and we’d love to hear from you if you’re passionate about moving the entire autonomy industry forward.

**Software and functional experts**

Our team has significant software and automotive experience with specialists in simulation, robotics, and autonomy.

**We’re a values-driven company**

Speed, customer orientation, raising the quality bar, and 'laugh a lot' are some of the values that make up the DNA of the team.

description:
As the company’s first engineering hire, you will shape the future of our company. Your work will directly impact the performance, scalability, and reliability of our platform, ensuring a seamless experience for our customers.

You will architect and execute innovative solutions, collaborating closely with the engineering and product executives to drive the technical vision and strategy of Verisoul.

Previous experience building and owning complex applications from the ground up

recruiting_advice:
We're looking for our **first engineer - core platform based remotely in LATAM**.

Not only should they meet all the requirements listed, but they will be the best fit if they share our values below. Please screen for this in your screening call:

● **All-in Optimism**: You’re all-in on the company’s and your personal growth. Building a world-changing startup is nearly impossible. You’ll have a steadfast optimism and energy that helps you push through challenges and accomplish the impossible, while having fun doing it.

● **Total Ownership**: You will individually own high-impact problems end-to-end. You’ll be both a self-starter and self-completer, combining structure that helps you know what to do next with execution and orchestration skills that help you get the job done.

● **First Principles Curiosity**: You’ll analyze problems with the curiosity of a beginner’s mind: challenging assumptions, rethinking the current way, and quickly testing new hypotheses. When working through ambiguity, you’ll focus on finding the best answer and learning something new - even if it means changing your mind.

**Helpful things you can share with candidates**:

**Our Growth Trajectory**:

We’re excited about Verisoul’s growth trajectory. In the last 16 months, we’ve:

● Developed a powerful platform that's already outperforming (and stealing customers from) established players like Fingerprint, Arkose Labs, Google, Cloudflare, and IPQS
● Grown to $100K ARR four months after launching
● Raised $3.8M to scale the team
● We can’t wait to go even faster as we grow the team.

description:

Joining Vellum this early means that you’re going to play a huge part in guiding both the business and cultural evolution of the company. 

Together, we’re going to face the hardest sales challenges this journey has to offer and build the sales function from the ground-up. As the team grows, you’ll be the battle hardened expert that everyone looks towards for guidance.

With great power comes great responsibility 🙂

Our sales cycles run 15-45 days and you’d need to run multi-threaded conversations with executives, engineers and business audiences
You’d also coordinate discussions with legal/procurement/security as part of the sales process
Building your own pipeline to supplement inbound
You’d experiment with outbound tactics like email, social selling (LinkedIn/Twitter etc.), ABM, events etc. to build more pipeline and help us grow faster
Your own pipeline is expected to be 20-30% of your monthly quota
Partnering with the CEO to standardize sales processes
We would figure out together how to streamline discovery, demo, objection handling
We’d negotiate favorable pricing and business terms with our customers by selling business outcomes and quantifiable value. We’re continuously experimenting with ways to drive up ACV
Collaborating closely with the rest of the company
Marketing: Close partnership to determine which channels are working and how to get more inbound leads
Product & Engineering: Serve as voice of customer and share what prospects are looking for to inform the roadmap
Serving as a cultural pillar of the team

recruiting_advice:
Looking for candidates who have sold products to technical teams is the #1 priority for the role. AI/ML experience is #2

Some things you can can share with candidates:

**Company info, fundraising, and team**: https://www.paraform.com/company/vellum-(yc-w23)

**What's it like working at Vellum?**

● We’re laser focused on helping companies bring AI into production and providing real value. Decision making is simple: if what we do allows our users to increase how many use cases of AI they’re able to successfully put into production, then we do it!

● Don’t cut corners, cut the right corners. What can you do with 10% of your time to get 90% of the desired impact? Now that you only spent 10% of the time doing something, imagine how much more can be done with the rest of your time!!

● Everyone is a 1000x engineer/designer/pm when they’re passionate about the problems they’re solving and love the people they’re working with

● Because we trust each other, we can move fast and have fun doing it 😄

**One selling point** you can mention to candidates on a phone screen:

● Working with Vellum means you get a front row seat into seeing what exciting AI companies are using AI to build. Because of our product, we get to see what companies are using AI for and what it takes to build a successful AI-powered product. For someone who is entrepreneurial and dreaming about starting their own startup one day, this is a cool opportunity.
avoid_traits: Should have high willingness to learn

company.name: Vellum AI
company.description:
At Vellum, our mission is to be the primary platform companies use to bring AI into production. AI is the biggest platform shift since the internet, the applications are everywhere! With foundation models getting better we expect the world to be dramatically different in the future. We intend to be the platform layer to bring this amazing technology to life in production use cases.

We enable companies to bring real business value from AI / LLMs. The output generated by AI / LLMs is usually stochastic and bringing AI into production requires robust testing and choosing the right model for the job. We’ve seen companies spend months of engineering time building good tooling for this (time which could be spent on their core end user facing product) and despite this they struggle to get the best results out of these models. Our platform provides companies best in class tooling to use their own data in production AI applications.

We’re a YC W23 company, raised $9.5m and are backed by top investors like Rebel Fund, Eastlink Capital, Arash Ferdowsi (co-founder of Dropbox), Dharmesh Shah (co-founder of Hubspot), Dan Scholnick (board member of Weights & Biases, Docker, New Relic), and Divya Bhat (former YC group partner, 2x CEO). We announced our fundraise on TechCrunch here: https://techcrunch.com/2023/07/11/prompt-engineering-startup-vellum-ai/

We’re excited to build our core team. The initial team will play a key role in the long term growth of the company.​

P.S: Why the name Vellum? - Vellum is a type of paper - the Magna Carta was written on Vellum. We intend to be the standard source of record in production - You can’t spell Vellum without LLM 😉
company.teamAbout:
Working at Vellum

  • We’re laser focused on helping companies bring AI into production and providing real value. Decision making is simple: if what we do allows our users to increase how many use cases of AI they’re able to successfully put into production, then we do it!

  • Don’t cut corners, cut the right corners. What can you do with 10% of your time to get 90% of the desired impact? Now that you only spent 10% of the time doing something, imagine how much more can be done with the rest of your time!!

  • Everyone is a 1000x team member when they’re passionate about the problems they’re solving and love the people they’re working with

  • Because we trust each other, we can move fast and have fun doing it 😄

Our Values

We live these values every day, we know there are difficult tradeoffs to each of these values and we’re willing to accept them.

1. It’s always Day 0

Every day is an opportunity to excel. We tackle challenges head-on, execute relentlessly, and strive for continuous improvement.

2. Customers come first

We are committed to exceptional customer service. Customers should be delighted when using our product. We measure our success by the tangible business outcomes our customers achieve through our products.

3. Be resilient, not stubborn

We maintain a positive outlook and work through challenges. Our team supports each other, ensuring we don’t let setbacks hinder our progress. We recognize the fine line between resilience and stubbornness, striving to stay on the right side of it.

4. Take care of each other

We believe in the power of teamwork. Our high-trust, low-ego culture ensures we support each other, cover for teammates when needed, and prioritize collective success over individual achievements. We hire and invest in top talent.

5. Go and see

We take full responsibility for our work, striving for excellence in everything we do. No task is beneath us, and we actively seek out and address issues at their source. Our commitment to relentless execution ensures continuous improvement and high-quality results.

6. Share more, share often

We prioritize clear and frequent communication using various tools. By keeping everyone informed, we minimize surprises and ensure alignment across the team.

7. Be transparent

We are committed to honesty with current and future teammates, customers and investors. Transparent communication and setting realistic expectations are essential to success.

8. Love your work, Love AI

We are passionate about AI and genuinely curious about its potential. Our team actively engages with the technology, ensuring we stay at the forefront of the industry.

9. Cut the right corners

We prioritize efficiency and rapid execution. By focusing on the most impactful tasks and adopting a Minimum Viable Product (MVP) mentality, we move quickly without sacrificing quality.

10. Don’t be an asshole

We maintain a respectful and supportive workplace. We communicate openly, give constructive feedback, and avoid ego-driven behaviors. This value ensures a positive and collaborative work environment.

Build ledger systems
Work with customers to build integrations with their internal systems and integrate our API
Be curious! Ideate with the founders on products to build, better UX, UI, and maintain real and true ownership in the product and company!
Establish better engineering practices, help grow the engineering organization, and set cultural direction
Own end-to-end design and implementation of features including development, testing and release
Build solutions that take into consideration issues of scaling, security, and performance
Collaborate closely with product and the rest of engineering to deliver on our roadmap
Grow with the company as a technical leader
workPlaceText: most likely In-person in NYC
visa_text_more: Can sponsor TN and H1B transfer but not H1B Sponsorship
experience_info: doing relevant work at one or two roles in the past and is really excited to jump into an early-stage environment and start contributing code ASAP! This is not a managerial position, strictly IC position
recruiting_advice:
We'll list this within the app, but we'd like to follow some of the philosophy Ramp and similar startups with a history of hiring early talent do. The philosophy is to hire people with a track record of building and ambition to code every day and are willing to learn sometimes difficult systems like payments operations, ledgers, corporate cards, etc. If they're willing to learn these things and also are willing to commit to the codebase every day, they'd be a great candidate.

We want someone ready for the next step in their career, with a commensurate step up in agency, ownership, and equity. This is a very high reward role, as we'd ask this person to make important engineering decisions, be the go-to on most engineering contributions, and also be a POC for integration with various customers.

A previous experience at either a startup or big tech company where they've shown some initiative and the ability to go above and beyond when needed is great. Along with potentially some side projects/their ability to learn new tools and become proficient at coding quickly. We're looking for problem solvers and builders, not necessarily leetcode solvers who have become proficient at solving abstract problems. None of the problems we'll face within our startup are abstract and all problems will be solved with code being shipped.

This candidate doesn't need to have worked at a startup before, but hopefully, they've read about or embraced the startup methodology of moving quickly and committing fully to the changes that can happen quickly within a startup. Especially being very customer and product-focused. 

This person should be able to ask themselves hard questions surrounding product decisions and implementation. Because they are our first founding engineer, this person will have little managerial oversight, which should excite them. Instead, this is a very collaborative role where they'll be working closely with the founders. They should be thinking every day about customer outcomes and how to ship code that furthers what our customers need. The ability, agency, and ownership to ask these questions of themselves are crucial to being successful in this role.

The final thing to add is that this person should always have an innate desire for urgency. If they want to close things faster, if they're no-nonsense and truly want to try and contribute to something great, we want to help them reach their goals!

**2-6 YOE requirement explanation**:

We're looking for someone that has maybe had one or two jobs in the past and is really excited to jump into an early-stage environment and start contributing code ASAP! This is not a managerial position, strictly IC position. We'll have engineers around this eng and they'll be making important code and architectural decisions from day 1. 

So preferably we'd like someone who has experience and is no longer a new grad engineer, but isn't too experienced in that they expect to oversee changes and won't be coding day-to-day. In that spirit, we're valuing someone who is willing to work hard, code every day, and likes to learn! Given that this person is earlier in their career, we're happy and encourage candidates to show off how they're willing to learn things on-the-fly (we doubt many candidates will be extremely familiar with payment operations, one of the biggest part of our product). We are excited to teach, learn, and upskill with them.
avoid_traits: People who don't have a strong background in coding, are unable to commit to something deeply, haven't been in a coding-centric role in several months/years. Someone who doesn't have deep experience, familiarity, and comfort shipping code to production regularly

company.name: Magic (YC S22)
company.description:
Magic is an early-stage fintech startup building a new payments platform that gives merchants control and flexibility while lowering costs. Our APIs empower merchants of any size to launch a closed-loop wallet to reduce payment costs, drive customer loyalty, and build innovative customer experiences.

Backed by top investors like Y Combinator, General Catalyst, and Hummingbird Ventures, we’re on a mission to fix the economics of payments and make payments work for merchants, not against them.

name: Engineer #1
description:
Durable Alpha is building the fastest, most comprehensive and robust tools for extracting information from the web! Since going all-in 6 months ago, we’ve signed up several financial firms and have crossed a quarter million in ARR with no customer churn. We’re continuing to grow fast and are looking to bring on more team members to grow with us.

Fundamentally, we are solving Open Information Extraction problems using autonomous agents and building interactive tools on top of our data layer. For example, a financial analyst can ask what the average discount rate at LuluLemon was last quarter and get an accurate answer with history in just minutes.

We’re currently looking to hire our first full time engineer to be a co-owner of our automated data extraction infrastructure.

requirements.description: Willingness to work in a fast paced startup environment - meaning comfort with ambiguity, bias towards action and a constant focus on efficiency.
Node.js & Typescript experience
RabbitMQ (or similar)
Redis, git, CLI/shell experience, SQL & cloud experience
Open information extraction (OpenIE) research experience (or similar)
Web scraping experience (mobile reverse engineering, intercepting network traffic, DOM parsing, puppeteer/playwright/selenium etc.)
Google Cloud Platform experience
Culture fit: https://durablealpha.notion.site/Values-22869fef2d544414b5bdf4c61cc68e6b
requirements.explanation: Please assess whether the candidate gets excited from this in screening calls. If they don't share these values, likely not a good fit

requirements.description: Candidate should be explicitly willing to take > 40 hours of work in a given week. We want to move fast and in some instances are going to expect more than that. It's part of how we envision culture

responsibilities: You will work alongside our CTO (Logan) and own large pieces of our core infrastructure for extracting, analyzing and visualizing data from the web. You will:
Develop autonomous agents for solving different information extraction problems
Develop heuristics/LLM/ML based tools for extracting and structuring data across different web formats.
Develop automated (AutoSQL) tools for performing analytics on extracted data based on domain context and natural language prompts.
Develop iterable automated visualization layers on top of the analytics layer; i.e. time series visualizations based on natural language input
Anything else we need! We’re a small team so anything from website updates, writing infrastructure as code etc. will be on the table!
visa_text_more: We work remote/async as well, but we'll find a way to make it work!
experience_info: as SWE/MLE/Data
recruiting_advice:
We should make sure to call out the value proposition we have, we're cash flow positive, have never churned a customer and are hiring to meet increased demand. We also aren't beholden to any VCs (we have more equity to give than if we'd already been diluted and control the company direction). Rohit and I have founded together previously, so we expect to stick together.

Also reach out to us for anything - we know you all are experts so we want to give you all the tools you need to help us succeed together!
avoid_traits: Lack of commitment, poor communication, failure to meet deadlines, difficulty structuring problems

Our founders (Rohit and Logan) have experience at Bain, C3 AI, Nourish (YC W21 founding engineer), hedge funds and more. We also have a team of contractors that write and maintain pieces of our stack that are not currently automated.

We move quickly, learn quickly and emphasize a culture of truth, transparency and ownership. We work async/remote but also colocate whenever possible (Rohit and I often get together for a few weeks). Our team is excited about the problems we're solving, believes in the vision and who we have to achieve it and pushes each other to work both harder and smarter! We want our next team member to think the same.

Founders:

Logan Harless

name: Founding AI Engineer
description:
As the Founding AI engineer at Delphi, you will be responsible for building and maintaining the AI infrastructure that powers our cloning and personalized conversational platform.

We are operating in brand new territory. You will work directly with the CEO & CTO to leverage & develop the latest & greatest in large language models to perfect our cloning technology & innovate to truly capture the essence of someone’s mind.

If you are passionate about using AI to transform the way people learn and grow, this role could be a great fit for you.

requirements.description: Bonus points if the candidate started company before
Entrepreneurial spirit
requirements.explanation: You have a drive to create and innovate, and you do not require much hand-holding to get things done. Bonus points if you’ve started company before.

requirements.description: Exceptional communication skills
requirements.explanation: Candidate should have exceptional communication skills to effectively convey their ideas and solutions to a diverse audience.

requirements.description: Experience in prompt engineering and are familiar with the latest advances in LLMs
Track record of designing and implementing successful full-stack NLP projects, particularly in the areas of conversational AI, knowledge, graphs, and reinforcement learning
Track record of being a strong problem-solver
requirements.explanation: It should be obvious to you that the candidate has the ability to identify and solve complex problems

responsibilities: As the Founding AI engineer at Delphi, you will be responsible for building and maintaining the AI infrastructure that powers our cloning and personalized conversational platform.

experience_info: Doesn't need to be an expert. High slope is preferred. Doesn't need to be a research engineer either - can be an engineer that picked up LLMs in the last couple of years.
recruiting_advice:
\*\***More important than skillset & resume in an early stage startup is alignment.**

**What we care about**:

● **Inherent Drive for Greatness**

We approach this in every facet of our lives - work, health, integrity, relationships. There’s no such thing as perfect, but there is such thing as the constant pursuit of greatness. We keep each other accountable to this every day.

● **First Principles Thinking**

You should have a good reason for why you are doing what you’re doing.

● **Anti-Mimeticism**

Related to the above, you should not being doing things because of external hype. Your decisions ideally are made on your own understanding of the world around you. Everyone in AI right now is extremely mimetic - moving from one thing to another. We must focus and be grounded on the reasons that are driving our actions.

● **Customer Obsession**

We appreciate individuals who create products that address real problems. They have empathy, and thus usually good communication skills. UX & design are top priorities in this company because we want the experience of using Delphi to be extremely delightful and intuitive for our users.

● **Good Quests > Bad Quests**

We want to have a net positive impact on people’s lives.

● **In Person**

The best company cultures, and relationships, are built in person.

● **High Velocity & High Quality**

We are using velocity here intentionally. Speed is the absolute value of velocity - we want to move quickly but in the correct direction. We cannot sacrifice quality for speed - we must have both.

**Who We're Looking For**:

● **Outcasts & people with chips on their shoulders.**

These are the people who feel like they still have something to prove. The people from non-traditional backgrounds. Those who think differently. Sam and I view ourselves as outcasts, and we are both heavily motivated to make this work. There is no plan B.

● **Ability to thrive in uncertainty.**

We are building in the curiosity phase of a new technology. Things will constantly change, and you have to be ok, even relish, in the ups and downs and uncertainties of innovating in an entirely new field.

A company’s trajectory is baked in after the **first 10 employees**, so it’s important to us that we build a culture of people who are aligned upon the same values and mission. Obviously, we are early and things will change, but as long as we have a strong foundation, we can grow fast and tall in the long run.

An analogy I like to use: for the first couple of years of its life, bamboo stays under 3 feet. It builds a strong foundation so that in the future, it can grow incredibly fast in a short period of time. Right now, we are focused on building that bamboo foundation.
avoid_traits: High ego. People who care about work life balance. FAANG engineers.

Delphi is a digital cloning platform that captures your thinking, making your knowledge, experiences, personality, and opinions available to others in a personalized way.

name: ML Tech Lead (Science and Engineering)
description:
At Cleanlab you will figure out how to best leverage new Generative AI advances for better tools that automatically find & fix issues in datasets. The north star of our company is to use AI to increase the value of Data.

Work with text, structured/tabular, and image/video datasets from companies across diverse industries, and help them address high-impact Data/AI challenges.

Help lead a brilliant team of ML engineers building the most useful Data-Centric AI platform.

Publish articles and open-source code.

We’re looking for PhD in Machine Learning, or equivalent tech industry experience.

Extremely strong Python skills and experience productionizing code/models in cloud environments. You should be comfortable with big datasets/models.

Desire to have a huge impact on your company, as well as the general way Data/AI projects are done, by building useful/practical tools quickly (simplicity over complexity).

Experience with ELT and data cleaning tools
Industry/research experience spanning: NLP / LLMs, computer vision, and relational (tabular) databases.
Lives in SF and loves hybrid work in office
Extremely strong Python skills and experience productionizing code/models in cloud environments. You should be comfortable with big datasets/models.

Work on large-scale ML projects with Cleanlab enterprise customers, from inception to production.

experience_info: (min 5 years experience without PhD or 2 years with PhD, top university or github or publications)
recruiting_advice:
Recruiter notes: All candidates need to be enthusiastic (not just ok) about hybrid work in our SF office. Strongly prefer candidates already in SF.

When screening candidates, please also make sure they are excited to join an early stage startup. It's a very different dynamic to FAANG and if the candidate is not early stage startup type, things eventually won't work out.

A unique selling point about Cleanlab you can tell candidates is that the founders did research together at MIT and that organically spinned out to be a company.

You can read about how Cleanlab went from MIT PhD research to tech used by Amazon, Google, etc. here

Also see what Google, Wells Fargo, and other Cleanlab users think here
avoid_traits: Somebody who wants to work as research scientist and only publish papers. We want somebody who wants to make a real impact and write lots of production code

company.name: Cleanlab
company.description:
Everything we do at Cleanlab is guided by our north star – to improve the world’s ML data more easily and quicker than any other solution – enabling AI systems to train more reliably on real-world, messy, error-prone data. We develop next-generation data-centric AI, open-source algorithms and provide no-code SaaS enterprise solutions to help individuals and teams at companies (across all industries) diagnose/fix issues in their datasets and produce more reliable ML models by providing clean labels for training.

While many companies can help store/manage data or develop ML models, there exist few solutions today to improve the quality of existing data, which is the core asset of the modern enterprise. This is where you come in. At Cleanlab, you’ll be able to take ownership of critical projects that pioneer the future of data-centric AI.

We are a hybrid company, with over half of our team (and office) located in San Francisco.
benefits: Premium health insurance (+ dental and vision)
Professional development stipend to keep up with the latest innovations in ML and software.
Competitive salary (+ equity offering for certain roles), with regular opportunities for a raise if things are going well.
Relocation bonus to move to San Francisco
company.teamAbout: Prior to Cleanlab, our founders (3 ML PhDs from MIT) worked at OpenAI, Google, Microsoft, Amazon, AWS, Facebook AI Research (FAIR), Dropbox, Oculus, Palantir, NASA, General Electric, MIT Lincoln Laboratory, MIT, Harvard, and Stanford – at every place we worked we repeatedly encountered the same issue – AI solutions failed to work reliably on real-world, human-centric data due to label errors and poor data quality. So, we spent eight years of PhD research at MIT inventing a new field to solve this problem and after successful pilots with world-leading organizations, Cleanlab emerged.

recruiting_advice:
We're changing our search direction and looking for exceptional recent college grads interested in joining an early-stage startup.

When sourcing, it'll be easier to narrow down who to reach out to if you follow this framework:

  • Were they a go-getter in college?

  • Did they do the most challenging/exceptional thing they can in their capacity?

  • Did they secure the hardest internships?

  • Did they start a company?

  • Were they interested in startups?

You can assess this in a variety of different ways including:

  • Did they start a company?

  • Were they part of a startup club at school (e.g. dorm room fund)?

  • Did they do a VC fellowship (e.g. Kleiner Perkins Fellowship)?

  • Did they intern/work at a startup?

In the screening call, please screen for:

  • is it clear that they're extremely smart?

  • olympian work ethic - is it clear from their previous track record that they work exceptionally hard?

  • bottomless energy = consistency - are they energetic (talk and think fast) and is it clear from their previous track record that they are a consistent performer?

  • high ambition - what is their goal? why is it clear that they want to achieve something exceptional very quickly

candidates just looking for another 9-5 'job'

company.name: Paraform
company.description:
Paraform is a marketplace connecting companies with open roles and recruiters who can fill them.

Companies can work with specialized recruiters more cheaply, monitor their performance, and flex based on demand. Recruiters don't have to worry about acquiring clients while earning and working on their own terms.

Incredible teams at the most exciting startups and enterprises are being built as a result.

We power talent for a wide range of customers:

  • Enterprise - Palantir, Anduril, Scale AI

  • Growth stage - Eight Sleep, Character.ai, Applied Intuition

  • Early stage - Mintlify, Jenni.ai, Decagon.ai

We've raised money from:

  • Co-founders - Twitch, Doordash, and Eventbrite

  • VCs - A*, Soma Capital, Founders Inc, and Primer Sazze

  • Leadership - Palantir, Opendoor, Ramp, and Scale AI

Other highlights:

  • GMV/Revenue increasing 50% MoM

  • We just moved into a beautiful new office in North Beach. Check out video of it here
benefits: 🌉 Beautiful office with golden gate bridge view at the Fort Mason Center in San Francisco. Moving to North Beach soon and we think it's even better :)
🌏 Company Offsites (NY, LA, Sydney, Seoul etc)
company.teamAbout:
Hey 👋 we're John and Jeff, the co-founders of Paraform. Funnily enough, this all started when we tried to recruit each other in 2022. Ever since then, we've experienced first-hand how broken recruiting is and our mission is to finally fix it.

Our values and culture

  • We work hard and enjoy being together in person. We are transparent about our work ethic and expectations because it enables us to have extreme ownership in building at a pace that is unmatched.

  • Customers, customers, customers. We're customer-obsessed and always start with the customer first. We are the customer support team.

  • Ship fast and break things. We believe great products come from lots of experimentation, so we value fast development. No one is going to wait around for us to make things, especially something that's perfect.

  • Take care of each other. We trust each other and want to enable everyone to do their best work. That means an all food and transportation compensated, gym membership, unlimited PTO, global offsites, premium healthcare and a free bike.

company.name: Wispr
company.description: Wispr is building a more natural way to interact with technology with neural interfaces. We have an elite team of engineers, product designers, and research scientists building magic.  We've raised 19.6M from top-tier VCs like NEA and 8VC. Our angels and advisors include Chester Chipperfield (product lead for the first Apple Watch), Ben Jones (COO, CTRL-Labs), Dave Gilboa (CEO, Warby Parker), and Jose Carmena (Berkeley professor; co-CEO iota). Our founders are Stanford alums and have previously sold a company and run a team at a deep tech startup with over 100M in funding.
benefits: Generous health, dental, and vision coverage
Generous parental leave, unlimited PTO (we encourage taking days off!)
Total compensation for this position may also include stock options and other potential future incentives
company.teamAbout:
Join us in leading the generative AI & neurotech revolutions and change how people interact with technology.

At Wispr, we step away from the status quo to rethink the fundamental layer of computing — how humans interact with technology.

We believe that the best technologies emerge from ambiguity and asking the right questions. We like building from 0 to 1 and strive to see our work in the hands of people. We take on challenges that may seem impossible. And most importantly, we grow and learn from one another while we’re at it.

If you're excited about designing the next generation of personal computing for an AI-first world, and creating a product that sparks delight, you’re in the right place.

We're hiring across all teams. We work together in our office in SF and are also open to remote work.

name: Software Engineer, Distributed Systems (Core)
description:
We are looking for a distributed systems engineer to work on the systems that power the syncing engine our customers and other engineering teams rely on. This presents an exciting challenge where you can apply your expertise in distributed systems, performance optimization, and troubleshooting to push the boundaries of what is possible and meaningful improve our ability to move massive amounts of customer data. This role also provides a unique opportunity to work on a multi-cloud and multi-region infrastructure that supports a global customer base.

We believe in enabling our engineers to do their best work for our customers by giving them extremely high levels of ownership and autonomy. This comes in different forms: you will own and deliver projects from start to finish, you will work directly with customers to solve their hardest scaling problems, and you will have a lot of influence over what we work on as a team and company.

requirements.description: Product-minded backend engineer
requirements.explanation: Strong customer and product thinking and who feels comfortable writing and engaging with product specs

requirements.description: You’ve owned systems that have undergone orders of magnitude of growth and helped them scale accordingly
You’ve created event collection or data streaming services that power company critical systems
You’ve built syncing engines that process and move terabytes of data per day in a scalable way
You have experience and comfort with distributed systems and high-scale systems or the ability and desire to build this experience quickly
Has a history of getting promoted quickly at the listed companies.
Have been part of growth tech startups through high stages of growth including: Stripe, Square, Lyft/Uber, Amplitude, Doordash, or other ideal companies
Have graduated from top CS programs such as: University of Waterloo, Harvard, Columbia, Princeton, Stanford, UC Berkeley, MIT, Carnegie Mellon, CalTech, Cornell, Duke, Dartmouth, Brown
You have strong communication skills, and are a fast learner who is excited to take on the challenges we face

responsibilities: Sync Speed: Customers want to sync a lot of data to important destinations like Facebook and Snapchat, which requires us to analyze every part of our syncing process and find where we can optimize to sync data more quickly
Streaming Syncing: We currently sync data from sources in batch only, but envision a world where we also do syncs in real-time and support streaming sources like webhooks and queues
Scalability and Reliability: As part of our rapid growth, we’re always evaluating current future bottlenecks in scaling and reliability, and architecting for the next order of magnitude of growth

Personalization API: Our Personalization API product provides a low latency caching layer on top of data warehouses that enable customers to use their data warehouse for real-time personalization use cases with <30ms p90 response times with QPS in the millions

Multi-Region and Multi-Cloud: Supporting our multi-region and multi-cloud backend, including extending it to launch Hightouch on in new regions to support data residency requirements of our global customer base
workPlaceText: North America
visa_text_more: can sponsor
experience_info: We are much more interested in aptitude over years of experience. We have found engineers with just 2-3 years of experience to be extremely qualified for what we are looking for, but we generally prefer 6+.
recruiting_advice: Our team is more than happy if you submit a lower number of total candidates. We are more focused on a higher quality of candidate submissions over quantity.
avoid_traits: Candidates who only complete assigned projects without scoping ambiguous projects
Individuals from large teams who only perform tasks handed to them
Candidates lacking confidence, as our environment is intense
Candidates who have been laid off. Our leadership team firmly believes that companies do not let go of their strongest engineering talent (as it is so hard to hire for them to begin with)

company.name: Hightouch
company.description:
Hightouch’s mission is to empower everyone to take action on their data. Through our Reverse ETL platform, business and data users can seamlessly sync data from where it resides, such as warehouses and databases, to where it is needed, including operational systems and SaaS tools. Traditionally, acting on data has required engineering time and bandwidth, and left most business users stuck with charts and reports that are unable to take automated action on their data. With Hightouch, every business user, without writing any code, can activate data to streamline critical processes, improve marketing performance, and scale operations.

Our team operates with a focus on making a meaningful impact for our customers. We believe in approaching challenges with a first principles thinking mindset, moving quickly and embracing our value of efficient execution, and treating each other with compassion and kindness. We look for team members that are strong communicators, have a growth mindset, and are motivated and persistent in achieving our goals.

Hundreds of companies use Hightouch, including Spotify, Ramp, Retool, NBA, Plaid, and Betterment. We’re based in San Francisco, are remote-friendly, and backed by leading investors such as Amplify Partners, ICONIQ Growth, Bain Capital Ventures, Y-Combinator, and Afore Capital.
benefits: Core benefits (health, dental, vision, life insurance)
Connectivity ($50 per month cell-phone or wifi connectivity stipend)
Commuter benefits ($50 are offered to both employees who come into the offices and to remote workers working outside of their home)
Remote first (in-person meetings at our San Francisco and New York offices plus our annual company onsite.)
401k for our US employees and retirement plans for our international employees
company.teamAbout:
Our team operates with a focus on making a meaningful impact for our customers. We believe in approaching challenges with a first principles thinking mindset, moving quickly and embracing our value of efficient execution, and treating each other with compassion and kindness. We look for team members that are strong communicators, have a growth mindset, and are motivated and persistent in achieving our goals.

Our founders were early employees of Segment where they saw the transformative impact of enabling business and marketing teams to activate customer data. However, they also recognized the limitations of the existing rigid legacy Customer Data Platform (CDP) market.

By building a platform that could sit on top of an organization’s existing data infrastructure, our founders knew that teams could unlock a more performant, flexible and secure solution to activating customer data at scale - and thus, Hightouch was born.

name: Process Technician (Thin-film deposition)
description:
As a Process Technician focusing on Swift’s R&D line, you will be a core member, ushering our company to the next stage of development by helping operate and optimize our new research projects running through the R&D line at Swift. You will specialize in running and helping maintain two major thin-film deposition tools as your primary function in order to make sure the team maintains a high throughput and reliable process. Working at an early-stage startup, you will have the opportunity to get involved in many aspects of the company’s technical development and internal operations.

On a typical day, you will review experimental plans with Swift’s process engineers and scientists, execute these plans, document the experiments in detail, and report your results to other team members involved in the process. As an evening shift technician, you will cover the late shift on the perovskite deposition equipment. You will be responsible for helping evaluate data, documenting and reporting any observations made during operation, and giving input on followup experiments. You will help keep the lab running smoothly and efficiently; for example, you may  perform  some tool-related maintenance tasks, troubleshoot equipment breakdowns and work closely with the equipment team. As a primary operator, you will manage and communicate supply needs, workflows, results, and tool output to support other work at Swift. While operating R&D deposition equipment will be your primary responsibility, you will also help with shared technician team tasks like substrate preparation and sample storage. You’ll have the additional opportunity to learn to operate & maintain additional tools along the R&D line once you and your manager feel like you’re ready to take on more responsibility. Taking organized notes, documenting procedures, communicating your work, and managing your time effectively are key parts of the job. 

As an early hire, you will help craft Swift’s culture and technical direction. As our team grows, we’ll expect you to help mentor and set an example for new team members. You will find many opportunities to grow your own skills and capabilities, and we encourage you to take full advantage of them.

requirements.description: Are able and willing to work a 1:30pm-10pm shift
Experience with thin film deposition equipment operation and troubleshooting
Chemical handling experience
Glovebox maintenance experience
Operating experience in a startup setting
Take initiative without prompt, work independently and are self-reliant
Communicate effectively and timely both in-person and online
Can follow complex and varying instructions and pay careful attention to details.

cover the late shift on the perovskite deposition equipment

While operating R&D deposition equipment will be your primary responsibility, you will also help with shared technician team tasks like substrate preparation and sample storage

recruiting_advice:
Since this is an evening shift role, it's important that this person is good at communicating and is proactive! 

Candidates who have experience with specifically solar startups are a good starting point because they are likely aligned with Swift's mission of creating a world where all energy is clean energy. 

Also during your search, there may be many candidates focused on maintenance rather than operation. A mix of both maintaining and operating this equipment would be great, but purely maintenance is not what we're looking in this role.

company.name: Swift Solar
company.description:
At Swift Solar, we’re building the future of solar. We believe that solar energy has vast untapped potential to reduce inequity and protect planetary health in the face of global climate change. We believe that today’s solar technology is good but not good enough. And we believe that what we build today should serve humanity forever.

Swift’s perovskite tandem technology breaks through the performance limits of existing solar technologies. By making solar better—more efficient, more affordable, and more widely accessible—we are helping to create a world where all energy is clean energy.

Swift Solar is a mission-focused startup funded by committed investors. We know it’s a long journey to take a new clean energy technology to market, and we’re in it for the long haul together. If you join us, you’ll play a meaningful role in taking Swift’s impact to the next level.

We believe that solar energy has vast untapped potential to reduce inequity and protect planetary health in the face of global climate change. We believe that today’s solar technology is good but not good enough. And we believe that what we build today should serve humanity forever.

Together our team is making this vision into reality.

name: Head of Recruiting
description:
As Head of Recruiting at Arena, you will be responsible for evolving and scaling our recruiting function to attract and hire world-class talent who are passionate about creating real-world impact through AI. You will develop and execute recruiting pipelines for hiring critical but hard-to-find roles, partnering with hiring managers to craft the right sourcing, assessment, and offer strategies to win the very best talent. You will build, scale, and rely on processes and systems, while constantly looking for ways to update (or sometimes ignore) those playbooks to achieve your hiring goals. 

You thrive on identifying and attracting top-tier talent that others struggle to hire, and you view it as your personal mission to make Arena the leading hub of AI talent in the world. You will bring the creativity, rigor, critical assessment, and drive to make that a reality, meeting Arena’s ambitious hiring goals while holding the high bar required to achieve that vision.

requirements.description: Ability and drive to operate as an individually contributing full-stack recruiter, not just as a manager
Proficiency architecting, operating, and continuously improving a scaled hiring process within modern, industry standard applicant tracking systems & outreach platforms
Experience successfully building hiring processes from 0 to 1 and then scaling them, across multiple roles
Demonstrated ability to recruit exceptional, world-class talent for hard-to-fill roles
Existing networks in AI talent communities, particularly in NYC
Passion for AI and the humans building on the cutting edge
Experience successfully deploying non-traditional sourcing strategies to reach hard-to-find talent
Experience recruiting for a company as it grows from Seed/Series A (and 10s of people headcount) through rapid growth to a B or C stage (and 100s of people headcount).
requirements.explanation: Looking for someone who has done that and recruited successfully for a tech company experiencing that kind of growth so that they know what it looks and feels like, and what pitfalls arise. They don't have to have been the lead on it.

responsibilities: Develop and execute recruiting pipelines for hiring critical but hard-to-find roles, partnering with hiring managers to craft the right sourcing, assessment, and offer strategies to win the very best talent
Build, scale, and rely on processes and systems, while constantly looking for ways to update (or sometimes ignore) those playbooks to achieve your hiring goals
Attracting top-tier talent that others struggle to hire, and you view it as your personal mission to make Arena the leading hub of AI talent in the world
Bring the creativity, rigor, critical assessment, and drive to make that a reality, meeting Arena’s ambitious hiring goals while holding the high bar required to achieve that vision
workPlaceText: Working full time in our office in NYC
visa_text_more: We are not able to sponsor new visas for this role, but we can accept a transfer of an existing visa.
experience_info: Very flexible on years of experience, but using these as a guidepost. We are looking for someone who has successfully hired and scaled queues in a startup environment.
recruiting_advice:
Will just go over the most important things to note here:

● **This role is on-site, full-time at our NYC office**
● Track record of achieving recruiting outcomes at a **fast-paced, rapidly-growing startup**. We're a Series A startup so experience with startups at a similar stage who had rapid traction/growth and backed by strong investors would be a good place to look.
● This is not just a manager role. They have to have the **ability and drive to operate as an individually contributing full-stack recruiter - think player-coach**.
● They need to have experience successfully building hiring processes from 0 to 1 and then scaling them, across multiple roles

company.name: Arena
company.description:
Arena empowers businesses across industries to make high frequency, critical path decisions fully autonomous. Our products have helped some of the world’s largest CPG companies transform their sales and supply chains into increasingly autonomous, self-learning systems — unlocking efficiencies and resulting in better, more affordable consumer experiences. 

Arena knows that Autonomy can help organizations tackle much more, from delivering critical goods and services more affordably, sustainably, and equitably to the world, to reducing green premiums on renewable energy to compete more effectively with fossil fuels.
benefits: 99% of the monthly premium for Aetna medical insurance, plus vision and dental coverage
Attendance to top conferences in their fields
company.teamAbout:
Our name is inspired by Theodore Roosevelt’s ‘Citizenship in a Republic’ speech, which pays homage to the ‘(hu)man in the Arena’. To us, entering the Arena means committing oneself fully and accepting the risk of failure in the pursuit of an audacious, worthy cause.

We’re a close-knit tribe of scientists and builders exploring the boundaries of how artificial intelligence can benefit humanity. If you share our passion for delving deep into real-world problems and solving them with fully autonomous AI, join us in the Arena.

name: Tech Lead
description:
The Tech Lead role will be a central figure in the development of our MRV technology platform. You will own the technology stack and have the opportunity to directly scale as well as grow and shape our engineering team as you see best fit. 

The successful candidate will be a proactive problem solver, experienced software generalist,  and a versatile leader capable of handling a diverse range of technical tasks and projects. This role is ideal for a self-starter, problem-solver who enjoys both directly building in a hands-on-role and shaping future technical vision.

requirements.description: You care deeply about climate change and feel a strong moral responsibility to act now.
requirements.explanation: This extends into all facets of your life: both personal and professional. No action is too small and no goal too big. Whether you have turned vegan or swear by public transport, we are big believers in emrbacing sustainability as a mindset and would love to learn what this means for you!

requirements.description: Past multidisciplinary teamwork (i.e. e.g. working on software in healthcare) is a huge plus, as you will be working with an interdisciplinary team with expertise in AI, Remote Sensing, Carbon Markets, Soil Carbon Modeling, Sustainable Finance
Past experience working in climate/agriculture is not a requirement, but a passion for climate is a plus!
BS/MS/PhD in Computer Science or related field
Proactive and collaborative self-starter with a strong ability to attract other top technical talent and lead them effectively
Ability to develop infrastructure/pipelines to support Machine Learning / Remote Sensing / Crop Modelling Simulation workflows
requirements.explanation: (e.g. setting up data pipelines, setting up infrastructure to parallelize model runs in cloud, automating deployment of models to integrate with the core MRV SaaS platform)

requirements.description: A track record of shipping and going through full product development cycle right from writing the first line of code to product in the hands of users and iterating quickly on feedback
Experience with setting up the technology stack and development infrastructure from Day 1 and scaling it with growth in a startup environment

responsibilities: You will lead the development of our Core Product: a soil carbon measurement, reporting, and verification (MRV) SaaS platform and the development of infrastructure and data pipelines to support the ability to run machine learning models, crop models, and remote sensing pipelines at scale in the cloud.
As the tech lead, you will work directly with the founders and own the entire technology stack, including making product decisions
You will shape the technical roadmap and have the opportunity to build out a world-class technical team and culture as you see best
workPlaceText: San Francisco office
experience_info: building and owning a complete end-to-end technology stack (Frontend + Backend + Cloud + CI/CD): you have owned architectural decisions for a product, led a team, and enjoy being full hands-on
recruiting_advice:
On top of meeting the requirements we outlined in the role, **please make sure you screen for this when recruiting:**

● Are they a proactive problem solver?
● Are they an experienced software generalist? 
● Are they a versatile leader capable of handling a diverse range of technical tasks and projects?
● Are they a self-starter?
● Are they a problem-solver who enjoys both directly building in a hands-on-role and shaping future technical vision?

**What does success in this role look like?**

● You ship product and have fast outputs
● You makes improvements to the product and tech stack by taking initiative to get user feedback and develop your own intuition for how our technology should grow
● You establish best practices on internal infrastructure and the development environment to enable others to build on your work

company.name: Terradot
company.description:
Problem: Globally, soils have the potential to sequester over 1 billion tons of carbon through regenerative agriculture practices and emerging solutions like biochar and enhanced rock weathering. However today, measurement, reporting, and verification of soil carbon sequestration is not cost effective, accurate, or scalable. This prevents large-scale climate finance from being deployed to rapidly scale soil carbon improvement despite its massive potential to combat climate change, improve food security, and alleviate extreme poverty. 

Terradot is building a global measurement, reporting, and verification (MRV) platform to accelerate high-integrity carbon removal and storage around the world. With Stanford’s Soil and Environmental Biogeochemistry Lab, we leverage technological innovation using ground truth sampling, remote sensing, and AI modeling to accurately and scalably measure soil carbon. For soil carbon project developers, Terradot decreases the time, cost, and complexity of MRV while increasing the integrity of the carbon removal credits for carbon buyers. This enables large-scale deployment of climate finance to incentivize the adoption of sustainable practices. We are focused on improving soil health in emerging economies to maximize global sequestration and community impact.

We are a public-benefit corporation driven by passion and purpose in service to our planet, people, and prosperity. Terradot is backed by world-class investors including Floodgate, John Doerr, Kleiner Perkins, Sheryl Sandberg, Ponderosa Ventures, 776 Foundation (Alexis Ohanian), George Roberts, and Stanford’s TomKat Center for Sustainable Energy. We are advised by an all-star team of Stanford climate professors with 100,000+ citations collectively.
company.productDescription: A global measurement, reporting, and verification (MRV) platform to accelerate high-integrity carbon removal and storage around the world. With Stanford’s Soil and Environmental Biogeochemistry Lab, we leverage technological innovation using ground truth sampling, remote sensing, and AI modeling to accurately and scalably measure soil carbon
company.teamAbout:
We’re based in the SF/Bay Area and are fostering a strong in-person first, collaborative, mission-driven culture. Our founders graduated from Stanford with a focus on Climate Science and AI. They have previously founded and led an international nonprofit that has rescued over 100 million pounds of surplus food from farmers to food banks and published AI+Remote Sensing for Climate Change research under Andrew Ng as part of the Stanford ML Group.

Values

- Curiosity: Most solutions to reach net zero do not exist yet. We are looking for sensationally curious team players who use a beginner’s mindset to find novel solutions and embrace the growth mindset to overcome setbacks   
- Kindness: Great teams change the world, we believe kindness is the foundation to build great teams on and also guides the impact we aim to have on our planet to pay it forward. 
- Mamba Mentality: Kobe Bryant’s Mamba Mentality combines love, passion, and borderline obsession to improve every day and create a culture of collectively becoming the best we can be at our shared dream.
- Speed and Scale: We value teammates who are ready to move at the speed and scale necessary to meet the urgency of the climate crisis. If you are looking to coast, stick to big tech.
- Multidisciplinary and Multicultural Collaboration: The ability to think across disciplines and work with people from a variety of backgrounds is not just a requirement, but a unique advantage given that our work spans multiple domains and impacts communities around the world.

name: Remote - Founding Full Stack Engineer (Backend Leaning)
description: The Founding Senior Full Stack Engineer at Aktos is a pivotal role aimed at building the Operating System for the $18B Credit Collections industry. This position is designed for an engineer with a lean towards Backend development (70/30), who is comfortable working across the entire tech stack. The role involves collaborating with the CEO, CTO, and other engineers to develop full-stack features and improvements, refine the SDLC & CI/CD pipelines, and maintain the AWS infrastructure. This position is for those who are comfortable with autonomy, ownership, and have a strong work ethic, with a passion for delivering high-quality code and making sound UX decisions. The engineer will play a key role in creating a modern software platform that enhances the credit recovery process, helping Consumers, doctor's offices, and local governments. The role requires 5+ years of Software Development experience, in-depth knowledge of Python, Django, JavaScript (React/Redux preferred), and hands-on experience with AWS.

Benefits and Perks: In addition to a competitive salary with employee stock options & bonuses, we also provide benefits including access to a 401K, medical, dental, and vision insurance and are a remote-first company.

company.name: Aktos
company.description:
Debt Collectors play an overlooked yet integral part of our financial ecosystem. They help Consumers settle their debts and improve their credit scores— granting them clean states to start over. Collectors help critical businesses like doctor's offices and local governments, who deal with high payment default risk, secure their revenue streams and ensure their continued survival.

In truth, Collectors have incredibly interesting, multi-faceted jobs. They are often one part sales person, one part therapist, and one part detective in their mission to recover funds. At Aktos, we are building a modern software platform that caters to Collectors' unique workflows, and make the credit recovery process a more positive experience for all parties.
benefits: Competitive salary with employee stock options, bonus and access to a 401K
company.productDescription: The Aktos product is a system of record, and core workflow software, for debt collection agencies. It is structured like a CRM, but it keeps track of delinquent accounts a collection agency is working instead of sales leads. There is a heavy fintech component as well, as we do multiple payment processor integrations.
company.teamAbout: Aktos was founded by seasoned Product and Engineering leaders who have worked at companies such as Zenefits, TikTok, Meta, LinkedIn, Google, Apple, Amazon, WeWork, Flatiron Health (acquired by Booking.com). We are experts at building, launching, and scaling word-class software platforms— rest assured, if you join us you will be working with and learning from the best.

name: Lead Research Scientist - Enhanced Rock Weathering
description:
We are seeking a Lead Research Scientist to be a part of our team to make meaningful and purpose driven outcomes in the space of MRV using enhanced rock weathering. This is an opportunity to work and be supported by a team who all share a desire to change the world for future generations using regenerative Ag, soil amendments, and technology. 

The lead research scientist will play a critical role catalyzing the precise measurement of enhanced rock weathering on global croplands. The primary goal is to investigate and model the potential of ERW to remove a gigaton of CO2 equivalent (CO2e) from the atmosphere in areas with the greatest potential of interest. This is a chance to lead and support a team to illustrate that together we can contribute to the future of wise land stewardship and climate mitigation; ensuring a thriving and healthy planet for all.

requirements.description: Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with a proven ability to lead and inspire multidisciplinary teams

An established track record of publications, especially in the realms of
geochemistry and isotope methods
Willingness and ability to travel to key regions for fieldwork and collaborative efforts
Demonstrated leadership in field sampling, laboratory analysis, and data interpretation related to ERW measurements
Prior experience in both measuring and modeling ERW is essential
PhD in Geochemistry, Isotope Geology, Agronomy, or a related discipline

responsibilities: Design and oversee field experiments to measure the impact of ERW
Stable isotope data analysis to trace the sources and fates of carbonates and bicarbonates in soil and water systems influenced by ERW
Manage field trial and data collection QA/QC globally, specifically Brazil.
Integrate field measurements into models predicting the long-term implications of ERW on global and regional carbon cycles.
Lead the calibration, validation, and immersion of reactive transport and Earth Systems models.
Direct sensitivity analysis to understand the primary determinants influencing ERW outcomes.
Engage with a network of geochemists, agronomists, and other domain experts to refine ERW measurement methods.
Coordinate with an interdisciplinary team of scientists, engineers, & agricultural experts to optimize ERW deployment strategies based on accurate measurements.
Collaborate with an enthusiastic and mission-driven team creating an enriching and supportive environment to meet our shared visions.
Publish findings in top-tier, peer-reviewed journals, emphasizing the intricate chemistry and isotope dynamics of ERW.
Represent the organization at international conferences, focusing on the sophisticated measurement techniques utilized in ERW research.
Disseminate the implications and potential of ERW to diverse audiences through public lectures, media engagements, and educational initiatives.
