experience_info: Need to be doing PHD, Completed PHD, in a post doc or working on Enhanced Rock weathering in some government, academic or industry context
recruiting_advice:
As the Lead Research Scientist, the key responsibilities of the role include conducting field experiments to measure the impact of ERW, analyzing stable isotope data to trace carbonates and bicarbonates, and managing global field trials and data collection, with a focus on Brazil. Additionally, the role involves integrating field measurements into models, leading model calibration and validation, and conducting sensitivity analysis to understand the determinants influencing ERW outcomes.

This person will have the opportunity to collaborate with a network of experts in geochemistry, agronomy, and related fields to refine ERW measurement methods. They will also get to coordinate with an interdisciplinary team to optimize ERW deployment strategies and get to represent the organization at international conferences

**What we will offer your candidate:**

● Competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package.
● A leadership role in pioneering an innovative climate solution.
● Access to state-of-the-art research tools and a global network of preeminent
experts.

company.name: Terradot
company.description:
Problem: Globally, soils have the potential to sequester over 1 billion tons of carbon through regenerative agriculture practices and emerging solutions like biochar and enhanced rock weathering. However today, measurement, reporting, and verification of soil carbon sequestration is not cost effective, accurate, or scalable. This prevents large-scale climate finance from being deployed to rapidly scale soil carbon improvement despite its massive potential to combat climate change, improve food security, and alleviate extreme poverty. 

Terradot is building a global measurement, reporting, and verification (MRV) platform to accelerate high-integrity carbon removal and storage around the world. With Stanford’s Soil and Environmental Biogeochemistry Lab, we leverage technological innovation using ground truth sampling, remote sensing, and AI modeling to accurately and scalably measure soil carbon. For soil carbon project developers, Terradot decreases the time, cost, and complexity of MRV while increasing the integrity of the carbon removal credits for carbon buyers. This enables large-scale deployment of climate finance to incentivize the adoption of sustainable practices. We are focused on improving soil health in emerging economies to maximize global sequestration and community impact.

We are a public-benefit corporation driven by passion and purpose in service to our planet, people, and prosperity. Terradot is backed by world-class investors including Floodgate, John Doerr, Kleiner Perkins, Sheryl Sandberg, Ponderosa Ventures, 776 Foundation (Alexis Ohanian), George Roberts, and Stanford’s TomKat Center for Sustainable Energy. We are advised by an all-star team of Stanford climate professors with 100,000+ citations collectively.
company.productDescription: A global measurement, reporting, and verification (MRV) platform to accelerate high-integrity carbon removal and storage around the world. With Stanford’s Soil and Environmental Biogeochemistry Lab, we leverage technological innovation using ground truth sampling, remote sensing, and AI modeling to accurately and scalably measure soil carbon
company.teamAbout:
We’re based in the SF/Bay Area and are fostering a strong in-person first, collaborative, mission-driven culture. Our founders graduated from Stanford with a focus on Climate Science and AI. They have previously founded and led an international nonprofit that has rescued over 100 million pounds of surplus food from farmers to food banks and published AI+Remote Sensing for Climate Change research under Andrew Ng as part of the Stanford ML Group.

Values

- Curiosity: Most solutions to reach net zero do not exist yet. We are looking for sensationally curious team players who use a beginner’s mindset to find novel solutions and embrace the growth mindset to overcome setbacks   
- Kindness: Great teams change the world, we believe kindness is the foundation to build great teams on and also guides the impact we aim to have on our planet to pay it forward. 
- Mamba Mentality: Kobe Bryant’s Mamba Mentality combines love, passion, and borderline obsession to improve every day and create a culture of collectively becoming the best we can be at our shared dream.
- Speed and Scale: We value teammates who are ready to move at the speed and scale necessary to meet the urgency of the climate crisis. If you are looking to coast, stick to big tech.
- Multidisciplinary and Multicultural Collaboration: The ability to think across disciplines and work with people from a variety of backgrounds is not just a requirement, but a unique advantage given that our work spans multiple domains and impacts communities around the world.

company.name: Dots (YC S21)
company.description:
Dots is a developer-friendly API that lets businesses pay their contractors through just a few lines of code. Whether its gig workers like Uber drivers, sellers on marketplaces like Etsy, or simply your local handyman - Dots’ abstracts away the complexity of payouts completely. We manage the entire process: information collection (KYC), payments through any rail (ACH, Venmo, CashApp, Zelle, international, and many more to come), and even filing tax forms! Dots lets developers get payouts up and running over just a few hours, rather than the many months this would normally take.

We believe the next generation of workers are already here, and are contractors in various shapes and sizes. We’re dedicated to providing a simple-to-use API that makes money movement as flexible as the modern workforce.
benefits: Unlimited Vacation with a minimum requirement of three weeks off per-year
company.teamAbout: We were founded by two ex-Google engineers who agreed on one central truth: Marketplace payouts were needlessly complex, especially when dealing with multiple payment providers. Much of the red tape was arbitarary—and it was time someone made money movement seamless, simple, and driven by choice. That's when Dots was born.

company.name: Hightouch
company.description:
Hightouch’s mission is to empower everyone to take action on their data. Through our Reverse ETL platform, business and data users can seamlessly sync data from where it resides, such as warehouses and databases, to where it is needed, including operational systems and SaaS tools. Traditionally, acting on data has required engineering time and bandwidth, and left most business users stuck with charts and reports that are unable to take automated action on their data. With Hightouch, every business user, without writing any code, can activate data to streamline critical processes, improve marketing performance, and scale operations.

Our team operates with a focus on making a meaningful impact for our customers. We believe in approaching challenges with a first principles thinking mindset, moving quickly and embracing our value of efficient execution, and treating each other with compassion and kindness. We look for team members that are strong communicators, have a growth mindset, and are motivated and persistent in achieving our goals.

Hundreds of companies use Hightouch, including Spotify, Ramp, Retool, NBA, Plaid, and Betterment. We’re based in San Francisco, are remote-friendly, and backed by leading investors such as Amplify Partners, ICONIQ Growth, Bain Capital Ventures, Y-Combinator, and Afore Capital.
benefits: Core benefits (health, dental, vision, life insurance)
Connectivity ($50 per month cell-phone or wifi connectivity stipend)
Commuter benefits ($50 are offered to both employees who come into the offices and to remote workers working outside of their home)
Remote first (in-person meetings at our San Francisco and New York offices plus our annual company onsite.)
401k for our US employees and retirement plans for our international employees
company.teamAbout:
Our team operates with a focus on making a meaningful impact for our customers. We believe in approaching challenges with a first principles thinking mindset, moving quickly and embracing our value of efficient execution, and treating each other with compassion and kindness. We look for team members that are strong communicators, have a growth mindset, and are motivated and persistent in achieving our goals.

Our founders were early employees of Segment where they saw the transformative impact of enabling business and marketing teams to activate customer data. However, they also recognized the limitations of the existing rigid legacy Customer Data Platform (CDP) market.

By building a platform that could sit on top of an organization’s existing data infrastructure, our founders knew that teams could unlock a more performant, flexible and secure solution to activating customer data at scale - and thus, Hightouch was born.

name: Software Engineer (Frontend)
description:
As a Cleanlab software engineer, you will be responsible for building Cleanlab Studio, a user-friendly web app powered by our data-centric ML algorithms. You’ll work on beautiful and easy-to-use interfaces for data visualization, interpretation, and correction of various issues found in datasets.

We encourage applications from software engineers who have an eye for elegant UI/UX and data visualization, and are interested in furthering their skills in building Data Science applications. No previous ML/AI experience is required, but bonus points if you have previously worked on UX for ML/AI or Data platforms.

requirements.description: Previous experience in a dynamic startup environment
Must be extremely comfortable with the following tools: React.js/Next.js, JavaScript/TypeScript, HTML, CSS + some CSS Framework (Chakra UI, Tailwind, Bootstrap), Figma
Knowing what a data scientist or ML engineer does with a dataset
Experience with UX/UI Design, Module bundlers (e.g. Webpack), Visualization libraries (e.g. D3.js), React testing libraries (e.g. Jest), Desktop app frameworks (e.g. Electron)
CS degree from a top university
Previous experience at a top-tier tech company or startup
requirements.explanation: full time experience not contract work

responsibilities: Work closely with UX designers, product managers, and back-end engineers to implement versatile front-end solutions to web development issues.
Explore product concepts to find promising directions that address both human and business needs, with an eye for detail to ensure the highest quality product.
Deliver innovative, engaging prototypes using the latest in front-end technologies, particularly in the areas of data visualization/manipulation and web app UI.
Collaborate with other engineers to build streamlined systems and help establish a strong engineering culture across the company.
workPlaceText: We are a hybrid company, we need candidates who can be in office at least a couple days each week. Office is in Mission District of SF
visa_text_more: We are willing to sponsor visas for the right candidate
experience_info: developing web apps using a modern tech stack and shipping code to production
recruiting_advice: Working at Cleanlab is awesome! Beyond the opportunity to work at a well-funded AI startup with an incredible, friendly founding team of MIT graduates, all full-time employees receive the following: ● **Annual travel stipend:** Travel enhances our empathy with different cultures and enables us to work together more effectively. It’s how we grow and learn: traveling is an essential part of what makes us human. At Cleanlab, every two months you will receive a reimbursable travel benefit. This is a unique benefit that lets you work from Paris for a week in February, then take a backpacking trip in the Andes for a weekend in March. ● **Premium health insurance:** We provide a fantastic $4 (we cover the rest) health insurance option. We also provide a $0 deductible 100% coverage premium health care option for those who prefer the best health insurance. ● **Stipend for attending conferences:** to keep up with the latest innovations in ML and software. ● **Competitive salary** (+ equity offering for certain roles), with regular opportunities for a raise if things are going well. We have a strong preference for candidates who can be in office at least a couple days each week. They must have experience writing frontend code powering products with complex UX used by massive numbers of people. You can read about how Cleanlab went from MIT PhD research to tech used by Amazon, Google, etc. **here** Also see what Google, Wells Fargo, and other Cleanlab users think **here**
benefits: Stipend for attending conferences to keep up with the latest innovations in ML and software.
Competitive salary (+ equity offering for certain roles), with regular opportunities for a raise if things are going well.
Parental Leave. Take time with your new family members!
Unlimited PTO + Unlimited sick days + 10 company-wide holidays
Hybrid work (our office is in San Francisco)

company.name: Cleanlab
company.description:
Everything we do at Cleanlab is guided by our north star – to improve the world’s ML data more easily and quicker than any other solution – enabling AI systems to train more reliably on real-world, messy, error-prone data. We develop next-generation data-centric AI, open-source algorithms and provide no-code SaaS enterprise solutions to help individuals and teams at companies (across all industries) diagnose/fix issues in their datasets and produce more reliable ML models by providing clean labels for training.

While many companies can help store/manage data or develop ML models, there exist few solutions today to improve the quality of existing data, which is the core asset of the modern enterprise. This is where you come in. At Cleanlab, you’ll be able to take ownership of critical projects that pioneer the future of data-centric AI.

We are a hybrid company, with over half of our team (and office) located in San Francisco.
benefits: Premium health insurance (+ dental and vision)
Professional development stipend to keep up with the latest innovations in ML and software.
Competitive salary (+ equity offering for certain roles), with regular opportunities for a raise if things are going well.
Relocation bonus to move to San Francisco
company.teamAbout: Prior to Cleanlab, our founders (3 ML PhDs from MIT) worked at OpenAI, Google, Microsoft, Amazon, AWS, Facebook AI Research (FAIR), Dropbox, Oculus, Palantir, NASA, General Electric, MIT Lincoln Laboratory, MIT, Harvard, and Stanford – at every place we worked we repeatedly encountered the same issue – AI solutions failed to work reliably on real-world, human-centric data due to label errors and poor data quality. So, we spent eight years of PhD research at MIT inventing a new field to solve this problem and after successful pilots with world-leading organizations, Cleanlab emerged.

name: Mechanical Design Engineer
description: As a Mechanical Design Engineer at Beam, you will be helping us get ready to launch our first concept with a close-knit team. We are looking for a passionate, growth-oriented person that’s as comfortable working on CAD as they are prototyping in the shop. This person must thrive in ambiguity, be excited to wear many hats, and do what is needed to ship a revolutionary product. You will work directly with one of our founders who leads product and engineering.

requirements.description: Experience with Designing for thermal considerations
Product-obsessed and genuine passion around building things that people can touch and feel
Strong experience with Solidworks or equivalent CAD packages
Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent experience
Experience working on 0 to 1 first products

Develop specifications, working drawings, instructions and other related documents
Support purchasing efforts to source components and services by obtaining or developing necessary technical specifications
Participate in vendor qualification as necessary
Collaborating with other members of the product development and customer team at Beam
Setting a high bar for excellence, and creating an inclusive environment
Passion for electrification and automation
Ability to inspire, create a strong culture, and recruit top talent
Experience with Designing for thermal considerations
Reliability and test engineering experiences
Experience working with partners and suppliers in Asia

recruiting_advice:
This is our first mechanical engineer hire so culture fit will be extremely important to us. We are looking for someone who can drive innovation and make tradeoffs between customer and user experience, performance, cost, and other constraints. They will have the opportunity to work closely with our founders and collaborate with the other members of the product development and customer team.

**Characteristics that will make your candidate stand out**

avoid_traits: 10 to 15 years of experience in niche products ie. door handles
10 to 15 years of experience in niche products ie. door handles, plastic, automative applications

company.name: Beam
company.description:
Beam is on a mission to revolutionize and decarbonize how we heat people. We are well aware of the emissions problem of keeping people comfortable — energy use from buildings contributes to 27% of global CO2 emissions, the majority of which is due to on-site use of fossil fuels. However, we seldom talk about catering to the distinct and differentiated individual needs of comfort of different people.  

We are building a smart, high-efficiency, revolutionary heating system that flips the orthodoxy of one-size-fits-all solutions that heat entire spaces as a way to heat people. Personal comfort is, in fact, personal and unique to individuals. We have developed a novel way to deliver individualized heat to people through an elegant hardware-software platform that is truly 10x better than what is on the market today.
company.teamAbout:
Our founders have experiences across engineering, design, and public policy, at Tesla, Zoox, Deloitte and others. We recently closed our first institutional capital round, where we brought on some of the best climate tech investors in the world.

If you are mission-driven, product-obsessed, and keen on building something that revolutionizes the customer experience while delivering benefits to the planet and future generations, you are a natural fit for the Beam Team.

name: Design (Frontend) Engineer
description: We are looking for a passionate design engineer (frontend engineer with design chops) with 5-10 years of experience based in New York to join our founding team.

requirements.description: Experience building email and/or other viral consumer apps
Has been a founder or worked as both an engineer and designer
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Art, Design or a related field from a top school (ie. Ivy League, CMU, Berkeley, etc.)
Strong knowledge of and experience with React and other frontend frameworks
Strong portfolio of work demonstrating ability to execute engaging, cutting edge frontend experiences
requirements.explanation: Has worked with amazing brands and has previously done web design and brand design.

requirements.description: Love AI - maybe you’ve been hacking on side projects and hanging out in slack communities
Key phrases to look for: Pixel perfection, eye for design, love for design, Figma
Experience as an early eng team member growing a product from 0 to 1 at a reputable company or reputable startup
requirements.explanation:
It's important that they are startup people. 
Some reputable companies: Instagram/Meta/Snapchat/Pinterest. 
Signs of reputable startup: grew/growing fast and backed by top investors

responsibilities: Build the frontend of a web (and maybe mobile if able) app that helps people stay on top of (and even get joy out of) their email, utilizing the latest LLMs and adjacent technologies
Ensure product is performant and the design is pixel perfect
Work directly with the CEO/founder (designer/product) and other engineers to influence and execute the vision for the product
Ideate, prototype and test new feature ideas quickly
Contribute to design and/or creative direction if able
Define and implement design and prototyping processes and design standards that push the team to create the highest quality product as fast as possible
workPlaceText: We’re currently in NYC/remote, but we will be focusing on more in-person co-working in NYC as we grow.
visa_text_more: We are unable to provide visa sponsorship at this time
experience_info: in frontend engineering at startups with design chops
recruiting_advice: For more information about Micro, please refer to our **Memo** This role will involve building the frontend of a web (and potentially mobile) app, ensuring the product is performant. This will give your candidate the opportunity to work closely with our CEO/founder (designer/product) and other engineers to influence and execute the vision for our product. Additionally, they will have the chance to ideate, prototype, and test new features quickly, and even contribute to design and creative direction if they had the ability/wanted! **Your candidate will be considered top tier if they have these qualities** ● Experience building email and/or other viral consumer apps ● Experience as an early eng team member growing a product from 0 to 1 ● Experience with Swift and React ● Experience as a visual designer or creative director ● Experience building generative AI apps ● Have worked as both an engineer and designer ● Have been a founder before ● Lives in NYC ● **Key phrases:** pixel perfection, eye for design, love for design, Figma **Types of people we would be excited about for this role:** ● Startup people: those who have worked in startups, can move quickly, take a hands-on approach, work long hours for less pay, and exhibit a passion for their work outside of their regular job duties ● Proof of excellence: those who have worked at top tech companies like Meta or Google (but not long tenures, 1-2 years max) ● Frontend leaning full stack engineer or frontend engineer who has a sense for design and is really good at Figma ● Design portfolio with experience in brand design, web design, and has worked with well-known brands ● Works on side projects and does hackathons for fun! Founding Engineer is a unique position that not too many engineers will get a chance to experience in their careers. Being one of the first 5 engineers at an early-stage tech startup is an incredibly challenging yet fulfilling experience. Compared to being an engineer at FAANG companies, there will be a much bigger emphasis on ownership and work ethic. Recruiting a founding engineer is difficult, so here are some tips we think would help you when sourcing and pitching candidates: ● Pitch to candidates that this opportunity means being a founding engineer at a **a16z-backed startup**. This is not only a fulfilling experience where they get to work at a fast-growing startup but also an incredibly strong signal that will be on their resume forever. ● We're backed by one of the best investors in silicon valley (**a16z**) and have a healthy runway. ● Competitive **Salary**: $140k - $190k, **Equity**: 0.5% - 1.5%, and **Benefits**: medical, dental, and vision insurance and unlimited time-off ● Being able to have complete ownership of the work they do and how high-impact it is. They won't just be working on 'easy' problems, internal tools or small features, they'll be given complex/difficult tasks to solve and drive the entire company and product forward. ● As you can probably tell from the expectations of this role, there is a high chance that a candidate will be a great fit if they were previously a founding engineer or a relatively early employee at a fast-growing startup during Seed - Series C stages. ● Being an ex-founder or working on their own projects is also a great signal. ● **This role is NOT for everyone**. If you think a potential candidate is just looking for another job and they don't really care what company they are joining as long as pay & hours are good, we strongly suggest against submitting them. They might have a decent resume but there is an incredibly low chance they'll get hired and will likely go nowhere after 1 interview. It'll be a waste of time for you, the candidate, and our company. ● We also found that typically engineers who are more junior in their career are a better fit for founding engineer. The right candidate for this role will likely have closer to 3 years experience rather than 10 years experience. Thanks!
benefits: Ground floor opportunity - depending on the candidate, this role has strong potential to turn into a leadership position (even cofounder)
Technically challenging, cutting edge and intellectually stimulating product

company.name: Micro
company.description:
Email products are not designed for humans and the way we work, yet the interface hasn’t changed in the 50 years it's been around. With recent advances in LLMs and consumer user experience design, we believe we finally have the tools to be able to change things.

We’re Micro, a stealth-ish startup backed by a16z building a new kind of email experience powered by AI. This goes far beyond AI-generated summaries and responses in the same old Gmail UI that hasn’t changed in 20 years - we’re reimagining everything from the ground up.

Our tiny team has built product at Google and founded venture backed startups funded by some of the best investors.

recruiting_advice:
For more information about Micro, please refer to our Memo

Founding Engineer is a unique position that not too many engineers will get a chance to experience in their careers. Being one of the first 5 engineers at an early-stage tech startup is an incredibly challenging yet fulfilling experience. Compared to being an engineer at FAANG companies, there will be a much bigger emphasis on ownership and work ethic.

Types of people we would be excited about for this role:

  • Startup people: those who have worked in startups, can move quickly, take a hands-on approach, work long hours for less pay, and exhibit a passion for their work outside of their regular job duties

  • Proof of excellence: those who have worked at top tech companies

  • Someone who is more backend leaning and is comfortable with data and familiar with modern AI technologies (OpenAI, Hugging Face, Claude AI, LangChain)

  • Works on AI- or ML-related side projects and does hackathons for fun!

Recruiting a founding engineer is difficult, so here are some tips we think would help you when sourcing and pitching candidates:

  • Pitch to candidates that this opportunity means being a founding engineer at an a16z-backed startup.

    • This is not only a fulfilling experience where they get to work at a fast-growing startup but also an incredibly strong signal that will be on their resume forever.

  • We're backed by one of the best investors in silicon valley (**a16z**) and have a healthy runway.

  • Being able to have complete ownership of the work they do and how high-impact it is. They'll be given complex/difficult tasks to solve and drive the entire company and product forward.

  • There is a high chance that a candidate will be a great fit if they were previously a founding engineer or a relatively early employee at a fast-growing startup during Seed - Series C stages.

  • Being an ex-founder or working on their own projects is also a great signal.

  • This role is NOT for everyone. If you think a potential candidate is just looking for another job and they don't really care what company they are joining as long as pay & hours are good, we strongly suggest against submitting them.

  • We also found that typically engineers who are more junior in their career are a better fit for founding engineer. The right candidate for this role will likely have closer to 3 years experience rather than 10 years experience.

Thanks!
avoid_traits: Primarily worked in legacy industries and larger enterprises (big banks, telecom, large healthcare players)

Technically challenging, cutting edge and intellectually stimulating product

name: Full-Stack Software Engineer
description:
Real-time, bi-directional data syncing across an infinite number of tools is a hard technical problem. Offering this in a way that’s simple and accessible is an equally hard design problem.

We’re looking for someone who is excited by this challenge and the potential impact we can make if we do this right. You’re a product-minded engineer who thrives in a highly autonomous environment. Shipping fast and building awesome things brings you joy.

requirements.description: Has TypeScript experience
Worked in an early-stage, high-growth SaaS startup (fast-moving, early-stage VC-backed environment) or previously a founder
Has strong product sense and high ownership and autonomy
Has Infrastructure and/or data pipeline experience
Proven ability to drive big projects to completion

responsibilities: Build many core functionalities that make Whalesync the most powerful data automation tool (e.g. data merging, sync rollbacks, scaling to millions of records, etc.)
Build many core features that make Whalesync simple and accessible for both developers and non-developers (e.g. sync previews, auto-schema creation, data visualization, etc.)
Work directly with our customers to help solve their problems
Ship a bunch of code!
workPlaceText: Workday must overlap by at least 5 hours with San Francisco, CA, USA
visa_text_more: We are unable to provide visa sponsorship at this time
experience_info: in software engineering or related field, we will most likely hire someone with less than 10 YOE out of college
recruiting_advice:
We have a highly complex technical product and an intentionally small team. Every member of the team is expected to have high ownership of projects across the entire stack.

Type of person who will thrive here

  • Experience at a fast-growing, VC-backed startup -> Seed to Series A experience, pre-PMF

  • Wants to write a bunch of code and ship a bunch of product

  • Excited to jump in and work on all different types of features as long as they benefit our customers

  • Can handle complex, ambiguous problems

Type of person who will NOT thrive here

  • Big tech attitude -> likes stability, structure, 9-5

  • Manager -> prefers managing as opposed to writing code

  • Smart & slow -> likes to think through problems really deeply to ensure they get the right answer

  • Excited and unfocused -> takes conversations in all directions

What we value

  • We’re always shipping - fast, scrappy people thrive here.

  • We’re obsessed with goals - we’re here to turn a small startup into a long-lasting company.

  • We start with the customer - we all talk to users and work backward from their problems.

  • We have an outlier output bar - we’re an intentionally small, highly effective team.

Our tech stack:

  • AWS Fargate

  • NestJS backend

  • Next.js frontend

  • Postgres and Redis data stores

Whalesync in TechCrunch here
avoid_traits: Lack of passion -> thinks of work as "just a job"
Seeks stability -> ideal job is a 9-5 where major changes are rare
Unclear communicator -> all over the place when you talk to them or speaks non-stop for long periods of time
Slow -> not used to moving quickly in delivering projects
benefits: Three weeks PTO in addition to holidays and sick days
Top-tier health, dental, and vision insurance
Latest productivity software such as Notion, Linear, and Superhuman

company.name: Whalesync
company.description:
Whalesync makes data syncing easy. Our automation platform syncs data between key business tools like HubSpot and Airtable. We give developers and ops teams two-way, real-time sync, so they can build production-ready workflows.

This makes it easy to manage things like customer data, marketing campaigns, and blog content spread across their SaaS applications without needing to hire software engineers and build a data pipeline
benefits: Three weeks PTO in addition to holidays and sick days
Top-tier health, dental, and vision insurance
Latest productivity software such as Notion, Linear, and Superhuman
company.productDescription: Whalesync is a no-code data automation platform that lets you sync data across key business tools like Airtable and HubSpot.
company.teamAbout: Whalesync launched during Y Combinator’s S21 cohort. Since then we’ve raised $4M from some of the world’s top investors. We’re now trusted by hundreds of companies like Ramp, Webflow, and Alchemy, and process millions of transactions every day. Many of our customers enjoy the product so much they tell all their friends.

name: Senior Backend Engineer, Infrastructure
description:
We’re looking for an incredible senior engineer to help us build the future of blockchain scalability.

This is an ideal opportunity for an engineer who is already passionate about tackling problems in blockchain scalability, or looking to break into the blockchain engineering space. If you’re looking to work in a fast-paced, high-impact team and help shape the direction of our product and company, this position is for you.

This role will be heavily involved in key strategic and architectural decisions for the company, but will be **primarily an IC and not a managerial role.**

requirements.description: Has experience designing, building, and maintaining robust APIs
Has experience with infrastructure-as-code tools like Terraform and building and operating Kubernetes clusters
Has experience writing backend services in Go or Typescript
Has significant experience with DevOps and cloud infrastructure and a strong background with cloud computing platforms, especially AWS
Has experience working in a cloud infrastructure role at a high-growth startup that successfully transitioned from seed to Series B funding stages
requirements.explanation: Highly preferred

requirements.description: Senior-level infrastructure experience at leading blockchain companies
Undergraduate CS degree from top CS school (Ivy, MIT, CMU, Stanford, UC Berkeley, and Waterloo)
(HIGHLY PREFERRED) Protocol Engineering experience
requirements.explanation: Does not necessarily have to be a protocol engineer at a large blockchain project, but should have a fundamental understanding of how blockchains work

responsibilities: Own significant components of Caldera's core infrastructure
Architect and develop backend systems to ensure the smooth operation of Caldera chains
Build out features end-to-end, from idea to production
Improve our DevOps pipeline, which allows Caldera chains to be deployed reliably and securely
Increase the reliability of our infrastructure by continuously improving the observability stack
Be a source of technical leadership and mentorship; for example, providing high-quality feedback and code reviews for junior engineers
workPlaceText: We’re located in San Francisco, and work in-person from the Financial District. However, we are open to global remote candidates, with a preference for US-friendly time zones!
visa_text_more: H1B transfers for employees already issued H1B visas at a different company, F1 OPT (super, super easy) assuming they have enough time in their OPT for us to attempt to sponsor a more permanent visa, TN visa (NAFTA visa, Canada and Mexico), H1B1 (special visa only for Singaporean and Chileans), E-3 visa (Australians)
experience_info: in software engineering or related field
recruiting_advice:
We're looking for a Senior Backend Engineer, Infrastructure to help us build the future of blockchain scalability.

This candidate will be responsible for owning significant components of Caldera's core infrastructure, architecting and developing backend systems, building features end-to-end, improving our DevOps pipeline, and increasing the reliability of our infrastructure. They will also provide technical leadership and mentorship to junior engineers.

**If your candidate has the following, they will be considered a top candidate:**
● Top-Tier educational background with experience in big tech or hypergrowth startups at an early stage
● Have familiarity with observability tools like Grafana or Datadog
● Are familiar with how blockchains like Ethereum or Bitcoin work under the hood
● Are up-to-date with Ethereum scaling solutions such as sidechains or rollups
● Have an understanding of cryptography primitives, such as hash functions or digital signatures
● Have built Ethereum “dapps” before

You can read more about what we do at https://calderaxyz.gitbook.io/caldera-documentation/getting-started/overview
benefits: Custom workplace setup (with monitors, peripherals, and accessories of your choosing)

company.name: Caldera
company.description:
Caldera enables dynamic, scalable blockchain experiences. Currently, dapps that are deployed to general-purpose blockchain compete with thousands of other applications for space on the network — this can lead to "https://www.coindesk.com/tech/2022/01/06/polygon-under-accidental-attack-from-swarm-of-sunflower-farmers/"

That’s where we come in. We’re building software that makes it easy for the most innovative blockchain applications to launch their own ultra-performant blockchains (rollups), enabling applications to own their ecosystem, scale to millions of users, and provide a superior user experience to their players.  

We’re located in San Francisco, and work in-person from the Financial District
benefits: Custom workplace setup (with monitors, peripherals, and accessories of your choosing)
company.teamAbout:
We're a bunch of passionate technologists who love to sink our teeth into interesting problems. We have a tight knit top tier team, previously tackling engineering problems at Google, Meta, Coinbase, and Jump Trading!

We’re backed by some of the best investors in the valley (including Sequoia and Dragonfly Capital) and offer competitive pay, an equity grant in the company, and full benefits.

We’re headquartered in San Francisco.

name: Software Engineer, Systems
description:
We’re looking for an incredible software engineer to help us build the future of blockchain scalability.

This is an ideal opportunity for an engineer who is already passionate about tackling problems in blockchain scalability, or looking to break into the blockchain engineering space. If you’re looking to work in a fast-paced, high-impact team and help shape the direction of our product and company, this position is for you.

requirements.description: Familiar with how blockchains like Ethereum or Bitcoin work under the hood and up-to-date with Ethereum scaling solutions such as sidechains or rollups
Willing to get your hands dirty tackling devops problems and are confident with performance optimization, identifying bottlenecks and scalability concerns
Has previous experience working with distributed or embedded systems
Has implemented or used a consensus algorithm (eg. Paxos/Raft, pBFT, tendermint) in the past and has an understanding of cryptography primitives, such as hash functions or digital signatures
Has previously built Ethereum “dapps” with Solidity or Yul
Has significant open-source contributions, especially in blockchain clients/node software, databases, networking, or programming languages/frameworks
Has familiarity with distributed systems concepts like CAP theorem, and enjoys thinking through and designing around trade-offs
Has deep knowledge of Go, Rust or similar languages
Bachelor's degree from top CS program (Ivy, MIT, Stanford, UC Berkeley, CMU, Waterloo, University of Michigan) OR experience with a leading blockchain company/project

company.name: Caldera
company.description:
Caldera enables dynamic, scalable blockchain experiences. Currently, dapps that are deployed to general-purpose blockchain compete with thousands of other applications for space on the network — this can lead to "https://www.coindesk.com/tech/2022/01/06/polygon-under-accidental-attack-from-swarm-of-sunflower-farmers/"

That’s where we come in. We’re building software that makes it easy for the most innovative blockchain applications to launch their own ultra-performant blockchains (rollups), enabling applications to own their ecosystem, scale to millions of users, and provide a superior user experience to their players.  

We’re located in San Francisco, and work in-person from the Financial District

name: Visual Designer
description:
At Azuki, you will have an opportunity to build a decentralized brand at the intersection of art, technology, and culture that will redefine how a global community can operate collaboratively. The lines between the physical and digital worlds are blurring and the rules are being rewritten. We’re building the right team to navigate and pioneer a multimedia brand for the future.

In this role, you'll blend your expertise in graphic design, illustration, layout, typography, and color theory to produce beautiful designs that advance the Azuki brand. With a keen sense of modern graphic design balanced with illustrative artistry, you'll play a crucial role in shaping the visual direction of our brand.

name: Founding Engineer (Full Stack Software)
description: We're looking for a Founding Engineer (Full Stack Software) to join our team! You will lead the development of our Core Product: a soil carbon measurement, reporting, and verification (MRV) platform. As the first technical hire, you will work directly with the founders and own the entire technology stack, including making product decisions. You will set the technical roadmap and have the opportunity to build out a world-class technical team and culture as you see best.

Experience with climate tech startups

🔁 A track record of shipping and going through the full product development cycle right from writing the first line of code to product in the hands of users and iterating quickly on feedback
🧱 Experience with setting up the technology stack and development infrastructure from Day 1 and scaling it with growth
⏳ Ability to develop infrastructure/pipelines to support Machine Learning / Remote Sensing workflows
💪 Proactive and collaborative self-starter with a strong ability to attract other top technical talent and lead them effectively
☀️ Past experience working in climate/agriculture is not a requirement, but a passion for climate is a plus!

♦️ Past multidisciplinary teamwork (i.e. e.g. working on software in healthcare) is a huge plus, as you will be working with an interdisciplinary team with expertise in AI, Remote Sensing, Carbon Markets, Soil Carbon Modeling, Sustainable Finance

🤖 Machine Learning and Remote Sensing experience is not required, but understanding how to support these workflows (e.g. setting up data pipelines, setting up infrastructure to parallelize model runs, automating the deployment of models to integrate with the core MRV product) is a huge bonus!

🌎 You care deeply about climate change and feel a strong moral responsibility to act now. This extends into all facets of your life: both personal and professional. No action is too small and no goal is too big. Whether you have turned vegan or swear by public transport, we are big believers in embracing sustainability as a mindset and would love to learn what this means for you!

company.name: Terradot
company.description:
Problem: Globally, soils have the potential to sequester over 1 billion tons of carbon through regenerative agriculture practices and emerging solutions like biochar and enhanced rock weathering. However today, measurement, reporting, and verification of soil carbon sequestration is not cost effective, accurate, or scalable. This prevents large-scale climate finance from being deployed to rapidly scale soil carbon improvement despite its massive potential to combat climate change, improve food security, and alleviate extreme poverty. 

Terradot is building a global measurement, reporting, and verification (MRV) platform to accelerate high-integrity carbon removal and storage around the world. With Stanford’s Soil and Environmental Biogeochemistry Lab, we leverage technological innovation using ground truth sampling, remote sensing, and AI modeling to accurately and scalably measure soil carbon. For soil carbon project developers, Terradot decreases the time, cost, and complexity of MRV while increasing the integrity of the carbon removal credits for carbon buyers. This enables large-scale deployment of climate finance to incentivize the adoption of sustainable practices. We are focused on improving soil health in emerging economies to maximize global sequestration and community impact.

We are a public-benefit corporation driven by passion and purpose in service to our planet, people, and prosperity. Terradot is backed by world-class investors including Floodgate, John Doerr, Kleiner Perkins, Sheryl Sandberg, Ponderosa Ventures, 776 Foundation (Alexis Ohanian), George Roberts, and Stanford’s TomKat Center for Sustainable Energy. We are advised by an all-star team of Stanford climate professors with 100,000+ citations collectively.
company.productDescription: A global measurement, reporting, and verification (MRV) platform to accelerate high-integrity carbon removal and storage around the world. With Stanford’s Soil and Environmental Biogeochemistry Lab, we leverage technological innovation using ground truth sampling, remote sensing, and AI modeling to accurately and scalably measure soil carbon
company.teamAbout:
We’re based in the SF/Bay Area and are fostering a strong in-person first, collaborative, mission-driven culture. Our founders graduated from Stanford with a focus on Climate Science and AI. They have previously founded and led an international nonprofit that has rescued over 100 million pounds of surplus food from farmers to food banks and published AI+Remote Sensing for Climate Change research under Andrew Ng as part of the Stanford ML Group.

Values

- Curiosity: Most solutions to reach net zero do not exist yet. We are looking for sensationally curious team players who use a beginner’s mindset to find novel solutions and embrace the growth mindset to overcome setbacks   
- Kindness: Great teams change the world, we believe kindness is the foundation to build great teams on and also guides the impact we aim to have on our planet to pay it forward. 
- Mamba Mentality: Kobe Bryant’s Mamba Mentality combines love, passion, and borderline obsession to improve every day and create a culture of collectively becoming the best we can be at our shared dream.
- Speed and Scale: We value teammates who are ready to move at the speed and scale necessary to meet the urgency of the climate crisis. If you are looking to coast, stick to big tech.
- Multidisciplinary and Multicultural Collaboration: The ability to think across disciplines and work with people from a variety of backgrounds is not just a requirement, but a unique advantage given that our work spans multiple domains and impacts communities around the world.

recruiting_advice: **Feel free to share more information about the founders!** ● **Florian Juengermann: Tesla Autopilot, ICPC finalist** ● **Alfred Wahlforss: 2X Founder** **We're funded by Sequoia + AI Grant!** Founding Engineer is a unique position that not too many engineers will get a chance to experience in their careers. It's incredibly challenging but also fulfilling. Recruiting a founding engineer, especially for a stealth startup like us without much public presence can be difficult, so here are some tips I think would help you when sourcing and pitching candidates: ● Pitch to candidates that being a founding engineer is not only a fulfilling experience where they get to work at a fast-growing startup but also an incredibly strong signal that will be on their resume forever. Having been hiring managers before, we know every company would want to hire someone who was a founding engineer. ● Being able to have complete ownership of the work they do and how high-impact it is. They won't just be working on 'easy' problems, internal tools or small features, they'll be given complex/difficult tasks to solve and drive the entire company and product forward. ● As you can probably tell from the expectations of this role, there is a high chance that a candidate will be a great fit if they were previously a founding engineer or a relatively early employee at a fast-growing startup during Seed - Series C stages. ● Being an ex-founder or working on their own projects is also a great signal. ● We also found that typically engineers who are more junior in their career are a better fit for founding engineer. The right candidate for this role will likely have closer to 2-4 years experience, no more than 6 years. ● Here is some more info you can share on why working at Merlin is great: **Why join Merlin?**

company.name: Merlin
company.description: Everyone hates surveys. They’re tedious to fill out and give shallow data. That’s because they’re only a proxy for the real thing: *conversations*. Through a conversation, you can ask follow-up questions and get deep insights in a way that’s fun for the interviewee. Except you can’t have 1:1 conversations with everyone… Merlin has built an AI interviewer that can ask follow-up questions, like a conversation, but at the scale and ease of use of a survey. We are growing fast and funded by **Sequoia** + **AI Grant**! There’s been $30B+ of market cap created from bringing surveys online. Our partner at Sequoia, **Bryan Schreier**, was the first investor in Qualtrics – the $12B survey company.

name: Software Engineer (Infrastructure/DevOps)
description:
As a Cleanlab software engineer, you will be responsible for Cleanlab Studio, a user-friendly web app built on our ML algorithms. You’ll orchestrate cloud infrastructure for data ingestion, model training, and data analysis, and you’ll optimize the reliability of our web app, model deployments, and data management systems. This is a position for those who want to tackle challenging DevOps problems and have a massive impact on their company – you’ll be building and maintaining systems from the ground up (not working with streamlined infrastructure like in a Big Tech company).

We encourage applications from software engineers with DevOps and cloud experience who are interested in machine learning (no ML experience required). Your contributions to our SaaS tool will be used by data scientists/engineers across all industries to improve the quality of their data and reliability of ML models produced from this data. Come help us build the next generation of data-centric AI!

company.name: Cleanlab
company.description:
Everything we do at Cleanlab is guided by our north star – to improve the world’s ML data more easily and quicker than any other solution – enabling AI systems to train more reliably on real-world, messy, error-prone data. We develop next-generation data-centric AI, open-source algorithms and provide no-code SaaS enterprise solutions to help individuals and teams at companies (across all industries) diagnose/fix issues in their datasets and produce more reliable ML models by providing clean labels for training.

While many companies can help store/manage data or develop ML models, there exist few solutions today to improve the quality of existing data, which is the core asset of the modern enterprise. This is where you come in. At Cleanlab, you’ll be able to take ownership of critical projects that pioneer the future of data-centric AI.

We are a hybrid company, with over half of our team (and office) located in San Francisco.
benefits: Premium health insurance (+ dental and vision)
Professional development stipend to keep up with the latest innovations in ML and software.
Competitive salary (+ equity offering for certain roles), with regular opportunities for a raise if things are going well.
Relocation bonus to move to San Francisco
company.teamAbout: Prior to Cleanlab, our founders (3 ML PhDs from MIT) worked at OpenAI, Google, Microsoft, Amazon, AWS, Facebook AI Research (FAIR), Dropbox, Oculus, Palantir, NASA, General Electric, MIT Lincoln Laboratory, MIT, Harvard, and Stanford – at every place we worked we repeatedly encountered the same issue – AI solutions failed to work reliably on real-world, human-centric data due to label errors and poor data quality. So, we spent eight years of PhD research at MIT inventing a new field to solve this problem and after successful pilots with world-leading organizations, Cleanlab emerged.

company.name: Coining MFG
company.description:
Coining MFG LLC, with a proud history of over 100 years in operation, is a leading manufacturer of critical components for the aerospace, medical, and telecom industries. As an essential business, we have consistently delivered revenue growth and profitability throughout our long-standing presence in the market. Our supportive and collaborative work environment has been a key factor in our success.

Coining MFG's manufacturing department is equipped with over 100 specialty machines including presses with capacities up to 400 tons and stroke speeds as high as 400 strokes per minute. The integration of our Wire EDM, CNC machining, and Screw machine capabilities allows us to service specific application requests with the broadest selection of manufacturing and engineering solutions.

company.teamAbout:
We are experts in precision metal manufacturing. Our vertical integration strategy allows us to control all aspects of engineering, tool design, manufacturing and quality control. The result of this strategy is lower prototype and production costs, compressed lead times, and tight process controls, which results in superior quality.

Our engineering and quality staff remain at the leading edge of manufacturing methods, techniques, and industry processes for products that require Forming, Drawing, Coining, EDM, CNC Milling, or Screw Machine fabrication. Our engineering department is ready to receive requests electronically utilizing Pro Engineer/AutoCAD.

name: Technical Support Engineer (Full-stack)
description: Sybill is in search of a full-stack engineer who has a fervent desire to perform dual roles - as a Technical Support Engineer (Full-stack). This distinctive position sits at the juncture of customer service and product innovation. It's an arena for tech-savvy individuals passionate about interfacing with clients. The ideal candidate will guide customers in feature development, troubleshoot issues, and draw insights from these engagements to enhance our main product.

requirements.description: Familiarity with full-stack technologies such as Python, React, Shell Scripting, etc.
Familiarity with ChatGPT to boost productivity is a plus.
Possess exceptional communication and people skills, with the knack for simplifying intricate technical details for a varied audience
A minimum of one year of supporting large-scale software solutions
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or an analogous field is mandatory.

responsibilities: Customer-Centric Solutions: Take charge from start to finish in resolving customer issues. This involves leveraging your full-stack engineering know-how to pin down potential bugs, devising test cases, identifying interim solutions, and consistently updating all parties involved.

Automation and Innovation: Aim to automate as many aspects of your role as possible using a variety of tools, AI, and potentially API programming. Preserve your expertise in the shape of knowledge base notes and articles. Innovate by developing resources that benefit both customers and colleagues – this includes documentation, training initiatives, processes, and tools.
Voice of the Customer: Here at Sybill, every team member is an ambassador for our users. We urge you to channel your customer success insights into shaping our product's future direction.
US/Pacific Timezone Support: Given that a majority of our clientele are US-based, you'll need to be available for at least 8 hours between 7 am PT to 6 pm PT.
workPlaceText: We especially welcome candidates from LATAM, Canada, Australia, and Europe. Given that a majority of our clientele are US-based, you'll need to be available for at least 8 hours between 7 am PT to 6 pm PT.
experience_info: as a full-stack engineer, preferably with proven experience in client interactions.
recruiting_advice:
We are in search of a full-stack engineer who has a fervent desire to perform dual roles - as a Technical Support Engineer (Full-stack). This distinctive position sits at the juncture of customer service and product innovation. It's an arena for tech-savvy individuals passionate about interfacing with clients. 

Our ideal candidate will guide customers in feature development, troubleshoot issues, and draw insights from these engagements to enhance our main product. 

**✨Ideal Candidate Criteria:**

● Ideally, candidates should have between 1 to 4 years of experience.
● Proficient with Python and has past experience working with it.
● Has experience in a customer-facing role, ideally in a software company, where they have helped clients succeed from a technical perspective.
● Familiarity with AWS.
● Familiarity with customer support tools like Intercom (which we use!), Zendesk, Freshdesk, etc.

We especially welcome candidates from **LATAM, Canada, Australia, and Europe**.
benefits: Reimbursement for health and dental insurance for both the employee and their dependents.

company.name: Sybill
company.description:
At Sybill, we are building the first-ever recommendation engine for B2B deals to boost the conversion rate by providing tailored, stage-specific recommendations at each step of the deal journey. This includes understanding and analyzing all of the customer interactions, including their non-verbal cues during calls, to offer strategic advice to sellers. With our deal engine, we can automate various administrative tasks like note-taking, email follow-ups, and participant research. The heart of Sybill is a dynamic knowledge database that uses customized LLMs and our own behavior AI to continuously learn from past and ongoing deals, making it the central nervous system for any GTM organization.

We’re growing super quickly (doubling revenue every quarter, currently ~$500k ARR). Our success can be attributed to the incredible value our product delivers within a short period. With over 100+ satisfied customers, we have secured $3.5M+ in funding from top-tier angel investors and VC firms who have a track record of building and investing in world-class companies.
benefits: Reimbursement for health and dental insurance for both the employee and their dependents.
company.teamAbout:
We operate as a lean, agile team of ~10 highly talented motivated individuals, with the majority located in the San Francisco Bay Area. Our collective passion lies in reshaping the future of B2B customer interactions, and we are excited to invite you to join us on this exhilarating journey 🚀.

Our founding team has deep AI backgrounds from Stanford, Harvard and UC San Diego, and 20+ years of experience in B2B sales. Today, Sybill helps customer-facing teams eliminate mundane tasks like CRM updates, note-taking and follow-ups, while enhancing their deal execution with deep prospect insights.

name: Head of Engineering
description:
We're looking for someone whose love for people and Data/technology runs incredibly deep, as does their ambition to improve the way Data Science and Machine Learning are practiced in the future. You should currently work as an engineering manager but have extensive software engineering experience, ideally with experience in a dynamic startup environment. You should be comfortable architecting large-scale software systems from the ground up, and deeply familiar with B2B cloud enterprise software and ideally data platforms (AI expertise not necessary).

You will manage a team of software engineers building a cutting-edge cloud application with many users, who each have many datasets, some of which are quite large. Your contributions to our SaaS tool will be used by data scientists/engineers across all industries to improve the quality of their data and reliability of ML models produced from this data. Come help us build the next generation of data-centric AI!

requirements.description: CS degree from a top tier university (MIT, berkeley, stanford, CMU, Waterloo, Harvard, Princeton, etc.)
high EQ and conversational abilities (any recruiter who had phone call with candidate should want to work for them).
Comfortable architecting large-scale software systems from the ground up
experience having worked as rank-and-file programmer. We are not interested in candidates that have never worked as software engineer.
Experience working in B2B cloud enterprise software, ideally also some experience in data platforms and data sharing across enterprises (less important though, even less important is AI experience)

responsibilities: You will manage a team of software engineers building a cutting-edge cloud application with many users, who each have many datasets, some of which are quite large. Your contributions to our SaaS tool will be used by data scientists/engineers across all industries to improve the quality of their data and reliability of ML models produced from this data.

Start out managing a team of 5, grow this to ~15 through external hiring. Create strong engineering culture in our organization. Manage day-to-day development of SaaS application (backend, frontend, cloud infra)

Oversee integrations of our software with big enterprises cloud data stores. Ideal candidates will have extensive experience working in data, particularly software that processes other companies' data
workPlaceText: We are a hybrid company, we need candidates who are enthusiastic (not just willing) to work Mon-Wen from SF office
visa_text_more: We are willing to sponsor visas for the right candidate
experience_info: spanning across software engineering/architecture and team management (management experience should be 4-10 years, not more as they're too high level then)
recruiting_advice: Working at Cleanlab is awesome! Beyond the opportunity to work at a well-funded AI startup with an incredible, friendly founding team of MIT graduates, all full-time employees receive the following: ● **Annual travel stipend:** Travel enhances our empathy with different cultures and enables us to work together more effectively. It’s how we grow and learn: traveling is an essential part of what makes us human. At Cleanlab, every two months you will receive a reimbursable travel benefit. This is a unique benefit that lets you work from Paris for a week in February, then take a backpacking trip in the Andes for a weekend in March. ● **Premium health insurance:** We provide a fantastic $4 (we cover the rest) health insurance option. We also provide a $0 deductible 100% coverage premium health care option for those who prefer the best health insurance. ● **Stipend for attending conferences:** to keep up with the latest innovations in ML and software. ● **Competitive salary** (+ equity offering for certain roles), with regular opportunities for a raise if things are going well. We have strong preference for candidates who can be in office at least a couple days each week and we aren't looking for candidates who are too high-level. They need to be capable of the following on as-needed basis (not part of daily job description): creating specs, reviewing PRs, architecting cloud systems, answering tech stack questions, technical interviews for hiring. You can read about how Cleanlab went from MIT PhD research to tech used by Amazon, Google, etc. **here** Also see what Google, Wells Fargo, and other Cleanlab users think **here**
avoid_traits: degree not in CS, or from university that does not stand out as exceptional
polite/proper communicator, but not somebody who gives you the urge to go work for them (we want them to help us build the best engineering team out there). We require high EQ and good energy
not enough experience working as rank-and-file programmer. We are not interested in candidates that have never worked as software engineer.
too high-level (over 10 years experience in management)
benefits: Stipend for attending conferences to keep up with the latest innovations in ML and software.
Competitive salary (+ equity offering for certain roles), with regular opportunities for a raise if things are going well.
Parental Leave. Take time with your new family members!
Unlimited PTO + Unlimited sick days + 10 company-wide holidays
Hybrid work (our office is in San Francisco)

company.name: Cleanlab
company.description:
Everything we do at Cleanlab is guided by our north star – to improve the world’s ML data more easily and quicker than any other solution – enabling AI systems to train more reliably on real-world, messy, error-prone data. We develop next-generation data-centric AI, open-source algorithms and provide no-code SaaS enterprise solutions to help individuals and teams at companies (across all industries) diagnose/fix issues in their datasets and produce more reliable ML models by providing clean labels for training.

While many companies can help store/manage data or develop ML models, there exist few solutions today to improve the quality of existing data, which is the core asset of the modern enterprise. This is where you come in. At Cleanlab, you’ll be able to take ownership of critical projects that pioneer the future of data-centric AI.

We are a hybrid company, with over half of our team (and office) located in San Francisco.
benefits: Premium health insurance (+ dental and vision)
Professional development stipend to keep up with the latest innovations in ML and software.
Competitive salary (+ equity offering for certain roles), with regular opportunities for a raise if things are going well.
Relocation bonus to move to San Francisco
company.teamAbout: Prior to Cleanlab, our founders (3 ML PhDs from MIT) worked at OpenAI, Google, Microsoft, Amazon, AWS, Facebook AI Research (FAIR), Dropbox, Oculus, Palantir, NASA, General Electric, MIT Lincoln Laboratory, MIT, Harvard, and Stanford – at every place we worked we repeatedly encountered the same issue – AI solutions failed to work reliably on real-world, human-centric data due to label errors and poor data quality. So, we spent eight years of PhD research at MIT inventing a new field to solve this problem and after successful pilots with world-leading organizations, Cleanlab emerged.

name: Software Engineer
description: As a Lead Engineer, you will play a pivotal role working with a diverse team of engineers and scientists with different backgrounds and areas of expertise. We believe that the real potential of AI will be achieved through the right interfaces, properly set data layers, and fast development cycles. Our lead engineers achieve these goals by mentoring  and leading developers, fostering curiosity and deep technical understanding.

requirements.description: Has a strong foundation in data structures, algorithm design, and problem-solving
requirements.explanation: Must be able to tackle complex challenges with ease.

requirements.description: Exhibit a proven ability to write clean and efficient code that adheres to best practices.
Track record of successfully architecting, building, and scaling complex systems, preferably in the realm of AI or machine learning.
Display a strong user-centric approach and the ability to translate user requirements into practical design solutions.
Experience leading teams to build systems where ML is the product itself, or essential to the product's success
Has proven ability to deliver technical products and solutions that have direct impact on revenue
Sincere interest in the future of ML/AI
requirements.explanation: The candidate has an interest and enthusiasm for Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning

responsibilities: Lead Development: As the lead engineer, you will spearhead the development of the next generation of machine learning software. Your expertise will drive innovation in three main areas: Core Intelligence-ML Modeling, Telemetry-Impact & Algorithmic Health, and AI interfaces. You will oversee and contribute to building out functionalities in all three domains.

Architect and Scale Complex Systems: Leverage your strong intuition and engineering acumen to architect, build, and scale sophisticated systems that power our active learning platform. Your experience in designing robust and efficient solutions will be vital in pushing the boundaries of what AI can achieve.

Collaborate with Cross-functional Teams: Work closely with Product Designers, ML Scientists, and external stakeholders to deliver user-facing products that delight our customers. Your ability to translate user requirements into well-designed solutions will be crucial in shaping the future of AI-powered applications.
workPlaceText: Work with our fully in-office team at 35 E 21st. We also provide a sign on bonus for anyone who needs to relocate to cover costs.
visa_text_more: We can only support certain visas like H1B transfer and TN visa
experience_info: as an engineer or in related field
recruiting_advice:
We have an extremely high bar for talent at Arena across all dimensions of a candidate. Below I'll outline our philosophy for recruiting, what we prioritize, and who we look to bring onto the team. You can also read a bit more here (https://www.complete.so/blog/hiring-in-ai-principles-from-arena-ai). You can also look at the current team here (https://www.arena-ai.com/about). We're backed by Founders Fund, Initialized Capital, and Goldcrest Capital. 

**Recruiting Priorities:**
● Above all else, we look for people who have excelled compared to their peers, and have had a sharp upward trajectory in their career.
● We care about the amount of ownership candidates have taken on in their roles. Regardless of the technical rigor of the tasks they may have completed in their roles, if they were not given ownership and responsibility of the outcome and consequences of that work, they will not be a good fit for Arena. We give engineers a high degree of autonomy to problem solve across a broad range of projects, and we need to trust that incoming candidates understand that ownership and have successfully executed on high impact outcomes before. 
● We want candidates who have experience building 0-1, meaning that they have taken something from ideation to architecture, actually built/deployed it themselves, and have owned the consequences of that effort, ideally resulting in revenue impact for their company. This ideally comes from experience in growing startups, but does not necessarily have to. 

**Arena's Culture:**
● We have a very high performance, very low ego culture. We will never hire a candidate who is technically brilliant if they are not sincerely humble, willing to learn from people with less experience, willing to admit when they are wrong, and own their mistakes. 
● We work hard. The technical and commercial problems we're solving are inherently very challenging, and part of our differentiation as a company working with enterprises is that we are willing to do the difficult, gritty work to win relationships and revenue that other companies are not willing to do. There will absolutely be times when engineers work late nights for a week or two, but that is certainly not consistent. That being said, we have unlimited PTO and people use it. We trust people to execute at the highest level, and take care of themselves. 
● We have high conviction in what we're building. Arena was founded over 4 years ago on the belief that transformers can provide enormous impact in decision autonomy for the enterprise, we are not part of the wave of recent AI hype. We know that not every candidate will be an ML diehard following the industry for years, but we expect them to have deeper conviction than "AI is the future." If the candidate can't articulate specifically why they're excited to be involved in AI/ML, they are not for us. 
● We believe in the power of face time. We work in person with each other 5 days a week (of course, people work from home when they need to). Our scientists and engineers travel globally to meet customers and users, understand their pain points, and learn more about their world to build better products.
● We actually enjoy working with each other, and we only hire people we're genuinely excited to work with. We screen out candidates who are not great collaborators/communicators immediately. 

**General Notes:** 
● FAANG engineers generally do not make it through our interview process (it's not very long, but the bar is high). We have some success with Amazon engineers, but candidates from Meta and Google have never made it through the process. 
● Please do not submit candidates you have only interacted with on LinkedIn / email and don't have a real relationship with. 
● We will not change or adapt the interview process for any candidate, outside of considerations for disabilities. 
● We will not match what FAANG candidates get offered. If candidates don't accept that they'll likely have a lower base than they would at FAANG, they shouldn't interview.
● If a candidate has built around ML or built ML models, please have them list the types of models and techniques they've used (e.g. were they building/using convolutional neural nets, recurrent neural nets, transformers,  reinforcement learning, active learning, supervised / unsupervised learning, etc).

**Selling Points:**
● We are a Series A, but we're much further along the journey than most Series A companies. We were revenue positive before our Series A, and continue to be very revenue focused and financially healthy.
● There is a very small group of companies who have successfully closed multi-million dollar enterprise deals in AI - Scale, Anduril, Applied Intution, and us (I'm not a market expert, I could be missing one or two). 
● Our founders are pragmatic about the business - we let revenue dictate when we grow, and are strategic about heading headcount to the team. We're building Arena as a fundamentally sustainable venture, not depending on venture capital for survival.
avoid_traits: Has only worked at large corporations
Has not owned delivery of projects with revenue impact
Is not willing to do "low level" work to support the team
Prioritizing managing in their next role
benefits: 99% of the monthly premium for Aetna medical insurance, plus vision and dental coverage
Attendance to top conferences in their fields

company.name: Arena
company.description:
Arena empowers businesses across industries to make high frequency, critical path decisions fully autonomous. Our products have helped some of the world’s largest CPG companies transform their sales and supply chains into increasingly autonomous, self-learning systems — unlocking efficiencies and resulting in better, more affordable consumer experiences. 

Arena knows that Autonomy can help organizations tackle much more, from delivering critical goods and services more affordably, sustainably, and equitably to the world, to reducing green premiums on renewable energy to compete more effectively with fossil fuels.
benefits: 99% of the monthly premium for Aetna medical insurance, plus vision and dental coverage
Attendance to top conferences in their fields
company.teamAbout:
Our name is inspired by Theodore Roosevelt’s ‘Citizenship in a Republic’ speech, which pays homage to the ‘(hu)man in the Arena’. To us, entering the Arena means committing oneself fully and accepting the risk of failure in the pursuit of an audacious, worthy cause.

We’re a close-knit tribe of scientists and builders exploring the boundaries of how artificial intelligence can benefit humanity. If you share our passion for delving deep into real-world problems and solving them with fully autonomous AI, join us in the Arena.

name: DevOps Engineer - Infrastructure
description: As a DevOps/Infra Engineer at Arena you will own the implementation and improvement of our cloud, devops, and security landscapes. You will work closely with our senior engineers and product teams to execute projects that allow our technology to scale as we grow our customer base, ensure we uphold our security and compliance standards, and improve the productivity of our engineers.

recruiting_advice:
We're looking for a candidate who has a passion for AI and building machine learning systems. We also want them to be passionate about good engineering, clean code, and scalability. Try finding those who have interests and enthusiasm for Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning! This role will be required to work on multiple teams and be able to context switch. Having an eagerness to 0 to 1 on business critical efforts will definitely be something to look out for. We prioritize fundamental competency which can come from any rigorous environment, often big tech candidates don’t meet the tech bar. Candidates should have significant experience in AWS (we host everything in EC2) and Terraform. We need someone who has a clear track record of building infrastructure and cloud systems from scratch for ML based products or otherwise high data throughput systems. Candidates that primarily do support, manage tooling, or handle tickets are likely not the right fit. 

**Candidates can expect to work on the following projects such as:**

**In the short term this includes:**
● Reducing devops friction and failures
● Automating AWS infrastructure management
● Owning permission and access controls implementation
● Ensuring SOC compliance 
● Improving monitoring and observability 

**In the long term, this includes:**
● Developing self-service infrastructure provisioning and software delivery
● Owning SOC2 compliance and automating our security posture
● Ensuring all production systems are managed via Terraform
● Improving our monitoring and alerting systems, working closely with our product development teams
● Owning container orchestration systems
● Pioneering and implementing best practices for Arena’s cloud infrastructure 

✨We're backed by top investors like Founders Fund, Goldcrest Capital! We also provide a sign on bonus for anyone who needs to relocate✨
