name: Software Engineer, Core Platform
description: Pocus is powered by a custom distributed database that helps our customers ingest, transform and make sense of product data in a no-code way. The core platform team is responsible for improving the reliability, extensibility, and performance of this database, so that our customers can represent increasingly complex data relationships and turn those insights into revenue. We typically process multiple gigabytes of data every day and we expect that number to increase many fold in the coming months.

requirements.description: Must have experience working in the cloud
requirements.explanation:
Must have worked on either AWS or GCP. Must be familiar with using cloud based offerings and navigating things in a cloud-first world.

We're not looking for someone who has only worked on services that were hosted on-prem

requirements.description: Must have solid experience in at least one backend language
requirements.explanation: examples - Java, C, C++, Kotlin, Go, Rust, Scala

requirements.description: Must have familiarity with Kubernetes
requirements.explanation: If candidate has not used Kubernetes before, we don't want to consider them

requirements.description: Must have worked on high scale systems
requirements.explanation: we want candidates who have worked on problems where the issues they ran into had to do with scaling those systems to handle more users or more queries etc

requirements.description: Must have worked at at least one startup before
requirements.explanation: If a candidate has worked only at large companies (Series C/200+ employees or higher when they joined), they will not be a good fit.

requirements.description: Must actively want to work for a startup
requirements.explanation: Here are some indications that will help you filter for this: 1) Must want to move quickly and be scrappy, 2) Must be motivated by equity rather than cash, 3) Must not be motivated by just getting a fancier title (we don't have titles at Pocus), 4) Must be hands-on operationally: candidate will be on-call and will be paged at odd hours in the night if something is on fire

requirements.description: Nice to have experience in Typescript, Kotlin
Nice to have experience with Clickhouse, Athena, Presto
Previous experience in backend platform engineering (e.g work on core platform, site reliability, high scale system, data processing)

responsibilities: Pocus’ infrastructure runs on AWS. We rely on Kubernetes and Docker for orchestration and containerization of our services. We use Typescript and Kotlin for writing code and communication happens via GraphQL. We use technologies like Clickhouse, Presto, Temporal etc. and have a strong bias towards using managed services wherever possible.
As an engineer on the core platform team, you will:
Build a distributed data platform that is reliable and extensible: The data platform owned by this team forms the basis of everything that our app is built on. At a very high level, it includes:
A data ingestion layer that supports data extraction from various warehouses, databases and CRMs
A transformation engine that enriches this data with computed traits and last-mile modeling abilities
A query engine that lets you filter and aggregate these transformed entities in milliseconds
A workflow system that lets you export and act on these results via 3rd party connections like Outreach, Slack etc. or via web-hooks
You will play a key role in making it feature-rich, stable, and scalable.
Have complete autonomy: Extreme autonomy and ownership is how we move so fast. At Pocus, you will have the opportunity to influence every aspect of our product and technology.
Work with best-in-class engineering practices: We take immense pride in the craft of our work. We don’t skimp on things like code review, developer tooling, documentation, testing, etc.
Join an incredible team at a magical time: We’re at the beginning stages of explosive growth. Join a passionate, scrappy, and no-ego team of builders that will inspire you every day.
workPlaceText: Only within US, Canada, and Mexico (must have the ability to travel to the US every now and then)
visa_text_more: We're not able to sponsor visas at this time and are also not open to anyone on OPT or other temporary status
experience_info: working on high scale systems. We're not considering work experience working on frontend technologies or work experience outside of actual jobs (no side gigs or solo gigs).
recruiting_advice:
Please do not contact candidates who are currently at Mixpanel - It's fine if they were there previously.

We're looking for a candidate with a high slope of career growth. Apart from their experience working at a startup, let's say they worked at a large company with a career ladder early in their career, we're looking for folks who had fast career progression e.g. SWE1 --> SWE2 in less than 2 years or SWE 2 --> Senior Eng in less than 3 years.

We're also looking for folks with expanding scope of responsibility. Good candidates will be able to talk about owning larger problems, tackling larger issues. If the candidate is doing the same thing over and over again, they will not be a good fit.

Here are some candidates we would not want you to contact:

  • Candidates who have only worked on the frontend or application layer: Typically, someone with experience in just javascript, python, ruby etc.

  • Candidate must not be a job hopper: If candidate has a pattern of hopping jobs too often, we will not consider them. They should have a history of staying at a company for at least 2-3 years

  • Candidates that are too senior: We're not really looking for someone with 15+ YOE. It's both a mixture of not being challenged enough and having expectations of very quick growth that can get difficult to navigate.

Please also make sure candidates are a good culture fit you can probably easily determine this if you observe whether they have the following traits:

  • Holds a high bar for quality and simplicity and takes pride in their work

  • Loves shipping early, learning from real world usage, and iterating

  • Is collaborative in a remote-first, async setting and is a strong communicator

  • Has a knack for problem-solving and thinking from first principles

  • Loves working in small teams with a strong bias for action
avoid_traits: Candidates who have only worked on the frontend or application layer: Typically, someone with experience in just javascript, python, ruby etc
Must not be a job hopper: If candidate has a pattern of hopping jobs too often, we will not consider them. They should have a history of staying at a company for at least 2-3 years

Company Offsites - Although we’re remote we truly believe that every team needs in person time to collaborate.

Parental Leave - We offer paid parental leave to spend quality time with your new additions.
Suprise Perks - Whether it’s a stipend for a home office set up or the occasional meal on Pocus, we’re always looking for ways to say thank you to our amazing team.

company.name: Pocus
company.description:
Pocus is the first Product-Led Sales platform that turns product data into revenue. Pocus empowers go-to-market teams to use data to improve customer acquisition, conversion, and expansion - without relying on engineers. Our no-code interface lets non-technical teams use information locked in the data warehouse and join it with customer data (from the CRM) to uncover the best opportunities and take the right action.

Pocus turns product data into revenue by:

🪄 Converting more free trials

🪄 Finding needle in the haystack opportunities

🪄 Increasing sales rep efficiency

🪄 Reaching out to the right buyer with the right messages at the right time

company.teamAbout:
We’re on a mission to build Product-Led Sales technology that transforms how go-to-market teams use data to drive revenue. But, this is just the beginning. Our vision is to bring the power of data to everyone… including non-technical users.

In a short 18 months, we’ve accomplished an insane amount. We built the first Product-Led Sales platform for customers like Linear and Clockwise, generated a waitlist of hundreds of companies, created a 2,000 member community and pioneered the Product-Led Sales category. We are backed by best-in-class investors (First Round & Coatue) and angel investors (COO Notion, CPO Figma, CRO Zapier, CEO dbt, COO Datadog, CEO Postman, CPO Adobe, etc.)

The Pocus team is full of humble overachievers that like to move quickly, build for impact, solve incredibly tough problems… and have a ton of fun.

name: Staff Mechanical Engineer
description:
We’re looking for an experienced mechanical engineer to lead new product development from concept through to production. You’ll be part of a small, mission-driven team and have significant ownership over decisions. We’re growing quickly so there are ample opportunities for career growth.

This role is available in the San Francisco Bay Area, with a hybrid model of remote and on-site work.

requirements.description: Highly proficient with 3D modeling and simulation tools (e.g. Solidworks, NX, Creo)
Solid understanding of root cause analysis, DOEs, and other quality measuring techniques
BSME or equivalent. MS preferred
Experience with high-volume manufacturing processes, design for manufacturability and assembly (DFM/DFA), tolerance analysis, functional dimensioning and geometric tolerancing (GD&T)
Track records of shipping high-volume consumer products, including manufacturing support in Asia

responsibilities: Architect and design complex electromechanical systems, including plastic, metal, and soft goods components integrated with novel sensors and actuators
Drive designs across the entire development lifecycle, including brainstorming, CAD, prototyping, testing, and ramp into production in Asia.
Shape the direction of our products and features by collaborating with industrial design, marketing, and product teams as well as company leadership
Solve highly cross-functional problems by working with electrical, software, reliability, and manufacturing engineering teams
Perform analysis and testing to ensure designs meet product goals, including thermal, fluid, and structural analysis
workPlaceText: This role is required to be onsite at our San Francisco office (1501 Mariposa St., San Francisco, CA 94107) 3-4 days a week.  While we have our HQ in New York, the Hardware Team is based out of SF.
visa_text_more: We can sponsor visa for the right candidate
experience_info: doing consumer product design with knowledge of injection molding, sheet metal forming, soft goods, and electromechanical systems
recruiting_advice: Please do not contact candidates from **Eero** - we have a close relationship with their team and do not want to poach from them. In terms of diversity preference, we are open, but would love to add female MEs to our team! When sourcing, feel free to share the following, if helpful: **Notable things about our company and product**: ● Eight Sleep is backed by leading Silicon Valley investors including Valor Equity Partners, Softbank, Founders Fund, Khosla Ventures, General Catalyst, and Y Combinator ● We were recognized as one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies in Consumer Electronics in 2019 and 2022. ● In 2019, we launched our temperature-controlled smart bed, The Pod. We now power the sleep of over 60,000 people every night, including world-class athletes like F1 champion Lewis Hamilton and baseball MVP Aaron Judge. ● We've been consistently recognized as one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies, including the top wellness company for 2023. **Why they'll love Eight Sleep**: ● We’re a tight-knit team that’s passionate about improving people’s lives. ● We’re committed to employees’ wellness and career development. ● All full-time employees receive the Pod so you’ll get a better night’s sleep. ● Flexible, generous PTO. ● Employer contribution for medical/dental/vision insurance.

company.name: Eight Sleep
company.description:
Eight Sleep is the first sleep fitness company. 1 in 3 people are sleep deprived, and the CDC calls insufficient sleep a public health epidemic.  Our mission is to fix this and fuel human potential through optimal sleep.

In 2019, we launched our temperature-controlled smart bed, The Pod. We now power the sleep of over 60,000 people every night, including world-class athletes like F1 champion Lewis Hamilton and baseball MVP Aaron Judge. We've been consistently recognized as one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies, including the top wellness company for 2023.

We've raised $90M from leading Silicon Valley investors, and are working on exciting new products that go beyond temperature control of the bed.
company.productDescription: Our temperature-regulated smart bed, the Pod is an absolute game changer, improving people's health and happiness by changing the way they sleep. It was named one of Time Magazine’s Best Inventions of 2019. We’re excited by the recognition and still have a long way to go toward achieving our mission.
company.teamAbout:
Eight Sleep is backed by leading Silicon Valley investors including Valor Equity Partners, Softbank, Founders Fund, Khosla Ventures, General Catalyst, and Y Combinator, we were recognized as one of Fast Company’s Most Innovative Companies in Consumer Electronics in 2019 and 2022.

Matteo Franceschetti is the CEO of Eight Sleep. He was an athlete at a young age and has always been focused on winning. That drive to succeed propelled him from sports podiums to the top tier of the international legal world and to start two clean-tech companies on two continents, all before age 30. It was his quest for more restorative sleep, which led him to quit his previous life and launch Eight Sleep. 

Alexandra Zatarain is the Co-Founder and VP of Brand and Marketing of Eight Sleep. Alexandra has built the Eight Sleep brand and scaled the company’s revenue from $0 to current state. She was named by Forbes to the 30 Under 30 list in Consumer Technology, and in 2020 she was named by INC as one of the top 100 Female Founders. Alexandra is alsoan angel investor in female-founded companies as a scout for Cleo Capital.

name: Sales Development Representative

As an early stage startup, we are looking for team-players with insatiable appetites who are eager to learn and develop along with the company as we build out our SDR function and grow our sales efforts. Your role will primarily be inbound followup, outbound, nurturing, and first meeting coordination.

requirements.description: Candidate has to be US Citizen

Experience using a CRM and familiar with overall CRM hygiene

responsibilities: Developing a scalable outreach strategy to be shared with future SDRs
Providing the company with strong, qualified sales leads
Creating an organized approach to prospecting to allow for feedback and guidance
Creating qualified opportunities in Hubspot and promoting overall CRM-hygiene

company.name: Atomus
company.description:
Atomus is a cybersecurity company focused exclusively on small businesses in the Aerospace and Defense industry needing to comply with NIST 800-171, DFARS 7012, and CMMC cybersecurity requirements.

We have major customers including the US Air Force, Defense Innovation Unit, along with aerospace and defense customers. 

We recently raised an investment from early investors in top tier companies like Snowflake, Robinhood, and Anduril among many others to scale Atomus to its full potential.
company.productDescription:
Atomus Aegis is our built cybersecurity software made for small businesses in the Aerospace and Defense industry. The system runs on computers, phones, and servers that handle defense data and configure these systems to the NIST 800-171 cybersecurity requirements.

Imagine if we shipped you a computer that was already compliant with the cybersecurity requirements in your contract out of the box. Our software configures your existing computer to this compliant baseline without the headache of buying new hardware or months having someone do this for you manually.

Once configured, Atomus monitors, maintains, and documents these systems to comply with DFARS 7012 and CMMC cybersecurity requirements.
company.teamAbout: Our team at Atomus is hardworking, move fast, and put our customers first!

name: Senior Unity Engineer
description:
Join our growing team as a Senior Unity Engineer!

You would be a great fit at Branch if you are a detail-oriented subject matter expert in your domain and enjoy working with small teams to build and ship quality games on a rapid timeline.

As a Senior Unity Engineer, you’ll play a massive role in building out Castaways - our instantly playable mass multiplayer voxel-based game. You’ll be responsible for designing and implementing significant game components such as the multiplayer world, character control, and other potential systems. You'll drive projects and initiatives and mentor and coach junior engineers on the team.

requirements.description: Experience mentoring junior engineers
Proven track record of having shipped high-production value games at indie or AAA game studios
Knowledge of how to profile, analyze, and improve performance, from low-level limitations to high-level architectural decisions
Experience building high-production value 3d multiplayer games and testing, automating, and instrumenting your code
Deep graphics programming knowledge and experience writing shaders
Understanding of the Defi landscape, particularly with Ethereum Virtual Machine or compatible chains such as Binance Smart Chain, Polygon, Solana, etc.
Experience building browser-first games (working in JS/TS, React, WebGL, etc.)

responsibilities: Rapidly iterate on game mechanics and features to build an evolving community-driven game
Create sticky mechanics of the Branch game to increase virality and retention
Ensure the best possible performance, quality, and responsiveness of the game
Design and implement a generic game implementation that works across platforms for mobile, desktop, and web
Build POC’s to understand new tools, techniques, and process; document and demonstrate steps to adopt
Act as a subject matter expert to guide formal design review processes for mission-critical components of the game
Become a resident expert of the Branch backend technical stack and guide new engineers in the agile game development process
workPlaceText: Our HQ is in Seattle but this role is fully remote within the US
visa_text_more: Unfortunately we're not in the position to offer visa sponsorships at this stage
experience_info: with a modern language such as C#, C++, Java, or Javascript and 3+ years of experience building games in a game engine such as Unity or Unreal
recruiting_advice:
✨ **Here are some benefits that we offer you can share with candidates**: 

1. Work remotely
2. Platinum tier health, dental, and vision insurance 100% paid for by us for you and your dependents.
3. Unlimited paid time off and sick leave policies.
4. 401(k) with employer matching.

Although the role is fully remote, if the candidate decides to work at our HQ, we offer a comprehensive relocation package up to $20,000 and commuter benefits of up to $200/month.

company.name: Branch
company.description:
Branch Technologies was founded in 2020 under the visionary leadership of our esteemed CEO, Dayton Mills. Our sole purpose is to explore and develop groundbreaking ideas that seamlessly merge the worlds of social apps and gaming, redefining the very fabric of interactive entertainment.

We invest in people who have surmounted many obstacles yet remain steadfast with an unwavering determination to cultivate the remarkable and enduring.

Our culture of relentlessly pursuing excellence has earned us a globally recognized reputation as innovators at the forefront of gaming.
company.teamAbout:
When you choose to work with people who care, you're embracing a team of individuals who are deeply passionate about their work. They possess an unwavering dedication and a relentless drive to excel in their respective fields. Their commitment is evident in the long hours they willingly put in, not because of obligation, but because they genuinely care about achieving outstanding results.

We believe in operating with utmost efficiency and consistently exceeding expectations. High performance is not measured by the number of hours worked but by the quality of results produced. It is about being resilient, recovering quickly from setbacks, and consistently finishing projects faster and better than before. We reward those who demonstrate high performance with fulfilling work, the respect of their peers, attention to their well-being, and the opportunity to create abundance.

Curiosity is a fundamental trait we seek in every individual at Branch. We encourage the exploration of new ideas and the rejection of preconceived notions. Curiosity means asking questions before providing answers, constantly testing beliefs, and embracing a scientific mindset. It is through curiosity that we challenge the status quo, discover innovative solutions, and continue to grow personally and as an organization.

name: Full-Stack Founding Engineer
description:
Leap, launched in early 2023, is a rapidly-growing startup at the forefront of integrating AI in applications.

With 100k+ users, millions of AI assets generated with our APIs, and a roster of high-profile clients, we're seeking a Full-Stack Founding Engineer to drive our mission forward.

This role calls for close collaboration with our founders, delivery of high-impact features, and a relentless focus on customer and developer experience. You'll contribute to the architecting, design, delivery, and support of new product features that span front-end and back-end components.

requirements.description: Familiarity with Diffusion Models and HuggingFace is preferred
Experience in architecting, designing, and delivering new product features
Ability to provide technical support and troubleshooting to customers
Alignment with our core values: lean methodology, design and UX obsession, constant risk-taking, rapid delivery, comfortable operating with uncertainty
Commitment to deliver value to production every single week and have an ownership mindset with the ability to operate with incomplete data
Expertise in TypeScript, Next.js, Nest.js, React, Python, AWS, and Vercel

workPlaceText: Our office is in the Fort Mason Center in Marina, SF. We usually work out of the office but sometimes WFH as needed. Would like to see more local talent.

Please also feel free to share the following to potential candidates: ● Be part of the team shaping the future of AI in app development. ● Daily engagement and close collaboration with the founders. ● Rapid career growth with opportunities to take ownership and make a significant impact from day one. ● Thrive in a culture that values leanness, design and UX obsession, weekly value delivery, risk-taking, and operating amidst uncertainty. ● Gain exposure to major clients like Heineken, Hashnode, Zapier, Inflection AI, and Musicfy.

company.name: Leap
company.description: A single platform for everything AI. Generate images, fine tune models, and more with our easy-to-use API.
company.teamAbout:
Leap, launched in early 2023, is a rapidly-growing startup at the forefront of integrating AI in applications. Our mission is to revolutionize the way businesses and individuals leverage AI technology to drive innovation and achieve their goals.

Joining Leap means joining a team of talented individuals who are passionate about AI and its transformative potential. We foster a collaborative and inclusive work environment where creativity and innovation thrive. We value diversity and actively seek out different perspectives to push the boundaries of what AI can accomplish.

name: Senior Solutions Consultant
description:
Join us on the ground floor as our second Solutions Consultant!  

As part of the Customer Solutions team, you will contribute to the success of PorterLogic’s ‘low-code Supply Chain Operations platform focused on Warehouse and Inventory Management that is being implemented at a variety of new customers throughout the US. Customer industries could include eCommerce, Retail, CPG, Food & Beverage, Health & Beauty etc. 

You’ll be an integral part of our success in delighting customers. You’ll play a critical role in taking our company to the next level and you’ll be rewarded with meaningful Equity. The sky’s the limit as far as growth and advancement, and you will be one of the first in line to move up the ladder!

requirements.description: Software experience and strong technical skills
requirements.explanation: Experience with WMS or Order Management Solutions, Strong SQL skills (you will write many complex SQL queries), Experience working with / basic understanding of how to interact with APIs, Experience with Postman (for testing API’s), and Exposure to Python or VBA (a plus / not required)

requirements.description: Strong Functional Experience
requirements.explanation: Configuration, Testing (have gone through a full test phase with a client), Support, Light Design, Client Facing experience, Lead Consultant experience, and Solution Demo experience (a plus / not required)

requirements.description: Bachelor’s degree in Industrial & Systems Engineering, Industrial Engineering, Computer Science, MIS or any other Engineering-oriented discipline
requirements.explanation: IE or Engineering BS degree from Georgia Tech, Clemson, or another well-ranked school in IE. Unless they moonlighted as a developer or somehow do have very strong technical skills, we nix on business or supply chain majors

requirements.description: Spent 1+ years at a consulting company on the ground implementing WMS or similar system
Strong interest in early-stage startups / entrepreneurship
requirements.explanation: This candidate will be the 6th full time hire (a dozen in total, including contractors), so they need to be highly entrepreneurial and interested in building something from the ground up.

responsibilities: Configuration [60%]: translate design requirements into system configuration. This primarily includes building workflows using PorterLogic’s proprietary low-code application platform, work with other PorterLogic customer solutions team members and client team to identify system requirements and then configure PorterLogic to those specifications using our visual workflows and low-code UI editors, work with APIs and testing these using Postman, and write complex SQL queries that are critical to the configuration of PorterLogic

Solution Demo Support [15%]: assist with pre-sales functions in tandem with PorterLogic Account Executives to build and execute custom solution demos for prospective customers, comfortable speaking with prospects during discovery phase to understand use case in more detail and sort through demo data, assist with designing demos / proof of concept solutions and configuration of workflows to accomplish a demo for a prospect, and assist in building other internal demos (e.g. base flows to show customers in early sales meetings), as well as other internal flows

Testing [10%]: support customer onboardings by executing test plans and identifying / debugging issues that are discovered, identification of test scenarios based on design requirements (this is NOT the same as writing test scripts and involves significantly much less busy work compared to writing test scripts), communicate with client team regarding client-side testing results, and assist clients with troubleshooting issues

Support [10%]: assist with supporting PorterLogic’s existing live customers with troubleshooting any issues. This typically includes building out additional features / workflows when customers require assistance, test and validate other issues and new feature releases. This includes debugging if needed (e.g. reading logs, research in source code if comfortable), and build customer trainings based on design documents. Work with customer end users on training when appropriate

Design [5%] (this aspect can grow in the future): assist other PorterLogic customer solutions team members with designing solutions per customer business requirements, including writing design documents, ideally will grow into being able to take on more design work in the future, will initially own design for smaller projects than can take on larger projects
Travel: may average 20 to 25% and this would include travel to client sites for Kick off, Go lives, and critical sales meetings, as well as and conferences / trade shows
workPlaceText: Location wise, they need to be able to make it down to our office in Ponce City Market, Atlanta, at least once a week. Our hybrid policy is flexible (ie come in when you need to collaborate).   They need to be able to start on-site immediately in order to speed up training.
visa_text_more: Unfortunately, we're not able to sponsor visas at this time
experience_info: post-college work experience in a supply chain technology company. With candidates much above this range, they usually want to be a manager, and this is a roll-up-the-sleeves type of role
recruiting_advice:
Ideal companies we think our candidates will come from: Manhattan Associates, Deposco, Logiwa. Others include consulting firms such as E&Y, Accenture, Deloitte, where they performed hands on WMS or ERP technical implementations. 

This is an on-site role. When sourcing, please make sure that candidates can make it down to our office in Ponce City Market, Atlanta, at least once a week. Our hybrid policy is flexible (ie come in when you need to collaborate), but the team is small and we need this individual to be willing to huddle in person. The first 4-8 weeks will be predominantly on-site in order to ramp up quickly, after which is it their choice. 

We Offer:

● Flexible working hours. We believe people do their best work on their own schedule.
● Open vacation policy. Taking time off to fully decompress is critical to our well-being and our success.
● Hybrid work environment, remote-first mindset. Our office is in the Industrious co-working space in Ponce City Market (Atlanta, GA). While office attendance will never be mandatory, we want you to be in geographic proximity and willing to huddle up in person when needed.
● Meaningful equity. We believe in incentivizing everyone on the success of the company. We all win together, and want all team members to act like owners.
● Competitive salary and benefits package. 

You can also read more about the company and founder backgrounds here: https://www.porterlogic.com/about
avoid_traits: Brilliant jerks and large egos
Poor listeners
Low EQ or low self-awareness
Completed a sales engineering bootcamp (ie is making a career switch)
Big company mindset (this person needs to be very entrepreneurial and roll-up the sleeves)
benefits: Fully covered medical, dental, vision for employee through United Healthcare
Membership to Industrious coworking space worldwide
Office space at Industrious at Ponce City Market

company.name: PorterLogic
company.description:
PorterLogic is a small but mighty team of dreamers and doers, hackers and builders who are transforming the supply chain software industry. We have deep industry expertise and have spent years building and implementing software in the supply chain industry.

Funded by premier investors and supported by a leading startup accelerator, PorterLogic (www.porterlogic.com) is building the software of the future for supply chains. It’s no secret traditional supply chain solutions are outdated, bloated, and inflexible.

We're transforming how supply chain teams do their work and changing how companies think about their supply chain functions - from viewed as a cost center to celebrated as a competitive advantage. Our flexible application platform is a 10x improvement in agility, performance, and resilience that enables companies to modernize their supply chain ecosystem and enable their operations to support growth.
company.productDescription:
Low-code platform to build your own supply chain stack - from inventory and warehousing to orders, returns, and more. 
Here's a short demo video we send to prospects around warehouse management - https://www.loom.com/share/20f1710d109a472d9f251aedd951ef7c
company.teamAbout:
As former supply chain software implementors and operators, we were in trenches and saw how customers spent millions of dollars on systems that did not solve their problems.

There had to be a better way. But we couldn’t find flexible solutions for the supply chain. So, we built it.

Jonathan is the chief executive and technology officer at PorterLogic. He spent most of his career designing and building WMS's and other supply chain technology at firms like Manhattan Associates. He built his first website when he was 15 years old, and started a software and design company in high school. Jonathan holds a degree in Industrial & Systems Engineering from Georgia Tech.

Anya is the chief operating officer at PorterLogic. After starting her career in management consulting at Deloitte, she held progressively more senior roles at high-growth, venture-backed SaaS startups, most recently as Director of Product at Groundspeed Analytics. Anya holds a BS in Electrical Engineering from Georgia Tech, an MBA from Quantic, and an MS in Computer Science from GT.

name: Founding Engineer
description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated first hire and founding engineer to join our team and help build our startup from the ground up.

As a founding engineer, you will be a cornerstone to our company's growth and success. If you are a self-starter who is ready to wear many hats and build build and scale products from zero-one, then this is the perfect role for you. You’ll have lots of autonomy and will need to be comfortable operating in ambiguous situations with an entrepreneurial mindset. 

You will work on the forefront of technology, utilizing generative AI and audio innovations that have only become available in the past few months. 

As time goes on, you will develop into a player-coach, not only contributing to the construction of our technology from the beginning, but also mentoring those around you and leading a world-class team that you build.

We are well-funded and offer competitive compensation, generous equity, and standard health benefits.

requirements.description: Experience with cloud computing platforms and deployment, such as Google Cloud Platform and Kubernetes.
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or a related field.
Experience working with applied machine learning, using open source and APIs (e.g. OpenAI).
Knowledge of database management systems, such as Postgres.
Strong proficiency in programming languages such as Python and JavaScript.
Experience working with electronic health record (EHR) systems.
Expertise in audio and voice tech architecture.

responsibilities: As a member of the founding team and first hire, you will have many responsibilities and will be involved in key decisions alongside the founders.
You will have a lot of autonomy and be expected to develop features and products from scratch.
We prioritize speed above all else at this stage of the company, so the ability to work quickly is essential.
You will interact with physicians and other healthcare professionals to understand customer needs and design software accordingly.
As we rapidly expand our engineering team over the next 6-9 months, you may have the opportunity to serve as a player-coach. However, we also value individual contributors.
You will develop scalable software solutions that comply with HIPAA and other security standards.
workPlaceText: This job requires in-person work in San Francisco. Candidates must currently live in or be willing to relocate to San Francisco within 8 weeks of being hired (we will provide a stipend for relocation).
visa_text: Certain Visa Sponsorship such as H1B transfer and TN available
visa_text_more: We can only support certain visas like H1B transfer and TN visa only if they're on the path to a green card
experience_info: as a software engineer (flexible based on performance in tech interview)
recruiting_advice:
Founding Engineer is a unique position that not too many engineers will get a chance to experience in their careers. Being one of the first 5 engineers at an early-stage tech startup is an incredibly challenging yet fulfilling experience.

Compared to being an engineer at FAANG companies, there will be a much bigger emphasis on ownership and work ethic.

Recruiting a founding engineer is difficult, so here are some tips we think would help you when sourcing and pitching candidates:

This role is NOT for everyone. If you think a potential candidate is just looking for another job and they don’t really care what company they are joining as long as pay & hours are good, we strongly suggest against submitting them. They might have a decent resume but there is an incredibly low chance they’ll get hired and will likely go nowhere after 1 interview. It’ll be a waste of time for you, the candidate, and our company.

We also found that typically engineers who are more junior in their career are a better fit for founding engineer. The right candidate for this role will likely have closer to 3 years experience rather than 10 years experience.

Hope this helps and we’re incredibly excited to meet the candidates you refer our way.
benefits: Competitive salary and employee stock ownership plan.
Full health, dental, and vision insurance benefits.
Reimbursement for at-home remote work setup.

company.name: Assort Health
company.description:
At Assort Health, we have developed the first generative AI call center built for healthcare. Our long term goal is to make exceptional healthcare accessible anytime, anywhere, for everyone.

Unfortunately, the high costs of scaling and maintaining call center operations and administrative staffing within healthcare are often passed down to the patient. We solve this problem leveraging the latest advances in machine learning to build an AI-powered contact center platform for healthcare.

We have PMF, paying customers, and a huge pipeline of inbound customers that we plan to onboard this year. We're supported by a top-tier institutional lead investors like Quiet Capital, as well as several angels, including the former CMO of Flatiron Health and board director of Athena Health, and the founders of Infinitus, Mercury, Mammoth Biosciences, and PathAI. If you're interested, you'll also have the opportunity to meet them!
company.teamAbout: Assort is led by Jeff (former Head of Product Engineering at health tech company valued at 6B Athelas/Commure, first non-founder engineer at Cameo, engineer at Facebook, Duke grad) and Jon (Founder of Shimmer YC S21, 7 publications in healthcare AI, former UCSF med student, Stanford grad in top 3%).

name: VP of Engineering
description:
Join our growing team as the Vice President of Engineering and shape the future of our promising mobile title Castaways. 

This is a unique opportunity to provide strong leadership, set a clear vision, and define the technical strategy for our small yet ambitious team. 

As the VP of Engineering, you will collaborate closely with cross-functional stakeholders to ensure alignment, optimize processes, and deliver high-quality releases. You will build and nurture a top-performing engineering team, driving innovation and operational efficiency. You will make a significant impact on our game's success as we scale to millions of players worldwide. 

Take this exciting journey with us and be a key driver of our short-term and long-term growth in the competitive mobile gaming industry.

requirements.description: A keen eye for design aesthetics and user experience, ensuring that the final product meets both functional and visual excellence.
Experience implementing robust testing and quality assurance processes to ensure bug-free releases and an exceptional user experience.
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science (advanced degree preferred)
Strong technical background and expertise in mobile game development, including familiarity with Unity and iOS and Android platforms
Multi-disciplinary engineering experience with AWS cloud infrastructure and Unity game dev
Proven experience in a leadership role within the free-to-play mobile gaming industry
requirements.explanation: Demonstrated success in building and managing high-performing engineering teams. Important to note that we prefer those who managed a team of ICs not manager of managers.

responsibilities: Define and communicate the engineering vision, technical strategy, and roadmap to align with the company's overall goals.
Provide strong leadership to the engineering team, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and excellence.
Set clear objectives, inspire and motivate the team to achieve technical milestones.
Build and lead a high-performing engineering team from scratch, including recruitment, hiring, and onboarding.
Develop and implement performance management processes, providing regular feedback and coaching to team members.
Drive the selection of appropriate technologies, development methodologies, and infrastructure requirements to support the company's mobile game development goals.
Oversee the end-to-end development process, ensuring timely and high-quality delivery of games.
Collaborate with product and art teams to translate requirements into technical specifications and feasible development plans.
Collaborate closely with product, art, and other stakeholders to understand their needs, prioritize projects, and align engineering efforts with company objectives.
Foster effective communication and collaboration between engineering and other departments, ensuring a seamless integration of technical and business goals.
Identify and address bottlenecks, inefficiencies, and areas for process improvement within the engineering department.
Implement agile methodologies, streamlined workflows, and automation tools to enhance operational efficiency and delivery velocity.
Promote a culture of continuous improvement, encouraging engineers to explore new technologies and innovate in the mobile gaming space.
Promote a culture of aggressive testing and a relentless pursuit of excellence to deliver quality releases to our users.
workPlaceText: Our HQ is in Seattle but this role is fully remote within the US
visa_text_more: Unfortunately we're not in the position to offer visa sponsorships at this stage
recruiting_advice:
We've been flooded with people who were VP of Engineering or Engineering Manager in their previous role. 

We're not looking for a standard engineering manager. **We're ideally looking for someone who sat at a lead role and managed a team of ICs rather than a manager of managers who is too senior in their career**.

This role will still be hands on. We're looking for someone who successfully shipped a game has run into technical issues or releasing a game on app stores. Ideally, they have 1-2 years of management/leadership experience.

We also came across a lot of folks who are not interested in mobile and mobile gaming specifically. This is important to us! We're not interested in candidates who sat in a leadership role for the past 6 years hands off on some VR game that's not related to what we do.

✨ **Here are some benefits that we offer you can share with candidates**: top tier health insurance (including vision and dental), unlimited PTO, 401(k) plan etc

Although the role is fully remote, if the candidate decides to work at our HQ, we offer a comprehensive relocation package up to $20,000 and commuter benefits of up to $200/month.

company.name: Branch
company.description:
Branch Technologies was founded in 2020 under the visionary leadership of our esteemed CEO, Dayton Mills. Our sole purpose is to explore and develop groundbreaking ideas that seamlessly merge the worlds of social apps and gaming, redefining the very fabric of interactive entertainment.

We invest in people who have surmounted many obstacles yet remain steadfast with an unwavering determination to cultivate the remarkable and enduring.

Our culture of relentlessly pursuing excellence has earned us a globally recognized reputation as innovators at the forefront of gaming.
company.teamAbout:
When you choose to work with people who care, you're embracing a team of individuals who are deeply passionate about their work. They possess an unwavering dedication and a relentless drive to excel in their respective fields. Their commitment is evident in the long hours they willingly put in, not because of obligation, but because they genuinely care about achieving outstanding results.

We believe in operating with utmost efficiency and consistently exceeding expectations. High performance is not measured by the number of hours worked but by the quality of results produced. It is about being resilient, recovering quickly from setbacks, and consistently finishing projects faster and better than before. We reward those who demonstrate high performance with fulfilling work, the respect of their peers, attention to their well-being, and the opportunity to create abundance.

Curiosity is a fundamental trait we seek in every individual at Branch. We encourage the exploration of new ideas and the rejection of preconceived notions. Curiosity means asking questions before providing answers, constantly testing beliefs, and embracing a scientific mindset. It is through curiosity that we challenge the status quo, discover innovative solutions, and continue to grow personally and as an organization.

name: Full Stack Engineer

As a Full Stack Engineer reporting to the CEO you will be responsible for Duffl’s product end-to-end, working alongside the CEO to plan and execute our product roadmap. Your role involves working alongside a Designer and another Full-Stack Engineer to execute on everything from coding, database design, product prioritization, cycle planning, design brainstorms, and customer interviews.

You will be responsible for optimizing both the customer and employee experience from a technology perspective. The ideal candidate is someone who is well-versed in data and can create a data-driven culture through the company. We are looking for a rising star who isn't afraid to exceed expectations and is passionate about our mission to empower students to better serve each other!

Passionate about AI & Game Design.
Experience with e-commerce, supply chain, logistics or on-demand delivery businesses.
Experience with our data tools (Posthog & Metabase)
Experience with AWS / DevOps, REST APIs / Microservices, and Unit Testing & CI/CD
Candidate is excited about working with young, ambitious college students.
Experience with React Native

responsibilities: Outcomes:
Execute Product Roadmap: 1) Increase Story Points per cycle by 2X, 2) Increase Cycle Completion Rate to 90%+
Improve Backend Systems: 1) Diagnose and fix data integrity issues & bugs, 2) Build data pipelines and tools based on team workflows
Maintain Infrastructural Integrity: 1) Unit Test Coverage > 80%, 2) Bug Rate < 10%

recruiting_advice: Being one of the early engineers at a high growth early stage startup is a unique position that not too many engineers will get a chance to experience in their careers. It's an incredibly challenging yet fulfilling experience. Compared to being an engineer at FAANG companies, there will be a much bigger emphasis on ownership and work ethic. Recruiting for an early stage startup can be challenging, so here are some tips we think would help you when sourcing and pitching candidates: ● Pitch to candidates that this opportunity means being an engineer at a **YC-backed startup**. This is not only a fulfilling experience where they get to work at a fast-growing startup but also an incredibly strong signal that will be on their resume forever. Having been hiring managers at many different tech companies ourselves, we know every company would want to hire someone who was early at a YC startup. ● We raised $13M from the best investors in silicon valley (**YC, Volition Capital, the founders of Chewy, Rent the Runway, and Thrive Market**) and have a healthy runway. ● **We have competitive benefits such as healthcare, PTO etc** ● Being able to have complete ownership of the work they do and how high-impact it is. They won't just be working on 'easy' problems, internal tools or small features, they'll be given complex/difficult tasks to solve and drive the entire company and product forward. ● As you can probably tell from the expectations of this role, there is a high chance that a candidate will be a great fit if they have previous experience at an early stage startup. ● Being an ex-founder or working on their own projects is also a great signal. ● Please make sure the candidate is qualified from both a skills and culture perspective! You can read about our 4 values here: **click here** Please also share this deck with all candidates: **click here** Hope this helps and we're incredibly excited to meet the candidates you refer our way.

company.name: Duffl (YC W20)
company.description:
Duffl empowers students to run 7-figure businesses whilst pursuing their degree. We use data to wholesale high demand/high margin products and deliver them directly to our customers in 10 minutes using electric scooters and a 100% student workforce.

We are currently live at: UCLA, USC, UCSB, UC Berkeley, UofA, ASU, TSU and UT Austin. We’ve raised a $13M Series A, backed by YC, Volition Capital and the founders of Chewy, Rent the Runway & Thrive Market. Come join us on a journey of empowering students to better serve each other!
company.teamAbout:
Duffl was founded by David Lin, a  philosophy major who saw the potential to build a better ecosystem for entrepreneurs.

What started off as a college side-hustle has now become a multi-million dollar franchise.

We believe that the best way to learn “business skills” is not by sitting in class, but rather by managing a real 7-figure PnL.

More than anything, we are proud of the genuine communities and friendships we’ve helped build.

College can be chaotic, stressful and lonely at times, so we tried to create a place that would always put a smile on your face. 

Your home away from home.

We are a small, passionate, behind-the-scenes team based in Santa Monica, CA. Everything we do is to help our stores succeed. Our HQ team is lean and openings are few and far between.

name: OSS Engineer - Agent Builder
description:
Steamship is building the world’s best Agent-hosting platform. And we want your help to do it.

We believe Agents will become the new architecture through which software is expressed. Agents blend traditional and AI-native programming: both the programmer and the AI share control; both conversational and structured I/O is possible. Agents will become your colleagues, your tutors, your support reps, and your friends. They will chat with you as the humans in your life do. But they will also integrate deeply within existing software, behind the scenes — analyzing documents, auditing accounts, triggering alerts, suggesting products, and so on. 

We are looking for engineers to build these Agents, and our platform, for the emerging GitHub communities. You'll work in the open and contribute to large open-source projects as well as our own.

requirements.description: Excellent communication skills - candidate will be directly interacting with our users and members of diverse communities as the Steamship representative
Passion and experience building projects using machine learning and/or generative AI
Open-source, community-driven development experience - experience interacting with users, their challenges, and problems in open, collaborative communities is a plus
Must be comfortable building tooling from scratch and have experience with maintainable code development and debugging

responsibilities: Work with communities to develop Agents of interest, with an eye toward consolidating development around key open-source repositories
Drive Steamship platform development to meet the needs of those Agents and delight users and community developers
Build project templates tailored to communities
Build seamless ingestion pipelines for content-based Agents
Design and implement operational monitoring paradigms for Agents
Build novel backend integrations for Steamship that unlock new skills for Agents
Curate onboarding guides for developers and enterprise customers
Build a deployment pipeline for Agents built in open frameworks

company.name: Siro
company.description: We are building an AI Coach for field sales. Most sales professionals in the U.S. work in field sales, but get ZERO on-the-job coaching because they are alone in the field. Top sales reps out-earn surgeons, but most do not. We believe that with the right tooling, Field Sales can become the most accessible path to financial freedom (see **top secret master plan**). Our founders, **Joe** and **Jake**, were top-performing sales reps before becoming software engineers and met while building a previous sales tool that has helped over 100,000 sales reps. Our team is world-class, hailing from McKinsey, Amazon, Grammarly, Monday.com, Stanford, and UPenn. We are a profitable company, and over 1,000,000 conversations have been recorded through Siro. ****A Warning**** Nobody has accomplished what we have set out to do. The journey won’t be easy, but we’re well on our way, and we have a plan. If this is exciting to you, let’s talk.
company.teamAbout:
We work three days per week out of our office at 22 Vanderbilt (next to Grand Central).

As a small team, you play a big role in shaping our culture. We are looking for teammates who match our values:

● Be Humble. - “In cultures of arrogance, people get rewarded for expressing certainty and conviction. The most confident speaker claims the most status. In cultures of humility, people are applauded for admitting ignorance and asking questions. The most complex thinker earns the most respect.” - Adam Grant
● Believe in growth - Focus on the arc not the point. You can be better tomorrow. Other people can be better tomorrow.
● Act daringly. Dare to dream, think, and execute at a level that scares you.
Serve individuals. Siro exists to help sales reps.
● Don't Be Elitist - Respect should not be dictated by social, economic, or educational status.

name: Product Engineer
description:
We're looking for a product engineer to help us build the most flexible and easy to use number crunching tool.

We have to solve various difficult engineering/UX problems:

Our spreadsheet-esque frontend interface: This interface comes with a slew of UI/UX challenges to support complex functionality without being complicated, and needs to be incredibly performant. Causal needs a low floor and a high ceiling — it should be simple enough for anyone to get started with, but powerful enough for really complex use-cases.

Our dashboarding and data visualisation capabilities: We have to allow users to create beautiful charts and tables to communicate with numbers.

requirements.description: Has product sense and cares about customer/UX (hard to assess from CV)
Worked on complex tools or worked at a Series A-C startup on a chart or data visualisation tool
requirements.explanation: complex tool examples: (BI tool, analytics tool, Figma, Airtable, Notion, etc.)

requirements.description: Huge plus if candidate has prior experience working with Aggrid (our table library)
Computer Science degree
React/Typescript experience (3+ years)
requirements.explanation: Also nice to have Node/GraphQL experience (→ full-stack). Some other keywords: data visualisation, aggrid, recharts, UX

responsibilities: Understand the product and the customer's needs in detail
Translate functional requirements into maintainable, well-tested, and performant code
Help set up processes to guarantee the long-term success of Causal's engineering team
Play a crucial role in setting the direction of Causal's product, as well as the company and culture
workPlaceText: We are generally remote first but in London, candidates should expect to spend some time in-person, but it's not fully on site. London is flexible hybrid and the other 2 areas (Toronto and NYC) are remote but we do have team there who may sometimes work in person.
visa_text_more: We won't be able to offer visa sponsorship for our open roles
experience_info: (excluding contracting). We want to see (huge plus) experience with open source projects and significant career progression
recruiting_advice:
The candidate should be an excellent software engineer (write scalable, well-tested, maintainable code that others can easily work with in the future) who is detail-oriented (code changes can't break our production system), fast learning [especially for junior engineers], and collaborative with good communication skills (collaborate with other engineers, designers, customer success).

**In addition to the benefits, candidates in the following locations will also get this:**

**United States:**
● Competitive health, vision and dental plans (covered a 100% for employees & 50% for dependents)
● 401k with 3% company match

**United Kingdom:**
● NEST pension scheme with 3% company contribution (salary sacrifice option available)

● Private health and dental (covered at 100% for employees & 50% for dependents)

**Canada:**
● Private health and dental (covered at 100% for employees & 50% for dependents)
● RRSP program with 3% company match

company.name: Causal

We are well-funded by some great VCs (Accel, Coatue, Passion Capital) and angel investors (Naval Ravikant, Scott Belsky, and many more) across the US and Europe.

We're a small team, and well-funded by some great VCs and angel investors (Naval Ravikant, Scott Belsky, and many more) across the US and Europe.

name: Founding Full-Stack Engineer
description:
We are looking for a founding full-stack engineer 🧑‍💻 to join our team. You’ll be working up and down the Minoa product and infrastructure while partnering with founders and customers to ship features that provide value for users. 

As the first hire, you’ll have a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to co-define our product roadmap, technical architecture, as well as the engineering culture at Minoa from day 1.

requirements.description: You thrive in ambiguity and know how to deeply understand customer pains so you can turn them into delightful product features
You have experience building reliable B2B SaaS applications quickly with React/Redux/Typescript/Node
You worked with Firebase/Google’s cloud infrastructure and multi-tenant systems before
You have previous startup experience

engage with customers and run user interviews to deeply understand pain points from an end user perspective
build scalable integrations into CRM systems and modern sales tool to sync data with Minoa
develop a document automation engine that lets users create presentations with live data
create an analytics dashboard that provides insights into the sales processes of 100s of sales reps in an organization
deploy and test security features to keep our customers’ data safe
design a workflow that helps users create customized ROI calculators in less than 1 minute
help set the foundation for Minoa’s engineering standards, tooling, and processes
mentor and lead future hires
… and much more! 😎
workPlaceText: Intensively non-remote. You’re excited to join our fast-paced, intense, and fun team. You’ll work in-person with us in our downtown San Francisco office. We have a 🏢  Super cool office in central San Francisco with unlimited coffee and free dinner. We can also support your relocation if needed! We're now also open to on-site in NYC. We don't have an office there yet but will be commute friendly.

experience_info: as a full stack engineer. Prefer closer to 3-5 years experience than 10 years!
recruiting_advice: Founding Engineer is a unique position that not too many engineers will get a chance to experience in their careers. It's incredibly challenging but also fulfilling. Recruiting a founding engineer, especially for a startup like us without much public presence can be difficult, so here are some tips I think would help you when sourcing and pitching candidates: ● Pitch to candidates that being a founding engineer is not only a fulfilling experience where they get to work at a fast-growing startup but also an incredibly strong signal that will be on their resume forever. Having been hiring managers before, we know every company would want to hire someone who was a founding engineer. ● We built the first version of the product in 3 weeks and since raised **$2.7m in pre-seed funding** from a group of highly experienced investors and unicorn founders 🎉 - including 468 Capital (Mesosphere founder **Florian Leibert**), Mischief (Plaid founder **Zach Perret**), Front founder **Mathilde Collin**, DocSend founder **Russ Heddleston**, podcast host **Lenny Rachitsky**, and senior operators at Airbnb, Salesforce, and Amazon. ● Competitive **Salary**, **Equity**, and **Benefits**: 📚 Learning budget & newest Macbook Pro (or similar), 🏝️ Unlimited PTO, 🧑‍⚕️ Health, dental, and vision insurance, 🌱 Pension & 401k contributions ● Being able to have complete ownership of the work they do and how high-impact it is. They won't just be working on 'easy' problems, internal tools or small features, they'll be given complex/difficult tasks to solve and drive the entire company and product forward. ● As you can probably tell from the expectations of this role, there is a high chance that a candidate will be a great fit if they were previously a founding engineer or a relatively early employee at a fast-growing startup during Seed - Series C stages. ● Being an ex-founder or working on their own projects is also a great signal. ● We also found that typically engineers who are more junior in their career are a better fit for founding engineer. The right candidate for this role will likely have closer to 3-5 years experience rather than 10+ years experience. ● Here is some more info you can share with candidates: **TechCrunch Article** **Forbes Article** Hope this helps!

company.name: Minoa
company.description:
At Minoa, we are building the next-generation pricing and value-selling platform for fast-growing B2B SaaS companies.

We help enterprise sales team close deals more effectively. Our tools help go-to-market teams articulate the value of their product for customers and optimize their pricing. Minoa creates an interactive space for sellers and buyers to collaborate on the deal - including building the business case, calculating ROI, defining commercial terms, and getting the deal over the line 🙌
company.teamAbout:
We have raised funding and closed first customers. Minoa was founded by Max and Richard who had become frustrated with the broken pricing infrastructure and seeing sales teams being increasingly ill-equipped to deal with customers’ demands for flexibility, detailed value cases, and custom deals. They built the first version of the product in 3 weeks and since raised $2.7m in pre-seed funding from a group of highly experienced investors and unicorn founders 🎉 - including 468 Capital (Mesosphere founder Florian Leibert), Mischief (Plaid founder Zach Perret), Front founder Mathilde Collin, DocSend founder Russ Heddleston, podcast host Lenny Rachitsky, and senior operators at Airbnb, Salesforce, and Amazon.

We’re growing the team. With the funding secured, we’re looking to collaborate closely with our first customers and built an A* engineering team in 📍San Francisco that can take the product to the next level. Wanna be part of it - right from the earliest days?

company.name: Superpower
company.description:
Superpower is building the world’s most comprehensive and convenient platform for managing personal health. It’s a new type of health care company built from the ground up as a technology platform, plus a category defining longevity brand.

We envision a world where wellbeing is fundamental & everyone is empowered to reach their peak potential.

We are invested in and advised by an all-star team of medical doctors, researchers, and technologists like Balaji Srinivasan, Cyan Bannister, Arielle Zuckerberg, Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss, and Dr. Jordan Shlain (Founder of Private Medical, Silicon Valley’s top concierge medical office)

more here: superpower.com/join-a-10x-team
company.productDescription: Every year begins with an advanced blood test. 80+ biomarkers, and our nurses come directly to you. Results are tracked across your lifetime, and our medical team designs a custom health strategy that evolves with you.
company.teamAbout:
We are all founders or former founders ourselves, and hail from amazing companies and communities like Inside Tracker, SEED, SpaceX, Amazon, YCombinator, and more. our CEO started two prior companies worth >$500m.

We’re based in both the SF/Bay Area and Los Angeles, and are fostering a strong in-person first, collaborative, mission-driven culture. Our team works in person in their respective cities and we do frequent monthly team all hands retreats.

name: Founding Full Stack Engineer
description:
We are seeking a founding engineer to join our stealth company. As the founding engineer, you will have a unique opportunity to shape the vision and direction of the company. 

We are looking for a true unicorn of an individual – a talented full stack engineer that is also product minded, can design, and has former founder or founding team DNA 🦄🧬

If you are passionate about health, biohacking or familiarity with the digital health and longevity industry that is a bonus.

requirements.description: Experience deploying products to one of the major cloud providers (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Experience across the entire stack, from backend to frontend
Former founder or has been part of a founding team
Has a strong sense of design and is product minded
Has experience with Typescript, Javascript, React etc
Has a genuine interest in health with clear evidence to back this up
requirements.explanation: Examples can be an interest in lifestyle improvements and following the latest health trends

requirements.description: At least 1+ years experience working at a fast-growth startup
requirements.explanation: This is especially important for having someone who can scale, write great code from day one, and have had experience from blue chip startups

responsibilities: Collaborate with product, design, engineers, and customers to produce world-class products
Own delivery of products end-to-end
Build and ship high-quality products quickly
You will build empathy for the customer and build features to solve their needs that we may never have expected or explicitly planned
Contribute to architectural decisions and build new infrastructure, services, and applications from zero-to-one
Advocate for and practice engineering best practices, including code reviews, testing, code quality, security, and monitoring
workPlaceText: We are hybrid – so candidate must be on site in either city plus flexible remote
visa_text_more: We're unfortunately not able to sponsor visas at this time
experience_info: as a full stack engineer
recruiting_advice:
Recruiting tips: https://www.notion.so/Superpower-Founding-Engineer-Archetype-ddd4ef95f1d140049da5bd1e2f34db39?pvs=4

Founding Engineer is a unique position that not too many engineers will get a chance to experience in their careers. It's incredibly challenging but also fulfilling. Recruiting a founding engineer, especially for a stealth startup like us without much public presence can be difficult, so here are some tips I think would help you when sourcing and pitching candidates: ● Pitch to candidates that being a founding engineer is not only a fulfilling experience where they get to work at a fast-growing startup but also an incredibly strong signal that will be on their resume forever. Starting 2 different startups that both went on to be valued $500M+ and recruiting there, we know every company would want to hire someone who was a founding engineer. ● I understand that there isn't much public info about our company, so feel free to share more about my background: **Founder's LinkedIn****Founder's Twitter** ● We are all founders or former founders ourselves, and hail from amazing companies and communities like Inside Tracker, SEED, SpaceX, Amazon, YCombinator, and more. our CEO started two prior companies worth >$500m. ● We are invested in and advised by an all-star team of medical doctors, researchers, and technologists like Balaji Srinivasan, Cyan Bannister, Arielle Zuckerberg, Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss, and Dr. Jordan Shlain (Founder of Private Medical, Silicon Valley’s top concierge medical office) ● Competitive **Salary**, **Equity**, and **Benefits**: Healthcare and PTO ● Being able to have complete ownership of the work they do and how high-impact it is. They won't just be working on 'easy' problems, internal tools or small features, they'll be given complex/difficult tasks to solve and drive the entire company and product forward. ● As you can probably tell from the expectations of this role, there is a high chance that a candidate will be a great fit if they were previously a founding engineer or a relatively early employee at a fast-growing startup during Seed - Series C stages. ● Being an ex-founder or working on their own projects is also a great signal. ● We also found that typically engineers who are more junior in their career are a better fit for founding engineer. The right candidate for this role will likely have closer to 3-5 years experience rather than 10+ years experience. ● Here is some more info you can share with candidates: **The Problem we are trying to solve at Superpower****Product Waitlist with more Info** Hope this helps!

name: Principal/Staff Front-End Engineer
description:
We are building the future of open-ended interactions between people and intelligent dialog agents. This requires rethinking design, user interfaces, workflows and interactivity from first principles. 

We’re looking for Staff to Principal level Front End Engineers who are genuinely excited about this future and can make significant contributions to our front-end development efforts. 

We're looking for a skilled software engineer with a deep passion for front end development, and ability to thrive in a fast-paced, agile environment.

requirements.description: Deep understanding of Typescript, Javascript  CSS, HTML, and modern front end design patterns and best practices
At least 4 years of experience with React, alongside proficiency in other JS frameworks and libraries, is also required
Demonstrated experience with UI/UX design and rapidly iterating based on user feedback
React native experience is highly preferred
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills are also required
Ability to navigate complex technical and product-related issues
Demonstrated use of data driven approaches to experiment, measure success and iterate is also a must
Proven ability to work in a fast-paced development environment and deliver timely results
Experience with the front end development of rapidly scaling consumer-facing applications
requirements.explanation: Someone who did frontend at a B2B SaaS startup with enterprise users for example, would not be a good fit. Some examples of rapidly scaling consumer-facing products can be popular travel apps like Airbnb or messaging apps like Discord with hundreds of millions of users. Our ideal companies section should have more examples.

responsibilities: Architect and develop highly performant, visually appealing, and user-friendly interfaces that push the boundaries of what's possible.
Refine and improve our user interface to ensure it’s highly engaging, that it delights our consumer audience and exceeds their needs, desires and expectations.
Collaborate with others to define and implement new product features and design patterns
Use your expertise with Front End technology and tools to create a positive and engaging experience.
Develop front end software for cross platform implementations.
workPlaceText: this role is on-site in Palo Alto. Office is in downtown Palo Alto near Stanford campus
visa_text_more: We can sponsor visa for the right candidate
experience_info: as a Front End Software Engineer with a strong focus on user experience and design
recruiting_advice: It’s important that you reach out to candidates that have experience doing front end development of **rapidly scaling consumer-facing applications**. Some example companies that have consumer-facing products (Meta, Lyft, Spotify, Discord etc) are in our **ideal companies section**. This is especially important for our frontend roles like this because we’re building a consumer facing product that already has millions of users. We’re building a product that will be used by the consumer masses, not an enterprise B2B SaaS products used by large corporations. We're also hiring for a principal/staff level front-end engineer, so they would need **10+ years of experience doing frontend**. Hope this helps with direction. **Make sure not to reach out to candidates at Open AI** because we don't want to risk our brand in these folks' eyes and maintain a good relationship. name: Database Engineer (Rust)
description:
At Edvo, we are building the next generation of tools for interpersonal computing. This means not just building powerful and intuitive user interfaces, but also powerful network dynamics which foster and empower the tinkerers of the world.

These days, you’ll hear people from every discipline wishing they had a “common filesystem” where all their applications could share data seamlessly. The same way everyone has a personal computer (now multiple personal computers), we have a thesis that everyone will have a personal database that augments them wherever they are, on whichever device they use.

We’re building a new open source database engine with the express intent of creating a federated network and protocol.

requirements.description: Candidate should be experienced with: WebAssembly, Network programming, LSM trees and Key/Value stores, Building indices, Query language and relational algebra fundamentals, and Peer to peer networking
Experienced and proficient with Rust
Experience with MVVM architecture is a major plus!
Previous experience at an early-stage startup required

responsibilities: Come up to speed on the current design and data model
Review architectural plans
Build small PoCs for various aspects
Work on a centralized version of the database for internal consumption
Contribute to architectural discussions
Build out components of the federated database
Help create bench tests for performance and quality metrics
workPlaceText: We're a lean team of seven and remote. We maintain core working hours of 9:30AM to 3PM Pacific, when we're all online and available at the same time
visa_text_more: We're unfortunately not able to sponsor visas at this time
experience_info: as a database engineer (or equivalent)

company.name: Edvo
company.description: At Edvo, we care deeply about helping people think well.  We believe the next revolution in computing will be Personal Intelligence and Intelligence Augmentation — the same way everyone has a personal computer (now multiple personal computers), we have a thesis that everyone will have a personal database that augments them wherever they are, on whichever device they use.
company.productDescription:
We're starting by helping each of us break out of tab hell, and break into digital spaces designed for thinking and flow.

We're creating the next generation tools for interpersonal computing, to help us make better sense of information and transform passive consumption into active thinking.

Similar to how designers have Figma and musicians have visual interfaces to interact intimately with their work, we'd like to give each of us the ability to interact intimately with our thoughts and knowledge.

We think of the interface as being like a game – where people can construct, navigate, and collaborate in their universes of knowledge. In a nutshell, we believe it's important to break out of expectations of the "traditional" application UI – where everything is rectilinear, transitions between views work a certain narrow way, and relationships are static.

You’ll have a prominent voice in all product design decisions, while working closely with highly collaborative and cross-functional team members to plan, design, and implement.

Given the nature of the problem, our product is large and we are still building basic, critical “table-stakes” functionality. Basic does not mean that these functionalities are not complex.
company.teamAbout:
We're a lean team of seven and remote. We maintain core working hours of 9:30AM to 3PM Pacific, when we're all online and available at the same time. We strive to be clear in our communication and our foundation is based on trust and self-agency.

We're building a team of empathetic and thoughtful individuals who care deeply about how we all think, collaborate, and create. Our current digital environments favor passive consumption, not critical thought, yet billions of people are online to learn, create, and understand the world better.

company.name: Edvo
company.description: At Edvo, we care deeply about helping people think well.  We believe the next revolution in computing will be Personal Intelligence and Intelligence Augmentation — the same way everyone has a personal computer (now multiple personal computers), we have a thesis that everyone will have a personal database that augments them wherever they are, on whichever device they use.
company.productDescription:
We're starting by helping each of us break out of tab hell, and break into digital spaces designed for thinking and flow.

We're creating the next generation tools for interpersonal computing, to help us make better sense of information and transform passive consumption into active thinking.

Similar to how designers have Figma and musicians have visual interfaces to interact intimately with their work, we'd like to give each of us the ability to interact intimately with our thoughts and knowledge.

We think of the interface as being like a game – where people can construct, navigate, and collaborate in their universes of knowledge. In a nutshell, we believe it's important to break out of expectations of the "traditional" application UI – where everything is rectilinear, transitions between views work a certain narrow way, and relationships are static.

You’ll have a prominent voice in all product design decisions, while working closely with highly collaborative and cross-functional team members to plan, design, and implement.

Given the nature of the problem, our product is large and we are still building basic, critical “table-stakes” functionality. Basic does not mean that these functionalities are not complex.
company.teamAbout:
We're a lean team of seven and remote. We maintain core working hours of 9:30AM to 3PM Pacific, when we're all online and available at the same time. We strive to be clear in our communication and our foundation is based on trust and self-agency.

We're building a team of empathetic and thoughtful individuals who care deeply about how we all think, collaborate, and create. Our current digital environments favor passive consumption, not critical thought, yet billions of people are online to learn, create, and understand the world better.
