name: Machine Learning Researcher
description:
Our Primary Machine Learning Objective: Tame the beast that is the text-to-image diffusion model by establishing fine-grained control over the image generation process, immaculate photorealism, and superhuman prompt-understanding.   

Achieving these goals involves solving novel machine learning challenges that push beyond the existing research frontier. For those initiated in text-to-image diffusion models, challenges like preserving text, fine-grained details, improving image photorealism, and achieving accurate multi-subject compositions in raw generated outputs will be familiar. We tackle these challenges every day, and want to work with ML Researches who are similarly excited about solving them in this role!

requirements.description: Strong experience with programming such as Python, CUDA, and deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow and PyTorch
Ability to read, synthesize, and implement methods outlined in the machine learning research corpus
Strong intuition for tailoring and constructing machine learning model architecture(s) to solve new tasks (especially those related to LLMs, Diffusion Models, and related models)
Track record of implementing machine learning based research project(s) end-to-end
Familiarity and experience with text-to-image diffusion models, LLMs, controlnets, LoRAs
Familiarity with major concepts in computer vision

responsibilities: Train new models that add conditional control to text-to-image diffusion models, including ControlNets and LoRAs
Read, understand, and implement algorithms in relevant research, as well as push the state of the art forward by contributing novel ideas bespoke to our use-case(s)
Train underlying base models to produce immaculate photorealism and superhuman prompt-understanding.
workPlaceText: We work in person in New York or remote
visa_text_more: We are willing to sponsor visas if the candidate is truly exceptional
experience_info: in a machine learning intensive role or in a research capacity

● Pitch to candidates that this opportunity means being able to work at a **YC-backed startup**. This is not only a fulfilling experience where they get to work at a fast-growing startup but also an incredibly strong signal that will be on their resume forever. Hiring managers have a positive impression of those who worked at YC startups. 
● We're backed by the best investors in silicon valley (**Soma Capital, YC, and Hack VC**) and have a healthy runway.
● If they join, they'll be working with a talented group of machine learning researchers and software engineers with backgrounds from Harvard and Caltech.
● We're looking for strong research skills and experience. 

Hope this helps and we're incredibly excited to meet the candidates you refer our way.

name: Founding Full-Stack Engineer
description:
As Complete's founding engineer, you'll play a key role in delivering on our mission to bring transparency to startup compensation. You'll be responsible for collaborating with product, design, engineers, and even directly with customers to produce world-class products for candidates, employees, and talent teams. As a full-stack engineer, you will own the delivery of products end-to-end, from writing database migrations to building and styling React components.

Our excitement about our mission and our stage of company requires a commitment from every employee, equally establishing a high bar of autonomy and responsibility.

Complete HQ is in San Francisco, and we're looking to build out the team in SF.

requirements.description: Has some experience developing Django applications or knowledge of Python and a working knowledge of Tailwind CSS, GraphQL, NextJS, and Node
Has built products using React and Typescript and is familiar with building application backends (microservices or web frameworks)

responsibilities: You'll be responsible for collaborating with product, design, engineers, and even directly with customers to produce world-class products for candidates, employees, and talent teams
As a full-stack engineer, you will own the delivery of products end-to-end, from writing database migrations to building and styling React components
You will build and ship high-quality products quickly
You will build empathy for the customer and build features to solve their needs that we may never have expected or explicitly planned
You will write up engineering proposals translated from designs or direct customer feedback. You'll be able to convert these proposals into well-scoped and prioritized tasks that you deliver on time
You will help drive the technical roadmap forward by contributing to architectural decisions and building new infrastructure, services, and applications from zero-to-one
You will push the quality and excellence bar by advocating for and practicing engineering best practices, including code reviews, testing, code quality, security, and monitoring
You have a passion for your craft that drives you to improve systems and code without being explicitly told
You are excited at the opportunity to grow with the company. We are very early, and you will need to level up quickly in both execution and leadership to grow with us
workPlaceText: Complete HQ is in San Francisco, and we're looking to build out the team in SF. We're not open to hybrid or remote, but we understand if folks have things going on that they need to work from home to handle!
visa_text_more: We're only able to support H1B transfers and TN visas
experience_info: 3+ years as full-time engineer, or 1+ years engineering experience working in fast growing startup
recruiting_advice:
Founding Engineer is a unique position that not too many engineers will get a chance to experience in their careers. Being one of the first 5 engineers at an early-stage tech startup is an incredibly challenging yet fulfilling experience. 

Compared to being an engineer at FAANG companies, there will be a much bigger emphasis on ownership and work ethic. 

Recruiting a founding engineer is difficult, so here are some tips we think would help you when sourcing and pitching candidates:

● Pitch to candidates that this opportunity means being a founding engineer at a **YC-backed startup**. This is not only a fulfilling experience where they get to work at a fast-growing startup but also an incredibly strong signal that will be on their resume forever. Having been hiring managers at many different tech companies ourselves, we know every company would want to hire someone who was a founding engineer at a YC startup. 
● We're backed by the best investors in silicon valley (**Accel & YC**) and have a healthy runway.
● Competitive **Salary**: $160k - $210k, **Equity**: 0.5% - 1%, and **Benefits**: medical, dental, and vision insurance and unlimited time-off
● Being able to have complete ownership of the work they do and how high-impact it is. They won't just be working on 'easy' problems, internal tools or small features, they'll be given complex/difficult tasks to solve and drive the entire company and product forward.
● As you can probably tell from the expectations of this role, there is a high chance that a candidate will be a great fit if they were previously a founding engineer or a relatively early employee at a fast-growing startup during Seed - Series C stages.
● Being an ex-founder or working on their own projects is also a great signal.
● **This role is NOT for everyone**. If you think a potential candidate is just looking for another job and they don't really care what company they are joining as long as pay & hours are good, we strongly suggest against submitting them. They might have a decent resume but there is an incredibly low chance they'll get hired and will likely go nowhere after 1 interview. It'll be a waste of time for you, the candidate, and our company. 
● We also found that typically engineers who are more junior in their career are a better fit for founding engineer. The right candidate for this role will likely have closer to 3 years experience rather than 10 years experience.

Hope this helps and we're incredibly excited to meet the candidates you refer our way.
avoid_traits: Job Hopping (we care about whether they have thrived in a fast-growing startup environment, so we're less inclined for ppl w/ average tenure of 18 mon)

company.name: Complete (YC W22)

company.description:
Atomus is a cybersecurity company focused exclusively on small businesses in the Aerospace and Defense industry needing to comply with NIST 800-171, DFARS 7012, and CMMC cybersecurity requirements.

We have major customers including the US Air Force, Defense Innovation Unit, along with aerospace and defense customers. 

We recently raised an investment from early investors in top tier companies like Snowflake, Robinhood, and Anduril among many others to scale Atomus to its full potential.
company.productDescription:
Atomus Aegis is our built cybersecurity software made for small businesses in the Aerospace and Defense industry. The system runs on computers, phones, and servers that handle defense data and configure these systems to the NIST 800-171 cybersecurity requirements.

Imagine if we shipped you a computer that was already compliant with the cybersecurity requirements in your contract out of the box. Our software configures your existing computer to this compliant baseline without the headache of buying new hardware or months having someone do this for you manually.

Once configured, Atomus monitors, maintains, and documents these systems to comply with DFARS 7012 and CMMC cybersecurity requirements.
company.teamAbout: Our team at Atomus is hardworking, move fast, and put our customers first!

name: Research Engineer
description:
Join us to build and safely deploy aligned, superhuman AI. For decades, technology was "just a tool" - could it be a colleague?

For decades, technology was “just a tool.” Soon, it will be a partner. We are building an AI pair programmer that feels like a full colleague inside your computer - capable, conversational, and reliable across domains. If this isn't AGI, then what is? Join us if you want to build and safely deploy aligned AGI in products that matter.

As a Research Engineer, you’ll work on training, evaluating, and serving large AI models, internet-scale dataset building, and help prototype new research and product ideas.

requirements.description: Excellent programming skills in Python and familiarity with frameworks like TensorFlow or PyTorch
Familiarity with cloud computing platforms and experience in deploying AI models at scale
Any expertise in designing, testing, and optimizing novel neural net architectures
requirements.explanation: Experience with graph neural networks and knowledge graph representation

requirements.description: Knowledge of GPU optimization techniques to enhance model training and inference speed
requirements.explanation: Understanding of parallel computing frameworks, such as MPI or CUDA

requirements.explanation: Deep expertise of deep learning techniques

requirements.explanation: Proficiency in data preprocessing, cleaning, and analysis to handle internet-scale data

requirements.description: Strong background in distributed systems and experience with distributed training across large GPU clusters
requirements.explanation: Familiarity with distributed storage systems, such as Hadoop or Spark

responsibilities: Pre-training: Distributed training across large GPU clusters
Inference: Optimizing inference throughput of a custom neural net architecture
RL: Continual learning to train AI models on user feedback
Tool use: Implement interfaces to allow our AI models to interact with real-world tools or APIs
Algorithms: Designing, testing, and optimizing new neural net architectures
Internet-scale data: E.g. scraping much of YouTube
workPlaceText: In-person (London, SF, NYC, or Vienna) or remote
visa_text_more: We can sponsor visas for the right candidate
experience_info: doing relevant research and/or engineering
recruiting_advice:
We have very high standards when it comes to recruiting the right candidates. I think the easiest way to describe this is benchmarking against other companies. We would be interested in less than 20% of OpenAI Research Engineers.  We would be interested in less than 10% of Meta or Google Brain Research Engineers. We would be interested in less than 15% of Deepmind Research Engineers.  We would be interested in 5% of Amazon Research Engineers. We are interested in maybe 50% of Inflection Research Engineers.

There are other companies that could be interesting, but they are almost exclusively smaller orgs. If someone is at a smaller org, why is the person the best?

The big thing we need is a track record of being outstanding even within outstanding teams.

If someone was laid off, it is nearly impossible that they would meet the bar, unless they were laid off as part of an entire org or due to location or something else.  Companies would never let go of the people we'll be hiring.

We are also VERY open to finding undiscovered talent in startups or locations other than "the standard" places that everyone looks to find the world's best talent (companies named above). There are brilliant people who went to schools that aren't top schools. These same brilliant people sometimes don't end up at the top places to work. That said, why is this person you are recommending one of those people?

company.description:
Breef is the world's first agency marketplace. As the modern outsourcing solution, our platform connects leading brands with leading agencies for all their digital + creative needs. Our product is a first-of-its-kind solution for high-value, high-consideration transactions, changing the future of work.

See our latest news in TechCrunch here: https://techcrunch.com/2023/02/06/breef-raises-16m-to-match-brands-with-marketing-agencies/
company.teamAbout: Hey there, welcome! We’re a team who believes there’s an easier way to outsource projects, pitch clients, and most importantly, create connections for better outcomes. So here we are, a global group of ‘doers,’ changing The Next Generation of Work. Join us.

name: Engineering Manager
description:
Breef is seeking an Engineering Manager to join our dynamic, fast growing team. This individual will be responsible for leading technical innovation and the management of a hybrid / in-house engineering team.

You will be responsible for establishing the structure and sustained success of Breef’s technical foundation, including leading Breef’s engineering team both internally and externally. You will partner closely with the larger product team to implement Breef’s product roadmap, hone Agile engineering processes, and build and develop a rockstar team. You’ll ensure that Breef’s technology drives best practices and innovation — ultimately shaping the marketing industry at large.

The ideal candidate understands and embraces the fast-paced nature of a startup, as they’ve found success in that environment previously. They also have the ability to translate complex technical concepts and communicate with a broad group of non-technical stakeholders. The ideal candidate drives decisions, and can also act as an individual contributor when necessary, especially as we scale our engineering team. Most importantly, they understand how to build delightful customer experiences, and prioritize balancing the customer’s experience with internal technical needs in their execution of tasks.

requirements.description: A general understanding of the marketing and agency space
requirements.explanation: Prior marketplace or fintech / payments experience a plus. Another bonus: DevOps experience

requirements.description: Experience with Agile development methodologies
Experience as an engineering leader as well as a hands-on contributor
requirements.explanation: Experience owning software development life cycles and driving technical projects

requirements.description: Experience managing an engineering team of 3+ direct reports
requirements.explanation: If their focus was mainly around people management in their previous role, this probably won't be a good fit. Altough that is part of this role, this role is much bigger picture talking strategy, roadmaps, etc. We would like to see more of the latter.

responsibilities: Manage and grow the Breef engineering team, working with our recruiting team on hiring roadmap, needs, vetting and onboarding of our ‘dream team’
Lead a team of entrepreneurial engineers to build web-based systems that are at the core of the Breef platform
Spend approximately 25% of your time “in the weeds” — understanding the ‘ins & outs’ of our code, jumping into Python on the backend and React on the frontend as needed
Manage and collaborate with our external development team to inform the how and why of every sprint
Architect and build high-value features and product offerings that drive growth and build Breef’s moat
Partner closely with key stakeholders across Breef, including Design, Product, Operations and Leadership
Remove project or team roadblocks and respond to and prioritize requests from the larger team

Lead, own and evolve the engineering policies, processes and procedures in alignment with Agile best practices, and whatever you deem necessary to maintain the health and integrity of Breef’s engineering org
Advise with leadership on key technical decisions; act as a translator between technical third parties and Breef
workPlaceText: We are currently a remote-first team and will be focused on growing the team / HQ in Devner, CO going forward. We currently have a team in CO and it’s where our Co-Founders are / will be going forward. If the right candidate is willing to relocate, great (but ideally we find them in CO!). Role is on-site in Denver with 1-2 flex WFH days a week
visa_text_more: We're unfortunately not able to sponsor visas at this time
experience_info: out of which ideally only around 2-3 years as an engineering manager (or strong tech lead), managing and hiring engineering teams and 5+ years experience as a full-stack software engineer prior to that (python & react)

name: Software Engineer - Frontend / Fullstack
description:
What it means to be an early engineer:

Joining Vellum this early means that you’re going to play a huge part in guiding both the technical and cultural evolution of the company. Together, we’re going to face the hardest technical challenges this journey has to offer head on. As the team grows, you’ll be the battle hardened expert that everyone looks towards for guidance.

With great power comes great responsibility 🙂

requirements.description: Previous experience and strong proficiency in React, CSS and Typescript
Bachelor's degree in computer science or relevant discipline from a top 50 CS school
requirements.explanation: ideally top 25 cs school

requirements.description: Strong interest/passion about AI
Previous experience working at a startup
requirements.explanation: fast growing startups backed by top investors. Please reference our ideal companies section to get a better understanding of the caliber

requirements.description: Shows "Extreme ownership" – has owned core systems, been at a single company long enough to really own big pieces of the tech and learned all the hard-won lessons that come with it (staying 1.5 years or less at all your companies doesn't give you this as much)
Ideally in New York
requirements.explanation: Can be flexible

responsibilities: Tackling our most difficult (and interesting) problems - chaining, onboarding flows and prompt iteration, just to name a few
Shaping the way users experience Vellum
Optimizing the performance of our frontend
A/B testing changes to maximize the number of users that achieve successful outcomes
Defining and scoping green field projects that move the company forward
Working closely with customers to understand what the need, figuring out how to make them successful, and owning the solutions end to end
Serving as a cultural pillar of the team
workPlaceText: Being based in NYC is not a hard-requirement for us. We are open to the continental US, but our preference in order of priority is NYC -> East Coast -> Other
visa_text_more: We can do H-1B transfers or O-1 applications on a case by case basis
experience_info: - looking for a senior software engineer
recruiting_advice:
It is important to us to find some talented women to join our team!

Some things you can can share with candidates:

Company info, fundraising, and team: https://www.paraform.com/company/vellum-(yc-w23)

What's it like working at Vellum?

  • We’re laser focused on helping companies bring AI into production and providing real value. Decision making is simple: if what we do allows our users to increase how many use cases of AI they’re able to successfully put into production, then we do it!

  • Don’t cut corners, cut the right corners. What can you do with 10% of your time to get 90% of the desired impact? Now that you only spent 10% of the time doing something, imagine how much more can be done with the rest of your time!!

  • Everyone is a 1000x engineer/designer/pm when they’re passionate about the problems they’re solving and love the people they’re working with

  • Because we trust each other, we can move fast and have fun doing it 😄

One selling point you can mention to candidates on a phone screen:

  • Working with Vellum means you get a front row seat into seeing what exciting AI companies are using AI to build. Because of our product, we get to see what companies are using AI for and what it takes to build a successful AI-powered product. For someone who is entrepreneurial and dreaming about starting their own startup one day, this is a cool opportunity.

Technical problems we're solving

There are so many interesting problems we need to solve: prompt chaining, fine-tuning infrastructure, open source models and multimodality, just to name a few. Ultimately, the goal is to bring engineering best practices to the fast moving world of AI/LLMs and ensure that our customers have the best models for the job trained on their own company specific data.

In case the candidate is curious:

  • Google Cloud Platform - as our cloud provider

  • Postgres - as our primary database

  • Python - what we write our backend in

  • Django - for our webservers

  • Flask - for our microservices

  • Typescript - what we write our frontend in

  • React - as our frontend framework

Things you should look out for when you initially screen candidates:

  • Are they articulate good communicators?

  • Excitement level of the AI space is good to gauge. They have to be excited about AI (even better if they're actively looking) but if they are just looking for another job at any company we'll probably not be as excited.

  • Excitement level of working at an early stage startup.

  • Understanding whether they meet the technical requirements on paper?

company.name: Vellum AI
company.description:
At Vellum, our mission is to be the primary platform companies use to bring AI into production. AI is the biggest platform shift since the internet, the applications are everywhere! With foundation models getting better we expect the world to be dramatically different in the future. We intend to be the platform layer to bring this amazing technology to life in production use cases.

We enable companies to bring real business value from AI / LLMs. The output generated by AI / LLMs is usually stochastic and bringing AI into production requires robust testing and choosing the right model for the job. We’ve seen companies spend months of engineering time building good tooling for this (time which could be spent on their core end user facing product) and despite this they struggle to get the best results out of these models. Our platform provides companies best in class tooling to use their own data in production AI applications.

We’re a YC W23 company, raised $9.5m and are backed by top investors like Rebel Fund, Eastlink Capital, Arash Ferdowsi (co-founder of Dropbox), Dharmesh Shah (co-founder of Hubspot), Dan Scholnick (board member of Weights & Biases, Docker, New Relic), and Divya Bhat (former YC group partner, 2x CEO). We announced our fundraise on TechCrunch here: https://techcrunch.com/2023/07/11/prompt-engineering-startup-vellum-ai/

We’re excited to build our core team. The initial team will play a key role in the long term growth of the company.​

P.S: Why the name Vellum? - Vellum is a type of paper - the Magna Carta was written on Vellum. We intend to be the standard source of record in production - You can’t spell Vellum without LLM 😉
company.teamAbout:
Working at Vellum

  • We’re laser focused on helping companies bring AI into production and providing real value. Decision making is simple: if what we do allows our users to increase how many use cases of AI they’re able to successfully put into production, then we do it!

  • Don’t cut corners, cut the right corners. What can you do with 10% of your time to get 90% of the desired impact? Now that you only spent 10% of the time doing something, imagine how much more can be done with the rest of your time!!

  • Everyone is a 1000x team member when they’re passionate about the problems they’re solving and love the people they’re working with

  • Because we trust each other, we can move fast and have fun doing it 😄

Our Values

We live these values every day, we know there are difficult tradeoffs to each of these values and we’re willing to accept them.

1. It’s always Day 0

Every day is an opportunity to excel. We tackle challenges head-on, execute relentlessly, and strive for continuous improvement.

2. Customers come first

We are committed to exceptional customer service. Customers should be delighted when using our product. We measure our success by the tangible business outcomes our customers achieve through our products.

3. Be resilient, not stubborn

We maintain a positive outlook and work through challenges. Our team supports each other, ensuring we don’t let setbacks hinder our progress. We recognize the fine line between resilience and stubbornness, striving to stay on the right side of it.

4. Take care of each other

We believe in the power of teamwork. Our high-trust, low-ego culture ensures we support each other, cover for teammates when needed, and prioritize collective success over individual achievements. We hire and invest in top talent.

5. Go and see

We take full responsibility for our work, striving for excellence in everything we do. No task is beneath us, and we actively seek out and address issues at their source. Our commitment to relentless execution ensures continuous improvement and high-quality results.

6. Share more, share often

We prioritize clear and frequent communication using various tools. By keeping everyone informed, we minimize surprises and ensure alignment across the team.

7. Be transparent

We are committed to honesty with current and future teammates, customers and investors. Transparent communication and setting realistic expectations are essential to success.

8. Love your work, Love AI

We are passionate about AI and genuinely curious about its potential. Our team actively engages with the technology, ensuring we stay at the forefront of the industry.

9. Cut the right corners

We prioritize efficiency and rapid execution. By focusing on the most impactful tasks and adopting a Minimum Viable Product (MVP) mentality, we move quickly without sacrificing quality.

10. Don’t be an asshole

We maintain a respectful and supportive workplace. We communicate openly, give constructive feedback, and avoid ego-driven behaviors. This value ensures a positive and collaborative work environment.

name: Distributed Systems Engineer (Backend)
description: You will hone in on building extremely scalable, reliable, and fast infrastructure using languages and frameworks like Go, Rust, Kafka/RedPanda, Kubernetes, and more. You should enjoy designing and building distributed systems with extreme attention to detail. Ideally, you would have 1+ years of experience building similar systems in the past to leverage.

requirements.description: Have significant experience in building any sort of large scale distributing systems platform
Prior experience solving distributed systems problems, optimizing for reliability, speed, and cost
Built or contributed to at least one open-source or personal project related to distributed systems
Experience or familiar with Go, Rust, Kafka/RedPanda, Kubernetes

workPlaceText: We work fully in-person in downtown San Francisco
visa_text_more: We can sponsor visa for the right candidate!
experience_info: of relevant professional experience out of college
recruiting_advice: We're looking for candidates that will "blow us away" in terms passion and knowledge for the AI/ML space. We want to see candidates who think about their work with a **lot of craftsmanship and strong opinionation** which typically results in great conversation. Candidates who have **worked at startups or have strong personal projects** are typically a strong indicator of this. Some other signals we've seen are folks with really interesting personal blogs online that write about random technical topics whatever they are, but obviously not the case with every strong candidate. We've worked with this other recruiting firm in the past that have given us candidates that are strong on paper and pass our technical challenge, but either *a. Felt like they didn't have the right drive* *b. Were too unopinionated about how they should approach certain technical problems we throw at them and asked surface level questions.* We've seen candidates won't reply to traditional recruiting messages. Instead, ***they will reply to a message around the tone of generally meeting with a founders and talking about product / industry; after which you can try to convince them to interview.*** Example candidate profiles I've sourced myself that I think are strong: https://fyd.ai/ https://www.elizas.website/ https://thisisfranklin.com/about/ https://justinjaffray.com/ https://dancrankshaw.com/ https://n-young.me/

company.name: Sieve (YC W22)
company.description:
In the late 90’s, humanity started contributing to a central store of all human knowledge — the internet. The internet back then was made up mostly of text, and to that end search engines like Google indexed it all — literally putting all human knowledge at people’s fingertips.

20+ years later, we’re at a crossroads where richer data types are being used to store human knowledge. 80% of the internets IP traffic today is video. Apps like TikTok have exploded, smart cameras exist almost everywhere from homes, to farms, construction sites, offices, retail stores, and warehouses, and we’ve been ushered into a new age of collaborative, creative tools with experiences such as Figma.

Unlike twenty years ago, human knowledge exists in more places and forms than ever. And every developer and company trying to build a new magical experience is left setting up AI / ML infrastructure, wondering why they have to manage datasets, and figuring out how to process, structure, search, and deliver resulting data to an end application.

Sieve’s mission is to build the core infrastructure needed to process, understand, and search the rich data — so developers can ship magical experiences faster. And video is just the start.
company.productDescription:
Ship powerful AI features, fast.

Stop worrying about complex infrastructure and broken tools. Leverage the latest and greatest models, while collaborating with your entire team.
company.teamAbout: Sieve is a seed-stage startup backed by some of the best software investors including Y Combinator, Matrix Partners, and Swift Ventures. We’re a small team interested in building great developer tools that people will use to build the next generation of AI-powered applications. We started out in Berkeley and are now based fully in SF.

You should also love staying up to date with the latest and greatest in ML and will build workflows that are generally useful as templates that’ll exist within the Sieve product from time to time.

company.name: Amber
company.description:
While interest in electric vehicles is at an all-time high, new EVs are still out of reach for most consumers, even with the support of government incentives in policies like the Inflation Reduction Act. High consumer demand and costs of battery materials continue to keep prices high and constrain available inventory.

If new vehicles are so expensive, why not embrace used EVs? The used EV population is poised to explode, presenting an affordable option for more consumers looking to make the leap to electric. However, used EVs come with their own problems — batteries lose capacity over time and replacement costs for out-of-warranty repair on EVs can be explosive.

This is where we come in — at Amber, our mission is to keep electric vehicles on the road longer by building technology-enabled protection, support, and infrastructure for second, third, and even fourth-hand EV owners.
company.teamAbout:
Amber is a seed-stage startup with experienced founders (e.g., Samsara, Metromile, Square) backed by world-class investors, and we’re looking for others who are passionate about the EV future to join us in our mission to accelerate the transition to a cleaner future of transportation.

With the used EV market poised to explode, we think this is the perfect time build these products and services — picks and shovels to ensure that our investment in EVs can be maximized and kept on the road as long as possible.

While ideal teammates will have experience in insurance, automotive, and software, we encourage you to apply even if you aren’t an exact match for a posted position. We value passion, willingness to learn, and diversity of perspectives and would love to hear from you if you think you could be a fit! Amber is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes candidates of all backgrounds.

name: Founding Product Leader
description:
This is a really special role and can take different forms depending on the candidate. You would be joining as a core member of the founding team and jump between engineering and customer-facing work.

Ultimately, we are looking for a hungry, tech-saavy person from an energy development, civil engineering, environmental consulting, or landman background to guide our product development.

requirements.description: Demonstrated experience with software development, data analysis, or modeling
Deep understanding of natural resources and development policy and regulatory requirements

responsibilities: Work closely with customers to deploy Blumen in their projects
Prioritize product features and build out roadmap based on past experience and customer conversations

Candidate qualities we look for:
• **Relentlessness**: You seek out hard problems and don’t back down
• **Depth and Clarity of Though**t: You approach your work with intellectual rigor

company.name: Blumen Systems
company.description:
We aggregate federal and state geospatial datasets and regulatory documents and build AI systems to give project developers and contractors automated spatial intelligence from site selection to permitting to project development across carbon sequestration, geothermal, hydrogen, and minerals projects.

We believe that by equipping energy developers, engineering and construction firms, and exploration companies with cutting-edge data and research tools we can dramatically accelerate the energy transition.

We are backed by some of the best early-stage investors and angels in vertical software, data, energy, and natural resources including Haystack, Caffeinated, Susa,  First Star, David Rubenstein, and Amit Narayan.
company.teamAbout:
I (Hannes) started Blumen while completing my graduate work at Stanford University in August of 2022. Having spent my summers before grad school working on farms and ranches in California and Wyoming, I was a bit of an outlier in the computer science department and spent most of my time reasoning about how to improve land development with data and ML. I got to know a lot of land owners and industrial facility operators and learned about the insane regulatory and logistical complexity involved in energy and minerals development. I met several kindred spirits along the way and we built Blumen to solve problems for the people powering (literally) the economy. 

At Blumen, we’re building software to power the American energy transition. If you are ambitious, hard working, and passionate about clean energy, infrastructure, and natural resources we would love to meet you. Explorers, builders, and adventurers wanted!

name: Founding Engineer, Geospatial

Candidates will have the opportunity to be a critical contributor to a first-of-its-kind system enabling the energy transition at scale and solve challenging engineering problems in the process. They will manage geospatial data across ArcGIS, GEE, and our internal database as well as work closely with customers to ensure our geospatial tool meets their unique needs.

company.name: Blumen Systems
company.description:
We aggregate federal and state geospatial datasets and regulatory documents and build AI systems to give project developers and contractors automated spatial intelligence from site selection to permitting to project development across carbon sequestration, geothermal, hydrogen, and minerals projects.

We believe that by equipping energy developers, engineering and construction firms, and exploration companies with cutting-edge data and research tools we can dramatically accelerate the energy transition.

We are backed by some of the best early-stage investors and angels in vertical software, data, energy, and natural resources including Haystack, Caffeinated, Susa,  First Star, David Rubenstein, and Amit Narayan.
company.teamAbout:
I (Hannes) started Blumen while completing my graduate work at Stanford University in August of 2022. Having spent my summers before grad school working on farms and ranches in California and Wyoming, I was a bit of an outlier in the computer science department and spent most of my time reasoning about how to improve land development with data and ML. I got to know a lot of land owners and industrial facility operators and learned about the insane regulatory and logistical complexity involved in energy and minerals development. I met several kindred spirits along the way and we built Blumen to solve problems for the people powering (literally) the economy. 

At Blumen, we’re building software to power the American energy transition. If you are ambitious, hard working, and passionate about clean energy, infrastructure, and natural resources we would love to meet you. Explorers, builders, and adventurers wanted!

name: Senior Product Manager - Payments
description: We are looking for our third product hire here at Zeal. As part of the founding Product team, you will manage the payments within our payroll infrastructure and will help lay down the foundations for the product team to grow and scale. You will be an active participant in discussions with stakeholders, engineering, and design to help ship beautiful products that our users love. If you are on board for a large-scope product role with the ability to wear many hats and define an amazing fin-tech product, this may be the role for you!

requirements.description: Interest in payroll, HR, and/or the fintech landscape
Customer-driven product development experience
requirements.explanation: You think about the problem first and question the ‘why’ behind how we build our products. You are adept at white-boarding and have an ability to conduct customer and user surveys to optimize the current and future product roadmap

requirements.description: Experience overseeing roadmap strategy and definition for a B2B-related product
Experience working within payments or fintech adjacent industry
requirements.explanation: Experience working in: finance, information systems, or an API ecosystem

responsibilities: This is a highly autonomous role which will own the entire payments road map here at Zeal
You will support multiple different methods of payments: push to card, earned wage access programs and more
Building a digital wallet program for employees and employers to organize funds and get money faster to those who need it
Working on establishing and improving our bank integrations
Partner with Ops to automate and improve the everyday ACH process for customers with a keen focus on process optimization
Write and maintain user stories per changing product and engineering requirements
Liaise between various teams to manage project scope
Maintain accurate, up-to-date internal documentation and release notes
You will partner in product discovery and lead product delivery to ensure the final, shipped product matches the expectations of the customer
Collaborate with various teams to manage project scope, reporting on project statuses and key metrics
workPlaceText: This is a hybrid role with 2x a week in office policy
visa_text_more: For the right candidate, we can sponsor a visa. Our policy is, each new hire must have 1 full-year of US working visa validity from start date to qualify for Zeal further visa sponsorship.
experience_info: as a Product Manager experience preferably at a start-up

company.name: Zeal
company.description:
We are a modern, embedded payroll provider that helps empower companies to build their own unique payroll service. On top of our easy-to-use payroll API, we are pioneering an all-inclusive tax engine to democratize a broken and cumbersome process providing accessibility to small, medium, and large businesses and helping Americans get paid.

Backed by over $18 million in funding from top investors such as Y Combinator, Spark Capital (Marqeta, Coinbase, Affirm), and Robinhood's Founder; Vlad Tenev we are projected to be a forerunner in embedded payroll with an industry amassing billions of dollars in untapped revenue.

Our mission is to empower companies to become their own fintech company using our simple, seamless, and forward-thinking payroll technology.
company.productDescription: Our core platform includes all of the features you need to provide payroll: Tax management, Pre-built payroll flow components, Payment processing, and Comprehensive support services.
company.teamAbout: We are a tight-knit, inclusive community that is into music 🎵, cocktails 🍹, pets 🐈🐕, ping-pong 🏓 and above all else ~ high quality espresso ☕ but more importantly we value championing for our staff to bring their authentic true selves to work and aim to provide a fun and collaborative work environment for everyone!

name: Senior Product Designer
description: We’re looking for a seasoned Senior Product Designer to join us on this journey. Product design plays a pivotal role in defining what this vision and strategy looks like. Through empathy and deep understanding of our customers' needs, we seek to untangle complex problems with simple and elegant solutions. Design problems may not seem unique, but as you dig into the details, the problems get increasingly gnarly.

requirements.description: Passion for solving product problems while balancing all facets of a user experience
requirements.explanation: strategy and research, information architecture, interaction design

requirements.description: A deep understanding of the end-to-end iterative design process
requirements.explanation: including how to develop and use design research, job stories, journey mapping, content modeling, wire-framing, prototyping, user testing, and high-fidelity visuals to achieve human-centered design solutions

requirements.description: Experience owning products from start to finish, working with developers and PMs
Experience in building and shipping applications or software
Mastery of Figma
requirements.explanation: and a Mastery of low and high-fidelity prototyping and its use in UX Research

responsibilities: You’ll own projects from start to finish, while leading various UX initiatives including running design sprints to define and explore customer problems, content mapping, sketching, wireframing, low and high fidelity prototyping, and leading stakeholder reviews
Partner with product researchers to help the team develop empathy for our customers and advocate for their needs. Data will be just one of the many tools you will use to help inform your work

Collaborate with different disciplines. You will work closely with engineers, product managers, product researchers, and front-end developers to explore, build and ship your designs. You will help other disciplines understand the value design can bring to a project and ultimately build and ship the best products
You’ll provide feedback to your peers to help strengthen your team and Cubby as a whole. You will help your teammates build context, strong decision-making skills, and empathy for our merchants
Ship valuable and high-quality work without sacrificing speed
workPlaceText: On-site at our New York office
visa_text_more: We are able to support h1b transfers, h1b1s (singapore & chile) and canadian TN visas
experience_info: of tech/startup or product design experience or equivalent

company.name: Cubby
company.description:
Cubby’s mission is to empower self-storage operators to grow their independent and family-owned businesses in the face of massive institutionalization. There are more than 70,000 self-storage properties in North America. They’re operated by more than 35,000 independent business owners who provide service to tenants in times of tremendous life change. 

Whether moving across the country for a new job opportunity or moving on after a family death or divorce, self-storage tenants find tremendous value from a high-quality renting experience. So much value, in fact, that self-storage is the fastest growing asset class in commercial real estate by value, surpassing $50 billion annually in the U.S. last year. The lending market in this asset class is growing as well, with over $10 billion trading hands annually. Additional investor interest is pouring in, and with it, tremendous pressure to compete at the highest level.
company.productDescription: Our product allows self-storage operators to market, lease, and manage their properties while seamlessly receiving payments and financing. We serve 3 persona categories: Leads, Tenants, and Operators. Operators captures 3 primary levels: store manager, district manager, and business owner which ascend in seniority.
company.teamAbout:
We’re a seed-stage team of 20+ experienced software professionals already closing significant customers. lucky enough to be backed by a phenomenal group of investors and 28+ of the industry’s most influential advisors, giving us the access and resources to build things right and think for the long term.

If you want to build technology that’s valued by more than 1 in 10 Americans renting a storage unit, the near minimum wage managers looking for a way to earn their bonus, and the independent owners, lenders, and investors that make up this industry, we'd love to chat.

name: Platform Engineer
description:
You'll play a central role in architecting and implementing infrastructure that lets users train, track and deploy ML models with near-zero infrastructure setup. You'll be part of a fast moving team and have enormous impact on shaping the engineering culture. 

This job description is deliberately unstructured. We’re a startup. You’ll be defining your own work and helping set the company direction.

requirements.description: Experience with at least one of the major cloud platforms (AWS/GCP/Azure)
requirements.explanation: Experience "hacking the cloud". You'll need to know your way around how cloud services and architecture work or be a pro at figuring it out. Background/interest in ML is also a big plus

requirements.description: Secure data streaming and remote execution (eg. WebSockets, gRPC)
Experience building distributed and scalable systems (Temporal, Kafka)
Experience building orchestration infrastructure (Terraform, Kubernetes)
Experience working with Golang and Typescript (Rust is a plus)

responsibilities: We strongly believe in **rapid iteration cycles**. You'll deploy code multiple times a day and have full autonomy on driving technical decisions. Here are the kinds of things you can expect to build:
Scalable GPU computing infrastructure.
A real-time orchestration engine for multi-tenant cloud infra.
Hacking containers to sync local and remote environments on a user's laptop.
Spinning up ephemeral/persistent computing environments on multiple cloud providers.
Build real-time secure, auth-less, bidirectional data streams between remote and local environments.
workPlaceText: Berlin or London or Remote
visa_text_more: We're unfortunately not able to sponsor visas at this time!
experience_info: of relevant professional experience

company.name: Unweave
company.description:
In a world where only a handful of major players dominate the machine learning space, we believe that powerful technology should be accessible to everyone.

At Unweave, we’re building tools to make it dramatically easier to build machine learning products. We're empowering developers with the foundational infrastructure tools they need to customize models to their unique requirements.

We’re building the Supabase for Machine Learning.

Having just closed our pre-seed round from top tier investors, we’re expanding out team to help build the future of ML development.
company.teamAbout: We’re solving challenging problems on the cutting edge of what’s possible with the cloud. If you're excited about hacking existing tech to shape it to your vision and pioneering new solutions when necessary, come join us!

name: Python Framework Developer
description:
We're looking for a Python framework developer to help make Steamship the best AI developer platform. You'll work directly with the founding team on developing: The Steamship Python SDK, First-party Steamship Packages and Plugins and Bridges to third-party tools etc.

You'll also gain experience directly joining the AI wave about to transform society.

requirements.description: Comfortable building in public
requirements.explanation: Candidates should be comfortable mixing it up with users on Discord/GithHub and get energy from broadcasting their work to the world

requirements.description: Experience with writing high quality technical documentation
Expert at SDK / Framework design in Python
requirements.explanation: Previous experience with SDKs, packages, plugins, APIs etc

responsibilities: Developing the Steamship Python SDK (https://github.com/steamship-core/python-client). Used to develop Steamship packages and plugins.

Developing first-party Steamship Packages and Plugins.Plugins are our connection points to OpenAI, Stable Diffusion, and all of the best AI models. Packages bundle those things into an API for a specific task.
Developing bridges to third-party tools. We want to be able to host as many kinds of AI apps as possible, so supporting things like https://github.com/steamship-core/steamship-langchain is a must.
workPlaceText: Fully remote, however, there needs to be a significant timezone overlap. Our four-person team is already stretched time-zone wise from CA to Belgium, and going 3 more timezones out would eliminate the possibility of any synchronous time
visa_text_more: We can sponsor visa for the right candidates.
experience_info: at tech product companies and preferrably, at reputable tech companies and/or startups, not contractor or consulting company experience

company.name: Steamship
company.description:
Steamship is building Vercel for AI -- a platform for hosting the next decade of AI Apps.

Whether you're building ChatGPT bots, Langchain question-answering APIs, profile picture generators, or storybook writers, Steamship can host and scale it for you.

We're funded by the top VCs in Silicon Valley, care deeply about developer enablement, and are fully remote with team get-togethers.
company.teamAbout:
We're four startup veterans from the the AI & Systems spaces. Collectively, we've built unicorns, founded major Google Cloud offerings, had successful exits, gotten MIT PhDs...

...But more importantly: we're a kind, hardworking bunch of folks who wants to find more of the same and build something great.

We're funded by the top VCs in Silicon Valley, care deeply about developer enablement, and are fully remote with team get-togethers.

The rest of us are excited to welcome you onboard.

name: Marketing Copywriter
description: As a Marketing Copywriter at Airfoil, you will play a crucial role in creating user-centric and engaging content for our clients. You will work closely with our design teams to craft clear and effective messaging that aligns with the overall user experience strategy. You will collaborate with clients to understand their business goals and translate them into compelling copy that drives user engagement and achieves project objectives.

requirements.description: A strong appreciation for design and the UX process, with a solid understanding of UX principles
requirements.explanation: How copy and design work together to create cohesive user experiences

requirements.description: A strong portfolio showcasing their exceptional copywriting and content strategy work, with a strong design sensibility and attention to detail
Familiarity of web3 space is strongly preferred
requirements.explanation: Familiarity with the web3 landscape is a significant advantage, given the majority of our clients operate in this sphere

responsibilities: Create clear, concise, and compelling copy across multiple platforms including websites, landing pages, marketing campaigns, pitch decks, blogs, and product descriptions.
Develop and maintain a consistent and compelling brand voice across all client communications and touchpoints.
Adapt and tailor copywriting style and tone to different client brands, industries, and target demographics.

Team up with our design and engineering pros, along with clients, to grasp their core business concepts. Transform these insights into compelling product positioning and messaging that showcases their unique value.
Run efficient client calls to gather valuable feedback, confidently present your work, and keep the project on track.
Conduct thorough research on industry trends, competitive landscapes, and target audience preferences to inform and enhance copy and messaging strategies.
Take charge of deliverables, ensuring they're completed on time. Handle multiple projects like a pro in our fast-paced environment.
Assist in the development and execution of content calendars and strategies to ensure timely and relevant content delivery.
Compose persuasive email marketing campaigns, social media content, and advertisements that ignite engagement and drive conversions.
Stay updated on the latest trends and best practices in copywriting, content strategy, and product marketing. Share your insights to keep improving our processes and deliver top-notch results.
workPlaceText: Remote restrictions: workday must overlap by at least 4 hours with Toronto, ON, Canada
visa_text_more: We are unable to sponsor visas at this time
experience_info: as a Copywriter or similar role, preferably in an agency or fast-paced startup environment.
recruiting_advice: Our perfect candidate will be able to dive into the world of product marketing, content strategy, and compelling copy creation. Their mission will be to collaborate with clients, understand their business goals, and spin that knowledge into persuasive copy that drives sales, boosts user engagement, and hits project targets.

company.name: Airfoil
company.description:
Airfoil is a collective of designers, engineers, and artists helping cutting-edge products in crypto, the creator economy, and future of work take flight. Since our inception in 2019, we’ve worked with 80+ teams to bring their products to market, including Solana Labs, Drift Protocol, Layer3.xyz, Playhouse, Highbeam, and more.

As we increase our involvement in the web3 space and prepare to launch our own product offerings, we’re rapidly growing our Toronto and Singapore-based (but remote friendly) design teams.

As a fast-growing startup, working at Airfoil is both exciting and sometimes challenging.
company.teamAbout:
At Airfoil, we believe that your time with us should be helpful to us and to you, and we see your experience here as an opportunity to further your learning and growth as a designer. For these reasons, we will support you in several ways:

- Thorough design critiques and support from our team.
- Access to learning resources and projects. 
- Cross-border experience and training from tech company founders. 

At Airfoil, we are committed to building a safe environment where you will be supported through your professional and personal growth. We are designers second and people first.

name: Software Engineer, Full Stack
description:
We're looking for an exceptional and enthusiastic full-stack engineer who loves to build new products from scratch and is skilled at creating dependable backend systems and APIs. In this role, you'll work closely with our team of engineers to integrate our AI technology on a large scale.

As a full-stack engineer on our team, you'll have the chance to learn from industry experts about machine learning. You'll get to build the entire inference stack and work on state-of-the-art AI technology that could change the software and design industry.

requirements.description: Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform
Strong proficiency with the Node.js/TypeScript stack and Python
Expertise with designing and maintaining database schemas, indexes, and other database structures using PostgreSQL

4 - 8 years of experience building user facing features and shipping to a production environment

Build and maintain scalable, efficient, and reliable code using modern web development technologies
Optimize databases for performance and scalability, ensuring data integrity and security
Write unit and integration tests to ensure quality and consistency of the codebase
Identify and troubleshoot performance and scalability issues to ensure a smooth user experience
Participate in code reviews and share your knowledge with the team
Continuously learn and keep up-to-date with new backend technologies and trends

visa_text_more: We can offer h1b transfer for the right candidates

company.name: Galileo AI
company.description: Galileo AI is a pioneering company that operates at the intersection of AI and design with a mission to revolutionize UI design in the age of generative AI. Our state-of-the-art AI enables the creation of interface designs from natural language, empowering people to design beyond their imagination.
company.teamAbout:
Our founding team consists of builders who have previously worked at Google Research, Facebook, and high-growth unicorn startups such as Faire and Cruise. Our team has extensive experience building and designing AI-first products such as GBoard, Google Search, and self-driving technology at Cruise.

We are thrilled to expand our team and are actively seeking talented engineers who are passionate and motivated by our ambitious mission. We strive to create a collaborative environment where individuals can work on groundbreaking technology.

name: GPU Kernel Engineer
description:
Join us to build and safely deploy aligned, superhuman AI. For decades, technology was “just a tool.” Soon, it will be a partner. We are building an AI pair programmer that feels like a full colleague inside your computer - capable, conversational, and reliable across domains. If this isn't AGI, then what is? Join us if you want to build and safely deploy aligned AGI in products that matter.

As a GPU Kernel Engineer, you'll work on ensuring high throughput and low latency during training and inference with giant neural networks.

requirements.description: MS or PhD in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or related field
Experience with deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch
Strong programming skills in CUDA and C++
Experience with GPU profiling and performance analysis

responsibilities: Implement high-throughput low-latency GPU kernels in CUDA or Triton
Efficient mixed-precision training and inference
Optimize kernel fusions
Profile and benchmark competing implementations
Maximize multi-GPU communication through efficient overlapping of communication and computation

They’ll be joining a mission driven team that’s well equipped with the best talent to build aligned and more complete AI to accelerate humanity’s progress on the world’s most important problems

• Benchmark-based compensation in the 75th or 90th percentile, including base salary, equity, and benefits

• In-person (SF or Vienna) or remote

We also raised $28M from tier 1 investors so we have enough runway and dry powder to make this work

company.name: Magic AI
company.description:
Magic is a public benefit corporation dedicated to building and safely deploying aligned, superhuman AGI.

Automation has led humanity from subsistence farming to becoming a globally connected society. AGI is the ultimate chapter of the story of human tool-building, presenting the potential to decouple productivity and ingenuity from human labor. What if the last 50 years of technological progress happened in 2 days? We want to make this a possibility.

We've recently raised $28M.
company.productDescription:
Code completion that operates across your repository. Magic helps you edit code across your entire repository.

For decades, technology has been just a tool. Soon, it will be your partner. What if you had a colleague inside your computer? We're working on fundamental research challenges to make this possible.
company.teamAbout:
AI will soon feel more like a colleague and less like a tool. This will fundamentally change how people work, learn, and live. Magic is launching this age of human-computer collaboration to augment humanity’s potential for creativity and progress.

The first domain Magic aims to tackle is software development, but this is just the first step. We believe complete and aligned AI has the potential to change the world for the better. Want to define the future of how we work? Join us.

Join us to build and safely deploy aligned, superhuman AI. For decades, technology was “just a tool.” Soon, it will be a partner. As a Principal Product Designer, you will talk to users, develop user experience strategy and design, ​​and take ownership of the little details that take a product from good to great. The role is hands-on; we're looking for someone who loves their craft.

recruiting_advice: Here's more info about myself, **Shawn**, and my cofounder, **Zain** to help pitch candidates about us at Paprika. We're co-founders who were UC Berkeley grads that have experience at startups at the earliest stages and are deeply passionate about the problems they’re tackling. To ensure you save some time sourcing, **you should avoid candidates who** had short stints (e.g. less than 2 years at each company), didn't work on core products at companies and only have experience at big tech companies. We've seen these candidates have a hard time transitioning to being a founding designer. We've seen candidates won't reply to traditional recruiting messages. Instead, they will ***reply to a message around the tone of generally meeting with a founders and talking about product / industry; after which you can try to convince them to interview.*** **Here’s an example outreach message you could use when contacting recruiters. Feel free to modify it in any way you’d like.** Wanted to connect from Paraform as I recently came across your profile. I’m recruiting for a VC-backed stealth startup (Paprika) building a platform to help developers and product teams ship real-time, personalized user experiences. I wanted to reach out because I think you’ve done some really cool things at ___ and with your own projects. For some context, before Paprika, Shawn (CEO) was on the product teams at Rdio & Pandora, led growth at Firework, and ran a product studio where they worked with celebrities and top companies to ship new products. His co-founder & CTO, Zain, was at Apple, was the first engineering hire at Elevate Security, and has independently built products used by millions of people. They’ve raised from top VCs (first investors in Databricks & Cloudflare) and have years of runway to build something that hasn’t ever been done before. They’re product incorporates cutting-edge technologies to process and operationalize large amounts of data in real-time and provides the necessary tools and LLM's to scale up customer experiences that were impossible to deliver in the past. They’re now building a team of world-class founding members and are offering top-of-market compensation with up to 250k base & significant equity. Would you be open to chatting sometime this week about potentially working together as a founding designer?

company.description: Paprika is a stealth startup working on a platform to help teams unlock their data investments to power real-time, personalized user experiences. Paprika has raised a large seed round from top VC’s (first investors in DataBricks, & Robinhood) and has years of runway. The team has traction with well known companies and is hiring founding engineers.

name: Senior Product Engineer
description:
We're looking for a senior product engineer to help us build the most flexible and easy to use number crunching tool.

We have to solve various difficult engineering/UX problems:

Our spreadsheet-esque frontend interface: This interface comes with a slew of UI/UX challenges to support complex functionality without being complicated, and needs to be incredibly performant. Causal needs a low floor and a high ceiling — it should be simple enough for anyone to get started with, but powerful enough for really complex use-cases.

Our dashboarding and data visualisation capabilities: We have to allow users to create beautiful charts and tables to communicate with numbers.

requirements.description: Worked on complex tools or worked at a Series A-C startup on a chart or data visualisation tool
requirements.explanation: complex tool examples: (BI tool, analytics tool, Figma, Airtable, Notion, etc.)

requirements.description: Has product sense and cares about customer/UX (hard to assess from CV)
Huge plus if candidate has prior experience working with Aggrid (our table library)
Computer Science degree
React/Typescript experience (5+ years for senior candidates, 3+ years for junior candidates)
requirements.explanation: Also nice to have Node/GraphQL experience (→ full-stack). Some other keywords: data visualisation, aggrid, recharts, UX

responsibilities: Understand the product and the customer's needs in detail
Translate functional requirements into maintainable, well-tested, and performant code
Help set up processes to guarantee the long-term success of Causal's engineering team
Play a crucial role in setting the direction of Causal's product, as well as the company and culture

recruiting_advice:
The candidate should be an excellent software engineer (write scalable, well-tested, maintainable code that others can easily work with in the future) who is detail-oriented (code changes can't break our production system), fast learning [especially for junior engineers], and collaborative with good communication skills (collaborate with other engineers, designers, customer success).

**In addition to the benefits, candidates in the following locations will also get this:**

**United States:**

● Bike to work scheme

● Private health and dental (covered at 100% for employees & 50% for dependents)

company.name: Causal
company.description: We're building a new way to think and work with numbers. Causal is a tool for performing calculations, visualising data, and communicating with numbers. We take the good parts of spreadsheets and combine them with the good parts of programming, to make number-crunching fast, collaborative, and accessible to everyone. We are well-funded by some great VCs (Accel, Coatue, Passion Capital) and angel investors (Naval Ravikant, Scott Belsky, and many more) across the US and Europe.
company.teamAbout:
Join us as we build the future of spreadsheets. We're on a mission to help people use numbers to make better decisions together. There's lots to do as we build Causal to become the de-facto tool for working with numbers — we'd love your help.

We're a small team, and well-funded by some great VCs and angel investors (Naval Ravikant, Scott Belsky, and many more) across the US and Europe.

name: Frontend (UI) Engineer
description:
We're looking for frontend/full-stack engineers to accelerate our product development.
We have to solve various difficult engineering/UX problems:

- Our spreadsheet-esque frontend interface: This interface comes with a slew of UI/UX challenges to support complex functionality without being complicated, and needs to be incredibly performant. Causal needs a low floor and a high ceiling — it should be simple enough for anyone to get started with, but powerful enough for really complex use-cases.

- Our dashboarding and data visualisation capabilities: We have to allow users to create beautiful charts and tables to communicate with numbers.

requirements.description: React/Typescript experience (5+ years)
requirements.explanation: other keywords: data visualisation, recharts, UX

requirements.description: Worked on complex tools or worked at a Series A-C startup on a chart or data visualisation tool
requirements.explanation: complex tool examples: (BI tool, analytics tool, Figma, Airtable, Notion, etc.)

requirements.description: Computer Science degree (very nice to have, not need)
requirements.explanation: nice to have formal design training/schooling background.

requirements.description: 6+ years of relevant professional experience (excluding contracting)
requirements.explanation: This role is a cross between design/UX/UI. Looking for either a frontend engineer with a design background, or a designer with very strong coding skills. Working in figma or other design tools is another bonus

requirements.description: Worked on a large in-house component library, or similar UI/UX assets
requirements.explanation: Candidate should have experience building scalable homegrown UI libraries, working closely with a design lead, in a fast paced startup environment. Huge plus if candidate previously worked with Aggrid (our table library) and worked on charts/tables

responsibilities: Understand the product and the customer's needs in detail
Translate functional requirements into maintainable, well-tested, and performant code
Coordinate with design and engineering to build a scalable and reusable UI component library
Help set up processes to guarantee the long-term success of Causal's engineering team
Play a crucial role in setting the direction of Causal's product, as well as the company and culture
workPlaceText: Remote-first (United States, Canada, United Kingdom) with physical spaces in London and NYC
visa_text_more: We can sponsor visa for the right candidates

name: Backend Engineer — Data
description:
We're looking for an engineer to build out our data infrastructure. Robust data infrastructure is crucial for our product — working with live data is one of the biggest pain points of spreadsheets, and one of the biggest value propositions of Causal.

We need to be able to connect to any customer data, wherever it lives — accounting software (e.g. QuickBooks, NetSuite), CRM (e.g. Salesforce, Hubspot), payments provider (e.g. Stripe), and custom databases/data warehouses.

requirements.description: ClickHouse or other database company experience (MongoDB, DuckDB, PostgreSQL, etc.)
Keywords: Clickhouse, DBT, singer.io, ETL, Python, API
Proficient in Typescript
requirements.explanation: They will be doing 90% of their backend work in Typescript

requirements.description: Computer Science degree

responsibilities: Build a unified system to manage all data pipelines (including health checks and alerting)
Build a unified system to manage all data pipelines (including health checks and alerting)
Work with clients and our customer success team to gather requirements and implement pipelines to pull data from various data sources

experience_info: (excluding contracting). Including customer-facing experience OR other demonstrated experience with excellent communication and collaboration

Core competencies include having strong engineering experience (very comfortable working with data and backend engineering in general), leadership potential, and collaborative + good communication skills (collaborate with customers directly).

name: Head of Finance
description: Beacons is looking for our first Finance hire! You will join the leadership team to build frameworks and implement scalable systems for finance and accounting at Beacons. As a strategic thought partner to the CEO, you’ll drive sound business decisions and ensure execution of long and short term financial goals.

requirements.description: 5 -  15 years of experience in strategic finance, corporate finance, accounting, or FP&A
Bachelor’s degree from a four-year college or university in Finance or related field
Prior experience in investment banking, management consulting and/or private equity
A strong understanding of B2C SaaS and fintech
Previously had a finance role at an early stage startup
requirements.explanation: Ideally 2+ years at a successful startup during their Series A-C

responsibilities: Manage our accounting and finance functions, including revenue recognition, accounts receivable, accounts payable, and financial reporting

Conduct monthly, quarterly and annual FP&A processes, including forecasting and reporting, financial modeling, estimating cash burn rate and runway, and providing updates, trends and insights on financial health to leadership
Work with our third-party accounting firm to produce accurate monthly and quarterly financials
Oversee cash and expense management as well as insurance plans

Build out and maintain processes for financing planning, reporting and budgeting, including working with third party vendors (e.g., Rippling, Quickbooks, Chargebee etc.) to streamline processes; focus on system automation and process improvement with the ability to monitor results
Assist with Beacons options plan and financial valuation reports
Drive ad hoc special projects for funding initiatives, Board materials, and investor updates
Support operations team in defining KPI’s and creating dashboards that provide a consolidated view of important operating and financial metrics across Beacons
workPlaceText: This will be a hybrid role based out of SF (not a remote role as they will work closely with the CEO based in SF)
visa_text_more: We can do H1B transfer for the right candidate
experience_info: Here we are referring to experience in strategic finance, corporate finance, accounting, and FP&A. Out of this experience we would want at least 2+ years at a successful startup during their Series A-C stages.

company.name: Beacons
company.description:
Beacons is the easiest way to build a website that your fans will love! We help creators centralize their online brand presences, connect with their audiences and partners in a streamlined way, and better understand how to build and improve their businesses.

We're excited to tackle the rapidly growing, $200 billion creator economy. There's a huge opportunity to help creators build the businesses of tomorrow, and we're positioned to build the defining solution
company.teamAbout:
Our founders met while working on engineering PhDs at Stanford. They met creator friends and were inspired to make better tools for creators to do their best work. Beacons went through Y Combinator in summer 2019. We raised our seed round in early 2021.

We have an office in San Francisco and are a hybrid company. Team members can work in SF at our office or remotely elsewhere. About half the team is based in San Francisco. The other half work remotely across the country in cities such as Boston, Seattle, Pittsburgh, Dallas, New York City, and Los Angeles (to name a few!)

We have a strong written documentation culture, leveraging Notion to share ideas and record processes and learnings. We try to do as much as possible asynchronously to move quickly and efficiently. Outside of that, everything is quite flexible—team members are empowered to work on the schedule that works for them.

We set everyone up with a great space to work, whether it’s in our San Francisco office or in your own home office. We offer a work from home set up, a wellness stipend, and a learning stipend.

It’s important for us to feel connected—we play as a team. We have two yearly offsites for the whole company to come together in person for brainstorming, planning, and team building.

Come Join Us! Be the best version of yourself at Beacons.
