name: Founding Full Stack Engineer
description: We are looking for a highly talented and driven Founding Engineer to join our team at Porter. As a full-stack engineer, you'll play a crucial role in shaping the future of our product and company by owning projects end-to-end, working closely with the founders, and directly engaging with customers. The ideal candidate is passionate about building cutting-edge technology, thrives in a startup setting, and is eager to make a lasting impact on the future of financial management. If you're excited by the prospect of being an integral part of a rapidly growing company and have the skills and drive to make a significant impact on the future of financial management, Porter is the perfect place for you. Join us and be a part of a team that's redefining the industry for the better.

requirements.description: A strong product mindset
requirements.explanation: Demonstrating a deep understanding of user needs and the ability to create innovative solutions that address those needs

requirements.description: A track record of shipping products and going through the full product development cycle
requirements.explanation: From writing the first line of code to placing the product in the hands of users and iterating quickly based on feedback.

requirements.description: Experience across the entire stack, from backend to frontend
requirements.explanation: (We currently use Typescript, React, Supabase, and are open to your preferences)

requirements.description: A proactive and collaborative approach, with the ability to attract top technical talent and lead them effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
A minimum of 3 years of experience in a startup environment, building products from 0 to 1
requirements.explanation: When sourcing, looking for the keyword: 'founding engineer' will be helpful!

responsibilities: Take ownership of projects from concept to launch, ensuring the highest quality standards and timely delivery
Collaborate closely with the founders and other team members to develop innovative and user-centric solutions for our customers
Engage with customers to gather feedback, understand their needs, and iterate on our product to continuously improve and meet their expectations
Contribute to the company's strategic direction by actively participating in decision-making processes and providing valuable insights
Work in a fast-paced, dynamic startup environment where you'll touch every aspect of the business, gaining invaluable experience and honing your skills
workPlaceText: We prefer on-site at least in the early days of our company. However, we're open to remote for the right candidates!
visa_text_more: We're not able to sponsor visas at this time!

company.name: Porter (YC W23)
company.description: Porter, a Y Combinator-backed and well capitalized startup, is revolutionizing accounting and finance by providing accurate, timely financial data to empower decision-making. We're streamlining financial information analysis, allowing companies to focus on innovation, growth, and success. Our team is committed to transparent communication, first-principles thinking, ownership, balanced decision-making, and kindness. Join us at Porter to be part of a groundbreaking financial management solution and an extraordinary work environment that fosters trust, innovation, and empathy.
company.productDescription: Modern Accounting for Startups: Taxes, tax credits, and bookkeeping; Insights on cash, burn, and runway on the 1st; Make better strategic decisions with your financial data
company.teamAbout: Joining Porter means embracing both challenges and rewards in a collaborative environment. While it's not a typical 9-5 job, the journey is fulfilling. You'll receive competitive compensation, top-notch equipment, tools, and a comprehensive benefits package to support your well-being. Our beautiful Menlo Park office is home to an inspiring team, empowering you to tackle challenges, drive change, and shape the future of financial management. Let's build something exceptional together.

name: Fullstack Software Engineer - ML Focus
description:
We are looking for a passionate full-stack engineer who loves to ship code and is not afraid to learn and apply new languages. Ideally, you are a self-starter, build things for fun, and are fearless in iterating fast.

We are looking for multiple full-stack engineers and this post is for the Fullstack Software Engineer - ML Focus role!

requirements.description: Strong Full-stack software experience (min 2 years - max 10 years out of college).
requirements.explanation: We use react, typescript, next.js, Supabase, and tailwind CSS for our app - and our back end is also written in typescript. Candidates don’t need to be experienced with all of them, but they should be able to pick anything up quickly!

requirements.description: Computer science fundamentals - working knowledge of abstract syntax trees and compilers
requirements.explanation: At Bifrost, we’ve built an “AI-powered compiler,” so it’s a plus to have some familiarity with how node trees function.

requirements.description: Deep knowledge of working with data structures and manipulating complex data.
requirements.explanation: It would be best if candidates understood how to efficiently parse, traverse, modify, and save large pieces of data.

requirements.description: Understand how to interface with custom ML models and with AI applications
requirements.explanation: For this role, you will not need to build models yourself - but you should be able to work with our AI research team to present data properly and integrate augmentations.

requirements.description: Can quickly learn how to work with services and tools even without experience
requirements.explanation: We interface with a few different tools (VSCode, Figma, web applications), so candidates should be able to pick up new frameworks and technologies quickly.

requirements.description: Excellent written communication (design docs, specs, documentation, code reviews, post-mortems)

responsibilities: Create a leading piece of software: Bifrost will become the default way to write frontend code, and as an early engineer here, you will be involved with all aspects of the product.
Engage with a small, passionate team: We build and ship quickly and like to be scrappy. You’ll learn how to hack and polish full experiences and take ownership of projects.

Work with the best: We have a product-obsessed culture and hire best-in-class talent. We work alongside other YC and F.inc portfolio companies and interface with the most talented builders in the industry.
workPlaceText: In-person in SF. Can commute from bay area but will have to work out of an office! We are 3 days in-person per week
visa_text_more: Willing to sponsor visa for the right candidates

That’s what we’re doing at Bifrost - We’re the first design-to-code platform for developers, by developers.

We’re a seed-stage startup backed by some of the best investors in the valley, including Y Combinator, Founders Inc,  Protocol Labs, OrangeDAO, and Streamlined.

name: Product Manager
description: Dyneti is looking for a Product Manager to lead and manage the software development that enables our customers to onboard customers and prevent fraud more effectively. This is an extremely impactful role at Dyneti. You'll work closely with the CEO and the engineering team to deliver a wide range of highly impactful products. The Product Manager is an onsite position (in office 2-3 days/week) and reports directly to the CEO.

requirements.description: 4 - 12 years experience as a product manager
BS in computer science, engineering or a related technical field from a top 50 school
Strongly prefer candidates who have previous experience in: 1) developer-facing products, 2) a regulated space, 3) working with enterprise customers
Former experience either as a founder or very early stage startup is strongly preferred
Looking for someone who’s more technical and good at working with engineers vs someone who’s more of a growth product manager

company.name: Dyneti (YC W19)
company.description: Dyneti is building the future of authentication, starting with making frictionless, fraud-free payments available on every mobile device. Our first product is an SDK that helps apps stop fraud and boost conversion by taking a photo of a credit card. The SDK is powered by a deep learning model optimized to run entirely on device. If you’re interested in being a critical part of one of the first startups working in the deep learning on mobile space, we’d love to talk to you! Dyneti supports enterprise customers globally and has raised $2.2 Million from global institutional funds such as Shasta Ventures, Y Combinator, and Sound Ventures, as well as from prominent angel investors. TechCrunch: techcrunch.com/2019/03/19/best-of-y-combinator
company.productDescription: DyScan is the market-leading credit card scanner that works on all credit cards. With our fast and easy integration, businesses can boost payment conversion by over 5%, and reduce fraud by over 50% with only an hour of engineering work. DyScan is available as a mobile SDK as well as a web API.
company.teamAbout:
Here at Dyneti, we leverage our expertise in customer experience, fraud prevention, and computer vision to build products that delight our customers. Our mission-critical challenge? Reducing fraud and improving conversion for our customers. 

We’re backed by an exceptional lineup of investors, including Y Combinator, Shasta Ventures, Ashton Kutcher and Guy Oseary’s Sound Ventures, the creator of Gmail, and the co-founder of Coinbase to name a few. Want to join our mission? We love meeting passionate folks who dive into new challenges with optimism.

name: Senior Graphics Engineer
description: Womp is a fast growing startup looking for a Senior Graphics Engineer to optimize our current features and develop new functionality. You will communicate directly with the CTO and lead Graphics engineers about important technical strategies and decisions. This is a long term position with a lot of room for growth as the company scales.

requirements.description: Solid C/C++ expertise
Knowledge of HLSL/GLSL, SIMD, OpenMP, Lua and SDF, 3D design and environments
Experience optimizing CUDA/Vulkan performance & GPU usage with large rendering data
Bonus Skills: Vulkan Ray Tracing, ReSTIR, PathTracing
3+ years of graphics CUDA/Vulkan experience

workPlaceText: We are headquartered in San Francisco and are remote-friendly.
visa_text_more: We're willing to sponsor visa for the right candidate

company.name: Womp
company.description: Womp makes 3D creation incredibly easy. Womp combines all of your 3D needs into a single 3D workspace. Whether you are an expert industrial designer, a creative who has dipped their toes in 3D or a total 3D noob, Womp makes 3D easy for everyone. 100% on the browser, zero downloads or knowledge required. Womp is venture backed and growing fast.
company.teamAbout:
We are headquartered in San Francisco and are remote-friendly. Team works and operates on (EST) business hours. 

Womp started as a design and consulting studio in 2017. Womp founder and CEO Gabriela Truela realized that the existing tools and paradigms were challenging to learn and master, so she reincorporated the company and pivoted to software in 2019.

name: Product Designer
description: The Product Designer will work closely with the product team, including engineers and product management, and the service delivery team, the Care Advocate team, to explore, design, prototype, test, and iterate on solutions that help make caregiving easier. They will be responsible for creating designs that connect user needs with data and business strategies that are equally thoughtful and delightful. As the voice guiding the design of our solutions, their work will have a meaningful impact on our Care Advocates and the caregivers they support.

requirements.description: 5 - 12 years of experience out of college in a product or UI design role
Experience working with wireframing and prototyping tools (e.g., Adobe XD, Figma, etc.)
Portfolio demonstrating the ability to solve complex problems through case studies
Strong preference for candidates with experience working at a healthcare, healthcare technology, or digital health company
Passionate about helping family caregivers and their loved ones, including older adults

workPlaceText: We prefer candidate to be in Chicago but remote within US is okay (remote in Central Time & Eastern Time preferred)
visa_text_more: We're unfortunately not able to sponsor visas at this time.

company.name: Carallel
company.description: Carallel is on a mission to make caregiving easier for the 53 million people supporting loved ones across the country. As a tech-enabled service, we provide empathetic support, personalized guidance, and practical assistance throughout a caregiving journey. We are committed to demonstrating the impact caregiver support can have on healthcare outcomes for caregivers and the loved ones who rely on them.
company.teamAbout:
We’ve walked the caregiving journey. Carallel knows firsthand that caring for a loved one can bring both significant fulfillment and constant challenges. 

Co-founders Hillary Ebach and John Banta created Carallel because of their experience caring for their aging parents. After their father suffered a stroke and their mother received a dementia diagnosis, Hillary and John, along with their two siblings, began to provide care for their parents. It quickly became all-consuming. 

The decisions were unrelenting. From finances and senior living communities to care plans and payments, they discovered how easily entangled caregivers can get while trying to tend to their parents’ daily needs.

Even with their backgrounds in finance, law and healthcare, the experience was daunting for Hillary and John. Knowing they were not the only ones, they didn’t want others to walk the caregiving journey alone.

From our executives and advisors to our Care Advocates, the entire Carallel team brings lived experience, expertise, and passion to the work of supporting caregivers.

recruiting_advice:
To help with sourcing, we recommend you highlight our founder and investor background to potential candidates alongside our mission. I can provide more context below.

Co-founders & background: Dyneti was founded by a fraud prevention expert from Uber, and has raised funding from an exceptional lineup of investors. Our customers include Fortune 100 companies and some of the fastest growing tech unicorns around the world. Our first product, DyScan, is an SDK that helps apps stop fraud and boost conversion by taking a photo of a credit card. We launched our product at the end of January 2019, and since then have grown rapidly to support enterprise customers globally.

Investors: Dyneti has raised $2.2 Million from an exceptional lineup of investors, including Y Combinator, Shasta Ventures, Ashton Kutcher and Guy Oseary’s Sound Ventures, the creator of Gmail, and the co-founder of Coinbase to name a few. TechCrunch: techcrunch.com/2019/03/19/best-of-y-combinator

company.name: Dyneti (YC W19)
company.description: Dyneti is building the future of authentication, starting with making frictionless, fraud-free payments available on every mobile device. Our first product is an SDK that helps apps stop fraud and boost conversion by taking a photo of a credit card. The SDK is powered by a deep learning model optimized to run entirely on device. If you’re interested in being a critical part of one of the first startups working in the deep learning on mobile space, we’d love to talk to you! Dyneti supports enterprise customers globally and has raised $2.2 Million from global institutional funds such as Shasta Ventures, Y Combinator, and Sound Ventures, as well as from prominent angel investors. company.name: CyberConnect
company.description:
[CyberConnect](https://cyberconnect.me/) is a web3 social network that enables developers to create social applications empowering users to own their digital identity, content, connections, and interactions. We’re building a world where we have ultimate control over our digital lives, and meaningful, long-lasting connections aren’t decided by centralized or biased tech.

Join our team on our mission to create long-lasting on-chain connections through the power of our network.

With its brands [Link3](https://twitter.com/link3to) and [CyberWallet](https://twitter.com/thecyberwallet), CyberConnect is one of the fastest-growing startups in web3/crypto. We're building something special and are looking for true believers to join our team. We're looking for ambitious individuals with a thirst for knowledge that are interested in working with some of the most exciting and groundbreaking technology.
benefits: We offer top of the line benefits, including health, dental, and vision insurance.
We eat lunch together as a team or get lunch credit if remote.
We hold team retreats twice a year!
We want people to take time off to rest and rejuvenate. We offer unlimited paid vacation.
You’ll receive all new equipment including a laptop, monitor, and any other accessories you need to do your best work.
company.teamAbout:
Join our team on our mission to change the future of social networking on the internet. CyberConnect is one of the fastest growing startups in web3. We're building something really special and are looking for true believers to join our team. We're looking for ambitious individuals with a thirst for knowledge that are interested in working with some of the most exciting and groundbreaking technology.

It’s not just another job here at CyberConnect. You get to work with a group of talented and passionate people. We build trust based on our strong belief of our mission and spending quality time together collaborating. Here are some photos from our US team’s retreat in Joshua Tree in 2022.

recruiting_advice: Here's more info about myself, **Shawn**, and my cofounder, **Zain** to help pitch candidates about us at Paprika. We're co-founders who were UC Berkeley grads that have experience at startups at the earliest stages and are deeply passionate about the problems they’re tackling. We are looking for an engineer who can be a generalist software engineer and isn't too hyper focused in one area of software. To ensure you save some time sourcing, **you should avoid candidates who** had short stints (e.g. less than 2 years at each company), didn't work on core products at companies (we need folks just locked in shipping code quick and not a lot of extracurriculars at work) and only have experience at big tech companies. We've seen these candidates have a hard time transitioning to being a founding engineer. We've seen candidates won't reply to traditional recruiting messages. Instead, they will ***reply to a message around the tone of generally meeting with a founders and talking about product / industry; after which you can try to convince them to interview.*** **Here’s an example outreach message you could use when contacting recruiters. Feel free to modify it in any way you’d like.** Wanted to connect from Paraform as I recently came across your profile. I’m recruiting for a VC-backed stealth startup (Paprika) building a platform to help developers and product teams ship real-time, personalized user experiences. I wanted to reach out because I think you’ve done some really cool things at ___ and with your own projects. For some context, before Paprika, Shawn (CEO) was on the product teams at Rdio & Pandora, led growth at Firework, and ran a product studio where they worked with celebrities and top companies to ship new products. His co-founder & CTO, Zain, was at Apple, was the first engineering hire at Elevate Security, and has independently built products used by millions of people. They’ve raised from top VCs (first investors in Databricks & Cloudflare) and have years of runway to build something that hasn’t ever been done before. They’re product incorporates cutting-edge technologies to process and operationalize large amounts of data in real-time and provides the necessary tools and LLM's to scale up customer experiences that were impossible to deliver in the past. They’re now building a team of world-class founding members and are offering top-of-market compensation with up to 250k base & significant equity. Would you be open to chatting sometime this week about potentially working together as a founding engineer?

We’re seeing this first-hand as we're experiencing explosive growth and we’d love for you to join us!

name: Biogeochemical Modeler
description:
We're looking for a Biogeochemical Modeler to join our team! 

Role Description: 

- You will lead our biogeochemical modeling efforts to support our core product: a soil carbon measurement, reporting, and verification (MRV) platform
- You will work to identify the correct model inputs and assemble datasets to parametrize soil biogeochemical models
- You will run simulations of biogeochemical models to measure and model soil carbon and calibrate biogeochemical models to data from field trials and optimize models to improve accuracy
- You will upscale calibrated models to the other fields in a soil carbon project working with limited data
- You will quantify any uncertainty and devise strategies to reduce uncertainty
- You will collaborate with our engineering team to setup and guide the development of infrastructure to integrate model runs into our core product.

requirements.description: PhD or equivalent experience in agriculture science, environmental sciences, soil science, conservation, or related field showcasing experience in soil biogeochemical modeling
Experience working with APSIM and other soil biogeochemical models (e.g. DNDC, DayCent, RothC, SALUS) and publishing research in this regard in peer-reviewed journals
Deep knowledge of soil science and agronomy to be able to connect biogeochemical model abstractions to underlying science to improve models in the long run
Experience planning and implementing soil sampling campaigns to collect ground truth data
Strong communicator with an ability to present scientific work to various audiences, including government leaders and local communities, and collaborate across disciplines

workPlaceText: Although we're an in-person first team, we're open to remote for this particular role. If candidate is in the SF/Bay Area that would be great, but not a must.
visa_text_more: We're willing to sponsor visa for the right candidate!

company.name: Terradot
company.description:
Problem: Globally, soils have the potential to sequester over 1 billion tons of carbon through regenerative agriculture practices and emerging solutions like biochar and enhanced rock weathering. However today, measurement, reporting, and verification of soil carbon sequestration is not cost effective, accurate, or scalable. This prevents large-scale climate finance from being deployed to rapidly scale soil carbon improvement despite its massive potential to combat climate change, improve food security, and alleviate extreme poverty. 

Terradot is building a global measurement, reporting, and verification (MRV) platform to accelerate high-integrity carbon removal and storage around the world. With Stanford’s Soil and Environmental Biogeochemistry Lab, we leverage technological innovation using ground truth sampling, remote sensing, and AI modeling to accurately and scalably measure soil carbon. For soil carbon project developers, Terradot decreases the time, cost, and complexity of MRV while increasing the integrity of the carbon removal credits for carbon buyers. This enables large-scale deployment of climate finance to incentivize the adoption of sustainable practices. We are focused on improving soil health in emerging economies to maximize global sequestration and community impact.

We are a public-benefit corporation driven by passion and purpose in service to our planet, people, and prosperity. Terradot is backed by world-class investors including Floodgate, John Doerr, Kleiner Perkins, Sheryl Sandberg, Ponderosa Ventures, 776 Foundation (Alexis Ohanian), George Roberts, and Stanford’s TomKat Center for Sustainable Energy. We are advised by an all-star team of Stanford climate professors with 100,000+ citations collectively.
company.productDescription: A global measurement, reporting, and verification (MRV) platform to accelerate high-integrity carbon removal and storage around the world. With Stanford’s Soil and Environmental Biogeochemistry Lab, we leverage technological innovation using ground truth sampling, remote sensing, and AI modeling to accurately and scalably measure soil carbon
company.teamAbout:
We’re based in the SF/Bay Area and are fostering a strong in-person first, collaborative, mission-driven culture. Our founders graduated from Stanford with a focus on Climate Science and AI. They have previously founded and led an international nonprofit that has rescued over 100 million pounds of surplus food from farmers to food banks and published AI+Remote Sensing for Climate Change research under Andrew Ng as part of the Stanford ML Group.

Values

- Curiosity: Most solutions to reach net zero do not exist yet. We are looking for sensationally curious team players who use a beginner’s mindset to find novel solutions and embrace the growth mindset to overcome setbacks   
- Kindness: Great teams change the world, we believe kindness is the foundation to build great teams on and also guides the impact we aim to have on our planet to pay it forward. 
- Mamba Mentality: Kobe Bryant’s Mamba Mentality combines love, passion, and borderline obsession to improve every day and create a culture of collectively becoming the best we can be at our shared dream.
- Speed and Scale: We value teammates who are ready to move at the speed and scale necessary to meet the urgency of the climate crisis. If you are looking to coast, stick to big tech.
- Multidisciplinary and Multicultural Collaboration: The ability to think across disciplines and work with people from a variety of backgrounds is not just a requirement, but a unique advantage given that our work spans multiple domains and impacts communities around the world.

You will set the technical roadmap and have the opportunity to build out a world-class technical team and culture as you see best.

company.name: BetterBrain
company.description:
At BetterBrain, we’re building the AI copilot for data and business intelligence. Self-serve analytics has been a long sought-after, seemingly unattainable goal in the world of BI. Visualization tools like Looker, Tableau, and Metabase purport to achieve self-serve analytics, but fail to solve the hardest part. These tools enable business stakeholders to be “readers” of data. For true self-serve analytics, you need to enable business stakeholders to become “writers” of data. If I’m on the revenue operations team and I need a new piece of information to make a decision, I need to talk to the data team to get that data, even though there are a hundred dashboards that use a lot of that underlying data. Ultimately, this leads to business stakeholders like sales teams moving much more slowly than they should be. 

A business user should be able to describe the information they want and just get that data back. We’re making this possible. We’re starting by building tools to make it easy for data teams to codify institutional knowledge and perform analyses without having to maintain unwieldy documentation. Over time, as we collect data and our systems improve, we’ll enable business stakeholders to become writers of data.
company.productDescription: BetterBrain's generative AI platform instantly retrieves the data you are looking for (all AI responses are vetted to ensure accuracy). You ask questions and get the answers you need in minutes, not days.
company.teamAbout:
My name is Abhishek Bhargava and I am currently a solo founder and looking for a Head of Sales / Co-founder to join our team. I studied Computer Science, Computational Finance, and Robotics at Carnegie Mellon University. After 2.5 years, I dropped out to start my first company, Vectordash. We went through Y Combinator (W19) and grew it to over $100k ARR. I eventually shut the company down because I wasn’t excited about the long-term vision and the prospects for unit economics. I then started working on other projects I was excited about. 

I then started Covalent in 2021 with my former co-founder David, and we saw a lot of traction with the product we built, and sold into a number of popular communities and some large enterprises. We raised a round of pre-seed funding and built out a small team to iterate towards product-market fit. We decided to pivot away from Covalent a few months ago because we realized the problem we were solving was a low priority for HR teams, and we wouldn’t be able to build the venture scale business we were targeting. Read more about my journey and why I decided to start BetterBrain here: https://covalentconnect.notion.site/Abhishek-Bhargava-ba41ee1d16b646dc81aadcbbac1e1ae5

name: Full Stack Engineer (Frontend Leaning)
description:
As a full stack engineering hire with an emphasis on frontend, you will be working closely with the entire team (we are small and scrappy) to build and own a delightfully unique product experience.

Your responsibilities will include: work on impactful features for a full fledged pay per view video platform; support existing codebase in Go, Typescript, Javascript, React, and HTML/CSS; lead frontend architecture and development of the platform; collaborate and brainstorm with the team on new experiments to run and features to build; build a delightful and polished end to end web user experience; own features and ideas end to end; and influence and own engineering standards and processes from the early stage of the company.

For your reference, here's our tech stack: react SPA, typescript, node.js, next.js, with a golang API/backend.

company.description:
Partnered with Andreessen Horowitz and Variant Fund - Sound helps artists capture more value from their music and help fans directly support the artists they love. Sound builds connections between artists and fans by enabling fans to buy song NFTs which allow them to become part of an interactive community.

The one metric that matters at Sound is how many artists make a full-time living off their music alone. Tees, tours, and fan clubs can offer incremental revenue for artists, but shouldn’t come at the expense of creating art. We’ll constantly listen, learn, and make adjustments as we work towards building a totally different kind of music industry that puts artists and listeners first.

Our vision for the future is ambitious: we want to honor the value of music by giving a million artists the opportunity to live off their art.

company.name: Amber
company.description:
While interest in electric vehicles is at an all-time high, new EVs are still out of reach for most consumers, even with the support of government incentives in policies like the Inflation Reduction Act. High consumer demand and costs of battery materials continue to keep prices high and constrain available inventory.

If new vehicles are so expensive, why not embrace used EVs? The used EV population is poised to explode, presenting an affordable option for more consumers looking to make the leap to electric. However, used EVs come with their own problems — batteries lose capacity over time and replacement costs for out-of-warranty repair on EVs can be explosive.

This is where we come in — at Amber, our mission is to keep electric vehicles on the road longer by building technology-enabled protection, support, and infrastructure for second, third, and even fourth-hand EV owners.
company.teamAbout:
Amber is a seed-stage startup with experienced founders (e.g., Samsara, Metromile, Square) backed by world-class investors, and we’re looking for others who are passionate about the EV future to join us in our mission to accelerate the transition to a cleaner future of transportation.

With the used EV market poised to explode, we think this is the perfect time build these products and services — picks and shovels to ensure that our investment in EVs can be maximized and kept on the road as long as possible.

While ideal teammates will have experience in insurance, automotive, and software, we encourage you to apply even if you aren’t an exact match for a posted position. We value passion, willingness to learn, and diversity of perspectives and would love to hear from you if you think you could be a fit! Amber is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes candidates of all backgrounds.

A typical day might look like: develop outbound & inbound strategies to create and nurture opportunities; understand, define, and adjust the company’s value proposition for both users and ecosystem partners; own the full sales cycle from lead to close for upper middle market and enterprise companies; take ownership of post-partnership execution and partner success; lead the development and refinement of our sales processes; engage with internal stakeholders from multiple functions (i.e. Engineering, Product, Ops) to help drive product & marketing strategy; and defining viable commercial models for clients and partners.

company.name: Paper
company.description:
In the future where the real world blends with the virtual world, we believe that non-fungible tokens will form the asset layer that represents identity, membership & ownership.

Our mission is to make NFTs more accessible and useful. From credit card checkout for NFTs to wallet infrastructure, we’ve helped creators, developers and brands make NFTs accessible for their audience so they can focus on providing value and utility for owners. We believe our products will accelerate progress towards a better, more decentralized world.

When there are less boundaries created by centralized platforms, there are less fees taken by middle parties and more interoperability for the assets you purchase and earn. This means more collaboration between ecosystems and more economic freedom for all the participants who create value.

At Paper, we’re looking for people aligned with our mission of improving accessibility in web3. You’re encouraged to apply even if you don’t fully match the job description. Your passion and willingness to learn quickly will suit you well in this nascent industry. We’re an equal opportunity employer and welcome diverse perspectives, and we’d love to hear from you!

company.name: Paraform
company.description:
Paraform is a marketplace connecting companies with open roles and recruiters who can fill them.

Companies can work with specialized recruiters more cheaply, monitor their performance, and flex based on demand. Recruiters don't have to worry about acquiring clients while earning and working on their own terms.

Incredible teams at the most exciting startups and enterprises are being built as a result.

We power talent for a wide range of customers:

  • Enterprise - Palantir, Anduril, Scale AI

  • Growth stage - Eight Sleep, Character.ai, Applied Intuition

  • Early stage - Mintlify, Jenni.ai, Decagon.ai

We've raised money from:

  • Co-founders - Twitch, Doordash, and Eventbrite

  • VCs - A*, Soma Capital, Founders Inc, and Primer Sazze

  • Leadership - Palantir, Opendoor, Ramp, and Scale AI

Other highlights:

  • GMV/Revenue increasing 50% MoM

  • We just moved into a beautiful new office in North Beach. Check out video of it here
benefits: 🌉 Beautiful office with golden gate bridge view at the Fort Mason Center in San Francisco. Moving to North Beach soon and we think it's even better :)
🌏 Company Offsites (NY, LA, Sydney, Seoul etc)
company.teamAbout:
Hey 👋 we're John and Jeff, the co-founders of Paraform. Funnily enough, this all started when we tried to recruit each other in 2022. Ever since then, we've experienced first-hand how broken recruiting is and our mission is to finally fix it.

Our values and culture

  • We work hard and enjoy being together in person. We are transparent about our work ethic and expectations because it enables us to have extreme ownership in building at a pace that is unmatched.

  • Customers, customers, customers. We're customer-obsessed and always start with the customer first. We are the customer support team.

  • Ship fast and break things. We believe great products come from lots of experimentation, so we value fast development. No one is going to wait around for us to make things, especially something that's perfect.

  • Take care of each other. We trust each other and want to enable everyone to do their best work. That means an all food and transportation compensated, gym membership, unlimited PTO, global offsites, premium healthcare and a free bike.

company.name: Magna
company.description:
Magna’s goal is to be the one-stop solution for all token-based crypto companies who want to track outstanding and promised token allocations, automate the distribution of those tokens, and manage information about their stakeholders. Some liken us to “Carta for Web3”.

Our mission is to make it easier for crypto companies to manage their tokens and tokenholders so that they can focus on their product and not custom internal tools and smart contracts as they scale. We work with projects of all sizes throughout various L1 & L2 ecosystems.
company.productDescription:
Tokens are amongst the core assets crypto companies use to compensate and incentivize investors, employees, advisors, and even community members. The most common use cases for Magna include: Token Vesting, Token Streaming, Airdrops, Programmable Unlocks, and Stakeholder Management.

Magna’s platform is used by investors, employees, accountants, lawyers, and other key stakeholders throughout the crypto ecosystem.
company.teamAbout:
Why Work at Magna? 

1. We’re a highly technical team: This is a space with deep technical challenges that reward builders. The blockchain isn’t just a distributed ledger anymore, it’s a distributed state machine. At Magna, we’re not just building a new paradigm of software — we’re also trying to leverage the best of web2 while we’re at it

2. We’re a well-funded company with runway that can last us through the bear market (as long as that may be)

3. A downtown Manhattan office with our own rooftop – we operate on a hybrid model, where most employees come in a couple of times per week.

4. Hardware — Whatever you need to get things done, plus a stipend to set up your home office.

5. Learning budget — Buy courses and attend conferences or hackathons.

6. Unlimited Vacation — Take time off when you need it - 2 week minimum.

7. Top-notch healthcare plans — We offer the best available platinum PPO and other similar plans that give you the most options with the lowest deductibles.

company.name: Drift Labs
company.description: Our goal is to make DEXs the best way to trade derivatives. Despite the decentralized nature of crypto, centralized derivatives exchanges still remain dominant - they're already fast, familiar and reliable. So far, the DEX trading experience hasn't met that standard. Slippage is high for large orders, transferring funds between platforms is subject to massive gas fees, and low liquidity leads to poor pricing. Drift’s goal is to bring a state-of-the-art trader-centric experience from centralized exchanges on-chain. We're a team of experienced traders and builders from DeFi and traditional finance working together to make this a reality.
company.teamAbout:
Drift is a leading derivatives exchange on Solana. Our mission is to bring state-of-the-art trader-centric experience from centralized exchanges on-chain. We're a team of experienced traders and builders from DeFi and traditional finance working together to make this a reality.

Within five months of launching, we have: Hit $10B in cumulative volume traded; Achieved over $50M in trader open interest with $13M in collateral vault balance; Launched 21 trading markets.

company.name: Better
company.description:
Founded in 2016, Better is a digital-first homeownership company whose services include mortgage, real estate, title, and homeowners insurance.

From its founding in 2016 through 2022, Better has funded over $100B in home loans and provided over $25B in cumulative coverage through Better Cover and Better Settlement Services, the insurance divisions of Better. Better has raised over $400M in equity capital since inception.

The company was ranked #1 on LinkedIn’s Top Startups List for 2021 and 2020, #1 on Fortune’s Best Small and Medium Workplaces in New York, #15 on CNBC’s Disruptor 50 2020 list, as well as being listed to Forbes FinTech 50 for 2020. For more information, follow @betterdotcom.
company.productDescription:
Better.com is one of the fastest growing homeownership companies in America. We're making homeownership simpler, faster — and most importantly, more accessible for all Americans.

We're changing the entire makeup of what it's like to buy and own a home in this country, and to do that, we need talent that can help us build things that don't exist yet.
company.teamAbout:
Better.com believes in building a community, not just a company. Our team members organize happy hours, birthday parties, offsites, fitness classes, and more. 

We offer unlimited time off, fully funded health, dental, and vision benefits, as well as a 401k plan and paid parental leave. We also offer equity in the company, because why shouldn't you own part of the company you work for?

Even better, our team members get free lunch delivered to the office everyday, as well as snacks, events and happy hours taking place in our top-of-line office locations.

Ready to join us? We're always looking for top talent to join our New York, San Francisco, Irvine, and Gurgaon teams.

name: Social Media & Community Lead
description:
Neurosity is building the next generation of mental health apps that interact with the brain. The Crown, our brain-computer interface, knows when you are in the zone and keeps you there. We are giving our users the ability to shift from any mental state into a focused mental state, allowing them to enter a flow state, and unleash their best work.

As a Neurosity Social Media & Community Lead you will manage our social media and discord presence.

requirements.description: Actively participates in a wide variety of social media activities such as blogging, community development and management, commenting, etc
2+ years of experience managing social media platforms or communities
Have an understanding of communities, what makes them tick, and be interested in fostering an ongoing relationship on behalf of a brand
Understanding of popular and emerging social networks

workPlaceText: we prefer US based candidates and our team is fully remote!

company.name: Neurosity
company.description: Neurosity is building the next generation of brain computers and our first product is the Crown. The Crown represents the next generation of our brain-computer interface, formerly known as “Notion”. The Crown guides you into a flow state and helps you stay in the zone. It comes with an app that allows you to track your focus over time. Additionally, you can connect the Crown app to your Spotify account to let your brain activity find the music that boosts your productivity. You can set your Crown to automatically mute your notifications while you are working. Here's a demo video of the crown: https://youtu.be/5KAib9EgjCQ
company.teamAbout:
Neurosity was co-founded by AJ Keller and Alex Castillo. AJ is a computer engineer and leads everything hardware at Neurosity. His ADHD has led him to help people understand focus. Before Neurosity, AJ helped Boeing automate the construction of planes with robots. Alex leads everything software. He is passionate about the brain and how we can use it to power the next generation of apps. Before Neurosity, Alex helped Netflix reach thousands of consumer devices. 

Neurosity is always looking for extremely talented software engineers, hardware engineers, neuroscientists, and more. Neurosity is committed to helping consumers unlock their potential.

It’s a place where you can figure out what you’re passionate about, create something you love working on, and then learn how to turn that creation into a financially sustainable path you can pursue full-time.

Ex-founders, people who have worked at startups in the past, people who have built + shipped their own personal projects/products to real users, and really anyone that’s made an honest effort to do cool shit in the real world.
We don’t care about FANNG experience, degrees, your age, or what college you attended. But, we do care deeply about your history building products that shipped to actual users.

company.name: Buildspace
company.description:
We're building a new path for the world's best builders to come together, explore promising domains and ship meaningful products. We're backed by a16z and YC to build Hogwarts for builders and dreamers. 

Instead of feeding you fake visionary bullshit on the raise announcement -- let me just tell you wtf we’re building. We're building a school for people that don't want to just “get a job”.

It’s a place where you can figure out what you’re passionate about, create something you love working on, and then learn how to turn that creation into a financially sustainable path you can pursue full-time.
company.productDescription: The best started like the rest. Weekend builds are the perfect way to get your hands dirty and get building. Explore domains like web3, machine learning and artificial intelligence by building projects that just need a weekend.
company.teamAbout:
We’re a remote company that meets up irl multiple times a year to hack/work together. If you’re good at what you do and want to join us, then we don’t really care where you’re based. We’ll make it work. We do have a preference for people in the US since we usually meet up within the US, so traveling is easier. But, not required.

Ex-founders, people who have worked at startups in the past, people who have built + shipped their own personal projects/products to real users, and really anyone that’s made an honest effort to do cool shit in the real world.
We don’t care about FANNG experience, degrees, your age, or what college you attended. But, we do care deeply about your history building products that shipped to actual users.

name: Head of Learning
description: The Head of Learning at Buildspace is responsible for creating and executing the educational strategy for the company’s products. This includes developing curriculum, creating content, teaching courses, managing a team of instructors and do product work for our core offerings such as builds and nights & weekends. The Head of Learning must be able to develop and deliver engaging content that meets the needs of builders in the Buildspace community. They must also be able to manage and motivate a team of instructors to ensure that courses are delivered effectively.

requirements.description: Started their own EduCo or EdTech company
Expert in one of the following areas: coding, AI/ML, Web3, engineering
Has experience creating learning content online (Youtube, TikTok etc) with a significant following
Someone who is both really good at creating learning content and has obvious evidence of doing so online but also who has experience managing people/team to help with that

workPlaceText: prefer US but open to international if candidate is exceptional

requirements.description: Has teaching and leadership experience

description:
We’ve gotten by but now at a point where we need help evolving our product while at the same time thinking through the design choices. We are looking for designers who are hackers at heart and can lead all things design at Buildspace. You can think of this as similar to founding designer role. 

Example of stuff you might be working on: designing UI/UX for our website, learning modules for builds and content assets we post all the way to architecting the experience of IRL events and programs.

requirements.description: Record of building/sharing design work in public and extensive creative portfolio
3 years + relevant professional work experience
Exceptional design sense, eye for aesthetics and ability to architect phenomenal user experiences
Experience working at a high growth startup environment or an ex-founder

name: Senior Front End Engineer/Tech Lead
description:
You will be in charge of designing and implementing Front End Web UI experience. You will work closely with our CTO and other engineers on the team and have the opportunity to make a huge impact given the interface you own is the main way customers interact with Zeet.

A typical week can include creating new UI flows/workflows and working on user-facing features/functionality that improves the developer experience. You will be hands-on writing code, not only proofs-of-concept.

requirements.description: Minimum 4 years strong frontend experience building with frameworks like React and Typescript
Has experience architecting complex frontend applications with multiple views and components
Early-stage tech startup experience, bonus points if that was a DevTools company

workPlaceText: we are open to remote talent but only within the US and can support H1B transfer if needed

company.name: Zeet.co
company.description: We’re building a platform for software engineers to build on the cloud faster, better, and more scalably than ever before. Our mission is to accelerate the adoption of cloud compute and unlock production-grade deployments for every developer. The next generation of startups will be built using multiple cloud technologies, from standard cloud providers like AWS and GCP to up-and-coming decentralized solutions like IPFS. The future is going to be far more complex, and we need tooling to manage it. Zeet will be the interface to the cloud(s) upon which the next generation of companies is built.
company.productDescription: Zeet is the best place to deploy any software into your AWS account, then [ SCALE ] to millions of users without breaking a sweat.
company.teamAbout: We're a small venture-backed team of driven technical builders, who have been working together for years building scalable infrastructure across companies like Amazon, Bebo, and Embark. We've set up production infrastructure countless times, and we know how annoying it is.

name: Developer Relations (DevRel)
description: We're looking for our first Developer Relations hire to help us build the best authentication experience for startups. We are early so this role is fairly open ended. We'll work with our hire to craft it to their interests and skill set.

requirements.description: US only candidates, prefer to hire in the PST timezone
3+ years working experience - there are many backgrounds that would help you succeed here: developer relations, development, community management, technical writing, etc

workPlaceText: We're a remote-first team, but prefer to hire in the PST timezone. US only.

company.name: PropelAuth (YC W22)
company.description: PropelAuth enables developers to add authentication and authorization to their B2B applications. Their frontend gets a beautiful, safe, and customizable login screen. Their backend gets easy authorization with just a few lines of code. They get an easy-to-use dashboard to configure and manage everything.
company.productDescription: PropelAuth provides end-to-end managed user authentication specializing in B2B use cases. Your users can manage their own accounts and teams with our hosted UIs and our libraries provide you with all the building blocks to add advanced authentication to your product including multiple authentication options, 2FA, SAML, RBAC, and more.
company.teamAbout: PropelAuth was founded on the idea that a great auth product gets out of your way. We believe that auth is more than just logging a user in—it's also about expertly managing your relationship with that user. PropelAuth provides you with the right tools out of the box—so you can quickly make your users’ experiences as secure and smooth as possible. We are a group of passionate, customer-obsessed folks that get excited when we're able to help our users build their products faster.

name: Senior Backend Engineer
description: We're looking for a senior backend engineer to build clean, maintainable, and well-tested backend code. You will collaborate with product and engineering to define, prioritize, and build, and design and architect backend REST APIs.

requirements.description: Professional experience in web3 and startups
Deep experience with modern backend technologies like Python, Django, Node.js, building micro-services etc
At least 4+ years experience doing backend at high growth startups

company.name: Showtime
company.description: Our mission is to onboard billions to crypto by building something that feels familiar to what people use everyday. We are building a social network, one eventually owned and governed by users, that powers our social interactions online. Our first product is a platform to discover and showcase any kind of visual NFT, starting with crypto art. Beyond NFT, our goal is to introduce new crypto primitives that will make a better social media experience for both creators and their communities.
company.teamAbout: We are a group of hard-working, ambitious people passionate about how tech moves the world forward. As wildcards ourselves, we welcome people who don't fit into traditional norms: underrepresented minorities, college dropouts, outliers... if you're exceptionally talented, energetic and passionate, we would love to work with you. Together, we are creating a new paradigm, so you don't need a normal CV to apply! Our culture is proactive: on your defined scope, you will have a lot of freedom. And since we are a very young startup, your scope of work will be relatively large.

Experience at a high growth startup is a plus

You'll be working with geospatial libraries and AWS to create and optimize pipelines to automatically ingest and process terabytes of data each day. You'll also help build our browser-based visualization and annotation tool to help our customers understand and derive actionable insights from the data that they collect.

Experience with front-end web dev using React and Typescript (Javascript)

Mach9 Robotics was created to build software that understands how the world is changing. Our team met at the Robotics Institute at Carnegie Mellon University and is based in  Pittsburgh, PA.

name: Head of Business Development
description: As a Business Development lead at Airfoil, there are several responsibilities we ultimately would like you to take on, although we won't expect you to take them on immediately, nor do so alone. You'll work closely with our founders to identify which pieces of the work are achievable given the resources we have, which should be considered more long-term rather than immediate work to tackle, and what additional support or headcount you need as the company expands. Some of them include: Organizing and pushing forth BD efforts at the company, Finding upselling opportunities and places to add more value to existing customers, Deepening our relationships with existing partners, such as L1s and L2s, other vendors/agencies, and accelerators. etc

requirements.description: Relevant experience and skills to do the job, including domain expertise in crypto/web3
Soft skills and intellect to collaborate effectively with colleagues spread out around the world
Standout experience, preferrably in a startup environment and track record of excellent BD
Minimum 2+ years of experience with business developement, preferably in crypto

workPlaceText: We're open to remote international talent!

company.name: Airfoil
company.description:
Airfoil is a collective of designers, engineers, and artists helping cutting-edge products in crypto, the creator economy, and future of work take flight. Since our inception in 2019, we’ve worked with 80+ teams to bring their products to market, including Solana Labs, Drift Protocol, Layer3.xyz, Playhouse, Highbeam, and more.

As we increase our involvement in the web3 space and prepare to launch our own product offerings, we’re rapidly growing our Toronto and Singapore-based (but remote friendly) design teams.

As a fast-growing startup, working at Airfoil is both exciting and sometimes challenging.
company.teamAbout:
At Airfoil, we believe that your time with us should be helpful to us and to you, and we see your experience here as an opportunity to further your learning and growth as a designer. For these reasons, we will support you in several ways:

- Thorough design critiques and support from our team.
- Access to learning resources and projects. 
- Cross-border experience and training from tech company founders. 

At Airfoil, we are committed to building a safe environment where you will be supported through your professional and personal growth. We are designers second and people first.

name: Art Director, Branding
description: The Art Director, Branding will be responsible for continuously elevating and strengthening the Azuki brand. They will create refined visual guidelines for Azuki (including logo, icon mark, typography, color palette, and art direction guidelines). They will also work with art and marketing teams to create launch campaigns including conceptualizing and executing photo/video shoots for new product releases. Additionally, they will work with product and engineering teams to create product design and specs that adhere to brand guidelines and push elevated digital and physical experiences.

requirements.description: Willingness and ability to do both hands on design work (from sketches to final digital assets) and high level conceptual work that define the visual principles of the brand.
Experience working at large consumer brands or agencies servicing them.
Demonstrated ability to create strong and long lasting consumer brands with compelling and consistent visual identities that span a variety of platforms and touchpoints.

name: Site Reliability Engineer
description:
The role will have primary accountability for maintaining and operating Syndica’s blockchain infrastructure platform. Golang knowledge is a necessity! The team operates with a “run what you write” philosophy and each engineer is responsible for deploying and operating the code they write.

You will be working closely with the Support and Development team on the architecture and configuration of our AWS and GCP hosted infrastructure as well as management of our bare metal RPC nodes. You will be responsible to ensure the environment is configured, managed, and monitored correctly to support the business. You will drive decisions on the right-sizing of servers and storage, troubleshooting performance issues, ensuring the highest level of reliability for the platform, and tuning the environment for maximum scalability, cost efficiency, and security.

requirements.description: Strong experience with Infrastructure as Code and Configuration Management tools is necessary
Experience with Prometheus/Grafana for metrics aggregation/visualization is necessary
5+ years of experience in a DevOps or SRE role is necessary.
Deep understanding of infrastructure-as-code (Terraform, etc.) and deploying large-scale systems reliably is necessary
Configuration of CI/CD pipelines is necessary

workPlaceText: prefer US talent but open to international talent if candidate is exceptional

company.name: Syndica
company.description:
Syndica is a developer infrastructure company building the cloud of web3. We are dedicated to building developer infrastructure that just works. Syndica offers highly scalable RPC node infrastructure, with advanced logging and analytics.

We are backed by strategic partners, investors, and advisors who are all-in on our mission: Chamath of Social Capital, Solana Ventures, and many more.
company.teamAbout:
Our team is composed of the brightest crypto-native minds from places like Messari and 0x Labs as well as traditional technology firms like Facebook, AWS, Microsoft, and more.

At Syndica, big things happen. Every day, we’re translating vision into reality by tackling new and exciting challenges head-on. This is a breakthrough stage in our company, and you’ll experience firsthand the infectious enthusiasm of our employees and leadership team. You’ll have the opportunity to learn new skills, grow your career, and work with the smartest, most passionate people in crypto.

company.name: KEF Robotics
company.description:
We started KEF Robotics (“K-E-F”) based on a love of going big, a desire to achieve excellence, and a shared belief that it takes too long and costs too much to bring robotic capabilities from the lab to the end user.

One of our mottos is "world class in three years". That means that we put ourselves and all of our teammates in a position to achieve and showcase 'best in the world' capabilities within three years of starting at our company.  We do that by hiring great people, giving them project responsibility from Day 1, and supporting them so they can excel. We're coming up on three years in business (December 2021) so we better walk the walk on 'world class' ourselves soon.

We work in a humble warehouse and don't have any interest in pageantry, but we spend big on equipment, materials, testing and travel so our engineers are as unconstrained as possible.  We have ample warehouse space, exclusive access to exceptional test ranges, and a cluttered electronics lab to build everything we need.  We don't post much media because we're working on projects that demand discretion, and because we're moving so quickly that most of our content is outdated by the time we'd put it up.

We're growing rapidly while we evolve and improve, and can't wait for the future.
company.teamAbout:
We’re a small, focused and ambitious team. We value and seek open communication, self-improvement, humor, and authenticity.

We’re continuing to refine our corporate vision as we mature, but above all we’re seeking to ensure we can provide value to the world, rather than redundancy.  We’d rather try something new and difficult than take the proven path.

If we achieve our goals, we’ll help open the skies to a brilliant future in human flight.  For commercial and defense purposes we’ll help aircraft reach their destinations in challenging environments that would require super-human perception or reaction time. In urban settings we’ll help fly safe, quiet, clean, ubiquitous aircraft that will change the way humans move in the world. 

We’re optimistic that robots and autonomy will make the world a better place, but we are aware that the capabilities we are developing can make people nervous about impacts to jobs, privacy and safety.

While we’re set on being ‘world class’, we aren’t cutting corners while we get there.  From the start of our company we’ve donated time and resources to our neighbors, and we will always seek to help others access the world of autonomy.  We seek out opportunities to support young, aspiring students and engineers from diverse backgrounds, and provide internships, jobs, classes, career advice and connections.

If KEF sounds like a place you'd like to work, send us a note and tell us about yourself.

name: Senior Frontend Engineer
description: We’re looking for a Senior Frontend Engineer to build with us our cross-platform frontend on web and mobile with React Native.

requirements.description: Previous experience at web3 startups or other tier 1 tech startups
4+ years of experience with React and/or 2+ years React Native
Passion for web3/crypto/NFTs

company.name: Showtime
company.description: Our mission is to onboard billions to crypto by building something that feels familiar to what people use everyday. We are building a social network, one eventually owned and governed by users, that powers our social interactions online. Our first product is a platform to discover and showcase any kind of visual NFT, starting with crypto art. Beyond NFT, our goal is to introduce new crypto primitives that will make a better social media experience for both creators and their communities.
company.teamAbout: We are a group of hard-working, ambitious people passionate about how tech moves the world forward. As wildcards ourselves, we welcome people who don't fit into traditional norms: underrepresented minorities, college dropouts, outliers... if you're exceptionally talented, energetic and passionate, we would love to work with you. Together, we are creating a new paradigm, so you don't need a normal CV to apply! Our culture is proactive: on your defined scope, you will have a lot of freedom. And since we are a very young startup, your scope of work will be relatively large.

name: Brand Designer
description:
We’re seeking to hire a Brand Designer to join our design team. Designers at Airfoil work either on internal products (Cheque, Mira, Flow) or on our partners’ products, typically in 4-6 month cycles (allowing you to contribute to various products across web3). We welcome candidates in-person in Toronto, Singapore, or remote.

Responsibilities for this role include: define and create a visual language as an extension of the brand (illustrations, icons, colors, typography, animations, etc.), collaborate with UX designers to create and maintain a cohesive and consistent brand experience between Marketing and Product, continually iterate on concepts in an effort to make the brand relevant and relatable to our audience(s), nice to have: Illustration or graphic design ability etc

requirements.description: Prior brand design experience in software products
Strongly prefer candidates based in either Seoul (South Korea) or Singapore
Ability to prototype in your tool of choice (Figma, Illustrator, etc)
A portfolio showcasing brand and visual design work with a strong design sensibility
Illustration or graphic design ability
Able to work independently, prioritize accordingly, and iterate quickly.

responsibilities: Lead projects for the brand team and own client communication
Mentor and guide fellow team members
Define and create a visual language as an extension of the brand (illustrations, icons, colors, typography, animations, etc.) and own all aspect of brand design for projects
Collaborate with UX designers to create and maintain a cohesive and consistent brand experience between Marketing and Product.
Continually iterate on concepts in an effort to make the brand relevant and relatable to our audience(s).
Nice to have: Illustration or graphic design ability
workPlaceText: we're open to international talent!
experience_info: in brand design or similar role, preferably in an agency or fast-paced startup environment.
recruiting_advice:
When reaching out to candidates, you can let them know:

At Airfoil, we believe that your time with us should be helpful to us and to you, and we see your experience here as an opportunity to further your learning and growth as a designer. For these reasons, we will support you in several ways:

• **Thorough design critiques and support from our team.** Through your work with us, we will collaborate actively with you, offer feedback on your work, and relay feedback from our clients. We will help you develop your skills both in terms of user experience/design thinking and aesthetic quality.

• **Access to learning resources and projects.** In addition to client work, we will occasionally host ‘design jam’ sessions via video call to support you in your growth as a designer.

• **Cross-border experience and training from tech company founders.** Our team is led by Silicon Valley tech company founders hailing from the USA and Korea, and while working with early-stage companies our team will be there for you to assist and advise.

company.name: Airfoil
company.description:
Airfoil is a collective of designers, engineers, and artists helping cutting-edge products in crypto, the creator economy, and future of work take flight. Since our inception in 2019, we’ve worked with 80+ teams to bring their products to market, including Solana Labs, Drift Protocol, Layer3.xyz, Playhouse, Highbeam, and more.

As we increase our involvement in the web3 space and prepare to launch our own product offerings, we’re rapidly growing our Toronto and Singapore-based (but remote friendly) design teams.

As a fast-growing startup, working at Airfoil is both exciting and sometimes challenging.
company.teamAbout:
At Airfoil, we believe that your time with us should be helpful to us and to you, and we see your experience here as an opportunity to further your learning and growth as a designer. For these reasons, we will support you in several ways:

- Thorough design critiques and support from our team.
- Access to learning resources and projects. 
- Cross-border experience and training from tech company founders. 

At Airfoil, we are committed to building a safe environment where you will be supported through your professional and personal growth. We are designers second and people first.

name: Experience Manager
description: The Operations Team at Mycelium exists to improve the experience of employees and facilitate the success of Mycelium and its products. As our Experience Manager, you will work within the Operations Team and your ultimate mission will be to make the experience of every staff member more seamless. You will do so by being the go-to person for office-related support, facilitating internal staff events, ordering and up keeping supplies, and ensuring office cleanliness is maintained.

requirements.description: Strong communication and interpersonal skills
Must be based in Brisbane, Australia (in-person role)
Minimum  of 1 year experience in an Administration or Office Manager type role

company.name: Mycelium
company.description:
Mycelium is a market-leading technology company leveraging blockchain technology to make financial markets more efficient. We build financial market infrastructure on public blockchains that is open, transparent, and accessible. We specialise in data provision and financial smart contracts. Mycelium has two core products leveraging financial smart contracts: Perpetual Swaps and Perpetual Pools.

We believe that the growing use of blockchains in financial technology will benefit everyone, and are committed to realising this vision.
company.teamAbout:
Mycelium will improve financial markets by creating more efficient ways for people and organisations to interact with them. We are unlocking new markets that are more accessible, secure, information-rich and trustworthy.

At Mycelium, we are energetic, take initiative and have a thirst for both personal and professional development by pushing boundaries and maintaining a forward thinking mindset. We work on the cutting edge of technology, but seek to bring a very human approach to our work. We do this by being customer obsessed, agile and moving with purpose.

name: Full-Stack Engineer (Mobile App)
description: As a Full-Stack Engineer you will help design and implement full-stack solutions to build out a seamless mobile application experience for our customers. A successful candidate will mirror many of Mycelium’s core values by being forward thinking, customer-obsessed, data-led, and motivated to take initiative with energy and confidence. Mycelium’s mission is to improve access and efficiency for financial markets globally, and by being part of our Engineering team you will play a vital role in executing this mission.

requirements.description: Strong Typescript skills
At least 3 years of experience in software engineering

You will also have the chance to craft world-class product experiences to help people discover work that is personally fulfilling and manage their projects and career growth.

requirements.description: Experience in early-stage product development
Excited about the potential for decentralized technologies to have a massive impact
Senior enough to manage a team of designers but also can contribute as individual contributor if required
Must be in US timezone

workPlaceText: prefer US talent but open to international if exceptional

company.name: Tephra Labs
company.description: Tephra Labs is a product lab developing critical infrastructure for large-scale human coordination. Our first product is a decentralized talent marketplace, protocol, and network called Radius. On the Radius network, users own their work history and reputation and are naturally incentivized to make their working engagements successful. We are a team of builders with deep experience in web3 and marketplaces. We recently raised a $5m seed round to support the Tephra Labs mission.
company.productDescription:
We’re not like other startups. Here are some of the reasons we are different:
  • We pride ourselves on responsible growth. We’re keeping our team lean and focused on achieving product-market fit and exponential adoption. You’ll join a tight-knit and talented team that’s laser focused on impact (see below).
  • We are laser focused on our massive potential for impact. We have a clear north star, and we’re adaptive and relentless in our pursuit. The impact we seek isn’t limited to one industry, solution, or set of technologies. We’re planning to make our first dent in the web3 space, and expand to other industries and other solutions over time.
  • We care deeply about our people. We want our teammates to show up to work as their full selves. We care about you, the whole you, before everything else. We provide competitive pay, excellent benefits, and great perks for you and your family.
company.teamAbout:
Our beliefs are core to everything we do:

1. Independent and flexible work will be the dominant form of work in the future. Some studies estimate that more than 50% of the US workforce will be freelancers by 2027, and the majority of GenZ workers today are already independent workers.

2. The solutions that exist to match independent workers to meaningful opportunities are insufficient to meet the needs of the growing independent workforce. Traditional talent marketplaces, staffing agencies/platforms, bounty platforms, etc. fail to provide independent workers with significant opportunities and to ensure high-quality work outputs for employers.

3. Decentralized ecosystems have the potential to reach unprecedented scales and achieve significant impact, greater than any centralized organizations in history. Decentralized ecosystems will be powered by independent workers.

Effectively enabling governments, corporations, and individuals to work together will allow us to solve pervasive and long-standing challenges facing humanity, such as climate change, cancer, access to education, and more.

You will also drive critical technical architecture and decisions for Radius and future Tephra Labs products and protocols.

A technically strong software engineer with experience in web3 and marketplaces

name: Senior Full Stack Software Engineer
description:
Your day-to-day will vary depending on the client, here are some of the highlights of what you could be working on:

1. Ship the next big thing! - Join our work with the world’s top venture funds to help their portfolio companies design, build, and ship incredible products.

2. Provide trusted advice - Use your product and technical experience to advise and provide directions for our clients. Help them achieve their goals by putting on your product manager or CTO hat.

3. Build relationships - Represent Lazer by keeping clients up-to-date, managing their expectations, getting them excited about your work, and collaborating to build a great product with a great relationship.

4. Be a part of the team - Even when you’re not working with other great Lazerites on your project, you can still be a part of the community by answering technical questions to help others, offering your opinions on debates, and teaching us your areas of expertise in lunch-and-learns.

requirements.description: Minimum 3+ years relevant professional experience
Due to the nature of our company they MUST be able to talk the talk and able to articulate their thoughts clearly and concisely to our clients
Most of our projects require React and Typescript with backend knowledge at its core so the extensive full-stack experience is a must

workPlaceText: we're open to remote talent within US timezone

company.description:
Lazer is a world-class digital studio composed of 70+ of the best senior designers and engineers in the world from companies like Facebook, Apple, Google, Coinbase, Uber, Tesla, and more. We've designed, engineered, and grown products from $0 to $200M revenue across a huge variety of industries from gaming and crypto to fin-tech and healthcare and much more.

Our company thesis is if we provide the best experience for designers and engineers, we will all find success together. Come join the best place for top-level designers and engineers to work and grow together!

Experience designing and building out programmatic APIs
Experience working on high-scale APIs

Collaborate with product to define, prioritize, and build
Design backend REST APIs for usability and for scale
Build and manage a team of backend engineers
